description:
This is one of those iconic places that we continue to return to every time we visit Pier 39. Their crab baked in garlic sauce is amazing - and it's the only reason we continue to come back. 
The atmosphere is nice and causal, the service is standard, and the view is just amazing.
This time around we were celebrating my friend's birthday and they were nice enough to bring out a complimentary dessert dish with a candle.
author: Q T.

description:
One of those touristy restaurants in Pier 39!

We got mussels, shrimps and crab combo ($49.99) and crab chowder on bread bowl($12.99). We got seated next to window so we had a nice view of pier. It was great but nothing really wowed me. Crab chowder was creamy and delicious but pretty standard. The iron skillet combo was good but I thought it's bit pricey. I can't complain given it's located in pier 39. 


Great service, good food, casual ambiance, very touristy and bit overpriced. Will I come back? Probably not but it's worth a try!
author: Clare L.

description:
I went here on the 2nd community day of Pokemon Go last August 12. It was really busy, but there were tables available and the service is pretty fast. Pretty crowded but they managed to find us a table for a  party of 10. The menu is pretty standard but the prices are expensive. It was probably worth it, and there are few items that are a must try like the cioppino, fish and garlic fries, calamari and the fresh-cooked crab.
The bread wasn't really appealing- it was chewy and not freshly baked. So that means they get their sourdough bread at Boudin or another well-known sourdough bread baker.
We ordered 2 of each: Two too crab, calamari, 3 garlic noodles, 9 sodas, 1 large cioppino. Of course, they are refills.
The crabs are sweet, fresh and the garlic sauce - OMG! So good. I highly recommend the cioppino, fish, and chips (garlic fries). So whatever is expensive and worth trying are the seafood dishes like crabs, mussels, seafood, shellfish, shrimp - they are so fresh, sweet and the tomato broth and garlic sauce - they are so yummy! I got the fish and chips - 2 halibut fish breaded with a light spiced cornstarch tempura batter with garlic fries on the side, lemon wedges, a small side of tartar sauce and their housemade cocktail sauce. The cocktail sauce is the worst housemade recipe I tasted. But I am also on a budget - I would splurge a little like for 2 people you can share the combo entree meals - fish and chips for $20. This is probably perfect for 2 people. 
But this meal was really expensive for 10 people. A lot of tourists and locals eat here for indulging a phenomenal meal. If you have the money to splurge, after spending your day at Fisherman's Wharf or Pier 39. This is where to eat.
In the late afternoon, the wait is usually 30 to 40 minutes. 
If you want to eat great food at the Fisherman's Wharf - there are only a few places that are worth eating during lunch or dinner time. The Crab House, and the Wipeout is pretty good for brunch, lunch or dinner. A great day to end the day playing Pokemon Go on a Sunday afternoon.
author: Jade M.

description: This was a good find, a good menu variety of seafood, fish, shrimp, crab, clams, mussels. Crab and clam chowder. I had a beer I never heard nfrom Crab house brewery, it was really refreshing kinda like a Hefeweizen meets a a light Sierra Nevada, I tasted a bit of nutmeg type flavor. I got the crab cake appetizer and garlic bread. The crab cakes were good alone but the spicy sauce made them ever more flavorful.  A small spot but the view from the table were great. I sat at the small round table next to the bar since I was eating solo.
author: Timothy P.

description:
I'm from the Bay Area but live in Texas now, so naturally when I visit California, I must come to Crab House at Pier 39.  You get what you pay for when you visit this place.  The food is always incredible, they are always busy and the service is always awesome.

I had the fish and chips and must say, they ruin fish and chips for everyone because its so good here.  HOW DO THEY MAKE IT SO AWESOME?  Just typing this makes my mouth water.  We ordered Garlic Bread with melted Mozzarella and oh my goodness it was so delicious. We are a pretty loud family, there was a total of 8 of us, but when the food came, we had the quietest table in the restaurant. 

My daughter won't eat seafood, so she ordered Fettuccine and it was equally amazing.  My wife ordered the crab, she even wore the bib.  She loved the food and wanted more.

Best part is, as I grabbed the check to play (it was my turn to treat), the bill was very reasonable, especially considering we are on the pier in San Francisco.

Food - A+
Cleanliness - A
Service - A+
Ambiance - A

I love this place and can't wait to go back to the Bay Area and eat here again.
author: Desmond S.

description:
A group of us decided to find a spot to eat in San Francisco since it was the first time here for many of us,  myself included! Based on a recommendation,  we decided on the Crab House at Pier 39.  Apparently, this is where the sea lions like to hang. They know what's up!

Although pricey (to include a 4.9% government mandated expense), I had an overall good experience. I went with the Iron Skillet-Roasted double shrimp and whole crab (~$60).  Nice and buttery!  I was super hungry, but still couldn't manage to finish all of it. Our server was also really friendly and addressed all of our questions/ needs. 

I'd love to come back to Pier 39 again even it's just to hang out with the sea lions. This is definitely a spot where tourists venture, so be prepared to pay a premium for that.
author: Nina W.

description:
I went to the crab house today for my cousin birthday party and I ordered crab and shrimp platter as I was eating I had got strong strange taste I got scared like my tongue went numb so I instantly start watching my food next thing you know I spotted a worm maggot or parasite whatever you want to call it I was highly disgusted it must be normal because when I told them they wasn't surprise they told me sometimes that happens I find that very unsanitary I don't recommend nobody eating there !! Now that I made it home I can't stay off the toilet and I keep
Throwing up .
author: Jungleboy Q.

description:
Had a great lunch at the Crab House yesterday afternoon in beautiful San Francisco. We decided to drive to the bay for a day of wondering around the piers and seafood with the girls. I've eaten at multiple places by the piers but this place was a new one for me.
The service was great, the food delicious and the portions generous. The reason for only stars is the lack of air conditioning at the restaurant. It was stuffy, especially considering that the temperature outside was a beautiful 70 degrees with a breeze. Luckily the windows open, allowing the cool bay air in. Overall a great experience, will definitely be returning.
author: Alena M.

description: The best place to eat Dungeness crab  with the family. Kids are comfortable and have a lot Of foods  to choose   that goes with the crabs .
author: Lydia H.

description:
The food was great. Our waitress was great.

But I had a weird experience when we are here last week for my birthday.
The manager/maitre d that night introduced herself to two other couples who arrived just shortly after us, insisting to them that if they needed anything, to make sure to let her know and hoped that they'd have a great time dining there that evening. 
The weird part was that we were that close that I heard everything she said, yet she didn't give us the same courtesy as those two other couples. If anything, it felt like she either avoided talking to us or just ignored us completely. I don't want to make any assumptions on what that was about, but I didn't like that a simple void of courtesy completely changed my overall opinion of this nice restaurant.

Note to self: there are other crab restaurants in the area.
author: Angela A.

description:
Went here on Sunday. Pretty crowded but they managed to find us a table pretty quickly. The aesthetic is amazing especially on the left side of the restaurant. The bread they gave us wasn't that appealing and the olive oil and balsamic weren't the best. 
Ordered two crabs and mussels and shrimp on the hot platform thingy and it was expensive and not that great. 
Also got crab cakes,large garlic fries, crab melt, crab alfredo and clam chowder. The fries were amazing like so amazing although we did get too much cause it also came with the crab melt. The crab melt sandwich was pretty good, lil buttery. The clam chowder was good with lots of filling, but nothing special. The crab alfredo was pretty tasty. The crab cakes were so amazing thooo. 
All the food came out pretty quick and the waiters were pretty attentive. Would come again!
author: Amyangelbee N.

description:
Crabs are definitely at the top of the list for my least favorite foods...HOWEVER, this place completely changed my preconception about crabs!! 

So fresh & yummy!! We only ordered a small portion because we were gonna eat dinner in a few hours, but I wish we had tried other stuff on the menu such as the shrimp. My eyes could not stop wandering around the restaurant. Everything caught my attention because of how colorful & delicious they looked! 

If you're at Pier 39 and looking for a nice seafood restaurant, this is the place to go! 

ALSO, PLEASE ORDER THE GARLIC FRIES!! THEY'RE MADE FROM HEAVEN!! So yum
author: Michelle D.

description:
I read the reviews and still thought of giving this place a try while we were visiting at the pier; despite the bad reviews about customer service! We arrive and our told the wait is only about 30 mins for a party of 2; despite a wait outside of the restaurant! My husband and I decide to wait and give this place a try! We actually ended up waiting almost an hour; although my husband went and asked the girl who took our name down!! she kept insisting we were next. However, that was not the case! she forgot about us! I was ready to just go and try out another place after starting off like that!

We finally were seated and ordered our appetizers, entrees right away!

Food; Food was amazing that's why I bumped up a few stars. We loved the super combo skillet and crab cakes. We did not enjoy the crab chowder! Prices are fairly high, however that's normal when you are in San Francisco. The quality of the food is amazing. 

Management; Please ensure your staff is not giving people high hopes with the wait time and then are forgotten about and told something else.
author: Regina R.

description:
This is a great choice at fisherman's wharf! Not too pricey, and not too bad of a wait (especially for 10 people on a weekend!) 

Ambiance/wait staff: the only reason this place isn't a 5, is because of the hostesses. I had asked how long the wait was for 10 people and they told us 20 mins, which was great news. Then when we went back to check on the wait, they girls said that we only asked for 8 people, (not true at all!) so it would be an extra 20 mins for 10.... they gave us a huge attitude.  But our waiter was awesome. He was so nice, helpful and took group pictures of us too! The ambiance is so cool, decorated crabs are everywhere and huge windows overlook the water! 

Food: we got all sorts of crab dishes between the 10 of us, crab enchiladas, crab melt, crab chowder in a bread bowl, and crab omelette! The crab melt was amazingggggg and served with garlic fries that were phenomenal !!!!!  The drinks were delicious too!!  

Would definitely come back here again if and when I go back to San Fran! 

Happy Eating! 
Nicole
author: Nicole S.

description:
Awesome Crab spot in SF right on the Pier!!! If you are walking the pier with family, friends, or your significant other, I highly recommend stopping by the crab house!! If you are craving some delicious crab, it's a must try.... plus you get a great view of the pier while you grub on delicious crab!! 

We came during the holidays so it was extra cool because everything is decked out in Christmas cheer!! You walk the pier with the cool shops, build up an appetite.... and grub at the crab house!

The crab house is on the second floor and we came during the lunch hour which worked out perfect! It was busy but we got seated right away.... and we had a great view of the pier!

If you have more than 4 people, i would recommend making a reservation! 

We ordered the Crab for 2.... which was 3 pounds of delicious crab that comes out on a sizzling tray with marinating with butter and garlic! The cool part of the sizzling tray was it keeps the crab warm!!! The crabs were pretty good in size and the flavor was very good.... bursts of garlic, butter, and seasoning! 

We also ordered garlic fries and the portion was huge!! The fries were pretty good.... slightly dry but they were crispy and the garlic was pretty good... could have been more....

Lastly, they validate your parking which is a plus!!! 

Overall, it was a great experience and we will definitely return next time we are in the pier!
author: Yao C.

description:
We were in the city after spending the week visiting family. My boyfriend and I live in Arizona so the fresh crab options are extremely limited/ non-existent. We were really craving a crab feast so we hopped on Yelp and happened upon this wonderful establishment. We called last minute to make reservations. The hostess politely informed that they request reservations be made 3 hours in advance and invited us to walk-in and be put on a short wait. It only took about 20 mins for us to be seated after we put our names on the list. It didn't seem like a bad deal considering how busy the restaurant was! 

They have quite the array of options including soups, salads, cioppino, mussels, shrimp, fish and chips, and even some chicken and chips for the kids. Everything sounded so wonderful but we came for a crab feast and by golly we were going to have a crab feast! 

We were having a hard time choosing between the Lotsa Crab (3lbs) and the Too Two Crab (4lbs). Our decision was made final after the server informed us that the Lotsa Crab was 1 1/2 crabs and the Too Two Crab was 2 whole crab. If this was going to be our only crab feast this year, we were going to throw caution to the wind and tackle a whole crab a piece.

Our crab arrived promptly after we ordered it. Two whole crabs still sizzling on the skillet. I'll be honest with you, I was terrified trying to figure out how to begin tearing apart this monster. After inquiring with the server about where to start, he kindly offered to cut them for us. It was a great addition to already impeccable service. 

We were offered 3 sauces alongside our crab; a traditional butter sauce, a "secret sauce", and a lemon caper sauce. They were all divine and complimented the crab beautifully. 

All in all it was a great experience. The wait wasn't too bad. There's a souvenir shop across from the restaurant that you can stroll around in while you wait for your table. Once you sit down the service is extremely prompt and friendly. The presentation of the food is impeccable and the views are to die for! We will no doubt be back next time we are in San Francisco!
author: Aisha L.

description:
For a place called Crab House, the crab wasn't amazing. They offer individual and group sized portions of crab. They rave about their special garlic sauce which is pretty good but not enough for me to trek back to the pier for. 

I came here the other night for dinner and ordered the crab enough to share for 4. We then ordered another order of crab meant to share for 2. They do not give you the head on these orders which some people look forward to. 

One thing I wanted to mention is the quality of crab from the largest order to the smallest order. The crab tasted fresher in the smaller order compared to the larger order. The meat was more moist and the crab legs were also bigger and meatier. 

The garlic noodles are ok. Not what I'm used to. They use fettuccine and a lot of butter. 

The entire dinner was just very buttery in general. I do love crab and it wasn't terrible. Service was friendly and they give kids things to color to keep them busy which is nice.
author: Shelly W.

description:
First place I legally had a drink when I turned 21, which seems like just yesterday. But, it's been some years now and I must say, I wasn't as impressed as I was back then.. probably because i've experienced roasted crab at a lot of other places now so my expectations are different.
The restaurant is casual, nothing to get "dressed up" for. Inside is real ship like, if that makes sense. Service was decent. I ordered a whole crab and shrimp alfredo.. the crab coulda had more of the roasted garlic taste but, wasn't bad! The alfredo was ok. Nothing was bad about the food but nothing stood out about it neither.
I think it's a cool spot with nice scenery. Prices are fair for the pier.. the whole crab was $47 (I believe) and the shrimp alfredo was $21. I believe it's worth the try if you're on that end of the pier and have a taste for crab.
author: Qushandia H.

description: The service/cashier is quick and efficient, thus not the kindest on earth. We have tried this place on a busy Saturday night and got the clam chowder and calamari with chips. The former had a robust taste and I found it pretty good! Calamari and chips were tasty, but I wish it was only calamari, because the chips were all at the bottom and I found myself eating chips only when I was half the way though the plate. There's pretty much nowhere you can sit to eat the food, but they provide a tiny counter where you can quickly eat what you've just bought.
author: Tommaso M.

description: We had crab for 2, an entree for our kiddo and it was delicious and service was great. Had a great dinner for $175 including tip, which isn't that bad in SF.
author: Michel F.

description:
4 star 
One star lost because they totally neglected my reservation. 

I was complaining how disappointed we are as the tourists.  The front lady apologized and was not sure why it got lost.  
They managed to place us a seating beside the window with a great ocean view which I originally requested for when making a reservation. We are comforted by how they made up their mistake. 
I would suggest you need to double check and triple check your reservation if the trip is time sensitive.

I have to say nicely that the customer service made up my disappointment.  Good food quality , uniqueness is perfect. Sizzling crab on grill pan gains lots of attention in tourist pier area at SF.  Well pronounced crab house and agreat recommendation from my travel guide book. 

I would recommend to give a try if you are one time tourist in Fisherman Wharf SF. I will not recommend to local because there is so many choices and way to taste the fresh crab in the area. 

The uniqueness of crab here is the sauce... its fusion of spices from east to west plus local catch only.


Another unique item is the crab chowder, very strong crab soup base flavor in chowder instead of clam. If you are a big crab fan like me, you definitely cannot miss it
author: Wendy B.

description:
Dinner on a Thursday night had a 1hr wait. Got our name down, then walked around for a walk. 

By the way, if you're going to walk around while you wait, make sure you come back on time. First, we noticed that they don't call a name a second time and second you have to pay attention when your name is called.

We came back after an hour, double checked with the front desk, and waited. We were seated just outside the restaurant and we barely heard our name. My cousin had to go in and see if he heard it correctly. not sure what they do if you don't show up for your reservation.

The double shrimp and whole crab was enough for 2 adults. We also ordered garlic noodles with chicken. Serving size would probably be enough for 1 person but they give you alot of chicken. You know what else? We added some garlic dipping sauce (the one that came with the crab) to the pasta. Pretty good.:) the crab feast was pretty good size also. Fed 4 adults with some veggies and fries on the side. The fish and chips were ok. They give you alot of fries and ok size of fish.

the place is a bit cramped, The food is delicious and the servers are nice. Overall good experience. Pricey but it's the same as every seafood restaurant in Pier 39.
author: Jem K.

description:
We stopped in for lunch, amazing food and service. Our waters were refilled every few minutes. 
I tried the cup of crab chowder, for my first crab chowder it was delicious. Loved all the veggies in it too. We ordered the garlic cheese bread = yummy. Maybe not necessary since you get a good load of sourdough at the table. I had the garlic noodles with crab, phenomenal. Met my expectations completely. My husband had the filet and crab. He said the steak melted in his mouth. The side was garlic fries, which were also amazing. Will def come back and try a skillet! Drink- the red Herron was yummy! Champagne with cranberry and orange juice.
author: Lindsey V.

description: We always eat at this place every time when we came to fisherman wharf. Surprisingly found out there was no line and we were able to get seated right away. Order came pretty fast. Just realized for a crab soup, it was $9.99 for a cup and also $9 for a small piece of Tiramisu. We ordered Tiramisu every time and it was so much smaller this time
author: Zhang A.

description:
Out of all the restaurants on the pier, I choose Crab House based off of many great reviews. Its around noon and the place is packed. Expected. Instead of a table, I was offered a seat at the round table in front of the entrance that had a gas fireplace in the middle. Sure, why not. Immediately I was greeted by my exuberant waitress as well as the smell of gas from the fireplace. I ask to be seated at another seat on the round table hoping that the smell would be better but NO, it got worse! I ordered the crab chowder and the house red but I mostly just tried to focus on speeding everything up so I could leave the restaurant and breath fresh air again! I told one of the hostess on the way out and she apologized. The entire experience really wasn't worth the 14-hour migraine that followed, tho. 

Credit where credit was due: the inside of the restaurant looked fun and campy, my waitress really seemed like she cared for the people she was serving, the food came out fast, the people next to me ordered the Lottsa Crab and it really looked like lots of crab plus it looked really good, they also had a pretty great view! Most of what I endured could have been avoided if I just asked for another table, however, I don't think it should have been a problem in the first place. Surely, out of years worth of patrons, I couldn't be the only one who has felt this way, right? 

Will I go back? There are so many restaurants here so probably not. 
Will I recommend it? Maybe? If they really want crab and a touristy restaurant.
author: Hannah G.

description: Your favorite seafood connoisseur strikes again  this amazing meal comes from crabhouse39 . My dishes of choice were Too Two Crab, Crab Chowder, and Crab Angel Hair Lasagna. These dishes were amazing but that lasagna is outta this world . Stop by if you're ever in the San Francisco area!
author: Phia L.

description:
I think crab house is the main reason why I came back to San Francisco! Lol 

Today we got the iron grill combo mussel, shrimp and crab, garlic fries and some mojitos! If you're not sure what you want, I recommend the combo! It was perfect for two people. I would have to say this is the best restaurant for seafood! 

The mojitos were ok, kind if pricey.. We had the strawberry and pineapple mojitos..
author: Toshiba G.

description:
Made a reservation for a party of 4 at noon on a Monday. The place was still pretty empty. It did start filling up at about 1p. 

Food was awesome! Got the lotsa crab platter and the super combo sizzling skillet to split between 3 people and it was more than enough food. We also had a crab chowder bowl to share. The bread was pretty thick so didn't really get as much chowder as I would've liked. The sauces that the platters were roasted in was very flavorful, may be a bit on the saltier side for some. Be warned that it can get a bit messy. The amount of seafood was definitely well worth the price. 

Service was fantastic. From the time we sat down to the time we left, the servers were very attentive and kept checking on us to make sure we didn't need anything.
author: Kacey S.

description:
I have to say that the garlic parmesan fries were literally the best fries I've ever had in my life. Trust me when I say that they are excellent. The fries were perfectly crisp, warm, seasoned and had just the right amount of garlic.  I am not a fries person at all and rarely ate them for the first 14 or so years of my life. However, their fries are to die for. A large will run you about $9.99 and they are easily enough for several people to share.

I had the shrimp and muscle combo. It was great and I enjoyed it immensely. The rest of our party also enjoyed their food. It was incredible and a better choice than another nearby seafood restaurant located within Pier 39. I would absolutely visit again.
author: Kari C.

description: The food is DELICIOUS. This is always a must have for me every time my family comes to SF. The crab and shrimp is super fresh and soooo rich. This place is definitely well hidden, so it may be hard to find, but it overlooks the bay and the atmosphere is very casual and comfortable. It's decorated with cute crabs all over the ceiling, and the tables are small and give a "seaside" vibe. Price is very fair for the quality of food, and honestly don't have much to complain about! Would definitely come back!
author: Christine L.

description: We went here because i wanted my daughters to have the experience of eating crab legs.  There was nothing wrong with it but nothing but I wasn't blown away.  It was super crowded and kinda of uncomfortable.  The crab was fine but for the money you would think it would come with a salad or something.  The crab bisque was really good and so was the crab lasagna.  So it was good not great. If we came back to the area I doubt we would go again.
author: Sharon B.

description:
The name of the restaurant and the decor attracted me to the restaurant. When we arrived inside, it was so cool that restaurant got the pier as a view. There are crabs in all sorts of disguise (bride, pirate, ghost...) around the whole restaurant as a decor. 

The service was friendly and super quick.

The food was delicious. My sister steak was so good and perfectly cooked. She was one satisfied girl. I ate shrimp and mussels with lemon butter sauce. It was so tasty that I felt I was in heaven. 

When you pass by the fisherman's wharf... come by this restaurant. It is worth it...even though, it's pricey.
author: Shahanaz B.

description: Their seafood is . Check out this trio of deliciousness. Mussels, half crab and shrimp. We also had their garlic fries. I would highly recommend making a reservation rather than waiting a while for a table.
author: Daniel D.

description:
Excellent crab!

I had the 1/2 crab and a bread bowl of crab chowder. The wife had the filet and a cup of the chowder. Both were excellent.

The room is a little loud and a little crowded but very nice and clean. Our service was excellent.

Highly recommended
author: Charles E.

description:
Well one thing for certain.. They get you in & out!! lol came to check out the Crab House because i always seen it walking Pier 39 but never stopped because it seemed so busy.. glad i stopped! 

The food was GOOD!! We ordered a whole Dungeoness crab & Crab Alfredo.. the crab alfredo was SUPER GOOD!! I already know im ordering that next time lol the crab was OK not much flavor and was drinched in butter. It would have been amazing if the butter had flavor! But our meals came out extremely fast, i thought they might have had the wrong table! Waited about 30 minutes to be seated.. but once seated they came & took our order immediately & we had our food in less than 15mins! 

It was SUPER small in there though! Jam packed!
author: Aaris S.

description: The entree arrived before the soup and two appetizers.  That's a big mistake for an expensive restaurant. Only response was "my mistake" and "sorry". Ruined the mostly good food. Can't imagine going back here.
author: Wayne T.

description:
Service wasn't as friendly, or I would have given it a five stars. The bus help was around more than the actual server. On our way out, our server didn't acknowledge us. Having been trained in the hospitality industry, I would always acknowledge customers. 

The view was amazing. It was the perfect spot to catch San Francisco's sunset and some grub. The food was awesome. I had the full crab and double shrimp on a hot top. My dish came with two dipping sauces, one extra buttery and the other citrusy. 

Pricing wasn't too bad. On my own, I spent a little over $50. Overall, the food was great but the service wasn't 5 stars worth. I admire small restaurants like this one, but I expected a lot more pride and effort among the servers. Nonetheless, the food was great, so 4 stars.
author: Jasen O.

description:
I visit the crab house fairly regularly! It's definitely one of my favorite crab places! 
Service: Service is usually amazing. They have a number of people waiting on your table which always makes you feel like you are being attended to. This last time I visited the crab house the waiter we had was a little on the rude side. My boyfriend had a number of questions about how a few of the dinner plates were prepared, and our waiter was clearly annoyed by the questions. The waiter was basically saying without saying hurry up and order. I was shocked! He must have had a bad day because this is defiantly not a norm for this place. Staff is usually helpful and friendly.
Food: AMAZING!!!!!! Food is cooked to perfection! I usually order a whole crab, and I have never been disappointed. Crab comes with this amazing butter that has garlic and capers in it! Only thing I would change food wise is the bread they give you as a starter. It's so hard that you can barley tear it apart. I prefer soft, hot bread. 
Atmosphere: Atmosphere is amazing! There are a number of windows with amazing views of the bay! Defiantly a great date spot! Restaurant is clean and well kept. I love the fire place in the middle of the restutant. It's a cute little touch. 
Price: A little pricey, but to be expected at a seafood restaurant. 

All around this is one of my favorite date spots!
author: Angelica N.

description: Spent Saturday evening in SF, Crab House was packed yet with open table got right in and seated. Crab was delish however no body pieces in a 2 1/2 lb order.  Crab chowder was excellent. Garlic noodles bland and under cooked. Not a problem going back for the crab. Would have to avoid noodles or send back for chef to try again. No drinks tonight...still 4 Stars as ambience is everything.
author: Lynn M.

description: Crazy good and small place feel... located on upper deck of pier for expansive view. This is great hangout in midst of disney-like location. Granted, I was there on Thurs night hanging out with Rhett (next Jim Cantore) and Gary exchanging lifes similarity's over a cast iron combo of dungeoness crab, shrimp and mussels that were accompanied by fresh bread roll and two butter cups, one with capers. Service is fast and was solid seafood experience.
author: rod m.

description:
Overall, good experience. The hostess was not helpful at all. She was wrong multiple times and was verging on rude. 

The food itself was delicious. I had the sea bass and it was cooked perfect. Most of my group and the crab cake melt and they all loved it on the toasted garlic bread. The fries, GARLIC FRIES, were amazing! I couldn't stop eating them. 
Our waiter was super helpful and even took a group picture for us. 
Great vibe, cute set up, and great views out the window!
author: Meg D.

description:
This place has got to be one of the best places for crabs and mussels.  Because their were two of us, My gf and I ordered the double mussels, a whole crab and some garlic fries (da  ). At this particular day (Dec. 25th) the service was super fast! So A+ for the service and for the young blonde hair lady who served us (sorry I forgot your name). She took our order and in less than 10-15mins later the food arrived. Hooray! Was sooo hungry!

We started off with the mussels and it was cooked perfect. It was garlicky, savory and had a hint of salt and butter. 
The crab was also delicious and must say I could've ate another whole crab. Seasoned just right and had lots of meat in it. 
The garlic fries was one of the hands down best garlic fries I've had. I will be coming back for the same trio the next time I decide to come here for lunch or dinner. 
This is a must go place to go to whether you're a SF native or a tourist. Give it a shot. You'll love it.
author: Lakeen W.

description: My husband and I flew into San Francisco and couldn't wait to eat some delicious seafood. We ordered the shrimp and whole crab iron skillet and the food was good, but not great. I think we were both expecting better. We didn't care for either dipping sauce. Still a fun experience and the service was great. Our waiter David L was awesome and attentive. I recommend going during the day or watching the sunset. I could tell there was a spectacular view, but we went at night and couldn't see much.
author: Jamie P.

description: A sit down with great view of the bay/harbor.  We had the crab chowder.  It has a lot of herbs and sme corn and careots and potatoes and of course finely shredded crab meat laid on top.  The bread bowl is classic sourdough served room temperature.  Flavor wise there is a lot going on in this medium thickness dish, i prefer creamier and more peppery, but i think this style is well done and the flavors match the bread well. Fast service too.
author: Charles S.

description: Love this place, and it's view of the pier. Had various dishes and they were all delicious. The crab chowder and crab fettuccine were my favorites here. Of course the menu options are great which I'll hand to try more next time. The staff was great and loved our experience.
author: Mary M.

description: We found this restaurant just by walking around the pier. The service was very nice and the food was delicious. It was worth the price and the wait for the restaurant. We also loved the bread and oils to dip while waiting for the food.
author: Tracy H.

description: Tiffany the hostess is polite and professional. Thank you for finding our reservation (Josh Y.) so quick and seating us on our anniversary! It's not always easy for you on these busy summer nights with a lot of tourists! Your doing great!
author: Diane M.

description:
Just for clarification; This is a great restaurant. I in no way wanted to downplay my experience. The food was great, the service was attentive, and the Management was concerned with their patrons.
 I used to catch all of my own seafood. Not everyone can do that. But nowadays any person whom may be in a bad mood may be spiteful enough to damage the prosperity of an establishment, affecting everyone, including the families involved.
 Don't join the masses of sheeple out there based on someone else's words. Determine your own judgement. Besides; opinions are like ***holes. Everyone has them and they all stink.
author: Richard M.

description:
This is tourism restaurant. The taste is more likely fast food. This is no skills during the cook.  However, the service is good. They helped with the crab. Also, the view is good. I would not recommend u to go. 
Just for a tourism advice!
author: Kay L.

description: Was in town for business and decided to go to the Pier for dinner one of the nights. Restaurant was busy for 830 but service was prompt. I had the Crab Alfredo and it was to die for. Looks can be deceptive, when the bowl case out it looked small but as I ate, it seemed to refill as the bowl was deeper than it looked. All in all great food. I will definitely return on my next trip to SF.
author: Todd S.

description:
Went here for lunch during our holiday visit and it was BUSY. We waited 30 minutes to be seated but it turned out to be worth it.

I ordered a Hot To Trout cocktail (Bourbon) and it was pretty good. For food we had crab enchilada, crab melt, grilled cheese with fries, and shrimp and chips. The food was so delicious--as good as the photos look (see my photos). The enchilada was plenty cheesy. The only small negatives for me would be:

1) there was a tad too many onions in the crab melt and it was a little overpowering. 
2) the garlic fries came with clumps of garlic cloves and weren't evenly spread out through the fries so some fries were VERY strong on garlic and others tasted like regular fries.

Be prepared to squeeze your way through the tight aisles and bump (or get bumped into) chairs behind you when you get seated. I mean, it is REALLY tight in there. 

The view is amazing so if you're lucky enough to be seated by a window, which we were, order a nice wine or cocktail to enjoy with a beautiful sight of the water and the docked boats. 

Overall we were extremely pleased with our lunch choice!
author: Ronna B.

description:
Had a really wonderful dinner at the Crab House.
We sat at the bar because the place was packed for the holiday. We had just come from Alcatraz and were starving. To eat right away it was suggested we sit there. We were thoroughly entertained by the bartender Brett. 

He made excellent recommendations for food was very knowledge about portion size and remembered how I liked my Coke refills! We had the sizzling shrimp and crab and chicken with a mound of fries. 

These were the best garlic fries I've ever had! I can't wait to come here again and try more food!

Brett was very hospitable with a great personality. You can tell he likes what he does and we had a great time sitting at the bar. This was a great Mother's Day.
author: Gorgeous P.

description: Second visit here.  Great location but very touristy as expected.  Food is great.  Service is very attentive.  Atmosphere is all SF.  Had the crab shrimp Louie salad--terrific!  The full crab and shrimp were delicious and HUGE portions.  You definitely pay the price for location but it's totally worth it.   Will be back!
author: Tom S.

description:
I would probably agree with the average reviews that this is 3.5 stars.

The garlic fries were meh. Crab cakes were basically $9 each, that order is only 2 crab cakes and I split that between 4 people.

The crab chowder was also mediocre.

My favorite was the hot skillet seafood (mussels and shrimp) but even that was kind of on the pricey side. The price just didn't feel justified for the quality of the food.
author: Kenny N.

description:
In my opinion Crab House wasn't that good or anything special. My husband and I came here because it was suggested by a local. Well this wasn't our favorite place to dine while visiting. 

We started our lunch with a side salad and their bread bowl of Clam Chowder. The salad was ok. Nothing special. The tomatoes seemed like stewed tomatoes instead of fresh. It was different but I care for fresh tomatoes instead. It was romaine lettuce, onions, tomatoes, cheese, and dressing. The dressing wasn't that good or didn't taste homemade. It tasted like standard bottled dressing. My husband's soup was ok to me but he felt it tasted more like a vegetable soup or stew. It had a lot of vegetables in it. He felt like the Fog House's Chowder was better. In my opinion I liked Crab House Chowder better. I will say the Fog House chowder is more like a real Chowder. 

I ordered the Crab Angel Hair Lasagna and my husband ordered the Crab Alfredo for our main meals. I love angel hair pasta so this was fitting for me. The sauce that was served with the dish was salty and super buttery. Besides the Salt it was ok. The actual lasagna itself wasn't bad. It could have used a tad more seasoning but it was ok. My husband thought his Alfredo was pretty good. I will say the Alfredo sauce was actually decent and his noodles were cooked well. Both of our dishes were good but nothing spectacular.

Overall, the Crab House wasn't horrible but there are certainly other places to get better food.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
One star - One star = Zero Stars
For the 45 minutes wait in line,   This is what our Christmas choice of restaurant gave to meeee

 A dirty haired crab for two by the sea

Hairy crab, not prepared correctly at all. My Louisiana Grandma would slap you for dirty hair left on the crab. That's just lazy.
Our waitress was Christen

Very nice nasty is what she was to me

We were seated at a 6 seating sectional table.  We sat at the two seat addition piece that was not connected to the other table.   [___] [x] 

We wanted two Iron Plate Combos at $35 each. We asked if we could move to a larger table knowing our iron plates would only fit one. 

Chisten said, " I'm sorry seating is tight  There is nothing available We are not allowed to move you"  We pointed to the table across from us that was empty ...again asking for room for our meals. We told Christen we want the seafood iron plates.
Christen said, you don't want 2 do you?

She also said her job was more important than our request, to ask the manager if we could move, but commented what a sweetheart the manager is. Then these two ladies sit where we asked, and they ordered only one iron plate. Same old forgetful service. No water, no bibs, no wet wipes for fingers, unless asked.

But we tipped anyway. Tis the Season to be Jolly Fa la la la laaa la la la laaa
author: Alyce D.

description: Coming to SF for the first time, I've heard great things about the Pier. The crab house was one of them and was not disappointing. Ordered the fish and chips. Great food (lots of fries, big fish) with amazing sunset view
author: Jay D.

description: This place is sooooo good! Food was delicious and service was great. Loved the view. Also love the music they play here!!! Definitely coming back soon.
author: Kristen B.

description: Had the delicious seafood soup called cioppino, I was expecting more seafood variety but the taste of the broth was spot on.
author: Ara A.

description:
Stumbled (literally) upon this place with a group of my friends a few years ago when we were buzzed and just wanted to eat something. Located on the 2nd level of Pier 29, I recall there was a pretty long wait (everywhere in SF had a wait) so we did what we always do to kill time - have more drinks at the bar. In my drunken state, I remember thinking to myself it was one of the best meals I've ever had. My friends all agreed which I felt validated my intoxicated opinion, no? Anyway since then I've been itching to come back to see if sober me feels the same. 

Few years later, I finally came back to take my little cousin out for her birthday. Sober verdict? Just as I remembered; very few things fell short of perfection. We came on a Monday afternoon and still had to wait 45 minutes! Since my cousin is only 15 and we couldn't just go have a drink at the bar, I tried to find some family-friendly things to do nearby and luckily we walked right into Mirror Maze which was such a fun way to kill time. 

This time we got the: 

Whole Crab + Double shrimp - Served on a sizzling skillet, roasted with their garlic sauce. Just like how I remembered it! Ahhmazing! Make sure you dip the bread in the sauce on the skillet. It comes with a garlic butter sauce and a herb butter sauce but I prefer the sauce on the skillet. 

Seafood Cioppino - Didn't care for this dish; not a tomato broth person but my cousin said she really liked it.

Garlic noodles with added crab - You MUST get this dish - I repeat - you MUST get it this dish. It's the key dish that gives the meal that perfect carb-to-crab balance. Definitely on my top 5 list of favorite garlic noodles and, like I've mentioned before, I'm a garlic noodles CONNOISSEUR! 

Tiramisu - I'm not a dessert person by any means, unless it's ice cream, but this was so addicting. We demolished it. 

The only downside is that they clean out the crab guts before hand so even if you order the whole crab you can't get the guts :( My favorite part of the crab!!!
author: VixCyn P.

description:
I would say that the 3.5 star rating that Crab House currently has is about right.  I'm always amazed at how on the mark Yelp can be :-)!

I went there at the end of August.  I was there on a Thursday night, so it was not very crowded.  I reserved a table on OpenTable.  I was disappointed that they did not allow a reservation for one, which seemed to discourage single guests from coming to their restaurant.  I brought this to the attention of the host and they seemed surprised.  I don't know if they have since fixed it.

Anyway, as I usually do, I ordered the crab.  It was a bit salty, but otherwise, quite good.  The crab itself is quite fresh.  I love the little tuxedo bibs.  The service was excellent.  I just wish they'd cut down the salt a bit.  People can always add salt if they'd like...it's rather difficult to take away.
author: Susan R.

description: We ordered "Lotsa Crab."  When the 3 pounds of steamy, buttery, and garlicky crab is delivered to the table, the impulse is to dig right in.  While the meek will drop the leg due to the heat, the true connoisseur disregards the burn to crack and tear into the heavenly flesh that is dripping with their House sauce.  A moment of euphoria rushes over you and when it was gone there is only regret left for not ordering the "Two too Crab."  Simply put, love the crab.
author: Dave H.

description: Another delicious place we ate at while in San Francisco.  A friend of mine recommended their crab chowder in the bread bowl and something called garlic noodles with crab.  We didn't want something too heavy since we were had dinner plans with friends so we decided to share the garlic noodles and get our own chowder in the bread bowl. The chowder was delish and was just right.  The garlic noodles was insane,  honestly I didn't want to share but I did...so thankful my friend Faith reccommend this place to eat it.  There are so many options to choose from it gets overwhelming sometimes.  Can't wait to return back to this beautiful city by the bay.
author: Janice T.

description:
This is a great place with fantastic service and food.
It's definitely casual and the fish n' chips were my favorite!! I wish they had clam chowder instead of crab chowder but everything was awesome!!
The service here is wonderful!
author: Angela J.

description: We were told that there was a 25 minute wait - got in after just 5 min! Awesome start. The host and hostess were really nice and accommodating. I overheard a couple people being impatient and rude to them but they kept their cool. Our waiter, Angel, was the definition of high quality hospitality. The food industry is tough and the servers do their best just to earn that extra tip. The food was overwhelmingly delicious. When I say overwhelming, it's because we underestimated how much food there was. The quality, freshness, and over all flavors gets you full so fast. I had to bring the food to go and it filled up an entire bag. Awesome experience all around.
author: Francesca Marie R.

description:
Absolutely amazing! We ordered the whole crab with the secret garlic sauce, crab chowder in a sour dough bowl, and garlic fries. 

We received our food in under five minutes and everything was piping hot. The crab was fresh and delicious and the service was friendly. 

I can't wait to visit crab house again :)
author: Daniela F.

description: Can't go wrong with this place!! Great food with fascinating view(if you get the window seat).
author: Gloria S.

description: We went to the Crab House on Sunday, August 19th for a 23rd Birthday! Although it was really busy, I had a reservation and was seated right when we arrived. Our waiter was attentive and great, our food was good and the ambiance was cool! We definitely return in the near future.
author: Latrese J.

description: Overall just a great place! Would definitely recommend to people around the San Francisco area who are visiting or live there.
author: Mark C.

description:
My friend and I dined here on the recommendation of a local when we were in town- I'm now thinking he may get a cut of all the proceeds just for sending people their way. We got here too late at night for the fantastic views we heard of, so definitely go during sunlight hours if you want that.

We were quoted a 45 min-1 hour wait time, and stared at for a while as we decided what else was around, when the hostess then offered us immediate seating at the "communal" fire pit table. Um, heck yes! Some view that as the peasants table but we viewed it as an immediate service and maybe some new friends. It took a bit to get the waiter to come to us but after that, we had great service the whole meal- so if you're in the same boat as we were, go the communal table route.

The food was your typical upscale tourist dining experience- yummy food but the price tag to go with it. I think we ended up making some free bread and an appetizer each our meals. 

Better option than most of the establishments on Pier 39
author: Erin B.

description:
OK, shoot me for thinking 4 pieces of cheesy garlic bread should cost me anything $5 and under. 

Forgive me for thinking that even Red Lobster's shrimp Alfredo tastes better than the one here. It was begging for seasoning.

And lastly, forgive me for not ordering crab at a crab place simply because I didn't feel like going to town on a whole crab. I was instantly regretful when I saw the sizzling crabs and the inhaled the garlic and everything else. Ugh.

Since the shrimp alfredo was an epic fail, we also ordered a bowl of crab chowder. Very celery-y but we still enjoyed it.

Cheese bread was heavenly but it was severely overpriced for 4 measly pieces.

Beautiful view and can't wait to come back with Scott when I get a pretty penny and an appetite for crab.
author: Alexys E.

description:
This place do not disappoint with the garlic sauce. We have the lotsa crabs and it's perfect for two paired with garlic fries and salad. The atmosphere with great customer services surely make it better. I make a reservation via open table at 8pm and it's seated at 8:01pm. Reservation definitely recommended with guests coming in the same time as me and was told 45-1hr wait.


If you are a seafood lover, a definitely try.
author: Jennifer H.

description: This was our first stop when we arrived in SF...well our first stop after we checked in our hotel lol. We made reservations and were seated by the window. We ordered the garlic roasted crab which was large enough to share with garlic fries. Our server was very attentive and knowledgeable. We felt the crab we shared was a reasonable price for a touristy spot. We enjoyed our dinner overall and left satisfied.
author: Rhea N.

description: I've lived in the Bay Area for 10 years and have gone to the pier 39 countless of times but have never ate there. My friend suggested we go to crab house. We went right after the blue angels show, expecting the wait to be long, we only waited 10 minutes. It's right along the water so the view is wonderful. The service was very good, they are quick to what you need. After we ordered the food came in 3 minutes! I have never received my food that quick before. I ordered shrimp with garlic fries. The garlic fries were a little too greasy, but the fried shrimp were delicious. The shrimp cocktail sauce was the best I've ever had. My friend had the crab, I had a little bit and it was cooked to perfection. The water glasses were a little to small for how greasy my food was. I would've preferred a bigger glass or continuos water fills. Other than that, the food and view were great!
author: Ami S.

description: I was there last night 10/28/18 and everything was great. Service perfect  food amazing no problems. But the reason for the three star review was because of this girl that was sitting at the bar and moved to a table. She was being so loud I was able to hear her from the other side of the restaurant I asked to speak to the manager I think his name was miles. He was very concerned with our complaint about the girl being loud. I appreciated that he knows how to provide good guest service,so I watched as he went over to the table and then I saw the girl start yelling at him. He eventually walked away there was no more loudness. But as they were getting up she was screaming inappropriate things and acting not normal she Called the manager a piece of shit and then I saw security come in and escort her out and I was very satisfied when that happened. So it's a 5 star visit but 3 stars because of the guest ruining our dining experience. But we will definitely be back.
author: F G.

description: Crab House never disappoints. The crab is always super fresh and my fav go to restaurant whenever I'm in San Francisco.
author: Raivon G.

description:
The place is right by the pier. The staff was great except for this one female waitress who was racist and unprofessional. She was downright confrontational and acted as if we didn't deserve the same treatment as the rest of the customers. We were sat at a table that was very close to another and when we saw a booth opened up, one of the ladies in my party asked the people by the front who sat us down initially if we can be moved to the booth and they said okay. So, my other friend and I proceeded to do just that. This female waitress with a short hair and white came at us and accusingly stayed "that table is for reservations only" and I told her in a calm and polite manner that we asked to be moved and was told it was okay and that we wouldn't just sit ourselves anywhere because we know better. Her response was "well I don't know you" and did this in front of other customers. Instead of apologizing she acted like she was in the right at how she approached us. In addition to that, I watched her the whole time we were there and she touched all the male waiters in inappropriate ways that I would consider harassment and saw that the waiters just tolerated it. Thankfully our waiter went above and beyond and I also spoke to the manager. She apologized and I do hope that this waitress will learn to be humble and change her attitude. The food was great and I would go back there if she is no longer there. Otherwise if you aren't white you might be reluctant to return. 

Just to be clear, besides the horrible experience with the female waitress who talked down to us, everything else was great. The food was delicious. We ordered the seafood served on a grill and it's the best I've had. The manager and our waiter went above and beyond. The manager listened to our complain and apologized as well. I would definitely return there if that female waiter isn't there.
author: Mary S.

description:
Go for one drink and a stack of "lotsa crab". The sauce is great and enough to dip the crab meat in plus dunk your bread in too. And the skillet helps keep all of it warm.
The waitress we had that night, Gigi, was the best. Helpful, attentive, funny, the perfect pairing for our great meal.
We'll definitely be coming back when we're in the city again.
author: Manda H.

description:
I love the fact that I can make reservations through another app. And by the time we find parking and walk over, we could be seated right away. During lunch and dinner, they always have a long wait. 

Food and service is amazing. Even if we don't have a reason/occasion my family tries to go once a month since this place is about 45min-1hr away from us. 

Proportions are ideal. Seating is great when you are placed by the windows. Bathrooms have been pretty clean. 

Great seafood restaurant on the pier.
author: Francesca B.

description:
Good service, Great food, what's there not to love?

Crab (sautéed and probably fried) on a skillet was delicious. Hit the spot, even for us southern girls who live on seafood. 

Crab chowder was bomb. Better than most crab corn bisques I've had ever!! Friends loved the Chopino.

I could eat a whole order of fries myself, if I didn't have any self control, and the fries here ALMOST made me lose any self control I had. Sooooo full of garlic. Yum. Drooling. 

Mixed Drinks are large and generous!

Came here with a group of 8 girls and would love to come back!
author: Amy T.

description: The crab house is a restaurant spot I've been too numerous times and every time the foods been fresh hot and full of west coast flavor. Pier 39 is very popular and busy and there's hundreds of seafood spots to choose from and you won't go wrong here, I never have! Ps the sights are amazing as well!
author: Keith W.

description: Delicious food, fabulous entertainment! Made us somewhat forget we never got picked up by Deluxe Sightseeing Tour ! Had to Uber back to Fishermen's Wharf! Great ending though having dinner at Crab House! Sat right at the bar and watched the seals out on the pier!
author: Catherine R.

description: We went her for the Dungeness crab after reading reviews and it was so delicious! Definitely touristy given its location but the crab was great. We also started with the scallops which were awesome. We dipped the crab in the sauce left in the cast iron skillet and it was rich and salty and amazing!
author: Kelly C.

description:
My first sign that this restaurant wasn't going to be good is that the waitress didn't know where the mussels were sourced.  Waitstaff should be told before they start their shift but obviously this doesn't happen as a sign the restaurant doesn't care. After determining they were from Canada (which means they don't even care to use local product) I overlooked that fact because I was told they would be of a good medium size. Clearly she didn't know what she was talking about because when they were served they were so small (the size of a finger tip and smaller) and when I called her out on it she basically ignored me for the rest of my meal!

And then there's the "killer crab"- yuck!  It's described to be in a garlic sauce (which I would have really enjoyed) - but it was so heavily laced with green peppercorns that there was in fact no garlic taste at all.  So disappointing as their signature dish!!!!

To prove the waitress was ignoring me - she brought my check immediately after I finished my meal and didn't offer any dessert. 

Did I eat it all - yes. But only because it was so damn expensive and I didn't want to waste it. $64 for a small order of mussels, half crab and an iced tea with tip!  And did I stop by In-n-Out Burger on my way back to my hotel - yes!!!  Because I was still hungry and at least you know what you're getting there at a good price!!!

Management - please don't bother to make a fake response to my review because there's nothing you can say to make me feel better about this mediocre meal. This restaurant should be ashamed for their gross food!!!!!

30 May 2018 - As expected management left a typical corporate response which is completely asinine and says nothing and does not address anything I have brought up. I posted the same review on TripAdvisor because this place is such a rip off given the "quality" of their food!  If I can spare just one person the agony I had to go through then so be it.
author: Theodore A.

description: Only giving this place 4 stars b/c it didn't feel so clean and tables were kind of dirty. Other than that, I enjoyed the food very much! We ordered the "lotsa crab" which was 3 lbs to share for two and the "Iron Skillet Roasted" shrimp and mussels. It was a good portion for two. I could have eaten more but it gets pricey. Can't say that I could go back because we are from RI. But if we lived in San Fran or if there were a Crab House near me...we would be regulars for sure!
author: Linda S.

description:
I love crab! First time trying this restaurant out and it was average price for seafood! We ordered the lotsa crab and it was just the right order for my boyfriend and I. We were so full after eating.. it was so good. They also had lemon butter and garlic butter for dipping sauce. Not that long of a wait, surprisingly. 

They had other combo's on their menu as well. Lots of variety, crab and shrimp combos or family combos as well! Must try if you're in the area!
author: Jeanneen M.

description: Great food. Crab was on point and the fries were great. Would come back just for the crab cakes. Service was quick and polite.
author: Colby T.

description: Location, perfect! Garlic noodle pasta with crab, delish! Crab, delish! Mojito, delish! I wasn't a fan of the crab chowder or the cleanliness of the restaurant. We sat in a booth and not that it was filthy but in the corner of the booth there was alot of crumbs, trash, dirty walls that just need to be wiped down and only I would probably notice. Pricey but that was expected; seafood, Pier 39. Server was friendly and knowledgeable regarding portion sizes and recommendations on the different seafood platters/crab plates.
author: Mayci R.

description: Extremely touristic place but this is not surprising, due to the location. There is a lot of staff but they are not well organized. We were party of 10 waiting for a particular table. The greeting person didn't inform the rest of the staff and they gave away this table to party of 4 (!). Super long wait for the waiter to get our orders, then we got our order a bit mixed up. The food itself... Crab is good but the salmon I ordered was below avarage. Small, dry piece, oversalted and drowning in grease.  The 70% of my plate was taken by green leaves of side salad. The price for this dish: $30 (plus tax, plus additional fee of 4.9% charged by this restaurant, plus tip). So if you are not there for crab only, don't go. Lots of better places in the area: not so crowded, not so pricey and with much better food.
author: Magia B.

description: Sat at the bar and ordered shrimp, garlic fries, and crab chowder. Soup came out cold. The fries were luke warm at best. The shrimp pieces were small and not sizzling on that supposed to be hot plate! I can vouch for their garlic butter sauce but that's it. The food was so eh I didn't bother taking pictures.
author: Tracy V.

description:
Dinner with a view here with my family.
The place is clean, a high end Crab house. The service is good we didn't wait too long for our food. The Crab  calamari  clam chowder and my Chardonnay is excellent... we came here Saturday and seated right away. No waiting. 
Beautiful experience. Will surely be back here!
author: Joanna R.

description:
Thank goodness i made  reservations for Father's day, 11:30 (that's when  they open).  As soon as we get there 11:10 there was already a line.  
Luckily  as soon  as they opened, they accommodated reservations first. We got seated with a view, window side. The restaurant was filling up quickly.   
We first ordered apps- Large garlic fries, bruschetta and we're given house  bread that you can soak w/ olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Yum  
My party ordered roasted crab with roasted shrimp,  garlic noodles w/chicken, crab chowder in bread bowl and my  meal, cioppino. Everything was delicious, our server was attentive and we enjoyed our meal and time there. I only had a few fries, my family tore it up! So we decided to order another one but medium this time.  
We were offered dessert but we just couldn't. What we needed to do was walk off our food around  the Pier.
author: EmmettsGuRL C.

description: My husband and I arrived a bit late, but they still accommodated us! Good service and good food! My husband remembered this restaurant the most from our trip to NorCal. We got Dungeness crab and mussels combo! Their garlic and lemon sauce is soooo good!!! Will be back
author: Sun Y.

description:
A touristy restaurant with a great view off the pier, we stopped in for crab.  Prices are high but we figured we were in the right place for crab.  I ordered the crab lasagna and was a little disappointed with the portion which was about the size of a post-it note.

Service was haphazard - we first has a waiter who didn't seem to understand us.  Then we complicated things by asking for a split check.  Another waiter took care of the drinks and did it auction style, holding up each glass and asking who wanted it.

Overall, an OK experience. Great view, nice but small portioned food, and a funny waiter experience you'll tell your friends about when you get home.
author: Harrison C.

description: Roast garlic crab was excellent. Great service. If you are walking in without a reservation plan on a wait.
author: Kay K.

description: The food was amazing but their service was terrible nasty attitudes as if I was bothering the nerve !! I'm glad the food taste better than their attitude !! & for the record i waiters should be careful who u rub the wrong way blocking ur own blessings good day !!
author: Sophia S.

description: loved this place!  Awesome water views.  Great food and very accomodating to food allergies.
author: Deb B.

description:
We ended up, in the area, last fall and ended up giving Crab House another chance. We showed on a week day for an early lunch. They open at 11:30am, so it was nice to get there early and have a nice bay view table. 

We ordered crab cakes, and unlike our first experience, the crab cakes were delicious; they were packed full of crab meat and gently breaded, just how I like them. Our drinks were a little pricey, but were refreshing. 

For our main course we shared shrimp and mussels. We were both very impressed with the freshness and the delicious flavor. We were also given complimentary bread which was fresh and yummy. We ended our meal with a dessert, to go, and split a piece of raspberry cheesecake while enjoying the view. 

One of the best parts of the meal was the service. Our waitress was very sweet and attentive. I wish I could recall her name because she is worthy of a job well done.
author: Angela O.

description: We only come here for one reason, which is their roasted crab. Their secret garlic sauce paired with the crab tastes so scrumptious, I'm dying just thinking how good it is. Their calamari is pretty tasty and garlic fries as well. Service can be hit or miss. One slight grievance I have that has nothing to do with the food is that there have been a few occasions where I have had lunch here and the restaurant leaves some of their windows open... and while it may help air out the seafoody smell sometimes it gets so windy that the food gets cold faster... I would choose smelling like seafood then eating with my coat on and shivering. We've asked to close the windows which they do so that's a plus.
author: Ann A.

description: Whew this was so good ... double shrimp  and whole crab . Caesar salad was one of the best!
author: Lilli O.

description:
This has been the best experience I've had with seafood thus far. We ordered the crab and the skillet shrimp and mussels. The butter sauce that came with the shrimp is to die for; so much flavor. 

The crab was magnificent as well. There were a couple pieces that weren't so fresh, but the waiter was super kind about giving us a couple more pieces. Service was quick as well, and our waiter was really attentive. 

Will definitely return for more!
author: Emily Z.

description: I've been coming to this place for years and they haven't disappointed me yet. We order the crab feast, garlic fries, and chowder and everything was delicious. I think this time was even better than the last time I was here a year ago.
author: Kevin S.

description:
I remember when we ate at another restaurant, I saw the crab here and it looked really good so we said why not and try this place.  Well we wanted to get the crab like everyone else, but was $45 dollars just to give it a shot and said well we should get something else instead as we have still a lot of time in the day.  We ordered the claim linguine and crab louise which were $25 dollars each and still pretty high, plus tack on the extra 4.67% for the SF health fee.  The place is somewhat clean, but the floors were pretty slippery as I felt like I was almost going to fall on the floor. Bathroom there is only 1 and the place you feel cramped, but they have to since there are many people waiting outside. 

Service can definitely need improvement as our waiter looked like he did not want to work there.  Pretty much we did not get our bread till very later like 15 minutes after we ordered our food.  The bread was very disappointing as it was hard as a rock and they did not give us butter. We had to ask for it.  Pretty much, we had to ask for more water.  The waiter did not look too busy as they were standing around, I can understand if he was doing other tables.  

We finally got our food. Pretty much the plate is very huge, but the portions looked every small as the hole to put the food was well small.  The salad was pretty good and had a long plate.  The crab was fresh and the only thing the waiter got right is he asked us for more dressing.  The pasta itself was good despite the smaller portion size.  

So overall, I would rate the food as a 4 and the service as a 1, so it would make it a 2 star rating.
author: Keven W.

description: I reserved thru open table. The food was fantastic and the view is great. My ife loved the shrimp and the crab. The chicken for kids is delicious. (Opps did i say deicious) hahaha i just ate what is left over from my little princess
author: Jeffrey C.

description: To be honest i saw the reviews and the pictures since before my trip to San Francisco and was excited to visit but i was very very disappointed, i made a reservation the day before and upon arriving the hostess was super rude and impolite and the food wasn't the best I've visited two Crab restaurants prior this and they were delicious, also the food was burnt and the place was so tiny and small for this many tables and people! I would go back hone but not recommend this place to anyone at all!! Go down or next door to get tour crab fix!
author: Shoug A.

description: I was at this place back in July I just forgot to post the review. It was really good food. I mean you can't go wrong with crab. The place is not large but then again it was very busy. We didn't have a long wait because we sat at this round table in the middle of the restaurant with other patrons but it was fun and it was a great view of the pier. The 1st picture was of the table next to us that had king crab. The following pictures are of what me and my friends ate, crab chowder in a bread bowl, crab cakes, crab enchiladas and crab lasagna. All so good and rich. Try it out.
author: Kesha C.

description: Really enjoyed this place. Not a very long wait and got to see sunset from our table. We had the full crab with shrimp sizzling plater and it was yummy.  Two thumbs up.
author: Sylvia V.

description:
My husband really wanted to come back to eat here since it was my first time in San Francisco. We ended up going here since it was conveniently right by where we did a segway tour right on Pier 39.

We walked in to a crowd and talked to the hostess. We decided to go for the bar area since it was just the two of us and less of a wait. After a short wait for them to clean up, we got seated immediately. I had a good look at the menu before so we put in our order immediately.

We got an order of the lotsa crab to share as well as our own set of drinks. I got the Moscow Mule and the husband got a bear on draft. The drinks came out first and they do not skimp out on portions. My Moscow Mule was served in a high glass which is far more generous than the copper mugs you usually get it in. Next, our waiter offered us some bibs to enjoy crab without so much mess. I was wearing a white sweater so I happily took the bib.

Out comes the crab! It came out freshly cooked with tons of garlic on top. This was my first time having Dungeness Crab and I think I had expectations similar to Snow Crabs. The crab itself is easy to break apart just by hand, but the crab meat just tasted dry to me. I dipped the meat into the sauce, but the meat still tasted dry to me. Husband was super happy eating it and for once ate more crab than me.

Service of the place was pretty impressive. They know how to turn tables quite fast and clean. As soon as we were done with a plate, it was cleared. Thankfully so, because the bar area we sat at could be so cramped with everyone ordering crab.

Overall, I'm just not crazy about the crab, but it's definitely a west coast experience to try out, regardless.
author: Abbie C.

description:
Love this place! Great spot on Pier 39. Not too long of a wait, but I called ahead of time to check their wait times. Our wait was 15 min. One piece of advice is that the garlic noodles are better without the crab. It's $8 more & loses its garlic taste. Personally the views are better during lunchtime rather than dinner, but I still like the ambiance!

2017.08.24 Thursday for 2 people. Too much food so we had leftovers...
Garlic noodles (5*****)
Small garlic fries (4.75*****)
Garlic noodles w/ crab (3.5***)
Crab louie salad (4****)
Cup of crab chowder (2**)

2014.09.01 Monday for 2 people. Right amount of food. No leftovers...
Glass of Honing white wine (4****)
Small garlic fries (4.75*****)
Crab (4****)
Garlic noodles (5*****)

KEY:
The range is one to five asterisks...
One asterisk is bad
Five asterisks is awesome
author: Kim C.

description: Tried this again and my  experience was very good. Service was a bit slow but once the food arrived it was all good!!! We ordered the Crab Fettuccine, Garlic bread with mozzarella and mojitos.  The Crab Fettuccine was excellent, the garlic bread was the BOMB ; mojitos were perfectly crafted. The hostess was very kind and attentive. This experience ensures thAt we will return to try that Killer Crab!! Thank you to Jennifer for reaching out to us to assist in an excellent dining experience
author: Sh J.

description: Absolutely loved this place!! I'm confused as to why the ratings aren't higher. We were initially going to try out one of the higher-rated restaurants at Fisherman's Wharf but we spotted this place while walking around the area and it looked a lot more enticing. The bread - amazing. The fish and chips- amazing. Mussels, shrimp, & crab- amazing! The garlic dip that comes with the platter is soo delicious we dipped everything in there. I would highly recommend trying it out. Also, if you're having beer and plan on ordering more than two, just get a pitcher. You can pour some on the platter too (; Overall will definitely come back here next time I'm in town. 5 stars!
author: Sofia T.

description: If you are looking for seafood at the Pier, this may not be the best bet. Cramped entrance and a very small bar area. The shrimp cocktail wasn't good. The seafood platter was served with shrimp that still had the peel. Very messy.
author: Stephanie W.

description: I normally avoid restaurants at tourist places like Pier 39 but we were looking for a snack and a crab cocktail sounded like a good idea. We were seated immediately at a table with a nice view. Our waiter was excellent and a bit entertaining. The crab cocktail did not disappoint with plenty of crab meat. The only downside was the price. The price for the crab cocktail buys a Crab Louie at a restaurant away from the tourist spots. (Four stars for the food and waiter, minus one star for the price.)
author: Gregory S.

description: Gorgeous views and good food. It is a little crowded, but worth a visit. The food was in big enough quantities to split. Certain spots had a nice view of the water. The tables are pretty close together, so it can get loud and you can hear everything the next table says.
author: Jonathan F.

description: Very Poor service (got an eye roll by waiter who didn't know his menu), lousy overpriced food.  View was ok.  Save a lot of money and skip this place and go to the Cod Money, you'll thank me!
author: R H.

description: My husband took me here June 2, 2018. It was a bit cramped inside but other than that the food was really good. We had the calamari, fries, crab, clams, and shrimp. I would have liked the shrimp to be a little bigger but it all was delicious. Our server made the whole experience awesome. I can't remember his name but he is from Italy. He took our pictures and chatted with us he was really nice and welcoming,, very genuine. We will definitely go back, since it's so close to home.
author: Miss M.

description:
Stumbled across this place while looking for dinner in the area. We took a road trip up from San Diego that day for spring break and hubby's work, so we were tired and it was getting late! Luckily, Bubba Gump's had an hour and a half wait, otherwise we would have never found this place!

The Crabhouse is located right on Pier 39 with amazing views of the city and the bay. We arrived on a Saturday night so we assumed we would never get a seat. Luckily, we only had to wait about 30 minutes before they seated our party of 6 on two separate tables close to each other. The inside was pretty loud and crowded, but we didn't care - we were hungry!

The hubby and I shared their $50 seafood plate which arrived on a HUGE sizzling griddle. Perfect for two and maybe even 3 or 4 people! There was mussels, shrimp and dungeness crab seasoned to perfection with a butter chimichurri sauce on the side. I was hoping there would be a side to accompany it; like rice or potatoes, but our server informed us that it did not come with any, but that he would bring out some bread. 

The kids ordered the crab chowder, the salmon plate and a burger. They each said their food was delicious! Tried the chowder, which was served in a bread bowl and thought it was very creamy and tasty!

Our server was very friendly and gave us just the right amount of space to enjoy our food. The prices were on the steep end and we noticed that the customers around us were either on dates or celebrating an occasion. 

Anyways, it was a pretty great meal to start out our vacation in San Francisco. So glad we decided to try this place out. We enjoyed this restaurant and highly recommend it. Can't wait to go back!
author: Anna D.

description: This place was recommended by a friend. And it definitely exceeded my expectations. No wait. Great location. Their food was so delicious. Their soup and bread is also delicious. I got the crab pasta with shrimp. Very tasty! Great view as well.
author: Wendy R.

description:
We stumbled upon the Crab House in the very busy tourist saturated Pier 39. We had limited time until we had to catch the nearby ferry and everything in the immediate area was jam packed.

After a short 10 minute wait we were seated at probably the best seat in the house. We had amazing views of the waterfront and could hear the nearby seals.

We let our waiter know we wanted to order right away since we were on a schedule and he was accommodating.

I started with the pineapple mojito which was light on the liquor but large in size. 

Less than 5 minutes later our appetizer and main course was brought out. Wow! Lightning speed.

For our appetizer we had the steamed mussels and shrimp which came on a piping hot platter. The shrimp were pretty good but the mussels stole the show.

For our main course we both had the crab sandwich. Messy but absolutely delicious. Garlic fries came as the side.
author: Becky K.
