description: Food was great slightly overdone seating was kind of tight.  Crab chowder was a little cold.
author: Tammie D.

description: Omg soooooo good. Loved it all. From the buttery garlic. To the mussels. I however do remember that the crab cakes were a little pricey. The area we sat was near a big open window. I thought that was a lovely view of the sun setting. The set up was cool. They had the food on this thing where it was above and you just throw your crab shells and bits on a plate below. I some how thought that was just so fancy. The combo of crab and mussels filled up me and my friend. I can't wait to go back! Make sure you get reservations! The hostess was accommodating to me. I thought our reservation was at 5pm...but it was really 8pm. They changed it and allowed us to come in at 6pm. Thanks!
author: Thi N.

description:
This place truly deserves it's stars.   We came here with friends from visiting us from Asia. 

We enjoyed the clam chowder and Cioppino.  I have my own personal favorite, vut this comes to a very close 2nd.   Their Cioppino is a pleasant dish that goes well with the other seafood dishes in the menu.  Our kids enjoyed the fish and chips.  

The place is pricey, but it's the norm for seafood restaurants in the area. After all, this is a very touristy area in  San Francisco.

This place will not disappoint.
author: Rochelle 'Shella' T.

description: Server we had was very poor, but the food made up for it. Delicious crab! Everything was cooked very well and seasoned perfectly!
author: Kevin S.

description: The food was great with the free bread, they gave us. I had the crab enchiladas they were filling but seemed to little for the price of it. I understand its in pier. The service was okay. It took a while before I got more water in my cup or to even order. It wasn't that busy. If you have money I would say go ahead and eat.
author: Mario G.

description: I've been coming to this place for years , it's a family tradition, but I recently discovered that their fish and chips meal is to die for. The fish is so fresh  and you can tell it's bartered and fried to order . I dream of this buttery crust . I will definitely be back soon, for more . Their crab is amazing and their garlic noodles are just so tasty. I recommend making a reservation , they are always busy , and make sure to park at the pier 39 parking and get parking validation from them .
author: Sofia G.

description: Absolutely love this place!! Their sea food is fresh and tasty! They are always packed so I would recommend making a reservation. This is my go to restaurant in SF.
author: Heba M.

description: Gave this restaurant a try for dinner on our first night in San Francisco... It definitely did not disappoint!!! We ordered The crab angel hair lasagna & the Two Too Crab... both were AMAZING. Gorgeous views and perfect service!! No reservations, so we sat at this round table with a fireplace just inside the door... worked out great! Would absolutely suggest this place to everyone!
author: Heidi L.

description: This resteraunt is one of if not the best crab resteraunt in San Francisco. Delicious food, a great atmosphere, and beautiful view of Fisherman's Wharf are some of the highlights of the eating experience. The only complaint I have is of the bread. You would expect some delicious sourdough bread to compliment your meal since the resteraunt is in San Francisco, but the bread only disappoints you. Or at least, it disappointed me.
author: Ian K.

description:
Being a crab lover this restaurant was highly recommended by a friend and I could not wait to try it.

We went on a Wednesday night in late January so business was steady but it wasn't packed.

The service was outstanding! The 
maitre d' and wait staff was friendly and attentive.

Unfortunately I did not enjoy the meal. 
We ordered the double crab, shrimp, and mussels, and the fried shrimp and chips.
The presentation was nice but everything on the double was void of flavor, except for garlic. I'm a garlic lover but sadly, this overpowered everything. It wouldn't hve been as much of an issue if there had been a choice of having crab or shrimp plain, without the garlic. A better variety of sides like roasted potatoes and corn, as is the norm with most seafood boils, would also be a nice addition. And the meal was quite pricey for what we received and the lack of enjoyment.?
author: Marian M.

description:
So you're in San Francisco and you want some seafood. I mean that's just the right craving to satisfy, right? 

I get Fisherman's Wharf is a tourist trap, but for some reason I always come back to this place. Sure the price might be over priced for crab, but I've never been anywhere else to compare. This place is always a hit for me. The crab comes doused in this this garlic butter sauce that's TO DIE FOR on a grill. The Seafood Cioppino is delicious. Especially on a windy and cold day out on the Pier. It's mixed seafood so you get a variety of clams, mussels, calamari, etc. 

The service is great and the waiters always very tentative. You also get to look out and if you come on time catch the sunset!
author: Christine L.

description: When I first stepped in here I knew I was going to try things I wouldn't usually try. I had the pasta with macaroni sauce in my opinion it was amazing. They have really good service and food and that is why I gave them 5 stars. I would come here again and I recommend you to come here to.
author: Alexis S.

description:
Ok. I noticed it's in the heart of the tourist of Fisherman's wharf. But my friends Kevin and Brenae touted the seafood platter and overall great chow so we tried it. I'm a fan of ciopinno and this is the BEST I have ever had-Including my wife's. And the Sea bass with ball bearing sized pasta balls reminded us of how good the sea bass was weeks ago at the Dead fish in Crockett. And they both served on like kind long narrow plates. We found out This is a sister Restaurant to the Dead fish in Crockett. 
Great chow. Will go again and try the platter.
author: Geanr L.

description:
We waited maybe half an hour before we got our seats. The place was packed with many people waiting outside around dinner time. I was delighted by how quickly the food came out, considering how long I waited for a seat. We ordered the crab clam chowder as an appetizer. I was actually very disappointed by it. For some reason I thought it would be similar to clam chowder but with crab. Sadly it was nothing like that and it almost just tasted bland with a lot of veggies in it. I didn't enjoy it at all.

For the main dish we ordered garlic noodles with crab and the crab alfredo. My boyfriend and I both agreed that the garlic noodle dish was way better than the alfredo. The garlic noodle was bursting with flavor and the added crab was a must. The crab definitely made the dish. As for the crab alfredo, I didn't think there was anything too special about it. The crab was good but the alfredo wasn't great.
author: Annie H.

description:
With all the hype of hearing about how big the crabs are here and stuff I had to come and try...well I guess that's is all it is...just hype. This place is really overrated and overpriced, but I guess it is what we got to go eat at the most tourist area ever. The wait to be seated here on a Thursday night for us was 20 mins, but the wait time isn't that bad. What I felt was bad was the host. I felt like he was a bit rude and probably over it. No matter who came to ask for a seat...there was no warmth and welcome from the host.

The dining area overlooked the pier and if you're lucky there might a sea lion to entertain you. We were lucky. We got a table by the window and there was one sea lion playing on the wharf. 

The food here was alright. We of course had to order crab. We got the iron skilled crab for two, crab garlic pasta, a large calamari, and a small garlic French fries. 

The pasta was a bit on the oily side. The calamari was delicious and plenty. The French fries was a lot for it being a small. A small size was good enough to be shared among friends. The crab was a bit on the salty side with the sauce. If you scrapped the sauce off then it would be perfect. Do be careful though there are pepper corn on it. I bit into two of these and my tongue was numb for a while. The crabs though on the bright side is super fresh.
author: Drew R.

description: nice place for visitor. Good food, good service, but too many people wait for a table.
author: Celina C.

description:
San Francisco has plenty of great seafood places, but unfortunately, Crab House at Pier 39 did not make my tier-1 list.  In a nutshell - nice location, delicious iron skillet-roasted items, tasty garlic fries, validated parking, and disappointing cioppino...  

It was crab overload for the family that night as we had an Iron Skillet-Roasted Combo with Mussels, Shrimps, and Crab, a bowl of Crab Chowder, a Crab Alfredo pasta, a Crab Melt sandwich, and a Seafood Cioppino.  If they had Crab Soda or Crab Coffee, we probably would have ordered them, too.  There was no shortage of crab here as the portions were relatively generous.

The seafood combo was as good as advertised.  The mussels, shrimps, and pieces of mostly crab legs were served atop an extremely hot skillet; it was so hot that one of the dipping sauces was still boiling when it came out.  When our server poured the magic sauce, the smell that filled the air was outrageous.  After savoring the aroma of roasted seafood, it was time to dive in.  The shrimps were the first to go because they would overcook on that hot surface.  The melted lemon butter was perfect for them.  The other dipping sauce was a red wine / soy sauce combination which was meant to complement the mussels.  These were not hard-and-fast rules, so we were dipping our food in either one.  The serving was just about right for four.

As enjoyable as the roasted combo was, it was a tale of two extremes because of the Seafood Cioppino.  It felt like someone opened a can of tomato sauce, tossed in all those wonderful ingredients, brought the whole concoction to a boil, and then served whatever came out of that experiment.  This was poorly executed and lacked character and flavor.  When I begin to think about the mouthwatering cioppinos at Woodhouse Fish Co., Sotto Mare, and Tadich Grill, Crab House's version was nowhere close.  I won't even bring up Scoma's because it is in a class by itself.  If Crab House were to partner with Apple, they could rename their cioppino to "iShoulda" because honestly, "iShoulda ordered something else."  For the love of cioppino, I was trapped into ordering this dish.  As such, I was highly frustrated because I missed out on the Roasted Crab in their Secret Garlic Sauce.

The Crab Chowder was very decent and contained a hearty amount of crab.  The best part about the Crab Melt sandwich were the Garlic Fries that came with it.  As for the Crab Alfredo, my younger daughter had to resort to her "parmesan-cheese-cures-all" approach.  This restaurant offers a lovely view of the bay and a one-hour validated parking at the Pier 39 Garage so there's also daylight here.  Having said that, they will also pad the bill with an additional 4.9% as part of the Healthy San Francisco initiative.  With the prices on their menu, I would expect that the surcharge is already buried somewhere there.  This is a solid spot for roasted seafood which would be our only reason to come back for, if ever...
author: John L.

description: I was surprised that people actually fall in line to eat in this restaurant. It was in pier 39 and my friends and I wanted to try clam chowder. When we saw crab chowder in the menu, it piqued our interests so we decided to try it. It was actually creamy and flavorful. However the crabmeat were too thinly shredded that you can barely taste the crab. The crabcakes were mediocre and small. 2 small crab cakes for $19.95. And the sauce was lacking. The service was pretty good though.
author: A G.

description: The menu was a little pricy and the portion size could have been better. Also they do not season their food, you will need to use some salt and pepper. Overall service was great and they are very quick.
author: Chelsea P.

description:
The seafood cioppino was amazing...hence the 3 stars...but everything else was ok. We ordered the 1/2 order crab legs it was pretty good kind of salty but dry. My husband had the fried shrimp and chips. The huge plate was covered in fries and about 8 pieces of small fried shrimp.
Concerning the wait.... we walked right in. No wait at all. It was a Thursday night. The place was pretty empty but by the way our waitress was missing in action you would think this place was packed and she was busy. After being seated it took her about 15 minutes before she came by to give us the menu. And while all the other waiters and waitresses would stand off on the side to wait on their table she was not around at all. For the amount that we paid for our meal I would expect better service. Will not go back.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Crab House is a touristy stop that specializes in, well, crab.  I'd probably like the place more if it were in a different location where I didn't have to wait an hour to drop $100 on lunch.

The wins:
1.) The crab was good. Not life-changing but really good.  We ordered a crab omelet, crab cakes, the crab linguini, and 1/2 a crab.  There was no shortage of our shelled little friends in any of the dishes and it was extremely fresh.

2.) Service was good. They are used to high turnover and the place runs like a well-oiled machine.  They want to get you in and out but aren't so pushy that you feel unwelcome.

The "meh":
1.) The 5% surcharge on every ticket.  I'm sorry if "the man" is sticking it to you but you should bury that in the price of the dish, not in a political statement at the bottom of the menu.

2.) $5 drinks.  Iced tea and soda should never cost $5, even at an airport.


The food is good, not great.  This place is more about where you are than getting the best dish of your life. Chances are you will be happy with your order, even for an extra 5%.
author: Travis B.

description: Had to go to get some crab. Everytime we are in town this is a must. Recognizing that this is a tourist trap, but, what a good place. Awesome crab, and hreat attentive staff. We loved it as always! The cran was juicy and yummy. And the liter of wine coupled with the amazing view sealed the deal! Will be coming back here next time we are in town! Guaranteed!
author: Thomas E.

description: We had the Lotsa Crab and the food was really good.  The service, however, was so poor. I think she really forgot about us.  I had to go to the bar to get my own water, drinks.  We ordered an appetizer (garlic bread & cheese), which was great....but then didn't have service for an hour. I got up and asked someone to check on our food.  The waitress finally made it back but blamed both the kitchen staff AND us for ordering the appetizer....this place would have been a 5 star had we sat somewhere else.
author: Veronica E.

description: Great crab legs! Highly recommend! We went to the Crab House for a late lunch and the place was almost full. We got seated without waiting for too long though. Their crab legs are fried first then sautéed with sauce full of flavors and condiments, and to my surprise, there even use Sichuan peppercorns in the dish! There are many Chinese customers dining in this place so that's a sign for great food right there! Lol
author: Connie K.

description: Brought my kids here over the weekend and I must say the food is amazing. from the apps to the meal to the service it was A-1. I love how they bring out the crab on the hot platter. My kids enjoyed it and thank you!
author: Kristinna B.

description: A MUST!!! I ate at a few locations on Pier 39 and was less impressed. I went to this place via Yelp review and OMG was it Excellent! I got the double shrimp and whole crab skillet and it was phenomenal. My wife got the chicken. Alfredo and ate it all. Try the Bloody Shark drink to pair with this. FANTASTIC!
author: Mikey F.

description: Good seafood. I've gone to this place a few times, all of which were good.  I'd stop there again.
author: Chris S.

description:
Overrated and Overpriced.
Came here for Lunch with my fiancé, BiL, & BiL's girLfriend.
Line was out the door and pLace was jam packed. After an enormous wait and finaLLy getting seated, I reaLized how smaLL this estabLishment was- no wonder it gets packed so quickLy. FYI- don't be surprised if you are seated at a dirty tabLe, they seem to be more focused on getting patrons in and out swift.

Our party ordered:
Crab Feast for 4- $140
Steamed CLams (medium)- $40
GarLic NoodLes(2)- $15/an order
CompLimentary Bread-$0

Crab was aLright, nothing great. The feast consisted of a few cLaws and legs, no roe. HUGE BUMMER!! 
CLams were good but cost more than what they were worth.
GarLic NoodLes were deLicious. 

Not worth the Long wait for food that was simpLy OK- 
Nice try though.....
author: Ter L.

description:
Touristy, overpriced, mediocre. Crab was definitely NOT fresh. It was tough and tasteless. It had either been frozen, or was very far from fresh, or both.  I feel ripped off for paying $100+ for crab dinner for two. I should have known better than to go to such a touristy place but got bamboozled by other reviews.  It was so bad that neither my partner nor I wanted to eat crab again for a long time-- and we love crab. 

Go almost anywhere in Chinatown and you'll get fresh crab for a fraction of the price. On the other hand... If you think Hard Rock Cafe (right next door) is fine cuisine, you just might feel right at home here.
author: Jay S.

description:
Can't go wrong with the Crab House!! Well, that's what I thought. Decided to celebrate the anniversary here cause nothing says love like sizzling crabs. It's right on the pier, actually confusing to find since its on the second deck. 

Anyways so let's start with the food
*Mussels & Shrimp - Great combination, the reason you must have this is because of the sauce that they pair this up with. 

*Killer Crab - Dungeness Crab that can feed 2. The flavor on the crab was good, nothing special though. Either way leftovers won't exist here. 

So the food was good, not really a thing to complain about. But being right in the heart of the pier I was expecting something more. Maybe I was expecting for the Crabs to be fresher, I don't know, something to put these crabs over the top. 

As for the service...
The service is the reason why I won't come back. We set a reservation and we got seated promptly. The host at the front had great energy, they greeted us "Happy Anniversary." Aaannd the pleasant service ends there. Our server didn't pay much attention to us. He was very attentive to other groups but not to us. He was very nonchalant and his lack of energy didn't make our experience a very memorable one. Maybe because we're young, not really sure why he wasn't showing us any love. 

Having been to Dead Fish in Crockett and the food was just as good if not better. And the service there was exceptional. Doubt I would come back to the Crab House, since the Dead Fish is a lot closer and the service was much better.
author: Arron E.

description:
Overpriced tourist trap with high prices and long wait times. The place is cramped, noisy and hectic. Not the vibe you want sucking on some crab legs overlooking the bay. 

Even though the obvious reason for coming here is to eat crab or other sea creatures, it's worth mentioning if there is anyone with dietary restrictions in your party, they'll be stuck ordering a side of steamed veggies or fries like I was. There are no gluten-free options, and they charge $9 for a small dish of steamed frozen broccoli, cauliflower and carrots. You know, the kind you buy at the Supermarket for $1 a pound. 

The $24 crab Caesar salad was equally overpriced and less than mediocre, with barely an ounce of crab meat on it. Don't waste your time or money.
author: Ute L.

description:
pro: i didn't have to wait long enough without a reservation.

Here comes the cons:
- poor service. our waiter was nice but too slow. sat down for a while before coming over to greet us and then took our order. He forgot our bread and only provided when we ask about it. our entree came before our appetizer did. the host/hostess wasn't friendly. gave the "i don't care if you eat here or not" kinda attitude. 

-food: if the food was at least decent, it would have made up for the poor service but the food was a big disappointment too. definitely had way better seafood. ordered the double shrimp with whole crab. 

I would not come back to this place nor recommend to anyone else. It's a spot where u would try if you come for a visit but would only go once and never again.
author: June Z.

description: Waited an hour for shrimp that have no taste but the crab was decent. The waiters weren't very attentive too. Not worth the time
author: Zeyad M.

description:
Me and one of my friends literally crave this place and are fully willing to make the two hour drive up there to do so! This place is a little cramped, so not the best for huge parties. And it's on the wharf, so a big tourist destination with a possible wait... but at the end all well worth it!

We usually start with the cheesy garlic bread, sometimes she gets the chowder or the Cesar salad. But always the main attraction is the crab! Depending on our hunger we'll ether get the lots of crab or two crabs. It comes on a hot skillet plate with this amazing garlic butter sauce. And then we'll do a side of mussels and/ or shrimp. Of course a glass, or bottle of white wine follows. Beware, you will be messy but an extremely happy camper! 

The staff has always been extremely helpful and know what they are doing. The only thing is sometimes takes a little for the initial greet from your server, but once you see how popular this place is you'll completely understand. They know so much about the menu, great suggestions and always fun to speak to. And then the bussers are fantastic! You never have to ask for water or to get the plates cleaned away, and any special request is fulfilled right away!

Love this place!
author: Samantha T.

description:
This review is for a visit from a year ago.  This place is a classless tourist trap.  My wife and I ordered the lotsa crab.  They just brought out legs.  I was like "Where's the rest of the crab?"  The portions were pathetic because they didn't serve anything from the body of the crab.  It was completely missing.  This made it waaaaaay overpriced for what you get.  Plus, on the receipt, it had a surcharge to cover some government tax.  They made it so obvious, and it's just classless.  How the hell are we supposed to enjoy our meal when we have to pay for an already overpriced meal, and on top of that, to make it painfully obvious that we were being overcharged to cover some government tax that diners don't need to know about?  If the restaurant can't deal with the regulations and taxes to run a restaurant, then they should not be in business.  There are plenty of other successful restaurants that are doing just fine that don't rub this kind of crap in the customer's face.  What most restaurants do is they just add a couple bucks on every menu item to cover that without dumping your restaurant business woes on the customer.  I guess since everything is already overpriced, the business is reluctant to do that as well.  

Very distasteful, disappointing, and just left feeling ripped off and dumped on.  Not recommended at all.  There are plenty of other places that are much better in every aspect, except the interior decor, at the base of the pier.
author: Sho U.

description: Absolutely Fabulous! On my last night in California me and my best friend tried out this restaurant. The food was incredible and the customer service was superb. The next time I come back to California I will be revising this place again. The seafood was fresh and delicious. The restaurant is right off the water so the weather was extremely cold, but inside the restaurant was so warm. When arriving at the establishment can take a longtime if you don't have reservations. The food is a bit on the high end but it was all worth it
author: Kaila T.

description:
Playing tourist for the weekend. I've eaten Dungeness crab my whole life. Hell, my dad used to work as a cook in various seafood restaurants so our family is used to eating only things that were swimming moments earlier.  

We came here for lunch. Seated promptly for a party 6. We were grossed out to see how dirty the water glasses were. Mine had pink lip stick on it and another had some yellowish crude stuck on. We notified the bus boy, who apologized and brought us 'cleaner' glasses of water.

Our waitress, who I didn't get the name was very nice, energetic and welcoming.  She was there to answer any questions we had, which was none.  We ordered the whole crab and shrimp platter, a romaine salad, garlic fries, seafood cioppino and the crab chowder bread bowl.

1) Seafood Cioppino; A little spicy, the seafood was cooked right and was not mushy or tough. Squid, shrimp, and mussels can be overcooked easily.  Use the complimentary bread to mop up this stuff.
2) Garlic fries; Meh...I've had way better.  Not much garlic and a whole lot of chopped onions/shallots. The fries are extra batter-y seasoned fries. Not much garlic flavor to them.
3) Romaine salad; It's a salad!
4) Crab Chowder Bowl; Bread tasted fine but I found the crab chowder very uneventful. Too much vegetables and not enough crab meat. Settle for the regular clam chowder.
5) Whole Crab & Shrimp on a sizzling platter; This was a major disappointment. As a major seafood eater I was shocked to find out how dry the meat of the crab was. The shell cracked easily, a little too easily, to be a FRESH crab.  I can tell this crab was previously cooked, frozen, then cooked again to be served. This makes the shell brittle, flesh dry and shrunk. The meat off the body was too mushy. Tasted like those casino all-you-can eat crab nights.  The shrimp wasn't any better. Most definitely imported previously frozen shrimp.  I had to drown everything in the garlic butter sauce to finish everything.

The food was not good. The setting was too chaotic due to the limited space and the amount of dishes and silverware on the table. Our waitress was the only redeeming part. She even helped us cut apart our crab!   Only came just for the tourist factor.
author: Robert N.

description:
We rarely go to San Francisco and whenever we do, we always go to Pier 39 just because they have a bunch of things to do and places to eat. We always ate at Bubba Gumps but this time we wanted something different so we gave Crab House a shot! It looked and smelled delicious but was a little iffy about trying after I saw the yelp reviews. 

There was quite a wait but we didn't wait too long. The seating areas were pretty small and tight. There was only room for one person to be walking at a time in between tables. I was constantly hit by waiters walking and it was annoying at times. We ordered the mussels, shrimp, and crab combo. As well as garlic fries, crab alfredo, and crab chowder. 

My favorite dish was probably the garlic fries and then the combo. The crab chowder didn't taste good to me at all. It was mainly veggies and barely any crab. There was also very little soup. I still prefer the taste of clam chowder. The crab alfredo was meh. It was so dry and plain. The noodles were hard and stuck together. Wouldn't order the crab chowder and the crab alfredo again. However, the combo and the garlic fries were pretty good! The portions weren't generous for the price but it tasted good. 

Service was okay. Our server was nice and they were pretty attentive. Despite good seafood and garlic fries, I wouldn't come back here because of the price. It's pretty expensive for a not-too-great crab. We ended up paying about $120 for the meal including tip. My bf's parents make better ones and it's cheaper too haha
author: Sheila C.

description: It was just ok. I had the Chowder bowl and I guess I was looking more for the Oregon Coast clam chowder. This stuff was crab chowder and lite on the crab. My son had the fish and chips and he loved them.
author: Rock G.

description:
Crab House is situated in tourist-heavy Pier 39. I've noticed that there can be a long wait sometimes judging by the sight of people waiting by the doorway. It is probably a good idea to make a reservation on Opentable before you come by. If you sit by the window, you get a nice view of the water on a clear day. 

Crab, and shellfish in general, is one of my favorite things to eat, so I typically order from the Iron Skillet-Roasted menu. 

$49.95 Crab, Mussels, Shrimp Combo
$49.95 Crab & Double Mussels or Double Shrimp Combo
$59.95 Whole Crab & Double Mussels or Double Shrimp Combo

Yummy, bib-on & let's eat.

Crab legs are steamed nicely and taste fresh & sweet. Get a whole crab if you like eating the tomalley, or crab pancreas, like I do. 
Most of the platter consists of mussels. The top of the sizzling skillet is dusted in salt, so the mussel shells are salty, but they still taste great; firm & not rubbery. 
The shrimp is nice and springy with a little char. 
It comes with garlic butter and an herb butter. They were okay, but I didn't use much of either.
You can dump your shells in the bowl underneath the skillet. Plus, there are moist towelettes, which are very necessary.

$18.95 Crab Cakes - not bad. It was ok, although I'm not really a fan of crab cakes, because I prefer chunks of crab meat over fried, shredded crab meat. The outside was nice and crunchy.

$7.95 Garlic French Fries - crunchy, salty, & savory. Still I thought it was too expensive for a small bowl of fries even with garlic, herbs, and a bit of parmesan sprinkled on top. 

I've noticed quite a few people wrote about negative reactions to the service, which I found surprising, because I've always experienced friendly, efficient service here. They put the bibs on us, ask us how we're doing, and smile. But then again, I'm not familiar with how they operate when the place is super busy with a line out the door. 

I always enjoy a tasty and very filling meal here. Somehow I find myself ordering the same skillets over and over again. Perhaps, I'll try the cioppino next time.
author: Joy W.

description: Server was super nice whilst she looks freaking busy. Main crab was good enough but nothing that special besides the reputations.. But has strength of location which has good view of Pier, definitely worth a visit for once.
author: Mijeong K.

description:
My daughter and I went there for the first time today.   What a horrible experience.   We ordered the Double shrimp with a whole crab.   We got about 15 tiny over cooked shrimp and an empty crab head shell with crab legs.   All you get for $59.99 are 15 tiny shrimp and crab legs.  I expected the whole crab.   The waiter did not bring our forks until the food was cold.   He never came back to ask if we needed anything else.   Our water glasses were dirty.  Once we were done with dinner it took about 30 minutes to get the check.    When I asked if they validate for parking he said, "Yes!"   He took my parking ticket and a minute later handed it to me stating that it was validated.   I trusted him.   When my daughter and I went to pay for parking we were charged the full amount.  The parking attendant told me that there was no validation stamp on the ticket.   He handed me the ticket and to my surprise, he was right.   The waiter lied to me.    I couldn't go back to the restaurant to complain because I'm disabled and not able to walk back to the restaurant againWe got overpriced, over cooked, not what was advertised for the price food.  We got horrible service and to top it off, the waiter lied to me about validating my parking ticket.  Through this horrible experience not once did I complain, not once was I or my daughter rude to him.   Do not go to this restaurant.   What a horrible experience.

Thank you to the owner who made everything right for my little girl and I.   You're the best.
author: K. H.

description: So I came here saw good reviews . I ordered the crab chowder and grill crab . Food was amazing . However customer service was a bit lagging . Not sure if because I was dining alone . But everyone got a roll and water and I was never offered none. Then when it came to eating my crab was not even offered a crab cracker. I did it with my fork. Being Mexican I find it very rude for waiters to be speaking in Spanish when all these other folks can't understand. Food wise was good though
author: Lizeth R.

description:
Showing up at 10 o'clock on Monday is worthless because they say they're open till 11 PM but they were not. That is their summer hours. So the information is incorrect and we are still hungry

An indication should have been that the phone number ring to  A generic Voicemail that didn't even tell you the company name
author: Ron P.

description: Their service was absolutely great! There was a waiting list for 3 more people but they manage it like a pro. We waited for less than 10minutes and poof we go! We got their combo which is the crab and shrimp & shrimp and mussels and the food was bomb to death! We will definitely going back here if ever we go to SF again! Will recommend this to everyone. And oh I forgot to mention the price was worth it!! Nomnom!!
author: Tiffany N.

description: (Edited) I left a comment that the restaurant charged extra $10 on my final bill here and their yelp page. The reason was that they replied to my initial comment on the yelp page, saying that they'll reach out to me, but they didn't. Thus, after ONE YEAR, I made another comment and reached out to them, asking them about the additional $10 charge. They pulled out the receipt copy, and it turns out that there was arithmetic issue there. The original bill was $109.35, and I multiplied it by 1.15 and put $125.00 on the total section (and wrote $125 down on my copy). Then I did the subtraction wrong and put $25.65 for the gratuity (it should be $15.65). Although I put $125.00 on the total section, they still charged me 109.35 + 25.65 = $135.00. I admitted that I made an arithmetic error, but it is my understanding from Visa's own rules that in cases where the gratuity does not match the total, the total amount is what should be charged. They replied that the policy is for the server to enter the tip amount, not the total amount, but they are willing to return the $10 to me. That's the whole story.
author: Jamie C.

description:
The place is a little overpriced.  $9.95 for a so-so crab chowder.

The restaurant can be found on the 2nd floor of the pier and does feel nice inside with a view of the ocean.

Tip : They do accept parking validation for togo orders so make a small order and save $9 on it.  The cheapest item on their menu is a garlic bread for $5.95
author: Kenji Y.

description:
I went here twice - once last November, and once this past week. The first time was great. We were there with a group of about 12, and were treated nicely. Monday I sat at the bar with my friend and the service was a little less than stellar. The beers we ordered(Great White?) were skunked and not very good. The food was decent - I had a plate of calamari I'd order again, but I ordered garlic fries which never showed up even after two reminders that I was in a hurry to catch a flight back to NYC.

I'd come back, but maybe table service next time.
author: Brian D.

description: Made reservation for Sunday at 6:30 for me and my boyfriend. There was a line and the restaurant was extremely busy. We came a half hour early. The hostess said it was fine and sat us in a booth. No wait! Our server, her name is Mam, came over immediately and got us started on drinks. My boyfriend got a beer and I ordered their strawberry mohito which I didn't expect to be so delicious. Just the right amount of liquor in it and not too sweet. I ordered the 2 lb crabs. The butter and garlic sauce that the crab was cooked it made the crab taste so so so good. Mam, our server is so friendly and fast. She cut up my crabs and also took photos of us. Love her. I ate the entire crab , I did not share. It tasted like heaven...when you dip the crabmeat in the butter garlic sauce and it enters your mouth. I couldn't get over how delicious it was. I honestly could of ate another one by myself. Thanks Crab House and Mam.
author: Maly C.

description:
For my roomie's birthday, I asked what she wanted to eat for dinner and she said CRAB! So I searched Yelp and found this joint. The reviews seemed great and the food looked awesome so done deal!

I'm always a fan of places who participate in reservation apps like Open Table or Seat Me. Crab House is one of them. Super easy to set up a reservation and when you arrive, they have all your information ready. The joint reminds me of a milkshake type diner turned Crab House. Everything is so white: the walls, the tables, the floors. Lots of big windows overlooking FIsherman's Wharf. We were lucky enough to snag a table right next to the window. Our server was also pretty on it. He visited our table enough times and really helped make the experience great!

For dinner, we went all out! Here's what we had: 

-Crab Chowder cup for $9.95. This chowder had lots of crab meat and lots of other stuff. The veggies seemed to overpower the dish only because the crab meat was shredded pretty thin. 

-Garlic Bread with melted mozzarella for $8.95. I liked this app. Lots of melted cheese and the bread was baked nicely as well.

-Too Two Crab (Serving 2-3 people) for $89.95. OH-EM-GEE, this is the dish to get! You get two whole crabs with the inside guts cleaned out. It comes on a sizzling skillet and served with a garlic herb butter sauce for dipping. SOOOO GOOD! Lots of crab meat in the legs and body. Great deal as well!

-Large iron skillet roasted Mussels and Shrimp for $39.95. Also a crowd favorite that day. The shrimp and mussels came sizzling and were flavored so well. The same butter dipping sauce made the entire dish come to life!

Overall, what a great evening! Great seafood, celebrating birthdays and loving the atmosphere. I'm having guests come to town soon and I'm definitely taking them here!
author: Rockne H.

description: Expensive AF and not worth the money. Go somewhere else not as hoytie toytie as this place for good seafood that doesn't cost an arm and a leg
author: Natalie Z.

description: It's Christmas eve and my 94 y.o mom wanted a crab salad.  Called them to order a Crab Louie salad from this place.  Was told that I need to physically be there before I can order the salad and it was CASH ONLY.  Went there to order and only waited about ten minutes.  When the hostess gave me the bag, I knew I should have looked in the box but I didn't because it was getting crowded.  The box was very light.  Walked back to my car and opened up the box.  Lots of lettuce but not too much crab.  Had part of the crab leg but little shreds of crab.  DEFINITELY NOT WORTH $25.00.  What's with CASH ONLY????
author: Paula Y.

description: We had very attentive service and great food. This is a very touristy area but this restaurant provides some sanity to the madness.  Crab chowder in a bread bowl is amazing!  Loved the view also!
author: Mary L.

description: What a miserable experience first of all I'm not usually much to complain not less there's a reason to complain and I am absolutely a foodie,,, I guess if you just want crab or muscles the place is probably OK but if you wanna ambience great food and food that look like they used Creativity putting their dishes to gather then this place is not for you. ,, Do not order the crab lasagna not less you like some strange combination of a cheese crust with like supposedly angel hair pasta which is actually spaghetti noodles in about 4 tablespoons of spaghetti noodles with a hint of crap flooding through them just the whole idea in the tiny little portion to give you I found one piece of crap and this dish,, they did take it off the bill but just a horrible experience the drinks were off my girlfriends dish was just OK it look like somebody vomited spaghetti sauce all over her dish with a hint of spies they call that crap enchiladas ,, save your money go to the fog Harbor go to the chowder house at this place needs help I know they're always busy and I really don't understand why my grandma knows it's bad food if she has no taste buds and she's blind
author: Mike V.

description:
Crab is one of my favorite things to eat and crab house definitely does it right. We were at pier 39 on our recent SF trip so we had to stop by and get some. Between the 6 of us, we split a crab feast, garlic fries, calamari, and I got to try some of the crab chowder. 

The main attraction and reason we were there, the crab feast, was delicious. The crab is nice and crispy and buttery. The shell was also easy to break which is always nice. It was so crispy that you could eat the whole end of the leg that's attached to the crab.

The garlic fries were garlicky (that's a word right? It is now :) Haha) and crispy, and the calamari was tender on the inside and crispy on the outside. Not sure what the sauce is but it tasted like a better version of a cocktail sauce; perfect pairing to the calamari. 

For as good as the meal was, the crab chowder missed the mark. I was excited to try it only to find out it was a little bland and flat. 

Overall our experience was good. The service was great as all of our needs were taken care of in a timely manner and the food came out quickly. This place is a bit pricey..being about $40 a person between 6 for the above mentioned. But, it's also crab so it's kind of expected. If you're not on a budget I'd highly recommend this spot; I'd pass on the crab chowder though.
author: Vi D.

description:
Let me tell you how I ended up eating here because it was a journey to be told..................

So for veterans day I decided to do a march/ruck to help end veteran suicide. My cousin is a veteran, multiple tours in Afghanistan and he is the leader for ruckfor22.org .  So I wanted to show my support and how did I show said support?  By marching from Sacramento to San Francisco over the course of 2 days.  Full pack. Trust me, it was crazy to walk that distance no humans feet, shins and calves should go through that, Lol. Well hello Mr. Blister? Good evening my pal shin splints.  We were a mess. Walked to vacaville the first day and then from emeryville to treasure island the second day.  Even over the new Bay Bridge. I was a limping mess across the finish line. 148 people honked at us. Yes, I counted because, well, what else you gonna do when walking this distance. But we finished!  Felt great, felt terrible.  We all went our separate ways to eat. I came all this way to NOT eat fast food and a small group of us ended up at Crab House...........

So I am STARVING, in massive pain where it looks like I have been beaten by a bat and super excited for some clam chowder. The bar was empty so we cozied up to it. They have crab chowder instead? Awesome! In a bread bowl? Hells ya!!! Crab cakes? Sure! Split shrimp and chips with my buddy? Why not! The bartender was a funny, random facts kind of guy. He added to the experience. The manager shook our hands and couldn't believe we walked from Sac. We couldn't either. Lol.  The food was amazing! The crab chowder was hardy and delish with the bread bowl.  Crab cakes were outstanding! I was super pleased. THEN as we are trying to pay the manager brings out free dessert for all of us. How nice even though I was terribly full. I ate it all!!! It was a poppy seed type of cheesecake with raspberry sauce. Will never forget the journey. The food. The people.
author: Wes S.

description:
For 3 people on Wednesday night this hit the spot.  I came for the crab but was blown away by the Ciopinno.  The sauce is really good and one of the best I've had in San Francisco.  We split several items among the three of us and it was about $70/person after all was said and done (including tip and alcohol).

- Small Tureen of Ciopinno 
- Medium Mussels & Shrimp
- "Lotsa" Killer Crab - This satisfied my craving for Dungeness crag, but I wasn't really impressed by the flavor profile of it.  
- Garlic Noodles - A bit flavorless but it had good texture.
author: Patricia N.

description:
The overall premise of this place fits the bill when it comes to seaside dining. Nice atmosphere, waterfront views, easy access. The food, although not absolutely spectacular (perhaps my summers on Cape Cod have spoiled me when it comes to fresh chowders and seafood) is still decent. We ordered bowls of New England Clam Chowder (just plain bowls...not the sourdough option so many others around us chose) and the servings were very generous. The chowder was thick and creamy but, again, does not even remotely compare to the chowders one can easily find in New England. But hey, we expected that much. We also ordered the mussels (in some type of coconut curry sauce) and the crispy fried scallops (appetizer). The mussels turned out to be surprisingly small and bland and were literally drowning in far too much sauce. The scallops were much better - crisp and well-seasoned -  and a nice way to fill our hungry stomachs while we waited for our chowder.

I almost gave this place three stars but decided the ambience is enough to bump it up a notch. It might have had five stars if not for our waitress who seemed lost in translation (she brought our chowder in the bread bowls even though we clearly stated NO bread bowls). She was nice enough but in other ways appeared annoyed when she brought us the wrong orders, etc. It was a little uncomfortable but - as in all dining adventures - you never quite know what you're going to get when it comes to food and service. 

Next time we're in San Francisco we might stop in for an appetizer and a drink but explore other dining opportunities outside of the Crab House.
author: Carol E.

description: This place is the best!!! First time there, and it was awesome, the food and service was excellent, super fast and prices are OK. Highly recommended.
author: Arahi C.

description: Loved the view from my seat. We had a window seat a great View of the bay. Just what I was hoping for that evening. Our waiter was great. Really took care of us. I shared the Crab for 2. I absolutely love the crab!! Couldn't get enough of it. The waiter cracks the shell for you. Also had Crab bowl. I'm a clam chowder person so it was OK did the job of filling me up. Great atmosphere I will definitely return to this restaurant if I get a chance.
author: Karen S.

description:
Hubby and I had the lotsa crab and it was lotsa yummy!!!  The garlic sauce, oh my!  I was dunking my bread in it to pick up every last drop!  We sat around the fire pit because we didn't want to wait for a seat.  Our server was amazing, he took our order...recommended we order the lotsa crab, delivered quick and kept our adult like beverage glasses full and our water!  Oh....AND he smiled a lot!!!  He was very nice!!  The gentleman who cleaned up our mess was amazing too!  He was constantly on the move...dumping the shells, clearing the plates, giving us napkins and towels.
The one negative....the gender neutral restroom was a MESS!!!  Toilet paper on the floor, sink was clogged...it was down right disgusting.   Whenever I notified the host, she acted as if I was annoying her.  I would have removed a star...but there was a ladies room.  I should have waited.
author: M F.

description: Great waiter 110 Fabrizio ? He spoke 4 languages our included (Spanish) not many people that talented in the this world. Food was amazing with a mix of sweet butter and garlic to dip and roll our crab in. Lol it was so eye looking good we dug in and ate it with no pic. We had bread with garlic and garlic fries. We shared a Mojito all in all it was amazing. Service was quick and customer friendly for the area that's so busy they did not skip of cleanliness and customer service.
author: Ed R.

description: Crab House at Pier 39 has some of the best tasting seafood out there that I have ever had. When I go in, I usually get their garlic fries, crab enchiladas or a crab omelette. The omelette is delicious and it comes with fresh tomatoes and other fresh ingredients thrown in. They really know how to work with crab well to get all the natural flavors out. I have been here a few times already and the views are always stunning and it's a guarantee to find warm, friendly faces as well as new specials every week. The Crab House at Pier 39 is a great alternative to enjoy seafood in this area.
author: Arnold H.

description:
For what it's worth, the food could be more tasty. But let's ease into that after the basic particulars:

The location is nice, easy to locate on the second floor of the area. The exterior is a nice ivory as the restaurant titles adorn the walls. It will catch your eye -- just how it caught mine.

When you saunter inside the restaurant you will immediately be greeted by the staff, which is kind! They try to tend to their customers quickly and efficiently -- we were seated immediately. The walkways are compact, hard to really move around with waiters and customers bustling to and fro; nonetheless, we were seated at a dainty booth that was freshly cleaned. It is probably the restaurant style, but they do not have windows. It's a nice touch, but a bird flew inside through our "window."

Moving on, the menu had a decent amount of choices for seafood lovers. You'd spend a good time perusing its contents and facing a mental debate on which plates to order. Now, most are expensive for what they are worth.

Personally, their garlic fries were better than our actual course. I do not remember the exact name of our order, but it was one supreme crab and a few shrimps. The shrimps were okay, nothing special, so it was a great filler. The crab I didn't enjoy too much. To be frank, it wasn't bad -- it just was not anything special.

I'd rather call my garlic fries we ordered my "dinner." We ordered the chicken alfredo as well; I couldn't even eat 1/4 of it. Yes, it was /that/ plain. The sauce was straight up cream, welling at the bottom, and not evenly coating their hard pasta. Maybe the pepper they grinded with it along with some spices bumped up the tolerance for me to have a couple of bites, but it was so incredibly plain I could not eat it. For its price as well.

Aside from the simple food, their staff was nice. It was a busy day so it was understandable to why they forgot my drink, but with that aside the staff was extremely kind and patient.

The noise level within the restaurant, as one might expect, is as loud as you might think it is. Converse from table to table morphs together into a loud plethora of jumbled voices, and maybe from screams of children -- if you are okay with that. I for one, found it quite rebarbative, but what could I expect.
author: Jenn D.

description: An excellent seafood restaurant, the main feature of which are crabs. There are several options for selection and for different prices. Yes, it is not cheap, but it's worth it. Very good and friendly bartender.
author: Colette L.

description: Came here for dinner on a weeknight after watching Hamilton in the City.  Was really excited to try their crab melt sandwich paired with their garlic french fries.  There was no wait at all at 5:30pm, and we were seated at the tables in the center aisle since we were only a party of 2.  They do have some booths along the inside wall of the restaurant and also tables along with window with some great views.  The center aisles with tables are a VERY tight fit with servers, bus boys and patrons constantly weaving in/out and squeezing between your chair and the person sitting behind you.  Food I'll give 3 stars. They start you out with bread and butter, but the bread is some type of French roll that is not warm and is relatively chewy.  Butter is provided in a metal tin and difficult to spread compared to the small packets since it's "chunky" and not smooth. Garlic french fries don't compare to Gordon Biersch garlic fries that you can get at the ball game, but they come with the crab melt.  The sandwich itself did have a lot of lump crab meat which tasted fresh, but would have liked more cheese or something as it was a bit dry for my liking.  Reason this place only gets 1 star is because their service was horrible...  Our server was not friendly, took our order while being distracted (he was still typing in prior table's order onto handheld device when asking for ours), never came to check-in on us once during our meal despite stopping over multiple times to engage in conversation with a table visiting from Spain who sat next to us, I had to ask him to check on my wife's entree (they brought my entree out with her cup of soup, but never followed-up when her soup was finished).  Finally, it was me who stopped him to ask for a box and the check and that's when he asked if I wanted a refill on my soda (when my glass had been empty 1/2 way through my meal) and also asked, "how was everything?".  Sad to think it wasn't even crazy busy at the time and Pier 39 is a major tourist attraction. If you're looking to fulfill a crab melt craving- skip this place and head over to The Pier Market on the 1st floor instead.
author: Philip M.

description:
This used to be my favorite restaurant in SF. I don't know if my taste buds are changing or if my stomach is shrinking but the last two times we came here, my wife and I were unable to finish the 3 lbs. of killer crab. 

The only thing we ever order here is the Killer crab. Honestly, don't even waste your time with anything other than that. If you do, don't say I didn't warn you. They give you free bread, and there is oil and balsamic vinegar on the table. STOP! Save the bread until the crab arrives!!! Dip it in the hot plate that the crab arrives on. If you want even a better experience, ask for a side of the killer crab sauce to dip your bread in. That's it for the food. Just bread, crab and sauce. Throw in a couple beers from the bar and it's pretty satisfying. The crab is roasted in a garlic sauce with capers, Szechuan peppercorns (can numb your mouth out), and the secret ingredient in the sauce is the crab innards. I know it sound gross but, you gotta try it. It's not off putting at all.   

This place is right in the middle of Pier 39 and if you ask for a window seat you can crack your crab while looking at the Golden Gate Bridge. Pretty nice view. The seats are in cramped quarters and on really sunny days it can get pretty warm in there however, just reach over and open one of the windows... Staff are really nice here. We've been coming here for at least 6-7 years and the faces don't change. So their employees definitely stick around. 

Okay, the reason why I'm giving this place 4 stars out of 5 is because of the value. When we started coming here the price for 3 lbs. of crab was $49.99, not a bad deal. This past weekend, it was $64.99 for the same 3 lbs. They also charge you an additional 4.8% on top of that, for what is described as a "cost of doing business fee"!! I don't understand that at all. Keep in mind this 4.8% is on the entire bill!! Not cool at all :/

In past trips to San Francisco, it would be pretty normal for my wife and I to eat here at least a half dozen times. Given the increased prices and the fact I can't finish our regular order anymore, one visit per trip will do from now on.

Enjoy this place Yelpers!
author: Alan Y.

description: Very delicious and the service is excellent as well. I will always pay this restaurant a visit when I'm in SF...I almost forgot to mention the view, we had the best view of the ocean, wonderful first time experience...
author: Elizabeth R.

description: Not friendly to food allergies, apparently everything has onions and cannot be made without it. Couldn't eat with my friend.
author: Talon M.

description:
It was our last night in San Francisco and we hadn't had seafood yet so seemed like a must do. We'd been walking around pier 39 and fisherman's wharf and ended the night here with family.

The decor was fun, little crabs up to all sorts of mischief. We were packed in like sardines so ducking and holding your breath seemed necessary every time someone at a neighboring table got up or moved. Not to mention it was really hot with all that compacted body heat. And very loud. I'm a crab and shrimp lover but I wasn't too impressed with either here. As if working for your crab wasn't enough all of the shrimp was still shelled too. It was overpriced in my opinion, the quality didn't match the price. The presentation was great but the flavor wasn't there. We did order a side of pasta that was the best thing ordered in my opinion. The garlic fries were ok. I didn't try the chowder but someone else in our party did and said it was good. Next time I'd skip the crab and shrimp.
author: Mysti R.

description:
Crab House is located inside Pier 39 on the upper level. Which turned out to serve as a great location to watch the sunset. 

Service was great; starlight to the point no frills.

Food was top notch seafood! So fresh and delicious I wanted to stuff my face and a doggie bag so the night didn't have to end. 

The combo (mussels, crab legs, shrimp) were finger licking good. And large enough for my dining partner and I to share. We also overindulgence in a large order of the best calamari I've ever had the pleasure of devouring. Delicate, yet bursting with flavor is the best way to describe the meal. 

I couldn't have chosen a better place to dine out in honor of my birthday. 

Strap on a plastic bib and enjoy!
author: Christy A.

description: Food was delicious and service was great! The hubby and I had the Lots of Crabs, mussels and shrimp. We also had a ceasar salad which was pretty big. Go hungry!
author: Elizabeth B.

description: If you love garlic and butter you will like their secret garlic sauce lathered over a fresh 2+ pound dungeness crab!  The mouth watering meal fills your tastebuds with that grilled sauteed flavor on a sizzling skillet served piping hot at your table. A table by the window lets you view the lights of the Golden Gate bridge.  Located on the second floor up the stairs from the many pier 39 shops. Enjoy!
author: Bob B.

description: Delicious Dungeness crab swimming in butter and garlic. Went there 17 years ago for my honeymoon couldn't wait to try it again on a recent business trip.  It didn't disappoint. Awesome location overlooking the bay too!
author: Kelly B.

description:
Looking for seafood....especially crab to eat for a late dinner this was the pick. 

Iron skillet-roasted:  
 - Double Mussels & Whole Crab = $60. An iron skillet of mussels and a bright reddish-orange-ish hued whole crab sat patiently ready to be eaten. Sorry buddies :(  There were roughly 25 mussels. 2 sauces: special garlic sauce and maybe a rosemary sauce? Mussels tasted like they've been sitting and roasted twice. Could be better.

Server did well by putting the bibs on for us but forgot to refill waters. Hand wipes were missing. Bus boy was attentive with replacing the throw-away bowl twice. 
Okay for a late dinner on Pier 39.
author: Tzarina W.

description:
I have been here over 30 times in the last year. I love it however this time might be my last.   

Very last!!!

Our server treated us like we were tourist or something..  I hate when places do that to anyone..

I got here and I was told about a 30 mins wait which was fine.  The host in front had bad energy and overall a bad attitude.  She looked lost and frustrated.  She told us to wait outside and they will find us..

The manager an Asian man was very nice and helped us out.  We waited 15 mins and got our table.  Once we sat down they had about six tables open up (9:15pm) I'm a bigger guy and asked if we (our 2top) could move near the window or booth.    

Sarah H our waitress said NOPE we have a 45 min wait, I asked nicely and asked again seeing if she could move us over since we just sat down. I explained that they could give another 2top our table...

she got nasty and said they can't , those tables stayed empty the entire time.  They then sat a three top and a child next to us.  Our tables were not split up, and my wife and I sat with three people we didn't know.  We moved it some, but still super crunched.  

P.s I love kids but it was date night and our kids were at home!!!

Sarah H hands down ruined this experience for me and my wife. 

- argued with me on how I wanted my order to be brought out. Finally she did but was rude, like I should feel lucky to have a table and have her as our server. 

You know when a server treats you like your broke and can't afford this place type energy... the funny thing is I own three restaurants in  Las Vegas and SF.

-$140.00 dinner I had to ask three different people for melted butter for the crab legs.. that's like ordering a pizza and they don't have cheese..

- they brought out the garlic melted butter, I requested regular, Sarah H didn't hear me or care to. I asked her three times for regular. Still nothing changed.

-3 plus pounds of crab legs and I had  to ask three people for a bib for us.  Sarah H didn't even offer us one however, she gave everyone else around us them.  Funny thing is most of the time the server always offers to put it on or explain how to.. it's about the experience Finally a busser did. 

Sarah H please learn how to treat people and have better energy. You are hurting the business.  I have spent over $4,200 over this last year here.  I guess I got treated like crap cause I didn't wear my suit and  shorts this time ...lol


Hands down people!!!  Trust me if they don't value customers then why go.
author: Jerome S.

description:
Just don't go here, let the people that don't look at yelp keep this place open. 
Worst service I have received in SF.
Everything took a long time,ordering, bread, cooking, refills 
In fact I cannot think of anything they did right.
I did not pay, they didn't even argue.
author: Rod D.

description: it is really good!!! Dipping the crab meat in the sizzling garlic butter is the best thing you can do when you are at the pier.
author: Shuang W.

description: Made a reservation for 11:30 AM the Saturday after thanksgiving and upon arrival at 11:25, there was already a long line of people! Those with reservations were promptly seated and I was very happy with where my table was located as we had a prime view of the pier :-) ordered the seafood cioppino and whole crab and that was definitely enough to make the two of us full! I'll be dreaming of the cioppino for days
author: Tiffany H.

description: This is our go to place for seafood in San Francisco. Although it's a tourist trap, right by the tour boats on Fisherman's Wharf, the food is always fresh and portions are huge. I made a reservation on line 7 months prior, got there early and eveything was exactly as promised. Greeted by friendly staff, our server was very attentive. Only drawback was the kids playing hide and seek at the table behind us, but thats not the restaurants fault. Place is very busy and a bit noisy, but when the sizzling crabs come out, everyone stops and grabs their phone.I love this place!
author: Vincent G.

description: Came early, right at 5 as we were still on east coast time.  Hit the trifecta - Food, view, and service (thanks David) were top notch.  Beautiful sunset over the Golden Gate Bridge around 6. Iron Skillet roasted seafood was great to share.
author: Mark F.

description:
The food isn't that great and lacks a lot of flavor. Not sure if I would come back again, considering how long the wait is to get a table/no reservations. In my opinion, not worth waiting for. Overpriced mediocre seafood. PPQ is better.

PROS:
-crab chowder soup
-calamari was tasty
-good customer service

CONS:
-sea bass quinoa: Not good, really bland and no flavor at all
-garlic noodles: more like fettucini garlic noodles so don't expect the usual thick chow mein style
-LONG wait for a table so you'll have to be patient
author: Jennifer J.

description:
We decided to eat at Crab house for lunch because we were drawn by the smell as we were walking by... Hmmmm.. We came in expected a darn delicious lunch .. Outcome: disappointed. For the price I expected the food to be a least yummy. We should've sticker to our original location. Well at least we enjoyed the garlic fries but everything else was ok.

Garlic noodles with crab - bad
Crab chowder- ok 
Crab melts - ok

Services- good
author: Katie K.

description: This is my third time coming here and it never fails. First time I got the crab alfredo and it was amazing. Second time my boyfriend and I got the crab alfredo, crab chowder, and one whole Dungeoness crab. And recently we got the Two Too Crab. The garlic/buttery flavor of the crab is amazing. Unfortunately for us the Two Too Crab didn't fill us up. Next time we will definitely be trying the Crab Feast.
author: Patricia S.

description: My boyfriend and I came here for a late lunch and were seated immediately on a Sunday. Our waitress was extremely helpful and sweet. The food was not bad, but nothing to remember it by. We ordered the double shrimp and whole crab plate plus a plate of garlic noodles. The crab didn't taste too fresh, but dunking it into melted butter definitely helped. Lol. The shrimp was good if not a little burnt and the garlic noodle was a bit on the chewy side. I'd have to say I give the food 2 stars. Not gonna lie - the bloody shark was bloody fantastic though!
author: Lang N.

description: Fast service, really good food and we don't feel shorted because we have a lot to see.  Nothing wrong with quality and fast. Not today!
author: Tami O.

description: This is a tourist spot on the hottest pier in the wharf but that does not mean it's not excellent seafood.  I came for the crab and a huge and delicious Dungeness crab is what I got.   Sooooo good and fresh.  I also got some ceviche which was really good but I was saving room for that beautiful crab.   I also had the waitress put a bid on my mom which made the experience very endearing.  It's also a little nicer than the other spots on the pier however you can come casual.  I don't know when I'm going to be back in the area but I'll probably make this a a stop again when I am!
author: Kirby M.

description:
This is not a post because I'm a tourist. The food is actually pretty good. We ordered two crabs that came on the grill with tons of butter. We also ordered shrimp and mussels that came in the same manner. Ordered the seafood cioppino  with very fresh seafood. Overall the food was 5 stars. However here comes the negatives. Bathroom wasn't too clean, just seemed over used and lack of attention. The server wasn't too tentative since we  were seated in the way back. The booths we sat in was very uncomfortable. 
Overall great food but will try other venues that all serve up the wonderful west coast seafood.
author: Mike W.

description: Very tasty, we spilt the Lotsa Crab and it was delicious. Server was great and offered great recommendations!!! We would go back and the view for dinner over the bay and sea lions was awesome!
author: Sarah B.

description:
Fantastic View.  

My niece and I came here for lunch while visiting the pier. We waited outside since this place gets really crowded. We waited a for a little long but since you're at the pier that should be normal. We had fun cracking the crab! It was delicious and meaty. We also ordered clams.. it was pricey but definitely worth the dining experience.  The service and staff were great!
author: Erika R.

description:
Best crab on Pier 39!

I went with a large group of friends for brunch. We are not tourists, but we had just gone sailing and craved seafood. Oh boy, Crab House did not disappoint. 

As a rule, I tend to avoid tourist spots. They are often crowded and expensive. Although Crab House is both, the food makes it worth the occasional visit. 

We ordered the mussel, shrimp, and crab leg combo. Perfectly cooked and seasoned. It was a reasonable price for the nice establishment. Your meal comes with complimentary bread and butter, so use it to sop up any juices. 

I would definitely come again and order the combo to hoard by myself. Skip the appetizers and go straight to the mains.
author: Joanna S.

description: Straight forward. Fresh, served hot, awesome sauce for the seafood. Our servers are very friendly and attentive. Love the experience. It is packed with tourist but if you have party of 2- less than 30 mins wait.
author: Loyce D.

description:
To me, this is typical tourist stop while in town.  On the wharf - check.  Fish on the water - check.  Crabs at a crab house - check check.  Pier 39 - check. 
Still, the wait is long regardless of the day you go.  
We waited about 30 minutes before we were seated.  The floors are VERY slick!  I think this is from the butter on all the crab dishes but i am truly guessing.  I can tell you that i almost fell flat on my arse twice trying to get to my table from the host station!
We had several different items.  My client had the steamed clams, he loved them.  He had a crab ceasar salad, it was a very generous portion.  
I had a bowl of crab chowder - good.  I ordered the  1/2 portion of crab and while it looked like nothing when it came out - it was more than enough.  I also ordered fries, totally not necessary.  
Ordered a kids fish and chips - this was disappointing.  The fish was way way overcooked, hard and dry, the batter was such a deep brown that it made it hard for us to break it. 
It is not a fancy joint, you def should not dress up to come here.  Floors sticky. table sticky and a tad dirty.  
Still, it's an experience and if you have any inclination to come and try it out - do just that.
author: Jan B.

description: Really disappointed with my visit to the crab house.It was an extremely long wait hosts  were supper rude. We were quoted 20 mins but waited 45mins. We finally sat down and our waitress was no where to be found . We sat there for another 15 mins before My husband had to wave down another waiter who was nice enough to get us drinks.. The waiter apologized for the wait and told us our waitress will be with us shortly Our drinks  came out but our waitress was still no where to be found .. we sat for another ten before the waiter returned to asked if some one had helped us.. "obviously not!" He took our order Our food came out  quickly but crab was over salted ..finally our Waitress stoped by and said hi but before we could order more drinks she ran way she only returned to drop off the check.
author: Heather G.

description: The Garlic shrimp is delicious, and the staff was very attentive to our needs even though it was Saturday night and there was a 1 hr wait time. We also reordered the Alfredo pasta because we had loved it last time we came however this time it was very dry, little flavor and had almost no sauce. Something must have changed. I ordered filet mignon along with another one of my friends and both asked for it to be cooked medium. His was cooked perfectly but mine was almost well done. I didn't ask for it to be sent back because I was starving but I'm sure they would have fixed it if I had asked. Overall I would recommend this place, just don't order the pasta. Garlic fries are ok, only a few of the fries have garlic and cheese the rest are regular fries.
author: Sandy N.

description: If you are planning on coming here, stick to the crab. Nothing else here is that great, but the crab is delicious. They are huge, cooked perfectly, and are very easy to crack open compared to other crabs I have had. The crabs are extremely meaty and don't even need butter, but if you do want it, I Prefer the garlic butter over the lemon butter. Service was very fast and our waiter was extremely nice. The seafood stew was good, but lacking a little bit of flavor. Like I said stick to the crab!
author: Harry P.

description:
My husband and I loved this place! 

It's a small cozy restaurant upstairs on pier39. It's fairly easy to find. We only had to wait about 10 minutes to be seated. I assumed a long wait, so it was a pleasant surprise. 

The price is fairly reasonable as well. Of course, if you cook the same items at home it would be a lot cheaper, but we are paying for the environment and service. It appears some people forget this aspect and complain about the price. Anyhow, we ordered the double shrimp and crab on a skillet and garlic noodles. We loved both dishes! I love everything about this restaurant. If you love buttery and garlicky this place is for you. 

Also, I love that the food comes out on a skillet. It just feels different in comparison to a plain white plate. Food sometimes tastes better because of the presentation. 

We will definitely be back!
author: Julia H.

description:
Definitely a splurge to come here but worth it.

Didn't have reservations Friday around 7 but waited only about 10 minutes. Boo got the filet mignon crab combo as I got the half pound of crab. Complimentary bread came and that was alright. Our main meals came out pretty quickly. His filet was cooked perfectly and was delicious. Of course, the highlight was the crab. I believe he got two giant legs and my half pound was four slightly smaller (still meaty) legs. These were amazing. Their garlicky parsley sauce was perfect. 

What really blew me away were the garlic fries that came with the steak and crab. These were hands down the best fries I've ever had in my life. Full of garlic flavor and perfect size/consistency...not too skinny nor too fat.

Our service was alright. We were checked on occasionally. However, when we were seated, I was trying to inform my meat loving boo about the process of eating crab as this was his first experience. I saw the tool to crack the shells but not any of the tiny forks. I did not mind as this wasn't my first rodeo and showed him how to use the claws of the crab legs to pry out any meat. It wasn't until nearly the end of our dinner that our server just plops into the jar, a bunch of tiny forks...so that was kinda annoying. I also thought our server definitely gave a bit more attention to some of the older (probably regular) patrons.

Overall, food was absolutely delishhh!!!
author: Amanda M.

description: If you are a lover of crab cakes, like I am, you will be in love!!! The sauce on the plate is to die for. I also had the crab chowder & it was fantastic. Can't wait to go again. Great fun music.
author: Wenzdai T.

description:
When you don't have relatives near by that can cook fresh crab, this is one place to dine while at Pier 39. Half a crab was $30 and it came out piping hot cooked in secret garlic sauce. The whole crab was $49. The half crab was enough for one person, but I could have eaten a whole one. 
My wife that the crab cocktail, $18 and had wished there was a little more crab. My daughter had the fish sandwich, $18 and it was ALOT.
The place was so packed that our server had to be asked to bring more water.
author: Charles D.

description: The fish and chips were really good. The shrimp was alright, they are not prawns. Their crab chowder is cool. Its almost like the Dead Fish in Crockett, they are owned by the same people.
author: Alaya W.

description:
This place is just OK. Tourist or not. 

For the price, you just expect better food. It wasn't bad, but wasn't amazing either.

Mussels $14.95 were small in size. It came with wine and melted lemon butter. There are other places that make mussels and fries a meal for +$3-4, and we would've rather had that. These mussels were small and overcooked.

Garlic noodles with crab $21.95 - most of the crab was at the bottom, and we got it toward the end. It was also probably frozen crab, as the crab in this particular dish was tasteless.

The crab chowder came with a decent amount of fillings, but not a TON of crab. Guessing this had previously frozen crab too? The crab meat was not very tasty and I've had my fair share of fresh crab.

Service was great, but we were placed on a corner table with a ton of traffic. I was waiting for noodles or a crab to fall in my lap.

Summary: if you're lazy and just want to eat, go here. Otherwise there are a TON of great restaurants in SF that could instantly out do this restaurant.
author: Christina L.

description: The bartender Brat was super friendly and helpful. And he made a terrific Margarita and was nice enough to take pictures of me
author: Caleisa T.

description: Hard to locate. Second level.  The ONLY place on Pier 39 to get a shredded crab sandwich.  $20.  A little more than I wanted to pay, but I was not disappointed .  Came with an ample amount of decent fries.
author: Robert S.

description:
Such fresh crab!!!
We got the combo of one whole crab with shrimp ($50) and its enough to feed about two people, maybe three if you guys are sharing other appetizers and such.
The crab itself was very meaty and very very fresh! Be careful when you first try to grab at it because it comes in hot on the grill! The shrimp was also very scrumptious with great seasoning. I loved to dip it in the their garlic butter.
We also got fish and chips. Loved the crunch on the fish and tenderness on the inside. The chips part are garlic fries!
As for the lobster chowder, steer away from it! It was so bland and tasted nothing like lobster to me.
If you sit next to the window, you get a great view of the side of the pier. Photo op!
Tip: Come before noon! We came in around 11:45 and there was no wait! Around 12:15 was when the crowd rolled in and the place was packed!!
author: Heidi L.

description:
Order the mussels! 
We stopped in for an early dinner on a Thursday evening and it wasn't too crowded yet. We got a table by the window and had a nice view. 

Started with the calamari appetizer.  It was delicious.  I'm not sure what the dip was. It tasted heavily of ketchup and since I'm not a ketchup fan, I had my calamari plain. 

For the main entree, we ordered the iron skillet roasted mussels, shrimp, and crab. While the shrimp and crab were good, the mussels were the clear winner! Next time I will order double mussels, which is an option.  The amount of food was perfect for 2 people. 

For small calamari appetizer, iron skillet trio, and 2 drinks  (non-alcoholic), our bill was $83. 

Food was good. I'll definitely go back for those mussels!
author: Jill B.

description: When you go in it doesnt seem like a fancy restaurant but once you are greeded and served the experience is as if you were running at a very fancy place. The host and waitress were so attentive and always with smile. We ordered our food and with 5-10min it was ready!! The food was delicious, we had the full crab and double mussels. If you can, ask for a seat near thr window, it is beautiful looking out to the ocean.
author: Olivia B.

description:
great crabs!
also recommand the garlic noodles!
author: Lizhou Y.

description:
Crowded. A little loud. But it's a Saturday at lunchtime! The food was fresh, hot, and delicious. I saw the yelp $$ symbols thinking reasonably priced. It's actually much more than I expected. No real cost saving food options, unless you eat a meatless salad for $12. I didn't take time to read the menu prior to. 
My husband, and son, and I ate (no drinks) and the meal was $108. 
But it was worth it. We were stuffed!
author: JENNIFER S.
