description: The whole crab here is incredible-if you get two or more you get them served on a sizzling platter that allows you to dip it in the garlic butter.  Only negative is that they don't serve sourdough bread!
author: Mike S.

description: Can't believe I spent over $100 at this place. I was going to go to a cheaper chowder place (it would have sufficed, trust me) but saw that this place was busy and thought "Why the hell not?" WORST DECISION. The food was overpriced for freezer food being heated up in the oven. We ordered a large calamari, crab chowder, chicken alfredo, fish & chips (2 orders) and garlic french fries. We waited so long to get seated that I didn't want to walk out once we tried the disgusting appetizer(s). Starvation = desperation. Will never step foot in this establishment again. I wish I could get my money back, but I can't.
author: Tiffany P.

description:
Even though I'm an SF native I don't normally frequent the touristy places like Pier 39, so it was a real treat when I found out work was taking my department here for lunch. 

Like I've said in previous reviews, I'm not a seafood lover. However this place was delicious. I started of with a crab chowder and that was heaven in my mouth. I then chose the fish and chips as an entree. I thought it was going to be some small lunch portion. The server placed the plate in front of me and it was freakin' huge! Not only was the portion big but it was probably the best fish and chips I've ever had. It was so good and the chips it came with were garlic fries! Even better! 

The place is a little bit pricey and like I said, if it wasn't for work I doubt I'd ever come here. But i'm pretty sure the fish and chips will have me coming back!
author: Mellani L.

description:
Garlic noodles good if you don't want to spend a lot with over priced messy crabs!!
Service really good, Mikiko was wonderful!! She's the best with kids !!
author: Pman B.

description: I was visiting the city with co-workers on business and I experienced the best seafood meal ever. The crab were so good words can't describe the pleasure my mouth had.
author: Corey J.

description:
To be honest, I love the Crab House -- I've been coming here since 2005 and I bring all of my SoCal visitors here to impress them with my bread and garlic crab eating skills. Seriously, if you've never seen a 100lb girl put down 3 loaves of bread and an entire crab on her own, you should treat me to dinner. No, but seriously, the crab here is amazing and if you aren't ordering multiple loaves of bread to absorb all of the garlic-buttery-deliciousness on the skillet, you are definitely missing out.

My biggest gripe during my last two visits has been the DISGUSTING floor. I almost ate it twice here, and not because I'm clumsy or choose to go out in heels. There is a layer of oil (butter?) and grime on the floor that cannot be sanitary! Also, I don't understand why, but I've been getting served cold chowder ... and that's just not okay.

So although I give the crab and shrimp a solid 5 stars, the filthy floors and cold chowder bring my rating down to a 4. For a place on Pier 39 with tourist prices, I don't expect hole-in-the-wall hygiene. Get it together, Crab House -- you definitely need a steam cleaning ASAP.
author: Jane L.

description:
This is located on Pier 39 where there is plenty of shopping and things to do around the area. Parking is a bit tough, but there is always a the parking garage right across the street ( a little bit pricey almost $10 an hour!! ) and the restaurants will validate to save you a little bit of money. If you make a reservation it makes it easier for you to get a table, because during high volume times there is usually a wait. We made reservation earlier that afternoon and requested for an ocean view to celebrate an anniversary. When we got there we were seated right away. The server and staff are all very friendly, kept our water refilled. We got a window seat ....such a gorgeous view to have dinner. We ordered the small steam clams, whole crab with their special garlic sauce, and small crab chowder. They have a wall of HOT SAUCES that was kind of cool to be able to choose what kind of hot sauce you want. They have different sauces from mild to extreme. The "TOXIC" hot sauce is crazy hot! If you are someone who likes hot stuff try that sauce out! 

The crab flavor was okay, it came out on a hot plate and it was a pretty presentation. The crab was very fresh and the meat fell out of the shell easily. The small bowls of clams was a good size to share for two people. It was very fresh and did not taste like the salt water from the ocean. The crab chowder was delicious!! The small is really enough just for one person. They use real dungeons crab meat in it. There is a small bar inside the restaurant with a small drink menu as well!!

Be aware that there is a small SF fee on the receipt and that is not part of tips (kinda weird).
author: Cindy W.

description:
Started off with the crab soup. I wasn't a very big fan of it. Ordered the shrimps next. They were fairly small and didn't have much flavor or taste to it. For my entree, I had a jumbo crab, of course! It was good, but it wasn't complete until I dipped it in lime with salt & pepper (Asian thing). If not for that, I wouldn't have even enjoyed the crab that much bc there was no old bay, and their butter isn't very salty. 

Service was decent, nothing to rave about. 

Would not wait in that crazy line again.
author: Phi N.

description: Only came by for some drinks and the view. They have a good selection of wine, beer and full bar. Was here with my friend, wife and kid. The bartender was great and made my kid a virgin drink. Although we didn't eat the restaurant smelled delicious!!!
author: Christina F.

description: Worst crab I have ever had, not to mention the most expensive. My party also had the fish and chips which was nothing more than a super crispy piece of fish on top of fries. The fish was almost burnt and the fries only acted as a sponge for the fish to drain the grease. I also ordered the crab cake appetizer and was very shocked that $18.99 only got us 2 very small crab cakes. Will definitely never go back.
author: Mark B.

description:
One of my coworkers wanted to eat crab, so with the help of Yelp we found this rest. The line was huge, so we sat at the bar. They were able to accommodate us, and Tyson our server was very good.

My three star review is related to the food. We had a large portion of calamari, the crab feast, and French fries.. The crab was good it just felt too greasy, in addition the sides they offer didn't offset the greasiness... I was hoping to see more sides, and more options in the menu .. Overall it didn't impress me, and is not cheap... I would go to another place.. Not this one
author: Roxanna Gisell R.

description: I had been there 4times. Food was great at the first time,but it is getting worse. Seafood is not that fresh and sometimes the smell of seafoods are awful. So I decided not to go there anymore
author: Holms W.

description: We will be back.mussels and crabs the perfect flavor with the perfect wine.  We have a new spot in San Francisco.
author: Robert J.

description: Incredibly overpriced, but what can you expect - came for the crab chowder but was disappointed.  It was very vegetable-y and not very crabby. I dunno man clam chowder woulda been better.
author: Grace T.

description: We went there on May. The waiter said SF's crab season is done. All their crabs come from DC. Which means the crab was cooked and frozen before they cook it. And those crabs do taste like frozen crabs. If you want fresh crabs and better taste, you should go to other restaurants.
author: Chrissy Y.

description: This is my go to place if I want fish when my friends and I make the venture over from the East Bay. We always have great service, and everyone is pleasant. Usually, my friends and I get a large order of Calamari  (Crunchy Thangs) as one of my friends nicknamed them a long time ago. My go to usually a bread bowl of Crab Chowder, and two Crab Enchiladas.  The Enchiladas are so filling. My friends usually get the Crab for one, or a Pasta with crab. We all agree that this place is always good.
author: Jeremy K.

description:
It's a very touristy place to begin with. However, I was extremely surprised that they served really good crabs! Ordered the 'lotsa crabs' for sharing together with a shrimp and mussels platter. 

The crabs were amazing! The garlic and butter sauce were just nice and gave the crabs a nice flavour. And they do use peppercorns so beware cause if you bite into them, they tend to give u a very numbing after taste. The shrimp and mussels were average as I thought the shrimps was not that fresh and mediocre, but the mussels were awesome! I love the garlic sauce that comes with it and compliments the freshness of the mussels.

The service crew can get really busy at times and you might have to wait during peak hours after 6:30pm. So I highly recommend coming in before that time to avoid queuing and get your food out fast.
author: Clement W.

description: Great service. Love the atmosphere.  The special sauce on the crab wasn't good to me.  Maybe offer additional options but the crab themselves were good. Will go back when in the area.
author: Glenn W.

description: See Brett at the bar! Not only will he give you the most attentive and genuine service, he will make sure your dining and drinking experience is expertly delivered.  Aside from offering recommendations on what to order, where to go next, and what sights to see, he shared the warmest smile with me and the rest of my bar buddies.  And apart from the awesome service, the food is A1; I'm not sure what's in the secret sauce but I don't care! The mussels, the crab, everything is tops.  Don't miss this gem!
author: Kris S.

description: Easy affordable no frills  place if you want the traditional bread bowl with chowder.  Chowder is nothing special but you can get it to go and grab a bench by the water.  They wrap your anchor steam in a bag so have a beer and soup on a bench and watch the water.
author: Kyle L.

description:
My first visit to San Francisco and I have heard a lot of good things about this establishment.  So this was my first stop and I couldn't wait to taste the crabs that everyone talks about.  I must say that I was disappointed and my bill of over $150 almost made me sick.  I really wanted to like the crabs but there was no flavor and sadly left a bad taste in my mouth. 

Maryland Blue Crabs win hands down.
author: S G.

description:
Came to eat here for my boyfriends birthday dinner. So glad we got reservations because this place was packed and a whole bunch of people waiting outside to be seated. I do suggest getting reservations on open table otherwise you will be waiting 45 minutes to an hour! 

Food: We started with Bruschetta, tomatoes were refreshing and mixed with a generous amount of garlic! Yum!  We also ordered cocktails which were on the strong side and I did not mind because we were celebrating. For the main course we order Double Mussels and a Whole Crab. All on a sizzling hot plate. The mussels were perfect and topped off with a white wine sauce at our table. And since it was "double mussels" there was at least 20-30 on the plate. The whole crab was so delicious and the best part is the waitress cuts the crab into sections so it is easier for the customers to crack. 

Service: The service was also great! The waitress was attentive and so were the bus boys constantly changing our scrap bowl when they noticed it was filling to the top. Make sure you too well because they all deserve it! 

Price: Seafood is always pricy no matter where you eat. I have to say I was expecting to pay more, but our bill came out to be around $160. 

Thank you so much Crab House! Definitely will be returning soon!
author: Stephanie A.

description: This place doesn't disappoint. If i'm anywhere near the wharf, you bet your bottom dollar, I will not leave until I have visited the Crab house and ordered their "whole lotta crab" and Ciappino. The food delish and the service is quick. So far I've been fortunate to come in at the exact time so I don't have a long wait to get my table. I've had 3-6 guests each time. They have great hosts, but my favorite is Tiffany. She makes you feel at home and is very pleasant. She get's you in quickly and even if the place is packed, which is always the case. I absolutely love this place.
author: Kelli K.

description:
We always come here once a quarter for their Killer Crab for two. It's the best period.

And we also share the caesar salad. Sometimes if we are hungrier we also get their garlic noodles which are just ok.

Been coming here for many years with family and friends and this is the best crab I have had in SF.
author: RJ C.

description: Fisherman's Wharf is a tourist trap, so it's only fitting to be a tourist and feast on loads of crab with garlic butter sauce for your first time, right? We ordered the iron skillet crab and shrimp, calamari, crab chowder, and romaine garden salad. The food is good, not great. Crab was alright. It's overpriced but you're primarily paying for the location and view. The bay view outside the restaurant is beautiful though. I do suggest making reservations as this place can get awfully crowded and busy.
author: Thi D.

description:
Not sure if we came on a bad night, but it was really a bad night! We made reservations for 7:00pm, we were there at 7pm, but no host/hostess. When a young lady with dark hair came out, she sat us to our table. But while we were walking to our table, she had a whole lot of food in her mouth so she was busy chewing and couldn't greet us. 

When we sat down, the waiter had given us water and bread and butter. The bread was so stale that when my husband bit into it he almost lost a tooth! 

We started with the fried calamari which was so over cooked. The squid was so chewy.
We had to drink water after every swallow to make sure it went all the way down our throat.

My husband got the clam linguini. He said it was just alright.. The noodles weren't cooked all the way and it hurt his jaw from constantly chewing.

I got the crab garlic noodles which was drenched in a tub of butter and oil. I honestly felt disgusted after eating it. 

Our experience was so disappointing that we skipped out on dessert. We just wanted to get out of there. 

It's a well known tourist restaurant. I'm glad I got to experience eating here, I just wished it was a little more memorable in a positive way.
author: Darlene M.

description: Drove to SF for my son's 21st birthday and decided to go here since the place looked fancy, the Yelp reviews seemed good and said they closed at 11pm. It was 10pm on a Saturday night when we arrived and the waitress was rushing us to "order everything we wanted because the kitchen was closing at 10:15" (her words). Her attitude, unfriendly demeanor, and lack of suggestions bothered me. After looking quickly at the menu and noticing the high prices and being rushed,  I was extremely annoyed! I wanted to leave but my son wanted to give it a shot so we stayed. We ordered crab legs, crab chowder, cheese bread and drinks. The crab legs were delicious but the crab chowder was full of corn with a little scoop of crab on top (very disappointing) and the cheese bread was boring. The drinks were good but the "birthday dessert" they brought my son was a very strong coffee tasting tiramisu. The service was ok but for the money spent it was not worth it at all! I could have taken my son somewhere much better for his special day. I will never return nor will I recommend this place.
author: Audrey N.

description: On my trip to San Francisco I had to experience the local Dungeness crab. Crab house at Pier 39 had what I needed. Decided on this location as there are more sights to see in the area. Got the garlic flavored Dungeness crab platter.  Good flavour, only thing is that it will take more work and skill to get the meat from the crab. I'm more used to the snow crab legs where they are easier to pop open.  I can see this frustrating any noobs to eating crabs. On a side note for Pokemon Go players, I literally caught a dozen Dratini during dinner. Pier 39 is lit with lures! Pokemon Go is popular enough in San Francisco that you wouldn't look like a weirdo keeping the game on while eating. Crab and Pokemon, it's a winning combination!
author: Cliff V.

description:
Came after my wife ate here in December and couldn't stop raving about the place. We had lotsa crab (enough for 2) and it didn't disappoint. As a side I ordered garlic noodles and side veggies. The veggies were nothing special, but the crab and noodles were out of this world! Highly recommend both and I'm looking forward to coming back to explore the rest of the menu.

About the service. We came on a Saturday at 6pm on the same day as the Giants fanfest and the Chinese new year parade. Suffice to say the place was jumping. Our server David was totally awesome!!! He exceeded our expectations and is an upright, honest gentleman. If any manager is reading this, David is a man of integrity and your company should be proud to employ. PM me if you want to know the specifics.
author: Bob E.

description: I go here every time I'm in town, they have delicious fish n chips and the garlic fries are so good! The view is gorgeous, so don't go too late. Lots of complaints on cost, if you're cost conscious then don't eat at a sit down restaurant on the pier, it's by nature more expensive to eat in tourist areas.
author: Amber N.

description:
This place is great for:

-Large parties or small ones.
-Locals of SF, the Bay Area, or just the touristy ones.
-DATES, just not first dates: it's gonna get messy, baby. 
-Your friends and them girls who aren't afarid to eat.
-Meal time with your family or in my case: my significant other's family.

Not good for:
-being cheap
-those who don't like garlicky things or too much.. this place is known for it.

Also my cousin told me it gets packed and the 8 of us got seats, but the restaurant quickly filled up after.. Lunch opens at 1130. 

(This is gonna be a long long review.. to skip through all the bull, scroll down to the asterisks)

My dad's family first situated in SF in California: but, we all know.. don't go wasting your time, money, or precious food buds at touristy restaurants near the pier. 

My boyfriend's family asked me for suggestions since I've gone and go to SF a lot throughout my life: just visiting family, family friends, or spending days here. Yeah I didn't know of places at the pier besides the little place I like to eat red clam chowder which isn't what his family was asking for.. So I asked my cousin who lived here forever and she didn't know.. And then BAM.. My cousin Kyle who also lives there had a suggestion and only one.. He took his ex-girlfriend her on a date once and it was GOOD, he warned it might be packed though and that it was gonna be pricey.

I checked in with my BOO-THANG's parents and they said money wasn't an issue.

My cousin and I have similar taste palate however my boyfriend's family prefers things that aren't very salty, seasoned, garlicky.. basically bland. So I was a little scared, but they wanted FRESH, FRESH, FRESH CRAB, and that was their only request. On top of that his relatives from Vietnam were joining us and I didn't know what their tastebuds even agreed with. 

***********
 The seafood was indeed FRESH. I've never had crab fresher than this and I'm not a crab person and I would have this again: there was so meat in it.. Everyone at the table loved their food. Although his brother said it was very garlicky (which I can handle), but he did love the pasta which had garlic. We got the crab version by accident.. Our waiter (shame on you.. you clearly heard it and repeated it) brought us crab instead of shrimp because not everyone *coughcough* my boyfriend likes that much crab. And crab is more pricey, so that slipup wasn't appreciated. 

^ We got 2 iron-skillets: one whole crab and double mussels, one crab and double shrimp.
One garlic noodles with crab. One garlic fries. 

They bring out complimentary bread. 

His family thought one skillet would be enough even though I didn't think so and we ended up ordering two. Mind you there were 4 couples at the table: 8 people. and four of the older crowd didn't eat that much crab, but it was the right amount. Except for me.. I still felt hungry.. 

Their garlic fries: you can't taste the garlic.. so maybe don't even bother, but their good and crispy, just ain't garlicky. 

They give you the not cheap bibs.. better than boiling crab: so you know where you're at when you're eating here: the fancy goods.

The interior was clean (white), chic, elegant, and cute.. I know my family would love this place especially my mom, so I'll treat them next time. Or even my friends would love this, but I feel like we probably wouldn't hit the pier up unless our relatives wanted to go.
author: Lilian L.

description:
Came back for a second try. Much better experience than our first time. Service was excellent and our food was delicious. I am a crab snob having grown up on fresh Dungeness crab in Bodega Bay. I ordered the fresh Dungeness crab which had delicious seasoning that still allowed the sweet taste of the crab to shine. The calamari was much better this time as well. Everything our party ordered was excellent.

My advice would be to come at a time when they're not crazy busy - it will allow for a much more pleasant experience.
author: Cheryl D.

description: We ordered a whole crab for 3 of us, it's perfect! Tasted good, it's my parents' fist time having seafood in San Fransisco, they really love it!!
author: Jiayin H.

description:
I expected the killer crab for a long time so here is the first place I gone when I arrival San Francisco. 
We arrival the crab house around 4pm and there is not so many people, we have two people and waited for about 15minutes although there were many seats available. No way to get a window seat for just two people because they left all window seats to 3 or more people. 
We ordered the whole crab and it was so great you have to try if you go there! We had one small order shrimps another small order of mussels not such special but were okay. 
I'll comeback again for the crab!
author: Nina N.

description: This was a total waste of time coming here. We were looking for a place to eat and saw this place. We were told 20 minutes.  It was way longer than that. Why? They accidentally put us down for 3 people instead of 2, so we had to wait for a 4-top table.  After 30 minutes, we went to follow up and we were told it'll be real soon. We waited and waited. Finally, that's when we found out that he put us down for 3 pax. Eventually we sat down. I was over it by then. The free bread came out cold and the butter was still tough. The only good thing was our waiter seemed genuinely nice. He had curly brown hair that looked European. But the food, long wait, loud atmosphere -- would not recommend. But luckily for them, they can depend on dumb tourists like us to take a chance on them.
author: Captain C.

description: Crowded. Busy. Tight space. But food was great. Not sure if I really liked the chowder. It was average. I could be biased bec I don't like corn in my soups. Crab cakes were good; love the slight crunchy crust on them. Had the garlic crab (two too special). Really good! Bartender was nice. He made me a great mule and let me sample the vodka and peach schnapps. Other than the tight space, I enjoyed it.
author: Chloe C.

description:
Thank you Crab House for accommodating my family and I. We were a party of 9 and wanted to sit together.  I definitely wanted to eat here that we were willing to separate our party just so I can taste the food.  The host was so nice that once the table next to us left, he quickly informed us that he will move my other two friends to sit with us.  It took less than 5 minutes and they were seated.  PROPS to the manager on duty and the staff.  

Service: 
Absolutely on point other than the server talking too much football to my friend.  

Food:
Crab Chowder
Fried Calamari
Bruchetta
Whole Crab
Garlic Bread with Cheese

Everything was absolutely amazing.  The Crab Chowder was delicious. 

Overall, a great experience but just a little tight with seating.
author: Nette B.

description: Went to Pier 39 and came across the Crab House. We were seated looking directly out the window at the Bay and Golden Gate Bridge; it happened to be Fleet Week so we got a free air show of the Blue Angels practicing directly out the window!  Food was excellent and service was equally good!  It was a bit pricey, but considering the food, service and views......WELL WORTH EVERY PENNY!
author: Sue B.

description: The double shrimp with whole crab was awesome. The garlic noodle was good as well. But crab meat in the noodle was very little. The sea bass was just OK.  The location is prime. The view of the sea is fabulous.  The price is a little high. The total bill for three of us was 148 including tips and tax.
author: Yingying W.

description:
We tried the Lotsa Crab cooked in garlic to share with 2 adults and a child and that was soooo delicious We had their crabmelt as well which comes with garlic fries. My son had they pasta in butter cheese sauce..Lastly, the Tiramisu. Yum!

I would suggest getting a reservation in advance.. We came in an hour early and they gladly offered the immediate available sit. 

Will definitely  come back here !
author: Donna C.

description: The wait wasn't bad... 10 minute wait. Order a cup of crab chowder, adult fish and chips, and a small seafood cioppino. The seafood cioppino was a little spicy but very good.
author: Rose S.

description: This review directly goes to our rude most unprofessional and extremely biased sever"JULIO M"! You shouldn't serve people if don't know how to appropriately talk to people! So today at our early dinner one of our family members is highly allergic to fish, so I asked him if all his food was fired in the same fryer he said yes so I asked him if we could just have pasta no chicken on it he looked at us rolled his eyes and ignored our request since we were a large party he said he wasn't going take to much time on us because he had other tables we said ok no big deal! All the other tables had bread and he constantly kept passing by giving other tables bread and ignored us until we ask an other sever we had to be asking other servers to refill our drinks because he came by 2 times only! So I Hope the 30$ we left of tip goes to the other sever Julio M! SHAME ON YOU!
author: Rosas F.

description:
That was my third visit and the worst. The waiter was pretty abrupt and quite racist asking if we were okay with english menu. The next interaction was not pleasant as well when we asked few questions regarding the menu before we ordered.

The garlic noodle with crab topping barely had any meat for USD 24,99 and it was sooo oily i could not finish it was too gross to eat. I have decided I won't come back again. The crab was so-so anyway.
author: Christina O.

description:
Some people may avoid Fisherman's Wharf, but for a San Francisco native like myself - I embrace it. It's touristy and fun, there is a lot to see and most of all there are amazing views of the Bay from most of the restaurants. Sometimes you can take a break and act like a tourist for the day. 

Don't mistake the Crab House from the nearby "Crab Shacks", this restaurant is part of a group that serves fantastic seafood. It's not a tourist trap, although it might be in the heart of it. 

With a friend in town from North Carolina, we decided to head over to the Crab House for a seafood dinner. It's Dungeness Season, so it's best to take advantage of the situation with a Sizzling platter to share. 

It was a full house, so we opted to skip the table and found some seats at the bar. We ordered a pitcher of beer to share and a couple bowls of the crab chowder. The crab chowder is fantastic and should not be missed. It beats the masses of clam chowder you will find everywhere in the area. They will serve this with fresh sourdough bread, the perfect side to chowdah! 

We ordered a Double Shrimp and Crab Platter ($49.95) to split amongst three hungry adults and we killed it. Not only was that a great deal, but the easiest way to hush the table. Working on enjoying crab and shrimp is a great way to keep everyone happy.  

The food was great, fast and delicious!
author: Rebekah T.

description:
My husband loves this place. It's hard to actually find a place that he actually likes overall. 

The crab here is really good, we only order the crab with either mussels or shrimp and it's filling enough for two people. 

There is a long wait some times since it's in a very touristy area. I can't even say wait till after the rush because it's always busy. 

Also, they make a killer Bloody Mary just saying while your waiting for a table you can grab one.
author: Jesse A.

description:
Came here with a few friends for dinner and I'm surprised I had never heard of this place before! I had been craving some good seafood, and this is definitely the place for it. We came on a busy Saturday night after the Christmas tree lighting, and the wait was surprisingly short.

My friend and I decided to split a meal, and we ordered the whole crab, and the garlic noodles and garlic fries for the table. Everything was delicious, and the crab tasted amazing when dipped in the butter garlic sauce. Definitely regret not getting the shrimp as well but will likely be back here very soon!

While a lot of the places at Pier 39 are generally tourist traps, Crab House is genuinely good and gives you quality food for the price.
author: Jaymie S.

description:
Thank goodness I made lunch reservations a week prior to the Superbowl 50 weekend! 

After enjoying the Superbowl City at the other end kof Embarcadero we enjoyed a bike taxi to Pier 39. Checking into the restaurant was pretty easy. We were given next priority on a table. Took about 15-20 minutes to get us seated. Considering the people that didn't have reservations waited an hour, it's not THAT bad. 

My main issue is that my party was stuck at a table for 2 with an extra seat! We hardly had room for our food and drinks. It was ridiculous. We were not a cheap tourist lunch meal either. After some bloody mary's, a seafood platter and pasta. We rolled in at just about $100. So you think we at least could have gotten a big enough table...BUT I guess it's a small place and you get what you get. We were backed up to the bar and some guy literally had as butt parked on my boyfriends shoulder! Bonus was the incredible view.

Bloody Mary was eh. Watered down and not worth $12. 

Seafood platter with mussels, shrimp, and half crab. Tasty. Some of it was overcooked, but thats expected when it's on a screaming hot platter with nothing to stop the cooking process. Had good flavor. We wiped out the sauce with the small loaves of sourdough provided with the meal. That was $49

Garlic pasta with chicken. Greasy, not much flavor. I felt sorry for my friend. I wouldn't have ate it. $20 something.
author: Katherine H.

description:
The food is awesome. I'll write that at the beginning. The ambiance was terrible. 

I'm so torn. 3 1/2 stars? Not three and not quite four. 

Our server was very...quiet. Quiet and polite but not...friendly. I dunno. Got a weird vibe.

The acoustics here are seriously unpleasant. The walls and floor and everything are covered in this white subway tile and the tables are marble, no doubt both for convenience in cleaning, but the busser was taking absolutely no care in stacking dishes and glasses, making the noise bounce around and hurt my ears. Surgical is the word that comes to mind. Surgical plus fake crabs all over the wall. Weird. The table where we were seated had chairs for six people, but space for maybe six small teenagers. Not full-sized adults. No elbow room, hardly any table room...very uncomfortable. 

Now, the food. The food was the best part of this experience, which I suppose is how it should be. The cioppino was fantastic; the sauce/broth was spicy and tasted like they made it themselves, which was nice. For $28, I felt there wasn't enough seafood in it, but I didn't leave dissatisfied. The crab that the rest of our party ate was really, really tasty. My partner ate land crab (chicken. that's what chicken is called) with fries. It was meh.

Overall, I won't be back because it's expensive and horribly uncomfortable, despite the food being on-point.

[update] I didn't bring the concerns about the ambiance up with our server because there was nothing he could do to change it. If I had, then he'd be forced to apologize and why should he? It's the walls.
author: Julia D.

description:
I don't know how I missed this place after coming to pier 39 for years!  This place is amazing!  First came here with hubs and another couple and we ordered the crab platter for 4.  It's seasoned with garlic, served with bread and what my husband calls 'crack' sauce.  That was all we ordered and all we needed to stuff our bellies with delicious crab.  I can't think of anywhere else that serves crab like this.  We've taken a handful of friends here on separate occasions and they all love it!

The place can get awfully crowded and busy.  I'd definitely recommend making reservations in advance.
author: Janelle C.

description:
Decided to play tourist for Christmas eve with the family of four. We really wanted some crab and it's just not available for us to cook for ourselves yet because of the domoic acid levels being found in the local crab. Sooo....off to Crab House (I think they get their crabs from Washington, like the Fisherman's Wharf places do...but frankly I didn't ask). Got a 6:30 reservation and arrived 10 minutes early and had to wait those 10 minutes....but it was worth it because it was PACKED with walk-ins and when we were seated we got a lovely booth with a view of the whole room and out the windows. We ordered drinks, cheese bread, Caesar salad, oyster shooter, the crab feast and the Torta della Nonna with lemon zabaglione.  

The Caesar was poorly tossed....all the dressing was on the pieces in the middle of the oblong plate, with none at the ends...but once we figured that out we worked it out ourselves and the flavor was good. 

The oyster shooter (sans vodka) was weird....it wasn't in a shotglass, but a small drink glass, FULL of SPICY liquid with the poor little oyster floating around in it. I didn't get it. Too spicy and too much liquid. Just use a shotglass, please, so I can down the whole thing in one shot. And a tad less spicy, please. Kids loved the cheesy garlic bread.

The crab feast was about 3 crabs (according to our server) and it was pretty darn good. At $129.95 it's the bargain (!) dish on the menu, touted to serve 4. We could have eaten 1 1/2 crab feasts, for sure, between two adults and two teens. Because we love our crab. So that's definitely a downside...we didn't quite get our fill of crab.

Ended with the Torta dessert and it was really quite good. Lemony and I believe almondy and very satisfying.

Service was excellent, from the main server to the  people taking away our crab shells consistently and giving us new bowls to fill. The atmosphere is light and bright and twinkly...liked it a lot.

Really think it's a 3 1/2 but I'm going downwards because it is Pier 39 after all and so it is very very pricey. 

Here's a tip: check in to Pier 39 itself and go for the coupon pak they offer at the 2nd floor California Welcome Center. It's good for 2 hours of free parking....since we got there early we were actually parked for almost 3 hours and we only paid $9....would have had to pay $27.
author: Laurie H.

description:
During my last visit to San Francisco we stopped by for some famous garlic crab. 

We shared two platters for five people. I started with the pineapple mojito and are entirely too much of their complimentary bread. Note: the bread is even better when you dip it in garlic oil of the crab. 

The crab was decent, but nothing amazing. It was a little overcooked for my taste and seemed a little chewy. The chowder was generic as well.

If anything can be said of this meal, it's that it was decent but not particularly memorable. It's a tourist destination so they definitely don't want for customers which might be the problem...they don't have to try as hard.
author: Emily R.

description:
Location is nice for this place. Lobster tasted amazing with sweet, tangy flavor and seasoning.  
My waiter was nice to serve and recommend a couple good dishes. 
I would come back and it serves me well back home.
author: Kevin T.

description:
I'm not an avid yelper, but I really felt like I had to yelp about the Bloody Mary I had here. 

#1 It tasted like iced down vodka with a splash of tomato juice. 
#2 When we tried to tell our waiter that our drinks were not very pleasant to drink, he just stared at us as if he was thinking "and that's my problem because?" He ended up bringing us a bottle of hot sauce to make our drinks "taste better." WHICH IT DIDN'T
#3 Our waiter didn't even try offer us new Bloody Marys or any other alternatives, so we were stuck with these horrible Bloody Marys that we barley touched during our whole meal. 
#4 I hated my drink so much that I even tried putting ketchup in it, which made it kind of better because I could finally taste the tomato and not just the ice and vodka.


Everything else was fine except we felt a little uncomfortable because the bus boy stood right by our table for like 10 mins just watching people eat.

P.S. It could have just been the bartender working that day.
author: Christine L.

description: Whole crab is recommended. Ask for the tool, it helps. Crab chowder with bread is just ok.
author: Joey B.

description: I thought the seafood is decently price. We got the double mussel with a whole crab, garlic noodle, and the garlic bread. The seafood came out on a sizzling plate which was a nice experience. Comes with two dipping sauce. One garlic butter. The other garlic butter is with capers. Very delicious. The noodle portion is small so expect to order one per person. Nice service and a good atmosphere. Would recommend
author: Ngan T.

description: We ordered more shrimp whole crab skillet! It was delicious! We definitely will be returning:)
author: Alex H.

description:
There was no wait for a table when we arrived though the place did seem to fill up just afterwards. We ordered the"lotsa crab" and fries. Our was definitely more than enough for 2 people to share. The crab came with on skillet full of garlic butter and the crab definitely soaked up all the buttery flavor. 

It is fairly pricy,  but if you like crab,  this place is worth trying out. 

Where the bib!!!!!!
author: Tyler A.

description: Thought the place was great. Food was good and decent portion for the money. Bartender was one of the best I've ever seen. Worth the stop for sure.
author: Steve K.

description:
We were looking for somewhere to eat dinner and decided to try this place. 

We were seated right when we walked in. Our server, Tony was friendly and nice. 

We ordered the fried calamari, crab Alfredo for me, fish and chips for our son and my boyfriend had crab Alfredo also, but with extra crab ($8 more).

Our plates came out pretty quick ... even before receiving our appetizer. Next thing you know, I saw the table next to us had fried calamari, but they haven't even ordered yet. I knew that belonged to us. 

So I asked a busboy if our fried calamari was on the way and he said he'll check for us. Then Tony came by to ask if we still wanted it and we said yes. He mentioned he won't charge us for it since it was their mistake. 

My pasta was DELICIOUS! It was the perfect serving size and the crab tasted great/fresh. My son ate his whole fish and a lot of the fries too! 

However the fried calamari was disappointing. It was really fried to the point of .. No flavor, just tasted the grease. Crunchy and dried, nothing was inside of the batter. Maybe they were rushing it since we've been waiting? I'm not sure.

BTW their chocolate truffle mousse cake was amazing.
author: Yee W.

description:
We left our crabs....In San Franciscooooo!
Actually, we took them home inside of us.  Now they're parasites.  No, they're digesting.  And what good  crustaceans they were, too.   
We didn't know this place existed until we received a gift card to The Dead Fish in Crockett and didn't want to go there.  With so many sister restaurants to choose from, we decided on The Crab House.  Not to be confused with a house of ill repute, the Crab House is on the upper level of Pier 39 with views and lots of dead crabs hanging from the walls and ceiling.
The menu, from our understanding, doesn't change and there are no nightly specials to confuse you.  What's on the menu (and it's on line too at crabhouse39.com) is what's being served.
My husband, who will not order fish at a restaurant on his first visit, (at my last count this was visit numero uno) ordered the fish and chips.  I chose the Crab melt sandwich.  Both come with garlic fries if you don't want just fried fries.
Fish and chips.  One huge plank of Basa fish.  What's a Basa?  What's a matta with you!  It's a white fish that's firmer than Talapia so it fries up better.  Flakey, firm and delicious.  
Crab melt sandwich.  Probably by itself would have been good, but I tasted the cocktail sauce and wanted it on my sandwich.  No food pictures should be an indication that we were way too into our food to play with it.  Sorry folks, you'll just have to go get your own!
The prices are pricy.  But not overly for a tourist trap.  And the portions are generous so things balanced out in the end.   And so did we, we helped each other waddle down the stairs and thank goodness we parked a bit away.  We needed to walk the meal off.  
We'll be back as soon as we need a calorie rich, seafood embedded, San Francisco Visitor Center Approved meal.
The service was pretty good.  As soon as we thought "Our server has left for the evening?"  he appeared to tend to us again.  We don't need a lot of tending.  And we don't usually have much tender.  But we did want to pay our bill and get going.  So we did and we did. 
Bring your friends, or yourself, or both to The Crab House.  Get the corny shirt and a filling meal.
author: Reba Jane S.

description: The bf and I came in and we were seated immediately. I got the Cioppino (was told it was a must have by friends), and the bf got a shrimp pasta. My Cioppino had all sorts of seafood (they didn't skimp me out) in a tomato broth. It was hot, delicious and filling. The shrimp pasta was also very filling but not a amazing. Also, our strawberry and pineapple mojitos were delicious. Total? $100~ Would I come back? Sure.
author: Shyann C.

description: I was at crab house today with my friend. We saw a hair in the bread plate. We asked the waitress to take a look, she grabbed the plate, she accidentally make the hair off the plate, we can't find. She said she didn't see the hair. Her attitude wasn't so good, and never said sorry. When I talked to the manager, he said sorry and give us a discount. I really don't mind if I pay the full amount of the meal, but I feel bad for being treated like that way.
author: Yining W.

description: I got the shrimp and mussels with garlic bread and it was absolutely fantastic! I was so impressed, I'd definitely come back!
author: Jennifer W.

description: The customer service was completely horrible. Crave for somewhere else folks! Aside from the bad service, nothing's special on their menu.
author: Shallene G.

description: Touristy, but the crab chowder in the bread bowl was delicious.  Bloody Shark was really nice as well, and I loved the wall of hot sauce.  Great view of the bay.  Sounds like a 5-star review until you order a $30 plate of Dungenese crabs, which is supposed to be "1-plus pounds", and almost feel the need to ask for a scale because that was the biggest rip-off I've experienced in my life.  The garlic sauce was tasty, sure, but an ~$85 lunch shouldn't leave me hungry.
author: Alex T.

description:
I don't like they will add 4.9% to every check, because they want that to offset their cost of doing business and expenses. 

Are you kidding me? Is this how they make money?
author: Tom Y.

description: Passed by the restaurant, have a peep into the restaurant and saw every table ordering crabs! The smell and sight is irresistible, so there we go, gave it a try. The crabs was fresh, well-cooked and very tasty!
author: Stella L.

description:
Food was okay, not great. Overpriced given the completion in the area.

Service was HORRIBLE. Rude.
author: Brandon G.

description:
Intrigued by the World Famous Dungeness Killer Crab and craving for seafood, we decided to have dinner here. We arrived around 8:30 pm, our reservation was set for 9:00 pm.  I thought we had to wait till 9pm but we didn't, they seated us right away.  The restaurant was busy and there were people waiting to be seated.  The ambiance was a little loud.  If you look up towards the ceiling,  you will see decorations of colorful crabs and nets.  We sat by the window so our view was the water and the boat dock.  The waiter took our order, we got shrimps, Dungeness Crab, and clams with fettuccine.

::Drinks::
I took a sip of the Strawberry Mojito, I didn't like it much because it lacked the strawberry flavor.  Instead, I asked for a glass of Riesling (white wine) which tasted better.

(http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=NO5e0WtLAOYcjheLU6OEVg&select=GzGUUHUxsZGUDFjA6ZieTg)

::Food::
After ordering,  we were given two loafs of bread.  We used the vinegar and oil to dip the bread in.  The waiter gave us a bib that had a picture of a crab on it.  First, we got the roasted shrimps (12 pieces)  which was served in an iron skillet and it came with a side of warm sauce that tasted like a mixture of butter and lemon. The shrimps were very small; it tasted good with the sauce.  Next was the Dungeness Killer Crab (whole crab - 2 plus pounds) that was roasted in their secret garlic sauce.   I was really looking forward to this dish but I was disappointed because I couldn't taste the garlic. The last one is the Clams with garlic sauce and fettuccine pasta.  The pasta was thick and a little hard but I enjoyed the sauce.

(http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=NO5e0WtLAOYcjheLU6OEVg&select=CiT3MATSzcTI76ymDRZajg)

(http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=NO5e0WtLAOYcjheLU6OEVg&select=_RK3zHLXhwv8UalmFLUKqg)

(http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=NO5e0WtLAOYcjheLU6OEVg&select=L2YgNdr7oyzjuWkc1E34bA)

::Customer Service::
They cleared out the plates quickly after we finished our food.  The hostess was nice and friendly. 

::Tip::
Call for restaurant reservation 

::M's Notes::
-Crab cracker tool is already placed on the table.
-Oil and Vinegar for the bread is also on the table.
author: MarVy S.

description: First time actually being able to crack crabs on my own. Lol!!  Visted here in June on a Saturday while traveling for work. Was about a 45 min wait but that's to be expected due to tourists. We walked around during that time. Had a nice view of the water. I loved that they have several different size shell crackers or whatever they're cslled. Totally made my dining experience awesome.  Seriously,  don't laugh but I usually have others do it for me and by the time I get the crab meat it's cold.  We ordered the Dungeness crab for two and he ordered some veggies on the side, thus he is no longer around. Lol.  This is now my favorite crab. The crab was delish and I did order a side of garlic butter but it really didn't need it. Wine and some bread and oil was all I needed.  Very busy atmosphere. Service was good but we had to wave for her attention a few times.  This place is not cheap so prepare to spend $$$.
author: Lala D.

description:
Came here on Christmas Day for dinner with my family. Unfortunately they weren't taking any reservations so we had to wait close to two hours for a table, so we decided to walk around pier 39 while we waited.  Came back in about an hour and to our surprise out table was ready. The staff here was very friendly. Our waitress was great and despite it being super busy always kept checking on us. We all ordered the roasted crab and muscles and shrimp which were finger licking good especially with the garlic butter dipping sauce.  Price wasn't too bad. About 300 for 4 people including appetizer and a few drinks and gratuity .


I will definitely be back soon!
author: Daniel A.

description:
Just had the worst Caesar salad in my life. LOL
The crab is OK, so give two stars! I will not go there again.
author: Chuan H.

description: Impolite staff. We heard good reviews about the restaurant from a friend, and we were little right on time, and wanted to order Togo. I called up to gave Togo order on phone. After a little beep, reluctance, she said.. we need to order at the restaurant. We went there to order, instead of handing over the menu, she pointed in the direction to get the menu. Finally, when I was ready to order couple of items, he says.. Togo orders are cash only. While I had sufficient cash.. I didn't like the experience. So.. I just got out, politely. Never going back with such bad staff.
author: Sashi S.

description:
If you're at Pier 39 and craving crab, this is a good option. However, if you're in SF looking for a crab spot, I'd suggest going elsewhere. There are sooo many other restaurants that do crab better. Why hit the touristy spot?!

That being said, the roommate had family in town and they wanted to have crab for lunch and hit pier 39. Rather than try and go to another neighborhood for crab, I decided on the Crab house at pier 39. The location was perfect and they took reservations! With 2 little kids, I didn't want to have to wait for a table.

Dungeness killer crab roasted in their secret garlic sauce ($38.95 for Whole crab 2 plus lb) - The crab meat was sweet and juicy, but their secret garlic sauce didn't have much garlicky flavor. Plus, the head of the shell was empty and I love that part! I was a little disappointed by that.

Fish & chips ($18.95) - Gigantic piece of fish! It came out freshly fried and hot! I had a small bite and it tasted good with the tartar sauce. The fries were garlic fries, but didn't taste very garlicky. They were nice and crispy though.

Garlic fries ($6.95 small) - Since we had a party of 4 adults & 2 kids, we also ordered a side of garlic fries. These were the same as the fries that came with the Fish & chips. Nicely fried but not very garlicky. 

Caesar with whole baby romaine, croutons & parmesan ($11.95) - I enjoyed this. The romaine was fresh and crunchy. The dressing had a nice anchovy-ness to it. I love salad and this didn't disappoint. 

Crab cocktail with house made cocktail sauce ($15.95) - The worst dish. And it was my pick! It was basically a small salad of tomatoes, lettuce & other veggies topped was a small mound of crab mixed with cucumbers. I was picturing a huge mound of just crab topped with cocktail sauce, so this was very disappointing. More salad fixings than crab itself. They should really call this a crab salad instead.

A very average crab meal. Convenient if you don't have a lot of time and have friend that wants to hit pier 39 and have crab at the same time. Otherwise, there are so many other options in SF.
author: Elena N.

description: Okay great place, sad food. Ordered crab cakes, very small and served luke warm at best. Did I saw very small, very small. Calamari was undercooked and soggy with batter hardly crispy and very bland. Fries were soggy. For the price should have eaten like a king
author: Carlo S.

description:
I was visiting Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39 when we decided to try the Crab House. I will start by saying the food tasted great. We ordered the seafood combo which consisted of crab legs, shrimp, and mussels on a sizzling skillet. The presentation was great. The service was a bit slow as I had to keep trying to track down my server to refill our drinks and once the food was served he barely checked back on us. The only issue I had (which is more than a preference really) is that the "secret garlic seasoning" on the crab was just too much. It was an absolute mess and didn't do much for the crab. My hands were covered in the sauce and it was a greasy, garlicky, buttery mess. The sauce did taste great on the shrimp though I was a bit disappointed that the shell was still on and that is was another mess that had to be made in order to enjoy it. I love seafood and don't mind cracking
into it but the garlic seasoning was just a bit much. It was a good dining experience but it's not a a place I would dine in again.
author: Christina S.

description: I took my husband for surprise valentine dinner as he loves seafood and he loved the crab and shrimp combo platter .....the flavor was good .. we also ordered the Alfredo pasta which was good too.... Just little expensive tho but it was yummmy and the serivce was good too.........
author: Subodhani M.

description: What a great place, the food was awesome, it was the busiest place in the wharf. By far the best spot here.
author: Cece C.

description: In a sea of crab houses and seafood restaurants, this one delivered.  Not sure how it compares with the others but the food was yummy.  Cioppino was good and the seafood platter was the same.  Didn't blow me away but definitely good.
author: Alison B.

description: WARNING TOURIST TRAP!! Terrible. I should of listen to the reviews when they said this is the definition of a tourist trap, and unfortunately the reviews were so right. The food is WAY overpriced my girlfriend and I ordered the garlic bread hoping we would get a loaf or something like most places, but no it was a shriveled up two pieces of bread that were OK at best. I ordered the whole crab and my girlfriend ordered a Caesar salad (because she doesn't care for seafood). All the food came out in less 20 minutes which made it seem like a fast food place rather than a sit-down. The crab was disgusting there was shell in it and it tasted gross. I had to ask if I could have butter with it which I shouldn't have to do that they didn't give me any of the utensils for it I had to find it myself. They even messed up my girlfriend's salad by slathering so much dressing on it with no cheese or croutons How do you mess up a Caesar salad?!?!?? Oh and by the way, when I asked our waiter where they get the seafood, he hesitated and nervously and quietly said 80 miles out. If you are thinking about coming here for dinner DONT this is by far the worst restaurant I've been to. If you want something more local and fresh go somewhere else. Don't spend a ludicrous amount of money on this place if you want to waste money at least spend it at red lobster it's better. DON'T GO HERE.
author: Sydney M.

description: We ate here our first night in San Francisco. The food was delicious.  I had the crab meat alfredo and for a late dinner it was very good. Everyone actually enjoyed their dish.
author: G W.

description: If you like Dungeness Crab simmered in a wine sauce......this is the place.  I usually try and make a stop here each time I'm in San Francisco.  Very tasty.....especially if you like garlic.  I recommend making a reservation because the lines get long.
author: Ron J.

description: It's overcrowded, overpriced, and noisy. Waitress wasn't very attentive, long wait time. Unfortunately, would not go back and do not recommend. Crab chowder was ok, nothing special. The bacon in the chowder overpowered the taste of the small bit of crab they sprinkled on top.
author: Karina H.

description:
Okay, I gotta say this place exceeded my expectations. I expected overpriced, super touristy fare, which was what I got... but in a tasteful and pleasant way. I came here with a visiting friend and we ordered the Combo Mussels, Shrimp and Crab on the iron skillet, a Crab Chowder, and a side of Acini Di Pepe Pasta. The food came out quickly and tasted pretty good--the chowder was my favorite. (The pasta not so much.)

Service was very friendly; the staff made light-hearted jokes with us, pointed out things to see nearby, photobombed my friend's selfies, and made sure to pepper their sentences with bits of the language they heard us speaking (Chinese). We got a window seat and the views were obviously nice.

It's very expensive for not a lot of food. I would not come here on my own, but hey, if you want the seafood at the Pier experience, Crab House is not a bad place to get it.
author: W. W.

description:
Came for lunch once and was not impressed with the value.

I don't even remember what we ordered and ate. The only thing I was really happy with was the view. You can see seagulls and sea otters from some window seats.

Another time we ordered a chowder bowl to get validation. They did not even bother to separate the bread bowl and the soup, which made the bread really soggy later when we tried to eat it.
author: Emma Y.

description:
The wife wanted crab for dinner, we planned to come here from the hotel.
The whola lot of crab for 2 or something like that can't remember the name.
WOW I was mind blown. Amazing I will defenetly come back. 
Garlic fries!!! Best matching pair for the crab.
Avoid the garlic mozzarella bread totally not worth it
author: Carlos A.

description:
As a New Yorker, I was only familiarized with snow crab or king crab, hence to come here and enjoy the taste of dougeness crab seemed to be a must-to-do task for me. Obviously, it didn't let Mr down at all. 

We ended up getting the whole crab, which was as big as my face (or probably even larger to exaggerate) and was fully filled with meat! Five star here. Yet the mussel and shrimp set was a bit plain, so I am taking away one star.

Overall, to my limited experience, this is the best crab place in SF and I strongly encourage everyone to have a try here. A long line will be expected though...
author: Elaine H.

description: Let's start with the positive - server was fantastic and the wine was delicious. Our food, however, was less than stellar.  We got the iron roasted skillet with double shrimp and whole crab with a side of steamed mixed vegetables.  Shrimp was tasteless, mushy and tiny (40-60 count) but the lemon caper butter sauce was on point.  The crab was stringy and hard, much of it stuck to the inside of the shells.  In our mixed vegetable side, there were random pasta noodles. Here's my problem - the pictures on their yelp page are misleading and the quality of the food was below what you can find at your local grocery store. We ate it because we were starving but I will never go back. Our entire meal was $150 for extremely poor quality food.  We shared our thoughts on the food with our waiter and received a free dessert as a mea culpa (tiramisu was delicious). I NEVER post negative reviews but if I had seen this before making a reservation, I would have made a different decision.
author: Rachel P.

description:
Crab House is one of the more casual (yet still pricey!) dining options in Pier 39 yet it was a great way to celebrate my early birthday dinner with the No1DP, who was in town yet again. Like any Pier 39 restaurant it is touristy, but we wanted to play tourist in SF as I'm not in the city all that often.

VENUE: Located in Pier 39, your view of the wharf can vary depending on where you sit. The actual tables themselves can be a bit small as they are trying to maximize the number of people the restaurant can fit. As a more casual option it can be a bit noisier (compare neighboring Fog Harbor, more formal but quieter). 

SERVICE: Service was busy even during the later hours of the middle of the week. It can be hard to get your waiter's attention if the restaurant is really busy. We had a little difficulty pinning our waiter at times but was still attentive.

Although bibs were given we both didn't make much of a mess eating. Our clothes surprisingly didn't smell of seafood or garlic afterwards.

Wine consisted of a glass of Fume Blanc. As we were eating seafood a Chardonnay or Riesling would be too heavy. Fume Blanc is quite smooth.

Appetizers consisted of a plate of mussels and shrimp ($19.95) served in a cast-iron skillet. Shrimps were plump and tender. Mussels were firm but not rubbery. It's best to eat them when they are sizzling hot. Whatever sauce they use to drizzle the shrimp and mussels is amazing and I had as much fun sucking the sauce as I did eating the platter. 

Crab House is known for their "world famous killer crab", which is dungeness crab roasted in their secret garlic sauce served in a cast-iron skillet. Waitress mentions that a whole crab can serve 2 people. No1DP and I opted for the whole crab option ($38.95). The head is already pre-cleaned and what you get is that the body is ready to be broken apart in half. The legs you'll have to break off yourself, but they're easy to pull out with a firm tug.

All the crab legs were meaty. The meat from the pinchers is a little more tough than the legs but there was still plenty of meat. However the best part of the crab is not the legs but the body, which includes the crab paste. The paste tastes a little briny and is PERFECT to suck on. I had the most fun dissecting the body and taking out all the meat. The No1DP never saw anyone so intently focused on picking a crab clean and enjoying every last bite. 

Dessert consisted of tiramisu ($7.95). Tiramisu was cold and firm and contained the right proportion of chocolate powder, mascarpone cheese, ladyfingers and espresso. It's a perfect way to end the night as well as take away any of the seafood or butter aftertaste.

Many thanks to the No1DP for taking me here.
author: Isabella B.

description:
Yes, I know this is a tourist trap. A little pricey but, where can you go with a view of the ocean, hang out after you eat in the neighborhood and see artsy stuff.

Every time I come to SF, I try to stop here or around here for some seafood and ambience of the Embarcadero. 

We had split the order of Crab, garlic fries, garlic noodles and clam chowder, they were delicious.

Lots of things to see and walk around after eating all that buttery stuff.
author: Russ C.

description:
We made a quick stop at the Crab House at Pier 39 during our last San Francisco visit. I really like crab, so I was excited to try this place. There is a variety of seafood to choose from here. The restaurant itself is set right on the water, so that's always adventurous! I went with the crab enchiladas which was highly recommended by the waiter. 

The shopping on Pier 39 is alot of fun with many activities going on, so be sure to bring your camera and have fun!
author: Steve N.

description:
Overpriced?  Yes but most things of the like are in that area.  My visit was pretty stellar.  I wish I remembered our waitresses name (blonde/Russian?)  She was freaking awesome!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Took very good care of us. 

Food?
Lovely.  We have the crab and shrimp.  The crab was huge and delish.  The garlic they use...OMG.  My mouth waters thinking about it.  The shrimp was very good too but came still shelled.  The calamari was fresh not frozen and the mojitos were on point. 

If you are visiting, you should eat here.  We skipped dessert so we had room to try other places.
author: ViJay K.

description: good crab, good view, good atmosphere. perfect view. highly recommended. will visit again when im in town.
author: Shijie C.

description:
The food was ok. Service was ok. We had a table of 5 and waited 1 hr to be sat. Nothing unusual since it was very busy all around us. After our food arrived we only saw our server twice. Took him a good 15-20 mins to come back to the table after we were done eating. 
The table bus guy brought us refills and to go boxes.
author: Kerrie N.

description: In my opinion, crab house has pretty good food. Love the view as well. But the wait was way too long. The service was so so . I would've expected better service for places like this.
author: Bridget H.

description: Five stars for the crab but service and environment are 3 stars. The family crab that serves 4 is what you should get. Yes crab can be a hassle to eat but the crabs are easy to crack open here.  Very tasty and delicious.
author: Joel R.

description:
Pro: great view
Convenient location 
Food came out super fast
Easy appointment 

Cons: crab was dry and average
Crab cakes were mediocre 
Crab chowder was bland
Expensive
Service was slow
Didn't have enough people working

We didn't get our water refill, our server came to our table 2-3 times at most. This is my second time eating here, and it's not anything close to the first time. I won't come back. We came to celebrate my friend's birthday and I asked if the restaurant has anything for a birthday, but the server (Julio M) wasn't friendly and forgot our request. I was disappointed that the food and service quality have gone downhill since we visited San Francisco 2 years ago.
author: Trang V.

description: Best food experience I've ever had. The Dungeness crab was cooked in a garlic butter that gave it a crisp delicious flavor to the meat. Best crab restaurant in the area I'd say.
author: Adan B.

description:
Wanted to try something new so we ended up here.

As we walked in, there was a couple that told the hostess that this was a must stop every time they were in the area and went on to explain that they are from Chicago. After hearing that and being enveloped with the smell of garlic and butter I was more eager to eat.

We were seated by the window that had a nice view of the bay, couldn't really see anything since it was already dark out. The restaurant itself is not that big, kind of small actually.

We ordered the crab, the crab lasagna, garlic fries and halibut.

The crab was a little over cooked but wasn't too dry thanks to the puddle of garlic butter at the bottom (great for dipping if you haven't had enough butter already). 

Halibut was cooked better, flaky and juicy. The fish was served with acini de pepe pasta (a similar dish that is served at another crab restaurant just down the block) and it too was a little on the oily side.

The angel hair lasagna was really really dense but really really good...It had a ton of cheese, a ton of flavor, overall a good comforting dish. It's called a lasagna because they bake the angel hair pasta and in turn looks like lasagna.

Loved their garlic fries, I would recommend them. They were garlicy and crunchy yet soft on the inside.

Kind of pricey but you can't expect anything less from a touristy place.
author: Jerrica N.

description: This place is great, a little pricey but totally worth it.  The food was outstanding super fresh and well prepared. Also best bloody marries ever.  If you are near pier 39 you have to check this place out.
author: Michael P.

description:
the iron skillet-roasted crab was not flash and tasted suck
other things was good, but i still unsatisfied for the crab
author: UK Y.

description:
Glad that we booked the table ahead of time via opentable. Along line of ppl waiting outside the restaurant. Even with reservation, we waited for about 15 minutes.  

The quality of the food? (Seafood) Yes, fresh. Outstanding? Meh.. For the price, it could have been better. 

Service? The waiter (David?) is pretty attentive and not intrusive.  

A very tourist place but not bad. Enjoyed the atmosphere.
author: Alanda B.

description: If you're visiting the Bay Area this is a delicious spot to stop by for some Fish & Chips. The fish was the perfect amount of flaky & fried. Our server was a friendly young lady who was attentive. The wait time was about 20 minutes on a Saturday afternoon during the holiday season. You have the enticing view of the dock. I didn't try the chowder from here although it looked good. We also tried the calamari- nothing to rave about but no complaints. I will say the tarter sauce was probably the best I've tasted- if tarter sauce could ever be so amazing. Shrimp and chips was almost just as delicious as the fish and ships but was a bit on the salty side. If you prefer your shrimp to be more on the seasoned side then you will enjoy this dish.
author: Crystal B.

description:
We visited the Crab House at Pier 39 on September 19th, 2016,  I had the half crab (Dungeness crab).  I was truly disappointed as I expected a more fresh taste.  The crab was salty.  I have had Dungeness crab many times and this was no where near the top of the best crab served.  

The service was good.
author: Sharon N.

description:
I went back and forth between four and five stars, but settled in with four as a five star rating has to be perfect. First let me say that I was going in to this meal with the feeling that it was going to be a completely touristy restaurant with below average food. Sure, it's touristy, look where it is. However, I was incredibly surprised by the meal as well as the service.

While walking into the restaurant I noticed that every single table had crab. Sure, why else would you come here, but seriously, every table had a huge crab on it (at least one). They must know how to cook crab, right?  Yep, they do. The crab was cooked to perfection!

We also started off with a bowl of crab chowder and shrimp cocktail. The chowder was excellent. The shrimp cocktail was good, but I've had a little better. I didn't care that much for their "house" cocktail sauce, but it wasn't a show stopper.

Their bread was also great and their service was excellent.

I was pleasantly surprised that this "tourist" restaurant didn't just rest on the fact that they are situated with a great view on Pier 39 and actually gave you a great meal.
author: Marc K.

description:
A.LOT.O.CRABS

Yum! We love our crabs! Drenched in butter, garlic and herbs. The crabs are so delicious. Pair that with a beer and you are good to go! Make a reservation or go early. They get packed with tourists/locals during prime dinner time.
author: Katie Anne N.

description: Horrible service and theives! Charged my card twice. Once the correct amount, the second was a random $155. They gave me Dolly's # knowing the made a mistake and said if it shows to call and they'd fix it. After 3 weeks and texts pretending to attend to the matter they stopped replying. Never going there again.
author: Jason C.

description: We ordered $129 crabs and fell in love.  This is a nice restaurant in a tourism spot.  Will come back again.
author: Eric W.

description:
Food:  We ordered the double crab and mussel's with small garlic fries.  The fries as other yelper's comment are pretty good and it's a pretty good size too!  But for the main entree, the crab was good so were the mussel's, it's too bad the mussel's were smaller than I expected, probably the size of a quarter.

Food rating:  3.5

Service:  The service here is pretty good.  Our waiter to me reminded of the NBA player Derron Williams (currently playing for the Brooklyn Nets). 

Service rating:  4/5

Overall:  My dining experience was good.  We were seating with a nice view of Pier 39.  I would come back and try out their other seafood dishes.
author: Elvin W.

description:
Overall dining experience was okay, not great. Dungeness crab tastes great but pasta is way too cheesy and quality is below average. 

Ordered a bottle of chardonnay but it came to us in a carafe not a sealed bottle. Very busy and full of tourists. Staff didn't bring us water until we called them to. Waiter was too anxious to take away our plates and utensils even though we weren't finished yet. Paid around 200 dollars for four people, but we didn't feel it was worth the money. 

Service needs a lot of improvement.
author: Carrie Z.

description:
Crab house is the place you take visiting family and/or SF first timers to show them a good meal with a nice view. It is by no means the best the city has to offer, but it's worth paying a visit, regardless.

I never venture past the staple "Crab Feast for 4," because at their pricing, the other items are really not worth it. It's really tasty, and coupled with their lemon butter sauce (with capers), I'd rate it a 5.

However, pricing is steep ($100+ for the "feast," which will really feed no more than 4 people) and the service is hit or miss. When we showed up this past weekend, the quoted wait time was 20-25 minutes for my family. I counted a whopping 55 minutes before we were seated, and were offered no apologies or "thanks for being patient, enjoy your meal." 

If you want a real good meal from around here, you could probably go elsewhere. Between parking in the area ($$), steep pricing, and general crowdedness, a better seafood restaurant in the area is not a bad alternative. However, for a special occasion, Crab House is a once-in-a-while worthy visit.
author: Danielle S.

description:
So we are town for the Memorial Day holiday and wanted to try some good seafood. We made reservations which was a good idea because when we got there the wait was an hour and 15 minutes for those who didn't plan ahead. It looks like some people rated this place worse because of that and the wait, but honestly if you are trying to go to a place known for their seafood you ALWAYS make reservations. 

Anyway we ordered what they are known for which is the full crab. Since it was the two of us we ordered the Too two Crab which is just two crabs and they were phenomenal. I was actually really worried about this since my husband is the crab fanatic and last time we had crab I hated it but since this place was famous for it, I took a chance. You didn't even need butter!! The way they cooked it, every bite was already infused with a garlicky buttery taste. So delicious!! We devoured our plate and were very impressed. 

We also ordered their side pasta that had some sun-dried tomatoes. It looks like couscous but it was also yummy. 

Anyhow my suggestion is to make a reservation. And also order what they are known for... The CRAB!!! It annoys me that people are giving them less than 5 star reviews for food that isn't their specialty. If you want a pasta dinner go to an Italian restaurant. If you want a burger, go to In and Out. If you go here, stick to the crab.
author: Marzena P.

description: Perfect location among the touristic Pier 39;  the food is excellent;  famous for their hot skillets of Crab, Mussels and Clams - almost every table orders it!    The food is very fresh and perfectly prepared,  you do pay a tourist premium and if you don't make reservations, you could wait quite a while.  If it is busy (most of the time),  you may feel a little rushed to get on and go!  If that wasn't an issue, we'd give in a 5* rating!   Great place!
author: Haig A.

description:
You know when you have a waitress that doesn't seem to care on Mother's Day, it makes it even that more sad.

That, and the meal combined for a less than spectacular Mother's Day. 

I mean this is Mother's Day after all and not "just any other day."

I personally think the Crab House owes us at least a better experience then what we had.

Had their whole crab to share and their crab chowder, and after waiting a long time on Mother's Day weekend, was very underwhelmed by their secret garlic sauce.

We waited 1/2 hour for this?!?

Maybe the secret is that they don't really care about their patrons, since this is more geared towards tourists rather than locals like me.

So back to our waitress who we had to flag down for wet wipes, water, and bread.

Um, you would think if we're ordering crab, you would give us wet wipes right?

I normally don't pay with cash, instead preferring to use my credit card, but I was so irritated, that I just paid with cash just to leave earlier.

And I could have asked for a manager, but why bother since everyone seemed busy, and our waitress couldn't even get me a refill of water let alone the manager for me to complain to.

Tried to talk to the hostess on my way out, but she was busy seating customers.

Crab House, if I could offer you one piece advice it would be to step up the customer service and have servers check on their customers and provide the essentials (such as water, bread, and wet napkins)---especially since we ordered the crab and had sticky hands!
author: Jack R.

description:
I have mixed feelings about my dinner at the Crab House. 

Upon walking in, we found it crowded but were seated right away. The service was efficient but awkward. Our server seemed very nervous and timid trying to maneuver between the cramped tables. The unisex bathrooms were pretty unpleasant. As a woman, walking in on a man in the stall is always awkward lol.

The sourdough bread was good, but the ice cold butter made it difficult to use without tearing the bread. We got the garlic fries which were crisp and fried to perfection. Then the iron skillet shrimp which were amazing! The garlic caper butter to dip them in was the perfect touch. 

I might give the place another try only because I noticed some pretty delicious looking good on neighboring tables including the "killer crab" and the fish and chips.
author: Suzanne Q.

description:
Crabs.Crabs.Crabs. everywhere!

That's what you see when you're at Crab House. Lots of variety of decorated crabs strung out as decorations everywhere throughout the restaurant except in the restrooms. Haha... not that I have a problem with that. I actually like the different cute crabs! :)

Let's see.. we went there on Saturday night before Mother's Day. There was some people waiting in front of the restaurant for a table. Boyfriend put his name down & after about 30something mins later we got seated. 

Overall food was pretty good. The best thing was the garlic fries--so freakin good. 

Service was okay. I think we had to keep flagging down our server for stuff. Also, noticed that they didn't give any butter with the complimentary bread & while all the other tables did. Plus, the bread was cold & hard. 

Crab House is definitely possibly more of a touristy restaurant & a bit pricey. They have the 2% mandated fee added onto the bill, but they also validate for up to 2hours for the garage parking which is pretty good. 

3.5 stars.
author: Amy C.

description:
I came here at around 6 with no reservation after the Christmas Tree Lighting Ceremony at Pier 39. There was about a 30 minute wait and we used the time to explore the pier. 

The guy who seated us was really nice and he seated us by the windows where there was a great night view of the pier. I came with two other friends and we decided to do family style.

Lotsa Crab 5/5 - Make sure to ask for dipping sauces! The lemon butter sauce was my favorite of the three. I wasn't in the mood to eat crab because I was feeling lazy but I'm so glad we ordered it! I forgot how giant and delicious the crab are in San Francisco! 
Shrimp Pescatore 5/5 - Great comfort food on a cold day. We ordered the small and it was large enough for seconds. 
Garlic Fries 3/5 - I like the Garlic Fries at Super Duper Burger better. The Garlic Fries were crispy though and I still enjoyed them. We ordered the large. 

Our meal came out to be around $30 per person and it was totally worth it! I was stuffed and happy...everything was so yummy! 

Parking is free at the meters after 7 PM.

I'm knocking off one star because I returned for a late night dinner and the Lotsa Crab wasn't as hot and fresh as the first time. The servers were all really nice though and recognized me from my first visit!
author: Karen L.
