description:
Great place to go for a celebration or to take a date.  The wait could be a bit long but it's in a location where there's plenty for you to do to kill some time before you're called on.  If you're lucky enough to get a window seat, you'll be met with a great view.  

You can't come here and not order the crab.  Do it! It's cooked to perfection and full of flavor.   Probably one of the best crab dish I've ever had.  We ordered ours with shrimp, although still good I wish we ordered a second crab instead.  Yum yum yum!
author: Polly N.

description:
I came with a large group. The service was fine. The food was tasty but almost certainly overpriced.

The crab chowder was average. The soup was mildly flavorful and the bread was average. I wouldn't order this again, as it's worse than the clam chowder at neighboring restaurants. The fried calamari was good. We also had garlic bread, but the portions were too small. The crab was great, though (but again, overpriced).

What really annoyed me was that they add a 4.9% charge on top of every bill. This was NOT a service charge, it was a flat out price increase. I ALWAYS hate it when a restaurant does this gimmick instead of simply increasing all the menu prices accordingly.
author: Brian C.

description:
Facility: an old diner feel with decorated crabs all around the ceiling. The establishment looked clean and well taken care of. 

Staff: we were seated in the bar area by choice as the wait time was something I preferred not to endure. We were seated at the fire pit table located in the center of the bar area where it was a shared area with others. Our waitress was kind but lacked attentiveness. Later during our meal, it appeared an acquaintance of the waitress had came in and he had received more attentive service than us. Let's just say the small things such as butter coming with the house bread was on his plate and not ours. The manager we had engaged with was uninterested in our concerns about our meal that I would explain later.

Food: my companion had ordered the crab with garlic noodles. She enjoyed it as did I, but I found the value to portion was not worth the price. I ordered the Caesar salad with chicken to dine on something light. I was presented with a very long and thin plate with what was an excessive amount of dress drenching the over sized cuts of lettuce and dry chicken. At the departure of our meal, I asked to speak to the manager to address the salad that I would not serve to any person. He gave a dismissive attitude towards my concerns despite assuring my feedback was valued. 

Verdict: what I believe is as important as the meal that a person eats is the customer service. Unfortunate, this establishment failed in many marks despite a dish like the crab with garlic noodles shine. If given a recommendation to you, I was suggest continue looking for a better meal and experience along the famous Pier 39
author: K C.

description: Excellent seafood. We got the platter with shrimp, mussels, and crab. So delicious! It was an hour wait on the weekend, but we went back during the week around 3 and no wait! We also had their bruschetta and it was delicious. Highly recommend!
author: B Y.

description: Food is good but not spectacular. Depending on the seating area a nice view of Alcatraz, the marina, and the Golden Gate Bridge. Slightly cramped seating area but good service. Decently clean considering the high volume of business. A place I would come back to but not something I would desperately seek out.
author: Casey R.

description:
We have been coming to the restaurant for long time and enjoyed it very much.  On July 16th we made the 50 mile drive to eat that day at the Crab house and was very disappointed.  We ordered the 1 small shrimp, garlic fries (cold), double mussel + crab ($49.99), and I had to order a small order of mussels (some were burnt) because the crab was salty and very little of it. 

When we were seated at our table there was nothing there, only a table cloth, and we were pushed next to a table of four.  We were in the section were the windows are open.  The table was so close on the right side of the isle and with my height I had to make sure that my leg was not going to be in the isle (I have a bad knee so it was not easy to do).  I immediately went to the host of front prior to service and explained the situation and ask if we could be moved (she would not try to accommodate me).  The bill came to $133 (round).

We ended up buying a crab sandwich on the pier because we could not eat the order.  This is the 1st time I am complaining about a restaurant and  at this time I do not know if we will eat there again.
author: Joyce H.

description:
This place is a must every time we visit San Francisco. It is a bit "touristy", it is located at the famous Pier 39, ie the name, & it is a bit pricey but it's worth it once a year. 

I'm from the mid west, we don't have fresh seafood. But I was born on the west coast so I know how good it could be & this is good, great. 

I always get the double shrimp double crab ($49.95). Every scrumptious bite is worth it.

The staff is very nice & helpful. The main dining area is always clean when Ive been there. The bathrooms are public bathrooms, just wash YOUR hands & everything will be fine.

Overall the experience was worth it; steak dinner, dbl dbl shrimp & crab & 1 mixed drink each w/decent tip was appx $150.

I hope to be back every year at least once until I'm too old to make the trip.
author: Stacie R.

description:
We made dinner reservations a week in advance for the Saturday after Valentines. Overall if was a wonderful dinner and we will come back again!

Food: Ordered a whole crab with shrimp. The service was so quick! By mid-corona we had our food. It was served on a hot grill and was amazing. 

Price: Very fair price for their portions. 

Atmosphere: The restaurant itself is cute. I really like that, if you're sitting by the window, you can open it like a garage door and it's like you're eating outside. Great for sunny days! 

I was a little disappointed because having eaten in restaurants at pier 39, I expected friendlier service. The woman in the front had an attitude with costumers who just wanted to let her know they have arrived for their reservation. 

Our server took our order and we never saw him again until he brought the check.
author: Stacey D.

description: I went here around 9pm, the place was crowded, however, the food was VERY fantastic, I had the Butcher's burger, even though they are not meant for serving burgers, it was delicious along with a side of garlic fries, 10/10 would recommend
author: Wei L.

description:
Came here over the weekend and wasn't happy with the service. They were a little on the pricier side. Not sure if it was the way I was dressed as I wasn't in a fancy suit or anything but they didn't really care or give any attention to our table. I didn't leave a great tip because of this. 

The food was fantastic which is why I am giving them 2 stars. But seriously guys, because someone isn't dressed fancy and looks a little young, don't treat them poorly.
author: Jessie F.

description: Everytime I'm here at San Francisco, this is a must go spot! Always ordered a whole crab for two people. But this time, we went as a family, so we ordered a Too-Two Crab. The sauce with garlic was great, the best way to eat it is with the bread. We also loved their crab chowder. Lots of meats and sauce. But the only disappointment was our fish and chips were burned. Otherwise, this was still a great meal. It is good for lunch and dinner!!
author: Shan C.

description:
This was a really good restaurant with a small menu. The food was really good. I got the special with a salad, entree and dessert.  I chose the crab stuffed enchiladas and NY cheesecake.

It was hard to find its on the second story of the boardwalk. It has great views of the bay.
author: Funtime P.

description:
Crab is my favorite food so it's either done right or not.  Crab House is excellent at their craft.  I had the half crab (could have ate a whole one) in some great sauce.  Plus the butter and a garlic butter dipping sauce.  The broccoli and cauliflower were great accents to the meal.  Washed it all down with Grey Goose and cran.

Liked the set up but since I was alone, I sat at the bar which was fine with me.  If you want a table, make reservations.

I had the nicest host, Matt at the bar.  Served my food and drinks.  Made a Sangria for the couple next to me.  He just did whatever it took to make it a wonderful experience.  Even helped me navigate my way back to the hotel.
author: MyShawn C.

description: The crab to share is the way to go! The shell is quite soft and there is plenty of meat. Butter and garlic can be soaked up by the meat and the bread. To drink? The Crab House Beer. The jug is good for three generous serves and it is an excellent partner to the crab. The fries with garlic and herb is a good accompaniment.
author: Sue L.

description:
My friend used to live in San Francisco and would seriously not shut up about this place. To be honest, I was skeptical at first. I mean, c'mon, a place called CRAB HOUSE located at PIER 39 (pretty much the most touristy area in SF)?! Sounded pretty whatever to me, but we went and I can honestly say I am pretty fcking impressed by this place.

The interior isn't anything special. Very nautical and touristy-- plastic crabs hanging, white walls, nets all around. Again, another reason I wasn't expecting much. Because it gets pretty busy here, service isn't amazing. We had to keep hailing for a waiter because they weren't very attentive. Anyways, here's what we got:

CRAB FEAST $115
The menu claims this is to be shared for four people, so we ordered a couple more things to accommodate our party of five. THEIR CRAB IS SO. GOOD. I've never had it prepared like this before-- roasted, dry seasoned, and crispy, golden brown edges, sitting in a pool of heavenly garlic sauce. It was also relatively easy to crack open because it was roasted which I LOVE because I tend to stray away from crab since it's too much of a hassle to get the meat out. The meat was nice and moist and tasted amazingggg in that garlic sauce. Also, they give you complimentary bread in the beginning so it was nice to sop up the bread with the remaining garlic sauce after our meal.

MUSSELS & SHRIMP {MEDIUM PORTION} $20
Not as blown away by this as the crab, but not bad! The mussels were cooked nicely and they also provide a butter sauce to dip them in. The shrimp tasted too burnt/roasted so I wasn't a big fan of them in this dish.

GARLIC NOODLES W/ SHRIMP $21
We got this solely to add some carbs to our meal, but I actually really enjoyed it! The sauce was flavorful, creamy, and not too salty, the noodles were cooked al dente, and the shrimp was a lot better in this than in the Mussels/Shrimp plate.

GARLIC FRIES {SMALL PORTION} $8
They forgot about our fries, so they upgraded us to a medium portion which was nice. These weren't that good, but fries are fries-- so you know you're still gonna eat them, lol. They had lots of garlic bits tossed in them, but the fries were kind of soggy.

MELON MOJITO $12
Meh, I wouldn't recommend this. Tasted like a watered down Midori Sour.

Prices aren't anything impressive, but you have to factor in that this is in a touristy area AND it's seafood which is always on the pricey side. Service isn't grrrreat, but I did appreciate that they upgraded our fries since they forgot about them. I'd definitely come back, but next time I'd probably just get the crab and garlic pasta because those were definitely the stars of the meal!
author: Sarah S.

description: The full crab and double shrimp on skillet was very tasty. Also had garlic noodles that were good. Service was prompt and waitress was nice ... disappointing seeing the check and was charged  $8.95 for extra garlic sauce. She offered another garlic sauce, I thought it would come in the small tin as the first one, not a white bowl ... she should have told me there would be a charge for it. $9 for extra sauce is not worth it and was a nice birthday surprise on the bill. I don't think I'll be back for a while.
author: Delylah K.

description: The crab legs were so delicious!!! Service was awesome. Our food came out 5 mins after we ordered. We were very impressed! Our waiter was very informative and nice. (Sorry forgot his name)
author: Celeste B.

description: Pricey but definitely good crab, view, and location for a tourist day! Sunset at the central bar couldnt be more perfect.
author: So M.

description:
Pier 39 is a main tourist attraction at Fisherman's Wharf, so I'm not too surprised that I felt Crab House was a wee overpriced and overhyped for what it is.  I made reservations for my seafood-loving father and my vegetarian mother upon reading the reviews for Crab House.  We arrived on time and were seated promptly next to a large window overlooking the bay, where we could see ships sailing underneath the setting sun toward Alcatraz.  I would not be surprised if the menu prices are inflated so the restaurant can pay the rent for this piece of prime real estate.

We ordered the following for the table:
1) 2lb+ Whole Crab ($37)
2) Crab Alfredo ($19)
3) Garlic Fries for sharing ($10)
4) Open faced Crab Melt Sandwich ($19)
5) Garlic Noodles ($12)
6) Pitchers of Stella

The restaurant proudly cites its win as the best crab in San Francisco, but I'm not exactly convinced that it deserves the title.  Yes, the size of the 2lb crab was much larger than any East Coast crab, but size isn't everything to me.  The entire crab, including the shell, was smothered in oil (aka the secret garlic sauce), thus leaving a sticky garlicky taste, and not a fresh seafood taste, in my mouth.  However, once you're finished with the crab, don't let the waitstaff take away the plate just yet.  Sop up the garlic sauce with the complimentary bread!

The pasta dishes are made with thick sauces, making them good for sharing. I'd recommend shelling out the extra $7 to get Crab Alfredo as opposed to regular garlic noodles.  I'm one who disfavors mayonnaise in my sandwiches, so the crab sandwich was a good choice for me.  It's made with pulled pieces of crabmeat, and topped with lettuce and tomato.  The bread is moistened with garlic butter.  Garlic seems to be the running theme at this restaurant.

Note: this is not a good restaurant for vegetarians.
author: Teresa L.

description:
My must go restaurant when I am in San Francisco!  Yes it touristy, yes it's expensive.  No it's not super fancy but its clean and upscale for a crab place.  The wait staff is always friendly and the food is worth the $250-$300 bill (family of 3 -4).  There was a time in 2014 that I went for 5 weekends in a row. Yup! There hasn't been one "miss" meal to date. Their crab chowder is so delicious that I wish I could order a gallon and freeze it at home. 
 
Our Favorites: Crab, shrimp/mussels, crab chowder and garlic fries. 

SO much good stuff you won't know where to start and it's the type of bill that doesn't hurt at the end because the quality was worth it. Do yourself a favor and make a reservation, it's easier to get right in on rainy days but still just in case you run in to a busy night spare yourself and reserve (waits can be over 1-2 hrs).  You can dress up or down at this one and keep in mind this is not usually a quiet place.  They are on pier 39 have plenty of parking lots nearby and are located right over an ice cream parlor, great for desert and "walking off' the meal.  I have recommended this place to many a friend and last night when my daughter asked if we "could fly to San Fran just  to go to the Crab house and come back in time to go to school" I thought I would share my years of wonderful experiences with fellow yelpers.
author: Roselynn V.

description: my friends loved this place when visiting from NY,  recommend the shrimp and oyster dish because I heard nothing but rave reviews on it.  I enjoyed a huge ceaser salad!
author: M S.

description:
DO NOT EAT HERE!! I GOT FOOD POISONING!!
DO NOT EAT HERE!! I GOT FOOD POISONING!!
After getting into san francisco late friday night, I had planned to spend the weekend with my family, this was the first restaurant we go to. I ordered a half pound of a crab from the restaurant and a plate of shrimp and five hours hours later i'm in the hospital getting IV's after throwing up everything possible in my body. It gave me a cold, ruined my weekend and gave me a daunting emergency hospital bill. I will note that we came in 1 hour and 20 minutes before closing time, the hostess said the kitchen closes in five minutes, trying her best to chase us out, when we decided to eat there as the kitchen was not closed yet, you could see the looks of disdain on her face. No only here but safe to say the whole staff looked upset to have to serve us, I wouldn't be surprised if they had rushed the preparation for our meal or even held a grudge for not being able to close kitchen and messed  around with our food. The food was also very mediocre for what's supposed to be a 4 star restaurant. Spend your money else where
DO NOT EAT HERE!! I GOT FOOD POISONING!!
DO NOT EAT HERE!! I GOT FOOD POISONING!!
author: Maya Z.

description: Awesome drinks, awesome food, awesome service! The waitress was so sweet and we felt very welcomed! We ended up sitting at the bar because the wait was pretty long from all the tourist, so definitely make a reservation in advance if you want the dining experience. The bar was awesome!
author: Lindsey B.

description:
First off I'm surprised this place doesn't have better ratings. 

Came here on a Friday afternoon and ordered a whole crab and garlic noodles for lunch and it definitely hit the spot! 

Food was really good. Both the crab and the noddles had such great flavor! Noodles had a good texture and it wasn't overcooked. Service was friendly, fast, and very helpful. We also had an awesome view so no complaints about food or service here !

On another note, they need to have more light in the bathroom. It's so dark I can barely see anything as I'm washing my hands!
author: Antonio T.

description: BEWARE! They have changed their style in the past two month. My husband and I visited this place several times in the past 4 years. Each time we order the combo of shrimp, mussel and crab was fresh and juicy. However, when we brought our friends who flew from another state to visit us to this place today, we were totally shocked! They started to serve refrigerate cold French bread which is extremely hard and stiff to chew. And they refused to warm it because our servant believes it is what it is. Think about it, how would a good restaurant service rejects their customers' request!!!!! Worse thing is that the combo we used to order is not fresh any more. The crab meat is dried out which means it's been there for a while and the mussel shrink a lot to tiny finger tip compare to their shell size. They are dry and not juicy at all. Considering eating unfresh sea food is pretty dangerous to our health, this will be our last time to go to this place. I would also warn anyone else to go there. Because getting dysentery by eating unfresh sea food is not worth it.
author: Jane G.

description:
An excellent place if you're craving for shrimps and crabs.

Located in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf, this restaurant is a good alternative to the numerous seafood stands downstairs. The wait wasn't horrendous (30 minutes) and we were lucky enough to get some seats next to the window. The crabs and shrimps we ordered were very good although I thought they were a bit too greasy for me. Service is excellent and price is reasonable considering its location.

Highly recommend.
author: Tim L.

description: Well prepared, fresh seafood at a reasonable price.  They get crowded, so make a reservation.  The servers are friendly and will cut your crab upon request.  Go for the crab roasted in their secret garlic sauce.  Very touristy, but a must when visiting San Francisco.
author: Christopher V.

description: Overall, our recent visit was rated a 4.  We ordered the double mussels & whole crab, a bowl of crab chowder & a sea bass meal which was delicious and we were surprised at the turnaround time from the time we ordered to the time we were served up this food.  We had made last minute reservations same day and sat in the exact spot ideal for us...bay & port view seating.  It's great venue, privately tucked away from the busyness of Pier 39, but it does get busy... Once the crowds started to pile in for a sit down dinner the ambience of the place changed...it got louder, our seats became a hot commodity as we started to wrap-up our "all out" Easter meal.  We definitely plan to return to The Crab House.
author: Jasmine P.

description: Very touristy area along the pier. Crab was pretty fresh, but by no means the best crab I've ever had. It was so busy and hectic when I went with a large group of people; it felt like the staff was not ready to handle everything. Some of them came off as curt and borderline rude. My favorite part was the view, which overlooked the ocean.
author: Katherine Z.

description:
This was our first time to San Francisco and were anticipating to be welcomed by some mouthwatering seafood at the world famous Fishermans wharf. We looked around pier 39 and decided to try this place out...

The crab melt was nothing more than French bread and crab meat. It was very dry and lacked flavor. (Boooo!) 

The pasta was also very bland, and the sauce tasted like a watered down Alfredo version of Progresso's pasta sauce.

The crab chowder was subpar...nothing special.

Though the service was good, the food leaves a lot to wish for. 

Can't have it all, huh? #1stworldproblems
author: Moni V.

description: Sat at the bar because it was packed and going to be a decent wait for a table. We were very pleased with the food and the service. I didn't catch the name of the bartender but he was very nice, quick,  and he makes a great Moscow mule. The fish and chips were amazing and the crab chowder was also. We will definatley come back next time we are in the city.
author: kate C.

description: To start the wait was long. The host and co-host were less than pleasant. I was given "tone" for not wanting to sit at their tiny bar. This place's seating is tight. It has a inexpensive diner feel/atmosphere, with a $50+ price. My garlic sauce was like burnt butter or something. The 1/2 crab was small. Trust me you can find something else in the $50 range. I walked from Powell station through China town, all the way up North beach to Pier 39 for the staff to accost me like I don't deserve a table? And the food was soso. The waiter was just OK.
author: Sea N.

description:
Bad Service. Okay Food.

We came around 6pm and the place is not busy. We were seated immediately. Our server was not helpful at all. At first we want to order the "whole crab" but our waiter told us it was too small for our party, so we got "lotsa crab". Nevertheless we were not told that "lotsa crab" is different from whole crab because it's just pieces of crab, which did not include all parts (we only got 1 claw). We also never got the bread.

We ordered calamari, crab, and pasta. Calamari is good. It's a little bit spicy which is good. We like the crab but the flavor does not get into the crab meat.
The pasta is tasteless.
author: Tiratat P.

description: T.O.U.R.I.S.T. Trap!  What it is it with wait staff that don't tell you their name or engage you?  The main objective of this place is to turn tables.  We ordered the crab dinner & you just get crab & bread.  They try to bus your plate if it is blank for 10 seconds.  Will not go back...
author: Jana B.

description:
All you need to order are the crab cakes and the crab feast that comes out on an iron skillet. Going for anything else doesn't make sense because it is not their specialty. I've read a lot of bad reviews given to this place yet the reviewer did not eat any crab so please don't listen to them... order crab, crab, and more crab and I promise you that you will leave very happy. 

However, this place could use better service and it's the reason for the four star rating. It isn't bad, but they can be slow and/or forgetful. 

Tips: order a Corona, try to make a reservation because they tend to get full at random times, and just order crab.
author: Damien V.

description: Really good place for some seafood.  We had a crab plate, clams and shrimp and all of it was great.  The crab was meaty and excellent flavor in garlic sauce.  Really recommend this spot.  My only gripe is the desert a little frozen but good.
author: Cesar M.

description: Pitcher of beer and a mound of crab and I am one happy lady! This place is super delicious, without a doubt. You really can't go wrong w anything here. It can get pretty busy and packed and HOT. Every time I go I have to beg for a window seat and most of the time they accommodate. I'll always be back for my crab fix!
author: Kristine D.

description:
I'm doing 3 starts only because our waiter and the staff were great.  These people deserve medals for being so professional and serving in grace under fire.  Bless Open Table too as I used a reservation which was the answer period for this insanely popular place.  

I get it prime location, 2nd floor Pier 39 awesome view, seafood, etc.  But I have never had a host bark at us.  At 1st we were fine as my daughter and I walked up and let him know us and our reservation (the host did check the clock in front of me - whew 5 mins early!).  Than he checks and says follow him.  Fine we follow him than he turns and goes "GO BACK TO THE HOSTS STATION!  YOUR TABLE ISN'T READY!"  And shoot man, we didn't turn heel fast enough as barked the order again.  Its like ok - starving so we will slump on back to wait. 

Well it was worth the wait and we earned it as it was by a window - view and ventilation as the restaurant is small meaning with all the people there and crazy it will be hot.  

Our waiter and all the supporting staff were very nice - exceptionally.  They tended to us in all the crazy.

The food was good.  I got the garlic noodles with crab - couldn't find much crab for the additional $3.  My daughter had the fish and chips (garlic fries) - it was typically.  The bruschetta was delicious.  Crab chowder was normal.  

It was all just good food.  Not notable.  It was just nice to have a place with a reservation with a nice spot to spend time with my daughter after we got barked at.  But considering a window seat and our memorable time it was worth it.  

I would return again to try the crab on a skillet as those looked good and fun.  But just do not expect - and you will do fine.
author: Denise L.

description:
I wanted to like this place but the food experience here was awful. The shrimp cocktail we ordered had no flavor, the shrimp was crazy small, and the cocktail sauce tasted like a mediocre ketchup.

Ordered a whole crab cause that is what they are famous for. It came out so fast that it must've been sitting under a heat lamp. I thought that their cooking it in garlic, etc would make the crab super flavorful but it made it kinda bitter.

I suppose that the only reason my review is 2 stars instead of one is because the guy that served us was so ultra attentive that we were never without anything.
author: Eric J.

description:
Generally, I don't brave the tourist invasion that is Pier 39 if I can help it, but if I'm craving crab, I'll definitely make an exception for this place. 

Crab and shrimp are served on a cast iron platter to keep it warm while you're busy peeling, cracking, and fishing out succulent meat from the super fresh crustaceans. The platter totally makes a difference, and helps to ensure that each bite from the first to the last is warm and flavorful. 

The crab chowder is also excellent as are the garlic fries. 

I did try ordering a steak here once. That was a mistake. The steak was passable, but the crabs and shrimp are definitely the stars of the show. Stick with those items and you can't go wrong.
author: Scott A.

description: I went here on a Friday night with my fiance and daughter and boy was I stuffed with delicious crab! It's usually busy here but I guess we got lucky and was able to get seated quickly. We ordered the Too Too Crab which was way more that I expected. It also came with a delicious dipping sauce but we just had to ask for more of their secret garlic sauce on the side. Mind you this is our second time coming here and I can definitely say that we will be coming back again! The crab was cooked so well and was so delicious. I might just be hooked! I must also say that the service was wonderful. Our server Tony did a great job in making sure our experience was a good one. I can't wait to come back!
author: Annie V.

description:
This place does crab by the pound at pretty reasonable prices, at least by SF/fisherman's wharf standards. The service has been good and the wait time has always been none or short. Two unixsex bathrooms in the resteraunt by the enterance. 

The crab is tasty as are the garlic fries.
author: Charles S.

description: Servers were attentive, quick service, and great food!  Ooo and the view was nice.  Definitely come here, especially for the crab!
author: Alicia A.

description:
We got the calamari, crab soup, garlic bread with mozzarella cheese and too two crabs. Perfect amount for 3 mid-size ppl. Everything was fantastic and freshhh except for the garlic bread. garlic bread was good, but i didn't taste any specialty~

Service was good. waiter was attentive my drinks never went below 1/3 of the cup.
author: Andy H.

description: Prompt service even on a busy Mother's Day holiday. The seafood is so fresh! We had the crabs platter for 2 and the mussels and shrimp with a pitcher of beer. The food is worth the price! You must eat here while visiting fishermans wharf.
author: Traci J.

description:
I was actually a little disappointed with their crab here. It tasted rubbery and didn't have the right texture I'm used to fresh crab having. They also don't utilize the natural taste of crabs but rather put garlic and sauces, so that is all you taste. 

Their crab chowder on the other hand was pretty decent as it tasted like a healthier alternative than clam chowder. It had more vegetables than I'm used to having but I actually liked that. 

It has a good view of the pier and there is a lot to do/see after you're done eating to walk off everything you just stuffed in your mouth!
author: Sarah L.

description:
Decided to came here for my birthday my husband and I couldn't wait to try their filet mignon again the juicyness and tenderness the way it was cook to perfection. We also had the whole crab which had so much meat in it enough for 2 people. We also had a side of garlic noodles everything just went perfect together with a bottle of cold beer. To top it off we had the perfect view next to the window overlooking the water. We luv coming here and will continuing to great customer service.
Total Bill $145 tip$25
You will not be disappointed coming here the wait is worth it.
author: Sammie H.

description: This is a really tourisy place, however it does not prevent their food to be awesome. As a solo traveler, I ordered half crab and fries. The freshness and sweetness of the crab meat were heavenly! What I love about crab is you feel like you eat a lot but the calories consumed are not bad in reality, which is very important to foodies. The bay view outside the restaurant was beautiful and service was great too. A super dining experience.
author: Yue Z.

description:
I think crab house is the main reason why I came back to San Francisco! Lol 

Today we got the iron grill combo mussel, shrimp and crab, garlic fries and some mojitos! If you're not sure what you want, I recommend the combo! It was perfect for two people. I would have to say this is the best restaurant for seafood! 

The mojitos were ok, kind if pricey.. We had the strawberry and pineapple mojitos.. I would skip on the drinks next time!
author: Naomi R.

description: Overrated! Expensive (only because it wasn't good food or service) Our waiter was horrible.  I been waiting to come to this place to eat for weeks. The food pics looked great on pictures but the taste was ok...nothing special. My husband and I ordered the crab feast for two...I had better crab legs in other places that charged less! The crab chowder was nasty and the bread was hard as a rock! Our waiter barely check on us if we need anything else....we only saw him twice (when we ordered our food and when he gave us the ticket) The Asian waitress that served the group of people behind us gave better service. She was to the point and took care of the people behind us. I'm disappointed and I paid for the food that was bland.
author: Carol N.

description:
I came here for lunch and was seated right next to a window! Unfortunately it was a rainy day, so the views were a little obscured by clouds. I made a reservation, but I didn't really need to. It didn't fill up until 12:30 pm. 

For lunch, I went for the filet mignon and crab. This came with French fries, and the crab was a half order. The food was really good! There was a lot, too! The filet mignon was cooked perfectly to my liking, and it was so nice and tender. The crust on it was great, too. The crab legs were good, and they were easy to crack because they were roasted. The butter sauce was a nice condiment. And the French fries were really good, too. I dipped these in the butter sauce, as well. 

For dessert, I tried the Italian cheesecake. I had a really good one at Becco's in NY, and unfortunately the one here fell short. It was ok, but it was too dry for me. 

Service was ok.
author: Rachel H.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants when visiting San Francisco. My last two visits my friend and I went specifically for the Lobster Chowder. A bowl of this delicious soup loaded with veggies and fresh crab with sourdough on the side is very satisfying and filling! 

I have also had their Crab Legs which are also delicious.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Whole crab crack down!  Woohoo!  

This place was packed and it is very crowded in here so if you are claustrophobic beware. 

The mozzarella garlic bread is so deelish and I suggest you order a side of it to go along with any buttery crab leg concoction. The bread  is super cheesy and warm and just melts in your mouth.  

We ordered the whole crab and it was a good plate to split for two people.  The server cut it in half for us and that made it easier.  Anyhow, it was perfectly cooked and the service following the delivery of our meal was fantastic.  

It is a pretty cut and dry place.  You get crab crab and more crab.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Today I invited 5 friends to visit Pier 39, and then we had lunch at Crab House around 12:20pm. We ordered 3 x "Crab Alfredo" and 2 x "Shrimp Alfredo" among others.  We finished the lunch around 1:40pm and the payment reference# is 307302099798 on the receipt. From around 3:30pm, all of the three persons who ordered and consumed "Crab Alfredo"  started to diarrhea or vomiting. As of now, the lady has vomited for 3 times (sitting in the car) and even did not want to eat dinner; the two gentlemen have already had 2 - 3 times of diarrhea. Crab House was the ONLY place we ate anything today. None of us had any issues before the lunch!
author: Mike Z.

description: Yummy and tasty cooked crabs! I have been there many times and love it. Only problem is most of the dish comes with sausage cooked along with it and I do not eat sausage and when I ask for replacement with shrimp they would not do it so I throw sausage out of my plate into trash, I feel bad for wasting food.
author: Devan K.

description:
Came here on NYE with my bf and another couple. We ordered Too Two Crabs, large mussel and shrimp combo, and garlic noodles. Sadly for over $120 worth of food, none of us were full and had to get more food afterwards. 
We expected the garlic noodles to be able to fill all of us up, but it looked like it was only meant for one person. The flavor of their secret garlic sauce was delicious, but the meat for the crabs were on the dry side, especially when it got closer to the tip of the claws. The mussels were small and the shrimps alone was just okay. Everything tasted a lot better with the garlic sauce so make sure you ask for extra. 
The place itself is super crowded and small. The walkway is only big enough for one person to walk at a time. Expect to be down and dirty when eating here. There's shells on the floor and it's kind of slippery. I almost slipped while walking to our table and the top of my chair was super greasy when I pulled it out. 
Service could use a bit of work. We had reservations and came earlier in hopes of getting seated earlier. We ended up not getting seated till 20 minutes after our reservation time. They also gave us broken bibs and at the end of the dinner only 3 wipes. 
Overall, I enjoyed the food, but would rather go to a cheaper place.
author: Renee Y.

description: The Experience from start to finish is amazing. Bart ( the manager) & his staff are awesome!!! The 1/2 dungoeness crab and shrimp on skillet was awesome. The crab cakes for appetizer were good too!! Fun place. Met all sorts of different people. I would recommend to anyone eating at Pier 39. The price was appropriate given what is on menu!! The quality is awesome!!!
author: Susanne M.

description:
My family wanted crabs and Crab House delivered them crabs!

We of course went for the Platter of Crab! It was a lot of crab and fed the five of us.  We did also family style some other dishes on the menu like the crab chowder, the cioppino, crab fettuccine.  All pretty good.

Definitely a place for everyone, bring the whole family and grub on some crab! Then, take a walk around the Pier.
author: Michelle T.

description:
I'm very picky when it comes to seafood. It was my first time feeling so good in a seafood restaurant. It has so many windows which made it bright and happy. Cool room temperature. a beautiful day. 

We were a group of 6 guys. The crab my friend ordered was fresh and meaty. Not skinny or dry. My other friends ordered grilled shrimps. They were light and very juicy, great with butter sauce and lemon. I ordered the shrimp alfredo. It was perfect portion and the pasta had the real pasta taste. 

Our server was the taller Asian lady. She was so patient as we were taking long to decide. She also put a smile which is really important for me personally. It makes the room more positive. 

Thank you Crab House. Coming back for sure.
author: Amin B.

description:
The Best Crab Restaurant in San Francisco ! 
Always perfect service and amazing Crabs with garlic !! Try it - you will not regret !!
author: Svitlana T.

description:
I absolutely love the Dungeness crab and the mussels here.  We come here every time we're in the area and it does not disappoint.  For two, we usually order lotsa crab and medium iron skillet roasted mussels and it's more than enough food for the both of us.

We ordered the medium mussels and a few weren't cooked all the way so I let my server know and he brought us out new freshly cooked mussels.  

We were given a table by the side with the open windows one time in the winter and my crab and mussels got cold real fast.  Since then we have always tried to come early to get seated on the other side of the restaurant (left side when you walk into the restaurant).
author: Diana V.

description: This is a great date night spot. The service is fast and the food is awesome. Little on the pricey side, so prepared to spend some $$$.
author: Glenda Jean S.

description: Crabs the size of your head, strong drinks and fantastic service! We loved it so much, we went back TWICE during our trip to San Francisco despite the price tag. It is consistently busy, but well worth the wait - Hope you get a window seat as the view overlooking the pier made it just a bit more special!
author: Andi S.

description:
I see what the rave is all about here - the dungeness crab, shrimp, and mussel. I totally agree. We visited San Francisco the first week of June and stopped by this place during our sight seeing at Pier 39. 

The customer service was not very good - our waiter ignored us the entire time. The only friendly gesture we received from him was when he cut our dungeness crab. The bus boy was more attentive than him so we gave him the tip instead. The liquor? Horrible - the mojitos taste like club soda and simple syrup. 

However, if you are craving good fresh seafood and can skip the cheap labor that they employ here, definitely give this place a try. You will not be disappointed.
author: J. C.

description:
My daughter and I were here last year and I've been dreaming about the crab fest ever since...it wasn't as good this time...the service was slow also. It was packed!

We had a reservation for 9p. I called and they got us in at 8p which was great. 

The crab was good - not fantastic. 

The steaks my kids ordered were very very small...

My husband ordered clams and said they were good.... But not as good as they should have been for the price.
author: Tami T.

description: Had the crab feast to share between 4 people and it was a perfect amount! The crab was cooked well & super delicious. The presentation was also wonderful! The late hours are great and the service was amazing!
author: Aleigha M.

description:
I have been here two times now and the service is always fantastic. You really can't go wrong with anything here. 

To start off the service here is always top notch even when they are very busy. The servers provide great recommendations and specials of the day. Heck even after you are done with your meal they don't chase you a way, which is plus in this touristy spot.

As for the food, it's simply AMAZING! Just go with any type of crab and you will not regret it. While your at it go for some oysters, mmm, mmm, goodness.

The views are very nice here as well. Nothing says romance like chowing down on crabs with the Golden Gate Bridge in the background. It was so romantic that proposed to girlfriend there.

Not sure if she said yes because she was stuffed with tasty crab, or the beautiful sunset, but nevertheless it was a great experience that I will not soon forget.

If you are visiting San Fran or are a native, check out the Crab House you will truly enjoy it.
author: Travis C.

description: This place is a MUST every time we're in the Bay! One time, we went two nights in a row! The crab is so delicious and the seasoning is just right. You must eat here for the real deal. If you like seafood, you will not be disappointed.
author: Sabra M.

description: The food was amazing!!  We had the steamed clams, filet mignon with shrimp and garlic fries, and some chardonnay.  We cannot wait to eat there again when we are back in San Francisco.  The best place we ate while we were there!!!
author: Jennifer P.

description:
Was looking for a sea food restaurant in the fisherman's wharf area with a good rating on yelp but couldn't find any. I bumped into crab house by coincidence and was excited about the plates.

We ordered the whole crab, mussels and shrimps all pan roasted. Everything was super delicious!

Crab was very nicely roasted, good size, fresh and very tasty!

Mussels with white wine seasoning on the side was perfect!

Roasted shrimps with an oregano spice was very unique!

Would definitely come back and recommend it to everyone!

I was a bit surprised by the poor ratings to this place especially when you order a sandwich in such a place! Anyway, I personally loved it :)
author: Amir H.

description:
Crab House at Pier 39 is so good. It ain't fancy. It ain't proper. It's pure tastiness. 

If you're like me, you've had a few bushels of crabs growing up. You know how to clean a crab. You feel right at home with your hands covered in crab juices and spices, siting in front of a pile of crab shells that you've demolished. If this describes you, then you will absolutely love Crab House. If this does not describe you, I'm betting you'll still love it!

Get the skillet. Lotsa crab is a good option to share. The seasoning is unique and ultra flavorful. Also, the garlic noodles are a must try. Crab enchilada was very good too and is one of the most popular dishes.

Here's a veteran tip: this place gets crowded and it's crazy. All you have to do while you're walking around the pier is go on yelp about 30 minutes before you want to eat, make a reservation, and 30 minutes later you will be walking past a long line of anxious and stressed out people trying to get the attention of the hostess, hoping they'll be seated in the next decade. You'll look like a VIP as you walk right by. Trust me, this tip works, you won't have to wait!
author: Thomas M.

description: This place is HORRIBLE!!! Save your time and money and don't go! We waited an hour and a few minutes for a party of 3. Got hella attitude from the hostess and servers just for asking how long. Like 15 empty tables. Don't know what's going on. Service is Bad!
author: Cindy S.

description: Came here twice because it was so good. The waiters and food were excellent. The food is worth your money. Recommend the super combo of mussels, shrimps, and crabs.
author: Jordan C.

description: My experience here was probably one of the worst I've ever had. First and foremost the service is incredibly awful. Waited 45 minutes for a table which isn't that bad for a tourist spot, so I was anticipating that it was going to be a great dinner since it was so busy, but boy was I wrong. After sitting and looking through the menu, it was probably a minimum of 15-20 minutes before we were even acknowledged. Just asking the server a question they were very annoyed and rushed, which made me uninterested in ordering more items. So service was terrible, so I was really hoping the food would make up for it, again very wrong. The bread is not good and cold. For a place called "Crab House," I expected a really great crab cake. What I got was two breaded hockey pucks that looked like it came out of a frozen package. The garlic sauce was not flavorful and very underwhelming. The best thing was definitely the garlic fries. Server wasn't around at all, so don't come thirsty because your drinks will remain empty. I don't understand why they use small cups if they aren't capable of refilling them. Overall the service and the food was bad, so save yourself from this tourist trap.
author: Jennie C.

description: Its a very good place, food is always very consistent. Could do better with the customer service.
author: Sil P.

description: My favorite place to get seafood! I highly recommend the salmon. The service is always great. Thank you Sarah!  Amazing atmosphere if you come in for dinner!
author: Victoria S.

description:
What better place to have crabs and seafood than San Francisco?!  Was here with a couple of girlfriends and we ordered the following:
Lotsa crab - great flavor, but the meat was just a tad bit rubbery.
Combo mussels and shrimp - LOVE the mussels!  So fresh!

Will definitely go back again!
author: Wendy W.

description: This trip was horrible. Food was bad, service was terrible. Waitress had to be reminded 4 times to bring water and bread. Food came out and it felt like it was cooked the day before. Crab was dried out. It will be a long time before coming back. Wine was good and the bread tasted better then the crab. Sad to say that but at those prices, I won't settle for what was delivered again!!
author: Scott R.

description: This place is THE place for crab on the pier. They accommodate large parties and have limited but available gluten free options.
author: Opinionated B.

description:
They are pricey and nothing special 
I don't know what all the hype was about 
I ordered the crab chowder - it was bland.
I ordered the fried calamari, about $20 it was a large portion good for 4 but there was nothing special about it, and they were small calamari rings with lots of little legs.
The crab cakes my friend ordered were normal, as she said "nothing special, fresh market sell them ready just to be heated up at home. Must better than these"

Their broad out two  mini Baguettes with butter. I was hoping the bread to be nice and hot but they were room temperature/coldish the scoop of butter was cold like ice cream. Not easy to spread. 

I wouldn't recommend this place or come here again.
They are pricey and nothing special
author: Shaima D.

description: The crabs are fired which leaves no moisture in the meat. Other than that everything is good
author: Jingchao W.

description: We ordered a crab chowder with bread bowl and double shrimp with whole crab for lunch. The crab n shrimp are not bad but the crab chowder just normal. The view n service are also good here.
author: Katelynn H.

description:
Maybe we should have just stuck to Crab...

We ordered a fried shrimp platter and fish n chips. 

The fried shrimp was bland the fries were so greasy I could even eat them. 
The fish n chips was NASTY.  Big, watery/greasy chunks of fish.  I almost barfed from the texture alone...Uggh

IF we return, we will definetley stick to the crabs

On top of that, its WAY overpriced.
author: Cameron K.

description: I love this place , I have never eat crabs like this guys have .They have some magic cooking done to it . Its just unbelievable how good is there crabs are . I try crabs all over the world but at Pier 39 Crab House they are the best . Price is kind of high ...But if you don't pay it you will never find out how good are they . I go to Crab house  once in awhile . I do love this place , wait time some times hits 2 hours + That's crazy . But it is worth your time.
author: Andreo C.

description: great view, great location, but don't consider to go back if I have one more trip to SF
author: Jessica Jieun L.

description: WOW, that service... probably my 80th time here.. except for the hostess from the waiter- from the server to the manager.. absolute disappointment. No way to get our order wrong-sparkling water with a crab bread bowl..  but they managed to do so. We complained twice to the waiter and then to the manager- but he let it slide, even though I spoke to him twice.. but after 45 minutes I hoped to have some sort of resolve. A lass, I certainly expected a higher level of service with the management- at least. What I received, in return, was nothing more than disappointment and further exasperation of disappointing service. We even left to the restaurant next-door and had him (the manager) bring our card to the restaurant because their Credit card machine was broken, inoperative, for close to 45 minutes. IDK ¯\_(ツ)_/¯.. not impressed for good reason!
author: P L.

description:
I really was hoping that in this touristy area we'd found a good place to grab lunch. Not so much. 

While there were some okay points, mostly my meal was not enjoyable. The Bloody Mary I ordered tasted like plain tomato juice. I honestly couldn't even drink it and sent it back... And I never do that. 

My Crab Louie salad was okay, but there was so little crab! I enjoyed the dressing that it was served with, but I was really bummed about the portion of crab. 

The Shrimp cocktail appetizer was okay, but the cocktail sauce tasted really weird. I LOVE cocktail sauce, so this was also a bummer.

The only thing I really liked was the garlic fries I stole from my husbands plate...
author: Rachel C.

description:
Came here on a Friday evening around 4 pm while on vacation in SF with my fiancée. Was told that it would be a 30 min wait, we actually only waited about 15-20 mins which was surprising considering the long line & numerous people waiting to be called to be seated.

Appetizers: 
Calamari: 5 stars! A MUST try if you come here! Tender & flavorful unlike most bland & rubbery calamari.

Garlic bread with melted mozzarella: 4 stars - a bit greasy, but what can you expect from bread smothered with garlic & cheese; nonetheless, delicious!

Caesar salad: 3 stars - your basic Caesar salad, except the romaine hearts were fresh & dressing was creamy with fresh Parmesan on top. Big serving size is also a plus!

Main course:
Fish & chips: 3.5 stars - garlic Parmesan fries(chips) are the star of this dish! Best fries we've ever had! Fish, although nicely battered & fried, did not have as much flavor as expected & was a bit over priced($18.95).

Small order of skillet shrimp: 4 stars - came with the most delicious butter/garlic/lemon sauce; shrimp were seasoned & grilled beautifully with fresh cilantro on top. 1 star is taken off because I prefer the shell to be taken off my shrimps.

Dessert: No room! Too full, maybe next time if I ever happen to be in SF again.

Service: hostess, waiters, servers, and bus boys were all friendly & seem very attentive to all the guests, including us!

Overall: I would definitely come back again! Too bad I'm not from the area. Though it is in a tourist area, don't let that fool you, delicious food & quality service are definitely here.
author: Priscilla R.

description:
Located on the top deck of the Pier 39.

Came in on a Saturday evening for dinner. I have patronized the restaurant three times. Each time ordering at minimum a Cuban Mojito. 

This most recent trip I had to wait to be seated. Wait time wasn't too bad. Host was fairly correct on the wait. 

Seated and menus were provided promptly. A modest wait was resulting for placing order. Initial drink delivery was prompt. The drink was delivered cool, refreshing and fair balance of sweet to alcohol. 

Food order was taken and a fairly longer wait from order point to arrival.

Food consisted of chicken n chips, garlic bread, and the halibut (crusted  pangrattato paired with couscous)

Chicken was dark golden and moist.. Garlic bread was adequately topped and just put on a dish. Nothing spectacular but definitely overpriced.  Four pieces of bread with garlic. No bread was offered to our table (seen on the other tables around us). Halibut was Flavorful and tender. 

Through the meal we requested a water or a refill and not a single staff visited any tables on this side of the restaurant for about 20 minutes. 

Meal was finished and again a wait for the staff to approach our table for check and payment. 

Good: Flavorful and properly cooked food. Refreshing drinks. 

Bad: Slow service can result in worse situations (ie choking). Overpriced garlic bread. 

Overall better ratings would be the result of food. The attention to service negated that. Three stars. Will likely comeback just for drinks. A shame.
author: Denny T.

description: Crab is the best! Love it and recommend it! It's not romantic but warm and good for chatting. Again! Crab killer is a must!
author: Danby L.

description: The food was good but it was very tight between tabes and noisy. Not a romantic venue but a tourist thing to do!
author: Stephanie G.

description: Garlic fries with the crab was the perfect combo. A great place to eat while at the pier. Service was amazing and the restaurant felt classy and clean. Only thing is is that price tag! It's pretty expensive but going with a group of friends helped bring down the price per person!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
We actually went here by chance doing the tourist thing on the pier.  The restaurant itself is really nice with obviously a great location. For starters the service was terrible. We sat waiting and waiting with servers passing us constantly but nobody even acknowledging our presence. We had to flag a server down for everything...take our order, drinks, check...everything.  Nobody wanted to serve us. It was almost as if we were bothering them. It was really weird.

I feel at the prices they wanted everything should be outstanding. It was just ok. The best thing we had on the menu was the garlic fries our teenager ordered with their sandwich, very sad for a place that claims to have outstanding seafood. I've had way better at mediocre chain seafood restaurants. Such a disappointment.  I will never go back.
author: Amy P.

description:
This is conveniently located at the end of Pier 39; so if you are looking for an easy place to find and relax at Fisherman's Wharf then this place is it. 

Re the food - we had the mussels, shrimp, and garlic bread - it was okay. 
For the price ($$$) you pay for though, it's a bit inflated.
author: Don H.

description: Very rude manager and receptionist. The receptionist first put 4 of us at a tiny table, we had to hold all our bags on lap. (We have a baby with us, so we have more bags than other group) Then we saw another  4-people table available with spacious side so we can put our bags on the floor. We requested the table. But the waitress lied first saying that table was reserved. Very soon, we figured it is not reserved at all she was just too lazy to move us. We asked for the manager, he said " I prefer not to move you" because he will have a lot of incoming customers soon and no time to deal with us. Crap service. This is Nov 27, 2016 noon.
author: Rachel H.

description: crab house wow some tasty crab the crab is roasted in a  garlic butter really fresh and tasty the bread that come along with it go great with the roasted crab you get a good view of the pier and view of the bay you should check it out when you are in the mood for some good crab they got some craft beers too check them out crab house yelp on yelper good eats
author: sushiatown s.

description:
Worst service. Worst food. Worst restaurant I have ever been to. I received my water after my meal after I had to ask twice. My waitress was arguing with her manager on the floor in front of customers. The kitchen floor was filthy. My lettuce tasted like it hadn't been washed. I had to ask three times for the check.

This was only the appetizer. We didn't stay to order a main course because the experience was so terrible!
author: Whitney N.

description:
Woah, REALLY expensive. Then again, it is Pier 39.

Our waiter that day's amazing (1/02/2016. I know, I know, very late review, but I'm a procrastinating college student). Cracking jokes with us, giving us his input on what's the best food to order, and always helpful. Gave us some nice advice too.

I love the garlic fries the most. I love dipping it in the sauce that comes with shrimp, it's so good! It's also very crowded, so I have to wait 35 minutes, but I think it was worth it in the end.

4/5
author: Vincent V.

description:
This place hit the spot! It was a really fun treat. We ordered whole crab and several drinks and fish and chips. It was in the triple digits for the total but worth it.
The whole crab was pretty awesome. It had a burnt butter flavor that didn't entirely tickle my buds but it's crab, so you can barely go wrong. Definitely worth the stop. Also, try the Crab House beer, hoppy and full of flavor!
author: Kaitlin P.

description:
Host seems depressed and unfriendly maybe crabby. Been here often but that was our last time. 

Ciopino was ok, pricier than before. 

Waiter try to be friendly but brought us two dirty spoons. Hygiene issue as well.
author: K R.

description: I ordered the Filet and Crab. My filet was a bit over cooked and I asked for Medium rare. But it still sliced like butter and the crab was tasty. All in all 7 out of 10 stars!
author: Dennis J.

description:
Who said not eating meat on Fridays  for lent had to be sad? My wife and I came here after work on Friday for date night. She loves crab and I couldn't eat meat for lent plus this place was was close, convenient, and fun-It's pier 39. 

The grilled shrimp and garlic bread with mozzarella was okay but the crab and side of garlic noodles is some of the tastiest I've had. 

I think we've found a new spot to satisfy our cravings for crab. Don't forget to validate your parking if you parked in the garage.
author: Jairus M.

description:
I used to love this place and would always bring my out of town friends here for dinner the past 4 years since I first tried Crab House.  I used to enjoy their crab and cioppino.  Tonight was the first time I ever returned a dish.  I could not force myself to eat the cioppino that I ordered.  It was so salty my mouth had that tingling, puckered sensation as if I had swallowed salt water from the ocean.  The calamari and shrimp were really tough and chewy.  There were no pieces of crab, just shredded pieces that were sprinkled on top.  I was so disappointed that I had brought my friends to this restaurant.  Another thing I noticed that was different was the bread that was served to us.  I could be mistaken, but I remember loving their bread.  I thought it was baked fresh and piping hot.  We would slather on the butter as it would melt into all the nooks and crannies.  Tonight we were given something more akin to ordinary room temperature dinner rolls.

My child and my friend ordered the filet mignon and it was prepared well - medium rare more on the rare.  They enjoyed their meals.


7/27/17

I just want to add the general manager was so kind to contact me directly to express her concern about my recent dining experience.  Hopefully my experience was an anomaly.  I appreciate their team's concern trying to make things right.
author: R S.

description:
I really dig this place. Wont come back, but I dig it.

My friends came from SoCal and they wanted to be touristy that day, why not? It was a fun day to be tourist!

After a long and fun day in the city, I decided to go grab some seafood from the wharf... what better way to end the day right? We got to the CH at 7:45 and waited an hour, we were actually seated in 55 mins.

The Crab House is expensive, so remember that!

Pros:

The vibe is awesome, very geninune 
The location is spectacular, too bad it was dark so we couldn't see the pier much
The Crab is delicious! My friends love crab, I rather take lobster :).
The shrimp is also very good, soaked in it's goodness, it had lots of flavor
The Garlic noodle with crab was also good, very flavorful and big hints of garlic
The crab alfredo, was also a good addition to the meal. Two pasta dishes definitely a bit hit with my friends
The wait, was not that long as it is an extremely crowded place and very popular

Cons:
WHAT The Fudge is the mussel? It was the tinest mussels ever, and I DID NOT EXPECT THAT. What a HUGEEE WASTE OF MONEY. DO NOT GET THE mussel!! I REPEAT, DO NOT GET ANYTHING WITH MUSSELS!!! They were the size of my pinky nail, such a huge waste.

My only con.

Everything else here was amazing and good experience in dining. Won't recommend it, but it was an experience.
author: -Johnson- N.

description:
Unfortunately I couldn't try steamed crab or other seafood since I didn't want to take too much time dismembering it when all my other friends opted for regular entrees. But I ordered their crab enchilada and it was pretty good! It's not like your typical mexican style enchilada so you might be disappointed when you were expecting something authentic. However, crab enchilada was loaded with crabs and I managed to enjoy my entree. I also ordered myself virgin oyster shooter, which was phenomenal. It was so good that I had to order another one. :)

I also tried my friends' crab chowder, garlic fries, and lobster thermidor (lobster cracked open in half with cheesy goodness on top). Everything was solidly good. Price is on the pricier side but why not splurge since you're at the pier in SF? Nothing beats fresh seafood!
author: Lisa K.

description: when I went to Crab House, I saw many crabs on the wall. I really like eating crab, shrimp and clam, so I ordered a big crab, shrimp and pasta. I sat by the window and I saw the wonderful sea view. It was pretty view that the golden sunset and the Golden Gate showed together. The food is delicious.
author: Andy C.

description:
Owwww, this review is difficult. So, from the point of view of food, it would easily be 4 stars. I had better crab but the food was really good here, no doubt.

It's overpriced, but that's kind of expected on pier 39.

What killed, totally killed the experience, was the service. We were a very large party and we had reserved our seats for weeks, via e-mail, even exchanging signed documents for getting a banquet menu. And we accepted to dine late at 9pm because, hey, we realized that seating so many people could be challenging.

Picture us suprised when we were told there was no trace of our reservation. And there was no way of accommodating us. After a brief discussion with unpleasant notes, we were challenged to produce the email exchange. Which we did, on the spot (that's the issue with challenging a bunch of nerds with something like that....)

After that, the music changed immediately to a more apologetic tone. We waited for 30 more minutes but at the end they accommodated us.

Fast forward to the end of the meal, they flat out refused to charge more than 4 different cards for a check. Which was uncomfortable, to say the least, for a large party of foreigners. Not to mention we had specifically agreed on this via email.

So, in the end, the evening was spoiled by service, but food was reasonably good if pricey.
author: Stefano Z.

description:
The pros: the view is amazing... you get to see the view of the city by the Bay and the golden gate bridge! Was especially nice since we came during sunset. The crab chowder was also very good!! 

The cons: other than the chowder, the food is only decent. Was so hungry after a long day in the city so that was a bit disappointing. The tables are also very very close together making you feel crowded the whole time your trying to enjoy the meal. Can hear everyone's conversation empowering yours and stares from everyone while your eating. Plus there was no AC so it was really hot in there! The floors are also very slippery and saw a couple people almost fall as they walked out the restaurant. 

But that view.... makes it worth coming again. Hopefully next time the food will taste better!
author: Dorris K.

description: The food and service were super. They really could do something about the cleanliness of the restrooms and the dining area.
author: Sally S.

description:
Ive been coming here 'most every time I come to SF; this is my family's kick-back spot. 

Things I love: 
--The atmosphere in the room past the bar. They've got portholes, colorful crab shells, and old transportation methods around the walls. 
--Their drink selection of special alcoholic concoctions; my favorite is the champagne-OJ-cranberry Red Herring. I always get that.
--The tiramisu is SOOOO light and fluffy! DE. Licious!
--Their crab chowder (NOT clam, crab) is a mix of red and white sauce, slightly spicy, creamy, and thick, with large shredded pieces of crab. 
--Their complimentary bread is almost real Italian; very crunchy outside, and soft and slightly sweet inside. They already have the olive oil out on the table, along with seafood cracking and digging utensils. 
--Speaking of crab, theirs comes out on a sizzling platter with garlic butter sauce, and is deliciously sweet and fresh. 
--Their crab cakes are deep-fried, with a crunchy coating, mild sauce underneath, and picked red bell pepper, which makes them HOT. Fun to pick at as you stare out the window.
--The view is fantastic. Depending on your viewpoint, you get an excellent view of either SF, the docks, or the bay. 
--The service. Even in packed times, waitstaff is quick and professional. Also, I had one bad plate while here, and they asked for comments for the chef, quickly removed it, and replaced it with a menu and swifty follow-up. They also comped the dish! They also don't rush you if you're cracking shells, and they're quick to clean up once you're through.

Things I don't like: 
--That bad plate was crab enchiladas. They came in a mild red sauce with salsa verde, which was good, but the inside was oozing Velveeta cheese, which completely overwhelmed any crab flavor. The flour (not corn) tortilla was partially gooey, too. 
--The price. It's a four- or five-star restaurant feel, with waitstaff in shirtsleeves and vests, marble floors and tables, but it comes with a five-star price. Expect to pay $30 per person, or $50 with drinks. 

Even so, if you have a special evening or just want to splurge, come on by!
author: Audra S.

description: Was here yesterday. My husband and I were craving crabs. This place did not disappoint us. We ordered too two crabs and crab cakes. Both were delicous. We left the place sooo full and satisfied.
author: Gabby U.

description: This is a tourist trap that isn't really a trap... because the food is actually quite good and not ridiculously priced. The garlic fries are seriously the best fries I've ever had in my life.. Seafood cioppino good, angry crab good, mussels + shrimps so-so, crab chowder meh...
author: Betty T.

description: We took our family to Crab House on a weekday which it was not busy and we enjoy our foods. Our waiter was good and he made sure we are doing okay. I'll be back again
author: Lisa S.

description:
OMG.... it's pricey. I paid like $100 for 3 people -_- Now that I got that out of my system, onto the review of the restaurant. My rating would be more like a 2.5... but since I got some sticker shock (O_O) I bump it down to two. We were sitting next to the emergency exit, and I think the manager opened it and we started complaining it was cold..lol. Then he got kinda pissed, I think... saying it was way too stuffy in the restaurant, which honestly I didn't notice.

I got the seabass..... it was decent. Maybe more salt was needed? I liked the tomatoes that came with it... and basil... always a great combo. The little pasta thing they gave with it.. it was too much little pasta pieces. It was like eating rice, but a bunch of rice. I wish they gave me a side salad instead. If I ever come back, then I would ask.

My friend got the crab melt and it wasn't anything he was expecting. It came with a side of fries and he didn't touch any of it... So... THAT'S OKAY. I totally swooped in on his fries and I ate it. The fries were on the soggy/soft side, which I know a lot of people hate..but I love my fries soggy (yes I know, I'm freaky) and the garlic on top was sooo good.

He also ordered the crab chowder.. which he let me have the first bite.. Well, it was .. okay.. I told him it needed more salt, so he added some.. and voila~~ It was a lot better. Not the best crab chowder, but a lot better from what I had tasted.

I guess this place just needs more salt... Slightly bland for an expensive tourist spot. We had a nice view though... Even though I'm from SF so I'm not that impressed, but I can see others could be impressed by it.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
The Crab House is the only reason you'd want to go anywhere near Pier 39.  Great food, great views, and entertaining tourist-watching, says this tourist.

I really love crab, and the dominatrix, er, dungeoness crab is my second favorite variety, beaten by That Deadliest Catch, the Alaskan King Crab.  The Crab House uses some sort of highly secret garlic butter sauce and bakes their crabs rather than boiling them.  I prefer the sweet, simply boiled taste of dungeoness crab, but the garlic flavor is still fine -- although it's not aesthetically pleasing, leaving a green-gray residue on the crab's interior that resembles the parts of the crab that you wouldn't want to eat (and which the Crab House staff has kindly removed for you).

Crab House also produces my second-favorite steamed clams around (333 in Oceanside, there's a congratulatory first-place review for you coming up soon).

View of the sea lions in the harbor and Alcatraz are nice.  Views from the other side of the restaurant, of gawking tourists strolling past, are fun too.
author: Erik S.

description:
It was my suggestion to come here and my friend loved it! it was his first time there, and he said it was one of the best restaurants on our trip.

We started w/ Bloody Mary's and Mojitos, they used their own horseradish on the bloody mary mix, it was perfect!

We all ordered the Garlic Dungeness Crab each, shared the garlic noodles, also shared the shrimp and mussels ( mussels were meh)

I might have to make another trip to SF in a few months, this place is the bomb! Garlic crab is soooo good, garlic noodles bomb.
author: Sandy C.

description:
A very touristy place but it not a bad option after a long walking around in the neighborhood. The food was okay. The dessert was a bit unpleasant but we didn't expect too much. 

Nice view by the waterside.
author: Safina Z.

description:
This place is aiight. 

I made reservations to Crab House approximately 3 weeks out from the actual day of our visit. It was our first time visiting San Francisco so I wanted to have the full experience; one that would include trying "Dungeness Crab" and "Garlic Fries". Having been rated at 4.0 stars with over a 1000 reviews on Yelp, I thought it would have been a solid win.

So when it came to the day of,  we get to the hostess station of the Crab House on the dot, and immediately we were seated. The place looked rather busy from glancing of one of the dining halls, the area we were in wasn't too crowded. I suspected that it would be this way since we had early eating for dinner.

So the server immediately approaches us and we go through the whole ritual. We got waters for the table, a diet coke for my boyfriend, a glass of chardonnay for moi, an order of Killer Crabs for two and side of garlic fries. Soon enough the food we had ordered was laid out on the table for us.

The dungeness crab was good, but not amazing. I wasn't entirely too impressed with the sauce that it was sauteed in. The garlic fries was just okay too. Everything was really just your average; nothing stood out. The food wasn't particularly hot either. Like they had made all the stuff we had ordered in mass bulk in the kitchen knowing that's what people would majority order.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Today was my first time visiting and I was very impressed. The service was FANTASTIC! The manager and staff honored our special request for a great window seat to celebrate our special occasion and even made an adjustment to make us even more comfortable. I would definitely recommend! 

Great place!
author: Mrs. D.

description:
Nice view. Lots of crab. Kind of pricey. 

We got 2 crabs between the 4 of us, and I honestly thought the flavoring was kind of bland... I've definitely had better crab elsewhere. Wish the crabs came with sauce or something. We also got the crab chowder which was good. Not much more to say here......
author: Amanda C.

description: Very disappointing.... Was really excited when seeing everyone's pics on yelp. I ordered what was the most popular things like the whole crab of course. Prob one of the worst crabs I have ever eaten. It was so over cooked and dry it tasted like jerky... Hardly any meat for a big crab & the Cioppini .... *heavy sigh . Oh well, now I know I'm never going back and letting all my friends know BOOOO  I WANT CRAB.... I WANT CRAB !!!
author: Leona T.

description:
Crab House at Pier 39 could have EASILY gotten a 4 star but service is a bit suspect. From the front house attendant to their bartender when you walk in and when the server decides to serve you. No one greets you. I understand. You are located in the Fisherman's Wharf's famous Pier 39. You get THOUSANDS of tourists daily. You have an amazing VIEW and loads of seafood on deck. People are going to flock. That is not an excuse to give marginal service. The busboy was the nicest person and helped us at our table the most. If i tooked down his name I would've definitely written a kind letter to the owner to let him know that he needs to be promoted. because the others FAILED. 

Our server was very condescending. For what? You are in the service industry. What did you expect? Rarely visited our table. I thought it was us maybe she didn't like how we looked. Maybe we weren't ritzy. No. she treated the seniors the same way that sat behind us. No patience or customer service whatsoever.

BUT besides that nonsense, the crab was spectacular. I'm not going to say it is the best in town. but we ordered the 3 lb "KILLER CRAB" that's served on a skillet. Took both of us an hour or so to even make a dent. It is cooked in it's "Secret Sauce" which is primarily garlic and butter and was amazing. The view didn't hurt either. Also added the "Crab Chowdeer" not a fan. It was just cream of corn with crab chunks. Nothing major to me. Maybe for you.
author: Yuki H.

description:
A great restaurant with a fantastic view right in the heart of San Francisco. Who cares if the pier is touristy. The food is great. Try it. I dare you. 

I had the mussels & shrimp and the crab chowder for lunch. So good. And the fresh bread is so yummy. 

This is a must stop and enjoy. 

Great friendly service too.
author: Liz D.

description:
It was disappointing. Heard this place was great that's why we came but it turns out to be a disappointment. 
The crab wasn't fresh at all, probably was frozen for a long time. All the crab meat was crumbled up.
The service was bad. This is a popular place and everyone is busy, that doesn't mean you can treat the customer badly.....
We will never come back here again.
author: Judy C.

description: Crab house makes quality food but they don't deshell the crab for you. Walk a few steps next door to fog harbor where they have more variety of food and where they give you the option to add deshelled crab.
author: Sean G.

description:
I was here during the 4th of July weekend and wanted to try as much of an authentic seafood place on Fisherman's Wharf as possible.  That being said, it's pretty difficult to weed through the masses of touristy hotspots on the piers.  

I decided to give this place a shot for lunch.  There was a half an hour wait.  No biggie, had a solid drink at the bar while waiting.  Seated right by the window overlooking the pier and boats on a beautiful summer day.  Ordered the crab caesar salad and the seafood cioppino tureen; the crab was cooked perfectly and the spice mix was on point.  The seafood cioppino was to die for!  Didn't know which was better, the seafood, the stew or the bread soaking up all the juices to devour.  Definitely going back next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Beenish H.

description:
Recommendation: Order the KILLER CRABS!  They call it killer crabs for a reason.  
We were craving crabs and they deliver!  Be prepare to dig in with your fingers and all.  It is totally worth it.  

Based on yelpers recommendations, we also ordered the garlic fries and crab chowder.  Garlic fries are good but they were average garlic fries.  The issue is... they served us BURNT chowder!  After we complained, they took it back.  We were certain that they were going to bring us chowder but nope - they assume we didn't want it anymore.  After asking our server, we finally got our chowder.  The chowder is good but not worth the agony.  

Bottom line - Just order more crabs to satisfy your needs!
author: Michelle C.

description:
Tourist place, maybe, but that isn't always a bad thing.

You come here to get the dungeness crab. The only reason to come here is for the dungeness crab. Most of the yelp reviews I read with unhappy people ordered something other than the dungeness crab.

They have dungeness crab all year.

I don't think the price is too crazy. I wish everyone saying that would give some examples of the cheaper, better, places on the the water with crab.
