In summary get the dungeness crab. Crab is messy so get a straw for your beer (I'm sure the staff will appreciate to not have to touch your crabby beer glass).
author: Thomas F.

description: Walked in 30 minutes before closing and still got awesome service.  My food was hot and came out quickly.  The fish and chips were awesome and so was my husband's crab melt.
author: Kristy R.

description: Expensive! But so is everything on Pier 39, so it was expected. Very busy on Sunday about 3pm. We were there for a light snack of crab chowder and crab cakes. Both were really good but tiny portions for such a large price tag. Served bread and butter at table, but it was rock hard/cold. Difficult to eat. Service was pleasant. Not a bad place to eat, just remember where you are (tourist trap) and enjoy the people watching.
author: Shelly R.

description:
Gets a two star because it was tastey  but for $25 and an 8oz scoop of crab vs what you get on Fishermans Wharf in the restaurants by the stalls no comparison. For $6 more and a pound of crab pass this place by and go to Sabella and Torre HANDS DOWN! No comparison. $120 for two salads with a dollop of crab, two wines, a beer and
Garlic bread never again
author: Robert T.

description: Thank you Ruben! You made us feel special. And the crab, calamari and Louie salad were delicious!
author: Ann E.

description:
This place was a great find. I was walking aimlessly down San Fransisco, I ask the local where should I get a great meal.  3 out of 4 people recommended this place.

Parking is across from the street so if you get your ticket stamped you can park you car for two hours for free.

Now onto the food:

The clam chowder soup "to me' seemed a little thin but they did put a lot of great flavors in it. I tasted corn, tomatoes and other flavors my untrained tongue could not identify.

The snow crab was cooked in a garlic seasoned sauce and served on a cast iron hot plate. I enjoyed the crab and the seasons that I was using the meat of the crab to soak up the flavors on the cast iron plate.

I never been to San Francisco restaurant but this was pretty good. I agree with the locals it is a must place to go to.
author: David S.

description:
Crab Chowder in bread bowl - Weak. Really bland and was full of veggies and barely any soup. Couldn't even taste any of the crab meat.  The bread was cool but bread is bread. 

Calamari - Good. Breaded pretty nicely and thick chunks of calamari. They somehow breaded two pieces of lemon as well which was weird but whatever. 

Garlic Fries - Good. Decently flavored with garlic and cooked just right.

Mussels - Weak. Tasted burnt and they were tiny. The sauce didn't do much to the flavor. 

So basically the seafood was poor at this seafood restaurant and the regular restaurant food had better rating. They really need to do something with that crab chowder.
author: Will C.

description: Best seafood ever!! We live in Florida but may come back just for the crabs. Absolutely delicious. Great atmosphere over looking the bay
author: Eric B.

description:
Yummy, but greasy as possibly can be. The fries were deliciously oily; a friend had to stop eating because his stomach felt terrible after all the fries. I'm personally not the hugest fan of crab cakes, but my friends loved it. My 3 friends and I ordered the too two crabs, which we didn't think looked that big... but definitely filled us up. I would highly suggest getting appetizers since the crabs, even though they're pretty big, aren't that filling.

I didn't think the Crab House was overtly touristy. The view is amazing; I got a window table, and you can see the sea lions and other piers! Definitely try to make a reservation, and perhaps ask if you can have a window table. We didn't, but we got lucky.

The service was nice, but you pour your own water. They allowed us to sit even though our party took about 30 minutes after our reservation time to completely show up. They also gave us plenty of towelettes, but we had to ask for more and more due to the greasiness.
author: Kimberly Y.

description: Yum!!! Lucky me I live in SF. I'm at Pier 39 all the time . All the restaurants have water views and yummy seafood.  I ate at the bar this time Tyson took exceptional care of my sister and I . Friendly excellent bloody Mary's and delish food. This place rocks!!!
author: Cecilia D.

description:
Open face crab melt - meh
Garlic fries - YUM
Salad (on prefix) - interesting but not enough to do again
1/2 crab (on prefix) - OK
crab chowder - disgusting
crab cakes - dry as hell
crab alfredo - needed salt
tiramisu - it was good

Though the view from where we sat was breath taking it just did not compensate for the food. The only things worth mentioning were the garlic fries, crab, and tiramisu. The service was nice, the old lady was very generous with the bread. Which we later used to feed the birds hehe. Though the place seems spacious and open, it just felt cramped especially getting through the aisles.
author: Mary Ann B.

description:
Servers are extremely rude.
My friend got food poisoned at this place.
Please avoid this place at any cost !
author: Jason Y.

description: We were four person and we sat down the aisle. The table was so small that it was difficult to seat. Moreover, the waiter was very rude. When we wanted to get some more water, he said "okay", but it took forever. I waited over 20 minutes for the water. Moreover, when I asked him a check, he threw it at the table. I wrote the tips on the receipt and gave it to the waiter. But, he asked me to write more tips and threw the receipt on the table and disappeared.
author: Youngju K.

description:
After being seated and ready to order

... we waited for a server.

I went to the men's room and came back.

... and we waited.

K went to the restroom and came back.

... and we waited.

Even Godot showed up and left.

... and we *still* waited for the mythical server.

15 minutes ticked by

... and we could wait no longer so we walked out.

(the hostess asked us if we'd finished ... so soon)
author: Umesh T.

description:
We were looking for a crab feast, and that's exactly what we got at Crab House - a huge mound of their garlic roasted crab split between 4 people!  This certainly satisfied our craving for massive amounts of crab.  We also had the calamari, which was delicious.  The crab chowder was ok; it had more vegetables than the other chowders we had on the trip.  

The restaurant was casual and had great views of the bay.  Not a bad choice if your looking for a dinner on the touristy Pier 39!
author: Katherine M.

description:
Nothing new to say here...

Get some amazing crab (Hopefully 3lbs or more..) get a side of sizzling shrimp and mussels...wash it down with some amazing chowder or fries...life is good...Can't beat this stuff..just simple goodness...
author: Prasath S.

description:
A good late night food adventure with a group of friends. Beautiful dining experience and service. Not to mention spectacular few of the bay and the pier. We ordered:

- KILLER CRAB = deadly delicious grab and butter sauce

-ACINI DI PEPE PAST = never had this, tasty and interesting. almost similar to quinoa

- SALMON pan seared with tomatoes & black olives = love salmon!

- CHOCOLATE TRUFFLE MOUSSE CAKE = yummy in my tummy! 

- TIRAMISU = typical, nothing special

Best to come here and enjoy a dinner meal. Fun and relaxing is the way to go!
author: Owie N.

description: Okay. We visited this place on a quick trip to San Francisco and were almost turned off by the price. But don't be turned off by price, this place is worth every penny! Our group had the crab chowder in a sourdough bowl, crab melt sandwich with garlic fries. We didn't do the regular crab as we went in for a quick lunch. But this place is the bomb!
author: Sue T.

description: Food is more of 3.5 stars and 0.5 stars for the nice window view. I came here for lunch and there was no wait. Service was attentive and we all enjoyed the food.  We had the killer crab (Which is famous in SF) and it was coated in garlic and the seasoning was delicious! It could get quite messy but its good. The fish and chips was decent. The french fries were very enjoyable. The clam chowder was okay and i didnt find it amazing. Overall, nice ambiance.
author: Jackie M.

description:
I went here for the first time with the bf and his mum on Thanksgiving day. It was a gorgeous day, we had delicious cocktails(got me a little buzzed), and ate amazing crab and mussels. I really couldn't tell you how many times we had to add to our order every time we finished what was in front of us! We also had these amazing avocado and crab crustini's and they gave us a side of burrata.....SO good. I don't even remember what we had for dessert because the crab and mussels is what stood out the most to me. We were sanctioning off our bread so that we could dip it in the delicious sauce that the crab was cooked in. What the hell was that stuff anyways? It was amazing. The waitress tried to take our empty crab skillet away and we immediately shrieked! We wanted that sauce at the bottom for our bread... 

It's become kind of a joke between the three of us how we are always thinking of crab ever since this first time here!

The second we left we already made plans to go there again for my bf's birthday. This time was even better than the first! We brought a huge party, had the same exact stuff, minus the crustini's because it didn't seem to be on their menu any more! Alas, this isn't an issue, I just ordered more crab to make up for it. Our waiter was amazing, I wish I could remember his name or something but he was so kind. We all had dessert to top off the night! I got strawberry cheescake, and I pretty much tried everything else on the menu from my friends' plates and everything was amazing. We didn't leave a single scrap of food left. 

Now, we have reservations for Easter... Already dreaming of crab!
author: Bat V.

description:
DO NOT EAT HERE IF YOU ARE NOT PAYING WITH CASH!!!! 

My friend and I both paid with debit card and were charged over $40 MORE then what we signed for. Waitress was horrible, flies were everywhere and food was mediocre.
author: Tina C.

description:
A tourist must come restaurant.
Seafood was just ok.
If you are local and if you like this place, you are an idiot.
author: Kexiang Z.

description: My family ate here for dinner and it was worth the wait! The host was very helpful and we waited 30 minutes (told it would be 1 hour 15 minute wait). The restaurant was crowded but managed well. I had the best lemon caper and butter salmon that I've ever eaten. My family loved the fish and chips.
author: Michelle R.

description: Over priced and mediocre food.  $5 kids beverages and $10 grilled cheese sammies for the kids.  The crab salad had very little crab.  The crab fettuccine was made with crab that tasted like it was past its prime. For tourists only.
author: William Z.

description:
Ok, I really had my hopes set a little higher here. I saw a lot of the Yelp reviews and figured we couldn't go wrong.  And it's not that this place was that horrible. It just wasn't that great. 

First, we were seated right next to the Kitchen with three kids ages 6-11. The bussers kept throwing the plates together right next to us which was loud and very distracting. They also pack you in here like sardines in a can. We were slammed right up against the next table and they were as annoyed as we were. And the third thing that really kind of got to me was the crab. You would think with a name like The Crab House, there would be somewhat variety of crab.....maybe just a hint of King Crab?  They should call this place The Dungeness Crab House, cause that's the only Crab you will get.  

With all that negativity, the crab portions were huge. You paid for it, but you won't go away hungry. The steamed clams were pretty darn good with toasted garlic bread to dip in. 

I can see why this place is popular, especially with the tourists. Location, Location, Location. Being smack dab on Fisherman's wharf captures the crowd with a clean restaurant and a tempting name. Since I have been there done that,  it will probably be a while before I go back.

Cheers!
author: Jim P.

description:
I picked this restaurant because of Yelp. 4 stars from over 1000 people should mean this is an amazing restaurant right?

Well...I can say the food was really tasty and well made but I will never come back here again.

We were seated right away but the place is SO cramped. I had to do hurdles over people's knees sticking out into the aisle to get to my seat.

Our waiter did not ask us ONCE if we were doing ok or if we were enjoying our food. He seemed so uncomfortable or nervous. I was wearing Hello Kitty socks - I am not intimidating.

But the food does make this place a 3-star instead of 1-star for me. The iron skillet shrimp was tasty with a wonderful buttery caper dip that complimented it. The order of small garlic fries was actually a bigger portion than I imagined and they added parm cheese to the fries. So how was I supposed to not try and eat it all?

Hopefully when you go, you'll have better service and maybe it won't be so crowded.
author: Connie C.

description:
Catch me at Pier 39 only when I'm:

1.  Showing out of towners around =\
2.  AT THE CRAB HOUSE!  =D

Usually you don't find the best restaurants in the middle of such a touristy areas, but this place is a GEM!  The prices may be a little hefty, but what do you expect?!  

Been here many times and every time the wait is looooong (25+ mins), but the food is always amazeeeballllls!

Everyone always orders the whole crab which is their staple.  My favorite is their fish & chips which is literally half a fish, and a whole buncha garlic fries (yummmm).  Also indulged in the mussels, calamari and garlic noodles.  All were very good!  

Yo girl can eat, but this place leaves me feeling overly stuffed and leaving with togo boxes full of food....(this may be also because I tend to over order when I come here ?)

Seafood lovers enjoy!! :)
author: Farhana D.

description:
The most delicious garlic roasted crab ever! 

My husband and I came here just to walk around and hang out in the city. The restaurant is located in the very busy and touristy Pier 39, but I have to say, the Crab House is probably the best restaurant at Pier 39. Everything else is just so-so, which is why I was so surprised how amazing this place was! The service was pretty good despite it being a really busy Saturday, it does get noisy, but the view makes it worth it. We shared the Too Two Crab with a side melted butter. The crab was roasted to perfection and it was honestly the best crab I've ever had in my life. We will definitely be coming back here!
author: Jillian O.

description: Dined here based on a recommendation from people who are total foodies and this did not disappoint! The iron skillet sizzling crab, mussels and shrimp was to die for. The waitress was very attentive and kept bringing my hungry 18 year old boys more bread. The crab Louie salad was large and in charge. My Moscow mule was just okay. We'd come back in a heartbeat.
author: Kim J.

description:
We were seated almost immediately on a rather busy night. 
Well done. The cioppino was excellent and the second day it was just as delicious.
My daughter's pasta dish was the same according her.
Our server was friendly, knowledgeable, and very attentive.
Certainly worthy of consideration.
author: William C.

description: Smaller restaurant in size compared to others on pier 39. Food was good my husband and I just came from the Alcatraz ferry and stopped in for dinner. Ordered Calamari for an appetizer which tasted fresh and amazing. Entree we had the shareable crab for 2. The staff and service our waiter provided was top notch. I only had wished a side of some sort came with our crab but it was okay.
author: T C.

description:
The food here is AMAZING!!! I'm allergic to seafood, but there's other options to choose from. I've been here several times with family and we always enjoy ourselves. I also like the associates and alway get served by 2 guys but don't know their names. Will be visiting and eating her in a few weeks. Can't wait!!!

Pier Itself:
Seriously, how can ppl not like this place??? There tons of stuff to do, see and hear. Yes, the stores can be a bit pricey, but going to the Pier is an "experience". The restaurants are great; yet, the people can be rude and arrogant sometimes. I love making the sea salt bottles. Each color has a different fragrance you can smell through the pier. My favorite time to go is at night when you can see the Bay Bridge lights lit up. I love SF and the pier shows visitors how beautiful California can really be.
author: Itsm E.

description:
Best place for seafood! 

This is our second time to be here. Love all the seafood we ordered. The crab feast. The mussels and clams. The only thing we missed was the California best dungeon crabs. 

The service was great. We had great time.
author: J G.

description:
AMAZING!!! We came here to celebrate 2 birthdays and were delighted by the views, food, atmosphere, and friendly staff. 

The crab and shrimp were to die for. And we also had the garlic fries, fresh vegetables and salad. Whatever you order I'm sure you won't be disappointed.
author: Melanie W.

description:
Ok Crab House, you were pretty awesome! 

I came by Pier 39 because I wanted to do all the fun touristy stuff, but I was also really hungry and wanted to get some grub! I just automatically assumed that all the restaurants around the pier were going to be mediocre and just a tourist gimmick because I've had some really whatever restaurants around the pier some time ago.

We decided to go to Crab House bc we were craving seafood and I wanted to eat by the bay. We came during Labor Day weekend so it was packed! We started off our meal with some drinks and their mojitos are excellent!

Our waitress was super prompt and friendly and she was very good at making sure that everything was ok. She suggested some entrees for us to try and we decided to order the mussels and shrimp, garlic fries, calamari, and the crab chowder.

My goodness, everything was super delicious! The calamari was nice and crispy, the chowder was nice and thick with good chunks of crab in it, and the mussels and shrimp was worth the hype. I was pleasantly surprised that there was such a good restaurant at the pier!! The whole time, the bf and I were just going at it at the seafood skillet dipping our breads in the wine garlic sauce. So. Effing. Good.

If you're around the area, whether you're visiting or a local resident, I highly suggest coming here for a quick lunch while you enjoy the sites. Very good place!
author: Hanna P.

description:
The service isn't really that great here but the food totally makes up for it. Truly one of the best seafood meals I've ever had. 

The Dungeness crab was fresh and perfectly seasoned and cooked. We also had the mussels which were fantastic as well. The butter sauce that came with it was soooo good...perfectly salted with a touch of lemon. And don't forget to order a side of fries. They are crispy and garlicy and delicious!!
author: Nik N.

description:
Great service great good. First timer and will definitely return! 

Had the sizzling double shrimp and crab with a small side of muscles. BOMB!
author: Negin A.

description:
Let's first say-when you forget about your wine, you know the food is good. We
ordered a Caesar salad, the crab enchiladas and the kind crab....all three were perfect and delicious. I've never enjoyed crab and this tasted fantastic to me!!! The waitress knew I was a novice and cut the crab up so it was much easier for me to eat the legs. The enchilada sauce was chunky with fresh tomatoes and filled with exquisite flavor that was slightly spicy. They were able to seat us quickly when it was almost 9pm and after we ordered the food arrived very quickly. They view is great and the decor is cool/fits the seafood and pier atmosphere. So happy I got to come here my first day in San Francisco!!
author: Julia W.

description: Yes, it's in the mist touristy spot in the Bay Area, but the food is delicious, our waiter (Tony) was efficient, and the prices were fair.   You can't go wrong with dungeons crab, but the muscles were tasty too.  I do wish the shrimp were peeled, but that's simply my preference.  My advice is to dine during sunset... that made the night.
author: Chris S.

description:
Had a good time chilling at the bar while Alex the bartender made everyone drinks. From the seat I did see some pretty happy people at the tables.

The sizzling plates look good, smell good. Presentation is well executed. 
 Not cheap, but what you expect with the best window view I've seen in a long time
author: Steve L.

description:
Very good crab, and the thing that I liked most about it is that they roast their crab! So it gives if a very nice texture on the outside. I found myself eating parts of the crab that I don't normally eat.

Atmosphere is surprisingly very family friendly.

Great food great view great service.

Would come back
author: Danny R.

description:
Since me and my friends were heading up to napa valley, we stopped by to see how good the seafood in SF awas. It was a disappointment..
We got the 2-3 people crab thing (Normally I remember menu names but since I will never return, whatevers. Right?) with a bowl of crab chowder and mussels & shrimp.
The crab we got was almost cold. I don't know why..
Since we were already disappointed by the crab chowder, we really didn't care much about the crab temperature.
The crab... Why would you deep fry it in butter??? When the crab should be juicy and tender?? The crab barely had meat with butter everywhere. I swear I can get this at any cheap hole in the wall restaurant.
Apparently according to my friends the mussels where okay and was the best dish on the table. What a shame...
I gave 2 stars since I liked the view out the window.
Never coming back. I'm going to stick to Redondo Beach seafood.
author: Jane L.

description:
My family and I came by on a Thursday evening for an early bday celebrating for mama dukes.  It was busy that night but we were seated almost immediately.  The service was good and the food was served rather quick. The items I tried that night:

Salad - boring. Mainly iceberg lettuce. Dressing was bland.
Crab lasagna - tasty but a bit too heavy for me.
Killer Garlic Grab - Very good. Though I only tried a leg, it was still yummy.  It was cooked and seasoned well.
Salmon - It was okay.
Fries - Delicious!  Not too oily and had a great garlic taste.
Tiramisu - Light and not too sweet.  A nice ending to our meals.
Crab chowder - Savory and hearty. Good amount of crab.
(Complimentary) bread - This would taste so much better warmed.  The outside part was hard to chew.  We all only had 1 serving of bread and wasted the other loaf.

Although service was good, the food didn't WOW me, especially with the price tag.  With so many competition around the area, I'd say this place is pretty standard.
author: Mel B.

description: Food is not bad if you don't mind shit service. Or maybe we're just unlucky to get a rude check in guy and a waiter that literally NEVER came around and messed up the order and had the audacity to ASK FOR TIPS after we eat. Still tipped his pathetic ass as charity tho, cuz his bitch ass ain't never gonna get tips.
author: Ricky W.

description:
Four Stars for sure.
Went here for Crab and Great Crab is what I got.
For two people The Lotsa Of Crab Platter is the way to go.
Service was first class and the view was also great.
Being right on Pier 39 meant you could enjoy shopping and some great fresh hot made doughnuts when walking around.
Their Crab Chowder Is also worth a try with lots of crab flavor. 
I give the place a strong four stars for food, service and atmosphere.
Worth a try if you want your fill of Great Crab.
author: Robert Z.

description:
Did someone say Corporate is paying for lunch today? YES I'm in lol 
My boss calls me and says the big dawgs wants to take my crew and I out to celebrate our success. I asked her where are we going? she mentioned Crab House @ Pier 39. Knowing I haven't been here in a while I thought why not? 

Inside the restaurant you have a spectacular view of boats & sea lions. The decor of the venue was kind of hideous with all the decorative plastic crabs hanging on the ceiling. Other than that the restaurant was not modern but decent. The last time I was here was 8years ago for dinner, big difference was moonlighting to day time. 

For starters we ordered two orders of the Bruschetta and Calamari. Results: Bruschetta-my bread became soggy so quick due to the overwhelming of roasted tomatoes. Calamari- Average, crispy with deep fried lemons. Our main entrees consisted of two large orders of Crab Alfredo and two large orders of their Roasted Garlic Crab, which included mussels and prawns. Results? The pasta was delicious, and the crab was ginormous! but barely any meat in it. Kind of oily, but didn't mind as I downed lots of water. I can't really hype this place up because the food was mediocre. Soweee.. As for desserts we ordered everything Tiramasu, Chocolate truffle mousse cake, Torta Della Nonna, and Italian cheesecake. The winner out of the four? Torta Della Nonna-consisted of lemon zabaglione-Yummm 

Would I come back? Ummm if someone says they'll treat!
author: Kathy V.

description:
A group of 4 of us came out to eat here last night. We made 5:30 reservations so we got here a little early and strolled around the festival Pier 39 which was still lit up and the Christmas Tree at the entrance was as beautiful as ever. There was even a guy name Steve who played some music next to the tree which added to the festive mood. We got promptly seated when we arrived and the place was packed. We examined the menu extensively and eventually settled on the house speciality which is "garlic dungeness crab" that is served on a hot iron skillet with melted butter. We had 2 that serve 4 people reasonably well along with grilled shrimp. The crab is delicious but too much for me, I ordered a crab angel hair lasagna which was great, portion a little small for $25.00 and a bit too salty for my taste, it came in a butter sauce. I ordered cheesy garlic bread with that.
The waitress was interesting, my party of 3 are all Mandarin speakers and I assume my waitress was also since she seemed to understand Mandarin, but refused to speak Mandarin to my guests and spoke  limited English which added to some ordering confusion. She appeared to be the only waitress working there and at times we ordered items from the bus boys instead of her since she appeared over worked.
Overall the quality of the dishes were good, tourist expensive though, our bill ran up to $275.00 not including tip and no alcohol. 
Decor was OK, appearance of a touristy crab place but the window seating was overlooking the pier. (Order the window seating with your reservation).
This is a once in a lifetime thing and I don't think I'll be back at those prices.
author: Dirk D.

description:
I'd been craving for seafood for a while so I decided to check this place out. Was expecting really fresh seafood considering its right on the pier! But the food was far from fresh. Really disappointing. I've had much better for a fraction of the price.

The crab cakes were seem to have been pulled out of deep freeze and thrown immediately on a skillet. Maybe it was just my plate since my cousin seemed to really enjoy it.

Calamari done right can be beautiful, crisp on the outside, fresh and juicy on the inside. Served with a lemon sauce and it's heaven. I ordered the calamari here. Maybe my standards are really high when it comes to calamari but the Crab House treated the dish like it was a plate of lowly onion rings. It was sad. And chewy. And flavorless. Served with a packet of regular sauce.

And to top things off, the place was absolutely PACKED. Didn't have a place to sit for ages and no help from the staff. 

Overall, quite unsatisfactory.

Looking at other reviews here, I'd like to give them the benefit of doubt, maybe they were overwhelmed by the crowd.
author: Nikhil B.

description: Great seafood and atmosphere. There's always a wait but that's because it's hard to get out of the chair after eating all that crab.
author: Drew O.

description: Wow......what a disappointment. A complete tourist trap. Came here by recommendation of a friend who came as a tourist last year. Hat the hell was she thinking. Lol. Don't get it at all. They throw a crab on the a flat grill and somehow it's fantastic. 1single crab with shrimp shared by 2 adults with a drink and bill with tip was $106. Went elsewhere after still being hungry. Go get some fresh steamed crab off the pier instead.
author: Jacob L.

description:
This place does serve up some delicious crabs. The restaurant's layout is nice, you're able to take in the whole view of the nearby waters and piers. The sourdough bread they start you off is really good along with the fresh butter. I love San Francisco sourdough!!!

Anyways, we ordered the lotsa crab which consists of about a crab and a half. Sad thing was that it didn't include the shell so we couldn't scrape all the delicious brraaaaiinns. But the meat was so succulent and plump. Very sweet and big pieces of crab meat. The crab chowder was good but nothing spectacular. I loved the garlic pasta, I added my own pieces of crab into it rather than bother getting the pasta with the crab included. Also ordered the shrimp on the skillet with the garlic-butter-lemon sauce, that was good although the shrimp were somewhat smaller than what I was expecting.

All in all, this place is really good and I strongly suggest you either getting to the restaurant early on a weekend or make reservations because it does get filled up fairly quickly.
author: Edison T.

description:
I got crabs and mussels + shrimps.
Overall was good but too buttery for me, but soda helps
author: Amy C.

description: Can't find a negative side.. Everything was delicious! Hmm.. Maybe a bit tiny portion
author: Veronica D.

description:
I guess if you have never had a reallllly good crab or seafood meal, I can see why the good reviews. Completely disappointed with the taste. For the price completely not worth it. You are better off going to Red Lobster and spending that amount for better taste and quantity. 
So what its next to water and beautiful views, all the tables are right on top of each other. Barely can get up to go to the bathroom. And there was only ONE bathroom, one toilet, which was disgusting. 

I would recommended Bubba Gumps at the end of the pier. Been there several times and still not been disappointed with the taste. Flavorful and big portions. Additionally, they have a mens bathroom and womens! With multiple stolls!
author: Sarai C.

description:
Did a drive by of this establishment after receiving poor service from another restaurant a short distance away. It was a beautiful day with many visiting the famous Pier 39 so there was a short 5 min wait.  
My hubby and I were seated in about 8 min. with our server appearing a short time after seating despite the significant lunch crowd.  Our server was quite pleasant and did not flinch as we explained how we wanted our check separated(hubby was on business and part if our check was to be expensed back to his company.
author: Terry S.

description:
If you want to enjoy yourself some delicious crab, with no regards to how clean you keep yourself while eating it, or how silly you look, this is the place to come! You even get to rock a ridiculous-looking bib. 

This place is adorable inside and a great dining option when in Fisherman's Wharf. Fresh seafood, a nice view and no frills. I loved the Crab Chowder, big pieces of crab, corn and potatoes all doing a Happy Dance in a creamy, piping hot bath.

We got the Mussels, Crab and Shrimp Skillet and the Crab in Garlic Sauce. Everything was delicious and seasoned just right. I would warn, however, that the Mussels, Crab and Shrimp Skillet comes with a good amount more mussels than anything else (of course, right?), so take that into consideration. 

Portions are huge and perfect for sharing. Get a Skillet or two and share it with a group. Get a side of Garlic Fries and an ice cold beer, and you are good to go!

Side Note: It's very funny when a crab leg slips out of someones hands and flies across the restaurant. It happened to me, and to a table nearby, in which that leg went straight into a woman's cleavage!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
NOT a tourist trap!! Congrats for doing your prescribed Yelp research. You have actually found a non-tourist trap WITHIN a tourist trap! 

Now, pat yourself on the back and go and enjoy some killer crab! Might I recommend the following: 

- The crab omelette 
- The crab enchilada 
- Their dill house salad (the dill is an excellent addition, you can really notice it)

The dishes are served in a steaming hot cast iron flat pan. Look at my pic for more details) 

The views are also killer from here! (it's on the second floor of Pier 39, closer to the back) Service is unobtrusive and extremely accommodating. Prices are VERY reasonable for the location and quality.

Excellent for a weekday dinner :) I ain't no tourist.. and I will definitely be back ;)
author: Kathy S.

description: My Bf and I were craving crab over the weekend so we decided to come to one of our favorite seafood restaurants. This time we ordered a small order of mussels, small garlic fries, and the lotsa crab (3lbs.) The mussels are always good here, they put dry seasoning along with a white wine sauce that you can either have poured over the mussels or you can use it as a dipping sauce. I feel with garlic fries they are always good at most restaurants. The crab here is one of the best crabs I've had. The seasoning is perfect! The crab was cooked perfectly! Everything from the staff to the views to the atmosphere of this place keeps me coming back for more!
author: Tracey P.

description: Went there on a rainy night in late November. (November 26, 2016) My best friend and I were visiting from Minnesota and wanted to eat at the pier our last night there. She had the crab alfredo and I had the garlic noodles with crab. We both LOVED our dishes!! The portions were perfect! Not too much, and not too little. People complain about the price...here's a clue: you're getting fresh Dungeoness Crab. It's not frozen. I had so much crab in my dish! Some pieces were huge chunks!! Great taste! The service was also top notch! We were welcomed right away, and the server made us feel comfortable and was attentive. The drink I had was strong...pricy, yes but very good. (I had the Moody Crab) The decor is fun and quirky. The seating could use recovering as some has tears but that's forgivable. All in all it's a great place to go! (Totally kid friendly, too!)
author: Nikki P.

description: We drive to the city just to eat here. Great view, great food. Always busy -- be sure to make reservations -- with advance reservations we're always seated on time upon arrival. Space is at a premium, tables are close together, but that adds to the festive environment. This is NOT a quiet, romantic dinner.The mussels are out of this world -- I prefer them to the crab...but hubby probably wouldn't agree. Fixe Prixe dinner provides an economical option, but for being on Pier 39, the prices are in line.A diner's tip--If you choose the cioappino, you can ask that the crab be shelled so the crab is ready to eat in the stew -- otherwise, you have crab legs to crack with your cioappino.Be sure to get your Pier 39 parking garage ticket validated to save 2 hours of parking for dinner!
author: Benjamin R.

description: while I don't mind in paying for crab this crapb was not good. Note this is not steamed crab! The way they cooked it pretty much ruined the crab  Service was great and everything came out quickly but I would you never eat here again
author: Alicia S.

description:
This is your typical touristy seafood place in fisherman's wharf. For the price, I expected a classier experience with better service. Instead I found a place that looked like a diner crossed with a knickknack shop, and made me feel like my money was being wasted.

Our waiter was brusque, and was really pushy about getting us to order. He circled back to our table every 30s or so to see if we were ready. After we waffled a few times, he basically told us exactly what we were going to order, and gave us an option between chowder and salad. This would have been super helpful, if only it was done in a slightly more tactful way.

The two of us ended up splitting the Combo Mussels, Shrimp & Crab skillet and Crab Chowder. The skillet was mostly a mussels skillet, with a few paltry pieces of shrimp and crab thrown in as an afterthought. That being said, there was a good amount of mussels. The seasoning was virtually non-existent, and the provided sauces didn't do much to add flavour either. The Crab Chowder was a better experience, with interesting flavours, though very little crab.
author: Graham B.

description:
If you're in the mood for crab, this is the obvious place to go.

It's nestled on the second floor of Pier 39. Make sure you either arrive early or make a reservation, there is a long wait.

We got a nice window on the bay-side overlooking the water and the pier. We tend to go a little overboard with our food, so we only ordered a Killer Crab for each of us, calamari, and fries. Next time, we'll just go for the crab. The rest are just space fillers. The Killer Crabs are roasted in Crab House's garlic sauce and is super rich and heavy, so eat fast before it gets cold and heavy. If you're going to order more crabs, maybe have them stagger it so you don't have any sitting out while you're chowing down on the others.

It's a little pricey, but it's a super fun place to go if you want great atmosphere and even better crabs.
author: Vivian L.

description: This place is great! Had my birthday dinner here the other night and it was more than I could have ever asked for. We had reservations but got there early so we had to wait a bit but it wasn't too horrible. So many tourists there that you're sure to get stomped on a time or two unfortunately but once inside things got much better for us. I ordered the calamari, crab chowder and the garlic fries - the chowder was delicious, the calamari left a bit to be desired as I didn't really enjoy the sauce they served with it, and the fries were decent. We then ordered the crab feast. It seemed like as soon as we ordered our food, it was magically delivered within five minutes. The crab appears to be fried instead of boiled like at most places and it was phenomenal!! I did wish the crab came withx  a side other than what I believe was a small bowl of couscous - maybe potatoes or corn or something. Only other issue I ran into was that I ordered a drink that I didn't like and when I asked for it to be returned the waiter got to asking too many damned questions. I took one sip, found it unsavory, and returned it. Just take it back and ask if there is something else I'd like. I'm spending $200 on dinner, one drink isn't gonna hurt your fancy restaurant.
author: Melissa E.

description: Cold bread, hard butter = basic fail. Cold bread bowl of cold crab chowder = fail. HOWEVER, the service was good, the flavors are good, but how can you serve food at the wrong temperature?!  Definitely not worth the time. Skip It.
author: Suzy C.

description:
My coworker and I dined here on Labor Day sometime after 2pm. There was a modest wait to get in (Maybe 15 minutes or so). Very cramped pathways to the seating areas but once seated, it really didn't matter. We were seated right next to an open window overlooking the Bay and had a view of a cute Sea Lion sun bathing on the dock. Lol! The breeze was fantastic and added to our positve dining experience. 

Our waitress was adorable. I have forgotten her name but she was attentive throughout our dining experience. Our food and drinks were promptly served by a myriad of wait staff. I liked that. The food was fresh and hot. 

My appetizer was the crab chowder bowl. 'YUMMAROLLA!' This was a hearty bowl of chowder with a descent serving of crab meat. My main course was the open faced crab melt sandwich with garlic fries. Absolutely delicious! The bread was like a french bread so it was a bit tough and required a little extra chewing but the flavors were delightful. Tiramisu completed my dining experience and it was so very good! 

My coworker ordered the pan seared salmon with Quinoa and she enjoyed her meal also. I tasted her salmon and it tasted fresh, light and flavorful! The bottom of the salmon had a nice crisped finish to it.

I was well pleased with the Crabhouse. Very well pleased. It was worth every penny. The cost is comparable to surrounding seafood establishments on Pier 39. I hope you enjoy it also.
author: Simone D.

description:
toutisty- yes. but thats obvious because its at pier 39. so, if you dont want "touristy" dont bother eating here.

service-despite the other reviews, my experience was actually very good. 

ambiance-dinerish with a great view

iron skillet plate with the combo of crab, shrimp, mussels was very good. $49.95

large calamari- not rubbery, perfect crunch; large is a really a large portion $19.95

clam pasta with garlic sauce- not too saucy at all, very light and refereshing (esp because it was a rare HOT San Francisco day) $26.95 -- my least favorite dish and for the price next time id probably try a different pasta 

overall, id come back to eat here again if i was in the area.
author: Sarina A.

description: Amazing food. We ordered the "Lotsa Crab", garlic fries and garlic bread -- just amazing! Crab comes out on a huge skillet soaked in garlic butter. Easy to crack and the flavor is great!
author: Derrick S.

description: Crab House is located at Pier 39 which is a nice touristy area with lots of restaurants and retail shops. I wasn't aware of the Pier 39 parking garage and parked at a private lot for $10. If you are dining, you can get parking garage validation and get 1 or 2 hours free depending on time of day. They do take reservations. I did not have one but was able to get a table right away on a Sunday evening. Wine selection isn't too extensive but what they have in red wine is pretty good. I tried the crab chowder which was excellent. I had the double shrimp and double crab. The crab was really good. The shrimp was good as well but I wished they used larger shrimp. It's a little messy so make sure you use the bib. The service was very good. If you are in the area, I would definitely suggest giving them a try.
author: Morris N.

description:
I have to start by saying at first I was a little discouraged because of the long wait time but in this wonderful establishments defense 1) it was lunch time 2) I was starving and when I'm hungry patience is not my thing. 

My boyfriend of 3 years lives in sacramento and on a visit to see him we went for the weekend to San Francisco. After walking the pier and seeing so many seafood restaurants we decided to come here. BEST DECISION EVER! 

We were seated by a window with a beautiful view and ordered our drinks almost immediately. I had the crabby mood and he had a strawberry mojito, both absolutely delicious! Seriously the best mojito either of us had ever had. 

Now on to the food..we both started out with the crab chowder, I all but licked the bowl. It was so amazing! The bread was ok I used it to dip in the chowder. We split a crab, which was a mistake because we both could've ate a whole one. It was the freshest and most well cooked crab I have EVER had! It was full of flavor and was worth every penny we paid and every minute we waited! Every table around us who's food came while we were there was perfection and I truly wish we could've tried everything on the menu. 

I will definitely be back any and every time I visit him! It made the whole day. We both love seafood and for the rest of my trip out there no seafood restaurant could compare to the outstanding food this establishment has or the freshness and high quality of the food.
author: Ashley B.

description: Although this Resturant is in touristic area it's not a tourist trap! Service is very good and servers are efficient. The seafood soup is a whole meal by itself, stick to the small size..it's too big! Very tasty and well spiced. Don't miss the crab dinner, lots of garlic in the seasoning making it really tasty. The down side is that it's somewhat pricy, 312 dollars for 3 people!!
author: Khaled A.

description: The crab there was the best of all dishes, the shrimps and the mussels were good too. Really nice sauces.
author: Gemma C.

description:
Loved this place!

Their crabs that come out sizzling on iron skillet with garlic butter, crab Louie, cheese bread, everything was fantastic!

Service was prompt and friendly...we sat in back..open air windows on both sides..beautiful views and classic crab house atmosphere.

Make reservation..books up fast!
author: Mary S.

description: As a lone tourist who wanted to try as much as possible, I got the combo of three consisted of mussels, shrimp, and crab. It wasn't as large as I thought it would be, and I finished what I think was meant for two people to share by myself...but I didn't get anything else. It was pretty good,  a little salty, and was around 50 dollars. There were A LOT of people waiting outside when I arrived, but since I was alone, I sat at the bar alongside two couples. The bartender/waitress was really nice too.
author: Alice Z.

description: Crazy expensive.. And  limited to the kind of crab they catch around there.. So not worth it. Tourist trap
author: Danny A.

description:
March 25, 2015

After a long day of exploring San Francisco, my guy and I made our way back to the pier again for more food. We ordered their medium shrimp and their Dungeness crabs (2 of them) and pasta. Pricy but worth it! The service is spectacular and emasculate. Even though we came in about 45 before closing, we weren't denied of food. Haha!  I couldn't ask for better food than this. So buttery and garlicky!
author: Diana H.

description:
Visited with my Family on a weekend getaway.  We had so many choices but decided to eat here because it was always crowded.  Went on Sunday evening, around 5. Asked for a seat next to the window.  No problems here...waited about 20 minutes.  Once seated we already knew what we wanted...CRAB!!!  We ordered the twin crab with shrimp, clam chowder, mashed potatoes and shrimp diablo.  The waiter was very helpful and offered a few suggestions.  When the food came out I thought," OMG, I ordered too much!!!".  It was a lot of CRAB.  It was so fresh and quite yummy.  The clam chowder was by far the best I had tasted while on vacation (Boudin's was good as well).  The star of the show was the spicy shrimp diablo pasta that my daughter ordered.  I have never tasted anything like this before.  The flavor was so unique and it was loaded with fresh shrimp.  
All in all, I would come back here on any day of the week for crab, chowder and a view! 
Very memorable family dinner.
author: Shanell C.

description:
We've been wanting to try this place since we've walked by it the first time. The next day, we came back without a reservation and the wait was two hours long. 

Perhaps after the long wait, we came with a high expectation... But honestly the food here wasn't that great. Except for the mussels, nothing else was that tasty. The crabs were over fried and skinny. The pasta was really oily and too buttery to eat. The clam chowder was really salty... 

It was definitely not worth the wait. Just another touristy restaurant that is overrated and overpriced. Not recommended.
author: Kitty M.

description: Crazy busy! The wait at the door said stay snd wait. The smell of the steamy crabs said, keep an eye on the bar for a seat. Score! Our bartender was fabulous (Tim?) and was on top of the massive amount of orders that came through without missing a beat. The combo of cast iron skillet cooked mussels, crab, and shrimp we decided on with a side of garlic bread left us full and satisfied. Yes, we were tourists, but we were joined by some locals at the bar. I saw they had a plethora of menus in different languages to assist with the tourist trade. Recommend the wait and enjoyed the atmosphere!
author: Pamela K.

description:
This is definitely a tourist trap. But that's not always a bad thing. Ate here with my family on a Memorial Day day trip to the SF. It is conveniently located right on Pier 39. That was the key for us. There are plenty of places to get better crab in the City. But we wanted to maximize our time at the Wharf. We had the crab feast (killer crab for four), garlic noodles (plain), and a kid's grilled cheese. The crab was dry, and the butter garlic sauce was a little salty. The noodles were tasty but came in tiny portions. The grilled cheese was by all reports delicious.

The service was decent, considering it was Memorial Day. We got our refills, but not much more. The view was honestly not that great. You can see the Blue and Gold fleet outside your window, but not much else. The windows on the other side of the restaurant open to the Pier. It was a little weird watching shoppers walk by and look in to see what we were eating.

We wouldn't come here for a special occasion, but it hit the spot for an impromptu day trip to the Wharf.
author: David L.

description: Average food. Crowed, loud. Services was not so friendly but food was fast. Over priced. Guess the seafood in SoCal is way better.
author: Kaya Z.

description:
Situation: We came here with 15 people for a friend's birthday. Normally, this would mean a disaster - slow service, incorrect orders, a crazy escalated bill and the messy dance by everyone at the end to try to divide and pay it. But this wasn't the case at Crab House.  We got a ton of great food and drinks, the bill came out extremely reasonable, and when we all put in our credit cards to divide it (somewhat unevenly), the waitress was on top of it and every bill came back correctly. Kudos for that.

Order: the crab is piping hot! careful with your hands. the mussels, garlic fries, and melon mojito were great.  I was less excited about the shrimp and garlic bread. 

Pro tip: DO take the bib they offer you, even if it looks ridiculous on. You'll be thankful later when you have crab all over the bib.
author: Janet Z.

description:
Undoubtedly a place which wants to kick you out as soon as they place food at your table. 
The food is good. Had the half order of the crab. Quantity wasn't as much as the price. I wonder if it was even half the order. Crab cakes $17 for 2 small cakes(a loot). 
The crab was flavorful but everything else was over priced. Didn't have fun dining here
author: Raunacq R.

description: great crab, great sea port view, great server. (Con: only 2 restroom and it is kind of outside-some non-customers also go to the restroom)
author: Kelsey W.

description: It's fun to play tourist once in awhile and my friend & I came across the crab house at fisherman wharf. We ordered the seafood combo on skillet, the garlic butter dip was right on!! It was already very crowded at 5:30pm, would take 30 mins to get a table, so we sat at the bar instead. the staffs were extremely nice & got a really nice vibe inside. We enjoyed our time & watched the sunset, it was a nice dinner indeed! Highly recommend to check it out if you are in the area!
author: Alice L.

description:
One of my favorite touristy traps in SF! If you're a local you might want to skip this place, if you're a local and your friends want to go somewhere in Pier 39 this place is worth it! It's got a great location: it's on the upper deck of Pier39's waterfront attractions. From most tables you can catch a nice waterfront view!

For 3 people we ordered: 1 whole crab, double mussels, clam chowder, calamari. garlic fries. It was more than enough for all of us. Overall bill was pretty pricey Plan on at least $30-40 a person for seafood The seafood was fresh, simple, but good enough for me. the seafood isn't really seasoned much at all, but they do give you some dipping sauces, lemon etc. I can't tell if the seafood is salty because it's from the sea or because they put extra salt on it. Either way, expect to get saucy here - lemon butter, garlic butter, something butter. Being allergic to butter might be rough here.  They bring out your food on sizzling plates that are elevated above the table... that's how everything manages to fit on their tables. 

The staff is really nice. The bus staff is really nice making sure all your seafood bits are cleared away and you have fresh plates napkins etc. 

I'd come back again here if I had friends in town that wanted to be touristy, it's good for that purpose given location, price, quality. Since I actually live here, I wouldn't go the extra mile to go here. Definitely recommend coming in early right when they open if not the wait definitely stacks up.
author: Christine B.

description: This place is solid if you like crab. Perhaps a bit on the pricey side but the location is cool and the crab is really tasty. Prepare to get your hands dirty as the way they serve the crab on the hot skillet amply covered in garlic butter nearly requires a shower when you're done. I ordered the 'lotsa' and finished it easily. I could have eaten more. This is not the place for non-seafood people - it's a go to place for crab and other shell fish lovers.
author: Dan S.

description: The food was delish! Service was okay. Super crowded, being its such a small place. We loved the Fish and Chips!
author: Amelia F.

description:
How the people gave this place a 4 star rating I will never understand. Maybe the crab is good. I don't know. I was very disappointed. 

Food: 2 stars. They brought hard bread to the table with no butter. Ok. We started off with shrimp as an appetizer. I could have gotten better at Raleys. I did the Prixe Fixe. I had the crab chowder which tasted like it came from a can and had huge piece of crab shell in it. The crab angel hair lasagna was swimming in this greasy sauce. I sent it back and a man who works there admitted the baking process breaks the sauce. Why TF are you serving it to me then?? I sent it back. The tiramisu was the only thing I enjoyed. 

Service: 4 stars. Our waitress was friendly, attentive, and accommodating. When I explained that I cant eat salad because of digestive issues she had no problem substituting the crab chowder for a salad. She apologized several times when we sent our food back.

Ambiance: 3 stars. It's cute enough on the inside with a nice view if you get a seat by the window. The casual interior definitely doesn't match the hefty price tag though.

Thumbs down. With so many other options do yourself a favor and steer clear.
author: Stefanie T.

description: Wish I would of listened to the star rating... The price you pay for the food is definitely not worth the quality of food or service. My family and I ordered just about everything the menu had to offer and still left unsatisfied :(... All grease no flavor. Let's start with the calamari, it was just ok. The bread we cold & hard... Crab shower has more tastes like a bowl of celery corn and potatoes... The $30 salad was made with iceberg lettuce that was cut hours before ordering, which I could tell by the wilting & purple edges ... Shrimp Alfredo was bland and the noodles were hard... Shrimp & chips had no seasoning... The crab feast was cooked too long and a bit dried out.. & served with no sides not even butter... Lastly they you serve glasses of water in small bar cups, where do you they do that at??
author: Hungry Lady K.

description:
ONCE YOU GO PPQ, YOU NEVER GO BACK! 

Trust a local, Crab House @ Pier 39 is just another Tourist Trap...

CH is part of the umbrella restaurants of Bobo's, Franciscan, The Stinking Rose, etc. and is located on the upper deck of Pier 39's waterfront attractions. I haven't been to the Pier since my HS heydeys when I thought overdrawn pencil thin eyebrows and dark brown lined lips were the hottest thing ever. With a Casper-like complexion, all I was missing was a red clown nose to complete my "look". :X

Anyhow, my friends and I wanted to eat crab at someplace new so w/ a 4 star rating, we decided to give CH a try. Last night, 3.15.11, we came to CH w/ 6:15 PM reservations.

F O O D: 
All the food came out fast; w/in 3-5 mins of ordering which was a RED FLAG!

*COMPLIMENTARY ACME BREAD: MEH!
Tasted like day-old bread; not crusty and very chewy.

*GARLIC BREAD w/ Mozzarella ($5.95):  MEH!
The lukewarm garlic bread tasted microwaved; oily, chewy w/ a soggy crust throughout. The only thing remotely good about it was the melted cheese which is hard to screw up.

*STEAMED CLAMS w/ Garlic (Small - $14.95): OK.
The small order has 14 clams and is a good starter for 2 people to share. The clams were large and sweet but the broth tasted liked watered down butter-flavored water and lacked any fresh garlic herbaceous flavor. We really made use of the lemon wedges to give it a punch of citrus.

*"WORLD FAMOUS" DUNGENUSS KILLER CRAB® IN SECRET GARLIC SAUCE - Too Two Crab (Feeds 2-3 for $68.95): OK, but there's nothing "World Famous" AND "Killer" about it.

CRABS: Our crabs were served whole, so it was very difficult to share. We couldn't help but notice everyone else's crab was pulled apart/cut for them. The crabs were fresh, large and perfectly steamed to a sweet tenderness though.

SECRET GARLIC SAUCE: Wanna know the "secret"? There's no real garlic (at least we couldn't taste any) or "sauce" (it was butter drippings). SHHHHHHHH!!!

The crabs tasted like there were dunked into a bucket of melted butter, plopped onto a sizzling iron platter and then served. Other than a mouthful of grease, there was no flavor and certainly no robust garlicky flavor to it.

If you think this will be the American version of PPQ's Roasted Crab, it's not. And, if you're use to PPQ's crab which is drenched in mouthwatering buttery garlicky goodness, I don't think you will not like the crab here. 

*GARLIC FRIES (Medium - $7.95): DELISH!
Sadly, this was the best thing out of all our dishes. The fries were fried to a golden brown and had a flakey cracker-like crispiness throughout. It was salty and well-seasoned, however, it could have used a lot MORE garlic. The fries were topped with garlic instead of being tossed with it so only the top layer had a garlicky flavor to it. 

S E R V I C E:  
RUDE AND INATTENTIVE!

It must have been "role-playing" night on how to epitomize French snobbery (btw French restaurants exuding snobbery is a myth). With the exception of the bus boys, the entire waitstaff at CH was very cold and arrogant.

From the moment we walked in, the hostess never greeted us and seem to have an issue when we wanted to move to a less cramped table. Mind you, there was only ONE other table in our section among a sea of other empty tables.

Our waiter, Richard Blais look-alike (Top Chef - Season 4) was inattentive and had a very pompous attitude. After giving us our apps, he never checked on us. Every time he passed by our table, we would try to make eye contact but he turned a blind eye and ignored us. We had to call for his attention when we wanted to order, needed water and wanted to pay for our bill.

Our water pitcher was moved to another table so we couldn't even "self-serve" our own water glasses without getting up. And, in his very little interaction with us, it was fake and contrived. 

I'm no stranger to working in the retail/service industry, so I know how tough it can be, but a simple "smile" can go a long way...something that should be reiterated by Management at their next staff meeting. 

A M B I A N C E / D É C O R:
Casual and slightly divey; reminiscent to a diner but w/ a ocean, boat and crustacean themed décor. The highlight of the restaurant is the picturesque view of the Pier especially on a bright sunny day.

P A R K I N G:
Difficult street parking, however, there's validated parking at the Pier 39 garage across the street.

*1st hr free before 6 PM
*2 hrs free after 6 PM
*$7/hr thereafter (Thanks, Steve for being late! J/k!)

For visiting Yelpers looking for artery-clogging and bold, mouth-watering flavors to tantalize your taste buds, go to PPQ Dungeness Island (Outer Richmond) for their Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles instead. It's is a little out of the way and the service can be iffy at times, but without a doubt you'll see one of the reasons WHY San Francisco is a Foodie's Gourmet Paradise!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
The wait time was entirely too long...their waiting list system is a little old school. Had a reservation at Fog Harbor but took a chance and gave it up to rat here. My husband, son and I were disappointed. The food was only so-so. Not worth the price. For how much I paid I coulda had better at Thanh Longs. 

Ehh you live you learn. This was a once & last time visit.
author: Shanitra R.

description: First time here. Came to celebrate mom's graduation. The food was spectacular. We shared the crab chowder bowl, the Caesar salad and a whole crab. The crab was fresh and sweet. The chowder was loaded with veggies and potatoes, with the subtle flavor of bacon at the back and a good portion of fresh Dungeness crab. The Caesar was dressed perfectly and the dressing had just the right amount of tanginess. The whole crab, which was roasted in a garlic butter and white wine sauce, came to the table on a sizzling hot cast iron skillet . Very satisfying. It was a beautiful day and the windows were wide open to allow a fresh ocean breeze to waft in and the delicious smells of the food to waft out calling in passers by to join the party. The space was tight but we were seated immediately. Our server was courteous and attentive. The only down side was we didn't get our seafood forks until our meal was basically finished. At any rate, we made do and enjoyed ourselves immensely. I will be back to try the fish and chips.
author: A W.

description: For locals we tend to not visit Pier 39, due to the fact thats where alot of tourist hang out.  But there is a good Crab House there.  Serving grilled garlic crab and shrimp on the Hot plates with Hot butter to dip the sweet crab into.  After dinner you get a chance to walk around the pier and reminisce when you were a kid.  Listen and watch the seals / sea lions play. will recommend and visit again.
author: Nic C.

description:
Alright, finally getting around to writing a review on this.  My friend and I were on a mission to find crab.  Interesting enough, unless you live in SF it's hard to find a good local crab spot that isn't crawling with tourists.  We were starving so decided to just brave the Wharf and give this place a shot.  The Crab House is a chain but I'd like to imagine that the SF one is extra special because...well, it's in SF!

We were seated right away and decided to order the "lotsa crab" to share.  It says it's 2 lbs. but like any other time you order seafood by the pound, it did not seem at all like it could possibly be 2 pounds.  Regardless, it was covered in this garlic butter sauce that sent us to the moon!  The crab meat was easily accessible with our nifty tools they gave us.  For 10 minutes we sat in silence as we worked away at getting the meat out and shoving it into our mouths as quickly as possible.

In addition to the crab, we ordered Cajun fries, which were good, but nothing special.  I also ordered a bloody mary and again, it was good but nothing special  The service was fast and friendly.  

I'd definitely recommend this place, but be prepared - it is SPENDY.
author: Mandi L.

description: If 10 stars was an option, it would have my vote. I hate crab, but this was not your ordinary crab. It was a freshly served gift of the universe. For a table of 6, we shared the giant serving of crab - menu item name escapes me now - and it was more than enough. I would come back 1 million times.
author: Lissette C.

description: Awful food. The food was either not fully cooked or burnt. The carb smells really bad. Clam chowder was like a vegetable soup. Worst lunch ever.
author: Shuzhen Y.

description: It was an excellent and very cool restaurant. I started with garlic fries. I haven't eaten such delicious one recently. The then whole crab was very delicious. The service was fast, and staff was very friendly. Special thanks to Sun who I chat about Turkish soccer league. He is aware of the performance of big team more than average Turkish soccer fans. I enjoyed a lot and certainly I would go there again once I come back again to SF.
author: Irfan K.

description: Noisy crowded crab house. I am unhappy with every dishes here. The chowder is not tasty. The fried calamari is not fried to an acceptable level. The pasta is too salty. The dessert is too sweet... High price is the only impressive thing here.
author: Yuzhou C.

description: Update: had a lackluster experience the first time and the manager called me after seeing my review and asking for my info. Wow talk about customer service, they made sure that my experience was listened to and they made it up to me!!! Very very impressed by this place. Food ain't half bad either! Boyfriend LOVED his crab
author: Elizabeth H.

description: My must go to place when I'm in San Fran. Crab is delicious! Our waiter was amazing, long list of stuff we ordered, he didn't write it down and we got worried when he went table to table asking other customers questions but he managed to remember it all and got it right. Can't wait to come back.
author: Jennie C.

description:
Had lunch here on a rainy day.  Got seated away since so few people out.  Great service, good food.  Found butter a bit overwhelming on crab and shrimp but that is just my taste.  
Pineapple mojito is refreshing wish it tasted more of pineapple.  However overall tasty and not too sweet.
I look forward to tasting cran from side vendors to compare.  Ambience may not be the same but I suspect flavors may be on par of not better.
author: Redblisspotatoes ..

description:
I was at Fishermans Wharf and wanted to eat some seafood. Yelped this place thinking it was going to be really good. Got to this restaurant and it was pretty empty so got seated really fast. The crabs were their specialty so I was told I had to get that. The waiter sounded like he was in a hurry. He made his recommendations and left pretty quickly. He recommended I get the crabs and also the mussel and shrimp but I only ended up getting Crabs, Fries and a bowl of the crab chowder. He must've not been pleased at my order because throughout dinner he never came and checked up on our table. He would walk by and talk to the other tables but we were pretty much ignored. 

Crab Chowder - The chowder came amazingly fast after ordering which was a bad sign. It must've just came from a can or something because I just saw some crabs sprinkled on chowder that looked pretty old.

Bread - Came after my soup. How is that possible?? It was hard as a rock.

Crabs - So this is their specialty. It looked amazing and while the crab itself was amazingly fresh.. the sauce was kind of gross. It was drenched in oil and had a weird taste. Definitely not garlic. I enjoyed the texture of the crabs but not the taste. I almost wished we just got steamed crabs. 

Garlic Fries - Probably the best thing that I ate here.

There were a TON of waiters/bus boys just standing around while we were waiting for our food. Kind of awkward. While leaving nobody bothered to even say a Thank you for coming. We caught the manager standing outside who did say it but man... the employees inside didn't give two shits. Our waiter was pretty terrible too. To add insult to injury this place charged a 4% mandatory fee which I totally don't think they deserve.

I don't think this place was worth it. This is one of those places where Yelp really failed me. I would not be going back. The view was good of the golden gate but nothing else was worth it.
author: Jacob H.

description: Worst restaurant I have ever been to!  Server was blunt, all they wanted to do was turn over customers. Ordered crab cakes as an appetizer. Didn't have time to even have a sip of my drink and they were there. Small but tasted okay.  Had not even finished our cakes and dinner was at our table.  Mu Husband had fish and chips. Batter was bland and fish soggy (Basso fish - a cheap bottom feeder)  I ordered the crap melt. Had absolutely no taste. Unless you want to eat very over priced whole crab, stay away from this place! In and out in under a half hour and our bill was over $100.
author: Barb P.

description: We have never actually seen this place but we read reviews. We walked all over the Pier to find it. It's actually upstairs. We got there and we were seated right away. it wasn't too big of a place, pretty cramped but no matter where you sat you have a view of the bay. We didn't know what to order so we just got the Lotsa crab. Which is basically alot of crab legs no shell. They had baked it with Olive oil and basil...so fresh you can smell the ingrediants. It's a different kind of taste but it was actually really good. The service was good, they came every so often to check to see if we were ok.
author: An N.

description: This restaurant is located on 2nd level of pier 39. It offered a cozy environment. Dungeness crab appeared to be popular but we opted for sea bass and crab melt. Both were exceptional. We also tried the strawberry martini which was really good. Pros: Friendly and attentive wait staff. Seafood was fresh. Garlic fries and couscous was ok. Cons: A little overpriced.  Overall, the experience was good.
author: Dona W.

description:
The service, food was amazing!  I'm reminded of two  restaurants in Seattle - Ivars sit down restaurants & Chinooks!  Primarily a fine dining fish house, but with a bit of appeal to tourists & locals alike!
The Caesar with whole baby romaine, croutons & parmesan was easily shareable between 4 people it was great!
Our waitress recommended the Iron Skillet-Roasted Combo Mussels, Shrimp & Crab - I mean come in it was Dungeness crab season!
Perfect choice!
Oh man the two butters were spot on for the mussels & crab!  I definitely could have used more of the garlic butter but I made due!  I practically could have licked the butter dishes!
Pinot Grigio La Boatina (Italy) this wine was amazing!  It was a perfect choice for what we were having, I believe it complimented the crab, shrimp, mussels & even the butter!
author: Diego S.

description: Yuuuummm, the aroma is awesome here!  We were quickly serviced and seated (next the three windows with the pier-side view and ocean breeze...awesome!) We ordered the crab and mussels specials and an order of the steamed clams (sooooo yummy, the "soup" broth was perfect also) as well as the clams chowder (much more crabs in there than clams!) We left full and satisfied,  skip the chowder. ..much better elsewhere.
author: Madelyn N.

description:
Was at Pier 39 with my wife and didn't know where to eat good seafood so pulled out my phone and launched Yelp app.  Crab House at Pier 39 had good ratings so took a chance.  We waited about 10 minutes and was seated next to a window with a perfect sun set view.  Ordered the sizzling crab with mussels, clam chowder, fried calamari and crab cakes.  I forgot to take pictures of the rest of the food because the crab was so good.  So I only got pictures of the sizzling crab with mussels.  
These food isn't cheap but on par with the rest of the tourist trap restaurants.   Will take my best friend and his family who lives in San Fran to this place in two weeks.
author: Steve L.

description: Came here for my dads birthday . Service was bad , food is mediocre. The garlic fries everyone talking about is just basic , not enough garlic . The crab bowl soup when I receive it it was cold . When the server took out order she was raising her voice .
author: Ciara F.

description:
Great location. Solid food. The crabs are very fresh and the garlic sauce is amazing. Shrimps and mussels on the skillet were a hit on our table. The garlic fries and garlic bread: yum too.
If you are at the pier, it's worth trying: a very good experience.
author: Srishti S.

description: Overpriced, small portion size.  The food is flavorful but really overpriced.  $49 for a crab/mussel/shrimp platter, with only three pieces of crab, the shrimps were cocktail sized, and most of the platter was mussels.  You would think $49 would at least buy you one whole crab at most seafood restaurants.  Side bar 4.5% extra charge on all bills.  Nice views of the water.
author: Scott N.

description: If there was an option for zero stars this place would get it! First...we were drawn in for the ambiance and the seafood cravings. When we first arrived, the host seated us right away with a beautiful view of the bay. WAIT FOR IT......10 minutes pass, 12 minutes pass, no one has greeted us or asked if we wanted something to drink. With a hungry family and getting irritated I got up at 15 minutes and went straight to whom seemed like management. Mind you that the restaurant had like 10 servers (more or less) with many open tables. When I told management that we haven't been served yet, a server interrupts us and says to me, "I was on my way, you literally just sat down!" (In a tone as if I'm bothering him). As I follow him back to my table, he asks me "what do you need?" (Again in an irritated voice) I replied, "I need service, water for my family and food!" (Now I'm very irritated that I'm about to drop money at this place for such terrible service). He takes our drink orders, brings it back with cold, hard bread and takes our order. I'm so disturb with our server that I told my husband I wasn't willing to spend at least $150 bucks on a meal with HORRIBLE SERVICE. We decided to get up and leave, as I approached the exit, our server standing at the bar staring me down (I'm positive he knew we were outta there) I approach another person who seemed to be management. I told her to cancel our order that we just placed because we were not staying because of the poor service. She asked why? I told her and left. I don't even know what the food taste like so I can't judge the food. However, anyone planning on dropping a pretty penny should think twice about going to this place. The servers were all huddled and talking and neglecting the customers. There are plenty of great restaurants on Pier 39 that I happily dropped over $150 on per meal with my family. I regret not getting our servers name. Jerk!
author: Victoria M.

description:
I'm officially calling Crab House the fast food of seafood because you order and your food comes out in 5 minutes or less.  

Two friends and I came here last night for a 6:15pm reservation via opentable.com and I was not at all impressed.  As we walked in, the hostess, who was reading a book, noticed us, put her book down and just stared at us.  No greeting, not even a warm hello was said.  We were seated in a 4 person table which was small and extremely close to the wall.  I went to ask the same hostess if we could change to a 6 person table.  She said (not in a nice way either) that we couldn't since we had only 3 people but we could sit at the booth.  I said that would be fine.  She responded with "go ahead" and walked away.

Why come here?  Great view of the bay down to Ghirardelli Square, fresh seafood, clean restaurant
Why NOT come here?  Food comes FAST meaning it's been sitting there, RUDE service, food lacks seasoning

CRAB:
*Too Two Killer Crab ($68.95) - Two whole, good sized Dungeness crabs were served on an iron plate.  Why oh why was our crab served whole because I couldn't help but notice that every other table's crabs seemed to be cut up.  The crabs are suppose to be roasted in their secret garlic sauce.  SURPRISE, there isn't any garlic!  Although the crabs were fresh and sweet, you might as well have been eating plain steamed crab.

OTHER FOOD:
*Garlic Steamed Clams (medium, $14.95) - Ok.  The clams were large and fresh.  The broth seemed like watered down clam juice and lacked garlic, therefore was missing the heavy garlic flavor.
*Garlic Bread w/Cheese (2 pieces, $5.95) - Pass.  The GARLIC bread lacked a sufficient amount of garlic, the mozzarella cheese on top was too overwhelming, and the bread wasn't even hot when it came out
*Garlic Fries (medium, $7.95) - Good!  The fries were thinly cut, extremely crispy, and had TONS of garlic sprinkled on top - just the way I like them.  

SERVICE:
Thank you Thomas M. for providing HORRIBLE service!  You were extremely inattentive, rude and stuck up.  We were checked on once during the meal and we never once received a smile from you.  Our water pitcher was placed on another table.  My friend had asked for water, he filled his glass up, looked at my almost empty cup, and placed the pitcher down and walked away.  Thanks that topped off my horrible night at Crab Hour.  You, Thomas M., need to find another profession because clearly this one does not work for you.  The busboys on the other hand were great and friendly.

PARKING:
Crab House validates for the Pier 39 Parking Garage across the street.  
*One hour free if you exit the lot before 6pm
*Two hours free if you exit the lot after 6pm
*$7 per hour
author: Nicole S.

description:
Waiting half an hour to get seated on Saturday for lunch is totally worth it. We ordered clams cioppino (med) and lotsa crab 3lbs.(2 share).

Clams are fresh, juicy and meaty. The greenish, creamy and garlic flavored sauce is tasty but a bit salty. There are 2 or 3 clams are a little sandy, but it seems inevitable.

The Dungeness crabs are fresh and cooked to perfection. we love the garlic sauce, strong but not overwhelming, a perfect match. When the dish gets cold, it's starting to lose its flavor. So you'd better eat them quickly. We see the same dish on several tables near us and the portion/size varies. We are not sure if all of them are up to 3lbs.
author: Wei H.

description:
We ate there on Sunday 8-30-15 just after noon. I chose the location because of the sizzling hot plate of a whole crab and shrimp I saw and smelled while walking along the pier.

We were quickly seated at a window overlooking the touring boats. The tables were a bit close to one another and does not allow for adequate or comfortable spaciousness if surrounding tables are occupied.

We were promptly greeted by the server who answered our questions about the menu and the steaming platters. We ordered our fountain drinks ($4.25 ea) and appetizers. It took a while for the fountain drinks to arrive. They were not delivered by the server but other helpers. 

We ordered Garlic Bread with Melted Mozarella. The bread arrived but only was four diagonally cut slices. The garlic flavor was hardly noticeable. For a cost of $9 I did not feel the quantity nor quality was sufficient. We also ordered Fried Calimari ($14). It was good but a bit on the rubbery side. We also ordered Garlic Fries ($10). They were flavorful. We also ordered the crab and shrimp platter ($50) and Fettucini Alfredo with Crab meat ($23)

The whole Crab and Shrimp arrived on the sizzling platter. The aroma was awesome. The taste was fantastic. The Alfredo and Crab was equally flavorful and had a decent amount of crab meat.
