All the dishes and drinks were not delivered by the server but by helpers. It took a fairly long time to get water or drink refills which I feel was unreasonable.

All in all I felt the meal was quite good. The cost of the meal was rather pricey. The view and location could explain the reason for the prices. 

I would recommend this establishment with the understanding of the priciness and space limitations.
author: Hakeem S.

description: I visited this restaurant and was very dissatisfied. The tables and plates were greasy. I ordered a shrimp alfredo which had shrimp shells in the pasta. We ordered a chicken Cesar salad, No chicken. Tasted like a mayonnaise dressing.
author: Micheal G.

description:
It is rare you find great food in heavy tourist areas but Crab House really came through with delicious crab and a great view of the Bay. 
The Crab House is on the upper level of Pier 39. My family of 4+1 stopped by for a late lunch on a weekday after exploring the pier. We ordered the Too Two crab to share between three adults it was right at $80.00. The Dungeness crab was so fresh, meaty and delicious, the shell had a beautiful crunch and the portion was the perfect size for the three of us. The service was professional but if there is any one in your party not at the door when your table is ready it will go to the next guest. We saw this happen twice during our 30 min wait.
author: Alex H.

description: Nice. The crab is A little blunt but very very fresh. Use the galic source on the hot plate, dont just let them take the plate away
author: Jason W.

description: Well, first of all. The food is really good. We have the crab and the seafood cioppino. But there is a Chinese waitress, her service was horrible, she have NO smile on her face during the dinner service(no just our table). She looks very surprise when we ordered dessert, maybe is our fault didn't order earlier. Finally, when we almost done with the cake the waitress lady handover the check. And she EDUCATED us how to pay her the tips, she especially mentioned the tips start with 18%. What should I say.
author: Nick J.

description: My family and I have come to the pier on multiple occasions and we finally tried this place. It was very busy, but the food and service was outstanding!! Definitely worth every dollar, it was fresh, lite and fulfilling! My boys loved their chickens and of course my husband and I loved our crab, shrimps and mussels! It's worth it and will be going back to try another dish!
author: Jacquelin H.

description:
Dining for one I was seated at this fireplace in the middle of the room. I kinda stuck out like a lonely sore thumb. The seating wasn't ideal and every server brushed into me as they passed. It was also bar style seating which I hate because my legs dangle. They didn't give me the option of waiting for another table. I didn't want to make a fuss because I was tired. 

My server was not very friendly and extremely hard to understand. He had a thick accent and we had a hard time communicating to each other.

I ordered the Filet with Shrimp, cooked medium and a ginger ale. The ginger ale wasn't very good but the water in San Fran tastes gross so I stuck with it. I cant have a cocktail or caffeine so my options are limited.  The garlic fried that came with the dinner were the best thing about my Surf and Turf dinner. Not soggy and just the right amount of garlic. The shrimp were very good even though they looked different than expected. Nice flavor with lemon and butter. The steak which I ordered medium was over cooked. It was more mostly cooked with a little pink. The texture was good and the seasoning was good too. I did hit them at a pretty busy time so that might explain the steak. The also give you a big piece of bread but I didn't eat it. 

My food came fast and I was in and out, which I like when eating  alone. 

I wasn't disappointed but I also wasn't impressed by this place. I don't regret coming here but I may chose a different seafood place if I ever come back to San Fran.
author: Holly C.

description: Decided to try this place. It was really busy so I figured they would be good. Unfortunately I was wrong. The portion size is small. The 1/2lb of crab was  a la carte for $30. The fish and chips had too much breading because you couldn't taste the fish. The service was good for being that busy but not worth the price.
author: Annette W.

description:
I visited couple weekends ago and below are my official findings:

Food: 3
Service: 5
Ambiance: 3~4

Alright let's dig in.  We ordered the crab chowder, one whole crab, medium cioppino and two drinks.  With 20% tip, total came out to about $140ish.  In my opinion it was overpriced with 4 star quality food, thus the downgraded 3 star grade.  What we've ordered is enough for 3 adults for your reference.

Service:  This place is super crowded and I highly recommend making a reservation well ahead of time.  Despite it's busy environment our service was top notch.  Waiters and bus boys are well coordinated and seamless in their service details.

Ambiance: 3 if you're looking for a romantic encounter.  4 if you're looking for fun and casual setting.  

Overall verdict?  I'm giving it a 4 because I loved the service there but I can't say I'll be back because well, there are so many other overpriced restaurants to try :)
author: Oh N.

description: Good and view were amazing!  Lotsa crab is a must have!  We also enjoyed the garlic shrimp pasta!  Its definitely touristy but well with it!
author: Chariya N.

description:
Where do I begin? I will begin by telling you all that I detest crab, so I had the halibut and it was so delicious and savory. Truly, every single bite melted in my mouth. We came to this fine establishment because my husband wanted to come and eat some of their famous dungeness crab. I sat watching him in amazement as he (completely by himself) ate two whole lbs of crab, dipped in butter. 
The waiter staff was really nice, and to top it off the view was spectacular! Sure, it was touristy, but it was delicious for sure.
author: Ana N.

description: I gave it a 4star because the food you get is great but its a taste you can get anywhere else. Everything else is perfect. The view of the ocean is great. Price is not bad, and staffs are friendly. The food itself is good but not so unique.
author: T K.

description: While my mussels and shrimp were good, I knew once I got my iced tea it was not going to be a restaurant I would go to again. Nestea at a restaurant where two people cost over $100 is a no-no. Cesar salad wasn't good, basic and dressing wasn't home made. Crab chowder was mostly potato. Also refills had to go through the bar so if I wanted more drink they had to order it from the bar and send it in a new cup. Do yourself a favor and walk 10 more minutes down the Embarcadero and go to Cioppinos. On an additional note my boyfriends cioppino was kinda sparse.
author: Nick B.

description: Super accommodating! The maitre'd was so nice. We had a reservation for 3:30 but we didn't know there was a Giants game and so much traffic! We arrived at 4pm hoping to get a 30-45 min wait at least but he told us as soon as the rest of our party showed up we could be seated. I was go grateful because they were crowded like they usually are. And true to his word 15mim later when the rest of our party showed up we were seated! The service was great, food was delicious, prices were a bit high but that's to be expected at a place like this. It can get a bit stuffy in the summer months so cross your fingers you're seated next to a window, and fyi, they do open and the breeze and sea smell is a wonderful addition to your dining experience! I'd go back again but probably not with such a big group. It's definitely worth the experience to with a large group but for a second time I'd use the place for a date night!
author: Raquel C.

description: I gave it 4 stars only because of the view . The food was 3 stars. kinda average. Servise was slow. It's more of a tourist trap. Maybe we'll try another restauant in complex next time.
author: Brent K.

description: Super pricey, meager portions, don't even waste your time. Smallest portions you've ever seen. Crab chowder nothing but potatoes and vegetables.  Crab lasagna looks like a snack, service hurries you out the door, over al......Rip off!
author: Russell C.

description:
This place was aight. I didn't feel comfortable with the Asian couple next to me who kept looking at me for some reason. Never seen a Mexican in a crab house? Lol 

We ordered calamari for appetizers it was good but too many banana peppers. Also ordered the crabs cakes (only had 2) for $17 not worth it.

For the entree I ordered the salmon and the misses ordered the pasta. Both were good but honestly for the price I don't think it was worth it . All together the bill was $90 but I don't think the food was worth $90 , this is definitely for tourist.
author: Rene L.

description:
The "Killer Crab" was amazing! Some of the best crabs I've had. It was cooked just right so the meat came out of the shell easily. The garlic sauce is what really makes the crab delicious. Be prepared to get a bit messy, but don't worry, the flavors left on your fingers will be finger lickin' good! Loved how the crabs are served on a hot iron skillet as well!

The crab chowder was another hot pick off the menu. Didn't taste too heavy and had a lot of great flavors with a good amount of meat in it. Also, we all loved the complimentary bread with the balsamic vinaigrette and oil dip! The server kept those coming.

Although this place is a bit pricey, it was definitely worth the experience. We were right on pier 39 and had a great view of the ocean.
author: Erica C.

description: The food was very good and the portions huge I split a "fish & chip" dinner with a friend and it was plenty. Our waiter was a wonderful young man who not only was very attentive but entertaining as well. The only negative I have to say is that it was VERY warm in the restaurant. Not sure why this was the case but even the host commented on it. We sat in the bar area because we were advised that it would be the coolest place.
author: Anja A.

description: What can I say!!!! A view of the Alcatraz and San Francisco Bay, a sea lion doing yoga, garlic butter Dungeness crab, seafood cioppino and a glass of champagne!! YUMM
author: Valarie W.

description: Everything was so good but the bread was a little hard to bite into. I had a crab melt,  a crab chowder, the mussels, and shrimp cocktail. Shrimp cocktail is the bomb!
author: Denice Arielle M.

description:
Went here for dinner because I thought it was a really famous crab house. 
We made reservations for 5:30pm and we're glad we did because there were a lot of people waiting in line!
Overall, the ambience and scenery is wonderful, especially when you go on a nice day. 
The food however was meh. 
We ordered the double mussel and double crab iron roasted, and it was pricey and not filling at all. The mussel and crab meat were small as well. 
We also ordered the crab cocktail, which was the smallest cocktail salad I've ever seen. Definitely not worth it. 
I think the best part was when we ordered the Crab Omelet, which came in a large pan and was filled with crab meat and tomatoes! I just wished they put some cheese. 
We also ordered 2 glasses of Sauvignon white wine, which was sweet and perfect with the meal. 

It was definitely a good experience, but would only be a one-time-thing.
author: Brenda Jiwon L.

description: Great $102.00 lunch. 2 beers 1 diet soda, 1 cup crab chowder, 1 crab melt, 1 crab louie salad.
author: Kristin K.

description:
I actually LOVE this place. The crab was so amazing here. Every time I came here I felt so in love with the crab. I also like their crab chowder, it was so delicious. 
It's located at Pier 39,  you can call to make a conservation to get a free parking here. The service is the best. The only things that I minus one star is I feel this place is small. Anyway, still the best crab for me so far. I'll be back!
author: Anna N.

description:
I've been to Pier 39 a lot, but I've never been here. I'm always withy kids and am usually here during the mid-point of our vacations, so the funds are low by this time...

Anyway, my cousins treated me and another cousin here. I loved it.  If I come back next year, I want to bring my kids. I'll just have to budget it in though cuz I think the four of us walked away at $120. BUT, we did get garlic bread, crab chowder, a large plate of calamari and 2 whole crabs. 

The crabs made it! It was yummy and huge and I had a hard time trying to eat my half (not a whole) of the crab. The fried calamari too was good. It was crispy and the batter didn't leave the calamari with too thick of a coating. 

The crab chowder I can do without. I would rather have clam chowder.  I love crab.  But I didn't like their crab chowder. The garlic bread was ok.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't something I went 'wow' over. 

I only gave 4 stars because it is pricey. (For me anyway. I definitely couldn't afford to eat here every night). 

We went around 9 PM and the place was busy!!! (Lines out the door). Even for a Wednesday night, so just keep that in mind.
author: Just N.

description:
Best crab I've had! The wait was a bit long though, but totally worth it! I would recommend the crab chowder as well to share.
The view from the restaurant is spectacular! Really excellent recommendation!
author: Gabriela C.

description: I brought my friend who were visiting from Taiwan there for dinner, I was a little skeptical at first because the location, but it turned out to be very very good.  I am a crab lover and I like my crab to be perfectly seasoned instead of just broiled.  The crabs were seasoned just right and the other seafoods were pretty good as well.  I also enjoyed sunset @ the harbor!
author: I-Ching L.

description: The food is good  but to have 5 stars not only the food is important,,,, the service is one of the important things the manager is an "Asshole" and rude u don't have any idea of what means customer service they cancel our reservation and when we get there he told us that we never arrived they change out date.
author: Gata S.

description:
Oh my gosh, this place is awesome!  Totally fun for our kids!  The food was delicious!  A must food experience when visiting San Francisco!   Waitstaff IS wonderful!   You will not be disappointed!   But make reservations way in advance or you will be eating at 9 at night!
Total experience!  A+++++++
author: Michaela T.

description: We ordered the "Too Two" (2 whole dungenous crabs) and a cup of crab chowder.  That's the first time we ever ate roasted crab and we liked it, but think both of us prefer the steamed variety.  Also, we were not big fans of the crab chowder.  It was good, but not great.  We did appreciate getting seated at a table that seemed to be nobody's first choice. The few couple before us were told 20-30 minute wait and we sat right down.  No problem.  Our server was on the ball, too.  Overall, a nice experience, but I think our preference for steamed crab sort of knocked our rating down.
author: Keith K.

description: I'm usually not a hater but this is insane dear readers.. I went in and I was expecting more for $100 dollar meal than what they had to offer.. I ordered double mussel and whole crab and it was okay except there were like 12 mussels and also ordered a "crab cake" for $20 and you get two little cakes that are as big as Zac crackers lol and my family was served by this ginger racist British guy who was being very rude and ignorant.  Also no signs of wet floor after cleaning... One of the diner fell on her face while walking through the tables.. What I ate there wasn't $110 dollar meal.. My stomach was grumbling for more food after all the mess.. Save your hard earned money my friends..
author: Seungsoo L.

description:
First time in SF, craved for crabs and this was the first mouth watering thing that we read on yelp. 

We parked at Pier 40 which was right next to it and it said that without validation we would have to pay $3 for every 20 mins parked in the lot, we were like oh well we are on vacation lets just do it.

For a party of 6 we only had to wait 15 mins. During the 15 min we yelped what we should try. So when we sat down we were already starving so we ordered 3 big bowl of crab chowder and a large order of garlic fries (which were to die for!!!) food came out very quick for what we were expecting.  Each person with a spoon in hand was ready to chow down! since our app came already we might as well order so we ordered: 1 double mussel double crab and 1 double shrimp and double crab. By the time the food came out we already killed our fries, since it was sooo good we had to order another one to eat with our meal. crab was cooked to perfection, i didnt care much for their garlic secret sauce i liked their lemon butter sauce better. Overall experience 2 thumbs up!

Service was also great, our server was Aliak very soft spoken. helped us out by letting us know that they had a family restaurant at the lot that we parked at and they would validate our parking spot just tell them that we ate at crab house which was a bonus for us!!!
author: Thuy N.

description:
If you're considering coming here- MAKE RESERVATIONS!

Came here on a weekday a little before opening.  Luckily the bf had made reservations ahead of time because a large crowd was gathering.

*quick tip* if you want a nice table- MAKE RESERVATIONS.  We wouldn't have received the window table if we hadn't made a special request on our online reservation.

The food here is pretty awesome.  The Crab House is definitely known for their crab which is buttery garlicky goodness.  However, ours came back a little burnt/drier than usual (-1/2 star)  I also recommend the garlic fries- some of the best garlic fries I've had.  Lastly, I ordered a side salad on a whim but was admittedly disappointed at the lack of dressing (-1/2 star).

The service was pretty good but not outstanding.  However, the place was packed so I can't complain too much.

Overall, if you're craving crab, you should come here.  Expect a wait if you're not here early.  And again, I highly recommend reservations but I guess from other reviews, these aren't always guaranteed.
author: Erin H.

description:
Overpriced and excessively touristy. Since I am a local (in other words...I LIVE in San Francisco), I requested a "window" seat and was willing to wait. 
The hostess then seats us RIGHT AT THE WINDOW at the walkway. 
Did she just fall out of the bucket of stupid? 
We had tourists oggling our food (so incredibly invasive and tacky) and one actually had the audacity to ask "that looks good...is it good?"
Uh..yea. Now move along while we enjoy our TWO HUNDRED DOLLAR LUNCH 

The Dungeness crab was dry (which means it was way overcooked) for the $57
The bucket of steamed clams was absolutely delicious...but for $30? We maybe had two handfuls. 
The Caesar salad I have to say was delicious and the fish and chips my family members had was incredibly fresh and tasty. 
What was the worst part? We had to ASK our server for everything. 

1. butter for bread

2. Clam forks 
(duh! The four of us are having CLAMS...give us the proper utensils for pete's sake!!)

3. Tartar sauce for the fish and chips (now seriously? Really? come on!!)

It PAINS me to still tip 20% - a stupid server with zero common sense. 

I will not bother with this place again. 
Always try something at least once... and then....move along...nothing to see here folks.
author: LisaLisa F.

description: Service was awesome! The restaurant is small but they get you in and out! After our tour of Alcatraz i wanted crab so boyfriend suggested Crab House. I gotta be honest the crab isnt all that. I have had better crab but your at Pier 39 in SF theres the bay and ambiance! The house bread can be heated up or toasted. The garlic fries is a must try! The cheese garlic bread was actually tooo cheesy and i love cheese but not worth $8. The crab seasoning is good but like i said ive had better. This is a place to take a date or family for the experience.
author: Thuyvi M.

description:
Yes, this place is touristy but guess what?...I'm a tourist and I like it!  

The décor and atmosphere puts you in the mood to chow-down on some yummy seafood.  We kept seeing huge platters of crab and mussels go sizzling by smelling quit delicious and if we had been more hungry than we were we would have gotten one if not both.  As it was we were hungry but not that hungry and it looks like they give you a lot, so we ended up splitting a caesar salad and cioppino.  Now I don't know if it was my hangover or what but it was the best caesar salad I've ever had!  Fresh and light, hit the spot.  We also split the small mixed seafood cioppino.  It had lobster, crab, mussels and calamari in a flavorful tomato based sauce, perfect to dip your sourdough bread in.  For a small you get a fair amount, enough to split between two and have a little left over.  So for any fellow tourists out there who feel like eating crab or seafood, this is the place!
author: Misty A.

description: If you come here and love mussels, this is a must get at Crab House! This was hands down our favorite dish here. We also got the Lotsa Crabs and it was great too! And the view is great of the Bay and boats. The kids seem to enjoy the window view!
author: D J.

description:
Came in and was seated quickly. We were quickly tended to by our waitress. She was somewhat helpful; somewhat as in she was only able to recommend the steamed clams and mussels and shrimp on their extensive menu which made me question how knowledgeable she was of the dishes where she worked. We ended up getting crab chowder, garlic fries and the two killer crabs. 

The food came out quickly which was good. Garlic fries barely had garlic on them and didn't have any flavor... I would say alot of the fast food joints would offer better fries, which by the way should say alot. The crab came out. Decent amount of meat but unfortunately, the meat was very dry so the flavor was also lacking of their "killer crabs". 
However, crab chowder was excellent! The ingredients went well together. 

I would have to say I only came for the pier 39 experience. I was overall disappointed in the quality of the food. And not to mention, i was shy of the "waterfront" view. My biggest complaint: the stuffiness in the restaurant. I could barely breathe in that atmosphere. Stuffy and hot. Very uncomfortable. 

It wasn't worth $75 for two medium sized crabs that was dried out (the bill was $130). I pay $11.00 per lb when crab is out of season and can make it better. But again, for the "experience".
author: Caroline L.

description: I've been trying to come to this place whenever I come to SF for any reason. This place is a bit pricey, but it is def. worth trying out for dungeness crab. But need to keep in mind this ares is pretty busy with a lot of tourists coming and going, even in the restaurant.
author: Jeongil A.

description: I went to the Crab House for an early dinner while visiting Pier 39 (Fisherman's Wharf). The restaurant was very busy during dinner hours (weekend). There was a 45 minute wait for tables. For starters, I ordered shrimp with lemon butter. The shrimp was tasty. Crab House lemon butter complimented the shrimp very well. It was difficult choosing a main dish. The "Killer Crab" looked amazing but crab pasta won me over. I thought the pasta was cooked well and flavorful. There was plenty of crab in the dish, which was a plus. The pasta portion size was a bit small. I had a pineapple mojito with my meal. The bartender did a wonderful job crafting mojitos. Crab House pineapple mojito is definitely one of the best mojitos I've had at a restaurant.  Our waitress was attentive and down to earth. Crab House has a nice ambience and great views of the bay. I recommend getting a window table if available. Overall, I really enjoyed my meal at the Crab House. I give Crab House at Pier 39 a 4.5 rating.
author: Dominic B.

description:
awesome ! delicious and worth for money. 
we came on Sat. they asked us to wait for 1.5 hour for getting a seat. Actually took us about 20 min wait time to get steated. soda is quite expensive $4 per soda but get refill.
author: Pyone K.

description: The crab platter was so extraordinarily delicious. Everyone around me was smiling, taking photos, and having a wonderful dining experience!!! The seasoning used on the crab, was like no other I've tasted. If you want a unique experience, try The Crab House  :-). I sure wish I lived closer. DELISH...
author: Carolyn L.

description:
Took my sister here for her birthday. Was a little surprised if the bad reviews this place has on their yelp.

My experience had GREAT service! They were very attentive, on top of everything. Food was delicious.

We ordered the grilled prawns, crab platter for 4 people and the garlic noodles. Perfect portions for us. 

Definitely would go back...
author: Ev C.

description: We came here for valentine day. Fresh seafood and everything was delicious! Our Favorite spot for dining fresh seafood. Plus the view!
author: Peter C.

description:
After countless times at the Pier and passing the Crab House, we finally went. Yes obviously located in one of the biggest tourist spots, it can be busy here. The restaurant itself is very nice. Great for all occasions. The majority white theme offset with some black contrast gives it a more classy feel. Don't feel compelled to have to "dress up". Remember a lot of tourist come through here and they of course would just be dressed casual.

So lets get down to business. The food. Check out their website for the actual menu and prices. The prices I feel were fair for the amount you get, quality, and overall dining experience.  We ordered double shrimp and crab. Shared within 2 people it was satisfying. We ordered a side of mix vegetables as well to compliment our main course. AND because there are those who are dying to know.. YES COMPLIMENTARY BREAD IS SERVED. 

The food was great though. It's roasted on an iron skillet I believe. So its a different affair from just a steam pot type of crab place.. ala Joe's Crab Shack. My suggestion is for $10 more get the double crab. 

Overall as previously mentioned great for all occasions and a great dining experience if you are looking for crab.  I actually do look forward to eating here again.
author: Eugene N.

description:
Unimpressed.  Very expensive (it was like 7 or 8 dollars for a beer!).  Table very very uncomfortable, leg cramps, chairs were jammed against a wall so cant slide back at all, barely fit in (I'm 6'3").  Bathrooms have lines - at a place were paying rediculous price you'd think they'd have a decent restroom, but only have a single occupancy room (one men, one women, one handicap).  Food was fine, not a crab fan so had shrimp alfredo which was good, but no better than a jar of alfredo sauce on boiled store-bought pasta and frozen shrimp.  Rest of my party thought crab was good, and our mussels were good too.  Service was rushed, they took partial food order before we'd even been asked for our drink order and half of us werent ready to order main yet.

Would not reccommend or ever come back, but still ok.
author: Craig L.

description: Chowder was great, service was fair, but the cleanliness of the cups and plates was a huge issue for me. Twice I had to send drinks back because of the cups beings gross. The view, incredibly stunning. They didn't run anyone out of the restaurant after it closed which made me very happy, you can tell they're into customer service. Maybe next time we're in CA we'll give this spot another try.
author: Brittany C.

description:
Date: Around March.


This is probably the only restaurant I'll eat at when I attend Pier 39. At Pier 39, all I could think of is the seafoods. Not a great place for groups, so we end up have two tables of 4. The wait time was about 5 min for us but we got lucky (no reservation). Reservation is necessary, better to be safe than sorry. 

Overall, I would recommend this place, amazing view, nice atmosphere. The shrimps, crabs and the calamari were great, fresh, and well cooked.
author: Vincent C.

description:
Food okay - but not worth the price. Long wait, but not worth the wait. Good waitress, but can't split the check.

Just stop by the bar and get a pineapple mohito. Do not let the reviews fool you if they are higher than 3 stars.
author: Rahsun M.

description:
Totally overpriced!
We started with an appetizer, not many choices , so we went for garlic bread , 4 small slices! 
Then my son ordered the Crab Angel hair Lasagne, He said it was delicious, however, it was a very small portion and it included 1 hard cold roll with no butter.
I ordered the fish sandwich, which was not the greatest. It just fell apart in my hands. They only have 2 choices for sides, garlic fries or mixed veg. My first AND Last time there. If you go hungry, you will leave hungry.
author: Sue M.

description: My boyfriend and I came to San Francisco for our anniversary. Since we're not really familiar with the area, finding a place to eat for our anniversary was a little tricky. We decided we wanted seafood and decided to try out this restaurant. We made reservations and got seated right away when we got there. They sat us down at a table with a view and got to see all the boats and such. It was really cool! We ordered calamari (too hungry to take a picture haha) and it was delicious!! It was cooked to perfection and it was really tasty. For our entree we ordered combo mussels, shrimp and crab with a side of fries. The seafood was so yummy and the fries were super crispy! And not to mention, the service was awesome as well. We left full and happy! We had such a good experience! I'll definitely be going back when I'm in town again!
author: Ruby F.

description:
I have sent the the best lawyer from Sacramento to San Francisco to file a lawsuit against them. I will keep updating this legal process: 
1/15/2016: I seriously inform the relevant personnels that I will not revoke the lawsuit unless you refund all my money back and solemnly apologize in a written form. If you refuse these conditions then I expect  you will send your representative, lawyers, and witnesses to the SF civic center courthouse.
author: Zidu Z.

description:
I went here based on reviews. It was super close to my hotel so that was great. Definitely a touristy spot but a very fun environment. The staff was super friendly and we were seated immediately. I'm beginning to wonder how dependable Open Table is because the only availability it gave me was 9pm.

The food! My boyfriend and I shared a whole king crab and garlic fries and it hit the spot. Would totally recommend if you're looking for something touristy with a nice water view.
author: Tiffany M.

description: Visited here on my first trip to San Francisco.  The setting is fun but I was underwhelmed by the food and service.  My husband and I ordered the two pound crab to share along with their seasoned fries.  We also both ordered drinks.  The bill with tip came to just under $100!  Enjoyable but not something I would recommend nor rush back to do.
author: Courtney R.

description: Launched yelp to see if there was some place to eat crabs. The pictures of the House look great, so we had a try. We got a table near the window and the sightseeing was significant. We ordered a whole crab, shrimp and mussels, some soup. The bread is free. We came around 5:15PM, so we didn't wait for a long time. The service is not that bad, anyway, I will recommend this crab house and may try it again.
author: Junwen B.

description:
I am so glad that we chose this restaurant for lunch.  We were there right when they opened, so we got a table next to the window and my son was well entertained watching the boats.

The service was hit or miss - our server was slow to attend to us and seemed to check on us minimally. However, the bus boys were quick to clear the tables and get us what we needed.

The food was really great.  We started with a bowl of the Crab Clam Chowder, and my husband, son and I slurped up each last bit of it. The bread they serve to the table was great for dipping into the soup.  My Mixed Seafood Cioppino was fully loaded with tons of seafood.  Although I personally loved it, note that the tomato broth is very tomato-ey, if that makes sense.  I loved the spices in it too.  My husband had the Killer Crab, and that was the tastiest American-style crab in the shell that I've ever had.  I actually only had two small bites b/c my son couldn't get it fast enough from my husband!  My son's Mac N Cheese off the Children's Choices section was really tasty, although he forgot about it once Daddy gave him some crab.  The only thing I found disappointing was the coffee - $3.45 for a very average cup of Joe.

We can't wait to dine here again.
author: Tracy L.

description:
The food here was good. But the place was a little tooooo crowded. The chairs were literally pushed up against each other so it was hard to get out of your chair without hitting the persons chair in another party behind you. Service was a little slow but that may be because there was only one waitress for our section.

The food was pretty good, I was pleased with most of the dishes. We ordered the "Lotsa crab" which was good for 2 grown men to share and I liked the lemon-butter that came with the crab legs. The crab chowder was just ok, i think they put too much substance in it. The garlic fries were pretty delicious =) The chicken and chips was just your regular chicken strips and fries, nothing special. The crab cakes appetizer was a big whatevs. I've had better. The Butcher's Burger was just your average burger.

I saw some table order the mussels platter which came out sizzling. Next time i'm definitely ordering that.

Location was really nice. You could look out at the ocean while you're eating which is really nice.
author: Nicole D.

description:
The Crab House at Pier 39 is a bustling LOUD diner feeling restaurant. It has an amazing view of the Wharf area and Golden Gate Bridge. The staff are genuine, nice and knowledgeable about their menu. If I could I'd give the staff 4 stars (sorry I reserve 5 stars for fine dining). 

I think the food for the crab that is sizzling on the platters are fair priced. And that's the big draw here. However, I ordered the Garlic Noodles $10 with the additional $9.50 for Crab. $19.50 for an entree on Pier 39 seems fair. But the end product just really missed my expectation. What I had envisioned was a entree of thick, puffy, Savory PANCIT type noodles with the aroma of garlic that's been roasted at a high heat with good olive oil slathered on liberally. And visible pieces of crab in the entree on a Normal size pasta dish. 
That isn't what I received. I was served what would look like a pasta dish, 1/2 Cup serving (that was okay) which appeared skimpy for an entree dish with so little crab. They say it's 2-3 ounces. But it's flaked and really not seen. 

Anyway, nice LOUD place with decent priced food for the wharf.
author: Rebekah B.

description:
Bad Service, decent food.. 

after spending a day over by highway 1, we came to pier 39 for dinner.. The view was truly amazing, you have the golden gate bridge in the background.. it was really nice.. especially when the sun set. 

However though, the food wasn't all that jazz. we had the calamari, pasta and shrimp. the calamari was good but the pasta was really bland.. all I can taste was just the cream.. there was no hint of garlic or cheese. The service wasn't all that great either.. out of the 90 minutes we were there, he came by for when we order and check.. it was really disappointing.
author: Alfred H.

description: Best chowder ever!!! I literally want to bottle it up in little bottles and drink it instead of those horrible protein shakes i drink for breakfast but anyway! Everything was delish, and the service was really great.  Our waiter was the guy who looks like Bobby Flay and he got a kick out of it when I told him, ha!  Some really good mojitos too and that's a lot to say from me (I'm a Miamian) one thing though, space is tight in there so be prepared to feel a little bit claustrophobic.
author: Daiana R.

description: This place is a MUST TO GO TO when you go to San Francisco, the food is AMAZING & the view is unbelievable, came here for my birthday on Friday & got crab and shrimp, I'm not a big fan of crab but here I Loved it, it was so good marinated and tasty. The shrimp was delicious as well, service was great our waiter was so attentive to all our needs. I can't wait to go back.
author: Yuly G.

description:
Ambiance: kind of cheesy decor in my opinion. But this isn't a main area of concern for me. The reason I come here is the crab.

Location: 1/4 of the way into Pier 39, top floor, left side, and on the back side where 1 side of the restaurant is facing the water. It's opposite a gift ship... and up the stairs from a Dryer's ice cream shop (I always remember this because you can't help but get mesmerized by the waffle cone scent wafting into your nose as you walk past). 

Cost: expensive; but it's seafood, and the crab is worth it-- for a treat to yourself every few months or so.

Service: good, attentive.

Food: I always come here with a group of 5 or more. We order 1 or 2 of the crab "feasts," and the garlic fries (actually garlic-y, very tasty, and not very oily). They also give you mini bread loaves that are good with some oil and vinegar. The crab is just good, plain and simple. They come out fast (I'm sure they're already steamed and just tossed in the sauce when you order it), coated in a garlic butter sauce, which some crispy ends to the legs that are just mmmm, makes you happy.

Bottom line: I'll be back here another time, I'm sure of it.
author: Caroline H.

description: The bar tender makes a killer Bloody Mary yum. Great food great attitude and great bread.
author: Naghmeh T.

description: We went here during lunch time and we had a great time.  Since I made a reservation ahead of time so when we got to the restaurant we already have a table reserved for us.   We ordered the mussels and whole crab and it was good.  As for appetizer we ordered the crab cocktail and it was ok.  The services are friendly and fast.  This place is kinda pricey, but it worth every penny.
author: Food-Travel-Adventure A.

description:
This place is expensive, but it is in a very touristy area so it's expected. I had never been to SF before and we were hungry after scouting for apartments all day so we went here. I got a crab caesar salad and it was very nice! I didn't care for the scallions on top, but other than that it was beautiful and delicious. Each individual leaf was laid on the plate rather than being torn up which was pleasant to the eye. The crab was amazing and it was pretty abundant compared to places. The soda was extremely expensive, so we passed and got water. My boyfriend and his mother don't like seafood but they wanted me to have seafood while I was there (because I LOVE seafood) so they got a chicken burger and a regular burger with garlic fries and loved them as well. 
The view was beautiful and the staff was very nice. I would highly recommend this place. I think next time I'll try the cioppino or get the whole crab with someone who will split it with me!
author: Samantha O.

description: I don't normally write these but this place was awful way over priced my waiter was in such a hurry I couldn't understand anything he was saying my salad was bitter and gross my fish was over done and my boyfriends food has decent flavor but his pasta was underdone and the only reason I'm giving it 2 stars is for the beer and bread I won't be back
author: Michelle D.

description: Maybe I shouldn't give the whole place this bad review, but I'm so appalled by the service I received - the waitress her name is Lei or Lai she was terrible picked up the check didn't say thank you or even look at us to say thank you.  It was the  worst ever I didn't pay $220.00 for someone to come by once and I hate it that they give cold bread.
author: Lesley C.

description: Best crab you will ever have! Seafood is served steaming hot and will not disappoint. Plus you can watch the sea lions right outside the restaurant.
author: Ekaterina R.

description:
My boyfriend and I had the misfortune of eating here.  The food was ok, the drinks were overpriced, and low quality.
The worst part of all was our service, the most we heard from our waiter was, "I'll be right with you" only he took about 20 minutes to come back each time.
The waiter also spilled cocktail sauce all over me, getting it in my bag, and on my jacket.  We were offered no comps, and only received a hasty apology and yet another, "I'll be right with you" when i asked for a towel to clean myself and my things.
author: Mackenzie E.

description:
MAKE RESERVATION.

I went on Saturday for lunch, and boy... it was so packed! We had to wait 5-10mins even though we made a reservation, but it's cool - because there were an army out the door waiting way longer.

I didn't experience that "exceptionally excellent" service everyone talks about (maybe because it was super busy?). But it wasn't definitely bad. Food came out quick and was yummy. Pricy, but I looked at the menu in one of the photo here uploaded on Yelp, so I knew what i was getting myself into.

I will need 2 things to come back to this place 1. Special occasion 2. RESERVATION!
author: Nathan C.

description: Came here on a busy saturday night without reservation for a party of 2 and thought we would had to wait long but only waited a few minutes.  We got a bowl of crab chowder, garlic noodles, and a whole crab!  Crab chowder was good but had better, the garlic noodles and crab was yummy though!
author: Len L.

description: I am a local who only finds herself at the Wharf when family/friends are in the City from out of town. I found myself at the Crab House with two friends of out of town and ended up having a great time. The food was okay and overpriced (it is the Wharf so I wasn't expected anything else) but our waiter, Tony, was the reason I wrote this review. He gave us excellent service and was very kind & hilarious. 5 stars to the Crab House, they are lucky to have such an awesome server!
author: Maddie F.

description:
I live in the east bay and have been to Crab House several times. The view is beautiful and I would definitely recommend coming during sundown. I have been both on a weekday and weekend. Weekends of course are much more crowded and the wait time is long but their seafood is worth the wait! I always go for the iron skillet -crab & shrimp. Divine. My mouth is watering just writing this review! 
The staff has always been very friendly and service has been great. 
I prefer coming on a weekday because it is less crowded and a less of a wait time. 
If I arrive after sundown, I prefer to sit in their booths. They only have a couple. Staff is always very polite when I ask how long the wait would be for a booth (even if it's only a party of 2-3 with me). I'm not sure if he is the floor manger but the man(who seemed to have authority) has been there a couple times and always allowed us to get the booth or window seat if it's sundown. I never mind waiting but I understand that they need to seat bigger parties in certain areas. Overall the service and food are 5 stars!
author: A. M.

description: Good for tourists.  Garlic roasted crab and mac and cheese were standouts.  The fish and chips tasted frozen.
author: Surai J.

description:
The food here was good.  I don't really think you can ruin crab to much.   Also had some of the steak it was well prepared.

The pier view was very nice and provided a perfect sunset with dinner.

It's very noisy here and a little crowded.  Seats are close to one another so you'll make friends quick.

Service was good
author: Ryan V.

description: Went to another restaurant down from Crab house. sat down and left right away.  walked into Crab house and knew this was the place. Great service and food was fantastic.  had crab chowder and garlic fries for starters. had the crab enchiladas,  crab linguine,  crab lasagna and crab noodles with butter and garlic. Will definitely eat here again.
author: Doug D.

description:
We came here about 9PM at night on a Saturday. I just wanted something warm so I  thought we could try the crab chowder. A table for 2 took about 40 mins. That's ok, cause we just walked around Pier 39 and came back later. We were seated and a very rude waiter took our order right away, i felt like he was rushing us.  We ordered the crab chowder and the steamed clams. 

As SOON as the waiter walked away with our order, literally 5 seconds later, our crab chowder came. HMM. I said to the waiter, "Well that was quite fast...." pretty much implying "was this sitting out the whole time, like someone else had ordered but didn't want it anymore?" He didn't get the clue/hint and just walked away. Ok, i tried the first bite of the crab chowder. LOL, tasted exactly as what my thoughts were. COLD. No flavor whatsoever! The bread he brought out with it? COLD. Disgusting. We didn't even eat anymore of that.

The clams came and luckily they were a little better than the chowder. Not much better though, a little on the plain side. But I wouldn't have paid $16.95 for it a second time.

The only good thing about this restaurant? Was the view from the window. Only cool if you were the one sitting at the window. 

I wouldn't come back here for their horrible service and not so great tasting chowder!
author: Molly M.

description:
First of all--where's the crab?   I have eaten at the Crab House twice, usually when my kids want to be touristy and visit Pier 39.  
My crab enchiladas had a very tiny amount of crab in them, mostly vegetables and too much gooey cheese.  My husband had a crab sandwich which he said contained very little crab. So, we were disappointed in our dinners.
 My son had the salmon which was very expensive and he received a very small piece of fish, with vegetables. The mojita I had was watery with very little rum, and zero taste.  Service was rushed from a rather bored waitress who obviously did not like asking children ( 12 and 13) what they would like to order for dinner.
Sorry Crab House, we are not coming back--there are other over-priced tourist traps to explore.
author: Linda Jean H.

description:
I normally do not like seafood, but their crab is absolutely delicious!!!! 

This place is on the pricier side but all worth it! The crab comes out on a sizzling grill with the garlic butter deliciousness smothered all over!!! The herbs and spices they put in the sauce makes it so good. I've never had a better sauce on seafood.

We got crab at the fishermans grotto that is cheaper in price and that was just boiled which is good- but I'm telling you, crab house at pier 39 is on a whole different level.
author: Paulina N.

description:
Best dungeness crab in town!  DO NOT FORGET TO ORDER the crab cakes appetizer!!! (Featured on diners,drive-ins,dives) --- they so good it will make u want to slap yo mamma!

The dungeness crab is 2 lbs and perfect to split with a date if u want to bib it up and get messy.  The garlic-butter makes the crab pop POP! Its crowded and can get noisy with all the booths full, but white noise for feasting is fine with me.

Havent tried anything else as why the hell would you want to?! Hello? Crab-shack! Wish they had micro-brew beers on tap, but the beer selection is fine with this stellar crab meat.

Its the pier, so its touristy and the price is reflected--but well worth the wait if it there is one.  Definitely check it out, i still dream of the crab cakes...
author: Jamie B.

description:
Been here twice. The price is a little bit pricy, but its seafood so I guess the price is about right. Its really cool to sit right next to the windows in this summer time.
Ordered crab feast and shrimps. Crab chowder was alright. The dipping sauce for shrimps are very delicious. Crabs got a lot of meats, but u have to dip it in the shrimp sauce otherwise it doesnt have much flavor.
Nice spot on the Pier. Will come back sometimes.
author: Bao N.

description: We arrived and were told that there was only a ten minute wait, but I'm sure we waited longer than that. Once our names were called we had to wait a bit more. We ordered the crab legs and a side of veggies. Everything was ok, but didn't blow my mind. The waiter brought us water after he brought us the food and forgot to bring any bread. Atmosphere was loud, crowded, and hot, and we had to share a table with people we didn't know. Food was overpriced, too. It's a fun experience because the restaurant overlooks the water, but for the price and service I don't think I would go back.
author: Liz C.

description:
this review is a bit behind since hubs and I came here for late lunch a week before Christmas.
The place wasn't as crowded as I thought.  
I had their mojitos which were pretty bland while hubs got his usual jack n coke.
He also ordered filet mignon which he claimed one of the best steaks he had for awhile ( i honestly thought the portion was small) while I had the garlic crab.  I was really surprised to realize that the garlic crab portion was too small and there were no sides that went with it.  I was really craving for crab and was honestly disappointed.

Nevertheless, I'm giving 4 stars the service, the ambiance and location.
Very touristy, quite expensive but diner-ish feel.
author: Learnee L.

description: We got the crab and double mussel skillet and it was really good. Got a window seat overlooking the pier and it was really nice. Only downfall is that it is kind of expensive but it's seafood so it is expected. Hope to come back here one day if we ever come back to visit!
author: Cathy V.

description: I found this place by the recommendation of my friend. It was not quite by full of SF style in terms of the way people talk here and how waitress guide tourist to order menu. We tried losta crabs, shrimp/mussel and seafood soup which were awesome combinations. I would definitely love to come again.
author: Peijun S.

description:
Absolutely amazing crab recipe. 

Made dinner reservations for a quick seating and all the staff members were very friendly.   

We ordered the "Too Two crab" and it was the best cooked crab I've ever had. It was prepped in a seasoned butter so you didn't even need a side bowl of dipping butter. Is it the healthiest choice, no. But that's ok in order to experience the great flavors. 

Also ordered the Fish and Chips which were also great. Not too many things you can change but it did come with garlic fries which was a great touch. Large portion of fish. 

Crab chowder was good. My mistake for expecting a traditional clam chowder but replaced with crab. No, it had a healthy serving of carrots, corn and other complimenting flavors with the chowder base and crab. 

Overall: The crab was a show stopper. A must try for tourists and locals. Downside, expensive... which most seafood is. I could see how the price may deter some from trying it and worrying it might not fill them up though.
author: Justin A.

description: Happy to get a seat very quickly. For the amount of food received, very pricy. Waiter had too many tables. Never received a refill on my drink. Food was delicious.
author: Audrey F.

description: Second time at the crab house.... Good crab, price however, it keeps going up . But if you really love crab, get the Killer crab for 5... About $100+, but well worth it.
author: Mario B.

description: My family and I was at Crab House on Sunday, September 3, Labor Day weekend.  Pier 39 and San Francisco was hugely crowded and traffic was a mess.  Good thing that I had a reservation as there were 45 to 60 minutes wait for a table.  We go here once a year on Labor Day weekend, but this past Sunday was the worst.  Food was excellent, but the service was the worst EVER!  It took the waiter forever to take our orders   We ordered lotsa crabs, seafood Cioppino, and garlic fries.  They were excellent and arrive to our table very fast.  My daughter has a Sprite and it takes the waiter forever to refill the drink.  Bread and butter was not even delivered to our table.  I have to ask twice for the bread.  Granted, the food is very expensive, and an extra charge for doing business in EXPENSIVE San Francisco, and I don't mind paying the high restaurant tab, but the service could be way much better.  I know the restaurant was super busy, but the busboy was much faster in clearing the tables than the waiter in serving us!  I know The Crab House is a tourist attraction, but for my money, I would not be back here on a major holiday weekend in the future and I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS RESTAURANT TO ANY TOURISTS ON A MAJOR HOLIDAY WEEKENDS!!
author: Tom N.

description:
crab chowder was full of vegetable, really peppery.

fish and chips looks good. huge portion. flaky fish, good batter.

crab and shrimp louie was good. fresh. clean. also Tue shrimps aren't mini shrimps. that's always good.

double mussel and double crab was just ok. portion is small. mussels are good. crab is overcooked. Flavor is uneven.

overall, servers were attentive. really small joint, not for big parties.
author: Kris J.

description: The lemon butter dipping sauce is to die for! Second time coming here, this time for my birthday. Service was awesome, friendly and very attentive, which really makes all the difference for me. Luckily we came right before the lunch rush, so we were seated immediately by the window overlooking the pier. Food came out fast and was flavored so well. We ordered 2 Dungeness crabs and shrimp. Usually we order appetizers, but skipped today because I knew I wanted dessert. The sad part was the free bread we got, that's why I had to give only 4 stars instead of 5. The bread was cold and hard to cut with a knife! We had to rip the bread apart and that was difficult to do. I ordered a tiramisu dessert and my hubby asked for a candle, the waitress was so nice and comp'd it for my bday :) they also validate parking tickets. I will definitely be back when I'm in town and have recommended it to my family in the Bay.
author: CJ M.

description: Perfect place to eat crab & shrimp in San Fran. The food was delicious, the staff was friendly & helpful, the location is right on Pier 39 and the view from our table was breath taking. A must stop for lunch or dinner in San Fran.
author: Lauren I.

description: Came for a late lunch. The mixed seafood cioppino was excellent. The crab cake appetizer was just okay and the shrimp cocktail was a fail. Good service and nice views. Don't think I would come here again but decent lunch.
author: Lana M.

description:
PHENOMENAL.  SIMPLY PHENOMENAL.  

When my dad started raving about Crab House to me, I really thought it would be any old seafood place.  Maybe even like Bubba Gump-just a bunch of fried or grilled seafood, fries, variety of soups, etc.  Same old, same old.

First of all, when you walk in the door, it's CROWDED.  There's people standing in a line to the bathroom, there's people standing in line to make a reservation, there's people standing in line to pass through to get to their table...  I was a little skeptical because there was just so many people, could it really be that good?

After waiting for about 30 minutes (a decent wait), we finally got seated.  We ordered the clam soup, main king crab but separated (I highly recommend the separated instead of whole as it's a LOT easier to eat), and garlic fries.  The clam soup was amazing, really light and almost-buttery like.  I could have eaten this all day-the spices were right on!  The crab then came, and **!!!  I never tasted a finer thing.  It's full of so much flavor, and you can tell they don't boil that thing-they bake it with the sauce!  Every bite was full of such goodness, and the garlic fries were a perfect side dish as well!  Definitely worth it!!  

Service here was also extremely friendly as all staff are really happy and recommend great things!  The lady we had was great as she was the one who suggested all our dishes and was so patient with us because we were so indecisive.

This was one of the best restaurants I went to so far ever in SF, and you must come here at least once when you visit Pier 39!  Don't let the original Boudin catch your eye...boudin's are everywhere!  Crab House in a one of its kind, and you simply must try!
author: Kim H.

description: I had a wonderful meal there one month ago, and I have already missed the taste. I am planning to visit next weekend with my family members.
author: Lynn W.

description:
I was expecting a lot more of this place since it was right off the waters and it looked nice outside. Their logo made it seem like they were famous for something. But I'm not sure what that is.

Our server seemed like he could care less in the world. He had one of those really fake smiles that made you feel uncomfortable and ashamed of being there. He didn't make small talk at all. I felt very much to leave once we encountered this waiter. 

The majority of the diners were Asian. He had all Asian diner tables and he did not seem please at all to serve them. All he did was take our orders, come by once to see if things were ok, and then gave our bill. 

The food runners were much friendlier and informative and made small talk. 

We ordered the 1/2 crab, shrimp, and mussel griddle appetizer. It was salty and the mussel shrank so much, it was barely there. The crab was salty too. Disappointed for the price at this point.

We also ordered their garlic noodles, which were also very salty. The flavor was decent, but it was so heavy, oily and salty. I ended up eating more bread than what we ordered. 

The only good thing about Crab House was their Bloody Mary and view of the bay.
author: J J.

description: At a "crab house" you should order the crab, so that is what I did -- 1/2 order of roasted  dungeoness crab. The crab was very fresh and appetizing, cooked in a garlic butter sauce. I also ordered a lemon dessert, which was quite good balance of sweet and sour, and a nice light finish to the meal. The serving staff was attentive, so my experience was positive.
author: Tina B.

description:
A very long overdue review.

My family and I were at Pier 39 and decided to celebrate my mother's bday at the Crab House.  We enjoyed every minute of it. If you enjoy great seafood and don't mind getting your hands dirty, this is the place to go. 
When you walk in there is a rack on the right handside with a variety selection of hot sauce (and I love me some hot stuff).  My sister chose her demon and I chose mine. 

We decided on the following:  
Appetizer to share: Garlic prawns and mussels.  They were definitely delectable. 
Entree: 3lb crab to share. Now, mind you, I'm allergic to crab but will definitely go back with my allergy pills with me.
Other entrees ordered were Chicken Fettuccine and the filet mignon for the non-seafood eaters.
author: Nerissa D.

description:
If you're in SF you have to have at least 1 seafood meal. I LOVE this place and I'm dying to go back! It can get crowded, so you may have to wait; don't worry, it's not tiny either, there's quite a few tables. Definitely go for a table near the windows if you can; you get a nice view of the bay with Alcatraz in the background.

+Crab chowder: I've never had a crab chowder before, this was so good! Crab meat with a thin soup

+Garlic fries: shoestring fries; delicious! Can't get enough of delicious fries!

+Clams (might be the Clams Cioppino on the menu...my boyfriend ordered it as "can we get the garlic clams?" haha) - OMG the buttery garlic sauce is AMAZING! Too bad clams are so tiny...I could fill up on just these. We took the bread they gave us before our meal to mop up some of the garlic butter; it's that good!

+1/2 crab -- yummmm! I liked the sauce on this crab as well; very well seasoned. You can also take the crab and dip it in the clam's butter garlic sauce. 

When you're done, you can walk it off along the pier! You might not want to hop on a boat too soon after eating haha.
author: Katherine S.

description: Second time coming to this restaurant and it never disappoints! We ordered 2 Dungeness crabs and skillet mussels/shrimp platter. It was sooo delicious! Its a fun experience, too! Highly recommended :-)
author: Vanessa D.

description: Seemed promising. Views from table was nice. Service is good. Food not worth the price tag. We order the 2 for 2 (2 crab) and the crab was definitely precooked. Disregarding the crab is supposed to be roasted and came out within 5 minutes, but the crabmeat not juicy and you can tell it'd been previously cooked. Their sauce was decent but nothing to die for. For $90+ I say go elsewhere.
author: Sun T.

description:
Was visiting San Francisco from Vancouver.  Wanted to give a local crab joint a try, and found this place through Yelp.

Walking up to Crab House was an experience in itself.  Pier 39 is buzzing with lots of activity and small shops.  In the restaurant, we got a table with a nice view of the harbor.  The atmosphere of the restaurant was a bit different from what I was expecting though.  It was a bit dirty and dive-y.

Service was excellent though.  Ordered a Crab Feast, shrimps and steamed clam.  The shrimp was okay.. a bit overdone for my liking.  The steamed clams were excellent.  They were in a white wine sauce.  The crab was spectacular as well.  Their signature seasoning was very flavorful, and the cook on the crab was great.
author: G L.

description:
Decent dinner.  For the price, I wish the service would have been better. Nothing big and our waitress did an ok job (no personality), just lots of little things; no tools at the table, messy floor under the table when seated, almost empty water pitcher when seated, and so on.  I would suggest, though, that they stop serving the Mohitos.  Everyone thinks they know how to make them, yet rarely are they successful.  Crab House is no exception... Lime and soda water is not a good drink for $10.

Overall, No different than any run-of-the-mill seafood place like Joe's Crab Shack. 

To Crab House management... People go where they're invited.  They go back where they feel appreciated.  Build your business on customer service.  After all, it's an "Experience Economy."
author: David M.

description: I have gone to this place several time when I first year came to U.S. First time it taste good,and second time and after it just has a good view. That the most of people come to here are tourists. If you get there, I recommend mussels, shrimp and the soup with bread.
author: Li S.

description:
I had Salmon. Dry overcooked small portion.  $28. Zero stars.

My friend had fish n chips. Average flavor. $19? was rediculous. 

Calamari was very good. 

Service was only ok for a high end meal.

maybe the crabs are great,   but avoid this for anything else.
author: tim w.

description:
I went here with my family and experienced the worst service here. This guy server was extremely rude and Ive never yeping before but seriously that rude service made me to do this.

We seated there and waited about 5 mins to order after recieving the water glasses, so we lightly waved hands to call him and guess what the server says. "Oh my god why you guys are so hurry?" With frowned face. When the foods came out, he was saying "here you go, you hungry people." WHAT?... I was speechless. I thought he was just joking around until now. I remember when I came here about 2yeas ago, server tells us to take a photo of killer crab and took crab shells away and cut the legs right there, but he just went away after serving and when he came back, we asked him to cut and he was rolling his eyes, giving us pretentious smiles and saying "I will, sir, I am" lol... And he even cut the crab legs with the knife that was on the table which my bf was using... And didnt even bring the new one back.
The foods were soso. It cant be good with that kinds of service.

After the meal, I accidently dropped the phone and since they have very very narrow gap between sofa and the wall, we had to lift up the sofa to take my phone out. My dad was even bending his waist trying to help him but the server shook head head, staring and pointing at my dad and saying "Are you gonna do it or do you want me to do it?" His voice this time was pretty loud so we had attention from all other tables. And guess what he said at last after taking my phone out, "I will give you an advice, put your phone in your purse all the time"
OK. I WILL !!!!
I was totally upset there and didnt even say thanks to him.

I dont know why I tipped him that much.
He derserves zero tip.
author: Rina L.

description:
Simply amazing. First off, the service was great. My little "Angel" 2yr old decided to Chanel "Chucky" this particular evening and was a complete terror. We were super embarrassed, but the manager and server played it like a champ. They were so nice about it and we're very helpful since we also had a 4mo old with us too.

Normally wouldn't go to a place like this w two little ones, but my cravings could not be stopped. What can I say, we are from Denver and opportunities for fresh seafood are few and far between!

Calamari is best I have ever had, and I have had a lot! Very tender. 

Killer crab was also amazing. My wife and I had the smaller of the "feeds two" options and it was enough, but she isn't a crab fan like me. If she was, I would get the larger one for sure. 

The sauce it is cooked in is really good. 

We also added shrimp and that was a good choice as well. 

Wouldn't change a thing (except going without little ones if you want to enter a meditative state while indulging is this gastronomic heaven of seafood at its finest.)
author: Andrew B.

description: Amazing, amazing, amazing!!! Food was great and service was as well! We were in and out, fast! Only thing is that it is a little cramped in there.
author: Jo A.

description:
I have no idea what everyone is raving about.

Overpriced and snobby staff.

Food was OK
author: Gina G.

description:
I made reservations via Yelp / Open Table. This place called the day of to confirm and I was happy w/ the service because by confirming via telephone, I was able to tell them the "third" party is a baby; they told me the stroller would be in the lobby which I am perfectly fine w/. 

We were seated right away. Dinner was at 6 and I was surprised the restaurant isn't packed. Tables are set closely together so maneuvering the car seat was definitely a challenge. 

It was my treat yesterday since I knew that this place is his favorite but instead of ordering his favorite (crab legs), he ordered the calamari from the appetizer menu! Not sure if he meant to eat "light" because those damn calamari were deep fried, yo. I ordered crab cakes and the crab enchilada. I was torn between that and the crab omelet but was immediately sold after the server recommended it. 

I did not notice the pitcher of water... my babe poured me the first glass and refilled it shortly after I downed it. Awww, right? I know the task is nothing but it was the thought and the attentiveness that counts! 

The crab cakes came out first and then our bread. The bread I did not care for because it was a tad hard/rough.. maybe it was left out longer than it should? Either ways, I only had a piece. The crab cakes were good but nothing to write home about; very crispy so that it did not have that flaky texture but full of crab, I must say. The medium order of calamari was huge. I can't comment on taste since I did not try it. How can I eat Squidward?! My crab enchilada was huge and it tastes very yummy... it was more packed w/ cheese instead of crab, I noticed but I did not mind. The sauce and the tortilla itself was good enough w/o the crab! I could have ate the whole thing but I took it home so that I would not be a fat ass. 

I would definitely come again. Service was quite awesome since the guy checked in on us several times. What was cool was that the table next to ours were from out of town so my babe told them his suggestions on what to order, talked about sports, and his motorcycle club. I knew he played hockey in the minors but never knew he lived in Toronto among other U.S. destinations. I knew he is committed to his bike club but never knew they are like family to him. BTW- I was a little pissy because he went riding even though we were supposed to hangout prior to dinner. But after he showed up and we shared a hug and a kiss then after hearing how close he is to his club, my pissy mood dissipated.
author: Tram N.

description:
My husband and I were looking for a great place to have a romantic seafood dinner while on our San Francisco vacation.  Although Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39 don't scream 'Romantic', the recommendations for the Crab House were spot on.  The dinner was in fact very sweet and the boardwalk provided a lot of entertainment and nostalgia.  

The staff sat us down promptly and we ordered two cups of crab chowder to start us off.  The chowder was the creamy and meaty - they did not skimp us out at all and the soup was rich with flavor.  Then we ordered a large crab plate to share between us.  We cracked away and quickly discovered this wasn't your average boiled crab - the sauce on it was incredible.  Garlic, sesame, butter? What else was in there? It was powerful stuff.  Simple, high quality ingredients.  Everything tasted fresh.  Classic food done right.

I'm giving this place bonus points for the excellent service and the view as well.  My husband, being from England, said he had never seen a sea lion before.   As we ate our dinner, we saw a family of them swim by and bark.  I know, if you're from the West Coast this might be boring, but for him it was exciting, and even though I grew up watching sea lions I shared his joy in seeing something new.

I would love to come back here on a visit to San Francisco.  The city overwhelmed me with it's excellent crab left and right.
author: Olivia O.

description: Great food; calamari, garlic bread, Caesar salad, garlic noodles, and of course crab, 8 yr old grand daughter had kid order of fish and chips that would have been enough for an adult, and service was on top of it, since we also had 4 yr old grandson with us. He loved the calamari with lemon, garlic bread and crab, didn't have to order a kids meal for him.
author: Mer C.

description:
3.5 stars.

This restaurant is easily one of your better options if you're set on eating at one of the establishments at the tourist trap Pier 39. Food is alright, but try to stick with their crab items. Would recommend the crab chowder and their whole crabs. Their fries were also okay. Other pasta items (garlic noodles) and fish and chips were bland and unappealing. 

Service was ordinary. A little sluggish.

Pricey and nothing special, but better than expected in a tourist area such as this. I wouldn't come back and I think the food quality and view of Fog Harbor is significantly better (but also a little pricier).
author: Farrah N.

description:
Don't trust the other review on this restaurant.  The services are terrible.  The hostess was very rude.   The manager is a major jerk.   When we complain to the manager about the hostess, he act as if it is not important.  Like whatever.  

Don't go there.  The restaurant was empty, but we have it try and knew right away why the place have no customer. 

Horrible place to eat compare to other seafood place around the Pier!
author: Hanh H.

description:
If you like crabs then this is a great place to have a wonderful preparation - roasted crab with garlic sauce.  I thought they used butter; however, it turns out that they use olive oil so that people who can't have dairy products can enjoy the meal as well.  Well, since it is a healthy dish, I didn't feel bad about the garlic fries.  

I have been coming here for years when I travel to San Francisco.  They use to have buckets of Coronitas.  This time we had a pitcher of Anchorsteam.  Very good, but I think I prefer the Coronitas.
author: Peter W.

description:
Yes, it's strange to go to a crab place and not order crab, but that's what I did.  As much as I love crab, you have to be in the mood to get messy and work for your food!

I started with a cup of the crab chowder which was okay and not too memorable.  Then I ordered the fish and chips which came with a GIANT piece of fish along with a generous serving of garlic fries.  Yes, indeed, those fries were VERY garlicky!  

This place had a pretty good view of the pier and bay.  It's strange that the women's bathroom is right at the entrance of the restaurant and let me just say, it could use a little attention.  There was paper everywhere!
author: Julie F.

description:
As a seafood lover from out of town I was looking for some fine crustaceans on the Pacific Coast and did i find it! I was lucky to have to wait 15 seconds for a table because after that the line was a good hour long. 

They had window seating that viewed the water and window seating that viewed the boardwalk which is what we got. I ordered the big sampler that included some crab legs, shrimp, and mussels. All the above were really good but the sauce/butter they gave were kinda shitty. And they should even out the shrimp and mussel ratio cause it was like 10 to 30. 

There's a lot more seafood to get the next time I'm in town but I'm glad i came.
author: Daanyaal K.

description: Food was amazing highly recommend this place,only a 10 minute wait, go for the crab feast
author: Guillermo I.

description:
Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf is the original template for tourist traps.  One visit is usually plenty, unless you are going on the Alcatraz tour, I'd stay away from here. 

Over priced food that is not 'great' food.  You can get great food at thousands of restaurants around the bay area.  Parking is outrageously expensive but that's normal for San Francisco.  You will see signs for pier parking that say 1hr free with validation at select restaurants, etc.  NOT worth it.  Park further away and walk to the pier.     

One truly entertaining thing is the sea lions, could watch that for hours.  

We got the fish and chips, nothing special here.  Should have tried the crab or mussels but didn't' want to spend $100+ on lunch. 

If you've been to Gatlinburg, TN, Nashville, IN or places like it, you will get the same contrived vibe.
author: James C.

description:
For what seems like a tourist trap, they actually have pretty good food.

As is apparent by their name, you get the crab here. It's messy, a bit pricy, and you're not completely full (at least the BF and I weren't) but it's pretty good. I ordered the whole crab and the BF ordered the crab, mussel, and shrimp combo. Neither one of us has anything to really complain about. The portions were a good size and the service was good. If I'm ever back in San Fran, I would come here over Fog Harbor.
author: Samantha L.

description: Total shock and disappointment that the restaurant canceling our group reservations the day before the event. And to find that out on our way to airport... What a surprise! Our group ended up having fast food for dinner. Sigh~
author: Bo L.

description: This place was a lot different then when we went around 4 years ago. Before the dining was very formal looking and a bit stuffy. This last time we went which was a week ago it had a casual vibe and the food was better than what I remember. We ordered the too two crab which was served on a grilling pan. It was very good and the crab meat slid right out of the legs. Even though the crab had butter on it already we asked for some melted butter. Also, don't forget about the garlic fries! The service was very good also and our waiter Carlos was very accommodating to our needs. Have a great time at fisherman's wharf a Happy Eating!
author: Ernest H.

description:
Stopped in on a whim, & we were immediately seated. Nice fire pit in the middle, awesome rack of assorted hot sauces and the VIEW and service were EXCELLENT.

Crab was delish, my daughter enjoyed her cioppino and the lobster fondue was really good but a complete let down because all of their bread was hard as a rock, probably the only disappointment.
author: Sandra C.

description:
The restuarant is located on Pier 39, and it is on the second level. The view here was very nice. You got to see the Golden Gate Bridge and also the beautiful view of the water and the sunset. 

The one meal that we ordered was the crab feast, which is 6lbs of crab for $100. Feeds about four people, but we had five people...So it really fed all of us. The crab didn't taste as fresh as I thought it would be. The meat was a bit dry and not juicy...kind of disappointed. The flavor was garlic and other spices, but I had an allergic reaction so I have no clue what they put in it besides garlic...

My friends ordered Stella beer in the pitcher and guess what it was $20 for about nine full 8 ounce cups of beer. Pretty good for the price; however, I don't drink beer so I don't know how it tastes like.

Service was pretty good, but sanitation wise was not good at all. They place everything on the table as in the utensils, the plates, the cups, and the water on the table before anyone sits down. Most of it had dust and other "dried up" special flavors leftover due to bad cleaning....The water had floaties in it...as in fat and dust...YES! I said fat...it was just circling and circling on the top. Ew...I know right?! 

Overall, I wouldn't suggest this place. Boiling crab in Southern California is so much better.
author: Connie C.

description:
If you are looking for some tasty seafood, especially crab, this is the place! The food was delicious and the service was awesome!

I highly recommend getting the crab chowder! So full of flavor! And anything crab on the menu. We got the crab melt and the crab enchilada which we would get again. I would love to come back and try everything! 

Our server Derek was awesome and quick! He never left us waiting. The whole staff was friendly and welcoming. 

I recommend making a reservation for weekends and during the holiday season, but they do take walk ins and the wait isn't too long. 

Great place to go for crab and other seafood!!
author: Kendall B.

description:
Get the double mussels and double crab!
There were so many mussels and the 2 sauces were great (obv one was for mussels and one for crab, but we double dipped)!

They serve your dish on a big big hot plate with a depository for the shells. They serve a little bread before your meal, but not bread with mussels since they aren't served in a traditional broth.

We made a reservation since it looks right over the pier, but it wasn't too packed because the resi was at 6pm. 

Their beer list was sparse, with only about six on there so I opted for the wine. The dessert did not look very tempting and there are so many ice cream shops along the pier that we decided to do just that!

Service was attentive and the overall experience was good!
author: Susan F.

description:
This was a great crab place. We split a bottle of wine, lotsa crab, small mussels, small garlic fries between three. Perfect amount of food. Service was fast & good. Food was fantastic and made me "mmmm". View was great (ask for corner table) and they do open table.

For a tourist area, this is a great bet. Just get the crab.
author: Megan E.

description:
