After reading the other Yelp reviews, I was excited. We wanted to try somewhere other than a chain place.

 For the price, I don't think we go our monies worth. My girlfriend ordered the crab and it  didn't come apart that easy. Also, for the money, there wasn't a lot. 

Go to Buba Gumps, so good. That's where where going next time.
author: Mike M.

description:
I love playing tourist when I visit my family in the Bay Area. While the city I currently live in has some pretty good eats...nothing ever comes close to the seafood at Fisherman's Wharf.

This time around my family and I went to the Crab House. My Mom heard about it via reviews and we had no arguments against it.

My parents and I love flavor. Love. But there is such a thing as too much salt. So, 1 star down for the food being a bit too salty. It's not too much of a problem if you keep drinking water. lol

My husband got the Chicken Alfredo, and I got the Crab Alfredo. Nice sized dishes. I couldn't eat it all and gave some to my Dad, who enjoyed it. The Alfredo sauce is a bit on the thinner side, which I didn't mind. But my husband prefers it to be on the thicker and more rich side. He said it still tasted great to him. The Crab Alfredo sauce was clearly made with "crab butter". (By the way, if you don't know what crab butter is...no need...just know that it's delicious.hahaha) Again, this added to the salt...but the noodles help offset it. I had plenty of chunks of crab in my dish, unlike another reviewer who said they only had bits of crab. I don't know. If that happens to you, my suggestion would be to talk to the manager? You're paying a higher price for your meal, you should be satisfied.

My Mom got the Crab Melt, which is an open faced sandwich. I'm pretty sure she said "Mine isn't salty at all. It's GREAT!" ...no less than 1 dozen times. Her sammich definitely LOOKED amazing. I'll tell you one thing I picked off her plate was the garlic fries. They were good (though pale in comparison to the Garlic Fries at AT&T Park). 

Lastly, my Dad ordered from the Prix Fixe menu. He got the crab. The salad was standard, but it was big. He said that it was refreshing and helped with the saltiness of the crab. The crab was great. I had some...nice and meaty. It comes with a sauce for dipping...which is great with the bread. I would bet $500 that the "sauce" is actually dressed up crab butter...which is why it was so damn good.

Had no issues with our server (a european guy). He was good.

I'd go here again.
author: Janelle J.

description: Don't wait in line if your party is not too big. Sat at the fireplace when it became available. Sat near very friendly out of towners and the whole meal was amazing. Only reason why it didn't get 5 stars because our waiter just took our order and went missing. I even forgot what he looked like. Luckily my bf is very generous and gave him over 20% because he said we'll be their every time we're in town.
author: Dee P.

description: Seriously, the most delicious crab I have ever had ever. and of course the price isn't that pretty but here is a must try! You have to wait in busy hours since there are always many tourists going around.
author: Yingying C.

description: Not bad but really expensive. If you want a better experience you should go to the Franciscan Crab House a few blocks away. Same owners, better food.
author: Troy B.

description:
Amazing crab!!!

I've only dined here once with my fiance and we both loved the food here a lot! We ordered their Double Mussels and Double Crabs Combo; they were perfectly cooked and flavorful, we could taste the freshness of the sea food, they were indeed live before cook, because it had a natural sweeten taste to them.

Two star off for two reasons: firstly was because they have small selection on the whiskey, the best they had was Maker's Mark; secondly was our waitress, she was the only one Asian waitress on the past Sunday night, talked extremely loud with strong accent, acted rude liked she was serving her customers at a local super market, didn't even ask us if we like some dessert or not, did NOT say "thank you" when we paid or left - horrible! I would love to give it 5 stars if it wasn't her.
author: Sammy C.

description:
The Crab House is definitely a hidden little treasure of Pier 39. The restaurant is hidden to the left side of the pier with a lovely traditional black and white decor. The servers are absolutely friendly and very professional in their attire. The first time I was here I ordered the crab chowder, the lobster with butter sauce, and the crab angel hair lasagna. The crab chowder came out quite fast. It had good flavor, but a tad on the cold side. The bread that was given in the beginning of seating is pretty hard. The Lobster pasta with the butter sauce was delicious. There is a wonderful amount of lobster meat and the flavor was there. The crab angel hair lasagna was something I had to try. It was extremely comforting and very filling. It was a bit on the oily side, but still good while its hot. Overall, it was a pretty satisfying meal. 

So the second time I returned I just had to try the giant crab. It's called The Crab House so of course I just had to get down and dirty with a juicy crab! I ordered the crab, garlic fries, mojitos, and bloody mary oyster shooters. It was even MORE SATISFYING than the first time I came here!!! I love food I can grab and dig in with my hands. There was intense flavors in the crab and the crab meat was soOo juicy! The garlic fries were perfectly crispy and was jam packed with garlic flavor. The mojitos were good. I have never tried a bloody mary oyster shooter before and have only tried the traditional style at Japanese restaurants so this was like popping my cherry! It was absolutely delicious! LoL 

Pretty decent restaurant to just relax and actually enjoy your delicious seafood with a great view and great company. Awesomeness... =)
author: Anji W.

description: My friend and I had a vacation in San Francisco on this summer. We stopped by Pier 39 like other tourists. We walked pass this restaurant and it was packed. Why not give it a try right? We came up and waited to be seated. Nice bay view, clean, and good atmosphere. We ordered garlic crab. It was so good. Got a good garlic flavor. The crab was huge even for two people. Expensive? Maybe. But you paid what you would have. The crab price around here is the same like $40 almost every restaurant. Why not pay for it and get good food and good spot right? We sat by the window, so we could see sea lions colony. We also ordered drinks which are melon mojito and blue Russian mojito. They were so so strong. It was good though. The bartender was nice and friendly. The staffs were outstanding. Great place for food while you're in pier 39. Must try!!
author: Manisa K.

description:
Looked up recommendations of what to order and was not disappointed. 

Started with the crab chowder (bowl). Do not get it confused with clam chowder. It was great and strongly recommend it! It can serve 2-4 people. If you don't eat much, just order the cup. 

Calamari was ok...nothing great.

Ordered the double shrimp double crab and shared with my wife...it's delicious! Don't be afraid to use all your fingers and enjoy. They give you a bib...so don't worry about getting dirty.

I had a great time.
author: Nelson Y.

description: It's a great place! We three people are treated well and all of us enjoyed the great food! The three dishes(crabs,shrimps and soups) recommended by the waitress are quite delicious and in reasonable price...
author: Yuhang H.

description:
This rating is overdue since it's been almost 3 weeks since I visited last. But the impression still stands. 
The waitress had zero personality or charisma at all. She didn't give me an inkling of a feeling I was going to enjoy my meal. The bread that came with my Caesar salad seriously would have cracked a tooth it was so hard. The lettuce is totally non nutritious as you get the whitest leafs from the end of the head. 
My finance's crab sandwich was something I could whip up for him myself... With a hangover. 
Calamari was the only thing decent and I wouldn't expect anyone to mess up something fried. 
I have no interest in coming to try what this place is named after.
author: Shayla J.

description: If you can talk your friends into not eating at the Fisherman Wharf touristy restaurants, try to. I can say this is sub par seafood, and I knew beforehand it would be, dang.  The mussels were small, dried out and stringy with no flavor, the shrimp wasn't all that either.  The crab had a very knacky tasting seasoning on them and it also looked unappealing. The bread was no good, I think the caesar salad was the best part, sadly.
author: Diana B.

description: The BEST dungeness killer crab I have ever eaten in my life!! Delicious! I will never forget!! The crabs were huge compared to the ones in Texas. I was visiting San Francisco and came here twice because it was that GOOD! The place was packed! Wait time would have been over an hour if we didn't have reservations. So glad we made reservations 2 weeks before. We had 4 people in our group the first time and 6 people on the second time. The service was great, the waiters were very tentative. Everybody got plastic bibs and wet tissues to wipe our fingers. Get ready to be messy. Each times we got the crab feast and lotsa crab numerous times in one sitting. I honestly lost count how many we ordered. They roasted the crabs in this delicious garlic sauce. You can taste it through the shell. The meat was so hot, soft, fresh, and perfect. I like to dip it in butter or salt, pepper, and lemons. We also ordered a side of garlic fries and calamari. Perfect combination of food coma. The prices are steep, but I was on vacation and I didn't care. I'm drooling again. Let me just say this place is highly recommended!!!! My favorite place on Pier 39.
author: Jae S.

description:
We had a wonderful time at this restaurant enjoying a very late lunch/early dinner.  It probably isn't necessary to point out that this is a HUGE tourists place to eat - but every place on Pier 39 is a tourists place.  That being said, Matt, our waiter made a good meal very enjoyable.  The crab was very good, the garlic fries should be illegal they are so addicting and we topped it off by splitting a serving of Tiramisu.

This a very popular restaurant.  We waited an hour at 3:30Pm in the afternoon and there were only two of us.  It is a good idea to make reservations especially if you have a group of four or more.  Of all the places we've eaten at Pier 39, this was our favorite.
author: John M.

description:
Food quality 4.
Expect to wait. We waited over half an hour, expected because it was Boxing Day.

It's pretty good crabs. We ordered the Crab Feast! and of course, more crabs. They were absolutely delicious, Crab House and had delicious seafood. Was overrated though, crabs were skinny. 

Mussels and shrimp plate: great value as well. 

Garlic fries -excellent. Slightly soggy inside, but amazingly crunchy on the outside And the garlic sauce is finger lickin good.
author: Ian L.

description:
I have to be fair and say right off the bat that I never got to try the food.  The line was soooooo long!  We stood for at least 25 minutes right at the doors' entrance.  I asked the people in front of me if their names were taken, or if they knew how long waits are expected.  They said they haven't even seen an employee walk near them.  

So I am a HUGE crab fan!!  My mother said I growl when I eat it!  ha ha  So,,, I was seriously looking forward to eating a huge share of crab!!  Sure, we could've gone to Bubba Gumps, but living in San Luis Obispo county, I've had it before at the Monterrey wharf.  I wanted the Pier 39 experience!! 

Back to the line.  We waited an additional 10 minutes then I, reluctantly, threw in the towel, or bib.  It wasn't going to happen.  We had no way of knowing how much longer as nobody ever acknowledged the huge number of people waiting.  Bummer.  What's sad is that I'm sure they could care less as it is such a highly populated area with tourists.  One family turning away, once an hour, isn't going to hurt them.
author: L R.

description: Yum! We shared the crab and shrimp and split a bowl of clan chowder. It was amazing, cooked perfectly and the sauces they serve with them complimented the seafood so well. The soup was the best ive ever had. Our waiter was helpful and showed me how to correctly break into my crab. I wish we lived closer because I would eat here all the time!!
author: Noe'l S.

description: The service I received at the Crab House was exceptional. I came with a party of 20 and Ryan was our server and he did a wonderful job attending to all of us and going above and beyond to ensure that we were taken care of.  The reasoning for the two star rating was the food. It was marginal at best. I ordered the calamari which was bland and extremely chewy. I also ordered the whole crab as well as the crab enchiladas. This place is supposed to be famous for its "secret garlic sauce". The secret to the sauce is that it's shitty. Find a better restaurant Ryan, they don't deserve you.
author: Christopher S.

description:
This place has a great view of the bay and golden gate! Despite being a tourist trap, the crab house actually lives up to its name.
We ordered the whole crab, it was juicy and delicious. I wish they had not emptied the insides of the top shell though...its my favorite part!
Garlic fries were addicting. The portion size for the fries is large, so I suggest ordering the small size and share it with group. 
Crab Louie didn't have as much crab meat as I had hoped. However, since we were already eating crabs, it was a nice compliment.
author: Nancy Z.

description: The crab legs here will send you to seafood heaven. so fresh that butter is not needed. They seat you at a make shift patio. (beware restrooms are hard to come by) and they bring you apps, and this metal shelf for your crab. I was a little confused too. you order that along with your DELICIOUS SIDES. please try the clam chowder....it is so creamy and rich! pack full of goodies. There are a lot of tourist and kids so....that is really the reason I didn't give them 5 stars. I think they should really section off people who do and do not have children .... bc I would have spend much more money and time there if I didn't have to eat my food around screaming children throwing food at each other.
author: Angel L.

description:
Well actually 2.5 but I'm feeling generous. Being that I wanted to truly experience the San Francisco area, I had to try their world renowned Bay Crab. After perusing yelp, I found this place in Fisherman's Wharf at Pier 39. We ordered the Killer Crab, a green salad, and tirumisu. The green salad and tirumisu were just adequate but who goes to a place like the Crab Shack for salad? The Killer Crab, the star of the meal, did not disappoint. Man, it was so fresh and buttery flavored with garlic and herbs. It was absolutely amazing! I would recommend it all to you. I would say that each person in your party should get at least a pound each because its that good. The waiter could have been more enthusiastic and was a little short with my party so that effected our experience and thus effects my rating. 

Just a tip for the waiter:  You should try to be nice to all the patrons that you are serving. Okay, thanks!

3 stars
author: Lauren O.

description:
It's funny how if Pier 39 didn't exist, the SF locals wouldn't even notice. In the heart of San Francisco's Fisherman's Wharf, this pocket of shops, boutiques and restaurants is a tourist trap where out-of-towners flock to. You'll usually witness and experience some kind of sideshow - some dude covered in silver paint posing as a statue, people playing music, someone performing magic tricks, etc. All my SF friends have very strong negative feelings about this area. 

However, in this tourist haven, there's a little gem. That gem is Crab House. 

ATMOSPHERE: It's what you expect from a seafood restaurant slash tourist trap. The walls are lined with fake crabs, fishing nets and lifesavers. Very loud and a little chaotic with a very diverse crowd. Crab House really packs the place with tables so there isn't much walking room. Talk about maximizing your space!

SERVICE: Great! I read several reviews dogging their service, but I guess we were lucky. Our server was very accommodating. I don't really care if servers constantly ask how everything is going or refill my water when my glass is half empty. What I really care about is how quickly they can respond to my requests. That's where our server killed it. We asked for more napkins several times. She brought them over quickly. We wanted tartar sauce with our calamari. It was sitting on our table in less than a minute. My plate was dirty when I sat down so I asked for another. I was graced with a clean plate within a few seconds. She was SO awesome. Another thing that really impressed me was that we were obviously starving (me and four friends). She could have easily recommended that we order more food, but stopped us after she felt like we were going a little overboard. I really appreciate that at restaurants - the staff not trying to upsell you when it's not necessary. 

LARGE GARLIC FRIES ~ 3.5 stars ~ $9.95: It was a huge heaping of fries sitting on a long plate covered in butter, cheese and garlic. Though it was delicious, it's nothing special. But it did make a nice compliment to everything else. It was the perfect starch to go with the crab and calamari. 

FRIED CALAMARI ~ 4 stars ~ $19.95: Just like the garlic fries, this portion was pretty gigantic. It was enough for five of us to devour it and feel very satisfied. The calamari was fried perfectly with the right amount of crunch without the greasiness. Garnished with sliced peppers and jalepenos as well as lemon wedges and two cups of cocktail sauce, this was a hit. One of my favorite things about this app were the few slices of fried lemon slices. I love that sh*t! However, I will recommend asking for tartar sauce. It goes way better with the calamari than the cocktail sauce served with it. http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=TnKEBMW0o4QWSnK8XH5sEw&userid=CZ36wJqV-Xit758UaOr81A

CRAB FEAST ~ 4.5 stars ~ $110.00: Picture a large piping hot skillet topped off with three crabs, giving off aromas of garlic and butter. The steam floating off the dish carries the scent of crustacean heaven as it touches your nose. The menu states that the Crab Feast feeds up to four people, but the five of us were totally satisfied with the amount of food we got. The feast comes with all the legs and claws of three crabs. None of them are pre-cracked so you'll have to get down and dirty. Don't worry, they provide all the necessary tools you need to break the shells. The crab meat was tender, buttery and just straight up delicious. I think one of the best parts about eating crab is also the worst part. There's SO much work that goes into cracking and breaking the shells that you start to get really impatient, but if you crack your shells properly and carefully remove the meat, you're rewarded with a huge nugget of crab meat completely intact. Have you ever pulled a huge piece out of a claw? Staring at it as it's barely hanging onto your tiny fork? Holding it up to everyone at your table screaming "Check this out!"? That's when you know you've made it. At that moment you realize how much you love crab and why you don't eat it more often. 

The food was great and so was the service. But I can't bring myself to give this place 5 stars, however, I think it's very deserving of 4. EXTREMELY deserving. If you can get past the touristy area and find your way to the second level of Pier 39, be sure to check out Crab House.

JUST MAKE SURE TO PUT ON THE BIB THEY GIVE YOU! That thing saved my shirt on three occasions!
author: Bruce C.

description: Still amazing! Got to finally bring the family here before the tree lighting! :) so good!!!!
author: Shannon S.

description: Had cocktails and Channel the bartender was incredible and so sweet. We will diffently go back to have dinner.
author: Roni H.

description:
Location & Vibe: Pier 39 & lots of tourists, crowded, great views out the restaurant windows, lots of open space
Must-haves: Its trademarked Killer Crabs and Shrimp Alfredo

Pros:
   - Great quality of crabs (extremely fresh and meaty)
   - Great Alfredo sauce
   - Presentation was good

Cons:
   - Poor customer service - the hostess and waiters took 30+ minutes just to clean up a booth table for us to sit down. Our waiter was a little weird at times and chuckled at inappropriate times when ordering food off the menu.
   - Did not provide any sauce for crab legs - just garlic and butter base for the dish
   - Mediocre bread quality
   - Pretty loud setting

Final comments: For you crab lovers, I highly recommend this place even though this place is located in the middle of all tourist attractions and is extremely hectic and loud. Its Killer Crabs were finger-licking great with its special House sauce made with garlic, olive oil, and butter. Aside from these crabs, the place is mediocre at its best.
author: Chanhee H.

description:
Crab House is a really fun experience.  The way they serve the sauteed crab on the stone plate is really different than most seafood restaurants I've been to (i.e. in big plastic bags).  As other people have noted -- it's greasy.  I mean as greasy as you can possibly get.  But I don't expect anything on the pier to be void of tons of greasy/fried goodness.  

As always, Pier 39 is flooded with people so, as I would expect, the restaurant was super, super crowded when we arrived at 4:30PM.  It was also Father's Day so I think that caused an influx of people on top of how popular it is already.  (For all the people from the South Bay, it's not as bad as Boiling Crab but it's pretty up there for a wait time.)  We were lucky and had made a reservation a few days beforehand.  Please note, that is the simplest and most painless way to go if you plan on eating here on a weekend.  They even called ten minutes beforehand to verify that we were still coming.  I was very impressed with the service.
author: Dustin N.

description:
Husband had the burger, I had the garlic noodles, and a side of their medium shrimp and muscle combo. Only thing I thought was good was the shrimp and their fries. There was so much oil in the garlic noodles; wish I would've remembered to take a photo of it to share with you all; couldn't finish it cause my mouth was all oil. The muscles were literally the size of the tip of my pinky. If I had known they were that tiny, I would've went with all shrimp. 

Would I eat here again? Sure. Maybe next time I'll order something else. Their service was great, btw.
author: Anonymous L.

description: I re-visited the crab house this weekend to celebrate my honey's birthday.  Well, he absolutely loved it and I have to say that I was able to appreciate the food even more than the first time.  However, I was a bit disappointed at how fast they remove the food from your table as I was still eating my bread and in a blink of an eye it was gone.  Despite the aforementioned, I was very pleased with our meal and the ambience is always great.  I will certainly visit again upon my next trip to San Francisco!!!
author: Lilly G.

description:
We were on our way into the city and I decided that I wanted crab for lunch. When I get my mind set on something, I just have to make it happen. I searched for crab in the handy dandy yelp app and, although more than a few options popped up, this one stood out.  Being able to make reservations via Open Table was a huge bonus.  

Crab House has lots of crab options from whole or half crabs to crab pasta to crab cakes and so on. I ordered the crab melt and it was fantastic with an ample amount of fresh crab piled on top of bread and topped with melty cheese. On the side were more fries than I could consume. Portions are more than satisfactory. 

Service was great and the prices are fairly reasonable considering the Pier 39, complete with a great view, location.
author: Emily J.

description: Got to the place and was seated after about 15 minutes we finally had our order taken, never was offered a complimentary bread but the people next to us got it as they got seated a few min later. Finally got our food and the waitress never checked up on us till after 3/4 of our way into the meal and she was rude to other people at the restaurant.  The food was amazing and came out really fast, bad star rating for the poor service from the waitress.
author: Erik P.

description: We ordered 3lbs of Dungeness Crab called lotsa crab. It was so fresh and delicious. I love how they roast their crab with their special garlic butter sauce which they are also famous for. It was $56 for the 3lbs which was little pricey but it was worth it and it was enough for 2 people. I will definely keep this place in mind when I come back.
author: Sarah C.

description: I started at the bar and had great service with the bartender then moved on to a table where Carlos our server went out of his way many times for our difficult table he was so gracious and kind and knowledgeable about the food and drinks and the surrounding area he is a keeper. Great experience great food and staff 100%
author: Thomas M.

description: Just called in to make a reservation. Young lady who answered the phone didn't sound so pleasant but I won't judge over a phone call. We'll see how the food and service is next week. Will be updating!
author: Lina S.

description:
Came here for brunch cause my friends from out of town wanted to eat crab, hit pier 39 and grab a bloody mary.  Crab house it is!  Great view of the pier, friendly wait staff and clean vintage restaurant.
Order:
Whole crab (full of butter and garlic!)
Chinese Crab Salad - huge salad with a generous amount of crab!  Amazing
Crab chower - YESSSSS!  A great starter.  Nice chowder creamy texture with potator, corn, and CHUCKS of crab.  Probably the best crab chowder within pier 39 and fisherman wharf.

Great place to bring your guests from out of town.
author: Ying F.

description:
As good as it gets for Seafood in SF! Been to this place a few times now and have always had a great dining experience. The only thing holding back a 5 star is the inconsistent service that ranged from exceptionally good to "I felt like I was at McD's at 3AM" service.

Food is very good - seafood is fresh and cooked just right. Among my favorites here - mussels, crab, and lobster pasta!

For the skillet get the mussels (skip the shrimp which pales in comparison to the mussels).

Must visit spot when in the area!
author: Vishal S.

description:
I hated this place, the placed spelled fishy, everyone was sitting on top of each other in this small restaurant.  The server was so arrogant that when I asked what kind of fish is in the fish and chips he would say "Fish, like a white fish", but what is the name of the fish I asked and he was clueless?.

We ended up canceling our order and going to next door to Fog Harbor as we were unsure what we were eating because of the server.  Fog Harbor was amazing food, service and it was fine dining for the same price as here.

Will not come again, you have to know as a server what your serving and what ingredients are being eaten as everyone these days has some sort of Allergy. 

The server was a man with an ascent in his forties.
author: Naz H.

description: YUMM-O!  I am stoked I gave this place another try.  Went with some friends and we ordered the garlic fries that were so delicious and the crab feast for 4, and wow was that crab fresh.  Everything taste so fresh and the texture of the crab was amazing.  Especially since last time everything tasted burnt and overcooked!! Highly recommend this place was it was so amazing!!!
author: Angeline Z.

description:
Don't go there unless you like to get punished eating food scrunched up in small tight space. The mean Asian lady at the front desk pointed to count how many people we have right when we walked in even after we told her everyone showed up in our party.  And then tried to shove the 7 of us in a small table even though the place was clearly not busy.  After that claim my wife was yelling when in fact that was not true.

We didn't stay and eat, walked out of there before waiter brought water by.  Have ate here a few times before, never again.
author: Shawn W.

description:
During my second visit to San Francisco in as many months, I decided to give Fisherman's Wharf another shot.  This time, I consulted Yelp for a good place to grab some whole dungeness crab, and this is what looked the most promising.

The Crab House is located on Pier 39, which is basically a mall sticking out into the bay.  It's a very touristy place, to be sure.  With that in mind, I don't know what I was expecting.

The Crab House is very crowded inside, but that's OK with me.  I don't mind being sociable every now and then.  The server asked if I was in town for Hardly Strictly Bluegrass (I was), and then insisted that I had to be in a band (I'm not) because I "look like the artistic type" (it must have been the Fedora, red pants, Chris Robinson Brotherhood t-shirt, and beard).

I ordered, of course, the whole dungeness crab.  The server returned impossibly soon with my cooked crab, and helpfully broke apart the legs for me.  I devoured my new deceased friend in a matter of minutes, cracking apart every part of his shell, fiercely ripping out his every muscle.  It turned out that the meat was actually quite dry; I suspect my little pal was overcooked or something (I'm not an expert on dungeness crab by any stretch of the imagination).

At the end of the day, Crab House At Pier 39 is another tourist trap, albeit with better service than the last tourist trap I visited at the wharf.  I suspect the crabs are not cooked to order.  Next time I'll try a little hole-in-the-wall Vietnamese place that serves crab...
author: Jeremy P.

description: Really good crab and mussels were fabulous. We came at lunchtime on Friday and easy in too. Really quick and great service from start to finish. Must go if at pier 39
author: J H.

description: Great food and great service. Definitely will be going back. I highly recommend the crab nachos and the banana mixed cocktail!
author: Amber R.

description: I loved this place, it really gives the seafood vibe and it's right next to the pier! Took my gf here and we got the Dungeness crab and some fries. The waiters were great, they were attentive and nice. Dropped 1 star for being so pricey. Other than that, I had a great experience here.
author: Wilson L.

description:
Despite being in such a touristy area, this place is actually really good! The crab here is so yummy! The flavor is very unique and definitely one of my favorite ways to prepare crab. Whenever my family visits me, they always try to eat here. During our most recent visit, we also ordered the garlic noodles but those were average and I probably wouldn't get it again. It did have nice meaty chunks of crab in it which is a plus. Our service was average--no complaints. Once we ordered, the crab came out super quick which was a pleasant surprise since we were starving. It even came out before we got our bread.

I'd recommend making a reservation cause the wait can be pretty long for dinner on the weekends. Even if you have to wait, there's plenty of shops around to browse to kill time. Also try to come for an early dinner so you can enjoy the view of the wharf/sunset while it's still light out.

Overall, a really yummy place to eat at for a special occasion or when you feel like splurging on crab.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
Its a surprise that there is a restaurant worth going to in a tourist trap that is Pier 39... This place is legit! 

Make reservations; I think you can even order ahead?? 

I ordered the crab chowder, Good and tasty but I should've saved my stomach and dough for more crab and shrimp.

Garlic fries are a must.  It was really gooood.

Ordered the roasted crab in garlic butter... Really good. I Recommend this.

Had the iron skillet mussel and shrimps. They were nice tasty breaks of buttery goodness when I wasn't stuffing my face with crab.

The free acme bread was nice.
author: Ronnie N.

description: The service is great, but the food is awful. Everything was greasy and drowning in butter and garlic. I couldn't taste the crab for the all the butter coated my mouth and killed my taste buds. They dump a ton of garlic to help, but it kills the crab flavor. My child didn't finish her lunch, nor did I. We felt ill from the grease overload. This used to be a great place. I am guessing they no longer have a chef, but have hired only cooks. Stay clear.
author: Patrick L.

description:
Great. 

1. Crab chowder: excellent

2. Crab in secret garlic sauce: excellent

3: Fried fish sandwich: maybe the best I've ever had. Perfectly fried and seasoned. 

4. What are you waiting for? Go eat here!
author: Dan F.

description:
To get to the crab house you have to walk through Pier 39 and cheesy tourist Haven. BUT once you are in the restaurant you had no idea that bubba gump is close by. The food was super delicious. 

I started with a Moscow mohito. Um yum yum yum. Vodka, chambord, lime and mint! Pour me another! Then my mom and I has the bruschetta very tasty. I had the 1/2 crab price fixe was good . First a Cesar salad then crab legs and claws and tiramisu . We also got a side of garlic fries. Yum. Actually it is really a garlic lovers dream. There was garlic on the crab too. 

My mom got the garlic noodles with crab. While I wouldn't normally recommend noodles at a place like this ... I'm more of a purest so I'd just get the seafood myself... It was really really really good. 

The tiramisu was good, no great. Skip the dessert. 

After this meal though I was full on crabby I certainly was not a crabby person!!
author: Samantha C.

description:
A little less scummy and a little less tacky than many of the other restaurants in Fisherman's Wharf. The portions are large.

The crab feast for four is a fun time, but it appears that they just deep fried the crab and then finished it by sauteing in butter, which was a bummer because it really dried the meat out (especially for such a tender and delicate creature like the dungeness).  Oh well.  Also it appears the crab feast was just legs and the knuckle joint.  It would've been nice for variety to at least throw the heads on the platter. 

The calamari was well seasoned but heavy on the breading.

Cocktails are cheap and simple, and they taste pretty good.  $10 Mojito is a steal for the city.
author: Mike L.

description: Good quality food.  Very friendly waiters.   Will come back again.      Ordered double shrimp and whole crab. It's a lot for two people
author: Junxiang Z.

description:
Decent tasting food.
Overpriced
Everything is pretty much pan fried in butter and garlic.
Tastes greasy and unhealthy

Crab chowder sucks
Bread is unheated

Fish and chips not bad
Crabs decent
author: Paul L.

description: This place was fantastic! Took my wife and the in-laws and they loved the place! Even had chinese menus. The waiter was fantastic and attentive, the manager was even on the floor to help us find a table because that place was packed, but it kept our reservation. The presentation was even better! Had 2 Whole Crabs, shrimp and mussels on a skillet, and they sizzled and dazzled the whole table. Everything was very timely, a bit pricey but worth the experience. The bibs, the view of the pier, and the atmosphere was all on point. Would definitely come again next time we visit San Francisco.
author: Yo T.

description: This restaurant is amazing!!! I love their crab chowder!! There is nothing that my friends and I ordered that was bad. We loved it, came here two times in a week span...:)
author: Karina P.

description: The view was amazing! The service was family friendly, fast, and attentive. It is right on pier 39. The food was delicious, my husband enjoyed the chipino very much. The kids had fish and chips. I didn't much like the chicken Alfredo it was mediocre. Crab cakes were tasty and garlic bread and calamari as well.
author: Carol V.

description: typical tourist trap, over priced and the food was nowhere near great. Definitely better of going to Crustacean for that money! We had 2 crabs and the crab chowder, shrimp cocktail (not edible - artificial shrimp) and the grilled shrimp, garlic crab noodles (tasteless) and alfredo (tasteless). In order for the grilled shrimp or 2 crabs to be good, we had to drench it in oil.
author: David G.

description: The food tastes average and it's definitely overpriced. The servers are also very rude.
author: Ziju F.

description: I ordered king crab and to my eyes it seemed that the crab has been pre-made hours ago. The inner meat of the legs were very very dry, which implied the crab has been steamed quite a few hours ago. Also the server was very arrogant in the way he treated me. Although I used to come here every summer as my favorite restaurant, Now I would NOT recommend this place to anyone else. I really hope Crab House can fix their issues to regain their glorious reputation as Pier 39's landmark.
author: Yong L.

description: Not a long wait at all very friendly and great customer service. Got the combo of mussels, shrimp & crab. With fries and crab chowder. The combo wasn't a disappointment at all, pretty good and cheap price. The fries was fries but don't really recommend the crab chowder very much but overall good experience
author: Danny N.

description: Crabs, clams, mussels ...cant go wrong. All were good here. Very touristy as it was on Pier 39 and kind of overpriced but it food and service were great. Nice views of the bay and super strong bloody marys! The taste of the bloody marys was really great and spicy....loved it.
author: Aline D.

description: So we are sitting here and made a reservation on Open Table and according to Brian, the manager, the company policy, which isn't stated on Open Table, is everyone has to be there on the dot or they give your table away. The marathon is on town this weekend. Really? We're here. Overpriced. B.S. Service. Save your money and time. Lots of accomodating places to eat on the wharf and pier. Inflexible. Poor customer service.
author: Lisa C.

description: I had The crab and it was amazing. It looks right over the water. You can look over the water and see the bridge outside the window.  The inside kind of looks like an upscale diner, but great food, good company, great veiw and great service make up for it. There is an automatic 4.9% fee on your bill before tip, so beware.  Brian was my waiter and he was extremely attentive to the busy crowd and very friendly.
author: Eireann W.

description:
The garlic secret sauce on the crab is so delicious! Never have I ever liked my fingers before! I just wanted all the flavor! 
I highly recommend this place. It's super awesome. Yes the prices are expensive (like $5 for a coke) but if you don't mind that and are touring Fisherman's Wharf then go for it! The view is beautiful as well!
author: Corrina L.

description: Tourist trap our not we loved this place  and seeing as to how I was a tourist I didn't mind dining here at all.  In fact I really liked it very much.  My boyfriend and I stopped in at the Alcatrez gift shop in Pier 39 and while we were shopping our nose's caught a faint wiff of heavenly sweet crab and butter that was floating out from the Crab House's open windows.  We wasted no time getting to the Crab House and were seated right away.  We settled on the dungeness crab for two and it was so fingering licking good so superbly delicious God I love being vacation.
author: Lucretiz C.

description:
We went here at 4pm on a Sunday and they said the wait would be 15 mins. After 5 mins we were seated which was great because we were hungry! We ordered a cup of the crab chowder and the lots a grab which is 3lbs for 2 people. I think after his beer and my ice tea the total was like $85 which I thought was a bit much but it was delish! It taste like the crab is flash fried but you dont taste the oil. The garlic butter basil maraniade they use was suttle but really complimented the crab. I would probably pass on the crab chowder next time because it just didnt do it for me. I dont like sweet soup but that is just a personal choice. Their salads look huge! 

Service wise the bus staff was amazing and would take the bowls when they got filled with shells we were tossing in there. The waistress could work on refilling their drinks more often as most everyone had to ask for a refill. Lastly the restrooms were almost impossible to get into as you cannot tell who is in line for them and who is waiting for their table.
author: danielle s.

description:
After missing our reservation at Ruth's Chris Steakhouse since he overslept during his nap, Mr. Face and I came here for my birthday dinner. For a Saturday night, a wait of an hour wasn't too shabby. 

I don't remember the name of our server, but he was on top of things... for the most part. There were two times where Sir Face needed refills on his diet coke, but got regular coke instead. The other items we got were; roasted crab for 2, medium garlic fries, crab chowder, crab cakes, and a strawberry mojito for myself. 

The chowder came first, and quite honestly it wasn't anything special. Crab is one of my favorite things to eat, but this left me thinking that clam chowder is much better. The fries were really good... crab cakes are so so. The roasted crab was quite tasty, but I think I prefer it just steamed as I feel that it was slightly overcooked as the meat was a bit on the dry side. 

The complimentary bread... I would have to say was crap; It seemed old. I do get that they're a busy place and all, but stale/old bread is never appetizing at a restaurant. I wasn't all that fond of the mojito, but Mr. Face said that if I didn't finish it, I'd have to drive home... so I downed it at the end of the meal. 

Oh! We also ordered their lemon tart dessert at the end. It was good, but I feel that the dough used for the tart was too sweet/soft. I was also given a piece of tiramisu on the house for my birthday, but I didn't like it because there was just too much alcohol soaked in the cake...
author: Nga C.

description:
Delicious crab bisque, crab cakes & Caesar salad. Best at Pier 39, up stairs. 

If you're entertains family this is the cleanest fish place at the wharf.
author: B K.

description: Brought some friends from out of town here for dinner. They love the crab and we order Crab Feast (for 4 people) and they love it.
author: Sam M.

description: Love the crabs here, and their pasta are very decent as well. And I don't know how some people said the service is bad coz I think the service is 5 stars here. Will definitely come here again!
author: Cory J.

description:
this place is pretty good but probably wouldn't come back. my boyfriend and I came to sf from la and we wanted to try something but it's a pretty touristy place and price is pretty expensive. we ordered a double crab with double shrimp and scallop. the bill came out to be $100. and being Asian and all, we like eating the head but they clean out the head so you only get the legs. overall, there was a lot of meat in the crab legs and their sauce was awesome!

service was really good as well as how fast the food came out.
author: Tiffany H.

description: So we came to this place because we wanted good seafood on the infamous pier 39, except we didn't find any.  We ordered the too two crab, garlic noodles, and the crab chowder (you always order the chowder wherever you go), needless to say it was $117 thrown away.  Crab house's service was horrible and the food was mediocre at best.  Everything was bland and not worth spending the extra money for "good" seafood.  I don't recommend this place to anyone and definitely will not be coming back.  SF is a good time but if you're looking for good seafood don't come to crab house.
author: Phirak K.

description: I just ordered take out and every condiment I asked for,  they were out of.  Stay ready so you don't have to get ready.  Business 101
author: Charles J.

description:
The crabs with the garlic butter sauce were yummy.

We also got the mussels and shrimp on a grilled platter and that was really good too. The garlic butter dipping sauce made everything yummy.

Garlic noodles with crab was delicious but a bit too garlicky.

They had a grilled cheese for the kids and that was so yummy.

Definitely worth coming back too.

Good idea to make reservations.
author: Kim N.

description: Fresh crabs, long lines. The garlic sauce is awesome. Also tried the pasta with mussels and shrimps, which is also quite delicious. Reservation does NOT guarantee a table but indeed helps move your position forward (My reservation was at 12:30 and I stilled waited for another 15 minutes before I got assigned to a table). -1 star due to overpricing. They will charge HOGM.
author: Haiguang D.

description:
Service was top notch, Carlos, our waiter is funny, helpful, and knowledgeable about their food and wine.

However, I did expect more from their food.
We had the Iron Skillet-Roasted Double Crab & Mussels, (double means ONE crab, funny...),
the crab is a bit over seasoned and the iron plate dries up the juice, makes the crab meat too hard to consume.

*Mixed Seafood Cioppino (Medium size), great for two people to share and loaded with seafood, but not the best Cioppino I ever have,

*Fried Calamari, ordered the small one but still a very good portion, the squid is juicy and crispy but I'm not a big fan of the chili that they put in.

Overall we had an excellent birthday meal, price wise is reasonable for SF Fisherman's Wharf, but we're not likely to come back because there're many wonderful restaurants around to explore.

3.5 star but round it off to 4.
author: Faust T.

description: The service was excellent and the crab angel hair is one of the BEST pasta dishes I've ever had. I'll definitely be going back during my next visit to San Fran!
author: Qiana L.

description:
Best. Garlic. Roasted. Crab. Ever. 

Service - the service here seriously deserves at least 6 stars if I could.  Very attentive, super friendly, quick service.  I felt like everyone who worked there truly wanted to make the customers happy and provide a satisfying dining experience.

We ordered the $100 platter -- enough for 4 to share, it says. It was pretty good, for four, I guess... considering we had a party of 6, and 2-3 people didn't really eat a lot of the crab... but since I'm a crab fanatic, I'm not gonna complain. More for me ^_^.

Bruschetta - way too overpriced in my opinion. two little pieces.. Typical bruschetta, nothing special to be honest.

Calamari - large portion, not too salty, nicely battered... semi-typical. Nothing too special about this one either, but definitely nothing to complain about.

Lobster chowder - nice and creamy, not too heavy... flavor was pretty much perfect. The only thing was, it was only slightly warm... and I like my chowder HOTTTT! Not warm, not hot, but HOTTTT. (Yes, with 4 T's, and no, I will NOT settle for less).

Fish and chips - not your typical fast food / long john's over-battered oily fried fish. The outside was crumbly in a very good way, and the fish itself was soo juicy and tender. Yum. The "chips" part consists of garlic fries -- also made to absolute perfection. Best garlic fries I've ever had, and trust me, I'm pretty much a slut when it comes to garlic fries. (I mean, I've been around, and I've had plenty.)

The only reason I docked one star was because I think it was very high in price. The place isn't too fancy looking, and our bill came out to be about 220-250ish for 6. (Forgot exact amount). That's like a $40 meal per person! (Yes, I can do math).

**See pics for all the food that was listed -- yes, I was in paparazzi mode, and yes, the people around me were staring, but so what? Don't judge**.
author: Cindy C.

description: I came to crab house with a friend for her birthday. We were treated horribly by our server.... He even called one of the bussers a "Pisa" and saying its first day on the job and he slacking. Basically, when he was off the clock, he told me and my friend later on the pier when he seen us "we need to go to mcdonalds with that shit" because we didn't leave him a big tip....10 wasn't enough? He said we were being cheap! I was speechless...........and he even used to N word.... Very offensive! I have him in video saying everything as well
author: Mellisa R.

description: We stopped in here on a busy Saturday, the weekend of the Chinese New Year Parade, so everywhere was super busy. Checked in at the front and the manager said he would have a table by the window for us in 10 minutes! True to his word we were seated and having drinks by the window within that 10 minutes! Service was quick and food was delicious. We had fish n' chips with garlic fries-very good! Our son's had a crab chowder bowl which was fantastic and burger prepared well. Also, shared a yummy, but pricey Tiramisu. All around us people were eating crab, which looked awesome. Prices are a little lofty, but expected on Pier 39. Overall great experience and would recommend. We'll be back!
author: S. H.

description: An absolute must-visit for anyone who likes eating crab. Their standard Dungeness killer crab is excellent and always served promptly. They also have other good options like shrimp and fish. Been here for many years during my trips to San Francisco - will probably be back for many years to come.
author: Michael C.

description:
It was my last night in San Fran after a week-long business trip last month.  I finally had some down time to explore the Bay so I headed off to Fisherman's Wharf.  Decided to stop in to the Crab House after glancing at their menu and was glad I did.  It was still fairly early in the evening, 5ish, so there wasn't a crowd when I was seated.  Service was quick and friendly.  I asked my server for suggestions and he happily obliged, noting the different menu options and answering my questions.

Though I felt it was a requirement that I should order crab, I decided on the mixed seafood cioppino instead and was happy I did.  Generous portions of shrimp, fish, mussels, and crab stewed perfectly in a light tomato broth.  It was hearty but not heavy.  Nicely presented in a ceramic tureen.

I was hoping, since I was a lone party, that I'd get a table with a nice view of the pier, and instead was seated in the middle of the restaurant.  It wasn't crowded so I could still see out the expansive windows, but if I were to come back here, that'd be one thing I'd request...a nice window seat.  Regardless, my table was comfortable, and the Crab House itself has an elevated casual vibe.  A few big groups (8+ people) started trickling while I was midway through my meal...and I was tempted to stay and order crab/shrimp/mussels after seeing them being served to the groups.

Glad I made my way here before I left SF.  I'll remember it the next time I'm in town.
author: Irene Z.

description: I booked a seat on Yelp, when I arrived, they really left a seat near window to me. The view is awesome! What I love the most is the crab chowder! Amazing!!!
author: Lillian R.

description: I was not impressed with this place.  The only thing that had great taste were the oysters on a half shell.  The New England clam chowder was bland and the fried calamari was only OK.  The waiter was great he was very tentative.  But I came in for more than just the service.  I want great food too.  Oh well, maybe the cook had a bad day. There were little pieces of clam shells in the clam chowder too or was that sand?
author: Ramón Y.

description:
While doing the touristy thing at Fisherman's Wharf, I really wanted to take advantage of the local seafood, so after scanning the reviews, menus, and prices, I settled on the Crab House.  I had a great time and the food was delicious; my server and the other staff were attentive and friendly.

I arrived early, right at 11:30 on a Friday for lunch, and by the time I left, the restaurant was full.  However, I was seated right by the window overlooking the bay, with a view of the sea lions, Golden Gate, and Alcatraz--perfect!

I had the prix fixe menu, which was salad, a 1/2 "killer" crab, and tiramisu for dessert.  I also ordered some garlic fries, as I overheard someone saying they had come highly recommended.

The salad wasn't very fancy, but had a delicious, garlicky dressing; very tasty.  The fries really were awesome--crispy and covered with fresh garlic, parmesan, and parsley.  A small was a very generous size.

The crab was fresh Dungeness, served on a sizzling iron skillet.  At first, I was disappointed that more of the flavor of the sauce it had been tossed in didn't actually get to the meat, but there was plenty of it on the skillet to soak up.  Very tasty.

The absolute highlight of the meal, though, was the tiramisu.  It's not normally a dessert I would order for myself--just not my favorite--but since it came with the meal, I thought I'd give it a try.  Wow...SO good.  The cake was absolutely soaked in liquor and the coffee cream provided a light, tasty counterpoint.

My biggest complaint was the price.  For what was essentially four legs of crab, an iceberg lettuce salad, bread, and dessert, I paid $30.
author: Amy H.

description: I am a crab snob.  I really only like dungenous.  I love the way this place prepare their crab.  They roast it in garlic and butter.  How can you go wrong.  The crab shell breaks easily because it's roasted.  Much easier to "get to", but it breaks into many small pieces.  So it's a messy business... But so delicious and worth the effort.  This place the menu is 85% crab.  Crab Omlet, crab chowder, crab Alfredo etc.  if you or your party aren't really into crab this is not the place for you.  The price is kind of high but the servings are generous.  And you are paying for their ocean front location on pier 39.  You do have to dodge a million tourists.  And there will be a wait because the place is always busy.  But if you love dungenous crab then this is your place.  It's my favorite crab place.  I like the romaine salad, the shrimp Alfredo is also very good.  It's light and not overwhelming with cheese which some Alfredo's can be.  They don't want you to linger because they want to turn their table.  But the large staff is fast and pleasant.
author: Malia K.

description: OMG, what kind of unprofessional attitude that Korean girl host have on us! We live in south bay and alway come here when ever we came in the area for many years. NOT anymore...!!! There are other 4 + stars restaurants on pier with 100 times better service.
author: Owen L.

description:
This place is amazing! I've been here a couple times. The food was great! I would've given this place 5 stars if the service was a little better. The food was a bit pricey, but I wasn't surprised since the restaurant is located in Pier 39.

We ordered the Dungeness Killer Crab that was good for 2, it was delicious! You can't go to this restaurant unless you try their crab. I mean... it is a crab house :) We also ordered Mussels & Shrimp on the skillet - it was delicious. We also ordered Calamari - it was good, pretty decent.

If you are looking for a nice spot to take your girlfriend/boyfriend or just want to go on a nice dinner, this is a good spot to go to.
author: Jadelann J.

description: It's ok .... presentation is amazing; food lacks flavor.  Not salt; but sum flavor .. my opinion. ..
author: D C.

description: The food was amazing as well as the view! Service was friendly, attentive, and personable. Food was delicious, especially the crab cakes, dungeon crabs, and crab chowder! The bread was really cold and hard, so we didn't eat much of that but who focuses on bread when you've got all the other good food coming out? It was a great experience, made us wish we lived in SF so we could dine here more often.
author: Mia T.

description:
Best crab I have ever had. They use a garlic sauce to cook it and it is amazing!

Don't waste your time eating the bread when it comes out, wait and dip it in the garlic sauce when the crab comes out. Delicious!

Everything is a la carte so some sides with the crab would have been nice, but still sooo good.
author: Eric D.

description: Best crab ever! Great fish and chip too! The highlight is the garlic French fries! I can eat it all day long! I love this place!
author: Shawn G.

description:
Awesome Garlic fries and Crabs .. YUM 
I had been to this place for every occasion like New year , b'day, my anniversary ,valentines day

For every occasion this is best of the best .
Yummy food , Awesome view, Amazing service , Reservation is must
author: Masiha H.

description: this restaurant is located at pier 39. so close to fisherman's wharf. like creb and shrimp so much! oyster is good aswell
author: Polaris Y.

description:
We treated ourselves to a wonderful crab dinner. My  daughter had the crab pasta 
I had the. Whole crab and my friend had the filet. 
The manager, hostess and staff were super friendly. But the biggest star was our server, Katri , was a joy and so polite 
She recommended the right amount of dishes and kept her cool with a busy 10 table station
Thanks Katri
author: elizabeth t.

description: I rarely write reviews but I had to for this place because not only are their crabs delicious, but their tiramisus are to die for!!! I ordered the prefix meal which includes a salad, an entrée of your choice, and a dessert aka the tiramisu sent from heaven. I will definitely stop by the next time I pay a visit to sf!
author: Sora Y.

description:
Dungeness King Crab in garlic, butter and topped with flavors of heaven. Oh my god...!

I had originally come here 10 years ago on vacation with my family. I had a hazy memory of myself being delighted by a giant crab, licking my fingers of that delicious seasoning and stuffing myself silly.

My memory did not do this place justice. I mean, in my head, in my memory, The Crab House was the best crab I had ever eaten! So coming back 10+ years later, I had really high expectations. I specifically made my bf drive out of the way after picking me up from the airport so we could find this restaurant and have crab just like I remembered. In my memory, I didn't even remember the name of this place. I only knew garlic dungeness kind crab at Fisherman's Wharf. So when we finally found it, I knew I had come home to heaven.

The prices are what you'd expect for seafood, but who really cares about price when we're talking about, and I'm really not exaggerating or hyping this place up, at least I'm not trying to, THE BEST CRAB I HAVE EVER HAD.

We ordered the crab and crab cakes as appetizer. $14 for two mini sized crab cakes by the way... so yeah, skip the crab cakes and save room for dungeness crab.

I only rave on about food when it truly blows me away and this place. Oh my god. Just thinking about it makes me want to drive to JFK, hop on the first plane 3000 miles away to San Fran and chow down. The garlic butter taste was in every bite. 

Last tip- You're going to want to start with the legs on this bad boy. Because, trust me, the body of the crab is the most succulent and you really have to save it for last. 

As touristy as the area is.. they really don't serve dungeness crab like this anywhere else.
author: Stephanie F.

description:
The "Killer Crab" was fun--a whole dungeness crab roasted in garlic sauce.  My husband generously cracked my crab for me.  I could have eaten the sauce with a spoon.  Luckily, I had ordered garlic bread

Plus, I saw Hank from Breaking Bad.  I'm easily amused.
author: Heather C.

description:
Worst place ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I came here years ago and it was one of our best place to go. Came here a day before thanksgiving, the table was dirty, dishes was awful and services is so bad!! Never going to make this mistake and come to this place!!! 
I order a whole crab and was moldy and stinky! I should've of take a picture but at that time I was pissed of the service and the food . Don't recommend this place at all.
author: Souhir C.

description:
Good food, good times!  
 I was with a coworker on our last night in San Francisco and decided to make our last night count by going to the pier.   

Loved the waiter who reminded me of a close friend of mine.  Very "hipster" but still relatable to us common folk.  

We ordered the cioppino (small) as an appetizer and a whole crab with double mussels.   Yum, yum, yum!!!!   Service was very quick.

I forgot to take a picture as I was memorized by the sizzling skillet and the garlicky goodness of the mussels drowned in red wine and the crab glistening like a trophy.

We dived in to the cioppino first and was not disappointed.  Generous portions of crab, mussels, fish and other tidbits (I think calamari?) floating in a sea of savory tomato based broth.  Yum!  My mouth is watering as I think of it.

The mussels were even better than I thought.  I had to stop myself from devouring the entire thing - my dining partner had to have some after all.   I turned my attention to the crab.  

We ended our meal with the lemon pie (yum) and the tiramisu (even more yum) and coffee.
author: S M.

description: This pic was based entirely upon yelp help! We are residents of the Bay Area and we wanted to show our out-of-town family a good restaurant at Fisherman's Wharf without being touristy. The crab was out of this world! The shrimp and mussels make it excellent hors d'oeuvres. The service was outstanding!
author: Early L.

description: The service are good, they add 4.5% to your total bill for the health care ( plus tip).  The food was good but not as good as a few years ago.
author: Eko K.

description: I only gave it two stars because of their service we was waiting for 2 hours and other groups came later and got seated before us. But the food is good far as the crab is mouth watering I was there on 06/27/15 @ 8:06
author: Latisha G.

description:
We didn't try the crab but they have absolutely delicious garlic fries and savory fried chips! 
Only downside was that they forgot to ask if we wanted drinks :(
author: Walter P.

description: Great crab for a tourist spot.  Great presentation! Our Server was below avg. (the blonde borat) was very disinterested and rude. The other servers seemed good. We ordered Lotsa Crab skillet and it was filling and garlicky.  My wife loved the crab. Overall very good.
author: Jesse T.

description: The crab didn't have much taste to it but the shrimp was good. I would highly recommend this place because the seafood wasn't like wow. Our waitress was a female and her customer service was very rude, it seem like she didn't care much. The view is good though.
author: Jeoly M.

description: This restaurant was convenient since we were already at Pier 39 to do some shopping and people watching. When we asked a store clerk at one of the shops where we should eat, she immediately said the Crab House. The service was super quick and we waited no time for a great table by the window, less than a minute for our drinks, and less than 10 minutes for our food. The food was good, we liked our calamari but wished the sauce tasted better than just ketchup. We got the whole crab with shrimp for $60, 2 beers, a glass of wine, and raspberry cheesecake for a total of $125. For the price, we left wanting more and better.
author: Heather A.

description: Stopped here for lunch today. We had a pound of the crab legs,  crab chowder, crispy shrimp and fish and chips.  The chowder was delicious,  crab legs were good but not the best, shrimp were great and so were the fish and chips.  I had a pineapple mojito which was very good. My boyfriend had an IPA. The service was fantastic. Super nice guy.
author: Sarah S.

description:
First the bad.  The place is crazy busy full of tourists, and really loud.  Fluorescent lights, marble floor and white subway tile walls feels like dinner in a school cafeteria ( or a subway!)
4 stars because all the staff were really friendly and hard working.  They serve fast and move the crowds through. The hot skillets full of Dungeness crab, mussels and shrimp are awesome. Bread, salad, and chowder OK but not great. Go here for convenience if you're at Pier 39 and for fast hot seafood, but not for atmosphere or romance.
author: Bob B.

description: Not bad. I got the crab and fillet. The fillet was delicious! The crab actually was not as good as I expected. The place was also a little dirty. Overall it was a fun experience but not worth going back for the price.
author: Adam M.

description:
The only thing worse than the food, is the service. The waiter couldn't have cared less. He threw a piece of cold hard bread on the table with no butter and never showed any interest in doing anything but the absolute minimum. We got the fish and chips which was hot, but very greasy. The fries tasted like they had picked up the flavor of the seafood. We were coming through SF and thought it would be fun to go to fishermans wharf and get something to eat. What a disappointment.
I understand that this is a huge tourist attraction, but if you're a tourist find somewhere besides this.
author: Chris K.

description:
Because of all the yelp reviews, we just had to try this place while on our trip to SF. We actually made reservations on yelp, which was really convenient. We arrived and they were pretty packed. Luckily for us we got seated pretty quickly and right next to the window so we had a really nice view of fisher's wharf. 

Our server was really nice and helpful and she brought us a loaf of bread to hold us down while we waited for our food. We ordered medium garlic fries,  medium iron skillet-roasted mussels and shrimp and a whole crab. Everything was cooked really well but favor wise, it was just okay, maybe because I'm just used to having super spicy cajun style seafood but the mussels, shrimp and crab was just too bland for me. Towards the end of our meal, our server just disappeared and my friend just went up to the hostess to pay for our meal. Overall, it's a good place to try once but I probably wouldn't come here again.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Although my overall experience was great, the price is quite unattractive. The restaurant is narrow so it can get very cramped when busy. The food is tasty and the crab is quite delicious. Their special sauce elevates the flavor. Each time I've been there, the service was great, and food service is very fast. Like I said, my only gripe is the price. Is double the price of what you could find outside at the seafood stands worth it? I'm not sure sure.
author: Murad P.

description:
The crab is really fresh. Unlike other places, it has a special garlic flavor. We also ordered crab chowder soup, it is surprising that there are actual crab meat in there.

We were sit beside the window, which has a super amazing view with the deck. Overall, I would recommend this place!
author: YT C.

description:
Loved it! Pier 39 is a bit of a tourist trap, but this restaurant was so worth it. 

For an appetizer, we ordered the grilled shrimp.. Which was delicious but mostly due to the dipping sauce that came with it. 
We came for the crab so we ordered the "lotsa crab" .. For two people it was more than we could finish and we were pretty hungry. As a side we got ordered the garlic fries and steamed veggies. One small order of each was plenty to share. The waiter was attentive, but a little too serious for the kind of restaurant it is. Otherwise, the service was unbelievably fast since the waiters send your order to the kitchen electronically as you're placing it (my beer was brought to the table before the waiter even finished taking our order). Definitely recommend it!
author: Illona A.

description: Defenitly a must stop  if you would like some great seafood and friendly staff. Next time I am in San Francisco I will stop by for some more great food!
author: Terry K.

description: For the price the food wasn't great. The crab chowder was disappointing, it was more like onion chowder. The crab alfredo was very bland. The restaurant was very crowded and they set my party of 7 at a very small table and no one could push their chair out. I'd definitely take my money somewhere else.
author: Sarah R.

description:
Great views of the pier while you're eating your garlic butter crab from a hot plate. It was good, but not "killer" as advertised.  $35 for two lbs of dungeness.  A little pricey for unspectacular crab, but considering the area, the price is okay. I think a restaurant downstairs was selling it at $12.95 for half a pound.  

The crab chowder was okay.  Nothing special, but lots of crab. 

The space is a bit cramped and the bathroom only has one stall, You might be better off going to a bathroom outside. Service is attentive.  Servers are constantly walking around.  They leave a pitcher of water for you at the table, but the servers still fill your glass. That's nice!
author: Dorothy N.

description: Loved it. Crab is very tastey , great customer service . Don't care for garlic butter. Crab had enough butter and garlic anyway
author: Lexy P.

description: This place is on peir 39 on the second level.  Good customer service and a fun place to stop in. The menus a bit expensive. Cheapest meal was about 20bucks. I had shrimp alfredo. The shrimp was delicious bug the pasta was bland. I had to add salt/pepper/parmesian to get some flavor. Overall it was a decent meal. Everyone else was eating seafood and really enjoyed they're meals.
author: Alessandra N.

description:
Pricey, but as expected at SF Wharf.

For a group of four, we ordered:
- Large Calamari (which was huge- photo taken) - really good
- Crab chowder - it was just ok - we will skip this next time
- Crab Feast - GREAT
- Sides - Veggies and Pasta - MEH - skip this too.
- Wine

$220 plus tip

Wished there was steamed rice! heehee

The service was great. Parking is validated. Our friends from Texas wanted to come visit us again so we can take them there again.
author: Riza T.

description: We love Crab House! Crab chowder is delicious! And you MUST get a whole crab. That's why you're there;) Open seating in the bar if there's a long wait.
author: Cori C.

description: Awesome crab on a skillet platter with great seasoning. It was well packed when we went with a 20-30 minute wait but well worth it. We ate late afternoon/early evening and tended to be fairly warm in the restaurant in October timeframe. Definitely will go again!
author: Chris A.

description: FINALLY  whole new management and staff. After 2 yrs of stuck up, cold and rude service waiters. Today i saw all new faces. My waiter Joy gave me amazing service. Bringing the extras i prefer while dinning at crab house without hesitation or rude attitude as i have received in the past 2 yrs. i am faithful and have been visiting crab house for over 5 yrs now. I loved the crab but hated the service so i stopped coming here. But today the food was hot and fresh. The portions for once in a very long time were generous and Joy my waitress was the sweetest and most accommodating ever. I asked for the bread to be warmed up and she kindly said she would ask the chef. He sooo kindly did so and it made our Cioppino taste even better. Thanks to todays chef!!! And as always i thank the bustboys who have never dissapointed me in all 5yrs. Often times they were more attentive and generous than the rude and distracted waiters. Great job to the new management and staff at crab house! I will come back more often now.
author: Sharon C.

description:
My husband and I ordered the crab chowder and lotsa crab.
My husband thought the chowder was good but I thought it was ok and lacked salt.  We both found a few shells in it.  I didn't think that was too big of a deal.
The 3 lbs lotsa crab was delicious!  It comes served on a cast iron skillet which kept it HOT the whole time.  That's a first for me and we eat a lot of crab.  The garlic butter sauce really made the dish.  The secret is to dip the crab into the bottom of the cast iron skillet to get some extra sauce.  The sauce is also great to diip the sourdough bread in.
I would highly recommend this place.  We chose it over Fog Harbor.  I should note that our reservations were at 5:15pm and they were still packed.
author: Tanya S.

description: It's between two and two and a half stars... the food is just ok. The service is also just ok. I wouldn't go back. Nothing to seriously complain about though. Too expensive for the quality. The crab cakes were very crabby though - that much I can say.
author: Joanna S.

description:
You can find this place on Pier 39 right behind an ice cream shop upstairs(I believe it was Haagen Daz or Dreyers). The inside was white with boating decor. The staff was very attentive. Our waitress greeted us within 5 minutes and took our order ASAP.

We ordered the "a lotta crab" which is a bunch of crab legs sauteed in their sauce. There's something about eating fresh crab that makes it all the better. The sauce tied in perfectly with the crab, however, I still stuck to my lemon pepper dip. 

We also ordered the calamari. It was lightly battered and tossed in with jalapenos and red peppers. The dipping sauce wasn't too heavy or light, it was perfect. In addition to the calamari, we got the garlic fries. Both were delicious.
author: Jennifer N.

description:
I have not written a review before, but I was compelled to share this ridiculously rude and disappointing experience with The Crab House management. Our group of 42 found our ideal restaurant choice in the Fisherman's Wharf area. I worked with Cody, Manager (seemingly very helpful), to create a fixed $50 banquet menu, shared our RSVP headcount, and submitted the required written banquet reservation form 7 days prior to our group event, guaranteed with my credit card.  Cody emailed 7 days prior, "Perfect, I have everything I need. Look forward to seeing you next Saturday."  

Less than 24 hours before our reservation, on the way to our airport flight to SF, he calls to inform us that The Crab House unfortunately cannot honor the reservation due to capacity challenges (we would occupy 1/3 of the space on a Saturday afternoon).  Are you effing kidding???  What type of restaurant would ethically do this?  We already had an off peak hour reservation at 4:30, so I offered to shorten our meal duration from 120 minutes to 90 minutes and move it up to 4pm.  Or break us up into 3 groups for seating. They remained faintly apologetic but inflexible, only offering us walk-in status, not even on the reservation slate.  Nor did he offer to make any effort to arrange substitute reservations at their sister restaurants and placed blame upon being uninformed of the restaurant owner's "new policy." They were obviously not willing to make exceptions through this policy to serve willing patrons through the transition.

Our group of families ended up having a fast food dinner at the Ferry Building. Embarrassed by this disastrous dining situation, I would absolutely not recommend The Crab House to anyone and will encourage our group to anti-crusade against this and their associated establishments. Their level of unaccommodating, non-service to prospective patrons is absurd, shameful, and unjustifiable.  Hopefully others seeking to have a moderately sized group dinner here will be dissuaded from wasting time arranging an event, at risk for breach of contract or other dubious practices.
author: Tanya R.

description: I have been yelping for just a little but, but not until today did I have an actual person from any establishment message me back to say anything at all.  Today I received a message from Crab House stating they were excited to please me.   Such and excellent company all the way around, and I will say it again, GO THERE, YOU WILL MOT BE DISAPPOINTED ALL THE WAY AROUND.
author: Aaron F.

description: It was good. We had combo mussels, shrimps and crab set for 2 people. It wasn't enough and there are only 3 or 4 crab legs. So if you are there for the crab don't order anything named mussels in it. Cuz you will get a lot of mussels and nothing else. I mean taste was good. It was good for its reputation but if you are there for the crab, order a whole crab. It's simple as that. If you are a group of 2 it's quite easy to get in. But if you are group of more than 4 you might have to wait quite a bit. Overall not bad.
author: Jake B.

description:
So it was about time I would write a review on my absolute favorite place in the WORLD to eat crab, The Crab House at Pier 39.  

The Dungeness crab is to die for here, I think that the best part is their secret garlic sauce, which I sometimes order extra on the side for after  I crack all the deliciousness crab meat out of its imprisonment shell. 

The added bonus is that once you are seated the wait staff is extremely fast and attentive to get you what you need. It's like they know you are spending some $$$ so they want to respect that..as it should be. Food also comes out almost immediately, I have never waited more than 10-15minutes for my food. Also great views of beautiful Golden Gate and SF Bay. 

Here's what you should know before you go. Be prepared to spend at least $50 per person here if you are ordering crab, this does not include alcohol, sides, drinks, or appetizers. The appetizers are not that much to rave about and I would say I have been disappointed a few times with the selections I have made as they tend to lack flavor, which is ironic because their seafood main dishes; crab, shrimp, mussels are popping with flavor.  Bruschetta is a usual, good, but not the greatest (it could be improved). As far as sides, it's lacking having only three choices and one being garlic fries, really?!?!  Also , this is a small small place and it is usually a tourist hotspot which means it gets crowded. Don't except to show and get seat it, you will be waiting. Best suggestion make reservations as they are quick at seating you and usually they have openings available. 

I have been patronizing this place since 2008 and I go three/four times a year. At one point I was going monthly because I lived closer to the city. If crab is what you want then this IS the place, and you will not be disappointed.
author: Giemar F.

description:
Crab house is a must try!  I can not believe I have lived in the bay area my whole life and only ate here once.  


My boyfriend and I came here on a date night, we were so pleased with the yummy food, we are still talking about it! 

Our food was served on a cast iron griddle filled with shrimp, crab, and mussels. I recommend it :)
author: Erica R.

description:
CRAB CRAB CRAB. The best crab in San Francisco I have ever had outside of crustaceans and the Crab House is much more affordable.  I brought some out of town guests here and they are still talking about Crab House til this very day.  They were so upset they did not get the chance to go back again before they left.  

They bring the crab sizzling on a hot plate, the dipping sauce is great too. 

Had a few drinks as well, they were good too.  All and all everything is good and you can't go wrong at this place.  Tourist will love it and crab lovers will love it too.  

I'm going back in two weeks for a birthday celebration.
author: chazz l.
