description: Crab, shrimp, & mussels...all were pretty good, so there were no complaints at my table. But those garlic fries? Those were better than the rest for me...would've been happy with those alone (more than generous portion to boot).
author: D C.

description: Nice place for a quick lunch! Friendly staff and great food! There clam chowder was very good.
author: Karen B.

description:
I'm so crabbed out!! Went to PPQ last Sunday, and Crab House at Pier 39 yesterday. Crab house was good.

The 4 of us ordered the CRAB FEAST (dinner for 4) for $100. Some other yelpers were complaining that it took like 5 minutes for the food to come out, but i don't see why that is a problem. The killer crab is a popular dish and this place is a busy establishment, so if the food comes out fairly quickly, then that just means Crab House is very well prepared to supply the demand! :P  

Anyhoo, the crab is friggin' delicious! It came out on an iron hot plate and was cook to perfection. It was accompanied by 2 types of dipping butter: Garlic and Lemon.  The garlic one is mehhhh, but the Lemon Butter is AMAZING. 

The complimentary bread is cold and hard as a rock, but who wants to fill up on bread anyway when you are having the crab FEAST? Use the bread to sop up the buttery crab juices on the hot plate. Yum yum yum..........!
author: Jennifer C.

description: Love everything about this place 100% recommend this restaurant. Love the garlic fries.
author: Alma P.

description:
If you aren't sure where to get crab around the Wharf, Crab House is a solid place.  For a good deal on crab, get the Crab Feast for $100.  It comes on a hot sizzling plate, the 6 lbs of crab steaming hot.  

We came on a Saturday night and had to wait over an hour, but thats okay, we just walked over to the seafood stands a block away and got some appetizers.

Try the garlic fries and the steamed mussels, both great options.  And for some awesome chowder, try the crab chowder, its like corn chowder with crab in it.
author: Kevin W.

description:
Came at peak dining hour around 7pm. Dropped by before we were hungry to put our name on the list, then walked around in the area for an hour. Worked out perfectly. 

Had the Lotsa Crab with the hubby, good portion size for two. I ordered a side of veggies, I'd suggest skipping it. 

The crab was worth the wait, only thing that took away from the experience was the waiter constantly trying to up-sell us on menu items (He initially insisted we get the larger portion Too Two Crab, as well as the Shrimp & Mussels). Kinda tacky and took away from the experience.

Overall, delicious meal!
author: Jannette C.

description: What you get from what you pay for is definitely not worth it here. This place is a typical "tourist rip off" place. Ordered the combo with the mussels, shrimp, and crab legs plus two more entrees. The quality of food is very mediocre or below, but combining this with their very high price, then it is definitely a never go again place for me.
author: George H.

description:
Yes, it's a bit over-priced (38.00 for a whole crab) and in a designated tourist trap, but when the food is so lip smacking delicious that I'm full until the next day, I call it a winner!

And for a garlic-lover like my, I'm drooling by the time the whole crab arrives on a platter, sizzling in oh-my-god-shoot-me garlic butter. The tourists were taking pictures of the crab, that's how good this place is.  My brother and I killed that thing a second time over, moist meat, slimy guts, and all. 

Also, the garlic fries are among the best. Perfectly slim and atrociously (in a good way) garlicky. I smelled like garlic the rest of the day. 

Cute crab decor, gorgeous view, and my brother called it the best meal of his life!
author: Jennie T.

description: Oh gosh had steam clams and crab chowder and they were so good. So the next time you get to San Francisco make sure you get to pier 39 and.stop and eat as everything looks yummy
author: Norma B.

description:
Went here around lunchtime on a Sunday.
I can say that the crab feast was really good, but our table was just super small for 7 people plus all of the drinks, crab, appetizers, etc. We couldn't  even fit our water jug on the table. After butter drenched crab, I need some water!

Service was OK, not sparkling. The water thing plus the lack of refills dropped a star for me (we had to wait for our server a few times).
author: Chris C.

description:
I came here after returning from the Alcatraz tour.  We were pretty hungry.

After perusing the menu and choosing the fish and chips, the server brought us some bread.  Just bread.  No butter, etc.

Being hungry, I went ahead and tore off a corner of the bread and ate it.  I would have liked to wash the dry bread down with some water but I couldn't seem to get a refill in my tiny cocktail glass.

When I asked for a tall glass of water, the bartender brought me one in a dirty glass.  Before noticing it was dirty, I took a sip and it tasted like dishwater combined with fruity soda water.

The fish and chips were good.  No complaints there.  The garlic fries were actually very good.  I recommend getting them if you find yourself here.

What else can I say that's positive about this place?  Oh yeah.  The view out over the water is really nice.
author: Will B.

description:
My fiancé and I visited The Crab House while on vacation over President's Day Weekend. Nice restaurant with good ambiance and gorgeous view of the San Francisco Bay! LONG wait time (probably due to the holiday) however once we were seated and had ordered our food came quickly. 

Ordered the medium shrimp & mussels iron grilled skillet and the shrimp iron grilled skillet and topped it off with the "infamous" garlic fries.  Great seafood w/ generous portions...definitely enough to share. The fries were good but not great. Definitely not an item worth ordering again. Loved the fact that they left a pitcher of water at the table! However my fiancé ordered lemonade which he said was greatly watered down. Our server was prompt, attentive and cordial. Overall, would visit again but definitely would make a reservation to avoid having the long wait.
author: Tasha M.

description: My family was very disappointed. In particular my crab with garlic butter noodles was terrible. They threw in a couple pieces of claw meat and the rest was some sort of terrible canned mix of shredded crab. Adding the 4.9% additional on to an over priced $38.00 about a cup full of pasta was redicilous for  "cost of doing business and government fees" very unprofessional. Wish I read this info first. I will never eat here again!
author: Jim H.

description:
BOMB!!!!need I say more!!
Worth every dollar!!!!
author: Melissa C.

description:
We ordered "lotsa crab" here and thoroughly enjoyed the amazing fresh Dungeness crab here.  Of course we also had to order the garlic fries (too many good "Yelp" reviews to pass them up.  We went there at noon on a Wednesday and it was not too busy to receive really good service.  We were well taken care of while there, and unlike some places in CA, they didn't make us feel like freaks or like we were putting them out by showing up with our five (5) children.

I'm craving fresh crab with garlic butter even as I write this!
author: David K.

description: The killer crab and crab chowder are the "must try". The food is tasty, but a little bit expensive. The style of this restaurant is casual. It's good for small party and family. The restaurant locates at the pier 39, a good place for dining, visiting, and enjoying the sea breeze. One hour free parking before 6pm or two hour free parking with validation in the its parking lot ($9 per hour is expensive for me).
author: Hongming L.

description:
Nice view. Crab melt was ok. Crab enchilada and crab lasanga was good. Service good except for the hostess who brought us to the table who was very rude. 
Probably won't come back because if her. There are so many other seafood restaurants in the area with the same food at same or cheaper prices.
author: Monique G.

description:
I'm surprised I forgot to review this restaurant - considering I come here almost every 1-2 months.  I tend to get a shocked reaction every time I tell people that I love this place too.  For one thing, being located right smack in the middle of Pier 39, Crab House is automatically perceived as the "touristy restaurant" that no local wants to eat at.  Fortunately, I have no shame!

CONS - Yes, it can be difficult to find parking here because it is tourist central.  Prices are slightly higher than they should be because, again, yes - it is tourist central.

However, the quality of their service and food really outshines everything else!  My favorite waiter is Rafet - who is literally one of the best waiters I've ever had.  For food, my default order is always 1/2 order of crabs and a side of garlic noodles.

On nights where I feel like being a total fatty, I'll order just one whole crab and eat it all by myself.  I would take their bread and dunk it into their sizzling hot, secret garlic butter sauce until there was nothing left...

Basically - they are known for their crabs.  If you don't like crabs, don't come all the way down here and waste your time!
author: Judy C.

description: Food was great. We had a whole crab and combo of crab, shrimp, and mussels. Also had crab chowder, it was ok, not to die for. Garlic fries were amazing! All seafood was amazing! Good came out really fast! The only negative is we were told a 45min wait but waited 2hours. Best to call n reserve :)
author: Marilyn S.

description:
This is one or our yearly, must, without a doubt, absolutely, gotta go to stops! Lemme tellya, if we're staying in San Fran, for 5 or 6 days, we're in this joint for 2 or 3 visits... no lying! 

Gotta get the crab for sure, (Killer Crab as patented) it's the only thing we come for! No soups, no salads, no pasta, just a pile of that sizzling on the pan, garlicky crab!!! They come to the table so sizzling hot, that when you grab um, you singe your digits. But who the hell cares.... I got more fingers.... I just gotta get um in my face! I'll dip the burnt fingers in ice when we're done. 

Two Grey Goose Martini's, to start. Then for appetizers, two Oyster Shooters w/ Grey Goose Vodka (The only way!) 

If we're alone.. it's the" Too Two Crab," @ $68.95 feeds 2-3 people. If we have company, and we normally do.... it's the "Crab Feast!" shares 4 @ $100.00. And on top of that we might order another pound or two, @ $19.95, each. 

You'll hear the crab coming before you see it. It's a pile of crustacean, on a sizzling pan, that is wafting wonderful garlic and crab aromas through the restaurant. I like the look on some of the patrons faces, with their look of .. 'Wow, what's that'... or the 'I wish we ordered that instead!' As the waiter put it on the table. 

You'll be surprised at how little conversation there'll be at the table. Oh, but there'll be noise.... cracking... licking,.....sipping,.... slurping,... chomping,... biting... ouch, that's hot! That quiet riot, will get get softer near the end, and then silence, as you contently view the carnage before you. 

But WAIT!!!.... What about all that buttery, garlicky, crab residue that's left on the pan? THAT... my friends, is what the sour dough bread is for!!!!! 

I'll admit, The Crab House at Pier 39, will not go away cheaply. 
But for attentive staff, the pier side ambiance, the fine spirit, and for the Crab, all about the CRAB! It's worth it totally.
author: Joe K.

description: Great for travelers and first time visitors. crabs are very fresh and I liked their fish and chips as well.  I would make a reservation to the seats by windows when you bring a date because they have an amazing view.
author: Tae Hwan I.

description:
Pricey menu and food.  
We ordered for 5 People:
Crab Angel Hair Lasagna $18.95
Double Shrimp & Two Crab $49.99
1 Whole Crab $37
Garlic Fries Medium $8
Crab Angel Hair Pasta $20
Garlic Bread $5

The food portion is decent.
Dining area is cramped.

I'm not from this area and never knew customer have to pay for workers health insurance which is very intresting.

Review via Blackberry Z10
author: TeaBoy A.

description:
I'm obsessed with crab this place is good.... But that's about it it's good. I don't really get the hype but hey a least it was decent. Place is pretty crowded so make a reservation if you don't want to wait long. Service was good not great but good.
    The only bad thing I would say about this place is I hate, repeat hate a dirty bath room, and this one is pretty nasty. Hey management if your going to be this busy make sure you clean the bathroom every hour! Having pee over both toilet seats is unacceptable.
author: Elena C.

description: The crab was over cooked so it only tasted average. The restaurant was "fine"'the prices should make it "good/great"
author: Michael L.

description:
I hate giving seafood places 2 stars, but in this case I must. 

My husband had reservations for 7pm on a Sunday. We get there and there's a huge line so we check in. Within 10 mins the host said our table is getting set up. Five minutes later we see a couple that just checked in got seated at our table by a different host. WTH? My husband asked our host and he says our table is being set up and will be ready soon. Too bad you said that 5 mins ago. 

We finally get seated by the window and the view would have been nice if it was still light out. Otherwise I'm just staring at the water and some logs. 

To start we ordered the iron skillet roasted mussels and it came out on a sizzling plate. Small mussels and okay flavor. Nothing explosive so that was a disappointment. The bread they served us was in a bag, cold and hard. No bueno. 

I also ordered the crab clam chowder and it was a full of stuff but a bit too bland. Like a party in my mouth without any flavor. 

We ordered the "Too Two Crab" that feeds 2-3 people and my husband and I were only able to finish one. I must admit, the crabs were huge and the most meat on a dungeness crab that I have ever seen. It was suppose to be seasoned in with pan roasted garlic sauce but I wish I had some lemon and pepper to make my own sauce since the crabs were very plain in flavor. FAIL. 

For over $100 for this meal, next time I'd rather head over to Crustacean's and devour their garlic roasted crab. This was a nice experience but I doubt we'll come back.
author: Betty D.

description: Second time eating here and the it's even better than the first time. I love seafood... Like really, really, really like seafood and and the iron skillet-roasted combo is amazing. Especially the tomato, garlic and butter sauce they have. I recommend to order some garlic bread either with cheese or without! Also I recommend ordering some delicious desert, like the chocolate truffle mouse cake... It's just aaaahhmmazzzzzinngg, that is all!
author: Lindsay S.

description:
Just what I thought a seafood joint in SF would be like.

This place is located upstairs on Pier 39.  The walls are covered in white tile and old crab shells.  It has an old school classic sea port kinda feel, which is perfect given the history of Fishermans Wharf.  We tried the crab chowder and Killer Crab.  The chowder was super good! Plenty of crab pilled on top of creamy, hearty chowder.  The Killer Crab was seasoned well and an ample serving.  The service is also top notch.  Courteous, attentive, and prompt.  This is definitely a solid pick if youre looking to get a taste of San Francisco seafood while taking in the atmosphere of the bay.
author: Sam P.

description: Couldn't even tell you what the food was like Jc the hours on this site for the restaurant are completely wrong. Very annoying
author: Clare P.

description: Stopped in to the Crab House on a mission to eat crab, and that we did! As an appetizer we shared a bread bowl of the crab chowder. I thought it was very tasty, but my other half wasn't that impressed. I don't think he liked the various vedge that was in the soup. Next we had a 'lotsa' order of the crab, and devoured it. We loved it so much we had another order. It was the most expensive meal of our trip to San Francisco... but I guess it was worth it.
author: Heather G.

description: Killer crab on the sizzling plate is delicious! Perfectly seasoned. The mussels are delicious as well and I love the butter sauce with capers!
author: Tracy N.

description:
Went to the crab house with my mom in December 2012 and it was amazing.

We had the crab bisque, Parmesan French fries, and crab garlic linguine. It was definitely not a diet friendly place but everything we had was DELICIOUS.

You can't beat the views from the pier either. For serious crab
Lovers they serve legs by the pound family style that looked incredible.
author: Jessica H.

description: A place for tourists! The seafoods were not fresh at all! Really regret going there! And quite pricy!
author: Stef N.

description:
Not the best I've ever had, but certainly not the worst.  It's about what I would expect for a tourist trap, and as others have clearly stated, make sure your wallet is up to the task depending on what you order.  The crab cakes were a little smallish and greasy.  The garlic fries are quite tasty and they do emphasize the garlic.  If you can, sit by the window so you can watch the occasional sea lion that comes down to that end of the docks. :)

Overall, not a bad stop if you're thronging it on the pier.  However, my friends and I agree they should change their name to CRAB HAUS! for more panache.
author: Jessica J.

description: My Fiance' & I came here on Valentine's Day, February 14, 2014. We were immediately seated close to a window with a view of fisherman wharf, plus the sunset was beautiful. We ordered a bottle of resiling wine, which was sweet & tasty. As far for entrees, my fiance' ordered the chicken & garlic fries. I ordered the garlic noodles with crab meat. Both of the entrees were delicious. Our server always checked in on our table. I recommend everyone to try it & ask for the table with the view of fisherman wharf for the sunset view. ;)
author: Jaiesha C.

description:
The food is delicious!! Five stars no doubt!! The servers are polite and provide excellent service! But....

The manager (Male) was completely disrespectful and inconsiderate during our last visit. We visit San Francisco at least twice a month and always eat lunch at the crab house. We wanted to change seats literally one minute after being seated. Our server was very polite and helped us find another table. Then, I'm assuming the manager, comes to our table without introducing himself telling us that we can't switch tables in a VERY RUDE manner. He ruined my entire lunch!! 

The food is fantastic and it's going to be hard to find a similar restaurant but after this horrible encounter I don't think I can ever go back.... :-(
author: Krista P.

description:
My wife found this place on yelp and asked me to take her for lunch with kids.

I have been to Pier 39 million times since I was a kid but I never noticed this restaurant because it was located on the 2nd floor.

We ordered shrimp with an whole crab and a seafood pasta.

The crab and the shrimp tasted pretty good but not as good as I expected.

The seafood pasta was really an average.  Not even close to Pasta Pomodoro's.

I could have been happier if I didn't order the pasta.  Also, don't order the kids meal with fried fish.

It is a garbage. Your kid probably will not finish it. =)
author: James A.

description:
If you can get past the fact that Crab House is pretty touristy, go stuff your face.  It's located near the end of Pier 39, so you get a great view of the seals and Alcatraz.  If it's dark outside, don't worry... Alcatraz is well lit and the seals aren't short on words.

A friend and I decided to order crab legs for two with garlic fries.  While waiting on the order, the drinks came out faster than we could understand.  Seriously, we actually joked about the speed of the specialty drink delivery.   We were two guys with big appetites and were no match for this order.  Sadly, we left two legs on the table.  By the way, they aren't playing games with the garlic fries.
author: Will L.

description: Good service. Beautiful view if you're near the window, but not worth the money. The shrimp cocktail was 3 skewers of TINY shrimp that looked like they came out of a frozen grocery aisle. The crab Alfredo was delicious but not worth the 20 bucks. I wouldn't go here again. Boiling crab is 10 times better.
author: Nina W.

description: Food was great, atmosphere not so great. Crazy loud and super busy even on a school night. Floors of the place kinda grossed me out slippery as owl crap! Maybe it was all the crab butter. For my money I would go else where.
author: Bob U.

description: Every visit here was enjoyable. The wait can be as long as an hour or even longer, so RSVP because it is in the tourist area. Also, park at the Pier 39 parking structure because they do full validation. Got seated next to the window where there was a view of the bay. Service was wonderful; the waiter was very helpful with choosing the wine and was very attentive. Ordered a cup of crab chowder, calamari, and too two crab (or two too, something like that). All were delicious. The chowder was full of crab and veggies, calamari was ordinary, but since bell peppers were added to it, it gave it more of a kick. As for the crabs itself, beyond words can describe. They are definitely known for their crabs, lots of flavor and lots of meat. This will always be a favorite spot to eat when it comes to crabs. But there is one con, it's their restrooms. The restrooms can be super dirty because it's shared, there's no separate restrooms. Other than that, this is the place to be.
author: Rochelle G.

description: I got da double shrimp and crab next morning i was sick too much oil on it  worse seafood ever!!! bad bad service
author: Franklin M.

description:
I was back to it and The Crab House meet myu already high expenctations from my previous visit!
The crabs are simple one of a kind!
author: Luis Pablo A.

description:
The dungeon crab is a MUST!!! Don't hesitate to get dirty & down w/ the crab because that's the only way to eat them. Along w/ that, my boyfriend & I had the mussels & shrimp skillet & garlic fries. It was so good & satisfying. The food wasn't too overwhelming or heavy.

Nice decor. I like how they hand painted the dungeon crab shells & used them as decor. Perfect for groups & families.
author: Olivia S.

description: Shrimp and mussels skillet was great. Crab cakes, garlic noodles with crab off the hook. Bowl of crab chowder was excellent too. Great place for lunch at the wharf.
author: Denny M.

description: I wish I could give 0 star. Food just okay,nth special .... Service is terrible. Manager is rule and impolite. Whole experience was bad. I would never return.
author: Yanxia C.

description:
Located upstairs at the back of Pier 39, this place was not easy to find, but the food was really good. Highly recommend the crab chowder, crab cakes, garlic fries, and of course the main course which is crab. The garlic butter sauce was excellent and went very well with the crab dish.

Will definitely return here again when I am in San Francisco.
author: Eric BC L.

description:
I came here with my buddies because a friend of mine had suggested the crab with the secret garlic sauce. It was a Saturday, almost noon. The place was a bit empty so they seated us next to the windows where our view was great (pictures to be posted).

We started off the with Bruschetta for appetizers which was pretty good. I also ordered the Crab Chowder which wasn't too bad. A buddy of mine shared the Dungeness Killer Crab with me. We ordered the 3 lbs for $50. It was good but wasn't as great as I envisioned. Maybe my friend who recommended this place to me over hyped it. I don't know if I would order it again. They did give us bibs though and it sure was messy. I'm usually too lazy for that kind of stuff but I was like screw it.

Before we left, the place was pretty packed. The rest of the day, I was walking around with the taste of garlic and oil in my mouth. I had a sudden craving for frozen yogurt or ice cream because of it. So after chewing a few pieces of gum, I went back to my hotel and brushed my teeth right away. All in all, it was a decent experience. I don't know if I would come back because it didn't impress me that much.
author: Smitcha B.

description: Great place! Servers were great, polite and attentive. We booked ahead and were seated straight away before any other "drop ins". Amazing table next to a window with a great view. Even though this is a touristy area I highly recommend this place to anyone. We had the mussel, shrimp and crab combo with a large fries. Don't go large the fries were a huge portion for me and my husband. The seafood was excellent we thoroughly enjoyed it! Loved it! Highly recommend!
author: Joely D.

description:
Definitely worthy of the three $$$ price. We ordered the Crab for 4, two filet mignon's, shrimp and mussles. Bill with tip ended up being $300. For a weekend for 5 after watching Amaluna we wanted to try an upscale place.

The place is a little on the narrow side when it comes to walk through but with space at a premium, cant' expect too much. Food was great, worth the price, the steak portion size was a little small and felt funny sideing it with fries (probably ordered by a friend), but most memorable was the service. Our waitress was fantastic. Was on top from the get go, had our orders correct, and explained the time spent cooking the steak. She wasn't going to read Shakespeare to us but at this price point, I'm happy with it. One benefit that put it over the top was, as expected, our girls wanted to take pictures of ourselves with the ubiquitous seafood bib and our sizzling crab, and she knew exactly how to photograph, asked if it was good enough, and was just flat out excellent.
author: Noel M.

description: Crab chowder and sauteed crabs...cannot ask for more.  Check this place out if you are in the area.
author: Stuart B.

description: We got a table near the windows and it is really nice to see the view of the sea while eating delicious food! The seafood soup (the red one, sorry I forgot the name) is really good and has a lot of seafood in it, my personal favorite!
author: Vivien L.

description:
Very nice atmosphere right off the pier. The food was great too and make sure you order the crab the quality is amazing and delicious! 

The service was great too. They had a guy who was standing over us in the corner making sure we we're okay at all times although he did forget to get the lemons we asked for but it's okay.

The ground was super slippery so just be careful of where you step. Overall a great experience that we would definitely go back and do again.
author: Jamin L.

description: Great place to go if you're in the mood for crab.  Service  was excellent!  We had the whole crab, steamed clams, garlic noodles and fish and chips.  Everything was excellent!  I don't usually eat crab,  but their secret garlic flavoring on it was too good not to enjoy.  I would definitely come back here again!
author: Anh N.

description: OMG!!!  What a meal!!!  Crab and shrimp. $65 lunch but WORTH IT!  Cool atmosphere and delicious food. The server was very helpful as well
author: Kevin S.

description: The crabs tasted old and dry. We were wayyy overcharged. Try another place away from here.
author: Dale M.

description: My wife and I came here for a trip a while back. We found this restaurant on yelp and were beyond satisfied. All of their menu items were amazing and the service was great. The bar menus was also great!
author: Brett M.

description: We had a great afternoon at Pier 39.  The Crab House was great.  There was a wait but not bad. The service was good.  The crab was delicious and hot!!  Just a fun experience.
author: Liz H.

description:
I'm going to tell you about my first experience here.  My sisters and I had just eaten breakfast and lunch.  As we were checking out Pier 39, we walked past by this restaurant by chance and it smelled so good.  The place was packed and happening so we decided to indulge since how often are we in SF.  There was a long wait with the option of sitting around the fireplace on bar stools.  We agreed to that and ordered the crab.  The crab and its sauce was so delicious!  Dipping the bread in it makes for a great meal.  My sisters still have that memory and can't wait to go back.

As for me, I've been here twice with friends (they've both liked it) and recently with my bf.  I wanted him to have  a taste of it.  Everyone who has gone there with me loves it.  For my recent experience, we ordered the 2 - 2/12 lbs of crab (basically 1 crab), garlic noodles, and garlic fries.  The crab was good. It wasn't as good as the first time I had it but it was still good.  1 crab is more than enough to feed 2 people so keep that in mind.  I had the garlic noodle before and didn't think too much of it.  I regret ordering that.  I was imagining the linguini type.  The garlic fries were very good. It came out to around $50 for 2 people. If you're ever at Pier 39, definitely check this place out.  It's on the 2nd level behind all of the stores.  It has a pretty good view of the bay.
author: Kaylin O.

description: The crab chowder was excellent, however the main course crab was not impressive. The meat was a little bit dry and the flavor was too salty. I didn't taste the freshness and sweetness of crab.
author: Dean L.

description: Crab House is convenient in that it's on Pier 39, and if you sit by the window, you'll enjoy a beautiful view of the waterfront. Crab, mussels, and garlic noodles were pretty standard, but I really enjoyed the shrimp. If you're looking for good crab and garlic noodles, I recommend PPQ instead.
author: Kelly R.

description:
The food (especially crab) here is really good. If you want clam chowder, this is probably the one place in Pier 39 you cannot get any--they have CRAB CHOWDER :)

The crab is great, and if you have someone to share with, order the portion that shares for two people to get the most bang for your buck. 

During our visit it seemed that the entire staff could have used a bit more training/experience.  The hostess claimed that she had called our name and we had missed it and had to wait more for our table (we were sitting directly behind her at the bar and were listening intently).  The bartender poured very messy--wine all over the outside of my wine glass -_-.

Anyway, I do enjoy the food here but the place gets extremely crowded (some parties shared large tables). If you really have to dine inside the tourist-ridden Pier 39, this place isn't too bad compared with everything else you deal with at this pier.
author: Anna V.

description:
ok crab house. I've been here before already and this most recent time, your hostess or supervisor, whoever she is, just had to tick me off. 

it was 1:30pm already, and it was going to be a late lunch. my girl asked for how long it would be for a table of 5, and the hostess said 40 MINUTES. ok fine, we'll wait (as i saw some empty tables already)

and next thing you know, this GROUP of 8 people (obviously some european tourists) walk in after to ask how long the wait was for their group of 8. As that happened, I decided to easedrop see how long it was for them. CLEARLY, the hostess said it would only be 10 minutes for them. 

So, I went ahead myself and asked how long the wait for 5. She quoted again about 40 minutes. So, I asked why is it only 10 minutes for them when they're a table of 8 and it's 40 minutes for a party of 5. IT MADE NO SENSE. The hostess had the guts to say "Oh it's because we would put two small tables together to make one table for them since they have 8" and so you wouldnt do that for a smaller party? it literally makes NO SENSE. If they were willing to do that for them, they wouldnt just give us a small table to fit 5? that is the dumbest EXCUSE i've ever heard. goodjob trying not to bust yourself out. 

it was obvious that they were willing to go out of their way for some european tourists that look like big money spenders while leaving me and my party aside just because we were some locals or whatever. 

you know what's even better? i LEFT and went to a better restaurant that had BETTER service instead of dealing with your crap.
author: Kenny L.

description:
This is a very difficult review for me to write.  I want to start by saying, that in the past this has been one of our favorite places to dine in the city.  I would have given it a pass if it wasn't for the following events.

My husband and I had dinner a little over a weak ago.  We came into the city on a Saturday night for reservations at 5:30.  When we first arrived I was surprised at the lack of customers, the place was almost empty.  We were seated and after some time our order was taken.  A couple was seated next to us about 15 min after we arrived.  We watched as the couple finally left after 10 minutes of waiting and no one came to help them or ask if they needed assistance.  Considering the place was almost empty and the staff was standing around I felt this was completely unacceptable.  So, to go on the food was terrible, the garlic noodles where NOT cooked and had no flavor and the crab was dry and bland.  As we left I asked to speak to the manager, after waiting about 10 minutes we finally left.

Now this is what I have the biggest issue with.  The next day I get a email from the manager saying how sorry he was and what could he do to assist me.  WOW I thought maybe it was just a bad night and a one time thing.  I immediately emailed back all my concerns and I am STILL waiting.  No additional email no call no NOTHING.  I assume they have a new manager and maybe even a new cook, but that is no excuse for reaching out to a concerned customer and then never follow up.  I could have over looked the staff, the food, and the lack of organization.  I can not over look going out of your way to try and fix a problem and then not caring once you find out what the problem is.

I gave it a week still no response so now I am writing my review.  We will not be back.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
I was at Fishermen's Wharf during the Labor Day long weekend for a hearty, memorable lunch and the great Yelp reviews brought me into the Crab House. I have to say my friends and I were lucky as we didn't have to wait for a table and we were brought to a nice table for 4 next to window over looking the bay. :)  (Justifies the restaurant price for us really..heh heh ;))

We ordered the garlic steam clams which is really, really delicious but the dungeon crabs in their garlic butter sauce was just average to us. We also had their garlic fries which was pretty nice and their garlic pasta which was not bad, not too garlicky, for some carbs to go with your seafood. I like that they provide us with this plastic bib to wear just in case of any 'flying accidents"- I'm sure you still want to step out of the crab house still looking fabulous!

Truth be told, I've tasted much better crabs.. if you think this is the best crabs you've ever had, you gotta try the chilli or the black pepper crabs in Singapore (they use Sri Lanka crabs) They are still the very best- you taste the sweetness of the crab meat while the black pepper sauce gives you the kick. 

I'll give 5stars for their clams and just 3 stars for their dungeon crabs. Their interior decor was very pleasant, like a beach house.  I will be back for just their clams when I go back to SFO. :)
author: Carina L.

description:
The crab here is like butter!  The meat slips out of the shell with such ease.  You become entranced by the taste and go into auto-pilot, cracking the legs and slurping the meat until everything is gone.  I wish I could prepare crab as decadent as Crab House!  

I also thoroughly enjoyed the crab chowder.  It's a thick base, with big chunks of fresh crab and vegetables.  A bowl is easily shared by two people.  Their garlic bread with melted mozzarella is delicious.  I just wish that for the price, you got a little more than just 4 slices.  

My only gripe has to do with the service.  First, we had to ask for bread several times before we got it.  Second, it took THREE different people to give our table individual sides of melted butter to dip our crab meat in.  First we got this bowl of who-knows-what sauce. so we asked someone else  Then, we got a bowl of melted butter to share amongst four people.  Still unsatisfied, we tried again and finally each got our own.

Eating here is not cheap, but at least they validate for one hour of parking!
author: Kristen D.

description: Food - Over hyped and over priced. Rude staffs, not worth the wait.
author: Paul L.

description:
Came here for great rate and wanted to have good seafood... i ask the server about the menu what usually people order and he just say the combo and he say he be back like didnt wanted explain..and we order the combo which had choice shrimp or clam with whole crab and I didn't know there was a choice and he just point the ( or) with the pen and didn't say anything and just stand there till my friend told me I had to choose ..I was kinda annoyed because right after people next to us the white folks they didn't even ask about the menu but he explain about what's good .. maybe we look cheap I guess..I'm a server so I know how we work for tip..so I always tip 20- 30 percent tip depend on the service .but I still tip him 15 and gave 5 $ to the busser ... so that guy was wrong about judging book by its cover..  
Food WA s good clam soup was good and garlic fries is must try.....loved it ..food 5 star but because service only 3.. pay 150.00 plus tip  ..and get this kinda service ...set next to the corner window vi e w was beautiful...
author: Jin J.

description: Touristy; hard on the wallet; tasty -- in that order. Stay away if you don't have a reservation!
author: Kevin M.

description: I forgot is way back April 17 I believed. You should definitely discuss with your staff and improve it!!!
author: Sally C.

description:
A whole 3+ pound of mouth watering garlic and herb drenched crab legs fresh from the water that was caught 10 feet away from where you were sitting.. What's not to like? The restaurant is located on the infamous Pier 39. It's famous for their generous portions of Dungeness crab freshly harvested in their signature rub. Pair that with a side of garlic fries and you got yourself a winner winner crab dinner. 

Also, their Great White ale is a great choice for your savory meal.
author: Andrew K.

description: Meh...mussels were wayyyy overcooked. Crab was tasteless and everything else was a greasy mess. Service was really good though.  Certainly not as good as it used to be....
author: Ani D.

description:
There was a short wait for a table and I requested one right next to the window overlooking the pier, near the sea lions. I loved the crabs that decorated the perimeter of the restaurant, each crab possessing a fun and unique costume...I'm talking taxi crabs, technologicrabs, you get the picture. 

To be different than the normal clam chowder, we ordered crab chowder ($6.95 cup, $9.95 bowl). It had chunks of vegetables but not too much crab in my opinion. The soup was also watery. I used most of my complimentary mini-baguette to soak up the liquids.  I packed the extra baguette in my purse. 

The soup was the only crab we got at the Crab House....I know, weird.  We also ordered garlic bread with mozzarella ($6.95), garlic noodles ($9.95), and a child's macaroni and cheese ($6.95). The garlic bread was only 4 pieces of bread (2 slices of baguette cut in half!) with cheese on top. The cheese was rubbery and didn't taste too much garlic. Plus it was a rip-off. On the other hand, the garlic noodles had tons of flavor. I have a thing for garlic noodles.  Slurppppp.

I also have a thing for macaroni and cheese. What's interesting is that their mac 'n cheese doesn't use macaroni, but fettuccine noodles. Shouldn't you call it fettuccine and cheese?  The sauce was cheesy and thick, but pairing it with those long flat noodles doesn't feel right to eat it like that.  I have standards.

The best part of my meal was the pineapple mojito ($9.00). Probably one of the best I've ever had! I had to get two of them.  I probably would have ordered two even if they were horrible. 

I don't think I'll go back to the Crab House again for food. I can cross it off my list. If the crab chowder isn't to die for then I should be eating my crab somewhere else. But for a mojito.....I might reconsider....
author: Tiffany C.

description: I was in town for only a few days and this restaurant is a "must stop" for great crabs, cooked and season to perfection! It was so good that I went back the following night!
author: Marisa C.

description:
Love this place. Great food, great service, great atmosphere and view. Prices are in line, and I feel like I really got my money's worth here.

Came here with a buddy around 4:00. There was no wait at that time of day. Got a table by the window and a couple of cold beers within about a minute of deciding to walk through the door.

The crab cocktail is amazing. A ton of super sweet fresh crab in a cool huge margarita glass. One of my favorite appetizers ever. Had that and some top notch chowder, and I was set!
The server was just awesome, and you could tell he was a pro.
Bottom line, I recommend this place with 2 thumbs up!
author: Mark S.

description:
My friends and I went on a short getaway to SF to celebrate the holidays.  We really wanted to eat crab and after some research, we decided on Crab House.  I was very excited to try this place after great reviews and also seeing so many people relatively early in the evening (always a good sign).  

My friends and I ordered the Too Two crab and some garlic fries.  The garlic fries were really yummy.  The crab came out fast and was also good, not the best I have had, not the worst...but just ok.  I was not really impressed by this place.  Our waitress was very disheveled and disorganized, and the experience was just ok.  I thought for the price we paid we the crab would be better.
author: Boyoung K.

description:
Ok so I went and ate at a touristy establishment because I'm a tourist here in SF! 

I couldn't pass up the chance at crab because I loooove crab. Hubby and I shared the Lotsa Crab and a small order of garlic fries.  I'm pretty sure the crab was deep fried first which made the shells easy to open.  I didn't mind because I already had my heart and stomach set up for my hippo meal. The garlic butter sauce was also tasty and don't forget to dip that crab in there and also the bread.  The service was great and the server was nice enough to tie a plastic bib around my neck and take a picture for us. The crab was meaty but a little pricey ($55) for us but a good amount to share between us 2 and the fries. 

The only thing I wish I had done differently was ask for the crab to be broken up in front of me versus having it served in pieces. As we were finishing up a family had ordered the crab this way and it just seemed like so much more fun (and you can keep tabs on how much crab you're actually getting).
author: Diana C.

description:
The people who left bad reveiws are crazy. The food is excellent. We were there today for my friends bday it was fantastic. 
You have to order the garlic frys there the best I ever had. 
The filet mignon was cooked perfectly.
The crab, clams and shrimp were veryyyy good. 
Our server was super nice and sweet she let us eat and checked on us from time to time. 
Great veiw of the golden gate and the mojitos are good. Not watered down plenty of liqour if u want a good drink. I would deffinetly reccomend and will go back again someday soon. Not to mention bathrooms were squeaky clean.
author: Ms L.

description: Delicious! Everything we have ever tried has been spot on and the service is always great. I go back almost everything I'm in the city because I know it's great all the way around!
author: Kimberli W.

description: Excellent service !!! Manager brian went out of his way to accommodate our party of 8 with our little pup. The crab feast was amazing and worth the wait. I'm sure there are other restaurants with cheaper price for the same food but with the service we received , i wouldn't go anywhere else.
author: Friendly N.

description:
Found this place on Yelp whilst looking for "crab legs" in San Francisco.

I usually stay away from Pier 39 eateries since to me, they all scream tourist trap.  I would assume the best, and cheapest way to eat crab legs or any kind of good seafood is to hit the places down the block from Pier 39, on Fisherman's Wharf.  Eat fresh steamed crab and fresh fried calamari while standing at a bar counter on the street.  Yes, to me that seems authentic.  A place where tourists flock, and restaurants hand out happy hour coupons?  No thanks.

All that being said, one Saturday evening, I happened to not be working and my wife happened to be craving crab legs.  The weather was nice (hot in San Jose means perfect in San Francisco) and we had nothing better to do, so we showered and hopped in the car on the way to SF.  I made reservations beforehand, which was a very smart idea, and we fought a little traffic on Embarcadero and it took forever to park, but finally we made it.

My reso was for 6:45 and right around that time is when I got in line to put my name in / check in.  Luckily he called my name despite the fact that I hadn't checked in, and we skipped the line and got seated.  They have one room with tables against a window overlooking the bay, and another room with a big open air window against the pier.  Luckily we got the former and had a great view of ferry boats coming and going.

Our waiter was quick and they got water for everyone.  Drinks and apps came out super fast, like 3-4 mins after we ordered them, and the main dishes followed very quickly as well.  My wife loved the crab, and I got the filet, which I was skeptical on, but must say I was surprisingly overwhelmed at how good it was.  It was actually very top notch - One of the better steaks I've had, period.  Like, way better than a chain, and almost as good as a steakhouse.  I did not expect that AT ALL!  I would even go as far as to recommend trying it here even if you are not coming for steak.

Also, another excellent dish was the garlic noodles.  After doing further research afterward, I guess crab and garlic noodles is a hidden San Francisco treat in other areas.  These guys do their noodles a little different - It is fettuccine with very light alfredo sauce and lots of garlic flavor and some cheese.  They were, however, fantastic.  So good that I am actually considering going back, just for the noodles and the awesome steak.  I am surprised at myself for saying this!

In the long run, it was a little pricey, very rushed (as with any place that is on Pier 39, the servers only make money if you hurry up so they can flip your table - we call it 'turn & burn' ;) ) and it was a little cramped and loud.  But it hit the spot for the wife (good) and I was actually pleasantly surprised at how good my non-seafood was (better) and I would even consider coming back again (best).
author: Robert K.

description: The crab is not bad, but not that good, I would rather go some local restaurants for crabs. That's why I gave 3 stars But this one is really famous, should come at least once, the view here is great! Good for visitors.
author: Ikkzz Z.

description:
Simply... freakin' AMAZING!!!

I was here once 6 years ago and don't quite remember what I had or how it tasted. This time around... I'm still raving about it and we plan to stop in whenever we're in town!

Garlic Fries - awesome!

Iron Skillet-Roasted Double Shrimp & Crab - my mouth is watering just thinking about it!

Crab Angel Hair Lasagna - rich & savory!

Can't wait to go back and sample other dishes!  Shoot, I may not even do that 'cause I was so happy with what we had!  :)
author: Michelle S.

description:
OK, perhaps my review is biased because I came withv a Meetup group and the organizer never bothered to inform the restaurant that she was expecting anyhwere from 15 to 40 people to show up. So we were stuck eating in the bar area sitting on stools on Christmas Day.

Overall, the food is overpriced and over-spiced with garlic. It tastes good, not great. The service was just OK, perhaps because the waiter wasn't thrilled to see 25 people all wanting to order food on seperate checks. 

The hostess wasn't glad to see us when we arirved, becuase she knew nothing of the event, and the place is crammed full of tourists. There are so many better seafood restaurants in San Francisco than this one. And the meetup organizer, who is promoting her dating web site, should have done a much better job, including finding a better place where we could actually be seated for a real dinner.

Here's the worst part. On a rainy night, they have no check room, no coat hooks, no coat rack, NOTHING. They do not offer to put your coat into the closet reserved for the employees coats and purses. You are expected to take your coat to your table. But we didn't have a table.

If you are sitting at a bar stool in a busy bar area around the firepit, where there are no purse hooks or coat hooks, and wearing a cashmere full length overcoat, there is simply no place to put your coat except on the dirty filthy floor. Likewise, no place for an umbrella either. And it does rain in the winter in San Francisco. Sometimes a lot. For days.

So I hung my nice coat from the tiled seperation wall nearby. When I looked over, someone unknown had folded my coat and placed it on top of a parked baby stroller. Apparently, they have no room for strollers eaither.

When it came time to leave, my coat was gone. SOMEONE HAD STOLEN MY CASHMERE OVERCOAT ON CHRISTMAS DAY!! From a restaurant that charges $35 for a whole crab and $20 for a bowl of Garlic Noodles with a tablespoon of crab in it. This place is not cheap!

And the management didn't give a damn. They could not have cared less. Now in my view, they were negliegent in not having a place to store coats and in not having a sign prominently posted saying they were not responsible for stolen property. That issue will be for the small clamis court to resolve, although I will send them a demand letter to see if they pay up. I was able to buy a replacement on sale at Jos. A. Bank for about $285.

So, if you are a tourist coming to San Francisco and have never had dungeness Crab, maybe go. It is easy to find on Pier 39. But if you live here, go elsewhere, where your patronage is appreciated.

And by all means, WATCH YOUR BELONGINGS LIKE A HAWK, THE PLACE IS FREQUENTED BY THIEVES.
author: Norm G.

description: Absolutely the most disgusting seafood and restaurant I've ever ate at. The manager who was also hosting was rude and slammed the menus on the table. Our server was more interested in talking with her co workers.  There was trash all over the floor. The crab cakes were the wrist I've ever had.  Pay more and go up 2 restaurants to Fog Harbor.
author: Jennifer K.

description:
Hi, my name is Merlinda, and I'm a tourist! I feel like that's what all my yelp reviews of San Fran are screaming so far since I'm basically only reviewing places that have already been reviewed to death by the masses. Eh, I'm not mad. My best friend had just visited San Francisco the weekend before me and texted me the most alluring picture from Crab House of a sizzling platter of crabs and jumbo shrimp that were larger than her, so naturally I had to make it a must visit. 

APPETIZER: Garlic Bread with Mozerella (we desperately needed to soak up wine country consumption + copious amounts of Sake, Beer and Liquor from the day and night before's debauchery before we could even think about seafood). Just what you'd expect. Another table's bruschetta looked amazing and I must admit I did have a bit of food envy.
MEAL: We split the 2 pound whole killer crab roasted in killer garlic sauce ($36.95) and a plentiful small order of the garlic fries and were plenty appeased. The dungeness crab was pretty tasty, but it was really the presentation and the tasty bits of garlic and saucy goodness that remained on the sizzling metal platter that sealed the deal for me. I had a Great White beer and my boyf had a Crab House I think ale. We barely struggled through one each, but under different circumstances they would have been really enjoyable.

The dungeness crab was pretty tasty, but it was really the presentation and the tasty bits of garlic and saucy goodness that remained on the sizzling metal platter that sealed the deal for me. Perhaps best of all was our waitress - she was extremely helpful and adorable with a vaguely eastern European accent that I couldn't quite place. Combined with our awesome table windowsize that was left ajar to let the bay breeze in, it was overall a great (albeit hungover) FIsherman's Wharf experience.
author: Merlinda I.

description:
After searching restaurants to try out while we were roaming around Pier 39, we decided to go to Crab House. Maybe my expectations were really high due to all these reviews but I thought this place was just so-so. The hostess that greeted us was nice but as she walked us to our table, she acted like we were clueless and lost. The server was great. I loved the garlic fries (but then again, I'm a fan of any type of fries!). 

My boyfriend and I ordered a bowl of crab chowder to share, we both enjoyed it as well as the complimentary bread that they gave us. He ordered a salmon and I had the garlic pasta. The salmon was delicious and it actually made me regret my order. The garlic pasta felt like it was missing something. I didn't enjoy it very much but decided to suck it up and chow it down. It wasn't bad but it also wasn't very good.

The interior wasn't what I had expected, I actually expected much better. The table we were seated at weren't much comfortable at all.
author: Helen N.

description: Nice place for a casual seafood dinner on the warf.  Located on the top level of the warf, you can see Alcatraz and the Golden Gate from most tables.  The prices are lower than the nearby competition, with averages between $15 and $20 per plate.  The portions are big and the menu has a nice selection of seafood, pastas, soups and salads.  I recommend anything from the Iron Skillet-Roasted menu.
author: Heath C.

description:
We wanted to comfortably indulge in dunganess crab since we'd know it was going to be a mess so found the Crab House at Pier 39 on yelp and decided to give it a try.  There was no wait, the 3 of us got seated instantly.  We shared a medium sized iron skillet shrimp platter and the lotsa crab with a side of garlic fries.  

Our server was thorough when explaining the menu and the view of the pier and partial hills in the city is breathtaking.  There is also a bar area to sit at.  The crab house is not completely visible but it is on the second floor on the left section as you are walking into the shop area of the pier
author: Jennifer L.

description: If you like sea food, you will love this restaurant. Do not miss king crab.. Garlic noodles one of the best I have ever had. Shrimp dishes also good
author: Sreekanth M.

description: This place was great and perfect for a nice wrap up to our vacation.  The view was beautiful as well. And have the crab!
author: Hilary P.

description: Came here for lunch after a trip out to Alcatraz to see the Ai Weiwei exhibit - playing tourist in a city I used to live in. We were hungry and walking, so I thought we would hit this place up even though it is located in one big tourist hot mess. Good choice of beers, but they were $8 each! I know, I know...the location. I ordered 1/2 of their famous killer crab in garlic sauce, and for $25 it was pretty small. BUT, the taste was excellent and the crab was fresh. My husband had a caeser salad with crab and enjoyed that, too. Great view of the docks and waterfront. The service? Not that great, really. Our server was a cute guy, but he seemed disinterested.  $81 for lunch for two, after all the taxes/fees/gratuity seems a bit steep even for Pier 39.
author: Leslie T.

description:
Like most Embarcadero/Fisherman's Wharf restaurants you assume that you are going to be consumed by the tourist trap. Crab House was different. The food actually tasted excellent.  Going in the off season, you wouldn't expect the best out of the crab served. As a group, we got the two full crab as well as a skillet with mussels and shrimp. 

All three served were excellent and am still wishing that we asked for the third crab....
author: Tim M.

description:
Some friends were visiting from out of town and wanted to try some seafood in SF. Seeing the good yelp reviews, we decided to check out this place.

I am a seafood lover, but I found everything to be pretty mediocre. We started off with the calamari which came in a big basket and tasted pretty good. But everything was downhill from there. The crab and shrimp were both pretty dry... probably overcooked. My friends seemed to love the mussels, but I didn't think they were anything special. The garlic butter dipping sauce was the one thing I really liked. But when we asked for a refill, they just gave us regular butter...

Overall, I was pretty disappointed... I don't think I'll be coming back.
author: Kavita S.

description: By far some of the best crab legs & service I have received in SF! We received our crab legs in 10 minutes & they rates delicious. Our server Tony and busboys tonight were super attentive and hospitable!
author: Jessica H.

description: Pier 39 may be touristy and over-priced, but that doesn't mean there aren't delicious places to eat. The Crab House is one of those places. They have my favorite fish and chips in the Bay Area, and have consistently great service. I also recommend the bruschetta for a relatively cheap and tasty appetizer. Overall, great service and great food. Well worth the price and the wait.
author: Robyn S.

description: The shrimp with source was awesome！and killer crab taste nice. Though a little bit expensive. But worth the price.
author: Maggie C.

description:
We were in SF for the day and stopped by Pier 39 to check some stuff out. After walking around and decided to come to Crab House because the aroma from the food brought us back. We walked in and there was a little crowd going on. It was little busy too. The host asked us how many people and that there would be a 5 minute wait. Not a long wait so we waited. Less than 5 minutes later we were taken to our table. The dining area was a little tight, but can't complain. I was eyeing the Prix Fixe Menu. You get a salad, entree, and a dessert for $34.99. Good deal and crab chowder. And my other party got iron skillet shrimp & crab and Chicken Alfredo. Sounds like a good enough meal for party of three. 

So as we were waiting for our food, every time the server would come by I get excited and thought that it was ours. I was pretty hungry I might add. Anyways, the crab chowder came out and it was ok. After we were done with the chowder our main orders are coming out...but it wasn't my order. It was only the iron skillet shrimp and crab that came out. I was a little sad that my food didn't come out the same time. You know the feeling when you're waiting and waiting it's not your turn? That's how I felt. So anyways, the skillet roasted looks and tasted awesome. Yeah, I know my food hasn't come out yet. They offer so I accepted. After a few shrimps in, my food finally came out and it smells so good. I knew it taste better...and it did. It was better than the iron skillet because it was roasted with their special garlic sauce. Oh...the pasta came too. It wasn't my order so I'm not too concern about it. Devour the crabs and I polished off the pasta. It wasn't great. It's not their expertise so I'm not going to hold it against them. Oh, I got a coke and got refilled three times without noticing it. So the service was pretty awesome.

My experience at Crab House is good and giving it a 4-star and it's a little pricey, but good food and service. Definitely coming back in I'm here next time.
author: Cheng S.

description:
My girlfriend and I ordered the portion and a half of crab legs (which was plenty). They were good, although I've eaten better crabs. The butter sauce was great though. I also ordered a clam chowder as a starter which wasn't good. I'm used to New England clam chowder in Boston so maybe I'm spoiled, but the soup just wasn't good.

Parmesan garlic fries were excellent, although I'm somewhat disappointed that this was the star of the meal.
author: Dave N.

description: The food here is delicious!! The location is spectacular and the customer service is outstanding. The Dungeness crab here is the best in the city. I love the garlic butter that come with the amazing mussels! The only thing that I hate is the bread. The bread is hard as a rock!! But I just stayed away from that. Love this place! I'll definitely be coming back and recommending this Resturant.
author: Jassica G.

description:
Absolutely Fabulous!!
Best Crabs ever! 
Mostly,have to comment on the 
Fabulous management!!! Thank you, Brandi Nigel!
Well Done!!!
author: Stacey C.

description:
After a very long walk at the beginning of Fisherman's Wharf, we finally reached Pier 39...where pretty much all the shopping, entertainment and great seafood restaurants are located.

I am a huge fan of seafood...especially crab...it's my favorite...steamed, baked, fried....buttered, flavored or even plain...I'll eat it any way, any time. So my sweet bf took me to this awesome crab restaurant...definitely satisfied my cravings for seafood!

So we ordered the Crab Chowder - oOo loaded with potatoes, peas, carrots and big chunks of crab meat! Great creamy flavor. 

Caesar Salad - hmmm a bit too much dressing and no croutons..and they didn't even cut up the Romaine lettuce..it was whole leaves tossed with Parmasean cheese flakes and Caesar dressing. I still had a lot of it because it's our veggie dish..lol

2 lb WHOLE CRAB Roasted in their amazing garlic sauce! - OMG I was in heaven! the garlic sauce was unbelievably delicious and it was soaked in the very very meaty crab!...ah wish my tummy would let me eat more! 

Service was great and the place was beautifully and cutely decorated with colorful crabs and nets. 

the bill came out to be around 70 bucks..just for lunch...but man was it worth every bit of it. MUST TRY! =D
author: Joanna L.

description: I came in for lunch on a weekday and sat at the bar. I was greeted by a friendly bartender who took my drink order. I ordered the crab cakes, which came with what looked like a small loaf of bread. The crab cakes were cooked to just the right crispiness. They had very finely shredded crab in them and the flavor was really good. The bread was excellent as well. The price was right in line with other places in the area. I'd definitely go back.
author: James L.

description:
Pretty good place to eat if you want better food around the Pier, but a bit more expensive than other restaurants.  The seafood was fresh and delicious.  The entrees are also very tasty, sandwiches were huge but pasta dishes are smaller sized.  Crab chowder was light, fresh, and delicious.  The garlic fries are very good.  Complimentary bread with oil and vinegar was decent.  Ask for a table with a view and you can see the harbor and city.  

Crab chowder - Very fresh and light not a whole lot of crab, but still very tasty.  Plenty of potatoes and veggies inside the chowder (almost like a santé fe style), I would have liked the chowder to be a little more creamy.  Not bad overall.  Order a bowl and you can share with 3-4 people for a small tasting.  

Combo of grilled mussels, shrimp, and crab legs - Great fresh and sweet mussels, although they were a tad small.  Shrimp was grilled perfect with a hint of garlic butter.  The crab was good, fresh sweet Dungeness crab legs.  The order came with about 2 dozen mussels, 1 dozen shrimp, and half a crab.  The seafood was all fresh and delicious, but a tad on the pricey side.

Fishwich - This sandwich is absolutely gigantic!  Good quality beer battered fish and fried to perfection.  It's served on toasted garlic bread with a few slices of romaine lettuce and Caesar dressing.   The garlic fries on the side were amazing!  Nice crispy fries with plenty of garlic and parmesan topping.

Crab angel hair lasagna - Definitely something unique I have not tried, and it was tasty.  Lump crab meat grilled and topped with cheese and scallions served on a bed of creamy angel hair pasta.  It was rich, creamy, and delicious!  The angel hair pasta was a tad overcooked and clumpy.  Portion was a little small, and for $17 I thought it was a tad pricey.  Not a bad entree, definitely tasty, but a small portion.

Service was excellent, but then again only  1/2 the restaurant was filled, so I expected better service.  The waiter constantly checked up on us to make sure our food was okay.  Prices are a tad expensive, but it's Pier 39.  The restaurant has a decent view of the harbor and city.  Overall, solid 4 stars, I'd come back if I was in town.
author: Terence N.

description:
If your looking for amazing crab, don't go here. Compared to the other reviews, I'm hoping that my friends and I simply had a bad experience. As for the food, the fish sandwich and garlic fries were very good. However, we ordered the $100 plate of Dungeness crab and weren't that impressed. It was slightly overcooked and covered in seasoning. The garlic butter they served with it was not good and we had to ask for plain butter sauce. I have paid less for better crab at other places along the coast.

As for the service, we had been hearing about this place all weekend and stopped in around 9:30 after doing other touristy things. When I walked in to meet my friends, the waiters standing around at the bar were complaining about how they were clearly never going to close and were annoyed that they were still getting customers. Needless to say, our waiter could have cared less that we were there. Every time we asked for something, like water, or a napkin, he would say he would be right back and never returned. We had to ask the bus-boys that were walking around for service because it seemed as if the waiter was ignoring us. We were also upset then that their was an included 17% gratuity that nonetheless gave our horrible waiter a huge tip that should have gone to the bus boys who actually serviced us.
author: Taralyn R.

description: If your used to eating crab don't bother. Crab is way over cooked. Flavour is good but over cooked isn't good.
author: Steph R.

description: This place has a nice sitting overseeing the water. The crabs were amazing. My wife really loved the way they were seasoned. The drinks were very strong A+. For that. The only feedback I will say is they need a deep cleaning , but overall good was good
author: B W.

description:
I've walked by this place a few times wandering around the pier, I always wanted to try it out after seeing the long lines people were willing to wait out... 

Finally, my boyfriend and I decided we'd give it a try. I made sure to make reservations because I didn't wanna be one of those people waiting in line... I'm not that patient, especially on an empty stomach. Lol. 

As soon as we got there we were escorted to our seats, they gave us a nice view of the wharf and everything. The service was amazing, both of our servers were awesome. They were totally professional and quick to check on us. 

The food was AMAZING!! The crab was totally delish!!  

It was a little pricey for the amount of food we got... but I figured it would be cause it is kind of a tourist spot. It's all good though, we had a good time.
author: Elaine T.

description: We ordered the share plate with its secret lemon garlic sauce. It was the perfect amount! A little on the greasy side & salty too. But overall quite satisfying! The crab chowder was good too 3.5/5 but quite cold when it came out so a little disappointed Definitely order the garlic fries! They were so good! Mojitos there packed quite a punch! 4/5 for the whole experience. Booking is a must as the place is very popular and crowded. They were able to facilitate our last minute change of number of people which was very good!
author: Monica N.

description: We spend our special occasions here .. Wife's B Day, My B Day, Kids B Days, Anniversary, out of town friends, etc... Staff are great. This place is packed most of the time so come early and be prepare to wait at least 30 minutes for a table.
author: Bruce L.

description:
As a preface, I want to say that I am very disappointed to write this review, especially since the food and prices here were very good, especially for pier 39. Anyways...

I came here with my girlfriend after a day in San Francisco, thinking this would be a great way to end a beautiful day in the city. Upon arrival, we had to wait for seating as expected. During this wait, we overheard an employee make a racist joke to the hostess referring to one of the customers. I was a little shocked to hear this, and even more shocked to see that they would make jokes like that within earshot of their customers at the entrance. My girlfriend and I exchanged a shocked look with each other in disbelief, but we shrugged it off and proceeded to be seated.

When we were seated, our waiter Carlos got us water and went through the usual menu overview. It was then that my girlfriend noticed that he was chewing gum. She called him out on it and he asked if it was a problem. My girlfriend went silent in a bit of shock that he even questioned the appropriateness of a waiter chewing gum. He left, and proceeded to chew gum the rest of the night.

These two incidents left an overwhelming mar on the entire evening, but the food was still quite good and well priced. We ordered 3 lbs of crab for $55, an excellent price for crab--especially at the tourist epicenter of San Francisco.

Overall this would have been a great dinner, unfortunately the staff were unacceptably rude. Given the tourist traffic, I feel that even an overwhelming flood of negative reviews would hardly impact this restaurant, but I know I will not be coming back here.
author: Matt R.

description:
Went to this place hoping for some good seafood and based off the prices of the food figured this would be a good place. Staff was friendly, however I ordered the crab cakes and my dish comes out and looks nice, however it cost $15 and was two small crab cakes that had oil dripping off and the crab did not taste cooked completely, my wife had salmon that tastes ok, but for $27 dollars was not worth it. 
This place is over priced for the quality of food and as a result we will not be eating here again
author: Stephen C.

description:
After pretty much not having any crab dining experience in the Fisherman's Wharf area all my life, I had my second one within about a month's time.  This time it's thanks to visitors who was staying at a hotel in that part of the city and asked me to join them for dinner.  While walking along Fisherman's Wharf and then reaching Pier 39, we decided this is where we will dine.

Here, as the restaurant's name tells us, it's all about the crab. :)  There were three of us adults so we ordered the multiple crab option that, on the menu, was listed as being good for two to three people.  That one was just the right amount for the three of us.  They brought along two little boys, so in addition two fish and chips were ordered (which I cannot comment about).

The crab itself is good, but "their famous" sauce was lacking in my opinion.  In fact to me there was no actual sauce, though there was flavoring on the shell.  I guess I'm comparing this to the place I went to about a month ago in which there was actual sauce to dip the crab meat into and which I personally felt was most tastier.

Otherwise, it's a good experience here, with a nice view out the window looking towards the Golden Gate Bridge.
author: H K.

description: We waited 25 minutes after deciding what we wanted before the waiter finally was ready for us to order. The waiter passed by our table multiple times too. I brought it up to the host and he was rude about helping me saying your server will come and basically pointed me back to the table. I understand they're busy but were spending A LOT on this meal for my parents and we wanted to treat them to a nice meal but this place totally ruined it for us. The floors had little shell parts and napkins on the ground and was just filthy. We started off the night with the host calling us for a table only for him to give him five more minutes after we reached him. The waiter who filled our water cups filled it to the brim in an impatient manner and walked away in a hurry. The waiter who finally took our order couldn't get his machine to work and ended up opening his pad to write down our orders with bills almost falling out of it. Very unprofessional of a business with rude staff members who I understand are busy but shouldn't take more customers than they can handle. Also the 5% extra charge is ridiculous and making this bad experience worse. Will not be coming back and I don't recommend you do either unless you want to spend a lot and end up feeling robbed!
author: Linda D.

description: We asked our server how long this place has been here. She said 10 years and during those 10 years I didn't even know this place existed! But I am glad I found this place because this is one of the better restaurants near the pier. Excellent service, excellent food, and excellent atmosphere. Crab House has mastered the system of quick service. I ordered a Sprite but I wanted to change my order. The servers has a handheld device that takes your order and sends it to the bar or kitchen depending on what you order. As I wait for her to finish taking an order at another table my Sprite already came! Within minutes!  And after we ordered crab our crab came out within minutes too! Don't worry though cause our server didn't just ignore us the rest of the night since they work as a team in getting food/drinks out. She came back to check on us regularly making sure we have everything we needed. The crab here is delicious!  We ordered Lotsa crab and it was perfect for two.  It's around 3+ pounds so there is plenty. They serve it on a hot plate and it's sizzling so be careful. Their garlic sauce is one of a kind making it a great mixture with the crab. Here is a tip for you. After you get the meat out of the shell, run the meat across the hot plate for the garlic sauce. If I am by the pier again, I am stopping by to get me some crabs!
author: Brandon L.

description: We were traveling in a large group from Orange County and had reservations well in advance. The day before our reservations, we received a call from the restaurant manager informing us they couldn't accommodate us any longer. What a huge disappointment to everyone who was looking forward to a nice sit-down meal on the Pier.  Wish they had the courtesy to work with us or give us more advance notice so we could make other accommodations. Big thumbs down
author: betty w.

description:
Very nice location. Ask for a window seating.
Great service!!
Try the Crab Chowder...it's very good. 
The crab was excellent too!!
author: Mj V.

description:
Anybody who reads any of my other reviews knows how much of a pain in the ass I am when it comes to rating a restaurant! 

I LOVE THIS PLACE!

I came here with a friend on a spur of the moment thing. The wait time was about 45 minutes (which is what we were told and its expected in such a busy, touristy place.) 

5 REASONS TO EAT HERE:

1. When we were seated, the waitress came over immediately to take our orders and was friendly and not overbearing.  

2. Our food came out in the expected amount of time to successfully prepare what we ordered, which was quite a bit. (Walking builds an appetite). 

3. We ordered quite a bit of shellfish, crabs, lobster and things like that. As we finished certain portions of the meal, our empty shells did not have time to stink up the place, someone was collecting it every so often so as not to have an over crowded table. 

4. We received refills on our drinks at no extra charge without having to hunt down our waitress.

5. When we were finished, I turned to look for the waitress and signal for our checks, AND SHE WAS ALREADY ON HER WAY TO OUR TABLE.  VERY ATTENTIVE!!

The price of this place is worth the food, service and ambiance! 

My friends tell me I am a restaurants worst nightmare because I expect everything to be perfect...YES!! That's what I'm paying for!!

PEOPLE, THIS IS THE PLACE TO EAT FOR THE BEST SEAFOOD AT FISHERMAN'S WHARF, THE BEST SERVICE, POSSIBLY IN SAN FRANCISCO, AND A PLEASURABLE ENVIRONMENT.
author: Pam N.

description: We were on Pier 39 walking around and enjoying the good weather and views and we decided we wanted to get some seafood for dinner. Obviously, every restaurant in that area specializes in seafood, but I specifically wanted some good steamed crab before I have to go home where I'm landlocked. We decided that a place called Crab House would probably be a good choice, come to find out there was only one real option for crab there. We ordered a crab chowder bread bowl which was mediocre--not super flavorful at all--and also some garlic bread to start, which was decent but burnt around the edges. My girlfriend ordered the angel hair lasagna which came out burnt and also dripping in oil, disgusting. I got the half order of crab and that too came out dripping in oil, I peeled off some of the drenched pieces hanging off the leg and pulled some meat out only to chew on the most rubbery piece of crab I've ever tasted. It was awful and we barely got two or three bites in before we tapped out for fear of food poisoning or just generally getting sick. It really ruined our experience and the one chance we got to have down at Pier 39 on our little trip through here. The view was nice though.
author: Jessie H.

description:
Om nom nom!

This place is a little pricey but a nice treat.

My mother, boyfriend, and I had just driven from LA To San Fran and had not eaten all day, so we were ready to feast. We ordered the mussels, shrimp, and crab sizzling plate, garlic fries, crab Alfredo, shrimp Alfredo, and filet mignon. 

I particularly like how they handle orders here. The waiters have a little computer they put your order into and it gets sent to the kitchen immediately- someone came out with our drinks before the waiter had even walked away! Super efficient, I wish more places had systems like this. 

The waiter brought bread and butter to the table first. Nothing to write home about. Then the fries came- delicious. I could eat mounds of those super crispy garlicky things. Next our seafood platter came. It was served on a big sizzling skillet and the guy who brought it poured a wine sauce over it - for effect I guess, and so you get the whole aroma. The platter had 20 muscles, 12 shrimp, and a half crab, along with two sauces ( a lemon butter and a crab one) for 40$. Expensive but delicious. The pastas came after, and we're both very good. Portions were not big, but I would say fair/average.
