My boyfriend said his filet mignon was very good as well, although I thought it was kind of weird that it was served with garlic fries ( fries don't seem to fit with a fancy steak, although I ate some of his, so I won't complain.) 

Our bill came out to be about 150$ ( without tip).
author: caley t.

description: I like crab house.  I'm here just for crab.  I can care-less about everything else.  For Jane and I, a bottle of bubbly, and the big plate of crab, we're happy campers.  We tried to find another spot for crabfest in the area, no one can compare, so we're definitely coming back for more crabs and the bubbles.
author: Gigi T.

description:
Came toward late afternoon with some friends after spending the afternoon around the area because we were craving crab.

FOOD: Decent. Garlic fries were nice and garlic-y. My crab chowder was quite good. I tried some of my friend's crab and it was tasty. But crab is too much work for me on it's own. It's a bit on the expensive side, but I think that's expected for the area.

ENVIRONMENT: it was a nice place - pretty big but not spacious. Lots of natural light from the windows. We got to sit in a booth - which I love.

SERVICE: Here's where they went down in my book. It was terribly slow. Hard to flag down our waitress. We actually had to flag down our waitress. We had to ask for water multiple times so everyone at the table got some. It was almost like we were being ignored.

Based on my first experience, I probably wouldn't go back even though the food was decent.
author: Kailyn G.

description: This place has fresh and delicious food all around. We started off with mussels and shrimp for our appetizer and it came out on a sizzling skillet. I don't know exactly what the dipping sauce was, but it seemed to be some sort of garlic butter; delicious! We ordered a whole crab, seafood pasta and the fish & chips. I tried all three and they were all fresh. This is the first time I've seen a crab delivered on a sizzling skillet  looking glazed as if it was just fried, and the garlic buttery sauce on it was really good! I split my brother's seafood Alfredo pasta with my fish and chips. I wasn't really excited for the pasta though. The seafood in it was fresh, but the sauce I feel could be a bit better. Also a bit pricey for the size of the bowl. My fish and garlic fries on the other hand was bomb!! Fresh garlic fries and the garlic wasn't too over powering, seasoned just right. The fish I believe they used was cod, not the normal white fish at other places. Wasn't overdone with the batter, but I wish the fish was more crispy. Overall, this place is a bit pricey especially for the pasta and fish & chips.. But this is the place to come for the fresh crabs, mussels and shrimp; it will not disappoint. I'll be back next time I'm in town.
author: Jerome B.

description:
Went here following fellow yelpers and the food was Amazing, we ordered the feast for 4 even though it was three of us and we handled it, be sure to get the lemon butter to dip ya crab meat into it, oh so good, and another must is the garlic fries, I woke up the next day craving them. 

Everything was great other tgen the fact that we constantly had to get the staffs attention for refills and the place wasnt even busy when we were there. 

Other then that, it was great times.

Strongly recommend this place for crab eaters.
author: Ahmed F.

description: every single dish is perfect here n the pier is absolutely nice luv the crab cake n chawder
author: Sheffey Y.

description:
Yes, I did it... As a local, I went to Fisherman's Wharf.. I took my out of country friend for a standard SF tour, and she wanted to eat in Pier 39 (oh nooo!!!).  We ended up in Crab House ~ the food was actually really good, definitely exceeded my expectations!  We sat at the bar, got couple drinks and ate crab and some other things.  They were all good, and the view was great, too.

The most memorable aspect was the service: bartender Mert was awesome.  He was very warm, welcoming and fun! Great service!

I will go back after all the tourists leave the city to get a drink and chat with Mert.
author: Bailey H.

description:
i know dungeness crab. 

i know how to catch them. i know how to break them down. i know how to cook them. i know how to eat them. 

you have to be pretty confident if youre willing to do a crab boil clam bake for 200+ yelpers (2007) jam out with your clam out (a grassroot fund raiser for the sf food bank).

i know garlic crab. i know garlic noodles. 

the better half and i found ourselves at the crab house on a random monday night yesterday. tourist hell? yes, but we were having such a great time remembering a long forgotten youth, wasting years and years doing teenage kid things, like hanging out at the pier... 

but this is about dungeness crab.

ordered the killer crab (lotsa crab) and garlic noodles.

the garlic noodles are a thick pasta noodle (fettuccine) in a buttery garlic sauce. not bad. think of ppq garlic noodles made with fettuccine, with less butter and garlic. 

the killer crab was good. think a blend of ppq flavors with thanh longs predictable and consistent frozen crab. 

yes. frozen. for sure thanh long uses frozen dungeness crab. im willing to bet crab house does too. it makes things much easier from a logistical standpoint... and im willing to bet most people would never know the difference. i could. the texture, the flavor and the way the shell "cooked". 

and if you want to know even more about sourcing dungeness crab, except for a very short period of our local season (and even during the season) most of our live (and frozen) dungeness crab comes from oregon (cresent city) washington and as far as british columbia. 

but back to crab house. crab house has an amazing location, good grub and great staff. a bit about the staff. that day i was there, a mainland chinese family was sitting next to us. we sat in the booth next to them. homie was going to town, but all of a sudden, the daughter tells the waiters theres something wrong and they want to speak to the manager. the crab is bad! the crab is bad! ...... 

ok... this can happen. you cant control things 100% somethings fall through the crack.... 

BUT IF A CUSTOMER HAS A PROBLEM WITH THE FOOD, THEY SHOULD SAY IT IMMEDIATELY, not after you ate nearly the entire dish.

the waiters and manager handled it properly. they understood you can only be professional, no matter how much the customer is wrong. kudos to the staff. if it was me, i wouldve tossed the table over and told them to get the fuck out of here. good thing im not in the hospitality industry. 

all in all, solid place. good food, good view and a good stroll down memory lane. def worth a visit.

3.5 stars round up for the staff
author: Euge L.

description: We had the crab, clam chowder and mussles. Perfectly delicious. I can't wait to go back to SF just to go to CH@Pier 39.
author: Janet G.

description: Crab cakes definitely get five stars, everything else was only a three.  Service was very good.  I felt like it is significantly over priced for what it is.  Definitely a tourist trap.  I agree with other reviewers, expect a long wait if you don't have a reservation.
author: JL Z.

description: Didn't end up staying to eat. Send back 2 of 3 drinks for stuff floating in them. Ordered appetizers and the side plates to eat on we're filthy. We sent them back and were brought 3 more filthy plates. We told the manager and our server that we were leaving without drinking our drinks and touching our appetizers. I don't think they cared because they were so busy with tourists.
author: Layne J.

description:
Waited about 30 minutes for a table today (12/25).  Considering a lot of places are closed today, i am glad they are open during the holidays.  Yes, this is a tourist spot... while waiting English may not be the mother tongue for 90% of the folks waiting for a table.  Of course, we are a tourist ourselves from L.A. so we blend in to the crowd quite nicely.  :-)

For my husband and I, we ordered:
Crab cake -- lots and lots of crab meat!  One of the best that I had ever tasted!  But then of course, it does cost $14.95...
Crab chowder -- good flavor.  For only $3 more, I recommend the bowl ($9.95) over the cup ($6.95).  You get twice as much.
Whole Killer Crab $31.95 -- It is a big crab (it said 2+ lbs on the menu).  Price is by each instead of by pound.  Their secret garlic sauce adds just enough flavor to it without destroying the fresh crab taste.  One thing that I wonder, however, is that the crab shell (the "back"?  I am talking about the largest shell that covers up the crab body) is completely scraped clean... why?  I started to wonder if they keep reusing the same shell for decor, as I see the waiters are quite eager to take that shell away
Melon mojito $8.95 -- again decent but not awesome.
Coffee

The bread that is offered upfront is cold.  I'd much prefer if they just heat it up a little bit.  Total tab is a tad over $80 for the two of us.  

5-stars on the pier view, 3.5 stars on the food, 4 stars on service.  So overall it's a solid 4 stars.
author: Maria G.

description:
My mom and I are foodies and it took us about 45 minutes to decide where we would dine at Pier 39 for our visit. We finally decided that if we wanted to eat crab, we would go to the Crab House, it couldn't dissappoint right? I mean, it's in the name! 

The food met every one of my expectations! We sat near a window overlooking the bay. Our server was very professional and friendly. The star of the show were the crab cakes. My lord!! Wow factor indeed. They were perfectly crispy, and not at all greasy. 
We also had muscles, shrimp, and of course, crab. They were very tasty and filling. Affordable and definitely got our money's worth.
If you like crab, EAT HERE! If you don't, they had other things on their menu like pastas, fresh fish, and salads.
author: Krystal b.

description: This place is amazing!! This was our third visit and we haven't been disappointed. The crab is always cooked to perfection, the service is uber fast and the wait staff is always very diligent and on top of our needs. Our last visit was extra memorable. We came in for my wife's birthday on Sunday the 12th and they had an enormous group in our section. We were any way perfectly cared for and never forgotten! It was probably the best visit yet.
author: Maria C.

description:
Great place!!!!!
Has a view 
Food is a little up there, but you get what you pay for!!!!
Big portions, great service!!!!!
Mojitos are awesome
Recommend Louie crab salad 
And fish and garlic fries!!!!
author: Joey P.

description: Hands down, delicious! Ordered the crab feast, garlic noodles, and garlic Parmesan fries. We cleaned everything off the plate. The service was great and the servers are very kind and check up on you at proper times. We were seated by the window with a beautiful view of the water. Definitely will come back!
author: Ruby A.

description: Just a compliment to the team for honoring my request for a window seat. It was a very busy Saturday night (wait times around 45 minutes), and I had requested a window seat just for 2 people. The host happily accommodated us and sat us within 10 minutes in a 6-person window table. They made up for the lack of friendliness of our actual waitress, but everything else was good!
author: katie g.

description:
I first tried this restaurant years ago on a friend's recommendation and I've been coming whenever I crave crab ever since! This restaurant offers up great views and an extremely friendly staff.

My favorites dishes are the Killer Crab - Too Two Crab and the Iron Skillet Roasted Shrimp. The Killer Crab for two is huge and could really feed 3. It's cooked to perfection in the house garlic sauce and served piping hot. Plenty of crab legs to go around!

The Iron Skillet Roasted Shrimp is cooked in a buttery garlic sauce, but I do wish they were peeled before cooking. They're a bit hot to handle immediately and get the shell off.

The wonderful staff is another reason that keeps me coming back. They are quick to get your drinks, and anything else you want, and always check to see when you're almost done with appetizers to put your entree order in.

If you're in San Francisco and visiting Fisherman's Wharf this place is a must try!
author: Liz M.

description:
My boyfriend and I are huge seafood fans so we decided to try this place one night for dinner.

We got seated within 5 minutes, which I was happy about since I was starving! We ordered the garlic fries and the iron-skillet roasted mussel, shrimp and crab combo. 

When I order a combo, I'd like to get an even combination of everything. With this place, it seems like we had more mussel than anything. Shrimp is my favorite, but I don't think I even ate that many. Overall, the seafood was good...but not the best! 

You can never go wrong with their garlic fries, though! YUM.
author: Lindsay A.

description: Came across this cause of all the high number of reviews. Started with crab chowder and the garlic bread with cheese. The crab chowder honestly tasted like campbell's hearty vegetable soup with crab in it and the garlic bread was microwaved and lacked actual garlic in it. For the main we got a medium shrimp and mussels and a whole crab. The crab was not fresh it was cooked from frozen imported, that is odd since the restaurant is situated right on the pier. Our server was a great guy. The entrance to the restaurant had both the toilets there and sadly the que was due to the general public coming and lining up to use it. Overall i would not recommend this restaurant.
author: Barrak A.

description:
Dungeness crab fans rejoice! The Crab House specializes in the good stuff!

My meal started with the crab chowder. The chowder itself had the right flavors with lump dungeness crab meat. My only gripe was the soupy consistency. I prefer my chowders thick and hearty. 

The crab Alfredo was good. Rich and full of crab meat. Our party shared an order of the dungeness crab. Soooooo good! Full of flavor! Salt, pepper, various herbs and full of taste! Perfect with the clarified butter. 

We left the place stuffed! The Crab House is on Pier 39 at Fisherman's Wharf so expect many tourists. It was a beautiful day with clear skies, so we had an awesome view of Golden Gate Bridge from our table. Service was friendly enough. Overall, a great value for San Francisco!
author: Paul C.

description:
Service was fine, but nothing too special. Prices are reasonable. Food was not as great as i was hoping it would be. Haven't gone to a crab restaurant in forever so I was hoping it would be super delicious when the fam decided to go here. The crab chowder was good, but I think I would have preferred just some good old clam chowder with some of that crab topping in it. The lady said we would need 2 bowls for the 4 of us, so we ordered 2 bowls and ended up taking 1 of the bowls home. My mom mentioned we should've just ordered one bowl and one order of crab cakes. That would've been a better idea..The garlic noodles was nothing special at all, if anything it was just a lot of grease chillin on the noodles. The garlic fries were yum. The double shrimp and double crab was good, but again, not mouthwatering or anything crazy good like i hoped. 

Overall, the place was good, but I'd probably choose to try other places instead of going back to this place.
author: Andrea M.

description: 2nd time at the Crab house!!! woot woot!!! I flew to San Francisco 2 weeks ago to celebrate my birthday and my bf's bday together.  When his family said that we're celebrating at the crabhouse, I was so excited. As soon as I landed, we went straight to Crab house and we ordered 2 crab feasts, a large order of mussels & shrimps, an order of lotsa crabs, crab alfredo, lemon pie,  and tiramisu...(and it's only 5 of us, but we finished it all hahaha) The server also gave  us a slice of  birthday cake with a candle...sweeeeet!!! Everything that we ordered was delectably finger licking good!!!..the mussels were a little in the tiny size this time tho, but i'm not going to deduct one star for that, i was too happy with my food that I can forgive them with the tiny mussels they gave us...Thanks Crab House for making our birthday celebration fun and special.  The service is really really good too! Thanks to our main lady server and the other servers who were very attentive to our wants and needs :)
author: Coco S.

description:
We were looking for a table for eight on a Sunday night. The pier was pretty crowded so we figured it would be tough. The folks at Crab House came through; although they had to split us up. We put the kids at one table and the adults at another. They treated the kids well and we really enjoyed our meal here.

I had the ultimate crab dinner. It was very hot and tasty.
author: Donley P.

description:
Service is good, but the food does not meet the hype or price one bit.
 
Had a 200 dollar dinner here
All the food we ordered came out in under 10 min together, appetizer and entree, which is a big problem. Most of their menu item taste half way decent only when it is hot. Half way eating, everything became COLD. Can you imagine what cold crab, calamari, garlic bread, and halibut taste like? 

Crab are not fresh, dead for a day at least or frozen to begin with, but most probably can't tell when you bathed that sucker in heavy garlic sauce. Very disappointing when Ranch 99's sea food clerk can steam a crab that taste better than this at a fraction of the price. 

Garlic noodle was under-cooked, very difficult to chew.

Halibut was overdone, it tasted, like what Gordon Ramsey would say "Gandhi's flip flop"

Come only if you a tourist who is too lazy to leave fisherman's warf.
author: ben n.

description: Not only was this place amazing, the service was off the charts! We had a large group and a sleeping baby, and the staff worked to insure we had the perfect spot for everyone including the baby! Loved the skillet with a double crab order and shrimp! The dipping sauce is simple but so necessary! Also tried calamari and a chowder bread bowl. Crab chowder was top notch and calamari was spot on yummy!
author: Sarah W.

description:
I absolutely loved this place.  I was here on my own for a work trip... and the food was great, the local beer was great and the lovely bartender was the sweetest  person ever. I was happy she chatted with me and kept me company since I was there alone and killing time.

I had a pasta dish with a olive oil wine sauce with large chunks of crab.  I dont remember the name of the plate, but I highly recommend anything with crab on the menu! Messy yet, satisfying!
author: Krys A.

description: I loved the presentation of a garlic roasted crab. It was so cool. But the price was high to me because one crab wasn't enough for a lunch.
author: Yang X.

description: Ehh the shrimp was kind of bland and the crab was ok. Service was kind of slow and we had to flag down waiter for help.  It was my mom a birthday and j told them we wanted a birthday song but they forgot.  Overall not worth the price.
author: Sarah L.

description: Have yet to have a bad meal here.  We usually just get the crab and garlic fries.  If you're in the area, it's worth the wait.
author: Sean M.

description: Really good seafood! Thieves one of my first go to places. Also, it is a crab house I definitely recommend you going there and trying it out!
author: Jackeline U.

description: OMG, for a seafood lover, this place is heavenly. My family and I ordered the grill combo seafood platter where it's sizzling at the table. It was soooooo good. They poured like some vinergrette and it tasted so good. I seriously licked the shells of everything I ate. Note, take the shrimp off the platter early because if you leave it on there, it will overcook. Everyone gets their own bread roll, which was good and cute how they packaged them individually. Also ordered a large bowl of crab chowder which we all shared and it was delish! I would come back to San Francisco just to eat here again!! It's a little pricey, but oh well, it's not like I get to eat it everyday! They have cute decorated crabs all along the top of the wall.
author: Carol N.

description:
It's not the best crab I've tasted, but it's good... and fresh. I usually enjoy the mussels more. The service is always nice, and I always get lucky and get seated by the window, so I always have an amazing view when I dine here, so that adds in my rating.

If you're a fan of dessert like me, they have one of the best chocolate mousse... it's rich, but not too sweet.
author: Katheryn H.

description: I stopped here for lunch on a Wednesday. I live in the Bay Area, so I know Pier 39 is a tourist trap and it is not where locals go for good food and service. However, I was doing some sightseeing in the area and I was hungry for crab cakes. I was seated right away at a window table without asking. It was out of the way and I had a beautiful view of the bay with the Golden Gate Bridge in the distance. I liked the decor with all of the sparkling white subway tiles on the walls. Katri was my server and she greeted me promptly. She was friendly and she had a nice smile. She answered my questions about the menu and I ordered crab cakes with a salad. My food was delivered within five minutes and it was delicious! The dungeness crab cakes were crispy and perfectly seasoned. The baby iceberg salad was fresh and the garlic vinaigrette dressing gave it some zing. The prices were a little high, but I would expect that at Pier 39. The food was excellent and the service was great. I had a very enjoyable lunch.
author: Dan R.

description: We were visiting from Orange County for the weekend. My boyfriend and I love crab so we yelped a location while walking around. We were not disappointed! He said its probably some of the best crab he has had!
author: Melissa H.

description:
From my experience, I definitely do not want to recommend this restaurant. I visited this place on May 3rd. The employees were very pushy and spoiled my day. I understand that this place is very popular and always packed. But, you do not need to make your guest feel uncomfortable and embarrassed.

When I got to the restaurant, my brother went back to parking lot to get his belongs. Meanwhile I was introduced to a table. I was waiting for my brother and about to order first before he come to shorten time. The waiter never came to me after I order my beverage. Instead, a guy wearing a red shirt looked down at me and told me I cannot be there without a complete party, very loudly. I said my party will arrive soon, but he was very pushy. I said I can order first, then the waiter finally came to me. I felt very embarrassed how the guy treated me. He could personally ask me, but he yelled at me in the restaurant in front of many people.

I understand how busy you are, but you never need to make your guest feel embarrassed. I will never come back to this restaurant. The taste is just the average. I would choose a restaurant such as Franciscan which has much better service with similar taste.
author: Eunjin C.

description:
I don't know how we've missed this place before, but we ate here a few days ago and had a great time. We came around 3pm and there was no wait for a party of 2. They originally sat us at a different table, but when we sat down we saw that a table by the window was being cleared off so we asked the hostess if we could move. She said she had to double check to make sure no one had reserved it and lucky for us no one had! So we ended up with a great view of the pier & bay. 

Ordered the 3lbs of their "Killer Crab", garlic fries, and bruschetta. The crab was meaty, delicious & sweet! I don't know how they did it, but the crab shell was easy to crack to get to the succulent meat inside. Garlic fries were good. Not amazing, but definitely satisfying. I'd pass on the bruschetta next time as it was mostly 2 large slices of bread with a small amount of tomatoes. 

As for service, the bus boys didn't seem like they wanted to work, but our waitress was great & very helpful so no complaints there. 

Overall we had a really nice time enjoying the crab & watching the clouds roll in over the bay.
author: Niko N.

description: Crab and shrimp was good, garlic bread good.  I thought the crab chowder was alright, I wanted white clam chowder.  I didn't care for corn in the chowder and sweet taste.  Service was good didn't have to wait too long.
author: Kathy W.

description:
Visits: Once. 

Apps to try: Two words for you: crab chowder. That's some tasty soup with a generous amount of crab in it. The garlic bread is also good.

Entrees to try: Fish and chips...with tasty fries! Crab Alfredo is fantastic, I definitely recommend it.

Desserts to try: We were too full to try any :( 

Service: Pretty prompt but nothing to write home about. The staff was mostly friendly.

Establishment: Nicely located on the pier, overlooks water, and has a good amount of seating.

Restroom: Eh. Not very nice. They need more stalls!

Parking: I don't think they have any.

Stay away from: Nothing we had here was bad, yay!

Special Notes: You may have to wait so don't get there during rush hours. It's in the middle of a bunch of tourist spots so the area is pretty crowded and full of visitors.
author: Moonie M.

description:
We were that loud, annoying group of 12 that you KNOW the staff loves. Despite this, though, our waiter was exceptionally attentive and patient.

I had the prix fixe dinner with a (surprisingly large order of) salad, half order of garlic-roasted crab, and a unexpectedly tasty tiramisu. A friend and I split the garlic fries just to make sure to ward of any unsuspecting men...or vampires.

It's a pretty touristy joint, but when you need last-minute Saturday night dinner plans, the Crab House really steps up.
author: Adena B.

description: Very delicious. Worth more than 5stars. I love seafood especially Crab and shrimp. Came here with my family on the 4th of July. Crab was succulent and well seasoned. Enjoyed the option of different butter sauces. Portion size was large and more than fair. Great place to take a family or large groups. Would highly recommend this place to everyone looking for seafood worth the money.
author: Kianna R.

description:
Had lunch here on our trip to SF a couple of years back. I had the crab cioppino and my boyfriend had the dungeness, both dishes were delicious, but the star of the lunch was definitely the crab chowder that we started with, it was totally totally amazing it was perfectly seasoned with a little spicy kick to it, loaded with lump crab meat and corn....my mouth is watering just thinking about it. It was so good that the next night we decided to come back and get a couple more bowl fulls before we left to come back home, wish we would have discovered it sooner, we would have probably had it everyday. 

The restaurant itself is pretty cute too, overlooking the pier and they have this cool 8 person table with a fire pit in the center (we sat there on our second night) it was very different, warm and cozy, loved the idea.

Probability of return - HIGHLY LIKELY
author: Premie W.

description: If you're craving crab, this is the spot! I highly recommend the combo appetizer, the mussels were to die for! Our server, Ryan D, was the best! He was super helpful with menu selections, really attentive, and so nice! We really enjoyed our meal and the whole experience! Would definitely go back the next time we're in town!!
author: Kim J.

description: Growing up in San Francisco and enjoying all my surroundings as a child and spending hours at Pier 39 at the old arcade (no longer there). I never ate here as child. Now 25 years later and living in San Diego me and my wife visit they Bay every year. Came here 3 years ago and have not stopped ever since. The Crab is the best I have had in my existence. We always order the Lots-O-Crab which is 3-4 lbs of dungeness crab heaven. There is something about roasted garlic crab that taste so good. The only rival would be Vietnamese style salt n pepper crab. Service here has always been great, get busy and stays busy all day. Drinks are overpriced in my opinion....but hey you are in the heart of the Wharf. We will always stop by every time we are in San Francisco.
author: Jimmy C.

description:
- Garlic Crab
- Garlic Noodles

Simple, but it sure is yummy!
author: michelle h.

description:
Love their crab, it's so tasty, so garlicky 
the bread could be better
service varies, but overall i'm happy
I always get a nice view.
author: Vero G.

description: My fiancee and I loved this place so much we went back the very next day. The food and service was absolutely amazing. I'm trying to think of more reasons to go back and visit SF just so I can eat here again!
author: Frankie J.

description: Ok so we were on vacation for a week and this was my favorite. I've seen a lot of reviews about rude staff and I can say I dont think they were rude but it would have been nice if someone could give them a boost in personality. We ordered the crab cakes, crab chowder, steamed mussels and shrimp and 1 1/2 steamed crabs. There was only 2 of us and I knew we probably would not finish all the food but boy was I wrong. We had a perfect view of the bay and we devoured every bite of food. I can honestly say I did not have 1 complaint about anything. The bill was over 200.00 not including the tip and was worth every dollar. Cant afford to eat out like that all the time but this was worth the treat. Cant wait to return some day!
author: Jimmy M.

description:
There was a 20 - 30 minute wait at around 2:00pm on Saturday, which isn't bad considering there's so much to do and see in the surrounding shops. 

My boyfriend and I ordered the Combo Mussels, Shrimp, and Crab and the Garlic Noodles. The combo was delicious, although the mussels tended to be on the dry side. The pasta was superb. 

Atmosphere was sweet with a view of the water. Service was friendly.
author: Sheri C.

description: I ordered the crap Alfredo and it was fresh and yummy. It could use a little salt though. We also ordered the crab cakes which were absolutely amazing however only two come on the plate and it was pricey.
author: Angelica C.

description: This place was amazing. We ordered the lotsa crab (1 1/2 crab) for the two of us and left completely satisfied. It would have been nice though if it would have come with corn or potatoes though. Our waiter, Julio, was beyond amazing. He was attentive without being hovering.  He had a wonderful sense of humor and truly seemed to enjoy serving people.  His recommendations for dinner were spot on. The restaurant itself, we felt was nice and clean. We sat next to windows that were opened to the walkway so besides enjoying wonderful food we were able to people watch.  Everyone visiting San Francisco that wants to eat crab should come to the Crab House At Pier 39.
author: Annie B.

description:
What's not to like? Charbroiled dungeness crabs and mussels with French bread and butter sauce. 

Cook perfectly. Yum!
author: Loan N.

description: The Crab House tricked us to dine by saying it close at 11 pm both on yelp and its official website. But when we arrived at 10 pm, the front man simply said that they were closed while many people were still dining and left us with no explanation. Imagine you had starved all day in Yosemite and went great length to locate a parking spot. It was no doubt an unpleasant experience.
author: Sunny M.

description: From the reviews on Yelp, I came to this place with high hopes of good service and good food.. I mean the prices are high so I expect good service. First off, the guy taking our order was extremely rude and may I say he loves rolling his eyes when being asked questions. Crappy services, food isn't that great, and again NOT FRIENDLY! Ruined my time in San Fran.
author: Marissa T.

description: I know the whole fisherman's wharf area is  touristy, but a friend recommended the Crab House to us for dinner. We did make sure to book a reservation before we went to San Fran. We loved it. The staff was great and the food fantastic. We were early so we waited at the bar and the bartender was great too. Of course, get the Dungeness crab.
author: Jack C.

description:
Parking was done at the garage right next to the Pier. The tickets will give you coupons and if you eat at this restaurant, you get your ticket validated for free parking at the parking structure. 

Went for dinner on a Saturday. It wasn't too long a wait until we got our table. Our server was nice and the food was good. All we got was a 3lb. order of crab legs with garlic butter sauce. It's a nice location, and I imagine that eating at this restaurant would be just as good if not better during the day because it overlooks the water. 

The bread they give as an appetizer was terrible. So hard to chew, it would have been better warm and soft. Would have pulled out my fillings if I kept eating it.

If you're in the mood to walk around the Pier, by all means, there are gift shops and specialty shops right outside the restaurant. Nice for a day trip or just to walk around. 

Don't pass this one up if you're craving CRABS.
author: Jenny B.

description: Had dinner here with my husband.  We had the garlic crab. Seating is a bit cramped. But food & view was good.
author: Denise W.

description: The wait here at certain times is quite long, but the crab and garlic fries makes up for it. That garlic sauce with the crab is yum. If you are looking for something that is not so touristy at the pier, come here. This place will have you drooling the moment you walk in.
author: Susie N.

description:
I freaking love me some dungeness crab.

i also generally love me some grilled shellfish, so that being said, the Crab House is riiiiight up my alley. They be speaking my language.

They do it right, every time, and quickly! 'Been here twice (in the last year in fact) and still can't get over how quickly they drop delicious, garlic-y, white-winey, steaming heaps of crab, shrimp & mussels, elevated on racks, in front of you. It's so delicious. If this even slightly sounds like it might be your bag, go, in fact, run. Order a beer too. You know that's the secret to happiness... hot, buttery, garlic-y, grilled shellfish abound. Do it.

To the other reviewer (I just read, to the right of my screen) who called this place a tourist trap:
I'm sorry, nothing personal, but I've traveled the globe, far and wide, and I still love this place enough to give it 5 stars... and based on my review stats, that's a pretty nice compliment. I love the Crab House At Pier 39 and look forward to it the next time I'm in San Francisco...
author: Jenna H.

description:
You just have to be a tourist sometimes, this is a good place to do it. 

Food is 3 to 4 stars, service was 5 star. Great staff here. 

Really nice ambiance and great view if you can get a window table.
author: Sarkis S.

description: Had family in town visiting us and wanted good seafood on pier 39! Had a wonderful dinner here, they hosted our large group with great service and delicious food!!
author: Juli K.

description: We stopped by due to curiosity of the long line it had, boy were we disappointed! We were pretty much ignored by our server,  when asking questions about the menu he had a sarcastic tone with us,  very rude! Fish and chips were burnt! Quality was not up to par, and at the end when we were leaving someone had opened up the kitchen door and it looked super filthy inside! Will not go back here again!
author: amy s.

description: For the savvy seafood eater this place is disappointing. Crab was way over cooked to the point where the meat was shrunken in the crab. 2 lbs turns into less than 1.5. The shell would crumble in you fingers and ruin the meat. Find another spot because this will be a bad meal.  The chowder was good though...
author: Stephen I.

description: Always great! Totally recommend, make reservations it gets crowded in the weekend, you can use yelp or the restaurant website, dos it with both different times and no issues. Carlos from Honduras was great waiter. The host... Not as good. The crab cakes are delicious and the whole crab a most. Don't miss it if you are in San Francisco.
author: Maria R.

description: One of my favorite spots! Ask for the lemon caper butter to dip your crab in...that's the secret to this place
author: Hitomi S.

description: They could easily charge $80 for the killer crab and people would still be waiting in line for it. It's simply amazing. It's so hot so fresh and smells so good it's something that if you could afford it you'd want it everyday. And it comes out so quickly too only about 5-10min later plenty of crab packed in. Make sure you ask for some of the butter and garlic butter on the side simply amazing here a can't miss when you're in SF
author: AC D.

description:
I know, I know this is in the heart of a tourist area, and it is a bit expensive because you're at Pier 39 but the food is so good.  

My husband and I only go for special occassions like our anniversary. We usually get the salad, pasta, calamari and crab.  The salad isn't as good as it used to be a couple years ago.  I think they're trying to save money because the house salad used to have baby greens but the past couple times we've been it only has iceberg lettuce.  

Or course the reason to go is the crab.  The garlic butter sauce it's cooked in is SO good. You will sop it up with the bread, it's that good.  If it's possible to go during crab season that's when the crabs are the best but other time of the year it's still good.  I'm drooling as I'm writting this.  

If you have visitors from out of state and would like to take them someplace relatively nice this is the place.  Go early because they don't take reservations for dinner time.
author: Suzanne C.

description: Agreed food is good but not worth the price.  If you are visiting SF then maybe yes, but if you live there find somewhere else.
author: Do M.

description:
We had our office holiday party here tonight.

Pros - nice room off to the right as you enter the restaurant.  Great views of the pier.  Great for group parties.  White linen table cloth.  House red wine was decent.

We ordered off the group pre fixed menu.  I was tempted to order the killer crab but decided against it since you have to get down and dirty.  Instead  I decided between the crab lasagna or the crab enchilada since I was at a crab restaurant.  Asked the server what was better, and she said the crab enchilada.

Con - I asked if local Dungeness crab since it's crab season, and she answered yes immediately.  Well, after taking an initial bite of the crab enchilada, the crab didn't taste local to me.  Tasted canned and fishy to me.

You get two huge enchiladas on a iron skillet.  Very filling entree, but I didn't care for the crab itself.  

I tried some of the garlic fries that a friend ordered, and those were very good.

Also, the chewy dinner roll was very good.  Comes in a white paper bag. And the mixed green salad had a great ginger oil dressing.  Kinda sweet.

Had to skip the tiramisu dessert because ran off to another engagement.  Will ask coworkers how it was another time.
author: Shirley N.

description: The service here is really great! Also, the crab is very fresh and delicious! We also ordered mussels and that was good! Perfect for people to share and eat here!
author: Chloe C.

description:
I lived in San Francisco for almost two years, and only on a return visit did I give this place a chance.  I was not excited to eat down at Pier 39, but Crab House really is worth it.  We had the Lots A Crab platter and it was no joke.  
Only thing I wish is that we came during the day so you had something to really look at outside of the window.  It was dark and misty/foggy.
author: Cris G.

description:
Last month we went to pier 39 and had lunch at crab restaurant, 
the crab chowder is ok, but the crab on the iron plate is sooo good!!
it's a must try!!!
author: Susan Shu-Chen T.

description: Customer service was beyond lacking on this visit. The waiter totally forgot about us. Not taking our order for at least 20 min when we sat down. It wasn't even busy. Then never got our drinks refilled, no wet naps. Nothing. I'd rather go to Bobo from now on.
author: Sean J.

description: Wow- it's pretty darn tasty!....it's in a very touristy area ...right by pier 39....there were lots of people around being a Saturday afternoon....but the wait for the restaurant went pretty fast ...maybe 10 mins.  We ordered the mussels and shrimp on the skillet, garlic fries, garlic noodles with crab, and calamari which was really good (had jalepeno sand house special dipping sauce)- the food was definitely good maybe a tad bit on the salty side....
author: Ji Won K.

description:
As a local, I was apprehensive about this place as the Pier 39 area is riddled with overly-expensive tourist traps with so-so food.  Fortunately we didn't feel that way walking out!  The four of us shared:

- CAESAR SALAD WITH CRAB:  Loaded with generous amounts of crab!   The dressing was a very mild version of Caesar, but after a couple bites I realized that was good so as not to overwhelm the sweetness of the crab.  A great choice for something lighter.
- DOUBLE MUSSELS DOUBLE CRAB:   This was 24 mussels plus 1 whole roasted crab.  The crab was slightly overcooked and thus a little dry in some areas, but the mussels were good, and I really liked the lemon butter dipping sauce.
- WHOLE KILLER CRAB:  We were hungry and ordered an extra crab so that we'd get 1/2 a crab each.   Maybe a bit too much food for lunch, but would be about right for dinner.  Same problem as the other crab in that it was slightly over-roasted, but still delicious.
- GARLIC FRIES:  Very solid rendition.
- GARLIC NOODLES:   Not like the Asian-style garlic noodles proliferating all over the Bay Area, but instead light fettucine noodles tossed with garlic, parmesan & herbs.   Tasty but I prefer Asian-style a little more.

While our meal was on the pricey side ($150 for lunch for 4), we enjoyed it quite a bit and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to others who are in the area.   Though it seems expensive, prices are about comparable to other crab restaurants (Thanh Long, etc.), so if you're going to get crab, this is as good a place as any, but you better like garlic  :)
author: Alice C.

description: They don't serve a whole steamed crab. Boooo! See I want my crab intact. I don't like it when you only give me crab legs. I want my yummy crab brain! The only thing I enjoyed was how they served it. Oh, and the company of my hubby.
author: Marjorie U.

description:
The first time I came here, they let me have the pasta by itself with the sauce on the side so I could control the amount of sauce I wanted to eat with my pasta. I thought this was totally awesome! But when I came there a 2nd time, they wouldn't let me do that. Weird.

The clam chowder isa MUST HAVE. Really flavorful and sooo good. Could go there just to eat that thing only.

The garlic fries are pretty good too, the best I had.

Pasta was meh, I really wish I could've controlled the amount of sauce on my pasta. That's why I knocked it down one star.

The customer service is good and pleasant.

I love looking at their interesting collection of hot sauces!
author: Nhi L.

description:
Checked out Crab House at Pier 39 this past weekend hoping for some delicious crab!  With all the high ratings and with almost 1K reviews I assumed top notch food.  

We ordered the Double Mussels and Double Crab (you don't get 2 crabs - it's actually just 1 whole crab with a bunch of mussels).  For $50 it was a pretty good deal and the food was pretty tasty.  Nothing too special in regards to how it was cooked but both the crab and mussels were fresh/meaty.  Service was very attentive (could be because I was there on a Friday night the weekend before Christmas so the restaurant was pretty empty).  We also ordered the clam chowder - a little disspointing - soup was a bit on the bland side.  

Overall, I still prefer Thanh Long or PPQ but that may be because I just prefer the Asian style and flavor.  If you're a tourist visiting SF or a local in search of fresh crab I highly reco Crab House.  However, don't expect all the flavors you get at a PPQ or Thanh Long =)
author: Danny K.

description:
The lady at the front taking reservations and answering the phone was not the friendliest, and it was extremely crowded when I went on a Sunday afternoon. But the service at the table was wonderful and food was delicious. 

We ordered a whole crab; iron-skillet roasted mussels, shrimp, and crab; three bowls of crab chowder; and one fish and chips to share between 7 adults. The crab chowder among my party grabbed mixed reviews, but I personally really enjoyed it, along with the fish in the fish & chips. 

While the food was pretty on the spot, the service at the front could really do some work.
author: Emily J.

description: Very much a tourist trap, but serious about their seafood.  Myself and a guest each had a cup of the crab chowder and then split a large shrimp and mussels skillet.  Both were very good and cooked to perfection.  The alcohol and beer selection was well below average.  Service was smooth and accustomed to being for the high volume.  For a split large entry, 2 drinks a piece and 2 bowls of soup, the bill was $120.  You are paying for service.  Down on the fishermans warf you can get just as delicious food for half the price.
author: matt f.

description: Love this place. One of the few non-tourist trap places on the pier. Food and service was great
author: Todd K.

description:
So, I first came here almost six years ago when I last visited San Francisco. I remember it was an amazing meal and was the best crab I had ever had. I even would tell people who were going to San Fran, "You have to go here, it is SO good!" 

Fast forward to this year. My fiance and I decided to take a road trip from Seattle down to San Francisco and back. I kept telling him that we have to go here because I wanted him to try it, and I remembered it being so good.

It was kind of a let down.

The crab is good, and the sauce is delicious, but it just isn't satisfying like I remember. Maybe we eat too much? I don't know, but we definitely weren't full after having our crab (we ordered the crab that feeds two). My fiance and I were talking about it, and we think maybe they need to offer something more. Maybe more bread? Or a side of something? 

Anyway, about an hour later we ended up getting something else at a stand in Fisherman's Wharf, because we weren't full from the crab. Maybe crab isn't supposed to fill you up, but for our tab being 100+ dollars (we bought a pitcher of beer too), it just was a little disappointing.
author: Laura B.

description:
KILLER CRAB. 

No, really. Make sure you have two things when you go: 1.) CRAB FONDUE and the most delicious crab ever - 2.) DUNGENESS KILLER CRAB® roasted in their secret garlic sauce. Whatever it is they put in that sauce, it's incredible. It's VERY saporous.. maybe a little too well-seasoned for some people, but not I.. and not anyone else I've been there with.

Oh, and if you ever find yourself going with someone who isn't in the mood for uber fun crab-cracking and REAL crab, the CRAB ANGEL HAIR LASAGNA is also scrumptious.. and very filling.

+ Sauvignon Blanc
author: Asha S.

description:
Go for killer crab
Cioppino is bit spicy
AWESOME garlic fries

(PS, didn't fit in the haiku, but not as pricey as it could have been, $120 for 3 people stuffed full after tax & tip)
author: Jennie K.

description:
So with visitors from out of town, decided to hit up a tourista site. Never been here but heard the crab was decent. Yes it was. Here's the details.

6 of us, I wanted to try a cross section of different things. Started with the 'acme' garlic bread, which was good for what it was, a simple garlic spread on acme bread. Wouldn't get it again, but it was good for what it was.

The crab chowder was average at best. It wasn't nearly hot enough and it was basically corn chowder with a dollop of crab in the middle. Disappointing. Expensive at $10 a bowl.

Fried calamari appetizer: in a word, awesome. Good flavor, not too much batter, light and tasty. One of the best I've had in a long time.

A tureen of Zuppa Di Pesce (mixed seafood stew) was very good. Very hot and tasty, filled with seafood. Almost like a soup more than a stew - wished we just ordered this instead of the chowder.

Seared scallops - a dish that any good restaurant shouldn't ruin, and crab house did a decent job. Nicely browned on both sides and good flavor.

Garlic Crab (killer crab) - was pretty good. The garlic on the crab was flavorful and the crab itself was juicy and tender. Definitely not as good as PPQ or Crustaceans, but not bad.

Crab House has decent stuff, the only caveat is that their prices is your basic tourist beast - i.e. high. A place to take your out of town guests when you've basically spent the day at the wharf/pier 39 and you want a nice restaurant to round out your day.
author: Dom L.

description:
My friend recommended the garlic crab here and it definitely didn't disappoint.  The crab is pretty well-flavored with the garlic sauce.  The garlic sauce is well spiced and it has a lot of flavor.  We also ordered their garlic fries and the fries were just okay.  I would have liked to have had more garlic.  Otherwise - they were perfectly crunchy.

I do not eat a lot of crab, but this place is solid and worth checking out - especially if you're at fisherman's wharf.

This review is part of my "AWESOME SF DAYTRIP" list.  Check my profile to see my other recommendations.
author: Ken C.

description: Wow they really cram as many people as they can in this restaurant. Service was pretty fast. Food was alright not sure it is worth the price though. Don't get the crab lasagna. Four stars for service.
author: C S.

description: It was good but super touristy. The ambiance isn't the best but that's not what I was there for. I wanted to try really good crab legs and that's what they served. The food is good but it wasn't a place I wanted to spend an entire evening in.
author: Ryan B.

description:
This is my fourth, fifth, sixth, seventh, eighth...times trying the crabs here!! IT IS THE BEST & TO DIE FOR ~

The crabs are freshly prepared and very well marinated, then fried and served on a hot plate!! Smell so.....good!! I brought friends here every time & never disappoints!! This time there were three of us and we ordered the feast which is enough for four people ~ I was totally stuffed but still keep eating until every piece is GONE!!!

MUST VISIT & MUST TRY!!!!! YOU'LL LOVE IT!!!!!
author: Amy F.

description: Good food,  expensive. . But all crab places are in SF...we got seated right away by default I think,  but think its normally a 30 minute wait.  Hostesses and waiter not too friendly, they seemed to not really care about the customer. .. when we arrived, it took like 5 minutes to get eye contact or greeting and im standing right in front of hostess!  I know its a busy place,  but some acknowledgement would be appreciated!  The place is small,  the bathrooms are located right by the entrance and waiting area,  super crowded, hustle feel there, but food is good
author: Janette B.

description: I had extremely high expectations for the Crab House, but was totally underwhelmed. The waiter was clearly rushed, the garlic fries and crab cakes were nothing special, and our main dishes were just okay. The food did come out quickly and the decor of the restaurant was fun, but the overall experience left much to be desired.
author: Danielle D.

description:
I grew up in the Bay Area and have been to Pier 39 so many times I could walk it blindfolded. The Crab House didn't attract my attention until this weekend, when a yelp search showed it as being highly rated. Our party of 5 lucked out and were seated immediately for lunch. We didn't get a window seat, which was too bad because the glimpses I got showed a really nice view. The restaurant's very crowded; we got in nice and cozy with the table behind us.

Crab feast - apparently the crab legs & small piece of the knuckle are drenched in garlic butter sauce & baked on a cast iron griddle. The knuckle meat (normally one of the juiciest, tenderest parts of dungeness) was dry and crusty. The leg meat was acceptable, but not enough to make up for ruining one of the best parts of a great creature. There was plenty of crab for $110 though - the five of us had to pack up some leftovers. Our waitress provided us with plenty of napkins & moist towelettes, which came in handy.

They're getting an extra star for the cioppino - a San Francisco classic and a must-have for any tourist. The large was a huge tureen full of mussles, calamari, octopus, shrimp, and other such delicious seafood, covered with a very flavorful stew. For $50, there was enough for each of us to have seconds, and some even had thirds.

The restaurant is cute, the service was excellent - our waitress patiently explained the cioppino sizes to us and they immediately swapped out the shell bowl just as it was getting full. The crab would be infinitely better if they boiled or steamed instead, then served with a garlic butter dipping sauce. I certainly won't be back for the crab, though next time I'm in the area with out of towners, I might take them in for the cioppino.
author: Linda F.

description:
For the abysmal service and the fact that they sat 6 of us in a table not even good for 4 people since its partially in the way from their serving room. With 2 people ordering the combo (crab + mussels + shrimp), the top of the table was full... what would they have done if more than 2 ordered? Tell us we can't because there's no place to put them on? My mother in law had the whole crab, and they already had to put down the hot plate where her plate should be and she had to eat directly off the serving dish!!! When I asked for a bigger table I wad told it was the biggest they had! 

Crabs were good, but nothing to write home about. Certainly not enough to ignore the bad service.
author: Jcee V.

description: Totally enjoyed the Crab and Shrimp! I think next time we will order more crab! Great dinner at the right price.
author: Matt A.

description:
I would give this place a 3.5 stars.

My boyfriend and I decided to come here for lunch around 3pm. The wait was 30 minutes. The place was actually really small compared to what we saw from the outside. We ordered the small order of mussels, the crab chowder, and the oven roasted crab. The really only memorable thing about it was the crab. The mussels were good too, but would have been better dipped in the butter that the crab came with. I thought the crab chowder was awful.

The service was just so-so.
author: Kelly T.

description: Food is decent. Service seems better than what I read from other reviews. Overall good experience
author: Pok C.

description:
Came here last week for the first time with my relatives. I'm not back in Michigan but I'm still missing the crabs and cioppino!

My cousin and his wife had just visited this place a few weeks ago, so they knew what to order so I didn't really have a thorough read of the menu. We ordered the crab feast, which was $110 (the amount was supposed to be for 4 people), and the seafood cioppino (think it was around $45 for a huge bowl with breads). 

The crabs were amazing! The way they cooked them was very special too. I think they've fried the crabs first because I tasted some tempura-like textures around the meat. The butter dipping sauce was delicious too.

They don't just sell seafood! My sister doesn't eat seafood, so she ordered a chicken garlic pasta. I laughed at her so hard because who would order a non-seafood dish at Pier 39 (?!) but it turned out to be very delicious and we all liked it very much, haha!

Service was very nice too. Our server came to change our plates and bowls multiple times, and was constantly checking on us if we needed help with pouring water (our hands were nasty... covered with garlic and butter). 

Besides the fact that it was a little pricy and I ate like a barbarian, I really enjoyed my first experience here!

Oh and remember to get there early/late to avoid lunch or dinner times! we went at 11:45 and we were the only ones there. By the time when it was close to 1, almost all the tables at our section were filled up.
author: Angela C.

description:
I pull several things out of my closet & none of it works. It's all wrong. It's all WHITE. You can't wear white when going out for crab! That's just a recipe for stain disaster. 

So, my party of four braved the chilly weather to satisfy the birthday boy's crab craving. I haven't been to Pier 39 in a while, but not much has changed: it's still mostly tourists & still haunted by *that* annoying, boisterous group of teenagers using language that makes you want to wash their mouths out with soap. 

We arrived 20 minutes before our reservation time but were seated almost immediately & then promptly had "Crab House" bibs tied around our necks. So, I COULD have worn white today! *sulks for 2 minutes*

We ordered:
- garlic fries app: crunchy & sprinkled with garlic. Garlic flavor did not assault your mouth, mild enough to be enjoyed by everyone.
- fried artichoke app: anything fried is usually a crowd pleaser. Plus, artichokes are my favorite thing to eat when I'm out. Dipping sauce was thick & tangy.
- (me) iron skillet-roasted double shrimp & double crab- 24 shrimp & a whole crab. Big enough for two people. 
- (bf) filet mignon (his commented that it was kind of plain, not the place for a steak, I guess)
- (bday boy) lotsa crab- 3 lbs of dungeness crab in a garlic sauce
- (his lovely lady) iron skillet roasted shrimp & calamari
- a complimentary tiramisu (complete with candles) was brought out for the bday boy

Total: $210 (not including tip)

Service was great. My friend's soda came out while our waiter was still standing at our table taking orders-5 stars for his handy dandy computerized order inputer! He & his bus boys checked on us often. 

The Crab House is one of the better restaurants at Pier 39 for seafood. But their sister restaurants (Boboquivari & The Stinking Rose) are even better places for crab because the garlic sauce flavor is more prominent at those restaurants. 

Good place to bring out of towners for a crab feast.

P.S. Don't forget to get your parking ticket validated.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Greasy & Pricey. 
Not Good!

The lighting sucked, and so did the service..
The place wasn't properly mopped at all. Someone actually slipped and almost flipped our table when he was walking by.
author: Dalu Q.

description:
We don't get a whole lot of fresh dungeness crab in Texas so it was pretty important to me to eat some when I was in SF. We hit up the Crab House on a Saturday night and encountered a wait of about 30-40 minutes. Not too bad for a touristy part of town. 

We ordered some fried calamari-delicious in the mouth! a side salad with their ginger oil-OMG, so good and a huge platter of the iron skillet roasted crab covered with uber salty garlic herb goodness. We tucked in and wrecked that crab. It was so good. Then we sopped up all the garlicky bits off the pan with our bread. 

This service was good. They kept our glasses filled and paid attention to our needs. 

I didn't think the 50 bucks for 3 lbs of crab was too terrible a price point. It is SF and we were on Pier 39. I like the fact that a number of the menu offerings came in small, medium and large sizes.
author: Theresa H.

description:
Seafood with a view.

My boyfriend and I sat at the bar and enjoyed with sunshine blaring through the wall of windows surrounding us and the tranquil view of the bay.

Clams, Garlic Steamed - Served in a bucket and drowned in a white broth that was herbaceous with a hint of butter.  We requested extra bread, which was a mini baguette that we tore off in pieces and dunked in the sauce.  The warm dough was soft and obviously fresh baked and sopped up the delicious broth.  There were quite a few clams in the medium sized pot and they were tender and yummy ($25).

Crab Cakes - Small little crab croquettes that were crunchy on the outside and not mushy like most crab cakes I've had.  Very good.  I highly recommend this appetizer ($15).

The food was awesome.  I would definitely come back and maybe try the Iron Skillet-Roasted shellfish.  A lot of people around us ordered that and it seemed to be what the place was known for.  Great seafood, great bread, and great service.
author: Elise G.

description:
So, this place is pretty nice for being at Pier 39 and all. It's decked out in marble and makes you feel all classy with napkins that aren't even made out of paper. And, true to the name, they have crab. If we would have ordered anything else I'd be a total asshat to leave a review. 

With that being said the crab was better than good, awesome even. Views are nice and the atmosphere is A-Ok. Easily the best meal I've eaten in a while. 

So, why only three stars? Three words describe the service: EPIC FUCKING FAIL. Like as in, I can't believe this really happened kind of fail. Really.

So, them giving me a dirty fork wasn't that big of a deal. Shit happens. Service being a little slow just means you're in San Francisco. 

However, our waiter brought me a diet coke, and then some other waiter came and took it away from me and said, "sorry, he wasn't supposed to give you that, it was for one of my tables." 

Let me repeat: another waiter came to my table and said I couldn't have my drink!!

When we complained to our waiter he took the diet coke off the bill... so I guess we saved $2.95 off of our $100 lunch. FAIL FAIL FAIL.

For something that egregious, the manager should have come, apologized and promised that he'd fire that asshole, or at least given us a real discount or something. That didn't happen. I hate to leave a mediocre review for a place with great food but when shelling out 100 bones for lunch it's not ok to be treated like dogshit.
author: Rob M.

description: OK, so I finally was back in San Francisco this summer, and I raved about this place to my gf; that we had to go to it, that that sizzling platter thing I had years before was so so good. I ordered the same thing that I did last time and it was really really gross. The platter they cooked the seafood on seemed like it hadn't been cleaned, like they just kept reusing it. The muscles were mushy, nothing on the platter tasted good at all. (Although the clam chowder we also ordered was good. Thank god we ordered that or the dinner would have been a total zero.) I was SO disappointed. This literally had been one of the Top 5 meals I had ever had in my life -- I mean I joined yelp just so I could rave about it -- and it was really bad. I guess even worse because I had been looking so forward to it. I actually wound up apologizing for bringing us there and hyping it up, especially because it was expensive too. Maybe it was an off night. I don't know. But I won't be going back there the next time I'm in SF.
author: Colleen L.

description:
We went to Crab House yesterday and had wonderful meals! Even if the signature dish is crabs, my husband had the Halibut and I had the Cioppino. Both dishes were excellent and the lemon tart was very good too.... So was the service.
If we come back to SF, we definitely will get back to that place.
author: Barbara B.

description:
YUMMMMM

The BF and I shared the following:
1. Mussels and Shrimp (medium size) 
2. Lotsa Crab

I hearted the crab first then the shrimp and mussels last. BF preferred it the other way around which is probably why we're perrfect for each other :)

He was full after but maybe he shouldn't have kept eating the gross, crusty outside parts of the bread in the beginning! gross gross gross! but that's just M Y preference.

Since I have cousins in MD, I'm a crab cracking pro but even pros of the likes of me are prone to crab shell cuts. But no worries, the server will happily provide you with some bright blue band-aids.

Oh and get some mini donuts at Trish's mini donuts on the first level of the pier.

BABE aren't you proud of me! My FIRST (and possibly) last review :*
author: Sylvia A.

description: Great spot! Limited menu but if you're are looking for crab and seafood look no further. Quick service and good size portions. You won't regret eating here.
author: Michael G.

description: The food was ok. I had the grilled shrimp and I didn't expect the outside to still be on. It was very crowded and loud.
author: Melissa H.

description:
Make sure to reserve before coming here! Otherwise you can give Pier 39 and the sea lions a good visit before you're able to get inside!

And don't bother dressing up real nice here because it's a crab house! Things are gonna get messy! I recommend the 6lb small crab plate!
author: Yasmine O.

description:
This place is BUSY, and rightfully so.  Service could use some work, but the food is great.  It's pricey, but that's to be expected, it's on Pier 39 after all.

We had a large party, so we were able to try a variety of items.  

Crab Chowder - Very Good
Calamari - Great!
Garlic Fries - Great!  Not the most Garlicky, that award goes to Sally's Famous Fishwich down the street, but still well seasoned and very, very crispy!
The Linguine with clams was above average.
The Crab Alfredo was decent.
The Zuppa di Pesce was good.

So why 4 stars still?  THE CRAB.  After all, it IS called The Crab House.  So the crab appears to have been roasted, and comes on a sizzling hot plate smothered in their "special garlic sauce".  It's flavorful, and a great change from your standard, plain, boiled affair.  

Plus, there's a nice view of the bay while you eat.  Always a plus.
author: Martin L.

description: the food was not bad, we came in at 4pm on Saturday and it was busy but no wait required. There were empty table but they seem like they wanted us to get out. They are very adamant about trying to clear our table. We had to stop them several time, at one point they took our cup with beer still in it. I know it's good manner to keep customer's table clean, but this is way too excessive.
author: san w.

description:
My friends and I are visiting from NYC/Austin... as tourists we were already at Pier 39 and seeing the reviews on here decided to stop in. We all wanted crabs. My friends were nervous because they didn't want to be tricked into a tourist trap and we were a bit nervous about the $$$. However, we were totally surprised. Walking in we were welcomed by the fire in the center. It was still pretty packed at around 4PM. We decided to get a whole bunch of options and split it.

Prix-fixed meal $24 gets you a salad, half order of crabs, and tiramisu.
We got cup of crab clam chowder, garlic fries as well.

The salad was surprisingly AWESOME! Simple but the dressing was delish.
The Crab Chowder was okay..coming from Boston we are used to a lot BETTER, even at a strip mall or something.

We devoured the garlic fries. The fries were crispy, seriously, the best we ever had. The garlic was just right. Check your breath afterwards though! hha

The prix-fixe crab came with 2 halfs of crab and 4 legs, just enough for 3 people to have 2 each. Garlicky and buttery yumm..dip your fries in it.

Not sure what it was, but we were expecting the tiramisu to be run of the mill..We all thought it was REALLY good! I don't know what the reviews on it are so bad but we ended up almost fighting for it! The flavor was great. 

In the end, came to about $20 a person including tip. Not bad.
author: Mai H.

description: Great crab. Great service good atmosphere. Had the crab meal for 4 and was good amount.  Added shrimp n chips which were really good.
author: Jozef S.

description: The service was great, and the food came out really fast. Little pricy, but it is definitely  worth it!
author: Evan A.

description: It's a great ambience. The place overlooks the bay and the staff is very friendly. My wife and I stopped on by early May and we were very content with the outcome of our visit. Our waitress, Hana, was very attentive to all our wants and needs and provided excellent service. The one gripe was the crab alfredo my wife ordered was a bit too soupy... delicious, but too soupy. Thus, if able I would give this place a 4.5!
author: David A.

description:
First off Let me just say that Pier 39 in its entirety is a complete tourist trap. with that being said I really enjoyed my meal here. I'm from the bay area so I would not consider myself a tourist so when coming here I was a little bit skeptical. My mother told me that I shouldn't waste my time here and the food was just okay (she said you can find way better seafood joints elsewhere). However I have to disagree with my mom on this one!

Crab Chowder: probably the only thing I did not like about this place. I guess I was expecting your traditional clam chowder but with crab in it instead and that was not at all how it was. Same cream base but there was chunks of corn in it and big chunks of veggies. I'm not a huge chunky chowder fan so if you are you might enjoy it.

Garlic Bread: Pretty good. I wouldn't say it was excellent but it was pretty good

Iron Skillet Combo: Crab, Mussels, and Shrimp: now this is why I gave it 4 stars. If you come to the crab house and get anything but the crab you are insane.  They have an Iron skillet combo that is too die for. The crab was sooo delicious and the shrimp was amazing. Plus they bring it out on this Huge Cast Iron Skillet and the flavor from it is exceptional. After we were done devouring our food we used the bread to slurp up the juices! and dark bits that were stuck onto the skillet delicous!

OH i forgot one last thing! Giant pitcher of beer! You cannot have seafood without beer and we of course had to have some. I would recommend the pitcher we easily got 3 maybe 4 full glasses each out of it YUM!
author: Chelsea W.

description: Pretty solid experience. Service was fine and food good. Nothing exceptional and almost 4 stars but just missed. You can do far worse for the money at Pier 39 and I'll give them a try again for sure.
author: Jerry J.

description:
We went here for our anniversary dinner and it is definitely not the atmosphere we wanted but it made up for it with the crab. I usually do not like sea food, even crab! But I munched that crab down here! 

I ordered an expensive steak and it was mediocre, for that much money I would expect more but its a crab house not a steak house. 

Go and eat here, its awesome.
author: Steven W.

description: I have dined here before but only for lunch..I met my son here a few nights ago while visiting him for dinner..we were seated right away since we had reservations for 5..it was downhill from there..5 of us were crammed in a corner next to the kitchen that the waiters kept brushing my grand daughter's hair with other diners meals..service was terrible..once seated we had to wait 10 minutes for drink orders..another 15 for dinner orders..bread plopped down in front of us..roasted crab mediocre..garlic noodles soggy..never saw our waiter again..had to ask the bus boy for water... he promptly got even though not his job..there are many other crab houses that are much better but we had my grand daughter & the wharf can be nice..sorry won't be coming back
author: Denise W.

description: Decent food but not worth the price. Save you money and go to somewhere else on the pier. Not great service.
author: Ashley C.

description: Waiting is so long without early reservation. But the whole dungeness crab roasted in garlic sauce is so worth the wait.
author: Python C.

description: The best restaurant we ate at in San Fran and we did more than our share of wining and dining. The crab was ohhhh so fresh and the crap enchiladas were a great surprise to my palate. The chowder was hearty.  The waitress was very knowledgeable when we inquired about the selection.  She was friendly and efficient.  We sat by the window overlooking the tour boats coming and going. It was just a great experience in its entirety.
author: Candi L.

description:
Delicious!!

After an especially cold, rainy and windy day out on Alcatraz, a friend of mine and I ventured in to Crab House for lunch. They were moderately busy, so we got seated right away. 

First impression was that I was in for a treat. I loved the decor and ambience, and I could smell all the freshly cooked seafood. 

Pros: Super-fresh seafood, the chowder is delicious (a little too sweet for me, I prefer it on the salty side), entire pitchers of ice water on each table (I drink a lot of water with my meals) and the sourdough bread is amazing. The flavors they use on their seafood are delicious as well. Really attentive wait staff. Nice location/views, even on rainy days.

Cons: my crab came out WAY too hot to eat, so I had to sit there, tummy grumbling, until it cooled off enough for me to attack it. The dressing they used on their chop salad was awful and tasted like acetone (thankfully, the waittress didn't charge me for it though).
author: Mehgan K.

description: Wanted to bring an out of town guest for crab.  Given it was Valentine's week-end and Pier 39 was jammed packed.  I made a reservation but if you don't have all your party with you, they won't seat you.  They only have 2 bathrooms so forget about using one anywhere on pier 39 on a busy week-end, esp. if your female!!  So we ordered some crab, romaine salads, garlic noodles and carafe of wine.  Crab came on a cast iron skillet with lots of butter and garlic.  I'm a SF native and I know good crab.  I thought the crab had so much garlic butter, you couldn't taste the sweet, delicate taste of simple crab.  If I wanted garlic butter, I could have had that somewhere else.  I guess most people may like their crab drowning in garlic, I just like it w/ lemon.  There wasn't a choice given, the menu did not say what it comes with.  The romaine salad had such big of pieces, you had to cut each lettuce piece to eat, there was some super small tomatoes on it, nothing else, and the vinarette dressing tasted just like vinegar only.  The garlic noodles were gross, orange grease and they were still very dry.  The only good thing, the service was good and they gave you unlimited sourdough bread.  But for $145. for 3 people I expected better food!!!  I won't be back there again.  Better to go downstairs at the Pier Market Seafood place.  I've always had good food there.
author: Elpida K.

description: I love the food, enjoy the view, and it's a bit expensive! But I'll definitely come back for the garlic crab! yummy! (Better make reservation ahead, the line can be more than 2 hrs long, since its a tourist place!)
author: V C.

description: I had a wonderful time the waitress made me feel very special as we were celebrating my 8th year wedding anniversary. I had never ate a whole crab before and she instructed me without condemnation. After we were finished paying she brought me a dessert with candles I almost cried. The food and customer service were the best I have had in a long time. Thank you for a wonderful experience.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Trust me I've tasted many growing up in the BAY...Crab House by Far was one of the best places I've had for crab. Mother's Day was my first visit and it was very busy...but they did accommodate us very quickly. 

Their Garlic Butter is so tasty and Crab is Fresh, which is important to me. I don't do well with Frozen or Not alive before Cook'd & Served. I get a stomach ache that almost feels like food poisoning if not fresh crab. I enjoyed the Garlic Fries & the Calamari, both crispy and not soggy or oily. 

The service is efficient and quick through out. However, it's a bit compact...I felt some what cramped inside my booth with my party of 4. No where really to put your coats or purses. Not a great place if your party includes someone with a stroller, walker or wheel chair...The ladies bathroom only had 1 stall...There was a huge line even out the door...

Food was excellent but a bit pricey. For some reason I expected a little bit more crab from the Lots of Crab Platter...I shared it with another person, but it didn't seem to me worth the $50...Portion wise...but Yes for the taste!
author: Leah B.

description: The food here is absolutely delicious! Let me rephrase that, delicious is an understatement. This is one of the best places I've ever been too for seafood! I also had a pasta dish with chicken. The chicken was a bit bland, I wish I had added crab meat instead. The wine selection is awesome, and not to mention the views! Overall such an amazing place, minus the service. The staff was rude, when putting up the shades to get a better view of the bay the manager I think he was yelled at our table and the table beside us. 5 star taste 0 star attitude!
author: Anna M M.

description: At least four stars guaranteed. Waited 30 minutes even though I had made reservation, but still worth it.
author: Minjun K.

description: I liked the food (although the crabs were on the smallish side for the cost but I guess these critters are expensive!).  But I don't like that they charged a tax on the mandatory san francisco surcharge although the manager was gracious enough to say that he was going to talk to the owner.  I e-mailed somebody about it and the response didn't appease me.  I don't think it's right.  It's not a huge amount but it's the principle of it.  Maybe I'm wrong about this but I'd be surprised if it's ok to charge a tax on a tax.
author: Shirley V.

description:
This spot is located at Pier 39 on the second level. This place wasn't too bad and walking and checking out the piers all day can build up an appetite.

We stopped in at dinner time. Took a seat at the bar and ordered one of the best mojitos I've had. Not sure, but it almost looked like they poured Prosecco in with it. Whatever it was, my taste buds agreed. Ordered two lobster pastas and they were both cooked very well. 

Now what's up with that butter? I still have nice dreams about it. The place is a bit pricey, but the food is legit.
author: Eric M.

description:
Came here last night with a few friends before closing ordered the large calamari and a crab feast for all to share and had a few drinks to go along with it. Service was average and the calamari was great.....

Aside from that everything else was below average the drinks taste like they had no alchool in them what so ever I may as well have been drinking juice.. 

The crab was very disappointing roasted almost too lon... The shells crumbled when breaking them and the crab meat on the inside was very dry and wouldnt really come out of the shell.

Ive been here a few times before and always had great food but last night was very very diffrent maybe we went too late needless to say I wont be back.
author: Michael W.

description: I get excited every time I'm handed a bib prior to a meal! It makes me giggly to know what's about to come. The "combo" which includes mussels, clams, and a whole crab, arrives to your table on a sizzling platter. The presentation is not unique, but still beautiful. Although the entire platter is well-flavored, the crab seems to always be too dry. GF loves it though. My favorite dish is probably the "crab angel hair lasagna." There are no words for its yumminess. The location overlooks the Bay and is gorgeous at dusk. The décor is kooky with painted crabs along the perimeter of the ceiling.
