The atmosphere is casual and service parallels that of fine dining.
author: Helen L.

description:
2 words. KILLER CRAB!!!

I would gave this place 5 stars because of the Killer Crab and corny crab decor, but it loses a star for being kind of cramped. The waiter knocked over our oil and vinegar like 3 times as he served other guests. It wasn't his fault, the place is just to small.
author: Jesse S.

description: DELICIOUS CRAB!  Since I was coming from out of town, this was just perfect!
author: Katalyst T.

description: Being on Pier 39 it is a casual tourist spot, but the food is good. Of course you come for the crab and we started with the crab caesar salad and then had the crab feast for two. Caesar salad was tasty with lots of crabmeat, but the dressing was a little too much in places. It was a big salad enough for two, just needed some tossing which isn't easy on the oblong serving plate. The crab feast for two was roasted in garlic and a good 1 1/2 pounds of legs, claws and attached knuckle pieces. It was very good, but I'd have to say Scoma's garlic roasted crab edges it out. Not really a big knock if you've ever had Scoma's and I'd definitely come again to the Crab House. Just make sure to have a reservation if you're coming at primetime on a Saturday night because by the time we left at 7pm, there was a good size crowd outside waiting to get in.
author: Roy F.

description: Crab cakes were good but small for the price.  You get two for $15.  My fiance got the salmon meal and she was pleased.
author: Jaydee N.

description: Another restaurant in tourist central, but it does have a great view.  I really do love the crabs here, and I've been here many times even before living in the bay.  The food has very good flavoring.  Not so sure about the pastas tho.  Be prepared for a wait...but service is fast and friendly.
author: Trynh K.

description: I visited San Francisco and my friends and I decided to eat lunch here. we had the crab with shrimp and mussells. I really enjoyed the flavor specially the white wine with butter sauce they serve with the mussels it's so good . The crab had great flavor and tasted great. My friend usually never orders crab however she had a bite of mine and regreted not ordering the combination. The drinks we got were ok nothing outstanding. The only reason I dont give it 5 stars is because of price and the alcoholic beverages were not all that. The atmosphere is very nice and clean and full of light. Nice place to relax and have some lunch. Overall the food was good but not sure if it was worth the price.I would problably maybe splurge and visit this location again.
author: Sandy V.

description: This is the only place we would go at Pier 39 for their crab specials. Food is A+ but don't expect world class service there every time you go. The waiter/waitress could be acting indifferently towards you - maybe they serve so many people every day, but still that's no excuse for a well known restaurant at one of the world's most famous tourist spot.
author: David S.

description: The manager of the restaurant is neither honest nor hospitable. He is a fucking racist. If you are an Asian, don't bother going there if you don't want a shitty meal. In my understanding, the reservations of the restaurant worthy nothing. If you make a reservation, and you arrive on time, they still let you wait, as they won't keep a table for you. What they do is to just let you wait until whenever there are some other guests leave. I wish I could rate 0 star. One star is just too good for the restaurant.  This is the second time I've been here. We had a reservation for a party of four at 5p.m. All four of us arrived at 5 tight, while one of us was parking the vehicle. They just told us they didn't have the table ready for us, and we have to wait till other guests leave. We acquiesced such unreasonable treatment as we knew it was a busy establishment. After about 10mins, they told us the table was ready but we had to wait until the person who was parking the vehicle come here to sit, or they would just release the table to others. We were in grave hurry as we had the had-earned Alcatraz night tour 1 hour afterwards. We told them the other person was just trying hard to find a parking spot and we could order for him first. But they just wouldn't listen. We still can't figure out why they tried so hard to discomfort us. As a host, she didn't have the proper attitude to her customers, rather, she talked in a curiously rude manner. We felt so hurt and would never come again. Besides, after finally having he meal, we all had a serious diarrhea.
author: Merlin L.

description:
I've been to the city more then a few times and I definitely try and avoid pier 39 but when showing a friend around that's never been it's kind of a must do thing. We happen to stroll by the crab house walking down the Pier and thought it sounded decent so after deliberating we settled on treating ourselves to some sea food. 

Our waiter (Matt?) was incredibly helpful and I can't say how great our service was. I felt like we were kind of a needy table having to constantly ask for things like an extra fork , napkins, lemon, and band aids, not to mention I spilled water all over. When ordering he offered other options that might work for us better which is ALWAYS appreciated. He smiled through it all.

The food was good. We had a crab fondue, clams, and some crab legs, along with a salad and desert. I did love the salad and desert. I would have to say my favorite thing was the fondue because how can you go wrong with cheese? The crab was good but not amazing. It was a bit greasy and hard to handle with my cut finger so that was kind of a downer. I think the greasiness kind of turned me off it a bit. Garlic clams were good.
author: Andrea A.

description:
This is the it place for the best Dungeon Crab in SFO 
The food is top quality and the service as well. A hidden jewel if you are not looking close. The have the best garlic roasted crab in the world... Come prepared cuz it gets messy!!!

Will come back for more, again and again... I'm in crab heaven!!
author: Xixi D.

description: My garlic fries was more garlicy than the crab we ordered.   I wasnt too impressed and should have just stuck to the mom and pops crab shops located near the boudin cafe. The crab chowder was really good and our garlic fries was also tasty. Would I comeback? probably not.
author: Alex R.

description: I try to go to this place each time I'm in San Francisco,  I have  been quite a few times and tried others as well but they simply don't compare. Be sure to make reservations and even when you have be prepared to wait a little while, it is definitely worth it! Can't find a place tastier. It is a very fun enviroment, every table seems to be having a great time devouring crabs. don't wear your fanciest dress you will make a mess. And the restaurant is lined with little painted crabs. It is a fun tasty and memorable experience.
author: Tessara V.

description:
Went here as a treat for my boyfriend, who loves crabs! and what a great turn out it was. The crab here was delicious! -- the combination of the butter and garlic etc was extremely good -- perfection. We also got the calamari (yum, but about average), bowl of crab chowder (yum yum yum), and the garlic noodles (bleh, asian garlic noodles are lotssss better, so I'd pass the next time I come here..) 

Service was okay.. we were seated, got our drinks, they took our orders, and we got our food.. that was it.. Ambiance was nice. Loved the view of Fisherman's wharf and the bay and the dim, but not annoyingly Hollister dim, lighting. I'd for sure come back though just for the crab.
author: Lana N.

description: The restaurant has different painted crabs on the wall, very interesting! They have very good crabs and I love the garlic chips that comes with fish. They got a good view in the restaurant as a well.
author: Ricki Y.

description: The crab and shrimp are amazing. Every time we go to the bay we eat at least one meal at The Crab House
author: Brandon M.

description: The crab was great: juicy, savory and even I got a lot of meat out of the legs(I am a horrible crab eater, for the record). But the pasta was a bit too salty and stuffy. A bit pricy but i guess it's expected for seafood and the good location.
author: Huimin L.

description: Although this place is quite touristy, the killer crab is tasty. I always ask for extra "crab sauce" to put on the crab and dip my bread in it. I haven't tried their other dishes so I can't comment on any of those items. Everyone who has gone with me has enjoyed having the crab.
author: Kimmy P.

description: The most amazing crab cakes!!! Sooo worth the price. Great, quick, friendly staff, well worth the wait.
author: Amy W.

description: The best place to eat crabs in San Francisco. The whole crab is super delicious! Just make sure that the portions are huge :)
author: Anna I.

description:
The view is beautiful and serene. Pier 39 is filled with lots of vibrant tourists. 
Crab House had a low key atmosphere, very relaxed. The crab chowder was very good. If you opt for the seafood echilada, share it. The portions are sizeable and enough for two people. Would go again, but won't run back.
author: Monika A.

description:
We visited on a Tuesday evening, you need to book ahead as this location is in the very touristy area at the Pier. We reserved our table via open table about a week in advance and had no problems when we arrived. 

Our waitress was very pleasant and helpful, especially once you dove in to start cracking your crab open! She seemed to always show up to open a wet nap for you just when you needed it!

Atmosphere in here is laid back, music was not too loud and temperature was warm compared to the outside breeze.

We both ordered Prix Fixe which seemed to be a pretty good value. Salad, entree and dessert included. Both of us ordered the 1/2lb crab which came out on a cast iron skillet baked in a mixture of butter, garlic, capers and some other spices. The crab was very fresh and we walked out not feeling like we over-ate. 

We would visit again! Thanks for a great meal!
author: Paul M.

description:
My sis, me and my Uncle all had dinner here last Friday night (our family date night!)

Sis made a reservation for 7:30 BUT of course, we didn't get there until close to 8 pm. We got in, thankfully our table was still there (although at that time, the place was not as busy as I thought it would be for a Pier 39 res.)

Got seated and got served right away. Sis ordered 3 regular mojitos. Then for our appetizers, we started off with the mussel "iron-skillet roasted" b/c my uncle saw it next to our table. It arrived pretty fast and we chowed down. 

Both my sis and I ordered the lobster thermidor and for my uncle, sis ordered him the filet mignon and lobster thermidor. Food came right after we finished the mussels. Folks, the lobster thermidor was soooo cheesy! We all just finished one side of the tail b/c we all had cheesy overload. 

For dessert, we ordered + shared the tiramisu and the chocolate truffle mousse cake. Both desserts were delicious and we made a good dent on all of them.

Overall, dinner was awesome and most likely, I want to try their crabs next time around. (We went here b/c my uncle doesn't eat crabs ~ yes and he's Filipino!)

Another round of THANKS for my sis for tagging me along, once again!
author: Cath M.

description:
Came here this past Monday for lunch with my brother and my fiance. I made a reservation through open table since I read a few reviews suggesting to make one. We showed up a little after 12 pm. Since the restaurant still had plenty of seats left and we did dine here on a Monday, a reservation probably wasn't necessary for us.
We were seated right away and greeted by our server less than 30 seconds later. The server uses some kind of palm pilot thing to take down our order and so as soon as my brother asked for a soda, literally 1 second later, this other guy comes and gives it to him, so pretty quick service here (2 thumbs up just for that).
Anyways, we ordered a medium order of mussels & shrimp, lotsa crab, medium order of garlic fries and I added a Caesar salad for myself because I wanted some fiber in this meal.
We didn't wait too long for my salad to be brought out, along with the mussels & shrimp. Then probably 5 minutes or less later came out the crab. So our server helped us don on our big plastic white bibs so we could all dig in. Our thoughts on the food:

Caesar Salad- total disappointment (yes I know you don't go to a place that specializes in crab and order a salad, but let me tell you why before you get all crazy on me)! All it was was a plate of lettuce plated on a long skinny plate with some cheese and croutons. I don't understand why expensive restaurants always serve these type of lousy salads, but whatever... not worth the $9.95. Oh and the lettuce that is used has so little fiber content, so it was like I didn't have any fiber at this meal.

Mussels & Shrimp- The mussels were nice and fresh. Easy to get the meat out of the shell. Liked that the flavors were nice and light. The mussel itself was lightly steamed, so wasn't tough at all. However, the shrimp was a major disappointment. All 3 of us didn't care for the seasoning on the shrimp and definitely had better else where. Could easily do w/o the shrimp. 

Lotsa Crab- The menu says that this is good for 2 people and I would have to agree. Although there were 3 of us, I didn't eat that much crab (I honestly don't like doing all the work that is involved in savoring these sweet tasty pieces) so this would be good for 2 crab loving people. The crab was nicely cooked. I think it was probably steamed and then dry roasted. It had a nice buttery and garlic flavor, but wasn't overdone. The shell was pretty easy to crack too.  

Garlic Fries- The medium size was probably too much for all of us because the main star of the meal was the crab. Probably could have had a small order to share among the 3 of us. The fries tasted good and had a nice savory garlic like taste but I didn't think they were that great. Honestly I'd be fine without it. 

Complementary Bread- A nice sourdough bread roll is brought out to us in paper bags. The bread is nice and chewy but you don't want to fill up on bread here do you? If you get crab here (why wouldn't you, after all, it is a CRAB house) just save your stomach for that and pack the bread away to go (it's already conveniently in a bag anyway) and eat it for breakfast the next day or something. 

Overall, the crab is king here, with very good attentive service, and prepared very well here. But since it is seafood, and it is made right, you have to pay for it... so this place is not for the penny pinching. Don't waste your money on the shrimp or the salads, or even the garlic fries. Just stick to the crab and don on your bib and take cheesy photos so you can post them on your facebook page and enjoy your meal.

Misc: Oh and real random, this restaurant is located upstairs. There is also some free 3 hour parking available really close to the main entrance of Pier 39.
author: Vic C.

description: It's a sea food restaurant , and the price is very expensive. Because it's on dork , and the environment is very nice. Sea Foods are quite tasty, but not that so worth for their price.
author: Dan Y.

description: Excellent customer service! We walked in and got seated by Cody who provided great service and accommodated us a seat by the window. We then got fast service by our server and food was out very fast! Cody then came by again during our meal and asked how everything was. Great experience!
author: Crystal D.

description: It's a little bit pricey but if you have guests in town, and you make a reservation, it's a nice place to sit down in a busy area. The crabs are very tasty. A reservation can also get you in the best table that has a nice view, very impressive to your guests :)
author: S. F.

description: After searching Yelp for a great place to eat crab, it came down to Crab House or The Franciscan. The reviews seemed to reveal that The Crab House gives you more crab for your money. I can't say if this was true or not, but we chose the "lot of crab" plate for both of us, which was 3 pounds for $50. Not bad. The crab was moist, buttery, and had garlic throughout. Really good. My only complaint is that the water in our stainless pitcher when we got to the table was at room temperature. Then we asked for new water and the new water was the same. Hi umm, a little ice?  Anyways, good place for crab, but maybe some lobster on the menu would be good too, or an alternate selection of crab (snow crab, red crab, king crab).
author: Brandon S.

description: The service here is so good! Crab chowder was amazing! And the view is beautiful! It was very busy in the restaurant but they seemed to have a good system down and got us in and out pretty quick (which I like). Wish I would've gotten crab platter additionally. Next time!
author: Sue M.

description:
Crab House serves crappy Killer Crabs that clog arteries.  I love to indulge in good tasting food oozing with fat, but sadly the excessive fat here did not help with the taste.  The crabs are deep fried, smothered with fat &salt, and served on an Iron Skillet.  The cut edges are dry, hard and excessively oily.

Moreover, their veggies are very out of place.  I would rather they roast some veggies and serve them with the Iron-Skillet dishes than to load them up in the Crab Chowder.

Okay Dishes:
(These dishes are decent, but not something I would go to a way-overpriced restaurants for)
* Clams (Garlic Steamed) - The clams are normal, but the sauce is good with bread and the dishes that are too dry.
* Crab Enchilada -  This dish has a lot of ingredients that go well together.  It is properly flavored, but I only ate a few bites because it is very rich and not outstandingly tasty.
* Mixed Baby Greens Salad (comes with Prix Fixe Menu) - The dressing is interesting
* Calamari - Normal
* Garlic Fries - Fried in the oil that they fry the crab in.  I like Gordon Biersch Garlic Fries more.

Crap:
* Crab Chowder - Worst chowder ever!  Very watered down and loaded with out-of-place veggies.
* Killer Crabs - Crap!  With 17 people, we ordered ten people worth of crab and doggy-bagged half of it.
* Mussels & Shrimp (Iron Skillet-Roasted) - The waiter said the Iron- Skillet Roasted Crab is the same as the Killer Crabs, so we only got the Mussels and Shrimp.  Not much flavor in the mussels and some of them are undercooked.  Moreover, I am not into the tenderized farmed shrimp.

Parking Tip: You can get validated parking at the blue parking garage opposite Pier 39.  There will be signs directing you to that $7/hr garage.  There is 1 Hour free validated parking if you *exit* the garage before 6pm, and 2 Hours after that.  The waiter did not ask us if we need validation.  In case you forget, you can get validation with the receptionist as soon as you arrive at Crab House.
author: Lisa C.

description: Food tasted horrible here. Nothing was delicious. How was it possible that this place got 4 stars. Even the clam chowder tasted like can soup. Seems like it's only for tourist.
author: Michael C.

description:
Overall the restaurant is crowded and tables way too small for the food placement and space to eat. They make creative use of the vertical space by placing large platters on stands, but still too cramped for my liking. 

We ordered the iron platter with crab. Shrimp and mussels. The platter was smoking hot and over cooked the food very quickly. The crab dried out, mussels and shrimp stuck to the platter and tasted burnt. 


 My daughters Cesar salad was presented well. Portioned appropriately and she enjoyed it. 

Service went like this..... You decide how to rate it.

Seated within 10 minutes after arrival with reservation.
Waitress asks what we want to order for dinner within 10 seconds of sitting down. Ask her politely if we can order drinks first. Ok allowed to do so. Ordered an appetizer as well. 
Drinks and appetizer makes it to table, allowed to eat at our pace and once finished the entrees are delivered. See food quality above. 
One more checkin halfway through the meal. Once plates  were removed, check in from waitress and when confirmed no other order check arrives within 10 seconds. 

As we were getting up from our table someone was there waiting to clear and get the table for someone else.

This place is a wham bam thank you ma'am kinda place. If that works for you, then it should be fine...........not for me.
author: Alex P.

description:
**3.5 stars**

I've been to Scoma's, Capurro's, Crustacean's and thought I'd try a new place with my friend in town. We had a tasty meal of steamed clams and roasted crab here. I think the crab could use a bit more jus. It's served in other places with some sort of gravy that encompasses the flavors the crab is roasted in and that was missing here. Luckily I had plenty left over from the clams to dip my crab in. They do give you a decent amount of clams in the clams 1/2 order. For two people we were completely satisfied. I don't know the total because my friend treated but it seems pretty standard for seafood, especially in the area. I'd go back to Capurro's over here but it's still a good eat. I'm just getting more and more picky with my crab!
author: Dalia M.

description: Short wait however the long line looks intimidating. Excellent food. I ordered shrimp and chips and the crab chowder.  More than enough food for two people to share.
author: DAWN W.

description:
On our first evening in San Francisco, we wanted a meal near the water and a with a view.  The Crab House fit the bill.

I easily made a reservation using Yelp, but it wasn't a busy night anyways (yet, technology is still cool!).

I'm not a fish person, but I did challenge myself by getting the fish and chips.  It was good!  My dad got a whole crab, which proceeded to stare at me accusingly the whole meal.  My requests to turn it around were ignored.  

Service was slllllooooowwwww, and the place was a little too crammed full of tables and chairs to move around easily.

Overall, decent food, excellent spot, "meh" for service.
author: Kate L.

description: The crab is Amazing. The sauce is delicious.  However you pay for it and pay for it. Great view of the water, good music. Had an oyster shot that I wasn't thrilled about but the crab was amazing. Dinner for two your looking at a hundred.  But worth the price
author: James T.

description:
a bit on the more expensive side. 
came here with my friend after a day game at the at&t park. was craving sea food and decided to walk to the pier for some. out of all the places we decided to  choose here because the smell was wafting towards us and we could not resist .  we got this combo plate where there was mussels and shirmp. nicely tossed with some wine right in front of us, and we were in heaven. the garlic butter sauce and a hint of lime was the best way to go with this. 

the crab chowder however was only okay. i couldn't really taste the crab. 

if it wasn't so out of my way and more on the pricey side i would totally come back.
author: Janne Y.

description:
5 star service! Fun and interesting decor. We had the roasted garlic crab for 4 with garlic fries, garlic noodles and bread with melted mozzarella cheese. MMMmmmm..... the crab was booooomb, so was the bread, but the noodles were nasty. I'd still go back for the crab and decor =)
The waiter places your bib around your neck....I though he was gonna crack my crab and feed me too....dang...but he didnt..woulda gave him a bigger tip ;)
author: Faren G.

description:
I took a first time visitor to SF here based on the Yelp score.... I was so let down. 
1. it is WAY over priced
2. The menu is not that extensive
3. the place smells like bleach (totally ruined the experience), I get cleaning with so much raw seafood around, but at least air the place out! 
4. The service was HORRIFIC! Our server was not at all interested in our table and the food took way too long for a sald and a filet of fish. 

The only pro was that the food was not bad. I had the crab caeser salad and I must say that they did not skimp on the crab. My friend had the salmon which he claimed was decent.  

Honestly there are so many good places to eat right in there, that I am shocked that the Crab House is able to compete. I was simply 100% disappointed in this experience.
author: Ashley J.

description:
Shooting photos in foggy, chilly weather can be a strain on your body.  Especially when you forget your gloves and don't have a flask of Bulleit Rye in your pouch.  So it was last eve.  To escape the bone-chilling cold, we ducked into Crab House to replenish ourselves whilst waiting for the sun to set in anticipation of night shooting.

Our server was incredibly polite and humble.  So polite and gratiating, in fact, that I wanted to take him home to beat it out of him.  But despite all this, our drinks were "satisfactory" and the food delicious.  Just what we needed to get some warmth back in our bones for the night ahead.

I'll come back, fo sho.  I'm curious to find out what I taste like on a bubbly skillet and smothered in garlic and spices.  Yummy!
author: Lorrayne L.

description:
Great food.  Large crab.  Great apps.  Large portions.  
Kind off pricey, but good food sometimes cost extra.
Friendly service, great ambiance.  

Only complaint Very Hot and stuffy in this place, and very cramped dinning room.
author: R H.

description:
Super grateful to Yelpers for turning us on to this gem. Fisherman's Wharf is (obviously) overrun with seafood restaurants, and without Yelp, we would have just closed our eyes, spun around, and picked one. 

Pier 39 is super cheesy, packed with kitchsy tourist shops and very little substance. We browsed it quickly, and spent some time checking out the seals, but wouldn't have returned if we hadn't found out abuot the Crab House.

We ordered steamed crab, shrimp, and mussels, and they were PACKED with flavor. We were seated overlooking the Pier 39 seals, Alcatraz, and the Golden Gate Bridge. It was exactly the San Francisco experience we were hoping for. The place is casual, reasonably priced, and the service was excellent. Our attentive waiter changed our shell-filled plates out frequently, and brought us warm towels to clean up with afterwards.

Pier 39 seems like a giant tourist trap, but it's worth battling through the fluff for a great dining experience.
author: Jessica O.

description:
Was referred here by a fellow tourist. Was craving godo crab but didn't want to over pay for "ok crab" .... and Crab House didn't disappoint ..

Everything about this place was great! 

The view is amazing .. day or night ..

The waiter we had was funny and great at explaining the menu. He was patient when we tried to decide how three of us would share a plate and helped us even get the best bang for our buck and the most meat out of the shell LOL!

The prices are pretty average I would say for a seafood place, and I was willing to pay and it was well worth it. The bill before tip was $140 for three people to share 2 large crabs, and two appetizers with drinks!

The decor is cute too .. think CPK with the boxes painted but this place has crabs painted all around the place.

A great stop also because it is at pier 39 which means you can shop after or before your meal and pack on the souvenir pounds too!
author: Emily P.

description:
Let's put it this way. I don't particularly fancy crab, but after eating this beautiful, succulent, and just simply scrumptious crab I must say I want more. This place has ruined all other crab for me. It's actually quite sad because I end up comparing seafood to Crab House's crab and nothing even comes close. 

On appetizers, I recommend the garlic fries, crab chowder, bruschetta, and caesar salad. I know a lot of people have mentioned the garlic fries and reading this one is probably wondering what is so special about this fries. Let me explain, even though it is most definitely fattening(it's fries, this should be a nobrainer) when i tasted this delight, I felt my weight lifted. It's light, creamy, but also salty and garlicy to the best degree. 

Personally, I don't like the texture of oyster so I didn't try one. BUT, my friend that came with me ordered and simply raved on about the it. I can't exactly say much but from what I heard, the sauce was delectable. From the looks of it, the presentation was palatable and the color was quite exquisite too. 

On another note, sometimes the wait to get into the restaurant is a wee bit long. It ranges from ten to forty-five minutes(max). During holidays, it could take longer. I strongly encourage reservations. But, if you decide on a whim to go to the restaurant, note that it is Pier 39. There are gorgeous decorations, a plethora of unique shops, performers. The street vendors offer cotton candy, churros, hot dogs, and other little snacks. Also, there are street artists that honestly are brilliant; I bought this little piece of the golden gate region for around ten dollars. It now hangs in my room. Basically, even if you do end up having to wait for a while longer than expected, there is always stuff to do. The wait is worthwhile. 

The view from the store is also something "to die for." If you end up sitting at a window seat on persay New Year's Eve or July Forth, you'll have the optimal view for fireworks. The bay is always gorgeous year round even without the special days so never fear. 

Holiday season is coming up and I definitely recommend this restaurant if you are bringing friends or family on a tour around San Francisco. They'll never want to go home. If the concept of your relatives staying for longer than a week scares the living hell out of you, maybe you want to reconsider going to this restaurant. It's that good.
author: Shannon H.

description: Five stars for excellent service and very delicious food. The garlic noodles were so good, we ordered another round. Of course it was so tasty, we ate it all before I had a chance to snap a pic. Oops.
author: Margaret Y.

description: Had lunch here with some co-workers over the weekend.  The place was packed!  Had the crab chowder with mozzarella garlic bread.  All-in-all, pretty standard fare.
author: Jesse M.

description:
I went for lunch with my family with high expectations from Yelp. Unfortunately, this place was a complete letdown.

For the price, I was expecting far better service. To begin with, my very small Chinese family of four found our booth to be too cramped. We asked to switch tables and while another server said it was okay (and we later found out that this switch was also made on their computers), our server said no. 

And speaking of our server... She was absent and entirely unfriendly until the end of the meal, when she started to at least fake a smile. I'm pretty sure she judged us the whole time we were there. I know Pier 39 gets a lot of tourists from countries where tipping is not customary, but we know proper restaurant tipping etiquette - we've only lived in the U.S. for 15 years. I have NEVER been looked down upon so much for wanting to share a meal because I wasn't hungry. She ended up giving us the wrong bill because of the aforementioned table switch issue and didn't realize it until we were almost out the door. She reminded us that gratuity is not included in listed menu prices and told us what recommended tipping percentages were. Ummmmmm OKAY LADY, PLEASE. I KNOW HOW THIS WORKS. Plus the menu already explicitly stated this! I actually told my dad to leave her a penny because that is all she deserved, but he was a lot more generous than he should have been. (But my mom and I both refused to let him tip anywhere near the percentage we typically tip.)

The one star earned back was for the food. It wasn't spectacular but it was good. The portions were pretty small. My sister's fish and chips were the family's unanimous favorite dish ordered, which is kind of sad in retrospect. I liked the crab angel hair lasagna I ordered, but it was overly salty and oily.

For a $$$ meal, unacceptable.
author: Annie L.

description: the crab is good, the shrimp good (and cheap) too. But the cram soup recommended by the waitress... Not so good. It's 30 dollars, but I would rather have a bowl of 10 dollar clam chowder! So, if you have a party of three, order two crabs, and maybe some shrimps! That'll be enough!
author: Zihan Q.

description:
Located on the 2nd level of Pier 39, not typically a place where we would go to eat out since it's super packed with tourists and food is overpriced; however, Crab House was worth it. But only with a reservation. With a reservation, you will perhaps have to wait 10 minutes for your table to get cleared, but that beats 45 minutes to an hour for walk-ins. 

The 2# crab is deliciously garlicky and buttery with a surprising amount of meat for two. You would be satiated. Best not to overindulge and encourage the onset of gout anyway. We also ordered calamari and a caesar salad. My suggestion is if it's not crab -- you're wasting precious stomach space on filler that's just "ok."

Go for the crab.
author: L C.

description:
I have been coming to the Crab House around ten years now. This is my favorite place in San Francisco.  If you LOVE crab as I do, this is the place to be.  We just ate here on my birthday Friday 9/13/13.  My boyfriend and I, while waiting at the fireplace bar for our table, had a crab cake appetizer and two Bloody Marys.. delish!! My only complaint??? only two small crab cakes :((
There were four of us for dinner, we ordered four salads, four crab chowders(needs to be hotter) and the "CRAB FEAST" OMGosh!!! absolutely the best of the best, and bread of course.  Service was great, I've never had any issues with that, ambience, great food, great company.. all in all a wonderful sumptuous birthday dinner :))
Being Friday the 13th, I had one small mishap O.o
reaching for the water pitcher I knocked over the balsamic vinegar to the ground and it shattered O.O
they cleaned it up within five minutes.. amazing
author: Susan S.

description:
Best crab of my life. Amazing fries. Shrimp. Mojitos. Garlic bread. 
I've constantly thought about the meal I had here and that was now four years ago.  If ever I am back in San Fran I will definitely be here again
author: Ang L.

description: Found this place on yelp then went, did not let me down. Had seafood here with friends and mom, they all loved it! Good breath around, view of the harbor, boats and seagulls.
author: Rui S.

description: Mediocre, don't plan to return. Got the 3lb crab, crab was somewhat dry on the inside and not very flavorful. Seemed like most of the sauce just fell to the bottom of the plate. I prefer R&G lounge crab...I know it's a totally different style, but my crab just didn't taste right...weird seafood smell. Garlic fries were decent and the calamari was good too. The crab cakes were overcooked and burnt on the outside. Crab chowder was mediocre as well.  Not a cheap place, about $500 for 10 people. On a positive note, I called the same day to make a reservation for 10 and they were quite accomodating. I even arrived 1.5 hours earlier than my reservation and they only made us wait about 20 minutes to be sweet. Yay for good service. Our server was also nice and patient w/us. 18% tip was included for our large party.
author: Caroline L.

description: Eating while steam crab on the sidewalk. Probably the cheapest way to eat a whole crab, it's kinda difficult to eat, but c'mon crab is really good!!
author: Jonathan l.

description: We come here every year as part of our family trip to Pier 39 for the holidays.  I was disappointed with this visit to the Crab House.  The food was great.  Cioppino and half crab were great.  The service however was lacking.  The food came out quick when we ordered which was nice but the wait staff was sub par.  My wife and I ordered a half bottle of wine (I won't get into the lack of quality wines for $12/gls when I can get a great wine for less at a Napa Valley restaurant) and a kids shirley temple.  The runner brought over the wine and shirley temple, which was in a large glass, and motioned like the kids drinks was for me when there were 2 adults and  one child at the table.  My wife ordered crab and I had to ask the server for a crab bib which he replied "sure" with a tone like I was asking him to knit me one.  Also, we were never given butter with our bread.  I think we will look for a new restaurant as part of our tradition next year.  It seems like they get so many people coming in that they just want to flip tables as fast as possible sacrificing service and tips for their staff.
author: Michael F.

description: The Killer Crab!!! 2nd time I've been here and it didn't disappoint. Great views,attentive service and great food. You can't ask for more.
author: Wil Y.

description: It's been awhile since I've been here, but the memories never fade. Everything was amazing. Try everything, simple as that. The crab feast is a must if you have 3 or more. The mussels are not be forgotten either. The view by windows was also nice.
author: sebastian T.

description: Everything we had was so delicious! The crab for 2 was perfect, garlic fries were savory and bloody Mary's were so good!! Can't wait to go back!
author: Julie K.

description:
So, I have been coming here for many many moons now or at least it seems like it.  I 1st Stumbled on this establishment with my boy friend back in (08). I am a huge fan of Pier 39 & we were wondering around stairs & this place caught my interest with crab cage, awning & water craft like appearance. Plus, it had a pretty good looking menu on the outside that defiantly helped. My boy friend has a deep love for Dungeness Crab that also helped. So, you put those things in the equation & you can pretty much guarantee him & I were going to dinner there. My most recent visit to the Crab House was last year with my best friend Stepheni R.

On the inside it packed full of charm & a rustic boat like feel.  They have adorable mirrored port holes at your entrance & Host or Hostess to greet you. They have a mini full bar & to the left a cute intimate fire place to eat or curl up in front of with your sweetie on those cold & windy San Francisco nights. There are several options as far as dinning seating goes. You can dine at the fire place, on the right side of the Restaurant where they have booths or the left side beyond the bar where you have  tables. They have more adorable mirrored port holes that are properly  threw out the restaurant & over head a huge  variety of decorated crabs. Any type of crab to fit any one's personality or for different occasions. They are too cute. They have lovely window seat's with view of Forbes island, the sea lions, & Alcatraz & the San Francisco Bay. Now, the eating quarters are a little tight. So, don't expect a lot of leg room.

Now, let's get to my (2) favorite dishes that I crave. These dishes are signature to the Crab House by the way. I  flippin'  LOVE the Crab Alfredo. Oh my goodness, it's pasta smothered in a rich Alfredo sauce with little chunks of Dungeness  Crab. This takes Alfredo to a whole new level. It is so much better than you can even imagine. It makes Chicken Alfredo or Shrimp Alfredo look like a joke. There is no comparison between them. 

Another delicious (1) for the record books is there Dungeness crab chowder. It's creamy & rich and seasoned to perfection. If you thought New England Clam Chowder is your favorite soup you may start to 2nd guess that. My only complaint is the hard bread they serve while you wait for your meal or appetizer. Get new bread guys.lol

I love this place it's as charming as they come,has a great location &some superb food. 

-Elena ;)
author: Elena A.

description: I was able to use Open Table to make a reservation for 11 and they sat u's right on time.  The killer crabs were tasty and delicious.  Service was good and food arrived fast.
author: Cindy T.

description: Very good lunch and drinks. Mango mojitos and fried fish sandwich and crab seafood bread bowl soup! Yummy good service great view!
author: Traci H.

description: Got a crab melt to go and it was extremely delicious! Need to find a place that has them closer to where we live! Went inside briefly to order super nice bartender offered me water while I waited. Only reason I'm doing 4 stars is because it smelled wired inside but honestly that was probably all the crab! No biggie! Again...sandwich was amazing!
author: Jenn O.

description:
Bad bad bad services!
We went there for lunch and the hostess have a very bad attitudes with us.
The worst thing is that when we complain to the manager and he acts like a " dead crab " and no apologize at all.
I don't think they deserve 4 stars at all.
I can get a better services and food somewhere else.

Not recommend this place to anyone!
Think twice before you decide to eat here.
author: Double D.

description:
You know that scene in Defending Your Life with Albert Brooks where he dies and goes to purgatory?  He's in the restaurant and orders and five seconds later a waiter comes back with his order and he's like, "You made this for me?  Just now?"  And the waiter says, "Yes, for you.  That's how we do it here."  And then he tastes it and it's the best he's ever had?

Well it's like that.  Except you don't need to be hit by a bus to have this experience.
author: Ryan P.

description: Took my man here for a romantic fathers day dinner..we enjoyed every piece of food that went into our mouth..our waitress was really prompt and sweet..our food came out minutes after ordering it..they were extremely busy it was crazy how fast they were able to get our drinks, appetizer, and main dishes out..we had a beautiful window table that overlooked the waters and boats..the crab was fresh and packed full of flavor..the garlic noodles were out of this world..not over bearing with garlic just enough to make u want more and more! We were really satisfied with our experience and can't wait to come back
author: Kanani S.

description: Not as great as it is hyped up to be, crab was ok seemed like it was frozen, crab enchiladas wasn't that great, had cooked lettuce.  The door man didn't do his job because he was letting people cut in front of other people waiting to put there name on the seating list.
author: Sel L.

description: First, it's an hour wait to get in. The crab was over cooked, the crab meat wasn't pinkish in color, more grayish. The steak had a char that over-powered the taste of the steak. The fries were best for me. The waitor would've got a better tip , but he was forgetful and didn't chat with us the way he did with other tables.
author: CY R.

description:
Best crab I've ever had hands down.

Crab chowder was amazing. Like nothing I've tried before. 

My boyfriend and I shared a 3 lb crab and it was perfect. The garlic butter sauce was amazing. 

We did have to wait about 20 minutes to be seated, but it was a Saturday so I expected as much. It was a bit chaotic though, so be prepared.
author: Josephine L.

description: Still an amazing place to eat. Had no reservations Monday night, place was busy but everyone was super friendly and accommodating. This night we had, Lots-A crab, Crab Chowder and Bala Fish which was all hot and delicious. Our waiter Carlos was super friendly and cool.
author: Mac B.

description:
Came here last December with a group of people.  It's run of the mill food and service at a premium price.  The crabs weren't that fresh, and it's really just OK.  I think it's more of tourist place than for someone who is local.  

I will come back again, if I don't have to pay for it.
author: Lolipop W.

description:
Came here a few months ago with a friend and was not impressed.  We shared: 

*2 pound crab -  the crab was dry and overcooked.  
*garlic fries - nothing special
*garlic bread w/ mozzarella - I thought the garlic bread would be served with slices of fresh mozzarella or melted mozzarella, but instead, it came with a few pieces of stale shaved Parmesan.  Such a disappointment. 
*zuppa de pesca - my favorite item we ordered from Crab House, but even then, not that great.  It reminded me of a lesser version of Stinking Rose's seafood tureen, with the garlic tomato broth and seafood.

Overall, an overpriced touristy spot with over sauced, poor quality crab.
author: Jen Y.

description: Had Dungeness crab. Delicious!  Service is superb. Thought it might be a little touristy because it's on the wharf, but not so. Worth the money.
author: Sandi F.

description: we showed up late afternoon and had zero wait.  got seated by the window, ordered just Lots of Crab and Champagne, no starch, nothing.  was such a feast, that extra touch of flavor to the crab was just right, and at $18 per pound i'm glad we didn't pull the trigger at one of those touristy places by pier 43.5!  best value ever for this range
author: Wendy L.

description: How good is this place ?  We had it 2 times in 3 days.   Garlic noodles and shrimp !! was great   crab enchilada bomb !  service good there is a line to wait for a table but it moves very very fast. The servers have all the new gadgets to communicate with the kitchen and bring you food exactly how you asked for it to be prepared.  This place is a must eat for San Fran.
author: Peter G.

description: Crowded.  Deliciously garlicky crab shrimp and garlic. fri es.  Steaks are ok.  If you lile your steak medium, order it med rare.
author: Lu A.

description:
#The crab shack is a little old place where we can get together, crab shack bay-bee, crab shack baby, crab shack, that's where it's at, crab shack, that's where it's at...#

Sorry, this is what happens sometimes. Crab House is as touristy as they come. Really. From the 'Got Crabs?' t-shirts to the plastic crabs and fisherman's nets which adorn the walls and ceilings, to the cellophane bibs and the giant sharing plates of seafood, this was something a bunch of Europeans like us just *had* to do during our stay in SF. Pier 39 baby. Bring it.

I experienced many brand new things at Crab House. One of which was being told to 'walk around' by a front of house member of staff. Yes, this is true. Jenny L and I popped over on behalf of our group of 8 which was arriving in a few separate segments, and we had booked, so we quote:
    'Your table isn't ready yet, the gentleman there is still paying.' (Points at restaurant area.) 'You can just walk around for a while if you want.'

Oh... okay? Around... the restaurant itself? Right. What we *did* do was pull up a few pews at the bar, and though this isn't the restaurant's fault, the gentleman in question seemed to be taking a financial analysis course at our table. Really, how long does it take to pay? What *was* the restaurant's fault however was that we were sat at that bar for approximately half an hour, and nobody even offered a drinks order. That was also pretty new to me.

What else was new? Oh yeah! So the guy opposite who was crabbing it up with his girlfriend did something I'd never seen before. He had a Corona with a lime in it, and after popping the wedge down into the neck of the bottle he covered the rim with salt, like a margarita. As a Corona fan I was intrigued, and if I'm feeling brave enough I might try it myself one day. Tips! The really nice dude sat next to us at the bar recommended one thing: the garlic fries. In fact those were so good, we ended up ordering two batches. Double tips!

Meanwhile we did eventually sit down, and four members of our party shared the monster epic crab dinner which looked amazing, and delightfully messy. It was apparently very garlicky but very good. I had basa fillet which blew me away, I had to say I wasn't expecting brilliance from a tourist trap but I was super impressed with the sundried tomatoes (I'm so 80s, I was also wearing a jumpsuit to dinner), the giant couscous, and even the salad side was delicious, along with the roasted veg. Jenny L and Row H both had steaks which they were equally surprised by. So we were all happily fed, and the waitress who attended to us was delightful. The beer drinkers at the table didn't rate the pitcher too hotly, but our Chardonnay was crisply nice enough.

The crab theme is cute (some may hate it but you've got to appreciate it in the kitschy charm kind of way), but marks down for the weird start to the evening... Other than that, thumbs up all round - great food, great company and a great way to spend our free night in the city.
author: Emma Louise M.

description: One of the nice places at Fishermans Wharf in SF, delicious food (we tried Halibut, Fish&Chips and Chicken Alfredo), everything was pretty good. Only a short wait today due to less people around. Only a little bit too loud so I would not recommend it for a romantic dinner unless you dont mind the atmosphere (which wasnt bad in general only growded and loud). I would definitely go again when I am in the mood for seafood.
author: Jana H.

description:
Went there while down in San Francisco. Food is delicious. Very good crab selection, and great fish and chips.

Ambiance is excellent. It makes you feel like your in this big boat or submarine...I don't know, any kind of transportation device underwater.

I didn't find anything wrong with the service, it was fine.

Overall, this is a wonderful place to get some seafood while in Pier 39. I left one star off because it was pricey, but it was probably worth it. Oh well, still a great place none then less.
author: Victoria E.

description: A little touristy, yes.  Great views, yes.  Crowded most of the time, yes.  If you however find a place that serves better Dungeness crab anywhere, please do let me know as I have not found one even close. The garlic butter sauce they put all over it is amazing.  Get a whole crab and a side of garlic fries and you are truly set for the night!
author: Tim P.

description: Heard about this place from friends.  I put on the bib, tried the crab and was very glad I did.  *Really* good.  Since then, we've been back a few times.  Yeah, that good.  I loved the garlic crab, down right addicting.  The garlic fries are good too.  Get the garlic crab and the garlic fries and you'll be good to go. My daughter never orders anything but the Crab Alfredo.
author: Darien R.

description:
I've seen this place on Yelp a few times when I was visiting the city and, now that I've moved here, decided to ask my roommate about it. As soon as the words "Crab House" came out of my mouth, she started salivating and freaking out in the car. I kid you not and I do not exaggerate.

We settled on making a reservation for Tuesday night to avoid the crowd and tourists. That was the plan anyway. The line at the restaurant on a Tuesday night was still out the door and the place was packed full of tourists but we got seated right away like VIPs.

Between 3 of us girls, we ordered:

* Lotsa Crab 3 lbs ($50) :: This is just a bunch of tasty crab legs that are somewhat difficult to crack and eat because they are coated in delicious butter. No, that's not really a complaint. If I had a butler cracking these suckers for me though, I could have easily eaten all 3 lbs myself. On a whiny, food critic note, some of the meat didn't slide easily out of their shells, which usually indicates that it was frozen at some point? However, with the volume they're selling, I can't see how that would be necessary.

* Medium Garlic Fries ($8) :: Clearly someone mislabeled the sizes here because a "medium" can easily feed 4-6. These are the tastiest and garlic-y-est fries I've ever had. You can actually see all the minced garlic bits on the fries! If fries aren't greasy enough for you on their own, be sure to dip them in the crab butter. Mmm, nomnomnom.

* Medium Iron Skillet-Roasted Mussels ($15) :: Also delicious, big surprise! I was really glad we got these because they're easy to eat when you want to take a break from crab-cracking activities. Also, both the garlic fries and the bread they give you taste fantastic dipped in mussel buttah.

Definitely a fan but the food seems a little overpriced (probably because it's in a tourist-y area). Will be back when tourist friends are in town.
author: Amaryllia L.

description: Had the shrimp cocktail and crab cakes for appetizers. The crab cakes were good but the shrimp had no flavor, other than the pepper they sprinkled over it. The cocktail sauce is not your traditional cocktail sauce. It has a weird flavor to it. We ordered the ice tea and it also had a flavor to it. The fish and chips were good. Huge piece of fish. Very tender and flakey.
author: Allison W.

description: We really use to love this place. We've been going for over 5 years and experienced the changes. The only reason we returned just recently was due to a voucher given to us after our last horrible experience with the server. We were hoping our feelings about the place would change and come back as repeat customers. When we left my fiancee and I decided we will not return. I'm so disappointed to say that as I was proposed to there and always have my birthday dinner there. The reason I'm giving the place a three, our server was attentive and busboy was friendly. So long crab house it was good knowing you maybe one day i will return but that day will not be soon.
author: I T.

description: Good food, good beers, but can get crowded and the bathroom situation is terrible.  There were LONG lines and I realized it was to use the restroom.  And to top it all off they were very dirty.  I wanted to use a hand sanitizer for my whole body after.
author: Sam K.

description: Ordered Halibut and Salmon plates, both were overcooked and dry, not going to this place again.
author: Nabil J.

description: Tourist trap kind of place.  Food was very so so but the scenery on Pier 39 was nice.
author: s w.

description:
Came here on a recommendation from my older sister on a date with my boyfriend filled with excitement and joy starting off our new-found relationship together. He had moved here from Socal and he hasn't been venturing norcal as much so I thought I'd be his personal tour guide! After showing him around the wonderful Pier 39 and taking adorable pictures all over the place, we had finally built up an appetite and decided to take my sisters word on trying the Crab House. 
Right as we walked in we were blasted with this fantastic smell of garlic and butter which sent out senses into a frenzy, we were most definitely excited as our waiter brought us over to a nice cozy booth to cuddle up in. We decided to get the Two Too Crab order and boy we were not disappointed. The crab came out on a hot plate with the garlic butter pepper sauce sizzling away. The aroma was amazing and the taste was incredible, such a simple way of serving crab but oh so satisfying! Our waiter was so attentive bringing us more napkins as we needed it and quenched our thirst as we finished up our water. This place definitely did not disappoint our Sunday date together except that they ran out of oysters.. and you know what they say about Oysters... they're an aphrodisiac ;D      OMG jk jk jk jk we were just craving them lol but all in all a great date.
author: Jenny C.

description: I have to say the service is really really terrible. Maybe because Asian tourists don't know to tip. They helps Americans with aprons, but not Asian. They basically didn't provide any services. When we ask the waiter" why u didn't help us with the apron" he said:"because they ordered two crabs, it might be hard to do their own"!!!! OMG, how sweet u are!!! BTW,apron was given before u got the food. And is that means  how much service will be provided is based on how much you order?
author: meatball l.

description:
Here's another spot me & my bf-Jayson have passed by many many times, & now we can finally say we've eaten @ the Crab House @ Pier 39 SF =) Went here ystrday for Father's Day dinner for his pops http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kWrVV4mS-SLy-Ph_DeJSAg?select=cnN16vjoaiGj1v1LWUkJ0w as did a lot of other folks.

LOCATION: We drove into the Pier 39 Parking Garage & found parking on the 3rd floor. Luckily we did not have to make round trips in garage, as Pier 39 itself had a very nice crowd of people out visiting w/ a sunny yet cool day in SF. Saw a few U.S. Navy Sailors on the Embarcadero sportin' their clean whites...no it's not Fleet Week, that's in Oct, but a ship had docked so we had some service men & women visiting us for a bit. Yeeeh, I'm a very proud U.S. Navy "bratt"!

RESTAURANT: Since we parked on 3rd floor of garage, walked over the ramp to the 2nd level of Pier 39, where the Crab House is located. Had RSVP for 5:30pm for party of 4, got there 6pm, waited like 5min to be seated @ "their" version for a party of 4, & then waited another 10min to be re-seated @ a larger table for party of 6 (thanks to Hostess Onya for taking care of us w/ seating). Moms & I are like 5'4" (mind you we're hippy too), while bf & dad are like 5'8" & 5'10"...I've said in my own prev reviews, we really need our "elbow space" so just a heads up...food is good, but table area just seems small. Not handicapp friendly at all (I'm being honest) nor heavy/big-people friendly..I'm shootin' ya straight!

SERVICE: Our waiter Vito was being kept quite busy w/ our table & others, as it was a packed place on a Sunday evening. We got our bread, order of chowder, & cocktails, but no water. Timing from the moment we placed our drink order (H2O & cocktails), took about 10min for water to hit our table. I'm not sure who to blame, but dag nab it, that didn't make much sense to us. Other than wait for water, service was good...able to flag down any employee speed walking by to ask for something & got the assistance. Again, tight/small place for the amount of patrons they want to cater so service is to feed u quickly, get you in & out, & move move move through the walkways btw tables. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kWrVV4mS-SLy-Ph_DeJSAg?select=RBsgttTzuzDTftoNTrfzzQ

DRINKS: We ordered Mojitos, all w/o the Mint...yes, w/o the mint. It just gets in our way. BF had Pineapple, I had Cuban Blue, & dad had Baja http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kWrVV4mS-SLy-Ph_DeJSAg?select=CnAiPXIts57hm8K9K0epdw The mojitos were pretty good. Speaking from a "light weight", Cuban Blue was enough & plenty alcohol...now speaking for dad (who's main drink is Tangueray or some gin straight on ice) it was aiight. Mojitos come recommended though.

FOOD: Pops had Bowl of Crab Chowder http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kWrVV4mS-SLy-Ph_DeJSAg?select=fYfV4afRbQpKaxyBXZ_tIw while the rest of us had the Cup; pretty hearty w/ more veggies than expected, but still good. Pops had Lobster Thermidor at which he said it seemed they just put a slab of cheese on the lobster vs a sauce compared to his tastings of Lobster Thermidor elsewhere; moms had Salmon http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kWrVV4mS-SLy-Ph_DeJSAg?select=fZroUZUIr_TV4PB-b2qR_g while bf-Jayson & I shared Combo Mussels, Shrimp, & Crab http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kWrVV4mS-SLy-Ph_DeJSAg?select=5F_-3E7DH2juvjVmFbrAIg Mussels were easy to de-shell, but shrimp..well, so much work for so little meat. The buttery dipping sauce http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kWrVV4mS-SLy-Ph_DeJSAg?select=QMPK73ENq8r5IvpXexENCw was good tho!

Final tab was $160 & some change. Interesting, the bill came out w/ the 15% gratuity calculated (NOT added to bill) for us just in case we wanted to know...wow wasn't that nice, here I thought that was done only for a party of 6+. U learn sumthin' new everyday. Honestly speaking, would we come back...likely noooot anytime soon, & if so, keep it just as a 2-some dinning experience..if more, just go to Crockett's Dead Fish http://www.yelp.com/biz/dead-fish-crockett
author: Mary J.

description:
Outta the Rain and into the boiling pot of crabby Love!!!!

This was just what the Dr order on a cold rainy day in April.  The services was a bit slow but we were OK with it as we were not in a hurry and enjoyed the view over looking the Harbor. 

Calimari = Nicely breaded and tender
Crab Chowder = Bueno
Fillet Mignon = Tasty and tender
Fish and Chips = huge slab of Cod and fries.  Good Stuff (The red stuff on your plate is not ketchup it is cocktail sauce, or spicy ketchup as my 4 year old pointed out)
Tiramisu = nicely done, moist and good finish fo rthe birthday boy.

Many of the restaurants on the wharf are purely tourists traps.  This one is not, legit good food.
author: Tim P.

description:
My man and I settled on this place for dinner after 9 hours of walking around SF. It was GREAT and well worth the calories!!

My man and I shared the "lotsa crab," which is 3 delious pounds of dengeness crab legs "$50). Damn, they were good and we were stuffed!!

Now the waiter was, um, not with it. The place barely had anyone in it (9pm on a Monday night). Sodas were $3.50 and he rarely came around the table to give us refills. I had to ask him for a wet-nap as I was sitting there with butter, garlic, crab shell hands waiting for him to come over to the table.

Oh, and the bathroom was clean, only one stall, but clean.
author: Rosie R.

description:
Even though I'm not from the city, it's pretty obvious that you shouldn't go to the city's biggest tourist attraction for a good meal. The multitude of positive reviews on Yelp made me take a chance on Crab House. 

The place is sort of out of the way on the pier, and they were happy to accommodate my reservation for eight later that night. Service was extraordinarily quick throughout the night, with single-digit minutes transpiring between placing orders and receiving our food, though I would think that a place called Crab House would have plenty of crab ready to go.

We started with two orders of garlic fries for the table, and the serving size was plenty large enough for everyone to have a share. The fries were only so-so, but the big blast of garlic no small consolation. 

I grabbed a bowl of crab chowder, too. I thought the proportion of vegetables (carrot, corn, and potato) were almost too much for the small cup of chowder, preventing the crab (what should have been the star) to shine through.

The giant 6.5 lbs platter of crab we ordered was listed as serving four on the menu, but it fed five well. The garlic butter provided good coverage, though I could have appreciated a side of said butter for dipping. The cast iron griddle on which it was served was so hot that it provided a rich flavor to the meat.

As I walked past one of the many chain seafood restaurants on the Wharf, I wondered if they used fresh seafood or worked from the same suppliers as the rest of their locations in other parts of the country. I wasn't about to find out. You can do a whole lot worse on the Wharf, and - though a little expensive - Crab House lives up to its name.
author: Brad S.

description: Awesome food!!! Loved the whole crab . Garlic bread with mozzarella was yum as they had basil on it. It was an amazing Anniversary dinner and view :-)
author: Priya W.

description: Crab chowder is great! We can see Golden Gate Bridge,  Al catraz and cute see lions from the window!
author: Edith S.

description: I'm a crab fanatic. Came when there was about a 20 minute wait & opted to sit at the bar which was great & still had a nice view. Got the order of  lotsa crab, and it was superb. Came with sides of melted butter and garlic sauce. Bomb. Also ordered the calamari which was equally as amazing. Tasted really fresh & not over battered.
author: J A.

description: Ate here on work/vacay, the food was insanely good and so were the drinks! Nothing topped our funny waitress Tyja though, she's awesome, give that gal a raise! Great place thanks again!
author: Jen J.

description: Oh my goodness!  The garlic crab and french fries are heavenly!  If I was to be asked what my last meal would be this would be on the top.  The atmosphere is very casual with the perfect location to walk off the calories you consumed.  I highly recommend this place!
author: Joo J.

description: This place was great me and the GF went two days in a row. We didn't want to take the chance of eating bad food. We spent 170$ for three persons each day but was well worth it. Will Def go again.
author: Jesse M.

description: Came here on New Year's Eve.  Took about 45 mins for a table but not bad. I was with both my Lady and Son and was disappointed they put us at a small corner table... The food was real good except the mussels were tiny as 5h1t. Crab cakes were the best i have had since it was purely dungenous crab no fillers. Other than that, the food a had great flavor and came our fast.
author: huy p.

description: Great food with a great view of the fisherman wharf's docks if you get a window table. Definitely would recommend the crab and mussels. If you plan on getting a beer, make sure you order the pitcher. You get the biggest pitcher you've ever seen of good beer for $20. Well worth it.
author: Matt S.

description: High priced service not great and food not great. The waiter was new and couldn't answer any questions. Had to send back 1 meal.
author: Jane L.

description:
OMFG. The mussels here are so amazing. They are garlicky, buttery and just knock my socks off yummy. Yes, nothing here is cheap, but it's Pier 39 what do you expect? The crab caesar is also really good and big in size. My mom and I split both a small mussels and salad and were completely stuffed- not to mention they provide you with a free decent sized roll of bread. It's not every day I'm on the Pier, because look, I'm a local now and going there makes my head spin. It's like Disneyland for everything crab. But when I am randomly here, I really don't mind indulging in the delicious overpriced seafood. I really really want to come back here on a date and consume the entire crab, yes please!

Note: It's important to walk the mile or so back to Embarcadero Bart station after consuming the food here, because it's guaranteed that you'll gain at least a pound.
author: Sonya D.

description: A bit expensive, but every bit worthy.  Great mussels, crab, garlic fries (a must!), and service!
author: Kathy P.

description:
Food:  For two of us, we ordered a cup of crab chowder each ($7), the mandatory crab for two (3 lb for $50) and torta della nonna ($7).  The crab chowder was awesome.  Beat the local clam chowder way out of the field.  Big chunks of crab meat.  The crab was delicious-- we took our waitress' advice and dipped the meat into the grease on the sizzling plate.  Yum!  Do yourself a favor and don't just crack the shells off the crab...all the flavor is on there!  Lick it all up before taking the meat out!!!  Unfortunately, the crab wasn't very filling.  So boyfriend ordered the torta della nonna, a lemon tart.  I took a small bite and it was OK.  

Service:  Waitress was helpful with recommendations + checked on us.

Price: As other people mentioned, it's pretty pricey.  Spent $105 on the food mentioned and a beer b/w two people.  Expect to pay way more if you want to leave full.  

I will be back for sure.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Went here today for lunch-dinner!

The restaurant is decorated very lively with colorful crabs! not too much people at 4pm on a Wednesday which made service very well.

The garlic crab was delicious, the shell wasn't too hard to crack at all and the size of the crab was perfect. 

The garlic noodles was have a great flavor, but I thought it was too "buttery"

Mussels&shrimp was amazing. 

Would definitely eat here again for great seafood.
author: Ray H.

description: The place was crowded (mostly tourists) but Ok.. The crab was fresh but I have had better. The service was not that good but food came out fast. If you want fresh seafood with a bunch of tourists, this is the place to go. Although the food was ok I won't go back since I know I can have the same quality food from somewhere else.
author: Yoonjin C.

description: The crab and shrimp combo is so good! It's fresh and tasty, highly recommended.
author: Yuxi L.

description:
Came here last week for a friends birthday dinner. A casual tourist dinner, so need need to dress fancy.  They also validate your parking for two hours.  

My friend and I ordered the crab chowder to share, presentation looks good,. but the taste of the soup was pretty bland.  I like my soup with a lot of broth, which this chowder did not have.  It was def loaded with goodies though. 

For the entree, 4 girls and I shared the $100 crab feast dinner and it was def more than enough for us. The crab chunks were huge, but the meat was really dry and bland.  I asked if they had a special sauce, but it was just a dish of butter to dip in,. BLEH.

I rate the food 2 stars. But the ONE STAR lower rating was influenced by the MANAGER who was running the show last Saturday. 

I was sitting right next to the window and the blinds were down cause it was blinding my friend infront of me. (this was when the sun was up)  During the middle of my crab feast,. as I was beasting away and eating with my hands.  The manager comes over and stated that people like to look at the view during dinner and asked me if I can bring the blinds up.  Blinds that I had to use both of my hands to wheel up. 

I looked at him and stated "so you want me to use these greasy fingers, while I am eating, to HELP YOU ,. raise the blinds up?!" he said "YES!" . wth?! I don't think his brain was processing at that time,. that I WAS EATING,. and you're telling me to touch something dirty and continue eating with my hands again?! HOW RUDE!

Luckily,. Our NICE WAITER,. quickly came over and stated ,. "OH Sorry about  that, I can actually do it for you." If the waiter can reach over to bring the blinds up, so can you! 

It goes back to my motto "If I Am Paying For Your Services, I Better Get Some Respect"

The crab feast was already dry, flavorless and medi'ocore, but getting interrupted during the meal, that was already NOT satisfying to my taste buds and to touch dirty bacteria things with my bare hands that was used to eat my dinner,..  NO THANK YOU! 

I will not be back !
author: Chanel L.

description:
Fan of crab?? Um... yes! I haven't been to a place like this, where they deliver optimal amounts of crab with your dish. No matte what you get, a ton of delicious crab is promised!

PS, get the crab ceasar salad!
author: Colin G.

description:
My rating is only based on my order of the cioppino and "killer crabs".  

If it weren't for the view and acceptable cioppino, it would have been 0 stars if there were such a thing.

The cioppino was tasty but lacking in the seafood department... about 5 mussels, a small chunk of fish ( a third of a deck of cards), and a couple of tiny shrimps.  I thought it was really steep for $26, but knowing Fisherman's Warf is a tourist spot, I could accept that.

The disappointment came from the main dish and the reason my family and I decided on this spot to begin with - the 'Killer Crabs'.

As a New Yorker, I can to purchase live dungeness crabs easily.  Since dungeness crabs originate on the west coast, I was under the impression that the quality would be much better in San Fran than what I can purchase back at home - oh boy was I wrong if high quality crabs are supposed to taste like the ones I had today.  I paid over $70 for two regular size crabs before tax and tips and the quality and texture of the crab meat was equivalent to pre-frozen, reheated King Crab legs.  Just to be clear, pricing wasn't the issue.  I was well aware of the menu prices before deciding on eating at the Crab House, but for what I was willing to pay for a nice lunch with my family, I expected nothing less than for the crabs to be freshly killed and cooked when ordered.  The texture of the crab meat is just sub-par.

The experience was extremely disappointing.   

Next time, I'm going to try the crab stalls at the broad walk which I'm willing to bet is just as good or better than what I tasted today - and if not, then at least I will save myself some money.
author: Nicole L.

description:
I'm always a fan of good, fresh garlic roasted crab. I used to get it at another restaurant in San Francisco. I was able to reserve a table with the Open Table app, which was nice because I didn't know when we'd be back from our bay cruise. So it was great to be able to reserve right away with the app. 

Our table was ready on time. It was very busy, but it's busy at Pier 39. It was so busy that it was hard to walk down the aisles to the table without bumping into staff along the way. But we got a window table. The restaurant smells of crab inside and outside, like a crab sauna. But that's their specialty. We ordered the half size garlic roasted crab, crab cakes, and crab chowder. All were delicious. We shared the entire meal, so all was served at just about the same time.

Our waiter put a bib on me, and went to put one on my boyfriend, but he didn't want a bib. It made the waiter look sad. I do think bibs should be a more optional thing, rather than making one feel like you've hurt someone's feelings. Our waiter was attentive overall. He did provide the check before offering dessert, which we did ask to order. The tiramisu was okay. It wasn't the best ever, but we came for the crab. And then we did have to ask for wet cloths to wipe our hands on before we left the restaurant. I think those should have been provided after the main course. 

I'd never had crab chowder. I think this was my favorite, with the garlic roasted crab right behind it. 

All in all, I would return. And I would recommend this restaurant, but I would always say this is Pier 39. You're not going to get the most attentive service. So don't expect it. I'd give this restaurant 5 stars if the service improved, and the floor wasn't slippery (I guess part of  that sauna effect I mentioned earlier).
author: Reyes H.

description: I had the pleasure of dining at Crab House when I was on vacation in San Francisco.  It was very busy and a reservation is a definitely must.  My girlfriend and I shared the Crab plate for 2 along with garlic fries.  The prices were high but expected and worth it.  The crab was very tasty albeit messy but thats part of the seafood experience.  Definitely recommend a visit to the Crab House!
author: Ponny T.

description: The crab was good.  There was a lot of garlic in the sauce, which we liked.  Beware though, if you don't order the whole crab, it doesn't come with the body.  We ordered some other dishes, but they were disappointing.  Only the crab was good.  I would suggest somewhere else.
author: Mark H.

description: Food was yummy!!! I loved the steamed clams and noodles, soooo good. The service was VERY fast at this restaurant too. The waiter had my drink ordered and to me before he even left our table. The service was friendly. This is a quick restaurant and it's pretty laid back. Good for a quick stop and awesome food! Highly recommend!
author: Amy Megan S.

description: I would give them zero stars if i could but I can't.  Had reservations and was told we could get in earlier by Ryan. We checked in at 630 for a 8 pm reservation. People who arrived after us got in faster with a wait time of 30-50 mins. Had Ryan told us that we would not get in until exactly 8 we would fave fucked our reservations and put our name on the list. We would have been seated at 715 pm instead 8. Then this Ryan would not let us get seated at our table unless everyone in our party was there. Everyone was there but one was lagging a bit behind. So out of frigging spite he wanted to hold us back. Manager Bart condoning this behavior. Moral of this story dont make reservations and dont listen to sh$; Ryan has to say. Abuse of power from a dork at the front door
author: Judy W.

description: We were a bit nervous about where to eat since tourist places aren't always known for great cuisine, however, our concerns were unmerited.  Our food was delicious.  As other reviewers mentioned, the Dungeness crab legs in garlic sauce...  Well, it's now my favorite way for crab legs.  Came to our table sizzling on a flat iron skillet.  My crab melt was also yummy.  I know everyone else enjoyed their food but, as usual, I was so into mine I didn't look too closely at what anyone else was having.  Service was very good, with only a small glitch that was quickly remedied.  We will definitely return and recommend to others.
author: L M.

description: Great food, great view and prompt service. The only complaint is service isn't personable. I have to say the food was delicious and better than expected!!!
author: Vi S.

description:
yeah buddy! Fresh to death crabs, free bread.

small tables but ours was a table for 2 so i'll let it slide.

make reservations too, don't be a chump
author: Steve T.

description: Overpriced. But it is a really great place to take visitors from out of town who want to eat at Pier 39.
author: Taz S.

description:
My bf brought me here for my bday for the first time and the hostess was very friendly and sat us in front of the window and we had such a beautiful view of the bay. 

Didnt quite care so much when they poured white wine all over my shrimp and muscles, I should have said something but got distracted. Ordered half a pound of crab legs and it barely had meat, guess we just had a bad catch that day. Checked on us frequently so their service was friendly. Would eat here again and try different dishes next time.
author: Maria R.

description: Ordered 3 lbs of crabs for two. The crabs came out in less than 5 minutes.  I appreciated the speedy service. The crabs packed a lot of garlic flavor, but just a bit too salty. The bread was cold. It was a good feast, but I'm still on the hunt for a better crab joint.
author: Kristin X.

description:
I expected this to be a run of the mill tourist trap crab restaurant on the wharf, so naturally, I made reservations for when my parents came to town. 

Turns out, it's a tourist-y restaurant, but actually quite delicious. I'm a HUGE fan of their crab sandwich, killer crab, and garlic bread. I love that the crab sandwich is served open faced. It's so good, it doesn't have to mess around with a top piece of bread. 

It's not overly expensive, especially for a restaurant at Pier 39. We got out for $50 with one appetizer, two entrees and two soft drinks. 

Also, parking is validated at the garage across the way, so it's easy and free. HUGE BONUS.
author: Kristen B.

description: Me and my boyfriend just left this horrible place! We ordered our food two hours ago. We waited for about 20 minutes and then got seated and ordered our food and drinks together. The waiter (Josh) sounded like he had our order under control and we waited what seemed like forever and seen that people that had gotten there after us were enjoying their meal in front of us. To top it off after such a long wait they brought us my meal and not my boyfriends?! We will never go back there again. The manager wasn't helpful at all. We just wanted our meal on time so I suggested we leave this stupid place and come next door to Apple bees :) were already seated and their customer service is awesome. Great view too. :) don't go here this place sucks! And the music is so loud and annoying! Hahaha
author: Seaoni R.

description: Good service, the crab is not bad but it's not better than crab hut
author: Ramos Z.

description:
Pretty darn good crab.  Better than just steamed and smelly dungeness off Fisherman's Wharf.  Has a nice fragrance and sweetness.  I don't they are using butter, but perhaps Olive Oil?
