Whatever it was, not greasy, and still taste the flavor of crab.  Their crab chower is pretty good.  Perhaps if I did not have my first taste of Hog Island Oysters' clam chowder for lunch, I would be raving about Crab House' crab chowder.  Its not too sweet, not too salty, and does not smell fishy/crabby.

Place is small and gets really packed.  We had reservations, and despite being a little late, got seated in fifteen minutes.  They turn the tables pretty good.

Worth a return trip next time on Pier 39.
author: Henry L.

description:
Not sure what all the hype is about with this place.  We ordered the "lots o crab" and the crab had barely any meat.  Crab was obviously frozen and not fresh.  Garlic sauce is ok, but it quickly gets overpowered by the heavy butter flavor.  

Doesn't come with lemon, we had to ask for some. Lemon makes it better, but the crab doesn't leave me craving it after. 

Garlic fries were good but all the parmesan cheese ended up on the bottom of the bowl.

Lemonade tasted like it was made from powder.

Our server was good though.  Her name was Katri K, and she was very warm and welcoming and explained the various options they had.  If it wasn't for her, I'd give this place a 1 star.

$92 for two people, and we didn't order any drinks.

Oh and be careful... the floors are SUPER slippery.  Pretty nasty to think of how much garlic butter is on the floors.
author: Alex P.

description:
I was SHOCKED.  I expected completely kitschy touristy boring food, and we got some pretty awesome crab.  First off, we got seated right away at 6pm on a Sunday, which was nice, but it was a little cramped.  Service, however, was a little slow in getting to us but personable and attentive after that. 

We ordered and the food came out like BAM, blink and suddenly our table was crammed with food.  It was nice, especially with the little ones with us.  We had the Crab feast for 4 (Which was huge!) fish and chips, shrimp and chips, 2 bowls of chowder and some garlic bread.

I couldn't believe it... I normally don't like crab that has sauce on it, because you end up with sauce up to your elbows trying to eat it... but this was so good, I didn't gear, I just dealt with greasey appendages.  The crab was not subtle at all, but packed with salty garlicky goodness.  

The fish and chips was initially disappointing because it was just 1 slab of fish and the whole beauty of fish and chips is that you get this most excellent crust to fish ratio.  Well, turns out that this slab of fish was tender and fresh and flaky.  The batter was crisp and light but didn't get soggy even after sitting for awhile, I was shocked and would definitely order it again.  Same with the shrimp, not heavily breaded, lots of shrimp flavor and not too greasy, but really tasty. 

Yum, I'd definitely come back, but I'm scared it won't be as good!
author: Kit W.

description: Their bar is a perfect spot to kill some time if you're dragged to the Wharf. Great people watching and excellent oysters to boot.
author: Corey H.

description:
Killer crab...killer taste.
I was skeptical of this place because of its touristy location but the Killer Crabs are legit.
What are you waiting for? Dig in!
author: Y d.

description: This is a great place to find very fresh seafood and great clam chowder.  It is always one of my stops anytime I am in the San Francisco area.  You can not go wrong.  The service is always good and friendly.
author: Darren S.

description:
The worst meal I have had in 8 years living in San Francisco.

The benefit of being in a tourist spot is that they don't care about repeat business and it shows. I would not have written this review if it was not for our waiter who made an unexpected comment at the end of the night. 

My table made a point to say that the Calamari was not good....we ordered their largest portion so I would have expected a very different response...we were not looking for a refund or for it to be taken back...just wanted to let them know how we felt. He said with amazement "well I'm not the cook, so what". REALLY.... what a rude comment!

VERY POOR VALUE

Pro: 
Good view of the bay
Good service (to some degree) 

Con:
Crab: fresh but had WAY too much butter and oil and a just OK flavor. Poor value!
Cioppino: fresh seafood but very little compared to most Cioppino I have had for similar price. OK flavor - not great! Poor value!
Garlic Bread: Good - but 4 small pieces of bread for $6...really? 
Calamari: SUCKED...noting good to say. Tasted like it could have been fresh at one point but they really figured out how to destroy it. REALLY BAD. 

I will never go back and if you're reading this, I sugest you try one of the other "crab" restaurants in the same area.
author: Ben G.

description:
I spent my formative years in Florida and, as a result, I grew to loathe tourists. Sure, I understood their necessity since, other than oranges and meth, Florida has no other industries. So I'd smile and greet them warmly, but underneath the veneer lay a black, venomous bile. 

"WHY are you driving so SLOW?!"
"WHY are you wearing socks and sandals?"
"Really? A fanny pack? REALLY?"

It's like people dropped at least 30 IQ points when they went on vacation and here I was, having to navigate Flowers for Algernon, but in reverse. I labeled the syndrome. I called them "tourons."

Fucking tourons.

Worst still was what tourons considered "good" and "authentic." I've see some rave about the "Florida lobster" they were eating as I noticed, of course, that said lobster had claws. (Nope, Florida lobsters don't have claws.)  I've seen tourons talk about "visiting" Florida while never setting foot off of Disney property. (I'm sure the siren song of Bithlo, FL's trailer parks and mud boggin' tracks are hard to resist.)
Alas, however, we all are tourons at one point or another. Yes, you've got your Yelp, your iPhones, your Lonely Planet apps, but at some point, you're going to do something embarrassingly touristy.

Hello, Crab House.

We were advised to go to PPQ. "If you guys want crab, you need to hit PPQ," a couple of locals advised us. I'll never know if they were right, because we never went. To be quite honest, 1) we were tired and 2) I kind of wanted to be a touron. I wanted to embrace it for once.  So where else do we go than Fisherman's Wharf?

Yeah, I can see your eyes roll even from Atlanta. And I'll make fun of you when you end up at World of Coke. Still, we enjoyed our meal at the Crab House. Was it authentic? I dunno. Was it over-priced? Probably. Was it good? Yep. Dungeness crab roasted to the point where their shells shatter with a mere squeeze? Kind of hard to screw that up and these guys didn't.  The service was friendly and on point. The space was charmingly touristy and pointedly inoffensive. (I mean, they DID after all make sure to remove the swastika from the model of the Hindenburg inexplicably hanging from the ceiling.)

 Sure, we could've been delirious from the miles of uphill walking we'd done, it could've been the mild buzz I'd whipped up while drinking my pre-dinner beer. Nevertheless, tourist trap or no, I've got to give at least 4 stars to this place.
author: Ivan S.

description: Horrible service. The waiter treated us like we were beneath him. The bus boy was the best part of the whole experience. The makers mark and vermouth drink was good. But that were the only good parts. I swear the shrimp was frozen. The muscles had pieces of shells in the meat. And the crab chowder had almost no crab in it. Will not be returning. A real letdown of an otherwise fun trip
author: Michael M.

description: Quality of food is over priced. Nice staff. Decent views. Crab was ok but no butter or seasoning for it? Crab enchilada was disgusting. Gooey, watery, oily mess that upset my stomach shortly after. I've had better food at Joe's Crab Shack.
author: Brian P.

description: This restaurant is situated right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco. We came here on a weeknight, in which we didn't have to wait to get seated. The mussel and crab combo platter was good, while Zuppa des Pesce had a bit of a kick to it and the portion was just right for the price. However, the salmon was a bit overcooked. The server was friendly and attentive. This place is not bad, but I have yet to find a place in Fisherman's Wharf that wows me.
author: Allen L.

description: Perfect lunch to end our day. Our server Danelle was very attentive. Eating a killer crab can be a little messy so she can by often and not only brought wet cloths she opened them up for us. Thanks Danelle!! Excellent crab, although my husband would of liked more of the body meat and I would of loved the sauce for dipping, my fault though for not asking. Small parties 4 or less sat within 30 minutes larger parties 45 - 1 hour. We were there at lunch on a Saturday. But hey you are at Pier 39, put your name in with the MOST PATIENT hostesses and walk around! Enjoy Yum yum
author: Rhonda M.

description: I have eaten here every time i am in San Francisco. Always top notch. Service is insanely fast. The wait can be a pain but worth it.
author: Kareem H.

description:
Giving 3 just because they were very fast. The Food was so-so, the prices are way too much. Portions are small. Our party of 6 were sited to 4 person table. Imagine with all the food on the table - it was WAY to tie!!!!
This place is too small, tables are super close to each other. People are constantly knocking stuff over. meh! I won't come back.
author: Katya S.

description: LOVE THIS PLACE!! Wife and i come here every time we are in SF!! Crab never dissapoints, BUT also recommend the angel hair lasagna!
author: Eddie C.

description: I liked the location of this place since it was at Pier 39 and they validated our parking for two hours even though we entered the parking garage a few minutes before 6:00 PM. The food was okay. The crab was yummy and the shrimp was tasty. The mussels were under cooked. We actually had to send the mussels back to the kitchen to get cooked more. Unfortunately, we had already eaten some mussels that were not fully cooked and three people in our party had stomach issues a few hours later. Either way, the food was still good. Just not worth the price we paid for it.
author: Kevin K.

description:
The food was decent. I enjoyed the view.

However, the service was horrible, when we first arrived, there where two employees standing around completely neglecting us. One of them looked at us and walked away, the other looked at us and proceeded to text on his phone! The first employee returned about 10 mins. later and sat us down. We then learned that she would be our server. 

A 10-minute wait would have been reasonable if the restaurant had been at least moderately busy. But it wasn't. It was almost empty.

We tipped her 30% although her service was not very good. 

It was very upsetting to have been treated so poorly, which is why I'm writing this review now, 6 months later. We believe the employees' pejorative demeanor was due to their racial biases.

THIS IS NOT A FRIENDLY PLACE FOR PEOPLE OF COLOR TO DINE.
author: Jacqueline H.

description:
My first crabs and the best fried Ive ever aten (and I have to tell I do not like fries so much)!

In case these were my first crabs I have nothing to compare it to but all I know is: they were excellent! And its kind of fun when youre going there with a group to eat it all. Actually its a mess - but a very delicious and funny one!

I had a good time in this restaurant. I also likes all the different crab-designs on the wall (some with hut, some with glitter...). Have to see it :D

The waitress was very very nice and helpful! 

I had such a good night with a beautiful view over SF with its Golden gate Bridge & Alcatraz!

Crab House rules! (oh no, I forgot to buy a Crab House-Shirt over there...)
author: Sophie K.

description:
This place is such a find in the chained-out Pier 39! The decor is a bit cheesy but man that food is awesome!

I came here with a group of friends after an Alcatraz tour (showing around a friend's BF) after a good search on Yelp. Everyone was so happy about the decision. We ordered a variety of menu items - crab melt, shrimp in tomato brodetto, clam chowder, chicken sandwhich, etc. Also got a large order of the garlic fries - SO delicious.

The quality of the food was incredible, service was quick and attentive and the pricing was decent. I will definitely be back here should I ever end up in this area. I almost don't want the word to get out because then it might get too busy.
author: Allie M.

description:
food is good,but price is so expensive!!!!
all drink menu is over 10$. 
dungenes crab and crab cake were good!
and we can see beautiful harbor!
author: Miyuki T.

description: The crab here is the bomb. Not pricey for the quality of food you get. Would come here everyday if I lived in San Francisco
author: Chris S.

description:
Pricy, touristy, tasty. Crab was dry and bogus. Mussels were some of the best ever. 
Very friendly staff and nice window seating
author: Jay W.

description:
My family went here last night for my dad's birthday. I was pretty excited because I have never been here before. We were a party of 5 and they sat us in this really cramped up table for 4 and the table as so close to the other tables it was so difficult to get in and out to use the bathroom. I had to squeeze myself between the tables. Thank goodness people were seated at the other table but the staff was not even accommodating our needs. Hello?! You see us struggling, move the other table over or give us a bigger table! We asked for another table but they said they couldn't because it was gonna get busier. They don't care to accommodate people who are already there to eat!

The food was good. I liked the calamari and the crab chowder was delicious! The garlic noodles...eh! And the crab... it was ok. I'm just not a crab person. So this place was alright. 

I came home with like diarrhea! So think twice about coming here.
author: Reese E.

description: I love seafood! I am so glad I found this restaurant while on vacation. It has an amazing view too.  My bf and I came here and we had the crab, clams and shrimp Alfredo.  The clams were delicious! each bite was amazing. I recommend getting the clams. The prices are high, but it's worth it. The service was great and quick. Everyone was friendly
author: Kristine A.

description: Crab, Mussels, and Garlic Fries were delish!!! Enjoyed every bit, just like Dead Fish
author: RayNe K.

description: No complaints. It's a tourist trap, so you're paying a lot for some pretty B rate seafood.
author: Amy R.

description:
I can't tell if I was sucked into a tourist spot or if all the hundreds of yelp reviewers just had bad taste that day.  I came here solely based on the high number of good yelp reviews and was curious if they were offering something equivalent to gold over what was selling on the street.  Even during the daytime, we had to wait about 20 minutes before we got seated.

For three people, we ordered 1 1/2 crabs, the shrimp fettuccine alfredo, and the garlic fries.  The crabs come in an iron skillet poured with their "special" garlic sauce.  Frankly, it's just garlic sauce.  Actually, it could be salted a  little more.  Lastly, the presentation sucked because you don't get the crab body (even though there's nothing in the body).. you just get the legs.  They should have just served the entire crab as all the tables around us were asking where was the body.  Some of the yelp pictures show the entire body being served but I guess you only get that if you have a big party or if you're ordering alot?  

The shrimp fettucini alfredo and fries were good.. you won't go wrong with that.

Last I have to comment on the service because it seemed like there was no service.. just get your order and give you your food.  The lady NEVER asked if we needed anything and we had to call her at least 3 times to get us stuff.  It seemed like she was just helping other tables out.. so too bad for her she didnt get a good tip from us.

Seriously just do yourself a favor and order stuff from the street.. you save money anyway. btw, we ended up spending ~$90 total for three people.
author: Sarah H.

description: Get the crab legs!!!!! Amazing! We had an awesome booth at the very back over looking pier 39 and the water. My husband and I got the crab legs (enough for 2) and regular French fries. Prepare to get MESSY!!
author: apryl r.

description: It is a classic seafood restaurant with good views of the sea. The deco is very good and upscale. The food is decent and the seafood is very fresh. They are nothing special.  We had the famous crab, crab chowder and crab cake. Its a tourist attraction at Fisherman's Wharf  was a little bit overpriced and overhyped for what it is.
author: Ivy Ziwei L.

description: Had a great dining experience at crab house.  We has a reservation at 915 but were hungry from walking around the wharf so we asked if we could eat earlier.  They took note and called us at 845 to seat us.  The food was delicious and plentiful.  Our crab legs came out really quickly and service was phenomenal.  I had a great experience.  Their garlic fries were nom nom too.
author: Tim M.

description:
Went here on a Saturday with the fiancee.  We came by ferry and were hungry when we got off at Fisherman's Wharf.  The pier was crowded since it was on a weekend.  We walked about 5 minutes or so to the Crab House.  There was already a crowd outside the restaurant waiting to be called.  I put my name on the waiting list and was told that it would take about 10-15 minutes for 2 people.  Couples that came after us were told 25-30 minutes of wait time.  This was more accurate.  We waited about 30 minutes before we were seated.  It took about 5 minutes before our waitress came over, greeted us, and took our order.   We ordered medium sized calamari, medium sized garlic fries and the lotsa crab.   A bus boy came back with our drinks within a few minutes.  It was crazy busy and they seemed to be on top of things and not let customers wait.  Our waitress came back a few minutes after we got our drinks and put 
bibs on us.  

Our calamari came out first and it was "seasoned" with fried lemon slices, regular lemon wedges, and jalapenos.  The calamari also came with that red dipping sauce.  It was crispy, lemony and spicy.  Our crab and garlic fries came out together.  I loved the garlic fries.  It's just regular fries with garlic tossed together.  It was crispy and hot.  The lotsa crab for 2 was about 10 or so crab legs with parts of the body on each.  The garlic butter sauce on the crab was delicious.  It was so flavorful.  I used the free bread they gave us and soaked up some of the garlic butter.  It was so good and worth the 30 minute wait.  

Overall, the food was awesome, the service was great (even on a super busy weekend), and the wait was worth it. It was a bit pricey though overall for us.  Taking the ferry from Sausalito cost us $42 (round trip) and the meal (including tip) was $101.  I would definitely come back.  Maybe wait a few months or so to save and splurge.  We're trying to save for the wedding so spending this amount would be a splurge.
author: Linda M.

description:
The food was great. My girlfriend and I Each got our own crab and it was really good. The decor was really nice as it was upstairs overlooking the bay. 

Service was decent. I wouldn't say the waiter was knowledgable just because he just said, "yea it's good." But he offered good service nonetheless. The only thing that bothered us was the fact that we were there before closing and some of the staff had gathered by the front(right where we had been seated) to socialize.

Price was okay. What you can expect to pay for a meal/place like this in pier 39.
author: Anthony R.

description: great !! Wait wasn't long at all parking was across the street and the good too less then 30 mins to come out the seafood was so fresh and my Martinis were all very strong 2 thumbs up  this place would be good to go on a date ps
author: Chi G.

description:
Still one of my favorite spot to take out of town guests. We both ordered a medium ZUPPA DI PESCE. We should have listen to the waitress that we could share it or got the small one each. The field green salad and dressing was excellent too.

But, the leftover was great and they actually gave me more bread for the to go bag.

Yes, I'm still a tourist after 7 years here. And don't forget you get 2 hours free parking if you eat at restaurants in Pier 39 if you get the ticket stamped.
author: Brandon M.

description:
Really liked this place. 

We had a long layover. So we wanted to get some seafood. 

Ate : crabcakes...awesome
salad ...pretty good
crab chowder... very good ..loved the subtle sweetness to it

waiter was great...he knew that we had a layover and was very quick.

would def. come here again.

loved the setup...great place for lunch ..not sure about dinner ..cuz the area is such a tourist trap.
author: mike y.

description:
Time to unwind & have Christmas Day dinner w/ DH  & Christmas evening romantic stroll at the Pier in the romantic city by the bay..
great seafood by the pier... fyi the owner of this place is also the owner of The Dead Fish in the East Bay Area..  hubby and i had a great romantic dinner.
author: Jo G.

description: Me and my boyfriend went here for a date night, the staff was very friendly the food was amazing. I can not remember our waiters name but he was really nice joking with us and just having a conversation, and gave a good wine recommendation. The food was AMAZING oh it was really fresh. We got the crab for two and muscles. It was enough for both of us and this might sound silly but I love the fact that they had water pitchers on the table so I did not have to bug anyone. I highly recommend this place the view is good and the food is great.
author: Norell F.

description:
There was that one instance, when a choice morsel of crab meat mixed with the Crab House's secret garlic sauce touched my tongue, and I thought wow...AH-MA-ZING!  

Then POOF; gonzo!  :)  The rest of the crab was all right.  Yes, it was literally one magical bite out of a **whole crab (2+ lbs)** that captured my fancy, but boy was it a good one!  My BF on the other hand, absolutely loves the crab here!  I grew up eating lots of boiled crabs though, so keep that in mind.  :)

I would definitely try this restaurant at least once.  Lots of tourists here!  **Service** was absolutely fantastic: Five stars!  We had reservations, and we were running behind about an hour, but we were able to call in and switch to an hour later.  We even showed up about 10-15 minutes late (parking can be tough) and they were still able to seat us in a reasonable amount of time.  Our server was sooo attentive.  My BF was downing his soda like the end of the world, but before he could ask for a refill, our server was already on top of it!

The **decor** is appealing.  The main part of the restaurant has white tiled walls, that give off a kind of a sterile old school hospital type of vibe, a la "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest" (movie).  Coupled with the uniquely decorated and colorful crabs near the ceiling it's an eclectic thumbs up.

TIPS:
1.  Make reservations!  There were a lot of walk-ins the last time we were there. 
2.  There is a parking garage nearby, but make sure you work the time needed for parking into your reservation time.  There was a line to get into the garage.
author: Roselina R.

description: Good food, sup-par service & somewhat pricey = 3 stars. Crab was fresh & well seasoned.  Soup was busting with flavor, & beer was ice cold & served in chilled glasses.  Waiters were rude & inattentive, failing to check on us or reill our water at any point during the meal. Probably wouldnt return.
author: Ryan S.

description:
HORRIBLE!  Truly 100% HORRIBLE!!
We were SO disappointed with our recent visit here. The Crab House WAS once of our favorite places in all of San Francisco.  BUT - not this time.  We were informed AFTER our horrible meal that the crab was NOT local Dungeness Crab. Flown in from Mexico. There was truly no meat at all in the legs of our two crabs. It was a total waste of money. The staff would NOT do anything at all about our lousy meal. Just handed us the $74.58 tab. Not even a thank you. 
WARNING!  DO NOT eat here during off season.  Otherwide, you too will be writing a very POOR review just like this one.  What a totally HORRIBLE meal!  We'll NEVER go back again.
author: Fred F.

description:
I had a great dining experience here. Had reservations and were seated quickly. Very friendly and attentive staff. Drinks were a little too easy on the alcohol but the food was amazing. We weren't too fond of the decor of the restaurant, needs a facelift, but if you get seated by the windows you have a great view of the bay.

We ordered the double shrimp and crab with garlic fries! Yum. Everything is definitely loaded with garlic so if you're not a fan I don't think you'll like this place very much. The dungeness crab was seriously amazing and so was the shrimp, perfectly cooked. The fries were crunchy and just great. We checked this restaurant out on a whim based on it's 4 star rating and were really impressed! 

Highly recommended! Wish there was a Crab House in LA.. looking forward to stop in again on my next SF trip.
author: Nora N.

description:
We ate here two weeks ago after a long plane ride. We were starving but had to wait about 30 minutes before being seated because the line was so long. We were hoping that the line was an indication of the quality - and we were not disappointed.

We were waited on immediately...we ordered crab in garlic, garlic fries, crab caesar salad and beers. DELICIOUS! They also bring this great bread to the table and serve it with probably the most flavorful olive oil I've ever tried.

Is this place touristy? Probably, but who cares when the food is so good!
author: Jeannine B.

description:
So people keep telling me never to eat seafood at the fisherman's warf, but my parents wanted to eat here so I didn't have much choice.  We started with some crab fondou and oysters over ice.  The fondou was gone in minutes, and the oysters quickly after. 

For the main dishes, we had shrimp and mussels with lotsa crab (yeah we forgot about vegetables~ oops) I have to tell you, this is currently my favorite place for seafood. Everything was delicious and have a couple bottles of riesling definitely helped compliment the meal.  Things do get a bit messy, but luckily they provide napkin wipes throughout the meal.  Fast and courteous service with a great view no matter where you sit.  

They also gave us a triple chocolate moos cake thing with a side of sorbet.  Delicious and perfect ending for a great dinner
author: Ryan Y.

description: We chose to eat here because it had the most and best reviews in the area for seafood.  Although we had to wait 1/2 hour, the food was amazing!  We had the sizzling hot platter of crab, shrimp, and mussells.  The lemon dipping sauce was special as I would come back to this place just for that sauce!  Service was fast once we were seated and we had great scenic views from our table.  We'll be back!
author: David D.

description:
Good location and views while dining, good service.  

 I went for the crab legs.  I figured, its called the Crab House, they probably have a good selection.  Well, they only have Dungeness Crabs, and im 99% sure they were deep fried.

I have never before had a deep fried crab leg, and I hope I never have another one.
author: AJ F.

description: This place was the worst place I have ate at. The service was bad, the server sat a table and told them to order because the kitchen close in 5 min. The shrimp was plain and the mussel was tiny... What kind of BS seafood is this place...
author: Mike H.

description:
Ive experienced something better and cheaper! The killer crab garlic sauce 
lacked flavor and the place is not worthy of all the hype of this place!
author: Foodie F.

description: Beautiful Saturday in SF.  Had lunch here.  Wait was reasonable, only 15 minutes and it's easy to kill 15 minutes on the Pier.  Friendly hostess, Attentive waiter.  Husband had the dungeness crab.  Too much work for me, I opted for the salmon with tomato and olives.  I have NEVER had such a good piece of salmon, and I eat a lot of salmon.  Best I have had.  I wish I had some now.  Only low mark from me would be the shrimp cocktail appetizer - had WAY too much black pepper and it totally took over.  But otherwise, so good so good, we will go back next visit for sure.
author: Suzanne P.

description: Always seems busy so that's a good sign. But I think the crab seasoning is a little too strong for my taste and the prices are a little on the high side. No value meals here... Service was meh. Might be a result of being in such a high traffic place. This is a good restaurant in a tourist trap area. My dinner party enjoyed the crab.
author: Laeres P.

description:
Omg the Crab house is the bomb!!!!! All I have to say is the sizzle
And the sauce will blow your mind. The crab is very tender
And scrumptious. I've eaten crab at different places but NONE
has been better than the Crab House. Oh yea please try with your Crab
Cheesy French bread with the crab meat & grilled shrimp Caesar salad and
Also try the drink crabby mood OMG so delicious ya'll.
THE CRAB HOUSE IS TRULY A FUN & WONDERFUL PLACE TOEAT!
author: Leona L.

description:
From the reviews, I put this on my "must eat" list while visiting SF. 6 of us went there for lunch and were promptly seated...if you could call that seating. We were squeezed into a table clearly made for 4. Once seated, no one could move. We're not very "large" people, (although we could drop a few), so I do not know how anyone with a little extra padding could have a comfortable dining experience here.
As for the food, we ordered the killer crab. We asked the waitress if we could have it cracked. She seemed kind of bothered. She came back with it, but it was just the legs, and the top shell of the crab. No body! Whaaatt!  Also, we ordered their crab chowder. It probably would be a lot better if they serve it hot. I don't get it. It's such a busy place that I would think that they would have hot chowder constantly cooking. On top of that, we had to ask for some bread because the waitress forgot. By then, we were through with our cold soupl Overall, we were very disappointed.
author: Logan M.

description: The only good thing about this restaurant was the view and the service was ok. The food was horrible!! $10 for a bowl of iceberg lettuce with a couple slivers of tomato and red onion. Crab and shrimp skillet was flavored a with oil only. No flavor on the shrimp, crab was dry. My husbands filet mignon tasted like it had been frozen, it had no seasoning and it tasted like hamburger. The prices were outrageous. Our tab was $200 for horrible steak, shrimp and crab, iceberg lettuce, cup of crab soup (which was good actually) and two glasses of cheap, bad, over-priced wine. I highly recommend that you don't waste your money here! What a huge disappointed as we saved our last night for the crab dinner.
author: Cherie T.

description:
What a great experience!

I haven't been to the Crab House in years but remembered it fondly.
So when Valentine's day came around this year I thought of The Crab House of pier 39!

I made reservations for 6, which worked out great! We ran into minimal traffic. Got there just as the dinner rush started and skiped a huge line to get seated at one of the best spots in the house.
The views are phenominal and at 6pm you still get to see the sun go down, the golden gate and whole city slowly fade into night.

We ordered calamarie, shrimp and their famous crab!

The food came out super hot, fast and delisous!

We had a great time and a great meal! I have been to lots of places to eat on the piers but I highly recommend this place to love birds and tourists alike!

Our bill after drink and dinner and a 15% tip was still under $90!

It was great and we will be back!
author: Gena M.

description:
I haven't been to crab house for years! My first was a pleasant one, the food was really good and service was great. 

Came back for brunch during Fleet Week and we ordered the double mussels and half crab. It was really fulfilling and delicious! If you get a window seat you can get a nice view of the bay. The service here is great our waiter was very attentive. We also got a glimpse of the jets doing runs!
author: Jenny G.

description: Don't waste Your Time!!! I am A Huge Dungeness Crab Fan And This Place Did Nothing for Me, The Crab Was Bland As Hell The Butter They Gave To Me Tasted Burnt With no Garlic At all. It was nothing more than Oily crab Legs with extra Cilantro No Garlic or Seasoning, for a Hole lots of $$
author: Boski P.

description: I appreciate your reviews of customer feedback  regarding your business!   In response to your question - we were there Friday (5/1) evening at about 7:30pm.
author: Marie E.

description: Not bad for a tourist place. Be warned, the place is busy and you will wait.   We went on a Saturday afternoon for a late lunch.  They had a 30 minute wait so we grabbed a beer at the bar.  Our waitress was friendly even though the place was slammed. We had the crab cocktail as an appetizer.  My husband had some pizza thing he said was really good. I had the crab pasta and it was delicious.  I wish we weren't staying in a hotel because I had a lot leftover.  They do not skimp on the portions.  Pricing is a little high but then again you're smack dab in the middle of tourist territory.
author: Laurie S.

description: Just had my dinner there! The killer crab n garlic sauce were so good!!! It's two of is n we had 5lbs crabs!
author: Fande Z.

description: AMAZING!!! We were in San Francisco and this is the place to eat.  Right on Pier 39, what can be better? Oh, I know......their CRAB!!!  Before we went here I myself was not a huge crab lover but now I am. My husband and I enjoyed every delicious bite. We had the lotsa crab for two and their garlic fries, it was amazing!!!  Service was great too and what about that view?! Sure this place is popular but when we went there was only a 15 minute wait. Is it pricey? Sure, but you get what you pay for. Worth every penny. We will be taking more trips to SF just to go eat at Crab House.  If you happen to be on Pier 39 this place is a MUST!!!
author: Jo S.

description: Awful service and food! Served us highball sized glass of lukewarm water, no ice, no refill. Charged $4.25 for coke and coffee each, no refills. Sat there thirsty whole meal. Served cold hard bread. Tom Brady wouldn't even play ball with this bread. Crab Enchiladas had soggy lettuce inside and chewy flour tortillas, take it no real chef in the kitchen. Served my son wrong entree. My husband still hungry after fish and chips. Told manger about problems, said sorry and walked away. Don't mind spending $120 on dinner, but felt ripped off and disrespected. Tourist Trap. Travel a lot and eat out often. Skip this place!
author: Sally B.

description: Just left this restaurant and want to warn others, NOT WORTH IT!!  First, Margarita, so watered-down more like weak lemonade.  Tables crammed together, too busy!!  Soooooo expensive! !  Had crab chowder, lukewarm, little flavor, and not enough crab!  To top it off, when I told the waiter the drinks were watered he said if you had told me in the beginning I could have returned it.  Ahhhh, poor customer service. I'll never return! !  And my husband said the bathroom was disgusting!   Yuck
author: Yelp r.

description:
Just so mediocre and an obvious tourist trap. 

We shared 2 lbs of dungeness w/ their secret special garlic sauce...butter, olive oil, some green onion, and garlic?  

The crab was pretty good but got boring fast. We probably should have tried some other stuff for variety. 

Service was pretty bad but we went late and were the second to last party there. Hostess was really hot. I'd skip it.
author: David C.

description: This is the  third time we have been to the Crabhouse when we have visited from Florida.  We won't be back.  The maitre'd, whom we understood later was temporary, was rude.  We arrived on time for our reservation and were standing in line to use the restroom when we were told to get out of line or we would lose our table!  Then while the waitress could not have been nicer, the food arrived so fast we felt we were rushed to hurry and give up our table. The crabs were not as good as in the past. Garlic fries were the best part. Also, this same rude maitre'd hung over the high divider that our table butted.  We had to ask him stop as we were having dinner! We won't be back.  Nancy Pelosi (I know same name).
author: Nancy P.

description:
This place has the fastest and best service! The waiter was really friendly and personable, and he even tied the lobster bib around my neck for me!

I was dining alone, and at a busy place like this I'm normally expecting to be given a small table off to the side. Instead, I was promptly seated at a table next to a window overlooking the bay and Golden Gate Bridge.

I ordered the chowder and the 2lb Dungeoness Killer Crab. The chowder came quickly and I was surprised to see a generous clump of shredded crab on top. The chowder itself wasn't too creamy, as some chowders can be, and there was just enough substance (crab and vegetables) in every spoonful that it made for a very satisfying beginning to the meal.

Next was the crab. It arrived on a sizzling platter and had this great, bright orange appearance. And it smelled fantastic. I had to let it sit for a minute to let it cool enough so that I could handle it. Once I started, it was easy eating as far as crab goes. The shell was crispy and brittle-- always a good sign-- and the meat was tender and juicy. The crab was soaked in this garlic-buttery sauce that gives it an incredibly rich and unique taste. The small, individual loaf of bread they give you offsets the richness of the meal, though.

Overall, the chower and killer crab were absolutely delicious. Avoid Joe's Crab Shack and come here instead. Get the Killer Crab- you won't regret it! Prepare to spend a fair amount, though. The chowder + 2lb crab + soda = ~$50 (not including tip). You'll walk away feeling like it was worth it, though.
author: Alex K.

description: There are several places to get fresh dungeness crab on Pier 39 and at nearby Fisherman's Wharf, but Crab House at Pier 39 has great cioppino as well!
author: Peter P.

description: While pricy, the food is top notch.  The crab is just as advertised -- perfectly cooked and garlicky.  My only complaint is that they are priced a bit too high compared to other restaurants around there that sell crab.
author: DeAnna P.

description: Definitely a tourist trap.  Decided to grab some food here.  Wasn't bad.  Crabs were good.  Shrimps were definitely frozen, not fresh. A little disappointed with the calamari.  Was under seasoned and the batter was a little too greasy.    Service was decent.  Over-all OK experience.  However, not a great value for what they charge.
author: Es P.

description: If I could give The Crab House less stars, I would. This was absolutely the worst crab I have ever eaten. It was over cooked, and the shells splintered when trying to get the meat out. On the other hand, others in my party had chicken fettuccine and it was good. But, shouldn't The Crab House have good crab and seafood? All of the seafood orders were bad. Also, while the servers were friendly, the service was less than stellar. We had to ask multiple times to receive drink refills and part of our order that was missing. The missing part of the order finally appeared as we were ready to leave.
author: Theresa M.

description: Dirty plates, undercooked pasta. When i asked to change my pasta they brought it in the same dirty plate and it was tasteless, no salt or seasoning whatsoever, it felt like i was eating butter with the spoon.Nasty! This is my first and last time being here! The prices are high and enough said about the food, disgusting, plus servers are extremely rude, don't ever come here!
author: Natasha K.

description:
Got Crabs?  Should be: Got good Crabs today?

The point being is the crab can be hit or miss here. 

The first time I went the crabs were  phenomenal, the next time; d squared for sure (definitely disappointing). They use a pretty delicious garlic sauce to cook the crabs in and I think that the second time they did not use enough of this wonderful sauce which was the source of my disappointment.  I do  have to admit that the crab angel hair lasagna is  very good, having a nice subtle crab flavor combined with nicely cooked vermicelli, though I do think that adding a little texture would not be a bad idea; maybe some lightly sautéed green and red pepper or something along those lines.  

The atmosphere is very nice. Being on the second floor overlooking the water the view is beautiful especially at sunset.  The décor is nothing to write home about but it is clean and tastefully done. 

No problems with service either, both times the server was knowledgeable and efficient. 

Overall not a bad experience.  Its nowhere that I am dying to go to again but it is somewhere I would go to again, if that makes any sense ( I rarely do).

But If it ain't broke don't Fish it.
author: Fish E.

description: The Food Was Good But The Service Was Not. We Waited A Long Time For Our Food, No One Checked On Us. They Were Pretty Unattentive. If It Wasn't For The bad Service they Would Have Recived A Least 4 Stars.
author: Joni M.

description: I was craving crab on Sunday, so I dragged my fiance to San Francisco for dinner :-) I trust Yelp, so I went with the crab house because of the great reviews. This place isn't the fanciest of places, but the food is delicious! Normally, for prices like these the ambiance would be more mellow and there would be white tablecloths and wine glasses on the tables......The food was sooooo delicious that I didn't care about all the extra stuff my money usually pays for :-) In addition to the 3 pounds of crab that we ordered, we also got glarlic noodles, and garlic bread. Garlic and crab are the perfect pair! To drink, my fiance had 2 martini's and I had a strawberry mojito. My mojito was to die for! Served in a gibralter glass, which is on the bigger side when it comes to cocktails! I'll be going back when I get my next crab craving!
author: Rachel A.

description: Had a great window seat with a spectacular view. Finger lickin' delicious crab and great garlic fries. Would definitely return. Oh, and the martinis were done to perfection as well.
author: Ellen F.

description:
I want so bad to give it 5 stars because my first two trips there were amazing! My latest visit was good but not great. 

Make sure to get the entrees served on the iron skillets as they are almost always fantastic! My last visit the crab and mussels were a bit off in freshness and quality. The service this time around was not that great but acceptable. The garlic fries are amazing so try them! Also there Amber unfiltered beer is fantastic! 

I will be back though

PS make sure to walk around the place and see all of the decorated clams on the wall. Very cool!
author: Dave Z.

description: This is a great place to take a girl on a date a lot of interaction. And a great view if you have a window seat.  Their crab lasagna is fantastic.
author: Gary C.

description: I see your talks with the staff has made no difference to how they treat their customers . also it would be nice to give the customers waiting over 15 mins a complementary something. oh definitely go to spud point for the freshest sweetest  tasting  crab ever and very good clam chowder.it is in bodega bay. prices are way better also at spud point.
author: Nellie J.

description: Went here with visiting friends.  Meal was expensive as expected at a tourist site, but I expected a much  better meal.  Friends ordered pasta dishes, both were very oily.  I ordered the crab soup which was very bland, not flavorful at all.  Ordered bruschetta and again the bread was very oily, topped with tomatoes and overloaded with garlic.  None of us finished our meals. Meal was disappointing as this was the first restaurant  friends went to in San Francisco.  Not very impressive.
author: Ruth L.

description:
I tried this restaurant because of  lots positive reviewers. Crab was dried and fluffy taste also crab meat didn't look fresh either. That was ok. But my cousin and I got rash all over body with diarrhea both after dinner there on sep 7. We never had sea food allergy. It want shellfish allergies. It was food poison. It should be bad luck on us.

I dont recomend and wont visit there again.
author: Kyu K.

description: My husband and I have a place in SF so we visit rather often. We like to do the touristy things every once in a while so we thought that we would go have lunch on the Pier and walk around. We chose to eat here primarily because it was a little before  lunch-time and nowhere else was open. The food was average but the portions teetered on the small side. The service was pretty good though. The restaurant is kept very clean and the view is amazing, but I suspect that's why their prices are sky-high.
author: Samantha L.

description:
So the owner contacted me about my review.

It was a nice gesture and I think a great way to stay in-touch with patrons. I'm glad to see an owner following up on reviews. It's a good sign of active ownership.

He offered to me, on my next vist, that his staff would be happy to recommend some stand-out dishes. If I do get back to SF, I'll take him up on the offer.

I will clarify one of my comments for him. I wrote that this was a tourist destination. I stand by that simply because the whole Wharf area is one giant tourist destination. We have friends that live in SF and they describe the Wharf area as a savior. In that, all the tourists go there, leaving the rest of the city to them. In other words, they hate it. When I talked about the Crab House, they responded that they never go to the Wharf, so they wouldn't know of it.

So there you have it. I said the food was pretty good and it was. If I eat here again, I will post a review. By the way, two stars signifies that "I've had better" according to Yelps rating scale. The Crab House is true to that rating.
author: Cliff J.

description:
I got to come here during the prime of the heatwave on 5/15/08.
Perfect evening for crab, garlic noodles and a gorgeous sunset.
The view? Beautiful.
The food? Delicious

3 pounds of garlic crab, 1 order of garlic noodles and 2 hungry beasts. 
We were content.

The crab was light, not too heavy on the garlic and butter like Thanh Long.  It was slightly crispy? Hard to describe the sauce, but it was finger licking good. 
The garlic noodles! It was more italian style pasta rather than the garlic noodles i've become used to (Thanh Long style). Once again, not too heavy on the garlic but still very satisfying and good. 
Also, I didn't feel like I was clogging my arteries and about to have a heart attack directly after.
author: Susy C.

description: So to start the meal off we get some water and the glass is dirty, not a great start. The seafood was passing at best, and the highlight of the meal was the garlic fries which I found to be quite good. View is also quite nice, and overlooks fisherman's wharf. While we were starting to wind down, but were still eating the waiter kept trying to get us to leave. He came by at least four times in 5-6 minutes trying to take our plates before we were ready to go. The place was quite busy and it seemed like people were enjoying themselves, but this place isn't going to get my repeat business.
author: Nader A.

description:
Crab House at Pier 39 is a nice restaurant with a great view. I love seafood more than anything so Crab House already gets a 3 stars head start for me. What I really like in this restaurant was their Crab Chowder, (thinking about it right now makes me want to crack a crab and dip it in some clam chowder) it was so good. They also have an awesome Calamari and one of the best Garlic Fries ever. Also want to give a shout out to the Shrimp Alfredo because it was rather tasty. 

But the Killer Crab kind of fell short of my expectation. Maybe I'm comparing, (well I am, it's my review) but it just wasn't as good as a certain restaurant I don't want to mention (let me just say it starts with the letter Thanh). I was just very overwhelmed with the butter taste I almost didn't taste the crab. 

Since I gave it a 3 stars head start I don't think I can give it any more than that. They definitely had good food and I'll probably go back next time I'm in Pier 39, but I don't think I'll be ordering the Killer Crab. I know I'm downgrading the restaurant for their Killer Crab, even though I enjoyed a lot of their other food, but I went there for the Dungeness Crab (and their called Crab House for god sake). This place is also very pricy (I know location and crab adds to the value of the food) but if I'm paying for the crab it better be Thanh Long good. You know what I'm sayin!
author: Mel B.

description: If you want to feast up on some garlic roasted crab, this is the spot. Located on Pier 39, it is our go to spot whenever we are in the area. We pretty much order the samething every time. Muscle and shrimp sizzling skillet with a garlic butter sauce, some garlic noodles, and of course "Lotsa Crab" which is 3lbs of the best garlic roasted crab. Highly recommend checking it out if you're in the area.
author: Erick S.

description:
I've never really had much crab in my life, but I rather enjoyed my lunch experience at this restaurant. We tried the crab fondue, the grilled cheese from the kid's menu, a medium order of fries (more than enough for three people, by the way), and the two-person serving of crab legs and claws. Everything was tasty, particularly the fries and crab legs. The fondue was laden with a little too much spinach. Whatever, we ordered that on a whim anyway.

I'm no stranger to cracking open a lobster and getting a little messy in the interest of eating a crustacean, but I wasn't prepared for the intense process of retrieving crab meat. The forks they gave were ill-suited for the meat, which would basically fall apart on impact because it was a little dry.  Our waitress explained the black plastic tool to us and things got a little easier after that. I think I still prefer lobster, but I'd consider braving Pier 39 again to eat crab here.
author: charlotte c.

description:
The location is awesome, perfect for a small get together, but not recommended for a first date (crab shells cracking everywhere!)

Too two crab feast was so delicious. The two of us scarfed it down with ease. We should have ordered a bit more, but didn't want to get overly stuffed. 

True..the complementary bread is hard as a rock and their chowder is just ok, but the crab rocks and that's the important thing.

I'll come here again, skip the apps, and dive right into the crab feast!
author: Jason R.

description: Really? Only for tourists... I'm sure vacationers would give 4 stars, but foodies, just 2. Service was fine and friendly but the food quality for the prices... "eh"
author: Mahsa K.

description:
Found this place from yelp reviews so decided to give it a shot.  It's good, but it's no Thanh Long.

Service was indeed lacking- three other couples who were seated after us had their orders taken and their food delivered first.  (They actually served our crab to the wrong table!)  The crab seems to peel and crack strangely and annoyingly into a million pieces, unlike some of the delicious crab I have had elsewhere.  Perhaps it was just the batch of crab that they got at the time.

Even though the crab wasn't stellar, the crab chowder was quite delicious, along with the mussels.  They were fantastic.
author: Greg B.

description:
We love the Crab House @ Pier 39.  The negative reviews here are upsetting, because we LOVE the Crab House!  We were looking for a place to have a welcome dinner before our wedding, something with a "San Francisco" feel that could do casual dining for 50 people, and we 
could not be happier with our experience!!

As locals, we were under the impression that there was no good food to be had in the Fisherman's Wharf area, but we decided (despite these mixed reviews) to give this place a try.  We went for lunch, and had the nicest, friendliest, most attentive-without-being-overbearing waiter ever, Rafet.  He acted like it was totally normal that we were clearly unfamiliar with taking a crab apart properly, and taught us some techniques.  The Killer Crab is SO good, it would be sad for someone who likes crabmeat at all not to know what this tastes like!  The delectable crab chowder, the shrimp, the garlic fries?  We were sold!

Paolo, the manager, was so patient with us over the next couple of months, as we repeatedly emailed him to change the menu, and the head count, and assured us that they knew what they were doing and that we shouldn't worry.  He was right!  The night went flawlessly (thank you again, Rafet!), our guests absolutely loved the place, the food was so delicious (and we had foodies in this crowd)... friends even said that the wine they had was better than the one we had at our wedding!

Now we have the personalized menu to keep that Paolo had printed on special paper, and a plan to go back again soon for more buttery seafood goodness!
author: Samantha G.

description:
Wow... so Sam planned my 21st birthday celebration here last weekend... (ok so maybe its an anniversary of my 21st bday....) and they were super cool with handling it! We had a huge crowd... and all but 2 people were actually on time. Unfortunately they had to give our table away since we were mostly all at least half an hour late but they were great about accomodating us. We had a great server who managed to deal with all our rowdiness and the confusion that ensued... not to mention that they gave us some candles and cut the cakes that we had brought!!

They're not a "great for banquets" type of establishment but the manager and hostess and servers were fantastic in rolling with the crazy punches we dealt out!
author: Vicky L.

description: Came here on a cold rainy day.  We came in pretty early so it wasn't busy so we were seated right away.  They tried seating us at a booth but it was so tight, my legs could barely fit in there so we had to ask to move.  We ordered a pretty big feast between the three of us.  We ordered the chowder, crab, mussels, shrimp, garlic noodles, and a crab melt and shared.  The food was all in all just okay.  Not the best I ever had but it wasn't bad either.  The service was okay too.  We were checked on throughout our visit, and our plates were cleared as soon as each item was done.
author: Gordon C.

description: I wish I could post separate reviews for food and service. Food was good - crab is exactly what you expect. Chicken and chips was great! 4 stars for the food. However, the service was superb. We ate at the bar and Tyson was our server/bartender. He was ultra attentive and an excellent conversationalist. Thanks for the memorable experience Tyson, you made our lunch a lovely experience!
author: Jamie S.

description: Delicious!! I was doubting coming in here based on some reviews and I'm actually glad we went in to try it. The food was really good, and Nikiko the lady who served us was super friendly and helpful.
author: Hilsin G.

description:
Let's get the usual out of the way: I'm a local and I avoid this area at all costs. But my family was in town and they wanted crab, and although SF is by the bay, there aren't that many great seafood options. So we came here. Yelp said it was good, and lo and behold: it actually was good. 

The decorations are insanely cheesy, but in a fun way. We actually enjoyed checking out all the crabs that seem to be glued to everything. And the food was great. We didn't get the big plate o'crabs, but we saw a few of them and they looked yummy. The prices were high, but not crazy high, and it didn't keep anyone from ordering anything. 

If you need a place near the wharf, this is a great option. But make reservations, as it's pretty small.
author: Sarah K.

description:
My wife, daughter and I visit SF every year.  It's one of our favorite weekend getaways.  When we're here, we always have to eat at Crab House at Pier 39.  We got back from SF last month and I've been meaning to give them a shout out.  I can not put to words how good their dungeness crabs are.  So big, so fresh, so delicious.  You gotta have their garlic fries too.  It is our second favorite thing on their menu.  The best part is the beautiful view of the water while you're chowing down on this decadent feast and afterwards, you can walk off the calories strolling Pier 39.  :)

It is a little on the pricey side, but hey, you only live once right.  Well worth the dent on the wallet.  Keep in mind you are eating seafood, so in that context, the prices are very fair.
author: Bryan N.

description:
I am not saying anything that has not been said already. I'm just going to say that this one of my favorite sea food places ever. Their crab is just fantastic. Please be aware that the line is long! 

I went here for my 16th birthday, and I feel like one of those privileged kids from MTV. It is such an honor to eat here. Definitely will go here when I visit SF in the near future.
author: Snook C.

description:
I read all the great reviews about this place, so I decided to have my birthday dinner here. Well let me tell you, I was supper disappointed. 

The place itself was not disappointing. We were seated next to the window, so we got a great view of the bay and the seals were out, so that was a nice site to see. The waiters were friendly, fast, and were pretty great. 

The food however was subpar and just a disappointment. I was super excited coming here, thinking I would have the best tasting crabs of my life. Boy was I wrong. The crabs arrived feeling & looking hot, as in cooked. But when I cracked open the shell, the meat was cold and there was no taste at all.  If you count bland as a flavor, then I guess that was the flavor they decided to serve that day. We ordered mussels as well, and it was a little overcooked. It was so chewy my jaws started to hurt from all the chewing. 

The only thing I liked was their garlic fires. Those were so good, I practically ate the whole bowl and it was a pretty big serving of fries. The fries I would go back for.

Maybe we just went on an off day when their crabs were not at their best.
author: Karen B.

description: The view of the bay was awesome. I had the Pre fixe menu with the 1/2 king crab legs with salad & desert. The crab legs were amazing! The salad was really good. My fiancé had the chicken & chips. Very juicy fried chicken breast & the fries were awesome. Will visit again.
author: Geneva S.

description: If you really realy like garlic this is the place for you.  Minced garlic seemed to be included on every item including the french fries, crab melt, fish and chips and bread. Made the meal almost inedible. Portions were small for the price.  The waiter was wonderful and cheerful.  The hostess was rather casual.
author: Trace R.

description: Visiting from out of town. Relatives took is here and it is very good crab we got some pallet thing of crab it was so good.
author: T W.

description: Crab House is my go to! Sure its filled with a bunch of tourist but if you have a reservation then your fine. The crab is amazing. It comes in a butter garlic sauce and they give you as much bread to dip with as you want. On the water has a great view an delious crab what more could you ask for? Maybe minus the crowd of toursit but thats managabel.
author: Jess O.

description: This is not my first time to The Crab House but I have to say that this time was not a good experience. One of the "servers" who brought out our first dish, knocked over a soda that spilled on my wife and then the guy had the nerve to tell me that I should have moved the soda. He did not apologize, he did not bring a towel or even offer any assistance. I had to ask someone else for towels, napkins, etc. Food here is not cheap, and to be treated like that is ridiculous.
author: Brandon F.

description: Great service, great food, great location. Exactly what we were looking for after a long day of touring the city. Loved the location, view, and laid back atmosphere, and we all loved our dishes (I had the crab, which was awesome). What really made the experience notable was the 5 star service. Tim, our server, was attentive, friendly, and extremely knowledgeable (not to mention easy on the eyes), and made our dinner that much more enjoyable. Definitely recommend!
author: Kate R.

description:
There is no doubt that the food here is excellent. I went with my family yesterday for my mom's birthday and the waiter was friendly and patient with us as we took our time deciding what to eat.

 There were five us and we decided to start off with 2 bowls of the crab chowder. This was more than enough for the 5 of us to share. Everyone in my family enjoyed it especially since it had big clumps of crab meat. 

I ordered the crab cakes and they were absolutely delicious. It seems like a small portion at first since there are only 2 crab cakes, but they are actually pretty plump. Way more filling than I expected, but very fresh and tasted even better with the sauce that came with it. 

Other meals ordered by my family included the fish and chips, the crab melt, and lotsa crab. Everyone had nothing but good things to say about each dish. The chips or "fries" that came with the crab melt and fish and chips were delicious because they were a garlic pesto mixture. 

The best part of the meal had to be the tiramisu. This is by far the best tiramisu I have had a restaurant in America. My sister who doesn't even like tiramisu couldn't stop herself from eating the small slice we ordered. It was pretty surprising how good this tiramisu was since we were at a seafood restaurant, not an italian restaurant, and in one of the most touristy spots in SF. 

While the food was excellent, the dishes didn't seem the cleanest. It seemed like we were constantly checking our dishes to see if they were fully clean or not.
author: Sonia B.

description:
Window table = 10 stars!
Food = 4.5 stars!
Service & cleanliness = 3 stars...

Yes, the view is amazing - especially when the sea lions are out in force.  

And the food was quite delicious, although I have now confirmed that I do prefer King crab.  Yet, the Dungeoness served here is cooked delightfully in tons of garlic butter, though this presents a challenge in opening!  None of the entrees disappointed.  The crab lasagna was an interesting twist over angel hair pasta (very rich!) and the mussels sweet and tender.  Lastly, I agree with others: the garlic bread is amazing, but small in size.  A fair price: 2 entrees (including the 2lb. killer crab), 2 appetizers, and non-alcoholic drinks came to over $110 w/ tip.

Service is a bit different here - seems that side staff bring the refills, clear dishes, etc. and this was often lacking.  For example, we sat, fingers drenched in butter, for nearly 15 minutes while waiting for a wet nap.  At these prices small towels would be a welcome touch, but oh well.  Yet, we asked repeatedly for refills and napkins to slow response.  Our server did not seem distracted, nor was the restaurant overcrowded so we saw no reason for such inattentiveness (note to restaurant: you could have turned our table a 1/2 hour faster had our server been paying attention).  We also noticed that The Stinking Rose is a sister restaurant and asked for suggestions - surprisingly, the staff offered none (so we didn't visit).

As to cleanliness, I know busy restaurants face a constant challenge in upkeep but... we were led to a table and then told to stand there while they found someone to wipe it off!  The crab tools were filthy, too, covered in buttery remnants of previous users.  Plus used wet nap wrappers lined the window sill next to our table.  Perhaps the extra grease everywhere was from former patrons looking for a wet nap as well.
author: Alan S.

description:
Overall rating: Based on price & quality & service = 3.5

We've been here numerous times over the past 3 yrs. Birthdays, anniversaries etc. I have to say we discover a new disappointment every time. 

We stuck to the same order each time, Lots-a-Crab and Garlic Fries.

Based on the last experience in late July 2011, the Crab looks and tastes overcooked. I know the turnover of crabs in the restaurant is rapid. Still the crab tastes like it's precooked and re-heated. Just doesn't taste fresh! It lacks any sweet/juiciness of fresh seafood. And it comes on a hotplate that was more like lukewarm, it sizzled off under 20secs. Mostly, we were quite bothered that there is a layer of white-film on the crab meat. It used to be a 5-star experience eating the hot-salty-buttery crab by the lovely sunset. But I can't say it is the same anymore.

And the Garlic Fries serving portion was reduced significantly!! Fries, garlic and salt must be cheapest thing to serve in a restaurant. Yet, they decided to cut down on this item?? A shame... 

The service was just-okay. The server was definitely overwhelmed. I felt like he was a broker, trading on the NYSE-floor, waiting to close a trade. I can't help but feel his anxiety translate onto our table and our dining experience. Hiring an extra hand would help. 

Our bill always total to $90-100 for 2 persons (with dessert, drinks and tip). I'm not sure it is completely worth the price now.
author: Pancakes D.

description: I don't care what people say about the service. Don't even care if it is a tourist trap, or the fact that there's usually a wait. All I care about is how awesome the 3 lbs of dungeness crab for $49.95 feels in my stomach.
author: Miko L.

description:
my.family and i were trying.to find.good place to eat crab since we were at San Francisco. So i checked on yelp and review was great and picture looked so yummy! And the restaurant was grwat location which has ocean view. 

We ordered caesar salad, lobster pasta and skillet crab.  They served bread with butter to start. It is busy restaurant so the food came out a bit slow but we can wait! 

The service was also good! water is always on table ready!
author: Alicia C.

description: Nice service and location, and the crab was good enough, although not great. I couldn't help thinking I could have gotten a much better crab meal in San Francisco somewhere else for the $38 I paid there.
author: Reid F.

description:
I finally braved Pier 39 to meet some friends from out of town. They obviously chose the location. After 2 years of living in this city, this was my first adventure on Pier 39. On a Thursday night it was not busy at all, although most of the stores were already closed when I arrived at 7:30.
We had great service. The 3 guys & I shared the crab platter for 4 with 2 sides. It was definitely enough food! The crab was roasted, not my preferred method of cooking crab but the meat was good. 
Acme bread on the table was a nice touch. Gotta love that sourdough!
I'm still against eating in touristy areas but there's certainly nothing wrong with Crab House.
author: Sara P.

description: Having visited the wharf earlier in the day, and seeing all of the live crab vendors, I was in the mood for lots of crab. So we returned that evening expecting a delicious meal. We were both disappointed. The crab is extremely hot, but oily on the outside. Once cracked, it's dry on the inside. When we asked how it was prepared, we were told it was originally steamed, then broiled while covered in olive oil and garlic. My guess is that our crab sat for a while prior to preparation. Everything else was fine, but not great enough to justify the premium we paid for three pounds of below average crab.
author: Robert R.

description: Very impressive! Had Lotsa Crab and Grilled shrimp & mussels. Good tasting and amount. Enjoyed it.
author: Zhenhuan G.

description:
It was ok.  Maybe I was expecting more, but just ok.

My wife ordered the mussels (which we shared) and the killer crab.  I opted for the shrimp and chips.  It was ok.  Nothing more, nothing less.  If you are wearing nice clothes, be careful of the mussels, which come piping hot and boiling, which may splatter you as they steam and bubble.

The wait staff was very good.  Drink glasses were filled, plates were cleared, etc.  Very attentive.

It is in a tourist trap area, so comparable quality is all around.  You could do worse.  But, you could do better as well.

I figure you can get the same taste and quality at any one of the places along the Wharf.
author: Alan A.

description:
Best place to eat Crab at Pier 39.
Don' miss the garlic crab, it is out of this world.
author: Miguel L.

description: While visiting San Francisco, we had lunch at this restaurant. It was very expensive about $40 for the whole crab. For soup we were giving dirty dishes, crab was extremely oily and not even tasty. Overall I would not recommend this place, it's pretty dirty and stinky, and service was below par.
author: Sergey M.

description:
OMG, OMG, I don't have a word go taste for urself.....It makes Crustecian and Thanh-Long...think about there menu....it's almost the same...but way affordable.....and the view....is GREAT of the Bay!..

CHeck it out!
author: Eddie B.

description:
My boyfriend and I love seafood (especially CRAB), so when I read the reviews on this place, I couldn't wait to try it out.  The restaurant is located in the touristy Pier 39 overlooking the water.  The atmosphere seemed a little cold to me, it just didn't seem like a place to have a nice lunch or dinner.  

We ordered the crab cocktail, crab cioppino, and 1/2 lb of the "killer crab".  The crab cocktail was "aight"...nothing special.  My boyfriend got the cioppino.  I honestly didn't care for it.  The flavors weren't complex and it just tasted like pieces of crab in a really salty tomato broth.  It didn't even have any other seafood in it.  Now if you want a great cioppino, you have to go to Aldo's in Santa Cruz.  Best. Cioppino. Ever.  Anyhow, back to the Crab House.  I ordered the 1/2 crab and it was so...boring.  The flavor wasn't that great, it just tasted like crab doused in butter.  I guess I"m really spoiled because I go to Chinese restaurants with great crab or PPQ in the city.  PPQ has the best dungeness crab.  

The fact that I keep talking about other restaurants in a review about Crab House kind of tells you something.  There are plenty of other places in SF that have great seafood.
author: Vivian W.

description:
For the price you pay, I'd expect better décor, but I guess the view isn't so bad.

Service is OK. Not the best I've had, not the worst.

We only had appetizers because we wanted to venture to around and try a little bit of everything.

Bread was a bit hard/slightly stale. I bet the bread would've been better had they been toasted. Cause I love bread. Crab fondue was delicious! Except the toast it came with was ROCK hard. So I ate it with the cold slightly stale bread instead. Crab cakes were mediocre. Not the best I've had, not the worst. Garlic fries were good. 

If you're looking to spend some money on the pier and look at different colored/decorated crabs, this is probably the place for you. Otherwise, I'd venture elsewhere.
author: Christina N.

description:
YAOOWWWZAAA! 
WAHOO! 
ROAR! 

The food here is excellent! I loved the following:
- Garlic Fries
- The house crab
- Clam Chowder
- Sandwich (I forgot the name of it, but it contained fish)

The clam chowder isn't like the generic stuff that you get from Boudin's. It's not served in a sourdough bread bowl. It's served in an ordinary bowl but was filled with nutritious elements such as seafood and potatoes. 

House special crab was served on a heated metal plate with butter and their special garlic sauce. Definitely munch on this before the plate gets cold! 

Oh and I totally got a new yorker into the garlic fries thing. A relative of mine said that it's a west coast thing to have garlic fries as they never heard of it before. 

Definitely will come back if I need to bring some tourist into the pier.
author: Eric Y.

description: It's a fun place to celebrate a birthday, the whole staff gets involved in singing and dancing every 1/2 hr. It was pretty pricey but well worth it, but the crab cakes are awful.
author: Sunny M.

description: I went to a tourist trap today.  It wasn't very good.   I'll give them 2 stars for being lovely and accommodating and having above average iced tea.  I'm not withholding stars because the Crab House is a tourist trap....they all have their place in the world... this just happens to be a lovely little tourist trap serving lovely little bad food...
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Good food, amazing view. My husband and I went for our anniversary, they gave us one of the best tables. The service was ok, it was pretty busy when we went there even though it was close to closing. I would have preferred other options in crab besides just dungeness, but the crab was still pretty good. 


At the end of the night when we got back to our hotel my husband noticed he left his bag of items we had just bought from another store. We called them right away and they did not have our things. The next day when we went to check again, they had found our items and set them aside for us and quickly were able to find them and give them back. All around it was a great experience, with great service.
author: Maryam H.

description:
YUM!!
Def. a place to check out if you are looking for a good meal in the area.  Somewhat pricey for what it is but you are in San Fran so I guess that is to be expected.

Pros:
-Great food
-Great view
-Nice service

Cons:
-Pricey

Here is what we ordered.  Everything was great to amazing.

App:
-Sizzling platter of crab, shrimp, and mussels.  Seriously one of the best seafood apps I have had.
-Crab cakes.  Good but small and pricey for what they are.


Entree:
-Fish and chips.  To die for!
-Clam Chowder.  Lots of chowder.  I didn't have this but heard it was good.  This was seriously the biggest bowl of soup that I have ever seen.  Lots of crab.
author: Michael B.

description: Great crab and the iceburg salad was perfect with it. If you like garlic like we do this is your place. Wine good too with nice size pours."
author: Barbara M.

description: Crab House was absolutely delicious! Minus the bruschetta.  Definitely go straight for the crabs and garlic fries; you won't be disappointed! Oh and please believe the waiter when he tells you the hot sauce is HOT!
author: Andrea B.

description:
Their signature crab is delish! I got the 1/2 lb...and if you're a seafood lover like me (I can eat 2 whole crabs to myself) the 1/2 lb is not going to be enough for you! I don't know what I was thinking when I ordered just 1/2 lb!

The dish didn't come with any sides, it was basically 5 legs on a cast-iron skillet...that cost $19.99! Don't get me wrong it was very good...but the price!?!? Shoot i ate that bad boy as slowly as I could just to get every penny out of it! LOL

I also ordered a side of garlic fries and that was also yum! For $5.95 I scraped that bad boy down to the bone! 

I really shouldn't complain about the price I had to pay since it is located in SF @ Pier 39, total tourist hot spot! I enjoyed my food, paid a little more than what I was expecting but in the end I left with a satisfied tummy. That's all you really need when your feasting in SF.
author: Chelle R.

description:
I had the baked crab legs with couscous.  The dungeness crab legs are baked with a ton of garlic/onion salt plus other unidentified spices.  The crab meat had long lost any juiciness.  There was a lot of "taste" due to the added spices but not much to do with crab.  

I'm picky about seafood and I think that if you are going to eat a crab, you should respect the delicateness of the meat.  Don't ruin it with extra stuff.  

On the plus side, they had a good ale on tap and a waitress from Estonia.
author: Marc W.

description: Everything was wonderful. We had a whole crab, crab chowder, crack cocktail, garlic fries, and garlic pasta. A beer and a very nice glass of white and all for $110.00. Would go back tomorrow if we weren't leaving the city..
author: Matt F.

description: Been here often. Always great service. Bartenders are a hoot! Great escape from the tourist traps just feet outside the door.
author: Sam M.

description:
We were there the weekend of the 18th - (family).  The food is great but the service is awful!  Waiters have too many tables & you don't get the service/attention you deserve.  As if you were paying "Mcdonald's Prices".  
And... the worst; check your bill.  Waiters tend to throw in their tip without your approval. We paid with debit & left a very good CASH TIP.  When we checked our bank statement, it showed that 'WAITER" had paid himself an xtra $20.
Other than that... which is NOT GOOD.  Food is great!

Blanca P.
5/23/12
author: Blanca P.

description: If you're new around here, you should definitely hit this spot. Breaks the wallet a bit, and it's arguable if it's worth it. But I love crab and I love shrimp and I love mussels and my cousins and I just got a bunch of crab, shrimp, and mussels and were not disappointed at all. So have at it!
author: Nicole L.

description: I love the crab here....it is so good!! I have been here several times over the years and it never changes, same delicious goodness!!! The service is good as well, and they have a good bar.
author: Carina R.

description:
My significant other and I grabbed a late evening meal here on the premise that I promised her I would take her out on a spectacular seafood dining experience before she left San Francisco. And boy, did Crab House deliver! 

We ordered the mussels & shrimps combination as appetizer with 3 pounds of seasoned crab as entree. They were some of the most deliciously prepared sea critters I've had the pleasure to taste in a very, very long time. The check came out to be around $90 with tip, but for a special occasion (I'd argue every occasion with her is special, but my budget tells me otherwise), it was well worth the Franklin. 

The service was great and the waiter accommodating, and they even have those wet towelettes usually reserved for Japanese restaurants. We sat by the window and it had a great view of the docks, and the decor of the venue, while being conventional of a seafood restaurant, is very fitting and cozy. 

If you love amazing seafood for your buck or just looking for dining options around the Wharf with your special someone, treat yourself to Crab House. You won't regret it. :)
author: Jonathan C.

description:
The Crab House is the busiest restaurant on Pier 39, and for good reason.   It's touristy for sure, but it's the perfect fit for that classic seafood dinner everyone is looking for when they come to San Francisco on holiday.  
Order the dungeness crab, and after devouring the succulent flesh, sop up the leftover crab/butter/garlic sauce with the french bread provided with every meal. Heavenly.
The Cioppino was terrific, the oysters were sublime, and every other dish our party ordered was above par.
This place is extremely pricey.  Perhaps too pricey even for this quality.
