But it is right on the bay, and the seafood couldn't be any fresher.
In town for the weekend, and don't mind spending some coin for a great meal in a fabulous atmosphere?  Go here.
author: MC Free W.

description:
I felt the prices reflected the real estate more than the food or service. We ordered "Lotsa Crab", which is 3 pounds of crab to be shared, without any included side dishes for the princely sum of $55. The menu for side dishes included only 3 items, from garlic fries to mixed vegetables.

I'm used to steamed crab, so theirs was a different experience. We decided it must have been grilled. It was Dungeness crab with an extremely brittle shell. It wasn't awful tasting, but it wasn't what I was looking for. 

Soft drinks were $3 each, but refills were free. Our server took our order, but always outsourced the drinks to someone else, so the efficiency of service was somewhat lacking. Our waiter also seemed to have something of a chip on his shoulder, which is fine since we didn't see him all that much.

On the plus side, we got there at lunch time and it was pretty busy. We were told it would be 15 minutes, but only 8 minutes later we were seated. They also have a deal with the souvenir shop directly across from them. By presenting our receipt, we were given a free T-shirt!
author: Michael S.

description: We were seated quickly and service was great. Two of us pigged out on the crab feast .. It was awesome! Pricey lunch but well worth it.
author: A. J.

description:
we ordered small garlic fries and calamari.

calamari had fried lemon wedges, wtf? why.
both size 'small' were PLENTY for 2 people.

the crab is freakin DIVINE. that brown crab gunk is superb, super salty. sop it up with some bread [if you're really gross].

mini shrimp were so good, that dipping butter was so yum.

ugh the CRAB! DELICIOUS. love this place. mojitos weren't strong at all, that's a let down.
i had to order double the rum for round 2, THAT fixed it.

great place
author: Ellie B.

description: I really like their crab.  Not much on the menu for a Gluten Free guy but my family really enjoyed it.  By my standards very expensive.
author: James M.

description: I love the crabs, and this place is great, but they are little expensive for what you get.  Regardless, I keep going back and I will continue to go there every time I am in SF.  They are a bit crowded, so be sure that you make a reservation.
author: Lindsay M.

description: Foods are pretty good actually, but I don't like the interior and the ambience of the restaurant.
author: Herman K.

description:
Ok, so we went to San Francisco AGAIN from Los Angeles JUST TO EAT THE DUNGEONESS CRAB at the CRABHOUSE!

Yes, you heard right, our original plan was renting a 1 bedroom suite in Vegas but when push came to shove, my taste buds got the best of me and San Francisco it was.

This was my 3rd trip to beautiful San Francisco and believe it or not THE BEST YET.
Ok, so in love was I (and gf) with the flavor and quantity of the succulent crab that we actually ate dinner there daily AND ordered the same plate (dungeoness crab for 4 people) along with an extra DIFFERENT plate each day for a total of 4 days. The bill for each day averaged to around 160 bucks for three of us total so you can imagine how much we spent just in that restaurant. The waiters got to know us pretty well, lol.

Mmmmmmm, I which i could transport that restaurant to LA.  Sigh.....
Man o man, the garlic fries are just as amazing...never had any fries like that. And the angel pasta to boot is a match made in heaven.

Can't wait to come up with an excuse to go there again, really looking forward to it probably early next year.  Hey, you got to live it up once in awhile. Hehe..
author: John S.

description:
Awesome food and deserts.   We have the 2 pound crabs and it was fantastic.   the secret garlic sauce was the catalyst in making this dish superb.   The tarimisu and chocolate mousse was also fantatstic.  My kids devoured it and we had to get another tarimisu.

The mojitos were good too - I would recommend the melon mojito as this was more refreshing and complemented the garlic sauce - at least for me.
author: Selvan M.

description:
OMG Fried Calamari, Double Mussells Double CRAB, Crab Cioppino,  Garlic Fries, a Shot of Patron and I think I'm in in Heaven! Yes, I love to eat a lot. 

It's a little tight fitting on the inside and weird with all the decorative crabs hanging all over the place but the staff is cool and the food is great. Don't forget to put on your bib there, it can get a little messy!

Some tend to forget, you are in a touristy area with guess what??? Tourist prices. Tourist Decor? LoL. It is what it is. It's a good spot with good food- so good enough for me.
author: Tei N.

description:
As an SF resident for many years, I finally decided to check this place out. It's a tourist trap, for sure, but I was still curious. Quick verdict: skip it. I feel bad for the tourists if they think this is good crab. It was much lower quality than the crab I have gotten other places in the city (try woodhouse!). On top of that, the service was awful. The food came out immediately, the waiter never checked on us, and I had to eventually flag him down to get a diet coke refill.

If you need any more proof that this place stinks, take a look at some of the reviews. All the good ones are written by people who aren't from San Francisco. Of course this place has better crab than Cincinnati... 

SKIP.
author: Kevin H.

description: Okay, we finally made it and I felt as if the waitress Natalie was avoiding us. Tomorrow is my birthday and I wanted my favorite food SEAFOOD. We ordered lotsacrab and it was greasy, unflavorful, and dry. We had to beg for complimentary bread AND refills to rinse it down. In observing the treatment of other tables, I do believe that there is a difference in how they deliver their service. We spend good money on our bellies and service but in the future we have decided to go 30 minutes farther to Dead Fish where we have experienced outstanding customer service, delicious, flavorful, and unforgettable seafood. One word-DISCRIMINATION
author: OnlyTheStrong S.

description:
Stopped by the Crab House after biking from the Pier to Sausalito.  Was starving and this place hit the spot!  The portions were filling.  I ordered the fish and chips.  The buttermilk batter was a nice change from the classic beer batter.  Also the fish was fairly large.  I didn't feel like dying afterwards.  The chips were garlic fries!  The garlic was not overwhelming and again I didn't feel like dying after eating it.  My date had the Crab angel hair lasagna which was compact but packed a flavorful punch.  This is a very nice spot.  

The price is high but worth a try.
author: Jay G.

description:
I came here on a Saturday night after seeing all of the good reviews and especially after seeing pictures of the garlic fries. I made the reservation through open table and showed up a bit early but was still seated promptly. Me and my date ordered dungeness crab, garlic fries & garlic noodles (remember: your date can't say anything if their breath stinks too). 

The crab was good but had a lot garlic and butter flavor that may be a little much for the purists. The garlic fries were extra crispy, cooked just right & topped with a decent amount of garlic. My favorite was the garlic noodles. Did I mention I love garlic? 

The service was prompt & methodical. I would have liked to see a little more warmth from our server but the night was old & I'm sure so many tourists can wear on even the nicest of people. It wasn't bad service by any means; lets just call it..... no frills. 

I was torn between three or four stars but every time I think about the garlic noodles I get all excited so I'll say four. Overall a very good experience!
author: Brandon G.

description: Pricey, but well worth it.  The crab feast is simply amazing.
author: Aryn B.

description: great！I eat crab just like dog eats his lovely bone. The garlic flavor is fantastic. And the best thing is the dinner is so cheap. If I live in San Francisco, I'll go to this place every day!
author: Bo L.

description: It's safe to say I ate like a fat pig here. Bong.
author: John S.

description: Baked crab is amazing. View is awesome. Experience is iconic. A must-visit whenever in SF.
author: Allan D.

description:
I learned a few things from visiting Crab House in San Francisco: 1.) While I'm already super-sexy, I'm even sexier in a bib; 2.) Crab Fondue is not what you think (or hope) it is; 3.) Just because a restaurant is over-priced and amidst tourist-ville doesn't necessarily mean it's terrible; and 4.) I was never meant to eat crab (at least, while retaining my dignity).

The crab was great. Really, it was. If that's all you care about, stop reading now and get yourself some Crab House.

What? You want to know more? Well... okay, I guess. You see, our server was fucking terrible. She put in our order incorrectly and brought us our check 15 minutes, then 10 minutes, then 5 minutes after we asked for it. Oh, and she put my bib on too tight! I know, right?? Pshhh.

Also, the dishes were labeled very poorly on the menu. Maybe I'm spoiled in NYC, but when you say something is crab fondue, at least write a blurb about it so we know it's actually two pieces of bread and a cheesy custard (with crab in it? abso-fickin-maybe!) in a pie tin.... instead of, ya know, crab fondue.

For the record, I made a total mess of my crab legs (which were served in a red sauce of some kind) and when cracking them failed, I simply began using my teeth and fingers to yank morsels out of their shell. By the end of it, our table looked like a crab holocaust and my face was dripping with crab tendons and sauce. While this information won't help you parse the restaurant, it may persuade you to avoid this place if you're going on a first date. You've been warned.
author: Aaron L.

description: I didn't believe my friend when he said this place was one of the best, until I tried it. And it is very good. I don't know how they do it but the flavor of the spices were really delicious and you can taste it on the crab meat. Located on the upper floor Pier 39. You have to pay for parking unless you drive around the vicinity and do public meter ( if you got a nice car...go park it in the garage , it's safer).  I will need to go back here and fully enjoy the crab once again.
author: Nixon L.

description: Luckily I went in with my wife and it was a party of two, seating looks to always be limited and if you have a big party be prepared to wait. The calamari was delicious and perfectly seasoned and cooked. We ordered the crab Alfredo (my wife isn't very adventurous) and it was decent enough. Noodles should have been cooked a bit longer and there could have been more crab meat in it. Was surprised that the Alfredo had no side (bread, crackers, soooooomething) but was good enough. Service seemed like they wanted you in and out. So if you're hungry and wanting a quick lunch then go ahead and order here. If you're looking to relax a little then maybe choose somewhere else to unwind from all the walking.
author: Diego L.

description:
YUMMY YUMMY in my tummy!!

The Man and I came here for our anniversary (Valentines Day..cliche I know, but there's a story behind it!) and I LOVED IT and he got major points for taking me to yummy seafood!

This place is great! The only downfall is that its super touristy and gets really crowded!

The food is deeeeelish! Super fresh and tasty! Definitely NOT your average  Bubba Gumps (eww!) The service is also great! 

A little pricey, but you can't really expect any less from a restaurant at the Pier in a tourist hot spot! Great for dates, cause you can walk the pier and enjoy San Francisco after dinner, BUT cracking crabs gets messy so maybe not for a first date HAHA!
author: Sai K.

description: Wow is this place awesome. Came with two people and ordered two whole crabs and DANG WAS I HAPPY. That garlic sauce they cook it in is AMAZING. My taste buds about exploded when I started sopping up the burnt/caramelized goodness that was sitting on the sizzling platter.
author: Pattie U.

description: Two words : SHRIMP ALFREDO. Delicious!! The sauce will change your life! The sauce in the crab alfredo is different than the shrimp Alfredo. My husband and I came here two days in a row just for the shrimp alfredo. It is just that good! We got the mozzarella garlic bread and it was delicious as well! The staff was very quick, helpful, and professional, there wasn't much of a wait, the restaurant was very clean, and the food was hot. What more could you ask for?
author: Claire P.

description:
As Southern California residents, this was our 1st time in San Francisco. So of course we had to stop and get a nice seafood/crab dinner...that's what you do when you visit sea-side cities right?

Since we stayed in a hotel in the Civic Center area, we decided to catch a cab down to the Wharf since it wasn't too far. We decided on the Crab House at Pier 39 and I must say, we were NOT disappointed. We received excellent service from the staff, the garlic fries were delicious; crispy, hot, with the perfect amount of fresh chopped garlic and parmesan cheese. When the Killer Crab arrived at the table, my eyes got larger than the bowl they give you for the empty shells. 

The shell of the crab was still hard enough to crack allowing me to cleanly extract the luscious meat from it's spiny orange encasement. And boy, was that crabmeat tasty!!! The perfect blend of seasoning & butter sauce made me feel like I had just entered a crustacean lovers paradise. 

The only feedback I have have would be for more side-dish options to be available. But all in all, the place deserves the five stars I've rated them...really good eating and friendly service, what more can you ask for?
author: Aric W.

description: Great food but the portion sizes were small for the price. It was a good, fancy dinner price with a little bit more relaxed atmosphere. The food was excellently cooked and was delicious! We just thought for the money it was not appropriate. We probably will not return based on this fact, but we recommend that anyone who is not cost oriented and wants a great meal should try this restaurant. We had the seafood pasta and the double shrimp and crab skillet. By the way the crab is not doubled in this plate and was equivalent to one crab leg cluster. The double shrimp was probably about twenty shrimps. Again, it was excellent but only appropriate for one really unless you have a small appetite. The seafood pasta was the size of a medium appetizer soup but contained a good portion of seafood. Overall, great atmosphere though it was very busy. Definitely suggest a reservation though we walked in and waited an hour. Great place overall with great food and great staff!!
author: Eddie M.

description: When we have family and friends that come into town and want to do Tourist stuff this place is a must-do when they want to eat near the Fisherman's Wharf.  Crab Chowder is pretty good!  Last couple times we've been here it's come out lukewarm though.  Crab Enchiladas, Crab Omelet, Crab Feast, Crab & Filet are some of the things we've ordered and have been happy with.  They validate parking for the garage across the street from Pier 39 too.
author: Evan G.

description:
This place is very touristy and full of typical harbor novelties. I usually try to steer clear from any tourist joints unless I'm one of them.

But Crab House is different. It's delicious.

Definitely more on the expensive side, but that's what you get for fantastic seafood. 

I must admit a group of friends and I came her after an evening of sailing and drinking beers. It was a perfect place to end the night.

Most of us ordered the crab legs, but I tried one of their crab pasta dishes and it was creamy and delicious. Not sure if I'll go back anytime soon since I do not frequent fisherman's wharf, but it is definitely worth it. Don't forget to order the crab chowder, it is amazing.
author: Katie S.

description: Best crabs I have ever had! I wouldn't bother with the sides and appetizers though. They are too pricey and aren't anything special in my opinion. The crabs are where it's at. They have a special garlic seasoning/sauce they put on the crabs, which make them so tasty! It gets pretty popping in the evening since it's in a very touristy area, so I recommend making a reservation.
author: Tina A.

description: Maybe I was naive, but I expected more. The dining room is quaint, and the food is good, but for the price, I really expected a higher quality. The crab was amazing, but the sides didn't seem to match. The scallops and shrimp were about what you could get anywhere, and the only reasonable side was garlic fries... again, I can find that anywhere. Our bill was $230 for four of us, and I really feel like we could have done significantly better.
author: Pete S.

description:
A restaurant right on Pier 39 with a breathtaking view of the water the bridges? You would think it is a tourist trap. But it turned out the food and service were excellent. Our favorite dishes were the killer crab (garlicky butter roasted crab served on a hot grill at your table), steamed clams with wine butter sauce (the clams were fresh, meaty and super sweet), and I loved the melt-in-mouth crab cakes! I was in crab paradise.

After our tasty lunch, we walked around the pier. Ahhhh, it's like being a tourist in my own city and it is soooo much fun.
author: L S.

description:
Crab House at Pier 39 is a tourist magnet!  I don't think anyone there was a local.  After waiting 1 1/2 hours for a table for two we got a chance to order some food.  Good thing Pier 39 has lots to look at during the wait.

The front reception desk staff was very friendly.  Our waiter on the other hand was not that friendly.  Felt like we got the one bad waiter in the bunch.  But who cares I'm here for the food!

We ordered the Tureen of Clams, Crab Cioppino, and a few pounds of Dungeness Crab.  All the food came out steamy hot (which is nice) but overall the food was mediocre.  Clams were boiled in a weak tasting broth of celery and leeks.  The cioppino was lacking some good wine.  Tasted like tomato sauce.  The crab was alright.  They steamed and then flash fried just like Joes Crab Shack.  Blah!  Nuff said...

We left feeling full but a bit unsatified.  But what do you expect from a tourist restaurant?  I think the basic steamed dungeness crabs at the near by smaller outdoor restaurants are better and at half the price.

"Went in for crab...left feeling crabby.  Asi Asi."
author: Junho S.

description:
Here's the story of why I give the food two stars.

The day I came back home from New York, my family took a trip to Half Moon Bay and purchased two crabs for $20 as a celebration of my homecoming. (Or so they say.) As I walked in the door towing my luggage behind me, I smelled the aroma of food wafting from the kitchen. Soon enough, my parents, aunts, and uncles started plating the table with dishes including the two crabs that were pink, steaming, and ready to be torn apart. Those crabs, my friends, were the best crabs I've eaten in a while. Not even salt was added; only a handful of minced ginger and green onions. The meat was fat, juicy, and sweet that slipped right out of its shell once prompted with a fork.

Not the case with the Killer Crabs here. Well, to be fair, it's not horrible...but it's not CRAB either. In other words, you don't taste crab. There's none of that original, natural sweetness of fresh crab meat that crab lovers (and picky foodies) would love. The little guys are pretty much doused and DEEP FRIED (*cringe*) in so much butter, garlic, and salt that the only thing you really taste is butter, garlic, and salt. Tis a shame. (Oh, and there's a video of what's in the "secret garlic sauce" on their website. I have to say that after watching it, I was expecting the taste to hold more...personality. But it still just tastes like butter, garlic and salt.)

Oh, and don't get their mussels because they're not good for your money. (Again, my family's kitchen can make a better batch.) They were overcooked and tasted pretty much like the crabs. Butter, garlic, and salt.

Oh, but their garlic fries were pretty good! Tasted exactly like how garlic fries should taste: butter, garlic, and salt!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
The seafood was so fresh and delicious, I wish I could have ate more! 

Killer crab: it was definitely KILLER! The leg meat came out in HUGE chunks that were so fresh and juicy. The crab just melts in your mouth.

Shrimp: came out on a hot sizzling platter and kept the shrimp warm throughout the entire meal. SO GOOD!

Tiramisu: just delcious. So soft and gooey and just ended the meal perfectly when paired with a hot cup of capuccino. 

Overall, I had a great experience and would recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting the warf. Also, the restaurant had a nice view of the water too.
author: Rachel L.

description: The best Crab Cakes and Crab Chowder ever! Expensive (but so is everything in SF) but totally worth it!
author: Grant H.

description: This place was recommended before going on my Alcatraz tour and the Crab they serve here is one of the best I've ever had. The shrimp and the garlic sauce was just right. Now the calamari  I had higher expectations , but the service made up for it the waitress that helped us was so nice!!!
author: Miguel G.

description: Yes, it's a tourist trap, but it's a well oiled, high quality tourist trap.  It's not cheap but if it's dungeness crab you're after you've come to the right place.  The waiters know what they're doing, the food comes out fast, and the crab lives up to the billing.  I've had the filet mignon and crab surf and turf here too and I would say that unless you must have red meat, stick with the crab.  They have a little bar area with a nice little fireplace where you can eat if you're solo.
author: Dave L.

description:
This place is not worth the hype. Coming from a grab-eater who grew up eating super fresh killer grabs pretty much every week here. The grabs here are not that fresh and they are WAY too salty. You know why? Because the salt is there to cover up the lack of freshness, to make non-crab eaters unable to tell. 

It's also way overpriced. You should come to Pier 39 and check out the other seafood places around here. I didn't realize there were that many all in the same square and thought that this was the only one here. 

It's also misleadingly priced. You're much better off ordering an entire grab/or prix fix even if you're someone who doesn't eat much. When they say 1/2 crab, what they really mean is 5 pieces of heavily salted crab legs, which you can easily get at a buffet for less than $25. Really, this place is a total joke. Their publicity people game Google so that this is the first thing you see when you google crab and san francisco. The only people who eat grabs here are the tourists as a result. The locals know not to go here.  

But honestly, there are so many great seafood places at Pier 39 and along the walk from the Ferry Plaza to here, that you should save your money and tastebuds.
author: salome S.

description:
I was excited to get back since I love crab!

I was eagerly awaiting the crab as it was ordered. First thing: it came pretty slowly. I remember it was packed the last time we came. But this time, we went on a weekday and there were many empty seats. So surely the food should come out fast? But it prolly is cooked to order which is a plus.

The crab finally came and the aromas filled the room! I dived right in.

My first bite was very oily and way under seasoned! I remember how richly flavored it was last time, but this time around it was really bland.

It got me thinking of asian style crab and lobster and how flavorful it is. The traditional Chinese ginger sauce is so savory. I found myself craving that instead of the crab before me.

Verdict: I was extremely disappointed this time around. Was it just a fluke? I dunno. But this experience let me down so much, the next time I'm in SF, I might pass on crab house.

I'm torn between a 2 or 3 star rating..My first experience was definitely a solid 4, but this time around is a weak 2. I guess for now, Crab House...you are a 3.
author: Sam Y.

description: A local recommended this place as one of the best at Pier 39.  We were not disappointed.  Excellent seafood, views, and friendly staff.  A bit more pricey than most seafood joints but not too much and this is in a high tourist area.
author: John F.

description:
I'm keeping this short and sweet since I'm about to pig out for a late lunch. 

It's Fisherman's Wharf, so its bound to be pricey around here. Good drinks, straightforward service and delicious good quality crab served right here. It's not just crab here either, they also serve oysters and mussels lathered in bubbling butter. Not bad looking, just a bit too much for me. If I go to a place that specializes only in crab, I'll go there.
author: Jason C. J.

description:
Came in on a Saturday night around 6:45pm and was seated right away without a reservation (We noticed around 7:15pm lines were starting to form of people waiting to be seated). The service was great. Our waiter was knowledgeable about the menu and had great recommendations. 

My boyfriend and I shared their "killer crab" and calamari. The calamari was delicious. The crab was to die for. We almost ordered the Lobster Thermador but when we saw how much they emphasized their crab and considered the name of the restaurant we went with the "killer crab". 

Coming to the Crab House was a great way to start our evening. We don't ever visit pier 39 since we're from San Francisco and have done the tourist thing before but this place is a necessity. I'll put the Crab House on the list of great date night restaurants!
author: Kate J.

description:
Seriously delicious. 
It's been about 3 or 4 years since I've been here, because I've moved, but the moment I can go back to SF, I am going to this restaurant. 
My mother and I used to go here so often that we would have our own table by the window. 
My mom was in love with the bread they give you and she'd always have steamed clams. 
I would always eat the crab. I'm fairly little, but I'd usually eat the whole crab. So good! The caesar salad is also very good! 
Any of the desserts I had were good too, although this one dessert which was like a cheesecake of some sort with little red berries on top, that was the bomb! 
I definitely recommend this place!
author: Ali g.

description: Some of the best crab I've had! We ordered the crab for two and it was way more than enough! It comes with this garlicky butter that just made it so delish! We also ordered the garlic fries which were also super yummy. Service was fast & our waitress was great! My only complaint is that after I was so impressed with their food I went to the manager to tell him how happy I was and he really could care less. He said ok and walked away! Totally blew me off.
author: Suzette P.

description: Crabs are delicious.  I know this place is pretty touristy, but it is still the first place I would like to go in the crab season.
author: Ying Z.

description: Hands down one of my favorite places to eat. The crab enchiladas are absolutely amazing. You must try the iron skillet combo with the crab, mussels and shrimp. You will love it.  Love this place
author: Paola S.

description: First time eating here and have to say the food was fantastic. Came here with my mother and step father for dinner since we never got a chance to eat here until now. I ordered a crab Alfredo which the Alfredo sauce was delicious and appetizer was mussles and crab. Crab was a bit messy but it was great. If you ever come here to pier 39 and looking for good crab to eat then this place is perfect.
author: Brandon P.

description: My parents and I had great time. Very tasty and worth your money. The price of crab is similar to other restaurants nearby. Service was bit slow but it was a full house. We will go back again!!!
author: Emily L.

description: The crab house is the perfect place for garlic crab in SF. Enjoyed the food,  ok service, but overall it was an amazing
author: Amber R.

description:
This is the one restaurant that we always visit whenever we are in the SF area.  Yes, it's THAT good.

Best value:  crab cioppino or the zuppa di pesce.  They're both stews but there's lot of crab/seafood in them.  Super yummy when you dip it with the bread.  We only started ordering these when one of my friends saw the crab cioppino featured on the Food Network.  We didn't know what we were missing!

Crab chowder and the crab angel hair lasagna are both excellent too, although they're a bit heavy.
author: Betty S.

description: It took about 15-20 mins to be seated. I had lotsa crab, the herbs used to cook it is able to bring the freshness of the crab. I even apply some of it on the bread, it just tastes so good. However, they fried it prior to final cook. Some parts of crab are over-fried. Hmm, that's why 1 star is being deducted here.
author: George W.

description:
Yes, it is a touristy spot on pier 39, but it's actually good. I went last Sunday and ordered the too two crab for 3 of us with some garlic fries. The crab isn't that big, but the garlic sauce is really tasty. It's a nice view of the bay and golden gate bridge, if it's clear, as well. 

Service was very good and attentive.

I'll be back
author: Ahmed H.

description:
A divine location to enjoy a summer rendezvou. I loved it!! My boyfriend and I walked in without reservations and were greeted by the pleasant staff. We requested a window seat...No problem! The waitress was very helpful and knowledgeable about the menu. We ordered the Seafood skillet to start with that came loaded with clams, crab legs and shrimp. 
For dinner we had Lobster Thermidor and filet mignon...The food was delicious! I thought I new what good seafood was but after eating here I found that my expectations were below par.
author: Carolina H.

description: uhh.... WHY ARE THERE 5 STAR REVIEWS... This place makes the best Garlic greeease crab jerky.... like you can feel the grease overtaking your arteries...yuck...No flavor, the crab was dry and jerky-ish... what the heck... SF cccrab...NOOOOO!!!! I regret having to finish the $100 crab feast, should have eaten at the stalls over at the wharf. Oh but there was the chowder....mmmmmmmm.....NOT!!!!... it was like steamed veggies and guck, drizzled with clumpy, separated cream... there was no chowder...all the ingredients kinda parted ways in your mouth. It was weird. DON'T ORDER IT. Though the service was awesome and the Caesar salad and garlic fries were yummy. I would go there for the view and the fries, but you can get garlic fries practically anywhere...This place was disappointing. Never let hunger blind your judgment.
author: guppeee p.

description:
I planned a reception dinner for 12 here after my wedding. The staff was very accommodating. They even gave me the OK for us to bring our own cake. I made the reservation a week or two in advance with a credit card. Our table had a great view of the boats and the bridge. My friends loved it. 

As for the food, I trusted Yelpers that this place would come through, and it did. Part of why I picked Crab House was because the menu, although not large, was diverse. I wanted everyone to find something they liked, and we all did. Between my group we ordered crab; crab lasagna; a vegetarian pasta dish; fish and chips; shrimp and chips; a fish sandwich; and a burger. Everyone was satisfied with their choices. For appetizers, we had the garlic fries and the fondue. Both were uniquely awesome. 

I am taking one star off because of the bathroom and the drinks. I was really excited about checking out the mojito bar, but wasn't a great fan when I tasted my drink. In fact, I didn't finish it. The bathroom had one narrow stall; it wasn't equipped for disabled persons. I am ambulatory but I have spent a lot of time working with special needs people, and found myself wondering how anyone needing assistance toileting would manage in that restroom. 

The Verdict: The staff was good -- not overly friendly, but attentive and efficient. Still, If this were strictly a food rating, I'd give Crab House Five Stars for excellence. I'd love to go back. Just skip the mojito!
author: Cara S.

description: The crab was really good but the service was horrible we had a European man as our waiter. We were there about 2 hours and he never stopped by our table after the first time and it was not as though he was too busy. When we asked about certain items he was very monotone and a little attitude came with it. The server whom came and was helping other tables near by was so enthusiastic and helpful, he even had to get our waiter so we could get our check after waiting with nothing on our table for over 20 min.
author: Sierra F.

description:
Crab chowder was great.  Killer crab was good but expensive.  May or may not go back because of pricing. 

Wait staff very friendly and helpful.  I noticed they were helping a lot of inexperience crab patrons.

My main criticism is due to pricing.  $25 for 1/2 an order of crab=1/2 a crab?!  Their killer crab can be reproduced at home quite easily and for a fraction of the price.  I've been told that there are other crab places that don't price so high, but out of the Fisherman's Wharf area. 

Worth the experience nonetheless.  It was a fun date night considering the Christmas tree lighting as well.
author: Sherryl P.

description: Absolutely loved this place!!  If your a huge fan of crabs then you'll feel like you've just died and reached crab heaven!!  Sweet and succulent, cooked to perfection!  warning though pretty pricey but that's the price you pay for seafood typically.  Would definitely go here again on my next Sf trip
author: Aloha A.

description: Happy Thanksgiving to everyone @ the Crab House. Me and the family decided to switch things up for thanksgiving this year. What can I say! We sure made the right choice by choosing the Crab House @ Pier 39 in my hometown. We will definitely be returning to the Crab House in the near future. 5 starts and highly recommended to all friends and family!!!!
author: The Truth V.

description:
I really like it here. Good food that is arguably worth the price, but hey, it's Pier 39, baby.
Whether it's crab chowder to go (love the stuff and the personal baguette), or dine-in, I've always left full and satisfied.
Good appetizers and good everything. Well-paced service and always upbeat and informative. I also love the view.
You never get bored here too, because there are decorated crabs that line the wall (an ADD kid's wonderland). AND IT'S CLEAN! Can't appreciate that enough. All these run-down and overpriced Pier 39 "experiences" and hustle and bustle of tourists make me hesitant to return. But when I find myself walking the Pier, Crab House is my go-to place.
author: Katrina D.

description: Stopped by here during a visit to Pier 39 and had the iron skillet roasted double mussels double crab combo - Absolutely delicious, well seasoned, super filling lunch for 2.  This place was exactly the type of lunch we needed after walking the pier during the morning. Service was a-ok as well. Absolutely would stop by again for the crab legs on a future visit.
author: Tatyana K.

description:
I hear the crab is really tasty; it looks good and smells great.

The trout dish is great.

bruschetta is good.
author: b s.

description: We came for Thanksgiving dinner.  Made reservations and got a great table overlooking the pier.  Our server was lovely and very accommodating.  We ordered their specialty, the roasted crab, and we were not impressed.  The crab seemed to have been recooked and not fresh.  It was also dry and not tasty.  We also had the clam chowder and fish and chips, both were better than the crab.
author: Shawn T.

description: Amazing crab cakes and legs and crab chowder is sooo good!! The bread they serve is to die for and great fries!
author: Ro L.

description: My husband and I sat at the bar and had an amazing time. The bartender was great, believe his name was Vicente. The crab was absolutely delicious!! We ordered the crab and shrimp skillet and the Cesar salad, we were no disappointed! You have to try this place if you're in the area.
author: Cristina B.

description:
I am a huge fan of this place because of their GARLIC FRIES(it is the best fries I have ever taste in my life). The fries is lightly batter and fry to perfection with fresh minced garlic. Dungeons Crab are wonderful and the Crab Chowder is a great way to start a day or end a day.  

I am very impress with the service here, our server was very professional and have a great knowledge of all the items on the menu. There was never a crumb on my table and my boyfriend's water was always fill, I cannot ask for a better experience.
author: Tiila N.

description: When I come to Pier 39, which is not often as I am a local, I often stop at Crab House. It's the best place for a nice lunch, what with the gorgeous bay view and excellent food. I've been to a few places on the pier and most are way over-priced average food but Crab House is quite different. I will gladly pay $100 for lunch for two here, which is what you should expect when you order a couple of drinks, entrees, and an appetizer. The crab chowder is a must! The corn, potatoes and hefty chunks of crab meld so perfectly together. The garlic fries are solid. I love bloody Mary's and oysters so the bloody Mary oyster shooter is always a must. And don't worry, you're in Pier 39 so people will just think you're on vacation and not judge you for slamming shots at lunchtime ;-)
author: Chi N.

description: It's been awhile since I've been here but I haven't forgot how good it was. You have to have crab at the crab house. We had several crab dishes and all were melt in your mouth good. We had the crab cakes, crab louie salad and crab chowder.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
This is my first time not agreeing with majority of the reviewers here: the food here is just horrible.

We ordered crab alfredo, crab chowder and shrimp and mussel pasta. The alfredo was made horribly: the noodles were not cooked well and the sauce was just bad. At first i wondered where the crab in the alfredo was, only to realize it was too small to be noticed. The crab chowder was very mediocre. shrimp and mussel pasta was ok but i have had better elsewhere. In fact, i could probably cook the entire meal i ordered better than what i was served today. 

The server also mixed up on our order. 

I also should note that the cutlery here did not look very clean.
author: J P.

description: Ate here last night only 45 min wait to be seated not bad went with my lady and had the double shrimp and double crab with calamari and some garlic bread and it was off the chain pricey as expected but well worth it awesome place to have a nice pricey meal with a view.
author: Abel G.

description:
I'm not really one for tourist restaurants, but it was cold, we were hungry, and Crab House was open.

Let me start with this: For a tourist restaurant, the prices are very reasonable.  I got an enormous bowl of crab chowder for $10 (same as I might pay back home for clam chowder).  I liked the decor, it was cute.  Our giant mugs of beer were pretty cheap, too.
author: Jillian Y.

description: My parents from China really enjoy that place. Love this!!! And that is not extremely American Style..That is awesome!!
author: Kaichang S.

description: Visiting San Francisco and stumbled upon this place.  We were in tennis shoes.  Great atmosphere, food, and service.  They are known for their crab (hence the name), and I loved their crab pasta.
author: Anu S.

description:
We were starving when we got into San Fran and decided to try this place as we were craving seafood.  We started off with the crab house ale which was excellent...great bodied ale and not too hoppy.  We shared the iron skillet mussels and shrimp.  The mussels had this great wine sauce that was just delicious.  The shrimp were seared and came with clarified butter...scrumptious.  

We shared the killer crab for two which was just delicious.  Succulent crab in a great galic butter sauce.  I would say that we probably ordered too much food with the appetizer...I would may share the crab for one with the medium mussels and shrimp app, but make sure you get it.  It's not worth missing.  

Our waiter was super helpful and told us some great recommendations for Napa!
author: Lindsey W.

description: This place is famous for its garlic roasted crab. $40 for one crab is a little pricey, but it's probably the best out of all the various crab and seafood choices at Fisherman's Wharf. The seafood platter/combo with mussels, shrimp and crab is also very good. It's served with a sizzling platter with lemon butter and is also quite tasty. Despite the slightly pricier menu, Crab House is well worth its asking price. The street fare is nothing to brag home about and you definitely get what you pay for. There's no comparison when it comes to seafood from a street cart vendor versus a bigger restaurant like Crab House. It's situated right inside of Pier 39 and on the upper floor. The service is fantastic and explains all the menu and portions thoroughly. We will definitely come back whenever we visit Fisherman's Wharf again.
author: Louie T.

description: I don't know how this place would get a 3.5 stars because honestly, I can get better food in terms of quality and quantity elsewhere than here.  We ordered half a crab, a bread bowl of crab chowder, crab cakes, and garlic noodle with crab meat.  The bill came out to be $101.25!  This is including the extra government mandate tax for eating in SF and the regular tax for the food.  The quantity was ridiculously small that we were still hungry afterward.  The crab was small and the garlic sauce was salty and probably will die for if you eat too much of it.  Bread was not warm but hard and cold.  The view was ok but we didn't really get window seat.  I would not choose this place to eat if you're hungry.  But if you feel like donating some money, then go ahead and eat there.  I rarely write reviews, but it's so bad that I feel that I need to inform others.  In addition, the waiters look so bored most of the time (we ate at 3pm) and they can't wait to keep cleaning up our dirty dishes right away.  I mean, come on, give us some time to enjoy the dirty dishes for a little bit!  If you are looking to eat crabs, I suggest elsewhere for better quality, price, and quantity.  This place is hijacking your wallet.
author: Anne C.

description: Took my nieces out for a late lunch at the Crabhouse at Pier 39. We were 6 adults plus 1 kid. Total bill $235 (no liquor bought) included was a mandatory tip for groups of 6 or more. I was happy they were open when we arrived at 2:45 pm. We got a window table with a partial view of the water. We all liked the food, the variety and taste. The service was alright, they were attentive to clearing plates and refilling drinks. They took care of my parking stub right off the bat too. Thanks! Overall a good experience will recommend to friends who has a decent size wallet.
author: M P.

description: Delicious crab! Perfect flavor and sweet! I could do without the shrimp, chowder and mussels. Nothing special. I would definitely be back for more crab!
author: Van H.

description:
The first thing that caught my eye was the new look of the restaurant. I've been here many times and was always under impression that it was too dark inside. Now with the walls repainted in marble-white, the whole setting looks more pleasant and inviting. And don't forget about the views! My table was right by the window, overlooking the Blue and Gold Fleet boats.
Oyster shooter worked magically to awake my appetite. First I've ordered bruschetta and fried artichokes and both were great. Bruschetta, in fact, with juicy ripe tomatoes and fresh basil complimented by a dash of garlic and olive oil was the best I've had! 
 I knew that Crab House restaurant is famous for the roasted garlic Dungeness crab, but on a lazy and sunny Friday afternoon I couldn't force myself to do the cracking. So I got myself a crab enchilada and a side of garlic fries. Garlic Enchilada was the star of the show! I was impressed by the freshness of the crab meat rolled into soft tortillas. Chili-tomato puree on top had just perfect amount of heat.   
Service was very polite and accommodating. It was very busy on Friday lunch and everybody was willing to help each other. I was a bit in rush myself, but my waiter, Chris, ensured that everything - cocktails, food and a check - would come out promptly.               
Although I live in San Francisco, sometimes I like to go to Fisherman's Wharf to feel myself as a tourist. After this visit, Crab House made the list of my top food spots to visit.
author: Vasil A.

description: Made an 8PM reservation since this place was booked on Open Table, but arrived and found the restaurant to be almost empty. This was disappointing since I would have preferred to have dinner earlier. Got the double mussels and double crab and was surprised to find that I enjoyed the mussels more than the crab (usually a crab lover)! Did not enjoy the garlic noodles or the chowder as both were very bland. Overall, PPQ is still my #1 for crab!
author: Juliana C.

description:
Here at Pier 39 is a very cute and fun area for eats and shopping, which is a lot nicer than the actual Fisherman's Wharf...and yes I did say cute, get over it. 

I love the atmosphere of this place, you can wear jeans and a T-shirt or dress up stuff and you'll fit right in. The place is filled with aroma. We ordered the garlic fries as an app. This probably wasn't fair since we are from Seattle and have dined on the garlic fries at Safeco Field. The fries were pretty good, they use fresh garlic as opposed to pre-cut cut garlic. 

I ordered the scallops with pearled couscous & my wife ordered the medium size mussels. The mussels would've fed a few people and that was only the medium size. My scallops were perfectly good and the flavors in my couscous were amazing. 

All the food we had tasted at its highest caliber of freshness. Wish I could be there right now for the lobster and fillet Mignon...
author: Mikal W.

description:
So...

My friend chose this place after yelping for Cioppino. We have yet to find the best Cioppino. I had the best  cioppino memory from Marin County and I can't remember the name of the place. I'm still chasing a memory!

Oh Mah Gawd! I must've been to Pier 39 so many times with visiting relatives or friends and never knew about this place. How can this be!!! 

It was great! We did wait about 40min tonight (Sat) bec/ we didn't make a reservation but WAS it worth the wait! We just spent some time in the souvenir shop across the way and also scored some seats at the bar and enjoyed a very refreshing pineapple mojito. They have other flavors too. 

It's on the second floor and if you park at the Pier parking lot and cross the walkway on the 3rd floor of the parking building it'll connect to the 2nd floor of the Pier just right to the Crab House! Oh any they validate for 2hrs if you leave the lot after 6pm.

After we were seated, we (the two of us) ordered the following to share:
- steamed clams (small order) with garlic/wine broth
- crab cioppino with the shell already REMOVED!!!! This is key! Like no more working with hot crab shell in broth flying all over the place, it is pure heaven to go straight to nice large bits of crab meat!!! 
- one roasted crab

Let me just say, for 2 gals who usually gab a lot... this was the most silent dinner we ever ate! Meaning... we were so absorbed by the meal and gleaning every tasty morsel of crab from the legs that there was no room for talking! Ha! 

Service was fabulous - they help you put on your protective bib at the start of the meal and even open the moist towelettes for you after the carnage is over. 

Definitely will be back! Thanks again to my fellow yelpers!
author: Kuishingal F.

description:
Dungenness crabs with the right amount of house garlic sauce=Win.  Crazy view of the bay with fantastic garlic fries=Double Win.  
$100 gone and still not full=Lose.
author: Jang David K.

description: Ok so me and the girlfriend decided to try the infamous crab at this quaint restaurant on Pier 39. The waiter, Lewis (Joe Pesci voice & pony tail) kept us waiting for a long time because he was engaging in small talk with other patrons. When it came time to take our order he was antsy and I we felt rushed. On top of that he wasn't helpful in suggestions for what to order being that it was our first time. When he brought out the food it took a long time. We were famished!  He didn't even bring us the hot butter dip for the crab. Crab was good but the experience was lousy.  I had to complain to the manager about the service. Long story short we didn't bother leaving any tip. Good service dictates a good tip!
author: Scott N.

description: Great crab. Food is expensive but good. The service was also good. Great atmosphere and views remind me I'm on vacation. We got the lotsa crab and garlic fries and really enjoyed the meal, just beware you pay for the location, about $100 for 3 people.
author: Steve W.

description: My 4th time here and have enjoyed it every time. Everyone must try the crab chowder, omg! The garlic butter secret sauce is SO f'n good :) Dip your sourdough bread in it too!
author: Amy T.

description:
Good food, good service. It's definitely a touristy spot which means it isn't pretentious at all but also that you'll hear explanations of seafood items/techniques/terms at many of the tables around you. 

Baked crab and angel hair pasta was a memorable dish and the crab cioppino did not disappoint.
author: Michael M.

description: This was my second time at the Crab House. It's a little hokey as its nestled in tourism central at Pier 39. However, if you like good crab and aren't looking for amazing atmosphere then this is a good place. The wait staff is always very helpful and attentive. The place could use a thorough spring cleaning in the details (windows, etc) but it's a decent establishment. Would reco for crab, but if you're just looking for good seafood head a few doors down to Fog Harbor Fish House.
author: Kristen G.

description:
One of my favorite places to dine on pier 39. 

The crab is great, the steak with the lobster tail is the best, the alfredo is good as well. Never a dissapointment. 

I always want to come in when were are at the pier, but my wallet (especially my bf's) doesn't always want to. 

Definetly one of the best on the pier.
author: Jeanette P.

description: Can you say Crabcakes and moan at the same time????!!  This is house delich it was....The Crab sandwich was so fresh I think it crawled into the bread itself.  With a great view and fresh seafood, it was the perfect place to stop and grab a bite to eat for lunch.
author: Rhonda G.

description: The food was very good.  It seemed kind of expensive for what you could get.  Service was great though!  Sit with the windows open or by the sea for a great view!
author: Jack J.

description:
Took my friend here for dinner. The server sat us away from the window tables even though we're a party of a male and a female, not a very smart move. 

Got the crab chowder, doesnt taste anything special, almost tastes like progresso to me. 

I got the seafood stew. Tastes like pasta sauce with different kinds of seafood mixed in, which i can defintely make at home.

tried my friend's crab, it was mediocre. 

bill was 88 dollars. You tell me if its a good experience or not.
author: James M.

description:
Sure, they've got the location which is a smashin' good spot on Pier 39, but that's about it.  Their food is just "A-OK."  First of all, one my my comrades who's been here before noted that the crab wasn't as good when we went (mid June) compared to another time earlier in the year.  This might have had to do with the fact that crab season is in the winter time (November/December) so they've had to save the crab for a long time or maybe imported it from Oregon or Washington.  Not so sure but that might have explained why the crab wasn't top notch.

I didn't have the dungeness crab (I usually don't order crab because I catch it in Oregon during the summertime), but instead opted to have the hawaiian sunfish fillet.  It was labeled as a house specialty but wasn't as good as I would have hoped.  The fillet was very thin and Crab House has got to be careful because people might get it confused with a baby hawaiian sunfish.  But granted, a hawaiian sunfish is probably different than a mola mola (2200 lb average weight) so I'll try to give them the benefit of the doubt.   Maybe another try will yield different results but I am surprised at their lack of fish entree varieties for a seafood restaurant (even though they're called Crab House, not Fish House).
author: Albie F.

description:
5 stars goes to the service at this restaurant and 4 stars goes toward the food despite the hostess. I'm going to totally bypass her for this rating. Because a good restaurant should not be at fault for poor hostesses. 

So I wanted crabs and walking through Pier 39... you could smell the crabs boiling and cooking up a storm here and my stomach refuses to be neglected for another second. So I had to stop by. The wait was about 20-25 min. - I think the hostess needs to be replaced or biatch slapped because she didn't do a good job of letting people know their table is ready. We had to come up and bullied her... let's just say ... I AM NOT NICE WHEN I"M HUNGRY. It's not me, it's my stomach.

We finally sat down and the waiter, a very clean cut guy came up to take our order immediately. I like the idea of having an ice cold pitcher of water ready to consume so that was much brownie points in my book. We ordered the crab chowder, apparently that seems to be notoriously famous and it did not lie. It was very good. Also had the garlic bread.. although I was a bit confused by the grated parmesean over it, I didn't think about it until afterwards... It was pretty damn good.

Then comes my whole roasted crab in their special garlic sauce. YES, i ordered a whole crab to myself. It was divine. I felt like i could be swimming in that garlic sauce. It was really easy to crack the crab so I wasn't breaking anything and popping people's eyes out. The meat was really juicy and tender. I was disappointed about the crab shell however. Usually, there would be some yummy delicacy on the shell itself... but it was not there! I think baking the crab has completely shrank it or they cleaned out the entire shell before cooking. Oh well

I've eaten my fair share of crabs and although this place was very good, but I would have to say that I've had better crabs.
author: Karly G.

description:
This place took crab to a whole new level. Literally. The big ole four pounder sat eye to eye with me sitting low in the booth...but with bib strung around my neck, fork in one hand, and crackers in the other, I was ready to conquer. I clearly underestimated the quantity of seafood that came out. I failed to take into account Mr. Crab's numerous minions--over twenty mussels littering the rest of the enormous iron griddle pan.

Despite the mini cups of their special garlic butter sauce, my boyfriend and I still had leftovers. The stuff was sooo good, conversation was kept to a minimum as we gorged ourselves on crab, mussels, and bread dipped into their sauce. The cooking method rendered the shell of the crab easy to crack with my teeth and the balsamic vinagrette poured over the mussels on the sizzling griddle added that extra oomph.

Service was also impeccable. Several white jacketed waiters waltzed around the restaurant, keeping an eye on tables and indicating to others when to remove the discard bowls, pour water, get more napkins, etcetera. It was awesome. Even more awesome to see all kinds of people getting down and dirty with their seafood. 

Finger licking is highly recommended here!!!
author: Jan P.

description:
Cozy restaurant based off first impressions.  Crab House is definitely a touristy spot, but what do you expect at Pier 39?!  

We ordered the following items:
Bruschetta
Chowder
Whole Crab
3 Beers

The food was good, but I wasn't that impressed.  Their famous killer crab was definitely very tasty and satisfying though.  The staff was extremely friendly, but the overall experience was just so-so.  The only great thing from the evening was the company I was with.
author: Carmen Y.

description:
We ate here last night, after a whirlwind Fleet Week weekend.  My husband and I treated my sister who is visiting from Washington D.C.  What a meal we had !!

Started with drinks...my pina colada was delish.  

I wanted a taste of the crab chowder and our waiter (Carlos) brought a complimentary bowl for us to share.  IT WAS DELICIOUS.  It put to shame the clam chowder we'd had the night before at Alioto's at Fisherman's Wharf.  This crab chowder had body, flavor and most of all, CRAB in it.  

Then we had the appetizer shrimp and mussels.  Both delicious.  

Then our garlic bread, garlic noodles and crab feast arrived !  Amazing !

We ended with a nicely brewed cup of Illy coffee.  

Carlos (waiter) and Martin (busboy) are a dynamic team and made every aspect of our meal a joy.  

A great meal !
author: Betty S.

description:
WOOHOO we just got CRAB WASTED!! My cousins were visiting me from Texas and of course after a LONG day of sightseeing we were HUNGRY!! I had never been here before, but I had heard some reviews. Man oh man was I so effin' happy that we picked this place. I would have hated to take my cousins somewhere that was just so-so. 
We were seated right away and our waiter was super friendly! We ordered the garlic fries, the whole crab, salmon, and the scallops. Everything I repeat everything was YUMMY!!! The fries were garlicky and delish!!! The salmon was cooked perfectly, and the scallops were buttery and tender!!! We tore up that crab!!!! We will definately be going back!!!
author: Dianna A.

description:
Terrific!  My husband's colleague recommended this restaurant for us since we are out of towner's.  My husband and I stopped here around 2:30-3ish for an early dinner.  We saw that the table had ordered the mussels and we knew we had to have them.  Tack on some crab and a couple of drinks and you've got heaven.  The buttery garlicky sauce was great, but really, the seafood here is so good, you don't even need to dip it in extra sauce.... even though we sure did.  

Wonderful place for a nice informal seafood dinner.  Next time in San Francisco, we'd go back!
author: Meg C.

description:
Food was okay but the worst customer service ever!  

First of all, there was a server who took the wrong order and when we politely asked for a correction, he actually complained to us because he said 'his boss' said something to him.  Afterwards he never came back to us for the duration of the meal, only when he brought our check.  FAIL!!
author: Elisa C.

description:
Service:  we were seated right away and attended to quickly.

Food:  The crab melt was delicious, especially the garlic fries.  I also had the crab chowder which was good, but not as creamy as Old Fishermans Grotto in Monterey.  The calamari was light and flavorful.

Value:  I was surprised, being on Pier 39 that the prices were not too expensive, plus we got our garage validated.

Atmosphere:  The restaurant was colorfully decorated and was clean.
author: Andrew W.

description: Killer crab was delicious (Get 3 lbs for 2 people - trust me). Not so crazy about the super-touristy vibe but that's to be expected anywhere on Pier 39. We enjoyed this place but will definitely look elsewhere next time we're in town.
author: Danielle P.

description:
Yes, it's touristy, but let's pretend it's not. The furniture is crappy and cheap looking. The painted crabs are really adorable. Definitely something needed in any touristy restaurant. 

But the food - the garlic fries aren't that garlicky, but they are way better than the ones at the ballpark. The fried artichoke app was very yummy. The crab wasn't so great. They didn't serve it with butter or anything, and it wasn't all that flavorful once we cracked it open. The crab for 2 really wasn't as much crab as I'm used to seeing in these kinds of places.

The mojito bar wasn't worth the space on the menu. It was a big tall glass with so much ice and soda in it that there was no mojito. Definitely no alcohol. Maybe they thought I was underage or something.
author: Monika M.

description: Crab House is fun restaurant with good food!  Maybe not the healthiest choice, but it is totally worth it! I love Crab Enchilada, Roasted Crab, Skillet Shrimp, Garlic and Melted Mozzarella Cheese, and Torta Della Nonna for dessert :)
author: Veronica C.

description: When I went to visit San Francisco this past January, my partner and I tried the crab at both Crab House and Alioto's. I would definitely choose Crab House over Alioto's any day. We ordered the roasted crab and the garlic fries. The roasted crab was sooo good! It was roasted in this garlic oil or butter sauce which gives it great flavor. Also, the crab itself was fresh and sweet and was full of meat. The garlic fries were amazing. It was very crunchy, even when it turned cold. I can't wait to go back.
author: May T.

description:
Late review:  I am from the LA area and came to SF to visit my little sister.  She took me here on 8/26 because of all the hype.  I really wanted to like this place, but I gave it a three star because of the following reasons:

Service:
Service started off okay.  Our waitress took a bit longer to greet us and take our drinks, maybe because she was busy, which I don't mind.  When she did come, she was very courteous.  It took a turn for the worse when they brought out the food.  The staff came from behind me and one staff member spilled the oil / butter sauce from the sizzling crab hot plate.  If anyone has eaten here, they know how hot it was.  Basically, my whole forearm was burned.  They spilled so much, you could see the puddle on the floor, which I should have taken a picture as proof.  I didn't even know who spilled it because I all heard was a sorry and he rushed off.  About maybe 5 minutes later, the waitress checked up on me and gave me a cold damp towel to ease the burn.  That was it, no further follow up.  I did, however, appreciate a particular staff member that offered burn cream.  At the time, I didn't think I needed it.  Nonetheless, I would've appreciated if 1) the Manager came to check up on me, 2) replace our crab plate, given all the juice is gone or 3) some kind of incentives to keep me as a customer, i.e. free drink, dessert, etc...  Nope none of that happened.  The next day, my whole forearm was pink/blistery.  Luckily, it went away with just a small scar and I'm not one of those that makes a big deal.

Food:
From what I recollect, we ordered the Lotsa Crab,  shrimp, clams and crab & shrimp Louie salad.  Crab: dry, probably because there were no juice left from the spill!  Shrimp and clams were dry and small, but I have to admit were tasty.  My favorite was the Louie salad.  It was delicious!!  

Overall, I would give this place 2 1/2 star just for the Louie salad, but I'll be nice.
author: Leanne H.

description:
I had one extra dinner before I had to meet my wife back at the Hotel.  While she eats crab, she won't go and hunt it down, so I figured I'd take advantage of my solo dinner and grab some crab.

The place was packed and I worried that I may have to wait like 45 minutes to eat.  I almost thought of looking for a different place to eat.  Boy am I glad I didn't!  I walked up to the front and asked the manager how long the wait would be for just me.  He turned around and asked if I minded sitting a little communal type table near the bar.  If I didn't mind, then he could seat me right now.  I was like hell yes, I'm down for no wait time.  The waiter came by and took my order.   Not sure if they have an assembly line back there in the kitchen, or if I got somebody else's order, but in less than 5 minutes, I had a wonderful, smoking hot crab right in front of me.  I also asked the server for an extra side order of the killer garlic sauce for dipping.  I mean, if I'm going down, I'm going down happy!  The crab was very fresh and so hot and so tasty.  And that sauce.  Oh, that sauce!  Wonderful sauce!  The meal was perfect.....fast friendly service, great food.....oh, almost perfect.  Seated next to the bar was a red neck guy and his family.  All I heard the entire time I was eating, was this fool telling his 9 year old to keep going up to the manager and asking how much longer before they got seated?!  Poor kid went up there at least 3 times to ask.  The dad thought it was funny.  What an idiot.  But, this review is not about morons, it's about crab, and Crab House does it well!
author: Brandon O.

description: We had the crab dinner it was great ,are server Katrina was sweet and gracious she made our lunch complete,better than here in Vegas,will be back and will recommend to all our friends,Crab House is a must,thank you for having great food and service.
author: Debbie T.

description: i've been here 3 times in the last 2 months. Always great service crab never disappoints. I didn't care for the garlic noodles Im a bit spoiled by Crustacean's. Its a bit pricey but soooo worth it. Can't wait going back in 3 weeks for my bday yay. (Im a huge crab addict).  I would recommend getting reservations through open table. the app or website make it oober easy to get a seat as soon as you get there. If you dont get a res you will wait and it may take a while depending on how busy they are. The earlier in the day the less busy. Get up right now and go....seriously!!!
author: Caroline C.

description: Impeccable service. Ask for Luis and you won't be disappointed in his service. He advised us well on what to order and even went so far as to run downstairs, just to see if a shop was open that we were curious about. Such a nice guy!!! The food was delish and came out in record speed. We ordered the "Too Two Crab," that easily served both of us girls. For dessert, we ordered the "Chocolate Truffle Mouse Cake." Garlic fries looked so good, but we didn't order them. Good thing we didn't, or we probably would have died from being so full. Great place to go for the experience. The bartender there was also excellent, even though it was his first day on the job. We ordered monitors (they have several flavors).
author: Angela Q.

description: For a tourist trap destination, I was pleasantly surprised by the food not only being good but the staff being friendly as well. The garlic bread was a little dry but the mussels, garlic fries, and seafood cioppino were delicious. It also wasn't overpriced, especially for seafood! I recommend this place to locals and tourists alike!
author: Z L.

description:
The perfect place for a romantic dinner!  I went here with my boyfriend for a special occasion and everything was perfect.  We had prior reservation and as we arrive they set up our table which overlooked the pier.  The service was fantastic and they were very open to helping us choose on our selection for the evening. 

We got garlic fries, calamari, and their signature dungeness crab with tiramisu at the end!  If you order the dungeness crab you really should ask the waiter to show you how to use the tools they give you.  It is really cool to see them do it!  Everything was flavorful and delicious and the atmosphere was fantastic it made everything perfect.  The only complaint I had was the tiramisu was a little off.  Other than that everything was tasty!

The decorations inside were very nice with crab nets and different crab shells painted all over.  It is low lit and has candles at the tables.  It was perfect for a romantic evening!

Go here for a special occasion and enjoy the moment
author: Barbara L.

description: Had the lotsa crab, mussel in wine and garlic noodle! I'm not really a mussel fan but this was very delicious! Crab was very good too, flavorful! As of the garlic noodle, flavor is there but the noodles was a little hard. The view was nice and the waitress there is super sweet n attentive! Delicious!!! Yumm!!!
author: Camille A.

description:
Our experience was among the worst in our lives.  I even signed up with Yelp just to comment on it.

We were seated across from folks who believed they should be the center of attention.  They were extremely loud and certainly had no table manners; two of them ate their steak with their hands.  About the only real vocabulary any of the three had was followed by the word, f**k.  

Obviously, the restaurant had to seat them.  Two groups of diners asked to be moved to other locations within the restaurant.  Our issue was that even though the waiter we had was very forgiving, we were unable to complete our meals because the front manager refused to ask these 'patrons' to leave.  We were able to eat about half of our two plates of fish and chips ~ $60.

Knowing full well of the type of language these folks were using didn't even stop the front manager from seating a large family with a small child right next to this group.  Shame on them!

On the way out, I stopped to give the front manager a piece of my mind. His response was that I had offended him!  Seriously.

In my opinion, to say this establishment is child friendly would be incorrect.  I can't honestly say it would be friendly to anyone based upon our experience.  Sure, everyone has a right to be welcomed into an eatery.  However, that right should end when diners become so disruptive as to cause others to ask to move away from them.  The response of the front end person was just plain inexcusable.  

We feel completely ripped off by this restaurant and trust me, we will never go back.
author: John B.

description:
We're constantly in the city, looking for new places to try.

Today, it was crab house. It's been a while since I've been on the pier, and boy was it crowded today. Even for a Monday afternoon, the cold and windy streets were paraded with tourists. Anyway, we walked parked near the bay aquarium was. Then proceeded towards crab house which is a little deeper in where all the shops and donut place is.

It wasn't that crowded, kinda dead actually when we got in. Picked a table by the window and were able to view some of the wildlife (seals and ducks...tourists on those tour boats). 

I started with a cup of crab chowder. It was pretty good, a bit overwhelming with LOTS of ingredients from potatoes, bacon, corn, crab and possible more. The chowder itself wasn't thick, but due to all the additives made it nice and chunky. They also had two mini baguettes to start with I guess. Olive oil and balsamic vinegar are set for you to use. I ordered the lobster therminador? to share with my mom. It was good at first bite, then got boring. It was lobster baked in a creamy cheesy herb sauce. It also came with couscous. We also ordered a whole crab, which was also meh. For $35, the crab was also very small. Being accustomed to asian styled seafood and crab has altered my tastebuds tremendously. 

Overall, it was nice to try something new, but the seafood here is mediocre at best.
author: Stine H.

description:
Have to admit, I didn't expect to taste quality crab at the pier.  But, each bite of crab had just the right amount of bounce!  The average size of the crabs served must have been 2.5 lbs or above.

Come here for the grey swirls on white marble décor, large group friendly (can seat 10 ppl+) seating, beautiful bay view, and delicious crab!

Greal meal for two: the Crab Melt (an open faced sandwich with at least a whole crab-body meat piled) complements quite nicely with the Crab Cioppino.  Be warned that the crab in the cioppino requires cracking; but a single bite of the crab meat soaked with the tangy caliente stew juice is worth all the hard work

Next go, will definitely have to try their iron skillet-roasted meals!!
author: Jen L.

description:
Crab overpriced and dry. Like the garlic butter that it was cooked in but couldn't get over how over cooked it was. If it wasn't overcooked I would probably give it 4 or 5 stars. But sadly, that wasn't the case.  

Caesar salad did not resemble a Caesar salad what-so-ever. Had no flavor. Had to add the balsamic vinegar at the table to give some flavor. 

The only thing that was truly enjoyable and the only reason it wasn't 1-star was because of the garlic fries which were excellent!
author: chris c.

description: Crab season recently started and now is a great time to have some seafood at the Crab House while enjoying some excellent views of the bay. Crab of course is their specialty but there are many other tasty dishes on the menu. They do know how to cook crab here, yum. Service is good once you get a table, place can get crowded. Meals are a bit pricey but the view and great food make up for it. Casual dining. You will most likely end up parking in a pay lot.
author: Ron W.

description:
Not sure what the fuss is about this place.
If what you want is cozy/quiet/romantics, turn away.

It's pretty crowded on weekends, you might have to wait 10-20min. We ordered Killer Dungeness Crab, Crab cakes, and crab soup. Yea, we did the whole crab.
It wasn't all that impressive, & soup wasn't even very hot, the way I like it.

I think crabs from outdoor places at Fisherman's Wharf taste better! At a lower price too!
author: Shelly J.

description:
I don't know what else to say-- this place is amazing! I always get the crab feast! Can't go wrong with that!

I was a little disappointed in the garlic fries-- but thats not what they're known for. 

Overall- great place, great service, and great crab!
author: Anthony V.

description:
Now amidst being stuck within the smog of tourist heaven, therein lies a wonderful collection of Dungenness crabs that will bring delight to your buds if not to your wallet.  Being that the weight of crabs being served includes the heavy shells and other portions of the crab one cannot eat, not much meat is to be had for the price paid.  $50 for Lotsa crab (3lbs.) is not really all that much.  Some are willing to pay the price, and because tourists are abound who know no better, the uptick is a shrewd business move.  

I, as a tourist from NYC, who prides himself as someone not fooled easily, especially when it comes to eating and paying the appropriate price when going out, hate hate hate getting ripped off at tourist joints.  I mean, I'm mofo'ing Elite baby!.  However, considering my options were limited, I had to go with the flow and order the expensive crabs and on top of that, I also got some Garlic Fries, which were mediocre.  Don't listen to the reviews who scream "These were the best garlic fries I've ever had!" because most likely it's probably the only garlic fries they've ever had.  My party also ordered the Mussells & Shrimp as an appetizer which was $20.  Once again, very delicious, but just not worth it.

Probably wouldn't come back again.  There's enough good food in S.F./S.J. to not have to come here.
author: Paul L.

description: Amazing cioppino!  It fits San Francisco like a great gumbo fits New Orleans.  If you've never been to San Francisco before, you have to try this local invention.
author: Chris S.

description:
GET THE CRAB! perhaps the BEST Dungeness Crab i've ever had.
i thinks its baked... it comes out on a skillet like a fajitas skillet would.
covered in their garlic (which was sweet and not overpowering) butter.
it was KICKASS!. only 4  stars b/c its kinda pricey, but its in a tourist trap and its seafood.. so.. i get it.

will
author: Matthew B.

description:
We don't get a lot of dungeness crab in Chicago so when I came to San Fran it was on our priority list. We made reservations and were seated almost immediately in a comfortable booth next to the pier. The view was great and gave our dinner experience a casual yet romantic feel. 

The food was delicious! We got our food almost immediately after we ordered. The garlic fries were popping with flavor and the dungeness crab was scrumptious. I recommend asking for a side of garlic butter to go with he dungeness crab. The service was friendly and attentive. Overall, it was a great and fulfilling experience.
author: Thania M.

description: The Crab was very good just a small note, there was a bit too much oil all over this dish. Have lots of wet napkins because your hands will be a mess.
author: Darryl J.

description:
Thank you Yelp members, once again for a great recommendation. Our actual rating is 4.5 and the only reason for the deduction is because the chowder just wasn't good. Of course we're spoiled by always having the opportunity to eat the best ever chowder at the Splash Cafe in Pismo Beach, California (highly recommend the clam chowder with shredded crab on top-amazing-look it up fellow yelpers)! But back to the Crab House. 

We went on a Sunday afternoon for a late lunch. The weather was showery so crowds on Pier 39 were not too bad. We were seated right away and our drink needs attended to. The decor is cheesy but not over the top. Here's a news flash for those of you who downgrade the Crab House because it looks like a tourist trap...it IS a restaurant on Pier 39...duh! Back to the meal. This was a birthday lunch for our 19 year old son and there were four of us at our table including our 21 year old and my husband and I. All of us LOVE crab. I took the Yelpers word for it and ordered the Killer Crab-Crab Feast. We also ordered Crab Chowder, a large Garlic Fry and the birthday boy ordered Shrimp Alfredo. 

Crab Chowder: Thin soup with an odd herb - dill maybe? While the crab was tender and plentiful that's about the only thing good to say. The chowder also had lots of different vegies (carrots, Corn, potato and?) all of which were too crunchy. The texture just did not match. It was also supposed to have bacon, but it must have been hiding today. Truly a bad cup of soup. I can make homemade crab chowder with an amazing creamy soup base and lots of bacon potato and garlic. Can't believe we paid for this stuff. 

Garlic Fries: Wow!!!!! So good. Hot crisp fries sprinkled with garlic and herbs. Best we've ever had. 

Shrimp Alfredo: Really good!. The shrimp was seasoned and grilled perfectly. Not at all rubbery, dry or over cooked. The pasta was delicate and tasted like it could be homemade and the Alfredo sauce was creamy and delicious. 

Killer Crab-Crab Feast: We were doubtful that there was going to be enough to feed four but at $100 we figured we'd just order another crab if we were still hungry. Well, there was definitely no need to order more. The waiter brought out a huge pile of crab on sizzling hot iron griddle (approx 13x9 inches). The smell made our mouths water. Grilled/roasted crab with an amazing garlic sauce. It was so hot and sizzling  that it was difficult to eat the first few minutes. All four of us dug in anyway. The boys ended up splitting the shrimp Alfredo. 

Rafael, our waiter was very polite and attentive without hoovering which is what we like. The busboy was on the spot too. 

Truly a very enjoyable afternoon of good food and great company!
author: Ann B.
