description: Three and stars. Had Crab Louis salad with excellent avocado and a whole sliced boiled egg. Located on the second floor and is a bit off the beaten path. Great views. We come here after disembarking our cruise ship. Take the elevator up because of our luggage and they kindly stow them for us.
author: P S.

description:
I feel a bit wrong giving this place 5 stars - it's a bit more of a 4 - 4.5 but this place holds a fond place in my heart.

The Crab House turned me into a crab lover. This was the first time I ever tasted crab so good that it made me come back for more and more. I've been here several times now, and am never disappointed. Do they have the best crab on earth? I don't know.

But they do have the best I've tasted in the Bay Area - this counts the Franciscan Crab House right around the corner. They give you more frills - this place gives you more taste.
author: Roxy G.

description: The Crab Lasagna was amazing.  Layers of crab, cheese, and angel hair pasta. The place was packed and we had a shitty cramped table that put me in a bad mood.  But the food came quickly and once I started to eat I couldn't remember why I was so grumpy.   I was in Crab Lasagna bliss.  Upon seeing my face the waiter said, "I know right."  I just nodded and stuffed my face.
author: Frank A.

description: Good value for your money. Excellent service and good food. This place made me a fan.
author: Rich S.

description: Great location, delicious food, pricey but still a good value considering the freshness of everything served.  This is not a coat and tie kind of place.  Prompt friendly wait staff.
author: Allan S.

description:
What more can I say, bring your friends have a glass and crack a crab :)


fun place, fun staff, stella on tap :)


A
author: Timber B.

description: the food, sevice & cocktails were worth the wait! buuuuut it was a super crowded & small table for 5 with a whole lotta food so we all felt super cramped. . . .  Next time i'll just go with one other person
author: Val P.

description: A place you want to go to when you are cold, hungry and craving for seafood! The huge crabs on a grill seasoning with green onions and butter just satisfy you in every way you want. Felt super filling and full after dinner haha.
author: Melodylu H.

description: OMG!!!! I wish I could afford to go every week! So BOMB!! Everything is good!!!!
author: Natalie J.

description:
This place gets 4 stars for food quality, 3 stars for customer service, and 2 stars for cleanliness (if you can avoid the bathroom do yourself a favor and please do).

We came on a Saturday afternoon which may explain it being overly busy, we were told that the wait time would take an hour but didn't get seated until an hour and a half later. Upon being seated our order was taken within the next 5-10 minutes which we liked because by that time we were starving, our food came out fairly quickly, but lacking the other items, i.e., our bread came out with no butter, we had no water, no tar tar for our fish and chips, basically the additional stuff to make a meal complete. Not only that, but a waiter would stand around and just look at us, at first I thought he did this to see if we needed anything else, like "water." But no, it seems as though he was waiting for us to finish our food, so he could collect our plates, give us our check and move onto the next customer. For a place that we are to spend a minimum of $200 I would expect a little better service, I know I should of asked but these things should come naturally.
author: Sandra Y.

description: A disappointment. The crab was dripping in garlicky oil and yet was still dry. Very little crab flavor. Bread loaf was stale. Beer expensive. Not good food and so not good value at the price.
author: Steve M.

description: Service was great, Dungeness crab was phenomenal really enjoyed the spot!
author: Cameron J.

description:
After already having dinner from downstairs at pier 39, my boyfriend and I walked around and stumbled upon this Crab House. 
Probably because it smelled so good from the outside.
We decided to go in and give it a try.
I'm not a picky eater at all, but when it comes to crab, I only like mine a certain way and this place makes its so good that even with a full belly, I can still eat again!
kudos to the chefs :)
author: Niki N.

description:
This place was pretty pricey, but worth it. Filled up my girlfriend and I with just the right amount of shrimp and crab. Everything tasted really good, but if only the prices were a few dollars less..
The service was really good, especially the Hispanic male bus boy. Sad part, though, our actual waitress was really bad on timing and didn't come often for refills and whatnot, but the busboy came often and was very polite. Strange, but this place is still good.
author: Derek C.

description:
Excellent crab in garlic sauce.  Nice and juicy inside and a little crunchy where the meat was sticking out from the shell.  Probably from deep frying?  Also came out piping hot, so it stayed warm during the time that we picked through the plate.

Would have been nice if the windows opened all around the restaurant.  Make sure you sit in the section to the right as you enter -
author: Neale R.

description: I love this place. Could be perceived as a little touristy but I have met many natives here. This is a good old SF style place.
author: Sammy A.

description: Food was outstanding!!! The crab chowder was fantastic! Unfortunately the service was terrible. The hostesses were more concerned with flirting with their coworkers than helping patrons. All the busboys sat in a walkway talking (in appropriately I might add). The location was great. Overall the restaurant was clean. But the terrible service got annoying!
author: Sarah C.

description:
Worst service ever.

Our waiter was totally incompetent. He bought out our food and forgot to give us:
Cutlery, tools for crab, stand for the crab, bowl for shells, parmesan cheese. So I tried to wave him down and he said 'in a minute'. We sat, looking at our food for 5. 

He finally came back, gave us SOME of what we had asked for. Dumped it on the table in front of my partner and walked off. 

We noticed another waitress giving great service to her diners, putting their bibs on, presenting their food nicely, asking if they need instructions on how to eat the crab. 

We called her over and said we wished she was serving us because our food was just dumped on our table. Instead of redeeming our evening she got defensive and gave us attitude saying 'we only explain it to people if they ask'. I thought 'yeh, you only give people forks if they ask too'. Totally ruined our night. I'll never go back there. 

They're obviously doing something to make their waitstaff miserable and rude and not able to figure out how to do their job.
author: Kate B.

description:
This was my second time at Crab House and my last.  I love crabs and have had garlic roasted crabs at many different places.  As some other reviewers have mentioned, the crabs are fried to the point where all the meat from body is crispy and flaky.  There's not much meat left except for in the legs.  At many other crab restaurants, the crabs tend to be more meaty and juicy.  The grilled mussels and shrimps are tasty but nothing really wows.  The bread was cold and tough to chew.  The kid's grilled cheese dish was hardly edible, pretty much consists of the same cold, hard dinner roll except they add one or 2 slices of cheese.  My 3 year old nephew had a hard time chewing or tearing apart his grilled cheese sandwich I had to tear it into pieces so he can eat it.  For the price they charge, they can't even at least serve freshly baked or at least warmed bread?   This place is overpriced and adds on a 4.9% fee just to cover the cost of doing business.  You'll definitely feel ripped off.  I don't mind spending money on eating out at good establishments with good food and services, but this place is not worth it.  Overpriced and overhyped.  I've had much better elsewhere.

The restaurant itself is very cramped.  The tables are too close to each other.  Not a great place to bring kids or a place where you'll feel comfortable for long.  My sister had to leave the restaurant just to go outside with her toddler just because it's so cramped.
author: Calvin M.

description: Customer service is excellent. Location is real nice as well. Went here about 5 times now with my wife. My wife loves crab so I recently brought her here for her birthday. As usual the food was great. I'm not much of a seafood person so I always get the fish and chips. Every time it's good and my wife can agree that every single time the crab was awesome. Don't expect a cheap menu but do expect some extraordinary food.
author: Michael L.

description: The food was good and the service was good, but it was extremely pricey. We shared the crab feast and a Caesar salad between myself, my husband and our three kids.  Everything is al carte but at the end of the night our bill came to $240!  The food was good but not for that kind of money.  Plus it was extremely hot in there, luckily we were sitting by a window and were able to open it for some air.
author: Cinsi H.

description:
So glad to walk by this place. The wait took forever but loved every moment of it (when we got seated). Between my boyfriend and I we ordered a bowl of crab chowder (yummy & a bit spicy), the calamari (yummy), and one whole crab--now that was very good. The garlic on the crab made it so tasty that you can't even stop eating it (talking about it makes my mouth watery for some) It was so easy to break it apart to get the meat. Dessert we ordered a Lemon bar something like that its called "nonna" something..It SO GOOD!! It wasn't too lemony. The waiter was awesome too always there to help us & give us a suggestion since it was our first time. There's this cute crabs decorations all around the resturants..Find the crab with a cowboy hat it reminds me of Woodie from Toys Story. 

Most definitely will come back here!!
author: Lina L.

description:
Oh crab house... how i love you....

My family and I have been frequenting this place for years now as a "congratulations you have managed to survive another year of life, here are numerous doodads and knick knacks that are sure to entertain you for two or so hours...And here is a lovely card congratulating you on that accomplishment...IT'S A PUPPY WEARING A HAT!!!"

Anyway.... We are very serious crab eaters and I have to say this place is the place to be for crabs!! And not the type that results in heavy itching and application of ointments in tender nether bits...

The "Killer Crab" is to die for... garlicky, buttery, and roasted to a crisp so that even the thin pieces of shell (Its edible people) are a treat.  If it weren't for the thoughtful bibs that the waiters graciously tie on (and remove if you don't mind the invasion of personal space) i would leave with the demolished remnants on my shirts.  In an attempt to create my own magic at home, i tried to mimic the recipe to no avail.  I even bought the iron plate!  

I have tried:
Garlic fries- Crispy, delicious, and just the right amount of garlic flavor... you know.... "i dont want to sleep with you until you get your stomach pumped" kinda amount.
Garlic noodles- Now i  know why gilroy stays in business.
Fried artichoke hearts- someone shoot me if i don't die from a bliss induced heart attack
Calamari- So-so... kinda tastes the same as everywhere else honestly. 

Service has always been exceptional and helpful.  Waiters are attentive even at their busiest times, and super friendly.

So why is Kurt D. so intent on convincing us all on the deliciousness of this place but only gives it 3 stars?  Well it has to do with reservations...

I reserved my table at 815 two days in advance on opentable.com.  When me and my date (wink wink) arrived to the crab house i was starving, the garlic was obviously toasting in butter, and my date was obviously glazed over in excitement from my utter beauty...  I walk up to the podium and declare my intent to destroy a "Killer crab" but alas... my table wasnt ready... in fact... i needed to wait an additional 15-20 minutes!!! (I arrived on time).  My date was much more irritated than I, I can usually over look pretty small things like waiting for a table for a few minutes... But my family and I have had to wait every time we made reservations... NOT COOL!! 

I will be coming back because the food is just that good... but will probably expect delays when i make my reservations again....
author: Kurt D.

description: We wanted crab and I am not disappointed that we chose this restaurant. It is at the pier, which is a bit touristy. The crab were really good. We had their famous garlic crabs. We ordered the mussels as well and those were awesome! Just great! The caesar salad was really good and it was enough for two. The only bad experience we had was with some patrons. Not the restaurants fault. My husband finally said we had to go. They were so loud! It's not a local hang out. When we go back we'll try another place, but this place did have good food.
author: Nancy P.

description: This review is very disheartening to post but here it goes. I recently dined here on 12/15/13. We waited less than 30min with no reservation. Which was actually not bad at all. We were seated in the back in the middle. There were two open booths that were reserved. We wanted a window sear and asked our server twice and he went to the front and asked we were turned down twice. During the course of the meal my daughter was choking and no one came to help. It wasn't a mere cough she turned red and wasn't breathing. The  restaurant went quiet and my son a new Marine was able to bring up food. We sat back down to eat a bus person came up to inquire about my daughter.  Our server showed up moments later.  I ignored him at this point because I am annoyed that our waiter did not spend time with us because he stereotyped us. He was not friendly and to make matters worse we sat in the restaurant watching random guest get their tables changed.  The one star is for the food. It wasn't epic but you could go down a block and get the same dish with better service.
author: Angelika T.

description: I've been coming to this place for almost 5 years now every time I come to San Francisco. It never fails to amaze me at how amazing their crabs in their secret garlic butter sauce taste. Each time I've been here it's been the same and nothing has changed. It is pricey but definitely worth your money if you're willing to splurge on a GOOD meal. I advise that if you want to eat here you should ONLY eat their crab. It is a crab house and it only makes sense to order crab while dining at a crab house. The service is fine to be honest, they take your order and the food comes out quick. They refill our water when needed and there isn't any waiters walking by asking how your food is when you have a mouthful of food in your mouth. I like the hands off serving, it gives me time to enjoy my food. I honestly don't understand why there are so many bad reviews on this place. It's a must to eat here when in SF!
author: Tanisha M.

description: We just left the restaurant & I was disappointed. Small order of Calamari was more like 'bits' of crumbs. The Garlic noodles were DRY, & STICKY as hell. The "3lbs" Crab was OK. More like 1lb CRAB. NEVER GOING THERE TO WASTE $$, again. WACK. 2 stars for the service.
author: Ane T.

description: everything we had here tasted pretty good. we had the crab chowder, fried calamari, garlic noodles, garlic fries, and the shrimp, mussels, and crab iron skillet. lots of food for two people, but we were celebrating a birthday! my only disappointment was that the skillet came with less crab than i had expected, and it may have been overcooked because the crab shells were almost flaky when we were trying to break them open to get to the meat. next time we will be sure to order more crab!!!
author: Sabrina L.

description:
Price is reasonable considering where this place is at although dinner for two could still run you close to a bill. It's recommended to make reservations on OT. We made reservations for 7pm at 3pm on OT and had plenty of time slots to choose from. When we got there we had a small wait while they cleared the tables but got seated next to the window for a great view while the walk in people had to wait much longer. The longer wait was pretty much due to them being understaffed and what seemed like one waitress running the entire place. Bar seats were first come first serve. 

We ordered the Whole Lots of crab for two, a bole of crab chowder, and fish and chips. The fries that come with the chips are garlic fries so no need to order a side of garlic fries but these fries are super good. 

The bread they serve is just average as the loaf is not warm and if you ask for butter they give you a cold slab of butter in a small ramekin not even worth using since it's cold. The crab chowder had plenty of fresh crab meat on top of just average chowder. For the amount we got it's a good deal, we had plenty to share as it comes with two small bowls. (crab chowder 7/10)

The fish and chips surprised us as the fish came out in one long fillet piece. We were expecting it to be two or three strips. The batter was light on the outside although didn't really stick to the fish. The fish was flaky and I encountered a couple of small bones but they were visible enough to spot. The garlic fries were excellent as mentioned by reviewers before. It's not smothered in garlic but enough to taste and have a lasting affect on your breath for the night. Soft on the inside and double crispiness on the outside, what fries should be. (Fish and Chips 9/10).

The whole lot of crab felt like one and a half crab. The waitress brought extra butter and garlic sauce but it's way too oily. The sauce on the crab is enough. Crab tasted fresh as the meat was tender and sweet. They over seasoned some parts of the crab as it was salty but manageable. We had some pieces left over to take home as well and they place some plastic utensils along with the take home box in case the left overs don't make it home with you. For the crab it's decent food although not the best roasted crab in SF. (Crab 8/10).

There are people who stop by your table to remove any empty dishes but the waitress doesn't really come to bother you or check in on you unless you waive her down. In some ways it worked out or us as we just wanted to eat and not have to say how good the food was, but we ran out of napkins a third of the way through but the place was too packed for us to flag her down.  We only drove up for dinner but should have stayed and hanged out for the day as the parking cost of parking will add to your tab. There are parking lots right next to Pier 39, to the left in the giant parking structure and a decent size lot on the same side. Two hour parking ran 15 bucks on the lot.
author: David Y.

description:
Went here recently with some friends while on vacation in SF.  We had two infants in the party who had been sleeping well all day, up until the garlic crab came out.  The smell was so pungent that the children cried all throughout dinner.  The tables here are so crowded together that the seating was actually an unpleasant experience.  Definitely think twice if you're travelling with strollers or car seats.  There was nowhere to stash the strollers either, so we ended up leaving them up near the front of the restaurant.

Crab was good, but not great.  I think it's something that you could have once in a long while, but it's not something that's on the top of the list for a go-to crab place in SF.  I think R&J or PPQ fills the bill for me on that level, especially since they serve crab three or four different ways.  On the other hand, their fish stew sounds promising.  If I ever go their again, I think I'll order less crab and augment with one of their other offerings instead.
author: Dave Y.

description: The food is very very overpriced for whats it's worth. One crab is about 40$ which is too expensive in my opinion. The crab didn't taste fresh at all the shell didn't crack cleanly and the shell was kind of elastic, the meat stuck to the inside of the shell. This tells me the crab wasn't that fresh. They cooked the crab with some kind of garlic butter sauce but it was just greasy in my opinion. I also tried the angel hair lasagna, it was soooo oily and greasy, and the portion was very small and it cost 20$. Overall, looking at the menu it seems like most things are overpriced.  The cioppino was terrible, it taste just like tomato sauce out of a can. The calamari was very oily, it tasted average, i've had better calamari for half the price. The bread was terrible too, it was stale, had no flavor, and they didn't even bother cutting it up for you. The crab melt was okay, just average. Our waiter was also weird and very unprofessional the way he talked. Overall will not go back, sooo overpriced and the food was not good enough. Save yourself the time and money and go to the another restaurant in sf.
author: Yvonne T.

description: The "2 pounds plus" of crab turned out to be very little food and it was ridiculously expensive. I think they weigh the body with the legs since they serve it whole. Normally places just weigh and serve the legs. The server had also overstated how many people it would feed (really only one person and it's $79!). The noodles we had to order to help fill us up had more garlic than I've ever seen on something, and I love garlic! The kids wouldn't even eat them. The legs were good (although way over priced) and service was fast and friendly.
author: Curtis H.

description: LOVED THIS PLACE!!! My gf and I spent the entire day around this area and wanted to eat seafood all day long. This was our 1st stop and boy were we satisfied! Ordered the chowder which was pretty good. The mussels and shrimps as appetizers and they were good too, but I liked the mussels better. Finally, ordered 3lbs. of crabs and we tore those bad boys up! I love the seasonings and butter-garlic juice they have all over them! I'm glad they gave us bibs cuz we got real messy! It was such a great lunch and we were so full afterwards! A definite must go to when in SF!
author: Arlene G.

description: Really great food here. The crabs with their special garlic finish is beyond good and the mussels were fantastic. We shared a huge caesar salad that was very tasty. When back in SF, we'll be returning.
author: Lee P.

description:
This place is delicious! You must get the killer crab feast..which is what they are known for. They cook their crabs in this garlic butter yummyness!!! Ant yes, they are dungeness crab legs. they give you the bib and all the utensils you need. There was soooo much meat in these little suckers i love it. Ask for some malt vinegar on the side...YUM! we definitely feasted that night.

My only concern is the pricing. For the feast sharing 4 people for $100. Its not that much crab...I could definitely have eaten more! or maybe thats just me...
author: Michelle V.

description: Horrible food and service! Beautiful view however with so many options in the Warlf don't waste your time or money
author: Kelly M.

description:
uggh. I should of just went to Scoma's but I haaaaaaaad to try something new.

Came here for my BF's birthday a couple of days ago, had a party of 7 and had no problems making reservations through opentable. I received 3 phone calls from the restaurant the day of to confirm... I should of made a run for it then.

4 of us arrived at the Crab House 10 minutes early and were seated in about 5 minutes.2 more joined us later on and was waiting for one person who was stuck in traffic.

Maybe it was a miscommuncation because we were waiting for one person, that all the later arriving tables were served and almost finished with their food before our waiter plopped 4 loafs of COLD bread on the table and asked if we wanted to "fire it up" which means to me the food was not even being cooked. So we were sitting there swatting flies and drooling at other's food

We order the garlic fries, crab feast, garlic noodles, crab ciopino, crab angel hair lasagna, clam fetticine,a couple of other pasta dishes,+ mussels and shrimp iron skillet. 

When the food did come, everything was DRY! The Crabs was dry and Mussels and Shrimp was dry, just dry. The birthday boy was hungry and feeling gracious and didn't want to complain so we forced ourselves to eat. I had to soak the crab in someone's crab ciopino to moisten it. Im glad our 7th person was a human garbage disposal and eat most of the food no problem.  The only thing decent was their garlic fries and beer.

I was really disappointed in this place for I used to work at the pier and walking by every other day the aroma of their food would make me want to play hooky. Our bill was close to $400, I expected soo much more. The chef have the nerve to serve crab that have been in the oven cooked to the consistency of hay. I am extremely embarassed I brought the family to this place.

The only reason I even give more than one star was the waiter was quite attentive, he was really patience explaining what's in what for some of us had food allergies and that was quite appreciated and I undersand the suckiness of the food was at no fault through him. Drinks were refilled quickly and he sings a good Happy Birthday. His service alone earned the place 4 stars.


I will never cheat on Scoma's again.


*
author: Katrina C.

description: Nice killder carb and chowder. but a little bit salty for my asian stomach.
author: Jojo K.

description: The crab and garlic fries were excellent. So yummy that when our vacay ended, we were still salivating at the thought of them.
author: Henry H.

description: Lunch with hubby and 4 kids Would  have given 5 but tables are small for crab eating and 6 people thank god we had smaller sized kids or it would have been horrible ok now for the review of food apps were garlic fries and crab cakes both tasty main course whole crab lots of work to eat but it's crab!!! Garlic noodles with chicken my 14 yr old picky eater ate most so this was a thumbs up youngest son ordered Fried fish and chips. Fish was flaky and portion was big Other items ordered  were Crab omelet looked over cooked but edible Grilled cheese very greasy Crab angel hair lasagna was so oily I had to tip bowl to let oil run to one side but flavor was soo delicious after all that ! everything came out fast and hot Might eat here again,  but with so many options it might take another couple trips
author: Chuck K.

description: Amazing crab, easy to crack and had lots of meat. Customer service was great. We didn't have to wait in line at all.
author: Karina G.

description: BOMB.COM....The only way that I can explain it! Not fishy just PERFECT!!  My friend took me there for my birthday and I love it..little expensive for my pockets but thats why its was sooo FRESH...WORTH every penny. I hope to take my hubby there today for fathers day!! My son loves CRAB so this is a to go spot for his birthday...he will fall in love.
author: Toya R.

description:
After Alcatraz, we had lunch here. The place seem to be packed but was seated right away. We were seated in the corner next to the windows with the nice cool breeze coming through. Not very roomy for four adults and one baby. 

We ordered...
The killer crabs for two: really oily but very yummy. 
Crab chowder: Very good with lots of crab meat.
Crab cakes: Very good with lots of crab meat also. 
Steak and fries: Didn't try the steak but the fries are garlic fries very good.
Free bread: Hard and cold

Not sure if the food came out cold or because we were seated next to the window with the wind coming in. The crabs and crab chowder were between warm and cold.
author: Annette W.

description:
My husband and I go here as often as possible.  We're from LA and treat ourselves to weekends in SF once in a while but the real treat is coming to Crab House.  The wait takes forever but I see it as an opportunity to get my tummy ready for a feast fit for kings!!!

LOVE LOVE LOVE the crabs and the tasty garlic sauce (with a fries) and a couple of mojitos to wash it down.  The best meal I could ever have =)
author: Leah S.

description: The Crab House at Pier 39 is a pretty good crab place.  We ended up ordering the "too two crab," which runs you at 69.95.  It consists of two dungeness crab, roasted in a garlic sauce.  The waitress we had was also gracious enough to crack the crabs open for us.  Awesome service.  If we had one complaint about the meal, it would be that the crab shells would tend to crack into the meat, almost like chipped paint.  I'm not sure if that's a result of the crabs being roasted...or being roasted with quickness (I swore it took like 3-5 min to get our crabs).  But other than that, I was satisfied.
author: Ulysses M.

description: My husband surprised me for valentine's day at this place. We ordered their famous Killer crab with shrimps and mussels. The crab was sooooo good that it's really worth your money. We also added some garlic fries which is one of the best fries ive ever tasted in SF! The service was pretty good but the downfall is, they failed to input our orders on their system so we waited for another extra 15 minutes again. After serving our main entree, they actually have forgotten about our other order.  But overall, it was a good meal and worth the price! If we were not that patient, other customers would have reacted on a different way. We were just too nice since it's valentines day and we don't wanna ruin that special day with little things like that. We will definitely go back again and eat this killer crab!
author: Kirsleve S.

description: Highly recommend the crab feast, best crab I've ever had especially for you garlic lovers . Also Great views of the bay
author: Heem O.

description:
If you're headed to San Francisco, try to make a stop at the Crab House.  The killer dungeness crab is delightful!

My boyfriend and I decided to try this place based on recommendations by my sister and her boyfriend when they had visited SF a few months back.  We had an early dinner around 5pm so that we could make our Alcatraz Night Tour at 6:30.  The place was pretty empty, it being 5pm on a Monday night, so we were seated immediately at a corner table with a fabulous view of the bay and the Golden Gate Bridge.  As I sat down, I noticed that an ice cold pitcher of water was already sitting at the table, as well as all the "tools" and utensils we needed to demolish our crab.

We started out with the Sizzling Iron Skillet-Roasted Shrimp.  The appetizer was novel to me - at least 12 good-sized shrimp covered in a seasoned garlic rub, actually sizzling, on an extremely hot iron skillet.  I love shrimp with the shell on; it makes the shrimp more juicy on the inside and this was no different.  First, you start off sucking and licking the delicious garlic seasoning on the shrimp and then peel the shell off to devour the juicy, sweet meat inside.  Simply heavenly.  The shrimp also came with a butter dip that I didn't really use.  I prefer the pure taste of the garlic and shrimp.  We also ordered the garlic bread, but I thought it was just so-so.  It was pretty standard as garlic bread goes: garlic spread on french bread with melted cheese over it.

We shared a 3 pound order of the Killer Dungeness Crab and my, was it tasty.  A full 3 pounds of huge crab legs and I think we each had two crab claws.  The crab was wonderfully seasoned with garlic and herbs - I had to polish off the seasoning before I ripped into the crab.  The restaurant provides you with these little instruments of crab destruction (no worries about chipping your teeth here) and the server even showed us how to use them.  They look like these little picks with two prongs at the end.  You pierce the shell of the crab with one prong and proceed to "cut open" the shell of the crab to get at the delicate meat inside.  Each bite was scrumptious, made even better by the "hard work" it takes to get each piece of meat!  

Service was prompt and attentive.  Our server made sure that we were well taken care of and never in need of anything.  He knew that we had never dined there before and patiently, or even enthusiastically, showed us the ropes.  

Warning: this will not be a neat meal.  Prepare to get messy and splashed with crab bits and don't get too dressed up.  They do give you these little bibs to wear that will help a bit with the mess, but don't count on it for full protection.

Although a tourist trap, this place serves delicious food accompanied with a fantastic view and smiling service.  Highly recommended if you're ever in the SF area!
author: Emily C.

description: Less than mediocre  service and super crowded.  Menu is  pretty limited.  Unless you are a fan of cracking through boiled dungeness crab most likely you will be disappointed.
author: Swagato C.

description: Got the whole crab. So good. I was skeptical at the lack of dipping butter, but they put just the right amount of flavor. Good fries too. For being one of the most touristy places in the world, the staff was shockingly bright and friendly.
author: Khalid N.

description: Update: I went to the Crab House New Years night (January 1) around 5:00 pm.
author: John B.

description:
As a part of my trip to San Francisco, I would do my best to explore the local food there. And crab house is a place you should not miss if you are near Fisherman's wharf.
Located on pier 39, it can give you a pretty good view of the bay. The decoration is nice and waitress is polite. Try its whole crab. It is big and delicious.
author: Stephen G.

description: I suspect this place is always very busy.  Be sure to make a reservation if you are on a schedule.  The "roasted" crab and mussel combo is unique and excellent.  A full crab and mussel order is enough for 2 unless you are very hungry.  I thought the cheese garlic bread while excellent was a bit over priced with only 2 slices given, other than that, no complaints and will certainly go back next time in SF.
author: Peter L.

description: We went on a Monday night, right before our red-eye back to Baltimore.  Got right in although it was crowded for a Monday, which I take to be a good sign.  Ordered a glass of Chardonnay and had one problem:  when it arrived it was frothing?!  As an avid wine drinker, I had never seen wine like that.  It looked like there was a film on top.  Hating to send anything back, I did.  The new glass was the way it should have been...clear, crisp, and delicious, so it leads me to believe that the original glass was  dirty (yuck).  Crabs were great (had the 1/2 order) and Husby (not a seafood fan) ordered the chicken and chips that were AWESOME.  We asked for bread and never got any...had to ask again and it was brought in the middle of our meal.  I'd return, but not before trying other places on Pier 39 first.
author: Christine M.

description:
Well knowing offhand that this would be an overpriced tourist spot, what can I say.  I was showing my parents pier 39 and we were hungry.

Starting off we had a 15 minute wait, nothing much to complain about around lunch time on a nice day.

First Impressions was it was cozy restaurant with simple yet unique decor (crabs galore).  We felt rushed to sit in our chairs as we were blocking one of the two path ways to the kitchen with waiters/busboys rushing around frantically.

It got worse from that point.  Now I know the workers there are trying to get everyone served, but it was a bit chaotic and disturbing watching them.  Not a place to sit down and relax to eat.

We waited for about 5 minutes before we had to flag down a waiter to order something or even greeted.  The waiter was in a rush and it was obvious.  Now my Dad is the chatty type, introducing us...however our waiter made it very clear via body language he was not interested in our names.  So we all placed our order and ordered some appetizers(the crab fondue).  We were surprised to see the food coming out quick, maybe within 10 minutes for the first plate, followed with the rest a couple minutes later.  But wait where is our appetizer?  I ask the waiter "Aren't we suppose to get our appetizer first?"  Oh sorry he said and brought it for a dessert with little care that they screwed up.

As for the food.  The only good thing I can say is that the Crab was decent.  Award winning best crab in SF which they claim?  Not, but tasty.  The Mussels were horrible.  Some were overcooked, others raw.  The Pasta was undercooked on my Clam Pasta.  Nice flavors however spoiled by the undercooked pasta.  The Salmon was OK, but nothing to special, at least it was cooked properly.  For our dessert (the late coming Crab Fondue, I liked it. My wife found the bread too hard to eat, which it was.  The Fondue toasted bread and the brick rolls which would take a hammer and chisel to break open.

Watching the busboys clean up tables, I seen McDonalds do a better cleaning job.  We were sitting near the kitchen and my wife and I found it very amusing as a tall female waitress would walk every time around the corner from the floor to the kitchen.  She would have a plastic smile on her face and every time she turned around the corner it would disappear to bigger frown.  Yes overworked and probably underpaid, as most the people are there, which reflects on the service and ambiance of the place.  Maybe a better place when they are not so busy, but from the experience we had I couldn't recommend this place to anyone
author: Robert A.

description:
What a great place!  My mom and I decided to have dinner here because she was in the mood for a dungeness crab and it wasn't too far from where we were.  I was afraid it would be overpriced and incredibly touristy, but it actually wasn't bad.  The decor was fun and casual and the atmosphere of the place was very nice.  It was Friday night, so I made reservations online to make sure we wouldn't wait too long.  Thank goodness we did!  When we walked in, the party ahead of us asked when the next available table would open up for walk-ins and they were told the wait was at least an hour and a half long!

That being said, we were seated immediately and had an attentive and very nice server.  We ordered a whole crab to share with a side of baked vegetables and garlic fries.  The crab was great because it was fresh and cooked in a delicious garlic sauce.  The vegetables had a sesame soy sauce that were all great and the garlic fries were absolutely delicious.  Everything was great and it was all more than enough food for 2 of us.

My mom even commented that she wants to come back to this place next time she visits!  Though it wasn't cheap, it was comparable to other places serving the same food.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Dee-effing-licious. Don't like seafood? Well, now you will. The wait? Bearable. The food? Mmm. Four things you must get as I did: 1. Whole Killer Crab, uh duh 2. Garlic Steamed Clams 3. Garlic fries 4. Garlic bread I kid you not, you will walk out happy, if you can even move afterwards. All this fed 5 people happily.

Dig in. The crab was definitely the killer. Killed my hunger and could not be more pleased. It was so buttery and juicy. At times, I had some issues cracking them open and pulling out the meat, but it did not deter me from nibbling their little succulent legs.  The steamed clams here are probably the best clams I've ever eaten anywhere. The soup they're cooked in is so flavorful that dipping anything in there will be a plus. The garlic fries are hands down the best garlic fries I have ever had. I just wish garlic fries can be a so cal thing too. They're fried just right so that you don't get that heavy oily feeling afterwards. A tasty tip for the garlic bread or the regular bread they give you is to dip it in the sauce they cook the clams in! Oh my heavens! And while you're resting your full tummies, you can sit by the window and watch the boats pass by. Great food, great service, great time!

Get your crabbin on!
author: Jo H.

description: well. considering you will have a view when you dine, and that view is Golden Gate Bridge . it's worth your $$$
author: Vegg C.

description:
Preamble to the review:
Skimming through the other reviews for the Crab House, I see most are written by people from outside of SF.  Given that this restaurant is ensconced deep in pier 39ness, I suppose I understand.  But, I've also sort of started to wonder, what is it that make a restaurant frequented by tourists (due to its location) such a hideous thing in and of itself?  Why are all things touristy assumed to be terrible, and what's so wrong with tourists anyway?  My favorite thing to do in life is travel, so I am usually a tourist in someone's country, even if I try to be low key and stay off the beaten path, etc.  Yet, when I can't travel, I find something exciting and exhilarating to be around those who are.  Sometimes, when I am feeling homesick for my own state of wanderlust, I head to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39.

Review:
Today's wanderings with my friend and her 15 month old took us to Musee Mechanique, to the sea lions, and eventually, we were hugry, so I checked Yelp to see what had better reviews, and we ended up at the Crab House.  

At about 5:30/6, there was a brief wait of about 15 minutes.  We sat in the bar area and admired the eclectic array of decorated crabs, a crustacean version of all those hearts that were all over SF a few years ago.

After moving to our table, our server took our drink orders via one of those handheld remotes that automatically transmit to the bar and the kitchen.  I had a mojito, which actually didn't taste like it had much alcohol in it, but it was refreshing nonetheless.  After the server took our food orders, my friend's crab chowder appeared almost instantaneously- ahh the magic of sending information to the kitchen without having to go there.  I secretly wish I had had this when I worked at Chilis, many moons ago.  It is much more efficient to work with tables without having to run back and forth handing tickets over to the kitchen.

Anyway, I had the Killer Crab, in and mid-90s southern California parlance, it was killer indeed.  The legs (I think Alaskan crab?  So says my SO, so boo for not local) were presented on a skillet glistening with garlicy butter sauce.  Mmmmmmm garlic and butter and crab.  MMMMMM.

It did get kind of stuffy in the restaurant until someone opened the windows, and while our service was ridiculously fast up front, it did take awhile to get our check, even after my friend had to take her toddler outside twice to avoid full on meltdowns.

But, overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my crab and will absolutely go back again, even if I have to drag my friends kicking and screaming to Pier 39.  What's more, I really liked hearing all the various accents of adjacent diners: it made me feel like I was somewhere else, if only for a moment.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Great View, I will give it that! The service is Mediocre, and the food was pretty good, but the prices...JEESH way to pricey for the food! 

I think they are charging the view because you know their rent has to be high. Would I go back and eat there again, Maybe??? 

I think I would try other restaurants at Pier 39 next time...but the view was deff memorable!!! Hopefully they will hire new chefs and improve on the Seafood cooking! I know I could cook better than them!!!
author: Natalie C.

description: We went on New Year's Day at around 2:30 pm and although there was a wait, our family of 5 was seated right away. We lucked out. Everything was really good, from the decor to the actual food. The kids fish and chips were really tasty, my kids ate every bite (which is unusual). The baby iceberg salad was dressed nicely and big enough for my 9yo son and I to share. My garlic roasted dungeoness crab was really good and my husband said his sizzlng mussels and shrimp platter were good. The sourdough bread was hard like it had been left out overnight, but who cares, it is just bread. My only real complaint was that the bathrooms were a mess. They weren't dirty or smelly (which is an automatic never go back thing) they just had overflowing trash bins and paper towels all over the floor. It was New Year's Day and they were slammed so I'll gve them a pass, but if I went another time and the bathrooms were like that I would reconsider. It is just to me, clean bathrooms equate clean kitchens and dirty bathrooms (these werent dirty, jusy messy) ....
author: Niki A.

description: Just finished my dining here at the crab house. It was quite nice. Spanish music int he background. Colorful crabs ornamented along the roof. Service was quite helpful and alert. Mussels cooked in oil and light salt they were splendid. The crab was covered with flakes of with tasty spices and oil; it was so delicious. Fried artichoke was a bit overwhelming, in that it was so oily. Garlic fries I felt were overrated. All in all good experience. After consuming so much fried foods and oil. I felt my face was going to break out with pimples and my arteries were going to be clogged with oil content. But it was totally worth it.
author: Geezy L.

description:
Let me start by saying...I was visiting San Francisco for the first time...so obviously I'm a tourist and this is exactly the place for a tourist like myself.

The ambience was good...one star.

The staff was outstanding (even handling a rowdy customer at the bar very professionally)...one more star

Good variety in the menu with lots of appealing sounding choices...one more star

And the food itself...another star.  We had a bowl of the crab chowder (plenty to split!), crab cakes (only 2 but they were yummy!), some garlic fries, and the sizzling shrimp and crab plate.  Everything tasted fresh to me.  My boyfriend thought it was similar to Red Lobster, but I give it way more credit than that.  Either way it was what I was expecting.  OH! And the best part was I was able to make reservations from YELP on my phone from the ferry! How awesome is that!
author: Danielle S.

description: The killer crab is really delicious but unfortunately we had food alergy afterward but maybe we eat too much. One per people will be enough as each will be more than 2 pounds.
author: Yang Y.

description:
It's located on Pier 39, so we expected the high prices that we encountered.  The staff was great.  I ordered the crab alfredo and aside from a few bits of shell in the dish - it was wonderful.  Someone else ordered the fish and chips and enjoyed it.  Another, that doesn't like seafood ordered the "chicken and chips' - don't do it - they need to revisit that technique.

I thought that it was a bit crammed - like me sitting in my chair right at our table prevented the person at the next table from getting up and out.

They food did come out very, very fast - we noticed that too, but it didn't occur to me that it was a negative thing, especially since most of us enjoyed what we were served.
author: Jason C.

description:
This is my absolute favourite restaurant.  While the decor is a little cheesy, I love the big windows that overlook the water.  

The food was absolutely delicious!  I had a mojito which was great!  The crab was the most delicious, most wonderful crab I've ever had.
author: Becks Y.

description: Great Service! I had my crab sooo fast that I didn't finish my bread Crab is great as well as the atmosphere.
author: Cleveland W.

description:
Ate here for a somewhat early Saturday dinner on a warm spring day with my girlfriend and another couple.  We walk in and my first impression was that it was a gimmicky and loud.  It is located on the second level of the pier, closest to the road (or beginning of the pier).  They have a small bar and a lively family-esque atmosphere.

We are seated in an elevated booth near the center of the restaurant.  We asked for a window view, but did not want to wait for one.  With the window views, you would have a table (not a booth) but with it comes views of the bay and golden gate bridge.  We each order a drink and note that the service is remarkably fast here.  Apparently they pride themselves on a quick turn to turn as much profit as possible to pay for what I'd imagine is a high rent being located on the pier.  We ordered the fried calamari appetizer as well which was superb.  They also served us three small loaves of nice bread.  This was served without butter, but olive oil and balsamic were already on the table.  I shared some of my girlfriends salad that came with hers and thought it was light and refreshing with a tasty dressing.  

Before bringing out our entrees, the server walks around and ties on their signature Crab House bibs to each of our necks.  Kind of fun and in tune with the loud and fun atmosphere of the place.

I had the lobster thermador as my dinner entree.  This plate is huge, rich and tasty.  Cheese and butter on two lobster tails.  I have only had lobster in the shell with drawn butter in the past, so I was somewhat skeptical, but this was delicious.  Cooked to perfection; most lobster tails I have had in the past have been slightly overcooked.

Also at my table was a filet mignon and crab legs.  The filet was pretty good from the bite I tasted and the crab legs were also good.  Again with the crab legs, they do not serve with drawn butter.  My girlfriend was slightly disappointed by this, but she said they were tasty nonetheless.  I agreed with her consensus.

We all split the tiramisu for dessert.  It was sweet, slightly rich and very light.  Again, delicious.  

So, all in all I was very impressed by the food and service here.  Great for a fun night, but probably not recommended for a quite date.  I was expecting much less than they delivered, so that made the experience even better.  The prices were a bit steep, but not too crazy.  You have to expect to pay a premium while eating at Pier 39 in Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Benjamin P.

description:
We ate here twice during our recent trip....

First Dinner:
DELICIOUS!!
Mussels and Shrimp Appetizer (the shrimp were ehh, Mussels AWESOME, and dip the bread in the sauce that is leftover)
Two Two Crab was outta this world....
Garlic Fries....OMG....so good and so garlicky!
Server was friendly and great...

Second Dinner:
Ordered the Mussels App (no shrimp this time)
...still yummy to dip bread
Two Two Crab again....and this is where the problems started...
They served it on a HUGE Cast Iron (HOT AS HELL, bubbling with garlicky oil) Skillet...it was a big rectangle and they balanced it on a circular metal stand.  Being that there were 2 kids in our party eating off the skillet (10 and 16) and I didn't love the presentation.  Add to that, this time, the crabs were not at all separated...they were whole(other than the main shell just sitting on top)...so, you would have had to pickup a sizzling hot crab and try to pry the legs off...and hope that having 4 people on the skillet didn't make it tip and cause a burn disaster.
I told the server that the other day it was different and he replied (tersely and not at all helpfully, "this is a different presentation") - I then ask for him to take it back and make it the other way....he was obnoxious and I was really annoyed and it honestly put a damper on my dinner....also, they brought the fries like 10 minutes before the Crab (main dish)...the server said, "you wanted the fries now right"? and I said "not really" and he said, "well the Crabs are coming out soon".  

The food is really good but the presentation and Carlos the server put a bad taste in my mouth.
author: Bari S.

description: Had a great meal and the house ale is good. Crab chowder is a good way to start. Elbow room is a bit hard to come by but our service was great.
author: Adam M.

description:
Taste: 5
Value: 4
Service: 3

I came here with a group of around 50 people for a work banquet on behalf of Abbott. We reserved a little over half the tables, and we had a prix fixe menu for the night. I think the total came out to be $2800 for all of us?

The appetizer (Mixed Baby Greens Salad) and dessert (tiramisu) were pretty average. For the entree, we were given 3-4 different choices, including the salmon, half killer crab, and crab enchilada. I decided to go with the half order of dungeness Killer crab, and I was definitely glad I did. The crab was absolutely delicious, and I'd definitely come here again just for that.

Overall, I was really happy with the food. The crab was amazing and definitely made up for the average appetizer and dessert. The bib was funny, but I decided to wear it since it really did get pretty messy.
author: David L.

description:
It was a date night for my wife and our dinner at the Crab house was absolutely memorable!   Without a doubt, we rate the Crab house as a five and here is why:

1) The entire Crab house staff, especially Vinny and Lei, were extremely helpful and kind. It was our first time and they really made great menu suggestions since we were SF foodies! 

2) OMG the food!  Although we were full, we couldn't stop eating!  Honestly instead of eating for just two, we literally ate for three and didn't regret it!
    -  Crab for two - Yum!  Great sauce, which was finger licking good! 
    -  Crab chowder - Yum! Yum!  Warm hearty chowder with large portions of crab! We had to order two of these! 
    -  Extremely delicious garlic noodle with crab - Yum! Yum! Yum!   We were surprised with large chucks of crabs!  Without guilt and regrets, we ordered two servings!
    -  Tiramisu and lemon crusted pie dessert!  (SMILE)


We are definitely plan to go back again!  Our next selections are going to be the garlic fries and mussels/clams with crab!
author: Harry C.

description: I think I had too much crab. Went there two days ago and now my face is burning with tiny rash bumps. I would still recommend the Crab House though. Good service, great food, and nice view. Nothing to complain about, except my allergic reaction:'(
author: L Y.

description: Excellent menu with traditional and unique seafood dishes. Everything was delicious and they have validated parking. Great view, nice service --especially considering how busy and boisterous the place was. The highlight was the spicy fruti de mar (I forget what the menu calls it but it had calamari, mussels, clams, shrimp and more) and smoked whitefish bruschetta but the crab chowder and fondue was incredible too. A really fun place, perfectly priced, and the entrees are big enough to share if you order appetizers which we did.
author: Ava M.

description:
BEST GARLIC FRIES!!! 
Came here with my fiance and we shared a cup of crab chowder, garlic butter crabs and garlic fries. Wasn't too crazy about the chowder but it was pretty tasty. The crabs was overall good. But, the highlight of the meal is the GARLIC FRIES! They are sooo YUMMY!
author: Ly T.

description: Good food! Love the crab, salad, calamari. Brushetta was soggy tho'
author: Doris U.

description: My wife and I have to bring a visiting family from overseas for a dinner. We decided to bring her here, and it was a home-run. Great location, easy validated parking (freebie always good) and great food. We love everything we ordered: Chowder, Garlic Fries, Calamari, Garlic Noodle and the absolute Killer Crab for 3. Fair pricing and great service.
author: R. S.

description:
You are going to see probably 2 kinds of reviews for this OVER PRICED TOURIST TRAP....that is mine end of story. I used to live nearby.

The other reviews will be 5 Stars and all by tourists too LAZY to look for a better place. Trust me do your homework and avoid this glorified Red Lobster.
author: Chuck F.

description:
Crab: 5 stars. Can be overwhelming if you eat a looooot though. It's VERY rich and they use a ton of butter but I love it!

Crab chowder: Thick, creamy, buttery and rich. My mom's is better but Crab House's is still good. =)

Calamari: Super flavorful, cooked perfectly and has a light crispy batter.

Caesar salad: Good. Simple.

Garlic noodles: I prefer PPQ's but still good. Just more buttery which can be overwhelming when you're already eating buttery crab. 

Sidenote: Get your parking validated here. Damn tourist trap makes the parking garage hellllla expensive.
author: Beverly T.

description: Great food..  a bit kitchy inside but I would go again.
author: Sharon S.

description: I like its pretty good the garlic crab a little bland but mussels shrimp skillet was good and clam soup was good.
author: Dun C.

description:
Ah I vividly remember the lazy and inebriated weekend I spent in SF awhile back. Drinking, eating, and sleeping in a seemingly endless lethargically hedonistic cycle. Perhaps it was the glory of that weekend that makes me recall the Crab House so fondly, perhaps it was that I was just down to eat and pay (relatively) dearly for the pleasure. 

The joint was packed when we arrived - to me this is usually a good sign. Although some think waiting for food is a fate worse than death, I see it as an omen of good, fresh food. To pass the 20 minute wait we slurped strong cocktails at the bar - pricey yes but I was pleasantly tipsy throughout the meal. 

We ordered the crab cakes which were good and crabby. I don't remember too much of what others ordered but delicious pomme frit-ish fries were up in the mix some where and I gladly partook. I ordered the scallops and was quite pleased. 

After this meal I slept for hours and when I awoke I gave birth to a food baby..... so beautiful.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Great crab and great mojitos! My boyfriend and I shared a whole crab (which was totally enough), and he also had the crab chowder (which I had to try). Both were delicious! 
Make reservations to avoid  a long wait. We made reservation and got an awesome table too:)

We have also eaten at the Fransiscan, which was also good. But the Crab House was better and cheaper.  
we will go again!
author: Missy M.

description: I love the food here: Fish n Chips, Crab Sandwich,  and Sizzling Clams & Shrimp are the dishes I tried. Pretty good for a restaurant in a touristic area.
author: Motaz H.

description: This was a fun place to go for seafood right on the water. We had order a side of veggies which we never got, but we actually didn't miss them. The sizzling mound of mussels, shrimp and crab legs definitely filled us up!
author: Christy M.

description: Delicious and fresh oysters & crab. Great service. No cocktail sauce.
author: Daydreamer S.

description: Fantastic crab & lovely melon mojito!
author: bliss s.

description: It was pretty good. Crab was good but not a lot of it for the price and the amount as advertised. Bread was a bit hard.
author: Andy L.

description: I truly enjoyed my food. I had the Crab Enchiladas and they are highly recommended. A big portion size as well. The garlic fries are scrumptious too!! Had a pretty tasty pineapple motito to top it off.. Then because it was cold in June I ended the meal with a delicious cup of hot chocolate. I Know weird combo but all in all I enjoyed everything!!
author: Natalie C.

description:
ehhhh.. this place was average.  So we were looking for somewhere good to eat near the warf, and this place had pretty good reviews so we decided to try it.  

Food: We ordered the killer crab, bruschetta, and crab chowder.  The crab chowder had corn in it, which was kind of weird.  but it came out medium/not warm temperature, so it that was one strike.  the bruschetta was actually pretty good, which is surprising at a CRAB house.  it came on garlic bread that was toasted. The bread they give you at the beginning comes in a paper bag/slip thing, and it even has the nutrition facts. oh yay.  And lastly.. our killer crab came out.  It smelled 10 times better than it tasted.  It was rather flavorless, they dont give you the body, and it is kinda pricey for what you get.  We also had a bloody mary.. which was un-spicy and came with an old piece of celery.

Service:  Okay, i really hate when i feel RUSHED at a restaurant.  The hostess was nice and got us seated quickly (because we had reservations), and even our waiter was nice.  The food came out RIGHT after we ordered it, we were barely able to get in a conversation.  and the second strike.. they started clearly our table before we were even finished eating. OMG.  it was annoying.  I mean, if you really want to hurry us out of there, you could have just told us it was a busy saturday night. 

Ambiance: Strike three.  hot.. stuffy... crowded grossness.  One thing.. the view was nice.

Price: too expensive. 

Maybe we came on an off night?
author: Ashley M.

description: Loved the food. Everything was delicious! I bought the crab whole with the head on, and it was very fresh and meaty. The service was excellent and so was the wine. I just think it is a little on the pricey side. I'll definitely return when I'm in the area and not on a budget!
author: Ami M.

description:
I went to the  Crab House at Pier 39 with my classmates on Thursday. We went in the afternoon at 3:00 pm. There were 9 people in the group.

Ambience: We sat near the window, so we had a great view of the bay. We could see ferries, boats, the bay and the port. However, some things felt out of place.  Like, a blimp in the sky.

Food: We ordered crab, filet Mignon, french fries, Caesar Salad and shrimp. It was very delicious, but some people thought it was too greasy.

Service: The waitress was polite, but didn't smile a lot.  For the price, we wish we had a friendlier server.

Price: The price was a little expensive, but our teacher said that is because it is in Pier 39.  Which is a tourist area.

Bottom Line: The taste is so good, but the food may not be worthy of the price.  But still I recommend it.
author: ILSC S.

description:
We went to the Crab House for our anniversary while in SF and it great.  The location is great - I guess if you're tourists :) We looked out over the bay and as it got darker we enjoyed muted lights over the bay.  

I ordered the following:
Chowder
Garlic Fries
Whole Crab

The clam chowder was hearty  and delicious but the Garlic Fries we AMAZING.  The Crab was perfectly cooked and I loved their garlic butter sauce.  The waiter was very helpful and attentive - always there filling water or making sure everything was going well. It was a very enjoyable evening - wonderful dinner & couldn't beat the company.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Pro: clean, bright, nice view, ok service
Con: The crabs was bit small, greasy, and dry, bit on the pricey side.

Bottom line: Unless you like heavily sauced, roasted crab, I would not recommend this place.

My husband and I found this restaurant on Yelp. Husband wanted to go to somewhere with a nice place to sit and enjoy the crab, so little stands on Pier 42(ish) were out of the question. When we walked in, we were quite taken by the view and the decor. It was clean, bright, even on a rainy day. Our server was quite pleasant. The table setup was efficient with water pitch, rack for placing the plate, a bowl for shells and all the utensils you will need to enjoy your crab. We didn't bother order anything else other than the crab so this review is based solely on the crab experience. 

When the crab came out, it was quite impressive. It was served on a very hot skillet. The shell had already been opened for us. Inside, it was smothered with a sauce of some sort. Our first impression with the crab was that it was too greasy. The sauce tasted good, but it also masked the taste of crab. When our waiter came by, I asked him how the crab was cooked. He told me that it was roasted with sauce and oil. We understand that some people like crab cooked this way, but we are not a fan. The meat was bit too dry for my taste and my stomach is still not happy with me 5 hrs after. We are sure their other items on the menu are good, we are just not a fan of their style of preparation. if you like heavily sauced crab, this is a good place for you. But if you are like us who prefer their crabs steam or boiled, you might be disappointed.
author: Niny R.

description:
Meh.

I came here yesterday at 5:15-30ish, we had to wait 15 minutes, no biggie.
We got sat next to a window, not bad of a view but mine included the wall of the restaurant haha.
Service was great, very attentive.

Ordered:
1 whole crab in killer sauce.
1 Small Garlic Fries (I should've ordered a medium... :p)
1 Crab Alfredo.

Garlic Fries are good, if I come back here, I would definitely order this again.
Crab Alfredo wasn't bad, lots of crab meat so it was pretty good, but it just wasn't impressive.

The Killer Sauce Whole Crab was a deal breaker. The crab LOOKS like it was baked.. (instead of steamed or boiled) so the meat on the crab LEGS was very dry. In addition to that, the sauce was veeeery salty, I felt my taste-buds burning up from the overdose of salt and garlic in this dish... killer indeed. The meat in the actual body was good since it was moist, but I don't think I'd order this crab again....
I think I should've ordered the sizzling platter though, that thing looks good! with mussels and shrimpies. 

You can definitely get better crab from R&G Lounge, this is just a suggestion. Crab House is not a bad restaurant at all.
author: Khanh T.

description:
The Crab House is one of the better seafood places you can go to get the crab. Eat the crab. Enjoy the crab, the garlic fries. Mmmm. Good. We had an appetizer and the calm chowder, er, clam chowder. I don't know  what calm chowder is, but I ain't ordering it. 

Waiters were attentive but not intrusive. Extra points here. Well made drinks, and no chintzing on the booze. (Shaken, not stirred) More points. I am not in the rating  business (yeah right), but if I was I would tell Mr. Michelin that this place deserves five yelp stars. 

I'll be back for the crab.
author: Larry F.

description: the best garlic crab in the city period! 1 of my top favorite places to go, but if your cheap or broke go some where else and dont waist your time with joe's crab shack that's the mcdonald's of crab if you want real seafood this is where its at.
author: FRISCASSO T.

description:
The waiter was great, fun energy. He really knew his stuff. We ordered the crab and it was good. But way too much butter for my liking. The crab fondue is not worth it, there was barley any crab and it was basically an overpriced spinach dip. 
Definitely a tourist trap, but a decent place to eat dinner.
author: Kelly Y.

description:
The girls and I originally had birthday dinner plans somewhere else, but due to us running late, getting lost, and blaming each other for being late..we had to drive around to see what was still open since we didn't make our other reservations. We stumbled upon Crab House, and let me tell you...we were so not dressed for the part. It felt like the smell of the sea was locked up and sealed inside this restaurant. Blehh. It was a bit cramped and small but we were seated by the window, which was nice.  

Our waiter showed up shortly after we were seated. We got a chance to look at the menu and decided to order a few items to share. Our choices included: garlic steamed clams, zuppa di pesce (mixed seafood stew), garlic noodles, and the crab feast (roasted in their secret garlic sauce, serves 4 people). We finished everything we ordered, so that's a good sign. The highlight of our meal was definitely the crab. It was a bit messy, but it was so tasty. The sauce was very unique and even the shells had flavor while we're biting into it. 

This was an unexpected visit but it was surely an enjoyable one.
author: Dung N.

description:
Im not a super seafood fan, but the two plates we had were delicious! Plus the view of the bay is great!
We ordered the Crab and a Burger. The crab was very tasty. Make sure to dip it in the sauce left over in the pan! The burger was moist, it was served on a baguette i think it was and a bed of field green lettuce. The garlic fries that came with the burger were a big hit! It had tons of garlic on it even enough left over to eat with some crab.
I would definitely recommend this place and go back when i go to visit san francisco!
author: Jennifer T.

description:
I AM A SUCKER FOR SEAFOOD!!! 

I was brought here one day as a "surprise." Thankfully that person knew EXACTLY what I love. I was surprised this place was not filled to its capacity since the food was so good. I actually did not go all out at this restaurant and order everything I felt like eating. I ended up eating some kind of pasta with lobster (taken out of shell) and the fried calamari. It was DEEEELICIOUS and filling! I kind of wished I would have ordered some crab or something but I didn't want to get messy but I guess I can save that for next time. The service was outstanding. Our server was so nice and fast when we asked for something and the bread was sooooo good too. I would definitely go back one day with one of my girlfriends and pig out.
author: Jennifer K.

description: A touristy spot, but since I was a tourist when I came here a few weeks back I gave it a go and was pleasantly surprised. I wasn't in the mood to work on a whole crab so I tried the crab enchilada. Good, though if you're a crab fan you may feel the spice and richness of the dish overwhelm the delicate meat. Excellent service and a surprisingly good value, with a limited but fairly well chosen selection of wines to accompany. A quick note for the woman seated next to me at the community table who decided to treat me to a filibuster about how she could cook everything on the menu better: Unless you also have a highly successful restaurant with one of the most beautiful views in the world, shut the hell up.
author: Steve D.

description:
First time here. 
Let me say that I love crab. I had the Killer crab. It was just OK, a bit overpowered by the cup full of garlic butter that was poured over top of the crab before service. I also ordered some mixed baked veggies, they came out drenched in the same garlic butter. The flavor of the garlic butter was great, but I paid for the crab.
author: Chad S.

description: Ordered the crab feast for 6 people and crab chowder.  Delicious but how can it not be, crab is already good but put some seasoning on it and then deep fried, it is heaven.  I ate so much crab that night that unfortunately I was crabbed out for the rest of the trip.  But it is not their fault I am glutenous.  They give you a bib which is awesome so you can pig out and not stain your clothes.
author: Tammy P.

description: Just tried this restaurant and it's one of the best. I believe between Fog Harbor and this, I'll take crab house. We were at Fog house last month but for crab I'll pick Crab House hands down. We ordered the crab feast for the family (2+2teenagers), a crab chowder and of course my beer. They provide bread and you can ask for more if you want to. Crab chowder is great but it seems a bit cold for me. Flavor and taste is good, we all liked it. Garlic noodles is good, we were not expecting that :). So a must order to partner with your crab. For the crab feast we like it just like how they serve it, with butter and lemon. It tastes good. I believe it's equivalent to 3 whole crab. It doesn't include any of the crab head so if you are like us who wants the fatty stuff from the head of the crab order the too two crab instead. Customer service is ok and they gave us a good table that has a view, as requested. Overall, for crab at Pier 39, this is the place.
author: jojo a.

description: We took our boy here for his 9th birthday dinner. Casual environment, which was perfect for us since we tend to be loud and goofy when we're all together, but the seating area was pretty tight. Five of us were squeezed into a small-ish booth, but it we're family, so we didn't mind. Anyhow, we ordered crab, shrimp pasta, a fish burger, and regular burger. All of the food was good. No complaints. It wasn't spectacular, but it wasn't terrible by any means. The crab could have used a bit more sauce and seasoning, but it tasted fresh.
author: Chenoa N.

description: Despite this being in a touristy area, this place keeps bring me back. I love love love this place. Their crab is to die for, I can't get enough of it. I always finish a whole crab by my lonesome and I don't care if I get judged. Sure you smell like crab a bit afterwards but that's just part of the charm. If you plan on going out afterwards I suggest to eat quickly or find a place to shower because everyone orders the crab here and the smell sticks to your clothing if you sit and talk for a while.
author: Christina S.

description: Good crab and mussels....a bit expensive but the view of the GG bridge on a nice day added to the experience...Pier 39 is such a tourist trap, but it was an overall good meal when looking for a good dungeoness crab.
author: Kevin E.

description: My friend took me here because she said that they have great lobster paste. But I didn't not order a lobster paste I wasn't too hungry so I just order a ceaser salad and a crab chower.  I have lots of clam chower but never have a had crab chower n I have to admit that I like the crab better.  Their crab chower was pretty good and will recommend it to my friends.  So my friend order what she order last time she was here the lObster paste and I had a shared of it and she was right. It was pretty good. And the lobster was in chunks n not small pieces.  Definately go back to orde that.
author: Jenny C.

description: Another great Yelp find! I was skeptical since the restuarant is at the heart of tourist central, but these are some good eats. Spltting lots of crab for two is heaven in my book. It's a must every trip and last time I had to go twice. I just couldn't get enough perfectly seasoned sweet dungeness crab. Gosh! I wish I could have it for dinner tonight and tomorrow.... and well, you get the idea.
author: Kellee K.

description: The roast crab is excellent.  For lunch, we order 3 lbs of crab to share for 2 people.  It was filling enough but we definitely could eat more.  It's so delicious.
author: Veronica L.

description:
They may sound a little unimpressive ... "garlic fries" ... but these fries will knock your socks off!!!! They were medium cut, hella garilic-y sticks of gold (pure gold!). I think it's safe to say that these were the best fries I've ever had ... and I've had a lot of fries in my life.

The crab cakes were nummy (two itty bitty things, but that's the type of restaurant this is). I had the mussels and seared shrimp. MMM! Those shrimps were real good! The mussels were sort of just okay ... they kinda had the aftertaste of riverwater or something.

But definitely, DEFINITELY try their garlic fries. They're like going to a mariah carey concert circa 1996 when her voice wasn't all shot.
author: Kevin C.

description:
For a regular crab eater the sparkling reviews on yelp are slightly overrated. We went on a Sunday night and was worried about the long lines but got a table (window!) in 15 minutes, mostly because everyone was quoted a 30 minute wait time and left their name to walk around pier 39 but we stayed and skipped to us quickly.

Had whole crab, garlic fries and crab chowder.

Crab was ok, it came quicker than the chowder but was super hot. Seemed smaller than the claimed 2+ lbs but obviously I couldn't have weighed it. Texture was ok, their secret sauce is basically butter with garlic. If you're here only for their crab, I wouldn't exclude this place but I felt like there could've been better.

Garlic fries were great! If you're wondering how the portion is like the small size was probably in between a McDonald's medium and large, enough for two people as a side.

Crab chowder was great until you ate all the crab meat, which was plenty but never would've been enough! Get the bowl not the cup, even if it seems too much,it's just a better deal.
author: Jason H.

description:
We opted for this one because it's on the Pier and kept showing up in other travel sites and reviews... My hubby and I had barely a 15 min wait.. but WOW!!  this is HOW the  Dungeness crab is supposed to taste!!  We  also opted for Crab Alfredo which was about as decadent as one can get right? Of course we shared  both) the whole crab (2+lb) and a side of  garlicky fries.. this was more than enough and just YUM all around!  
Only downside: the table we ended up getting was just too small for all paraphernalia you need when partaking in the "CRAB" and our server, while nice enough was clearly having an off night she just kept forgetting things/ taking things away that we still needed but she was gracious enough to right her wrongs and politely say "sorry" so no foul there.  We said we'd gladly wait a bit more for a larger table next time.. plus this place is really cute and they have the most rolls of TP in the bath we've ever seen lol..
author: Sopla R.

description: My husband and I came here last night to celebrate some good news that we received. There was only about a 1 minute wait to get in when we got there around 7:00 PM on a Monday night. We were seated at a table near the window but a large wall blocked the view, we were okay with that since we had not requested a window seat. After we ordered our drinks, someone came by and offered to move us to a table that did have a window view, which was very nice. Through no fault of the restaurant, a large group was seated near us that was really loud. I believe they were celebrating a birthday and every couple minutes they would start shouting. One of the waiters kept egging them on, so it only got worse as the night progressed. As far as the food goes, it was pretty good but way over priced. I ordered the crab alfredo and my husband ordered the killer crab. My husband usually takes leftovers home when we go out to eat, but left The Crab House still hungry after his meal. I have to say that my meal portion was small for the price as well! When we left there was a line out the door to get in. Overall, the food was good but not worth the money in my opinion.
author: Becky R.

description: My friends and I probably chose the wrong time to go to the Crab House because none of us were hungry enough to try the massive crabs (I was quite jealous as several of them passed by).  However, I had the crab cakes which were truly full of delicious crab meat - instead of a bunch of bread like some restaurants' crab cakes. The complimentary bread was a little hard - but hey, it's complimentary.  The service was excellent. In addition to providing the expected level of service (suggestions, food delivery in a timely manner, friendliness, etc.), my friend broke the bottle of vinegar and people came from all over to clean it up in a hurry.  They were very nice about it.  I will definitely come back to visit Crab House whenever I'm in the area again.
author: Maria C.

description: Welcome to Crabtown, CA. I'd recommend one whole crab per head and make sure to dip the meat in the sauce that comes on the skillet. Buttery, garlicky, peppercorn sauciness. Pricey, but good times.
author: Ronnie S.

description:
Walking along Pier 39, there are all kinds of smells; chowder, donuts, chocolate, sea lions, but where is that garlic and crab smell coming from? It is coming from the Crab House At Pier 39! 

Location, location, location... located at the end of the Pier, level two, walk the plank for some of the most mouthwatering seafood you will ever eat..
