The restaurant is very inviting with its aromas, beautiful views of the Bay, white linen tablecloths and an open fire pit to add that cozy, I am here to relax and enjoy feeling. 

I have a bad habit. When I am being seated, instead of smiling at patrons, while walking by, I am peering at their plates to see what they are eating! So trip me, at least I get a good feel for the food. 

We are not talking inexpensive, but we are talking fresh and creative dishes that do not disappoint. Since there were four of us, we were able to sample quite a bit. of appetizers and entrees. 

Before you even think of ordering, let me tell you, their bread is not to be skipped! We ordered and shared the garlic bread with fresh mozzarella melted on top, the cheese was optional, you can have the wonderful garlic bread without and I do believe they also had a Bruschetta. Why is the bread so important, is because it is a fine tool for lapping up garlic butter sauces or the clinging remains of your chowder. Looks better than licking the plates. 

Ina Garten taught me years ago to roast my shrimp, even for shrimp cocktail, instead of putting it into water, which removes so much of the flavor. I even do this for my shrimp and potato chowder. The Crab House agrees with Ina, because they roast their shellfish and drizzle it with their secret garlic oil and serve it with a side of garlic, butter dipping sauce. I love secrets! I do believe shallots was one of those secrets in the sauce. 

The mussels and shrimp served in a hot iron pan were to die for, some of the best mussels I have ever had. The Crab Chowder was loaded with flavor and crab. We didn't share the chowder, but we did share a wonderful Caesar topped with fresh Dungeness crab meat. 

Two of us had the roasted Crab Legs. I am still dreaming about them. San Francisco is known for their fresh caught Dungeness Crab and not only are these fresh they are cooked and seasoned to perfection. We also ordered the crab cakes, very good and loaded with meat and the Zuppa di Pesce, which is a seafood stew with fresh crab and shellfish. You need more than a spoon to eat this, hands are required to remove shells from the shrimp. I had one bite and passed it along. It was very tasty, but too much playing with my food. If I had been at home, I would have held onto that bowl tightly.

If you love crab, like I love crab, you will want for nothing in the way of it here. Crab appetizers, stews, chowders, salads, pastas, in shell, crab enchiladas, hot crab melts and even an omelet. They also serve burgers, steaks and fish. 

We did have to wait for our table, but they do have a lovely bar and lounge. I had one of their house specialty drinks, which was their own version of a Bloody Mary. I don't recall the name of it, but it was enough to turn you into, well,  wanting one everyday. 

The Chef is from Italy and has several other restaurants in and around San Fran. When visiting some restaurants in a tourist area, you tend to feel like it is a cattle drive to get you in and out. You will not feel this here. Very friendly and competent service from the moment that you walk in and they tie bibs on you, once seated!. 

I highly recommend reservations and do ask for a window seat. Dress is casual elegance, remember this is a known tourist area.
author: DJ M.

description: We saw that the Crab House at Pier 39 had some good reviews so decided to take friends there for lunch.  We were very disappointed with the food and price.  I'm sorry but $38.00 for a small sized crab is ridiculous.  It is crab season here and crab at restaurants are usually about $20.00-$25.00.  Our crab smelled a little like ammonia which means it was starting to rot.  We ordered a house gin & tonic which they charged us $10.00 for and an Anchor Steam beer was $8.00.  There are much better restaurants to go to in the area...STAY AWAY FROM THIS ONE!  Rip Off for sure!
author: Dan R.

description:
Came here with three friends on a Saturday night and were seated within twenty minutes. We ordered the medium iron skillet -roasted mussels, zuppa di pesce, crab cakes, and 3lbs of their Killer Crab.

Within several minutes of ordering, the crab cakes came out. I was a bit dissapointed at first. The dish is $15 and it only contained 2 small cakes, roughly 2" in diameter and 1" thick. Once i bit into it, however, I was thoroughly impressed. It was delicious and not drenched in butter like most other places. The exterior was seared to a nice crispy texture and the inside was moist and filled with dungeness crab flavor.

The Zuppa Di Pesce (mixed seafood stew) came out immediately after the crab. There were tons of seafoody things in there. Clams, mussels, squid, shrimp, etc., etc., and they were all bathing in a perfect stew. The stew even had a hint of spiciness to it. It drove me insane! in a good way.

Next came the mussels and the crab. The mussels were great! When they brought it out to us they poured some kind of liquid all over the dish causing it to steam like a volcano about to erupt. The smells were phenomenal. The mussels were cooked to a perfection. None of the pieces i ate were rubbery at all and had the simplest most delicate flavor. 

The crab was good. Not great, but good. The seasoning (roasted in their secret garlic sauce) was good and all but It was overcooked. It was very similar to asian style crab stir fry. I've definitely had better. 

All in all. I'm very impressed with this place.The food was superb and the service was excellent; The wait staff was very attentive and quick. I definitely recommend this place!
author: chris s.

description:
This is my first review because I thought this baffling experience warranted a write-up.  Overall the food was very good, as my party of 3 ordered a two for too (??) crab feast which ended up consisting of two huge crabs.  The garlic fries were good as well.  The food was not the problem, because we ended up enjoying it very much.  

Now, I'm not a picky diner or someone that generally gets upset over service, I'm not really that upset now, just insulted.  Apparently our order was misplaced to the table beside us, with two nice ladies, and they started eating away at one of our crabs.  About halfway through one of the crabs, they ask the bus boy where the shrimp portion of their meal was, since they had ordered the "Crabs and Shrimp for Two."  After a few moments of confusion, it looked like he realized the mistake and took it back.  After returning with the ladies' actual entree, which appeared to be a completely different meal, I had a suspicion that he'd try to pull something on us by bringing out the previously eaten meal.  I suspended that suspicion for about the ten minutes it took for him to re-arrange the two crabs to make it look like they weren't touched, because obviously, I didn't think anyone could be that stupid to think that something like that would have worked?  Especially since we were dining right next to the table that he just picked that up from?  

Whoops.

So of course he brings it out, and out of the corner of my I, I could see him conferring with his bus-boy buddies, smirking and giggling.  At first I could only see that two legs were missing, and I was going to let it go.  After taking the shell of one crab and noticing half of it eaten, with the entrails all mixed up, I had to say something.  Called him over to let him know that we knew what he was up to, and he came over with the same grin and a "you-caught-me" look.  

It's not upsetting, just extremely baffling and insulting.  Never thought that something like that would be within the realm of possibility, but people have a habit of surprising you.

Food:  4/5 excellent, but pricy (68.95 for 2 big crabs that the three of us shared comfortably.)

Service:  the waitress was very nice, but didn't check up on us as much as we would have liked.  The pitcher was empty towards the end of our meal and we probably could have use some more water.  3/5 (minus 3 for the bus boy fiasco.)

I think I'll average it out to a 2.
author: Tam V.

description:
crab for 2: flavoring was very good, however you can tell the crab was not fresh. It was covered with white residue, the kind you have when crab was previously frozen.  The meat was to minced, it just kind of fell apart.

there was a bad smell, the dirty water smell that was pretty distracting because you are questioning how clean everything is.

the decor was very cheesy but I guess it fits since its a tourist attraction

the service was good, very friendly and attentive.
author: Anna T.

description: Not what it used to be... The crab was suck your fingers scrumptious about two years ago... Now it's very simple... The sauce has declined. Garlic noodles and Mojitos are still great though!
author: Lasheil J.

description:
We did not order crab when we at the Crab House. We had the crab chowder which was amazing. The fish and chips was extremely salty. I could not eat the outside of the fish because it was that salty. The crab dip was OK and it was opposite from the fish and chips because it needed more seasoning. 

I was sitting where the sun was shining in my eyes. The bathroom was extremely dirty, but expected on the Pier. Other than that, the staff was very friendly.
author: Linh R.

description:
I am no stranger to fresh crab, so I thought this place was only 'good' and not 'great.' The garlic sauce is fairly mild in comparison to the Stinking Rose.  Thankfully, they provide bibs, otherwise there could have been casualties. I went during a weekday so seating was not a problem, and we had a wonderful view.  We also tried the garlic fries as was recommended by alot of reviewers on Yelp.  At first, i was disappointed, as I didn't believe that it lived up to the rave reviews.  However, the more I had it, the better I liked it.

Lastly, not sure if this was just a coincidence, by we paid in cash, but the incorrect change was brought back, eventhough he acknowleded that we gave him a certain amount??

Only because I am a crab nut, and I had expected to be wowed would I give it 3 stars, otherwise, it would defintely be 4.
author: Jone H.

description: we went to san francisco fro Christmas, i have dinner reservation another restaurant but when we show up they are closing in like 20 mn. we walk around and the only restaurant open with 45 mn waiting time was the crab house. the restaurant manager come outside and ask me how many are on my party and i respond 8 ppl. he give us a table less the 10 mn. the place pricey but is so delicious and fresh.
author: Ronny J.

description:
Came here with my sister today and we ordered...

Double Shrimp and Double Crab
I felt like it was too greasy and buttery and salty. Also I wasn't very into the dipping sauce. I preferred just cracking the crab which was already doused in butter to begin with and eating the meat like that.

Clam Chowder
It was ok but kind of watery, not salty enough, not too much crab meat in there and I really would have just prefered normal thick clam chowder.

Garlic Fries
Perfectly crisp with just the right amount of garlic. SOOO GOOD!!

Bread Rolls
Must have been good considering I ate 2.5 loaves on my own.

All in all i can't even believe my sister and I finished all the food. We must be fat asses.

This restaurant is ok but I don't think I would come back especially with the price.
author: Em F.

description: We came here from a friends recommendation. Unfortunately the crab was disappointing. The crabs are frozen crabs and not very fresh. The butter and garlic sauce was too salty. We also ordered the mussels which were good. However the calamari was not very good. This place is a tourist trap.
author: Kate N.

description:
this place. eh.. it was okay! and its HOT INSIDE this building... not the greatest feeling

we got the mussels, shrimp, n crab combo, Medium Garlic Fries, 2 of their special drinks, and a sprite. Price: $70-80

went with a friend and we love shrimp and crab, but the skillet was mainly mussels(small muscles), VERY small portion of crab and shrimp. i guess we have been spoiled from boiling crab in san jose with an enormous amount of jumbo shrimp and tasty crab. the shrimp here are SMALL, and the amount of crab we got... SMALL as well. Crab was overcooked. We also got the garlic fries that everyone have been talking about. To be honest, those weren't that great as well. I was hoping for more garlic taste. We ordered their special drinks. melon mojito and crabby mood drink. 9 dollars each, NOT WORTH IT! ALSO!!! we asked for a sprite since we weren't satisfied with our other drinks. We drink our sprite.. NO taste at all, just carbonation!!!

SEVICE- our waiter was not a happy camper. Our only good service and reason for 2 stars is that we made reservations here online on yelp and we made it on time and got called for a table right away while other still have been waiting for a long time. the only PLUS STAR to our visit. The other star was for our ticked validation.

Other than that. I most likely wouldnt come here again.
author: kathleen v.

description: This place should be called Bell Pepper House. Why would a chef who hates the flavor of crab work at a restaurant called the Crab House?! This is the only explanation we can imagine that would account for bell peppers completely obliterating the flavor of the crab, in not only the crab cakes, but the CRAB CHOWDER, as well. Since there is no rating of zero stars, this single star is for the apologetic waitress and the bread and butter. Unless all you want to taste (for hours) is bell pepper, find your crab somewhere else.
author: Kieron G.

description:
A bit expensive, but good-quality crab.  The meat literally falls off the shell and tastes just right.

This doesn't surprise me, since this place is owned by the same folks who own Dead Fish over in Crockett.

Good selection of drinks, and friendly service.  Did I mention the view?  Yep, this place is filled with tourists, but hey at least they smile and are usually a lot less uptight than all the snotty snarky transplants that live in SF these days.
author: Justin C.

description: Tight seating. Touristy so high prices expected. Great food.
author: Karen W.

description: Good but what's with the wine/soy/butter sauce that goes all over the crab? Great service. Expensive prices but able to make it reasonable considering the amount of food. Full crab and a small mussels with two beers was under $80. Great views of half the city, the bay and the golden gate peeking through the fog. Yeah, I guess the food doesn't have to be the only factor. I'm giving it the extra fourth star for the service, view and overall experience.
author: Kathryn M.

description: I was very disappointed. We drove out from LA and were actually really hungry. Sadly this place did not deliver. It was stuffy and very noisy. The waitress didn't warn me about the oil used to flavor the mussels and I ended up with oil splashed in my eyes and on my boyfriend's arm. She didn't even apologize. We had the crab chowder which was missing a lot of flavor. The mussels and shrimp were ok but frankly I prefer the Stinking Rose's version of these platters. It definitely didn't satisfy our appetites at all.
author: Agnes D.

description: Been here a few times..... It's "ok". Even when you have reservations you end up waiting. It's fun when you come with a group.
author: Irma R.

description:
2.5 rounded down because current rating of 4 stars is way too high for this place.

service was rather speedy, like we still were eating our soup and salad when the entrees showed up.

crab chowder was all right.

my trout was decent but not standout
author: Jeff G.

description: Better than average seafood but great bread! We planned to have lunch here since we were strolling along doing the tourist thing in the area.  It wasn't crowded for lunch because it was a Monday.  The service was very good and the decor was funky but clean. We had the chowder (white of course) cioppino, crab omelet and the crab cakes.  One of the better meals we've had in the Fisherman's Wharf/Pier 39 area.
author: Harry Y.

description: Killer Crab is great. Good Value. Waiting time is a bit long.
author: Terry W.

description: I like the crab taste here, and the staffs are really friendly. The atmosphere is awesome, great view. But I am not so sure if their crab is fresh because the crab meat is kind of dry, i think I had it fresher and more watery at Joe's crab shack. But still, it's a good place to have some seafood.
author: Suabot J.

description: Very good food, great service. Took some out of town friends on a week night. No wait. Of course, the views from the Pier are always breathtaking.
author: Thomas B.

description:
Normally, you can't get me within a mile of Fisherman's Wharf, but a few years ago a group of us were going to Cobb's Comedy Club and needed a place to eat.  I got stuck with the task and not knowing any restaurants in the area, stumbled on to the Crab House.  We had a large group and it was last minute, so away we went.

Expecting a dumpy tourist trap with terrible food, I couldn't have been more pleased.  Sure, the decor is a bit kitschy, but it works.  The service was great with ample drink choices and... *wait for it* buckets of Coronitas!  The best part is the cracked crab, which is drowning in garlic butter.  We've been back a half-dozen times over the years since and have never been disappointed.

On the negative side, the rest of the menu is mediocre at best, but if you want to pig out on excellent crab, this is the place to do it.  Just be sure to wear one of the plastic bibs.
author: Mark B.

description: Killer crab tastes reeeeally good. Remember to reserve for the hot spot that embrace the sea.
author: Yun W.

description: Got in for an early dinner and beat the friday night rush.  Our waitress Katri was very nice and beyond the standard service. The crab here is excellent and a must have if you're eating here. You will likely spend a little bit here but it is very worth it. It is among a number of seafood restaurants at pier 39 by Fisherman's wharf.
author: Thomas V.

description:
Visited this place for the first time on Christmas Day. Had a reservation and requested a window table, and we were accommodated no problem.

The dining area looks a little cramped, with not much room to move around, but we had a large table with plenty of room for me & my girlfriend.

Ordered the crab & shrimp skillet, which was fantastic. Lots of flavor and the service was excellent.
We also ordered the crab fondue, which was more of a chard & crab dip, but also good.
Had a mixed greens salad & garlic fries on the side. Salad was good, but oily. I'd get the dressing on the side next time. Didn't really like the garlic fries. The fries themselves seemed over-processed. I've had better in the club level at AT&T Park. Overall it was a good experience. There were many other items on the menu that piqued my curiosity. I will definitely be back.
author: Hashim A.

description: Fun experience...getting bib tied around your neck and getting all gooey-buttery with crab guts.  REALLY buttery.....Good food,  not spectacular.   Garlic fries were pretty good.  Really no reason to go unless you LOVE crab and digging through it for meat.  I don't think its worth the money though...$35 for 1 crab.  Great view...pretty much expected for a tourist-trap.
author: Ken B.

description:
Bruschetta = delicious

Garlic fries = delicious

Killer Crabs = tasty, but the dungeness crab meat is not naturally sweet, so it requires massive flavoring - also, messy to eat and you should definitely wear the crab bib

Pastas = terrible.  don't get this.

Overall - okay experience but VERY expensive considering the quality of the food.  Definitely a tourist trap.  Also, everything is cooked with a lot of butter, so it's not that great for your palate.  

Service is great and quick.  Food comes out very fast.
author: Diana N.

description: Best crab hands down in SF.Crab is very juicy,they serve you a nice portion,and crabs are very big.A little pricey but worth it.Garlic seasoning was mouth watering.overall 5/5
author: Bizzle T.

description:
How have I not reviewed this place yet?!?!
I recommend it to all out of towners for seafood in SF.... located in Pier 39, beautiful views of the bay (Especially during sunset!) and fantastic food! 
Hmm lets see.... well the whole menu is good. DONE :)

But more specifically: the cioppino is delicious, as is the zuppa de pesce, the mussel/shrimp/crab skillet (which has too many mussels, so i would go for one of the other ones), foggy wharf w/crab salad, mojitos, hmm anndddd I need to go there again to list more things in this review :D
author: Sofia J.

description: Great restaurant with great food. The pasta and crab dinner was fantastic. We had a wonderful experience here. Highly recommended.
author: Sandro C.

description:
YUM.

The bruschetta was delicious.

The 2-person crab was awesome.

The shrimp/mussel combo was amazing.

I had great service, a great time, really good food, a huge smile and a really big bill. No complaints!
author: Hue M.

description:
This seafood restaurant is great. The decor has a very Northwestern/ New England feel to it. The restaurant is surrounded by other great seafood restaurants.

 If cost is not an issue, this place is great for a family gathering. Do not bring a date to this place if it is the first time out on the town. Crab+ Eating With Your Hands= A Mess. The crab, mussels, and scallops are awesome and ultra fresh.
author: Ed M.

description:
Crab House is obviously a tourist trap and I definitely had my reservations walking in, but considering our dwindling dining options in the area, we decided to give it a try.  Sometimes it's nice to have low-to-no expectations because that's when you can be pleasantly surprised.  That's exactly what happened to me at Crab House.

The service was pretty good.  The waitress brings out plastic bibs prior to serving you the food.  I believe it's actually her job to tie the bib on you.  I'm not much of a bib person myself.  I don't mind getting a little down and dirty for the sake of good eats (What, I've got crab in my hair?  Eh, I'll just save it for later!), but she seemed so earnest in her request to put it on so I let her.  

We certainly did have a crab feast that night.  Crab cakes, crab chowder and the signature Killer Crab (plus a salad that actually went really well with the crab cakes).  I was afraid it would be too much food and we wouldn't be able to finish it.  I'm not usually shy about taking home doggy bags, but considering the mini-fridge in the hotel was gonna charge us to put personal items in it, I wasn't keen on the idea of having leftovers.  I needn't have worried.

The Killer Crab came on a sizzling platter of garlic, butter, and olive oil sauce, which was perfect for dipping the relinquished crab meat.  Too bad for the crab that it went from being imprisoned in the shell only to find itself locked in my belly.  Delicious.  In fact, every last morsel of crab we ate was delicious.

After we ate here, I saw ads for it in just about every tourist magazine, pamphlet, etc.  I felt slightly cheesy for having eaten there...but I didn't feel the least bit crabby.
author: Kristine R.

description: Nice ambience, and great food - their specialty crab is a highlight. Only let down by a gruff waitress!
author: John S.

description:
I LOVED this place! I am a huge crab lover, so this is the place to be! Beware of crazy people fight over window tables!! These women were being so rude & demanding they get a window seat after they were seated at a table all while two other parties had been waiting (for a while) to be seated at those window tables being cleaned. At the ended the beeechy women didn't get the window table after all. That's what they get for being CRABBY! ha.

Moving on to the food shall we?! I tried the crab chowder and I actually liked it! It was different and I actually got quite a bit of crab as opposed to some reviewers who claimed it was watered down and barely had crab - maybe I was early and got the good stuff?! I also ordered the Hot Crab Melt Sandwich with garlic fries and it was huge and oh-so tasty! I was in love! My sister also loved what she ordered as well and the service was fast & friendly. I would absolutely come back!
author: Miss V.

description: By the reviews I was expecting an an amazing dinner but it was just okay. The food came out fast the waitress was friendly but the food was just okay and was pretty expensive for what you get which is expected because of the location... Wish the food was better to give a better review!
author: Kelly W.

description:
Yeah, their garlic butter crabs were good.  Definitely worth it.  And for a little over $30/person, our group ate very well that afternoon.  We has had the mussels (good), garlic fries (yum), garlic noodle (okay), crab chowder (good but a little too much fillers in it) and of course the crab (YUM!!!)

Didn't have a long wait either even though we had a bigger group but then again, it was around 2 PM in the afternoon so maybe we missed the weekend tourist lunch rush.  Service was also very attentive.
author: Penn T.

description: Took the family there to celebrate my wife's birthday. We really enjoyed the food. Their garlic seasoned crab was very good. I would highly recommend the grilled shrimp and garlic fries as well. The waiter was nice enough to bring out some desert with a bday candle. We had reservations but arrived an hour early and they were still able to seat us fairly quick. We definitely look forward to going back again.
author: sung k.

description:
Food was good
Service was overbearing
Food seemed priced okay for the location (Note: Pier 39 is a tourist trap)
author: Raymond F.

description: Amazing as usual. They seated us immediately at our reservation time. The crabs,  mussels and shrimp were perfectly tender bathing in their garlicky splendor. They also make the best Caesar salad. I am normally not particularly thrilled with restaurant salads so this is a big deal! The side if garlic noodles are a must have as well. I visit here every time I come to San Fran.
author: Pam R.

description: Food is good except for the bread. .bread was hard as a rock...don't get the Asian waitress...the bus boys were better than her!!! would have gotten more stars,  but the service just brought it down...too bad...oh get the garlic fries though...yummy
author: MadiMoo A.

description:
I was told "STAY AWAY FROM THE TOURIST TRAPS IN FISHERMANS WHARF, IT'S ALL CRAP" but we had some friends that had visited before and highly recommended this place. 

Butter, garlic, and dungeness crab legs. What else can you ask for!? We ordered the feast and upon first glance, I thought it was waaaay too much food for our group of 6. We ordered the garlic noodles, garlic fries, crab chower, and a side of mussells. Ya, a lot of food. Well, our fat asses ate everything. The crab was awesome, and I really liked the noodles. Lots of garlic :) Everything we had was really good. We even had the scenery of a dead sea lion to accompany the meal. Nice touch.
author: Diana V.

description:
So I went with the general Yelp review and ordered the killer garlic crab.  Boy was it HOT!  The cast iron dish came to the table sizzling and popping and the crab shells were crispy, slathered with a lumpy brown garlic sauce.  But then the waiter came over right after the food was delivered to ask me if I knew how to eat the crab.  What?!  Are you serious???

What an odd comment...

Well, I paid $19.95 for a 1/2 order of the crab and what that meant was only four crab legs.  FOUR!  That's it!  For twenty bucks!  That's way overpriced.  The crab was good, but I don't think I would come back to pay that much for that little food.  BTW, they also give you a free mini sourdough baguette, but I didn't even eat it because the bread crust was so hard that I had to struggle to rip off a piece of it.  Sorry, hard bread is not my thing.

Recommended for those willing to pay the high prices.
author: Cynthia L.

description: Mom visited from NY and she loved it. The do something magical to those crab legs. Service was fast as well!! I will be back!
author: Dishon M.

description:
Yelpers you have disappointed me!  Went here based on yelp reviews and left hungry and broke. 
 
Ordered: Crab chowder, fish and chips, angel hair lasagna and the mussel, shrimp and crab combinations.

Every one said that the crab chowder was really Good but sadly it had this cheese taste that I didn't like. It had a santa fe type of taste to it. The combination platter was subpar. there was not a lot of crab for about $30 and it wasn't as flavorful as I would have liked. we are next to the pier all the seafood should taste delicious...come on...
The mussels, though, were delicious. The shrimps were not peeled so i had a hard time eating it. 
The lasagna was very cheesy. I didn't like it at all. The fish and chips was okay because of the garlic fries. They use a bassa (catfish/bottom feeder) that did not taste fishy which I liked. 
Now here is what I hate...CRAP service. The service was horrible. The woman who served us didn't even have a smile. I had to ask her for water two times because the pitcher they gave us was empty. she also forgot our garlic fries that we ordered but we didn't even mention it because the food was so awful. This women was NOT personable. WHY was she a server?? Every question we asked was met with a mean/annoyed look and a monotoned answer. It was not even busy... and there was runners and bussers and all for her. COME ON.  GET A PERSONALITY.

NOW for all this mediocre food and crap service I left with - $125. Seriously guys.. this is just a tourist attraction. DO NOT eat here just because you are on the pier. ITs obvious everyone who yelped this establish with high stars was blinded by propaganda or doesn't know real food.
SO SAD!!

and BTW -- that garlic sauce tasted like nothing.
author: Samantha H.

description: Over all the crab and garlic fried are the bomb...I can't wait to go again
author: Heather P.

description:
Very slow service once we were finally seated.  This is basically an over priced tourist trap but we were hungry!

If you're not afraid of garlic then you have to try the garlic fries. They're slightly crunchy on the outside and they are smothered with garlic and grated parmesan cheese. 

They only serve dungeness crab here so don't expect any snow crabs or anything else. I think the saving grace for their crab was the garlic sauce.  If you don't like to pick at the body of the crab for meat then don't  order the whole crab.

I had the foggy wharf salad or foggy something with crab on top. It could have used a bit more of their soy vinegarette dressing but it wasn't too bad.  

For the gluten conscious, the crab and regular salad with the ginger dressing were the only thing close to gluten free.  The garlic fies are not gluten free because they're cooked in the same oil as something else that's battered.
author: Old W.

description:
There are two equallly good routes with cooking sea food
1. focus on the natural taste and try enhance it, but do little as possible - think sushi (at least the traditional eat-way), or lightly seasoned fish fillet.

2. The very flavorful type, the original raw taste is either mix-in, recreated

And Crab House in my opinion is better in their flavorful dishes.
But many of the dishes are standard seafood dishes and they do them extreamly well, so just get your usual if you don't want to venture and you will be at least happy enough.
author: Johnny D.

description:
Crab chowder for the win!  This place is perfect to watch the sun set over the SF bay.  I came here on a Friday evening for an early dinner.  We were seated quickly and right by a window.  Our waitress was really helpful and explained any questions we had about the menu.

We did a mostly appetizer dinner which is a great way to try a bunch of delicious food.  I split the crab fondue with a friend and had a cup of crab chowder.  The crab fondue is more of a crab, spinach and cheese dip served with crunchy bread.  Very flavorful and tons of crab!  My little cup of crab chowder went on forever! It was filled with crab, corn and other veggies and had a spicy kick to it at the end.  It was good until the last spoonful!

I definitely would come here again.  This place is super comfortable and a great way to end an evening on Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Allegra I.

description: Very good for a tourist trap.  The garlic roasted crab is as good as advertised.  Will definitely come here again.
author: Eric S.

description: The place gets packed, over an hour wait but seats were available at the bar and we went for it.  The bartender was great; good drinks, good service, and her recommendations were all excellent.  I got the whole crab and it was delicious just as it came, no need for dipping sauce.  The clam chowder was very good too.  The  only down side is that the place itself is not very big and it gets cramped inside.
author: Manny L.

description:
7/25/2013 ------  HORRIBLE SERVICE --------------NOT FRIENDLY OR HELPFUL----
Went to San Francisco to celebrate my niece's 16th birthday. Just 10 days prior to this I had major oral surgery. Why is this important to know? Please read on...I was only able to eat soft foods that I could basically swallow with minimal chewing. Mac and Cheese or mashed potatoes, scrambled eggs, ice cream, these were the easiest things to find on menus. 

My Sister, Mother, Niece and I were hungry after shopping and sight seeing and thought we'd give this place a try. The girls ordered a bottle of wine, my niece and I had sodas and they got a large calamari and  order of crab cakes. All while we were deciding to eat for dinner. I already saw they had mac and cheese on the kids menu and was willing to pay whatever it took to eat SOMETHING. Our server, he's from Turkey, I don't recall his name, told me it was against their policy to let me order mac and cheese from the kids menu. TRUST ME SIR, IF I COULD HAVE HAD REAL FOOD I WOULD HAVE, anyway I sat there during my families dinner and ate nothing. We didn't want to leave since they already had their appetizers and wine and were looking forward to their crab but I just can not believe that they wouldn't serve me. I told them I'd pay them as much as a crab dinner cost I just wanted something that I could eat. I will advise my friends and family to find somewhere else to eat down at Fisherman's Wharf. I'm sure the crab is just as good if not better at one of the many OTHER places to eat down there. 

As an example, I went to another restaurant and ordered mashed potatoes. I noticed that all of their salads were served with a hard boiled egg on top. I asked the server if I could get a couple of hard boiled eggs. I explained it was due to a medical condition, not that I didn't want their food it looked great and sure enough I got eggs. She hesitated at first because she didn't know how much they would cost but when my family got their meal I got my eggs. I don't understand why the Crab House could not be so accommodating.
author: Chelley S.

description:
Ok are you kidding me?? I stumbled upon this place somewhat begrudgingly because i am an SF snob and any restaurant at Pier 39 must suck right?? Well that would be incorrect. Once you get beyond the tourists, order the crab enchilada(insanely good) or the crab chowder. Its sooooo good. Ask for Vito..gives waiters a good name with his sunny disposition. 
ps the garlic fries are really good too
oh be prepared, your clothes are gonna smell like fish after eating here, the only downside
author: Not M.

description:
It's Crab Season, Steph! It's Crab Season!!

This is what I've been hearing from my local friends since I moved here earlier this year. 

"You totally missed crab season!?!?" 
"Just wait til the end of November/early December, cuz it's the best time to get crabs in SF!!" 

Yeah, yeah, yeah. But my question is? Did I order the wrong crabs? Because I tried some here and um, really? 

Was it good? Sure. It is hard to go wrong with a sizzling skillet of butter and garlic, but the crab had no taste to it. It wasn't sweet, salty, or any taste really? Just kinda bleh to blah. As for the mess we made eating it, oh that was in full force. Even wearing a bib I managed to get it all over me and that really wasn't a bad thing, since that is kinda par for the crab eating course, right?

As for the place. Well, it's a tourist trap. No doubt about it. And it isn't super cheap either. I think if you weren't a, dare I say the word, foodie, you would probably dig it, but there are so many other fabulous offerings in this city, that I feel bad that people are spending their hard earned dollars here.

On the flip side, I don't really know of anywhere else in the city that is famous for having crab dipped in buttery goodness, so you may be stuck with tourist trap hell.
author: Stephy S.

description: Pretty good stuff. We had the double shrimp & double crab so that worked out to being two-dozen shrimp and a whole crab. Very messy due to the way they prepare it but tasted very good. Just wish the shrimp were larger.
author: Andrew J.

description: Delicious.  Stopped in here for Lunch while on a mini-vacation to SF.  Was promptly seated by the window so we could watch the Sea Lions.  I ordered the whole Dungeness Crab and it was absolutely fantastic.  Perfectly cooked and seasoned.  Be warned however, that if you order the crab, you do not get any sides with it.   I wish my server would have told me that so I could have ordered some fries or slaw to go with it.   My friend had the crab alfredo or something like that and said it was very good.  Ordered a few of their specialty cocktails as well and they were great.  Our little Asian server was so nice and came over and cut up my crab for me.   Very attentive service and tasty food and drinks.
author: Rob N.

description: The killer crab is delicious! The garlic butter the crab is cooked in is great. Loved it a must if visiting San Francisco
author: Tyrone C.

description:
I reserve for 5 ppl and we run out late, the restaurant call and save the table for us for almost 30 min, when we arrive we only wait like 1 min to get to our table.
this is the first time we came to this place, we order the Combo Mussels, Shrimp, & Crab,Bowl of Crab Chowder,garlic noodles, and of course garlic crab, all the food are great. 
and the waiter give very nice service.
I think I will come this place again, 
thanks yelp have the option to make the reservation.
author: Yvette L.

description: The crab here is awesome, been there twice and both times it was phenomenal.   The prices are reasonable for the wharf area.
author: Austin S.

description: I really enjoyed this place. I ended up coming here on NYE, and it was super crowded, but we only ended up waiting about 30mns before our party was called. I didn't really like where my table was placed, but I understand it was crowded and not easy to be as flexible given the occasion. I just don't like being seated in the middle of any restaurant where there are other tables surrounding me from front, back, and both sides. Our waiter was a really cool, and personable guy! He was very good with checking in with us throughout Given it was so crowded. We ordered and were served within 15 mins, which was great. The food was good, (not super awesome as some other places I've been to), but it was worth the money spent. It's also sitting the water, so if you get a good seat, you'd get an even better experience. We spent only ~ $170. I liked this place, and the Cadillac margarita was nice! Kudos to the bartender on nye! Lol ;) if I ever go back though, I'd probably try a different side dish. I got the garlic noodles and added crab meat, which was good, but just as oily as others. I'd want to try the crab cakes. The actual dungeness crab was crispy on the outside, and moist inside. I don't like how they make the crab crispy like that on the outside bc the shell starts to feel like meat, and I kept eating some of the shell from the top of the crab leg lol
author: S K.

description: The bartender here is always friendly and helpful (tipped me off to some other great restaurants), and the crab chowder is always good. Good burgers, too!
author: Michelle S.

description: Crab cakes were real good. Crab Fettichini Alfredo had 2 small pieces of crab. Crab cocktail was way below par. The food definitely was NOT worth the price. I'm sorry I went there. Beer was good. Hard to screw that up.
author: Roz R.

description: Absolutely love the roasted mussels.  We didn't ordered enough the first time.  My kids took it all.  But it is very pricey.  And I didn't like the automatic 18% tip.  Maybe it is a Fisherman's Wharf thing.  But great location and the food is really good.
author: Lisa C.

description: Given the price, I expected something really special and outstanding.  We got the crab cioppino, the crab special, and the fish and chips.  Although everything was tasty, I didn't feel like what we paid was justified, taste-wise. It seems like you're paying more for the experience to eat at Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Peter B.

description: We stopped here after the Alcatraz tour.  I had the mussels, shrimp and crab skillet.  It was Gooooood!!! The seasoning was great and the portions are big.  Others in my party had linguini Alfredo, garlic fries and shrimp skillet.  All were pleased.  The service was great and the drinks are big so refills were not needed.  Would definitely recommend this spot if you want good seafood.
author: Gina B.

description:
Don't think this is a place for tourists. Even the locals eat there. My friend took me here when I was visiting him in SF. I usually avoid restaurants located in tourist hot spots but, we were hungry and my friend recommended it. We were promptly seated and the service was friendly. 

They have different types of Mojitos but, I ordered the regular. It was served in a large glass (biggest Mojito I've ever seen). We ordered a small order of Mussels for an appetizer (they also come in dinner portion) and they were served within 10 minutes on a nice hot sizzling plate with herb and lemon butter. Yummy!!!

I ordered a whole dungeness crab and my friend ordered the hamburger (he does not eat sea food). The crab was perfectly done and the waitress even tried to help me crack the legs. I let her have her moment realizing she was trying to "help a tourist". I guess they do that on a regular basis here. I ate the whole crab in less than 15 minutes. It was one of the best Dungeness crabs I've had. I also ordered a small side of garlic fries and the portion size was huge. Very tasty though!

My friend's hamburger was great. He was very happy with it. Remember that the portion sizes are huge....so, order accordingly. Two people can happily eat a small order of fries. 

Our table had a great view of the sea lions frolicking on the pier. For a moment I felt like one of them considering the way I was eating. 

Definitely recommended.
author: Krsna V.

description:
I was and still am amazed at the fact that there is actually not just a decent restaurant but a GREAT restaurant on Pier 39. I have always had terrible luck when it comes to finding good places to eat in this area, so I was very glad to be introduced to the Crab House.

We ate the garlic clams, which are steamed in a delicious broth, the zuppa di pesce, which was similar to the cioppino except that it had a bigger variety of seafood in it, including fish, crab, octopus, mussels and clams. Aside from the beautiful yet simple presentation of the food, the flavor was fantastic. I didn't really eat anything else, but everyone else as very content with what they had ordered. 

Aside from having excellent food, the Crab House also has excellent drinks and great service.
author: Daniela A.

description:
I wish I could give this place zero which is what it deserves. Here are a few reasons why:

1. I asked the waitress for a straw for my water. She gave me a USED straw. It felt greasy when she handed it to me but I still used it. I put it to my mouth and tasted something sweet!!!!!! Yes, someone else had used it!!

2. I ordered the Cesear salad and the lettuce hidden on the bottom was all rotten. The chef had actually put rotten lettuce in my salad. If that is not bad enough the salad only had a sprinkling of dressing on half or one side of it. I was given something like 7 small whole romaine lettuce leaves (not cut up) that were just laid across the plate. They were mostly yellow and not green. They threw 4 small shavings of cheese on top and  added a piece of bread that was so hard I could not bite it. I am not joking.
I was suppose to be given croutons. I guess this piece of stale hard bread was the crouton.  When I showed the waitress the lettuce she took it in the kitchen and came back and apologized and asked if I wanted some dessert!!! The dessert cost less than the salad and they did not offer to make a new one or give me my money back.

3. The price of the food is outrageous. We bought one side salad, a few bowls of soup and two sandwiches and soft drinks and  Paid $149!  They added in an 18%  tip.  Yes, they automatically added in an 18% tip without saying anything to us about this policy. The waitress received a 20 dollar tip and did not deserve one penny! Is there a law again this? We did not see any sign posted saying they would automatically charge the tip without asking us.

This has to be perhaps the worst restaurant experience that we have ever had.
You would be better off eating anywhere else.
author: Angela B.

description: Their crabs are extremely delicious! We just got the crab legs for 2 @ 49.95 and they were sauteed or marinated in some herbs, garlic and oil. It was to die for!
author: Amy M.

description:
A lot of people don't give this place a chance because it's touristy, but this is really a great seafood restaurant if you into crab. I would rate this as high as the family operated viet crab house (crustation? spelling?)  

Here is my recommendation throughout the years in Crab house.

Appetizers:
Garlic fries with extra Garlic! 
Crab cakes (they really filled up the inside)
Entrees:
Sizzling platter combination (shrimp/mussels/Crab)
Dungeons whole crab

It's funny that everytime the sizzling platter comes out I always get a lot of wohs woos from the people around us.    

Give this restaurant a try!
author: Wei H.

description:
i can't believe it took me a whole week to eat crab after the start of the season.  that's 7 whole wasted days.  damn.

a friend from guatamala was in town and wanted to do the fisherman's wharf thing.  having never been out to eat down there except for in and out- i was kind of at a loss.  but i used rebekah t.'s crab list and found the crab house.  

it was the tuesday before thanksgiving- so i had no idea if it would be busy or not.  turns out- not.  got a great parking spot and hit up the penny arcade beforehand.  love that place.

our table was ready and there were a few other tables full but it was by no means empty.  we got a bit of everything- garlic fries (awesome and huge- that's what she said), crab fondue (for the preggers friend who is crazy bout cheese), crab chowder, garlic bread, garlic noodles (not too impressed with) and crab for 3 (there was 4 adults and one kid eating crab).  you can choose between $100 worth of crab or $50.  we went with the latter and it was plenty, especially with all the sides.  the crab was great and was a good amount for us.  

a non-crab eating friend ordered haddock after asking what the hell it was.  i found that funny- as a kid- all white fish was haddock.  i never knew there were other kinds of fish till i got older.  when he asked the waitress about it- she pronounced it "had dock" and acted like it was an upscale fish.  no way jose- that's poor mans fish in lowell, massachusetts.  and it's not had dock.  it's haduck.

only down side of the meal was the size of the table.  we had 5 adults and a kid.  there was no way we could fit even half of what we ordered on our table.  we had jackets and purses and the huge ass water pitcher on the table next to us, fries and noodles on the windowsill, and fondue balanced on top of the crab contraptions.  we were hitting elbows the whole meal- they need some bigger tables.  and i'm all for going green- but i think the cloth napkins are a joke when you're eating crab.  just saying.

will i go back to the crab house?  for sure... if another out of towner is around. 

and if it's crab season.  

the most wonderful time of the year.
author: Katie H.

description: I was so unhappy when we placed our order. We had two entrees, appetizer and alcoholic beverages that started us at about $50 without batting an eye and the waiter brings out a 6" mini-loaf of sour dough that was mini in height as well. I thought for sure the whole experience was going to be cheap. I will say straight up, the crab lasagne was AH Then SOME (awesome)!! Yes don't be on a diet and don't care, it is an amazingly worthy dinner. My friend's marinara based fish dish was so-so, at least in comparison to the crab lasagne.
author: Leon F.

description: We came here after standing in the rain for 2 hours at another event.  It was nice to sit down and enjoy a meal.  Unfortunately the first table, or rather booth, they tried to seat us at was really snug.  My tall husband could barely get his legs under the table.  We asked to move to a regular table and they were fine with it.  The three of us devoured a huge meal.  We started off sharing a big bowl of their crab chowder.   It was really nice of them to bring 3 bowls for all the things, and split it for us.   The waitress had told us there was bacon in it, I guess in case we didn't eat meat, but we didn't taste it in there.  We then shared a meal of crab, mussels, and shrimp.  The mussels were so sweet and delicious.  The shrimp was very flavorful.  The crab was just okay to me. I prefer the Vietnamese type roasted garlic crab over this crab.   All three were served on a hot plate with sauces.  We also shared clams, which were really good in a buttery broth.  The garlic noodles weren't that great.  They were really bland and not very garlicky as we are used to.  The hubster also got a crab melt which had an abundance of crab overflowing from it.  We also enjoyed mimosas with our "brunch".  It was really refreshing and good and it was a pretty big mimosa.  They also give you these wonderful mini french baguettes on the table, but remember you're in for a big meal so don't fill up on that.  They also have a wall of all different kinds of hot sauces!  The service was friendly, she checked on us often.  They also have machines as their order taking pads, which was really high tech and cool.  I love the little decorated crabs that lined the top of the room.  It was a good meal but not the best I've ever had.
author: Kymberli C.

description:
I have very mixed feelings about crab house.

The killer crab they have on the menu was delicious! I enjoyed it very much which is what earned the stars on this review, because their lobster dishes were less that spectacular.  The lobster was bland, stringy and not very well prepared and if the lobster was the only dish I had tasted from Crab House, then they would have gotten a zero if that were possible, but oh the killer crab legs! 

All I have to say is skip the other dishes they have (except for the crab chowder which was very tasty) and stick with the killer crab legs!
author: Christine C.

description: Love this place! Bring the whole family or don't. Food is great! Atmosphere is what you'd expect from a crab house! Food fun.
author: Monica V.

description: Went for dinner with my husband a few weeks ago. We don't get into the city much, and I have been wanting to try some things, so this was on the list. We had a great table with a view of the sunset. We started off with the cheesy garlic bread, which was great. I ordered their famous marinated crab which came on a sizzling iron platter dripping with garlic butter. It was incredible. I had to keep fighting off the waiters trying to take my plate while I sopped up the juices with the house bread (which I had to ask for, boo). My husband got the crab enchiladas and he said they were some of the best enchiladas he'd ever had. We didn't get dessert because we were so stuffed. It was an excellent experience and I would definitely go back here for crab.
author: Goldi J.

description: The seafood is fresh and you can never go wrong with the lobster pasta.  The ciopino was delicious but difficult to eat because the crab was still in its shell.  But its a nice place to be and great views of the pier.
author: wisdom m.

description: The best crab I've ever had! I tried crabs in other places, bit this one is still the best. The service is very fast & friendly, great spot! Their strawberry mojito is really good!
author: Dana S.

description: What a gem of a find, amazing garlic crab from the girl who likes her seafood plain and simple. A must visit
author: Heather C.

description:
It was a beautiful day in the city and being a silly tourist was in store.  From a trip around the Ferry Building to ending up at Pier 39 - a late lunch was definately in need.  It's a restaurant kind of tucked away upstairs it Pier 39.  Older feeling outside, a sample menu displayed, just simple - walking in it's a low ceiling with dark woods, a fire pit in front and a small bar to the right.  We were seated within 5 minutes - cute waterfront view.

There was a pitcher of ice cold water waiting, utensils, clean napkins etc - I like when all the condiments are displayed.  Soon we ordered some grilled shrimp and crab, also a mozarella cheese starter.  The cheese bread wasn't anything special.  Warm, gooey but not especially tasty (4 mid sized pieces).  The crab and shrimp were brought out on a hot skillet and placed on a holder with a bowl underneath for the shells.  The crab was delicious, fresh, tender, buttery, seasoned well and just juicy!  The shrimp was prepared just right, very flavorful and you can choose from a few difference butter sauces and cocktail sauces to dip if you wished.  Oh and they give you a small bread for free, fairly ordinary but welcomed.

Our server was nice but not amazing, efficient but a little slow.  Some of the plates had cracks in them, not something I'm a fan of.  Also the decor is cheesy/cheap and cute at the same time.  They have a bunch of crabs lining the walls painted in silly ways (Italian one, chess one, disco one etc) - cute yet cheesy.

The food was great, everything else just pretty good.
author: Sabrina A.

description:
Crab House's location is unbeatable. Situated within the midst of Pier 39, I would consider this to be a good seafood restaurant with an unbeatable location... whether for lunch or dinner. Along with the food, the service was certainly above par (our waitress was very professional).

What stood out most about Crab House is its Dungeness Crab (aka. "Killer Crab"). The crabs were filled with juicy chunks of meat; they were noticeably fresh. Moreover, the crab's exterior was dipped in a hot, tasteful garlic sauce. The Clam Chowder was also very good; it had bacon and corn. Another favorite were the garlic fries. Overall, I would consider myself very content with Crab House (though for some reason, I am not compelled to give it five stars). Perhaps another visit would make me a bigger fan of this place.

The Dungeness crab is about $20 for a 1/2 order plus one pound. A whole crab (2 lbs) is about $35. They have a "Crab Feast" -- which is about $100; I saw a party of six order this and it appeared to adequately feed all of them (yeah, I couldn't help but look at all that crab...).
author: A B.

description:
Crab, wine and bread simple and delicious!  There was an hour long wait however a manager sat us almost immediately at a table by the window.  

IF YOU WANT CRAB THIS IS WHERE YOU GO.
author: Astrid T.

description:
I had a lovely $50 gift certificate for two at this place, so I took my buddy Helen K here for dinner. Although I felt like a tourist immediately upon sitting down, I really liked their food! We ordered popcorn calamari, a 1/2 lb of king dungeness crab (their speciality), and crab alfredo pasta. 

The calamari was just ok - definitely could've been crispier. The crab alfredo was absolutely delish - soft pasta, creamy alfredo, and good-sized chunks of crab meat. And even though my hands got all dirty from cracking open those king crab legs, the juicy and tender meat on the inside was well worth the mess. 

So even though it's a touristy place, I still really liked it! Plus they have these cool decorated crab shells hanging on the walls. Look for the one that looks like a golf course hole.
author: Lisa M.

description:
Too bad this place is in Pier 39.  I hate eating at a local touristy area.  BUT... occassionally, I would  put on a disguise and pray that no one I know would see me, and head up to the Crab House for The Killer Crab.

The Killer Crab is the house specialty.  Cooked in some sort of garlic butter concoction, pieces of crab are served on a hot plate.  Put a bib on and prepare to get absolutely messy.  The crab is fresh, tender and after one bite, you will dig and dig to get every last piece out of the shells.  It would be sinful to let any of the crab meat go to waste.

I love crab.  I have ordered crab from everywhere.  And this place, this place wins hands down for the tastiest crab on this planet.
author: Yuan W.

description: Not only is this a cute place, the crab is really good!  Get the garlic crab and lots of butter to dip it in!  It is pricey and the service was a little slow, but in the end, the crab is worth it.  If you sit next to the windows, you get an excellent view of the bay at fisherman's wharf.  We had a great romantic time (see picture of us with garlic crab in my profile)!
author: Nadia L.

description: Came here tonight for the Fixie Dinner ($24.95) and the Garlic Noodles. Great service and beautiful night! The Fixie Dinner(?) is basically a 3 course meal. Salad (which is awesome), main course (there's a list for your choice) and tiramisu. Bread with vinaigrette is greatttt! Their crab there is said to be the best. It tastes like garlic crab. Is good though! Do try cause you only live once(=
author: Vivian L.

description:
This was a lot of fun. I'm a crab convert now (can't stand blue crabs, but dungeoness... why didn't anyone tell me they taste like lobster?!). Touristy spot on Pier 39. Boat loads of crabs in loads of butter and garlic and yum. 

It's loud and kitchy. There's almost a gangster feel to the place. Go with friends, plan to be loud and have a beer. They've even got bar stools around a counter height circular fireplace for taking off the chill after seeing the sea lions on the pier. It ain't cheap, but it's worth it. 
Go!
author: Megan M.

description:
I have been to Crab House a lot of times and it is definitely my favorite restaurant in Pier 39. (I mean, there are Hooters, Bubba Gump and Hard Rock Cafe) So, whenever I have friends and family visiting and I HAD to go to Fisherman Wharf, Crab House is usually my pick for a relaxing casual dinner by the bay.

Like all other restaurants on the pier, the decor is hideous and looks like a theme park. The service, however, is always friendly and warm. It is one of those places where I like to go in when the sun is still there, and watch it sets as I am having dinner. Well I usually make reservation and ask for the booth table on the left end when you enter the restaurant.

Some of the starters that I love are the raw oysters, crab stuffed mushroom, and oyster Rockefeller. They have very thick and hearty soup too. There are other clam chowder and sour dough place out there, but Crab House's are pretty good too.

For main, I recommend macadamia crusted mahi mahi. It is topped with mango salsa and served with crab rice and stir fried vegetables. Also, the lemon sea bass, with artichoke hearts, mushroom, and crab orzo. The Lobster pasta is good, if you feel like eating some carbs. They know their seafood, and they are very tasty. Of course, why go to Crab House, if you are not getting their steamed dungeness crab.

As I said before, it is a good place for casual dinner with visiting friends and family. I mean, it's the Fisherman Wharf, with tourists on Segways in front of your car wearing fleece jacket.
author: Jose K.

description:
Want a sure fire way to lose some of your holiday weight?

Come here and feast on the crab (frozen, no flavor, stringy), garlic noodles (a joke as I could have made this disgusting dish at home), and fried artichokes (absolutely no taste other then fried!), because you'll spend the whole night on the can extracting your insides.

This establishment is like waving a huge middle finger to all of the tourists at the Pier and screaming for them to never come back to SF.

I did however enjoy my Shirley Temple.  Yes, I'm 26 and I love Shirley Temples...they're a tasty delight!
author: Courtney B.

description: I sincerely appreciate the comments received from the manager that works here. As I stated, the crab was fantastic and the attention to service was very good. I have upgraded the rating to reflect my new feelings on the exemplary follow up to my review. Thank you.
author: Evan P.

description:
The Crab House rocked my SF trip. This place was ridiculously delicious. I made reservations not knowing if this place would be worth the trip, but it really made our second evening in San Francisco. When I called up a week earlier they were super friendly and said that they had a table for two right by the window and WOW. 

The line for the restaurant looped around the pier and we sauntered in dressed to the nines and were quickly escorted to our table. Seriously this made our night. Watching the sunset over the Pacific Ocean while sipping drinks and eating amazing shrimp, salad, and crab. It was amazing. 

My girl had issues working the crab cracker doodad, so I did most the work, and in that I had the garliciest fingers this side of the Mississippi.

The service was great and the everyone seemed to be genuinely having a great time working there. The walls were decorated with crabs painted in all different colors.
author: Gregg F.

description:
Ok so I brought my boyfriend here for one of our date nights and I have to admit that I  was a little wary of eating at some touristy looking Pier 39 establishment.  But we didn't want to go too far from where our daughter was being looked after and Houston's looked like it was going to have its usual friday night 2 hour wait so...we ended up here.  The prices are steep but what else can you expect to pay for seafood in Fisherman's Wharf? Most of the menu items are available "a la carte" so don't expect your entrees to come with side dishes.  We ordered the whole crab roasted in garlic sauce for 2 ($49.95) which I wasn't so sure would be a hit with my bf.   He absolutely HATES sharing food with me because he never thinks that there will be enough for both of us even though I can never finish my own food.   But 3 lbs of crab??? Come on.  I think that's plenty for 2 people.  

We also ordered a ceasar salad ($9.95) which was not only crisp but had the perfect amount of dressing and fresh parmasean cheese distributed throughout. Excellent!  I'm sick of these overdressed ceasar salads that use iceberg lettuce and creamy dressing with those bland disgusting store bought crutons.  Yuck.  

After the salad the crab came (along with the delicious crispy garlic fries we ordered...$10.95) and hilarity ensued.  The waitress handed us each a plastic bib....which we were both way too embarrased to wear.  I did just fine with out mine....my boyfriend did not. There were shells flying everywhere, and my hands were getting filthy!  By the end of our eating frenzy crab shells and stray pieces of crab meat littered the table, the booth that we were sitting in, and my boyfriends lap.  Definitely not a first date kinda place, unless you are both laid back and ready to get messy.  I realized that there really isn't a graceful way to eat crab.  Oh well.  We both enjoyed our evening, & our food.  I will definitely be coming here again.
author: Stephanie S.

description: I recently ate at the Crab House and had less than adequate service. But I can say the response I got from the owner about the service I received of the Crab house was great. After I wrote a Yelp review the owner himself apologized and ensured he would provide our server with additional training. I felt that he really cared about what I had to say concerning the service we received. I also wrote an email to the comments link on the Crab House website (something I've never done) and received an apology immediately. I really appreciated the time they took to ensure that I knew my message was heard by management. The response I received makes me want to give the Crab House another chance. Especially because the crab was delicious. I am still giving the Crab House one star because I'm still a bit bitter about the service I received.
author: Al O.

description: I am from Seattle, it takes alot to impress me with seafood.  This place is touristy.  Atmosphere is ok.  Service is ok.  Overall, OK...they aren't as busy as the other touristy places like BubbaGump.  They are away from the crowd, which is nice.  If you go, ask to sit near window if weather is nice, fresh air is nice.  We did not sit near the windows and it was a bit stuffy.
author: Rachel P.

description: Great service, incredible food, and a beautiful view of the Golden Gate bridge is a hard combination to pass up. The Angel Hair Lasagna is an amazingly unique dish.
author: Brendan T.

description: Yum Yum and Yum.... Good service, good food.  I showed up without a reservation, they seated me immediately, and the place was busy.  I had 2 large crabs to myself, it was that good.  The bread was good as well.  I will definitely make this a routine stop when in SF.
author: Aman S.

description: This place was SUPER good. I came here on a Saturday at 5pm.  I made reservations before going and they were able to seat us right away plus we got a nice view of the golden gate bridge while eating. The crabs were soooo good! Love this place, will definitely come here again.
author: loni l.

description: A bit expensive but the Crab enchiladas was mouth watering. I was impressed with the portion. Would I come back, depends if I will get a raise this year. :)
author: Rick T.

description: For us- this place hit the spot, but not the pocketbook.  Me & the hubby split one whole killer crab & a cup of crab chowder for lunch- plenty to eat including the bread that comes out w/ your meal.  The crab chowder had big chunks of fresh crab that were good.  The sweetness that I think other people refer to in the soup are the bell peppers & corn- it didn't bother me.  When our crab came out, we made complete pigs of ourselves- we were in heaven.  Pretty damn good.
author: Amy B.

description:
On the verge of 5-star heaven. I have to visit more than once to grant them perfection though.

We were here for an expensive lunch the other day. Pricing aside, the food was fantabulous and the service was good. We had the crab chowder, which I am craving again as I write this review. I had the crab enchilada with it and just like the chowder, they do not skimp on the large chunks of luscious crab inside. It was delicious.

I am always a fan of french bread with olive oil and balsamic vinegar, so that won me over too. Were it melty warm it would have been over-the-top.

My daughter had a shirley temple and she always asks for lots of cherries. At my companion's requests, the busboy must have brought her at least 3 additional trays of cherries. I think she counted 26 in total. It may sound stupid, but that helped them rank with me as well. 

Next time, and there WILL be a next time, I will get messy and order a killer crab. If you are down by Pier 39, make this your lunch or dinner highlight. It far outshines anything else I've tried in this area.
author: Erin O.

description: Love their crab melt! Crab chowder was pretty good too, but me and the bf also ordered half order of crab and damn was it small! It was crab season during the time we went but their crab had hardly any meat in it! Wtf?! Wish their was some kind of sauce I could dip it in too. Oh well, I'll be back for the crab melt and fries!
author: Marilyn W.

description:
this is my favorite seafood place, EVER. 

The food is ridiculously good, the whole of half crab with shrimp will put other competitors out of business. the seafood is seasoned to perfection with seasoned butter lightly sprinkled over it. 

the lobster pasta, was a little on the oily side one time I ordered it, but I think that is because it was fresh out of the skillet, and it didn't have time to rest.. other than that I would recommend giving this place a try. 

this items on the menu are pricey, and you should come prepared to spend over $100 for 2 people.
author: Michelle F.

description: been here many times, love the food! The crab and mussles are the best!  I love that buttery garlic dip they have for the bread and for the crab and whatever else you want to dip.  But it was a really cool place.  Drinks are great there too, the bartender was really cool and my favorite drink there is the Crabby mood :)
author: LaVon S.

description:
Can I give this place ZERO stars?

What a terrible experience. Granted, we had a large party (14 people), but the management just has no clue how to run a business. After grossly underestimating our wait time at 30 minutes, the hostesses kept telling us that we'd be up "soon" whenever we inquired. We ended up waiting for 2 hours only to get totally fed up and leave for another restaurant. We complained to the manager, who told us that it "wasn't possible" to split us up into smaller tables as we watched party after party get seated before us. We had asked multiple times to be seated at smaller tables only to be deflected by the hostesses. SERIOUSLY? We were getting so hungry that we would have all sat at tables of 2 if only to get some effing food.

Yes, it was an obnoxious table of people who would not leave the restaurant for over an hour after paying their bill that was keeping us waiting. While I believe that karma will take care of those jerks, the fact that the hostesses and manager were doing nothing to "encourage" this party to leave after they were clearly done with their meal pissed us off big time. We had been waiting so long that one of the hostesses felt so bad that she brought us two baguettes to munch on while we waited. Great, we shared 2 baguettes among the 14 of us. Really helpful there.

An overall awful and time-wasting experience. We decided to take our business elsewhere after waiting for way too long, and that obnoxious group of diners still had not left. Never coming back here again --- I don't care how good people say the crab is. Nothing is worth this much time and trouble.
author: Janet L.

description:
How have I not reviewed my Pier 39 guilty pleasure, Crab House?

I know, I know... so touristy but I can't help it... their food is really good! I love the crab chowder, the cheesy garlic bread and the crab alfredo... I haven't had anything that wasn't really good.

The service ranges from average to slightly above.  If you're going to eat in Pier 39 or the Fisherman Wharf area.. this is a dependable choice... especially since there are a bunch of crappy places out there.
author: Derek B.

description: If you love crab, don't mind paying a lot for it and have patience for at least 30-minute wait, this is the best place to be. If not, you're better off eating a crab omelet from another restaurant. Food taste is not much different from other crab places and service is so so with understaffed operation.
author: Aung W.

description:
My bf surprised me with a date to the pier and a dinner at the Crab House.  :) 

It wasn't too busy at the time we went, so we were able to be seated right away.  We were able to sit next to the window, which wasn't that great as it was getting a little too hot.  When we first sat down I noticed that there was a handkerchief napkin under our table, I wouldn't have minded but since I was wearing sandals it kept running against my foot. So I thought they should have done a better job of cleaning up after the person before us.  

The food was great. I ordered 1/2 a crab, my bf fish and chips, and we shared a medium sized calamari dish.  The calamari was really good, the portion was large too, I would definitely recommend this dish to others.  My 1/2 a crab was okay, not as juicy or tasty as ones I've tried before, I would prefer Thanh Long's crab or PPQ Dungenous Crab. The fish and chips were pretty good too.  My bf's not a big fan of garlic fries so I think they should put on the menu that the fries that come with the fish are garlic fries, not regular fries.
I also didn't like how we had to cut our own bread.  I'm not lazy, but you'd think they'd cut the bread for you so you don't have to do work while you eat.  Or maybe it was just the bread they gave us, but I had a hard time cutting it.

During our meal a bee had flew past me and landed right next to me on the window.  So I wasn't enjoy my meal too much, as I was too busy focusing on the bee.  My bf opened the window hoping the bee would fly out, but it just stayed put.   So I ended up putting my napkin over it hoping it would stay put until we left.  The bee finally came out right when we paid the bill!! So wheww!!

I would probably come here again for the calamari, but not the crab.
author: Elizabeth W.

description: Hands down the best crab anywhere. We've dinned there at least 10 times by now. We take our guests there and everyone always walk away in a food coma. We mainly go for the delicious garlic crab. We also love the Caesar salad and garlic bread.
author: Cindy W.

description:
It's touristy, it's expensive, but it's my favorite place to have a pound and a half of crab in the city.  It has nice views and big portions.

Put on your bib and dig in. I have seriously thought I could go Kobayashi and eat 3 lbs of crab here.  The garlic/butter sauce is just the right ratio to facilitate a feat like that.
author: Tim G.

description:
Crab for people who don't know CRAP about CRAB.  The WORST crab on San Fran.  Not only was the crab horrible, but someone burned something in the kitchen that filled the whole restaurant with smoke.  The WORST experience I've had at any restaurant in San Fran.

They try to cover up their horrible, dry, rubbery crab with a garlic and butter taste, but it fails miserably.

Expensive, and not even good... For a better price if you want good crab in SF, go to the Bourdin Bakery, which also serves a mean clam chowder.

By the way, I ordered an Absolut martini but I saw the bartender use TAAKA to make my drink.  Absolutely horrible.  These guys need to be shut down.
author: Christopher M.

description: Main dish was REALLY AWFUL. Parts of my fish smelled like it had gone bad. Tables are small and cramped. Their crab cake are bland and do not come with any sauce!! Waiter was nice and tried to compensate for that by bringing thousand island sauce. Garlic bread with melted Mozzarella appetizer was good.
author: Tania G.

description: The food here is just  phenomenal when your in the mood or craving some awesome crab!!! The Crab house has some sister restaurants as well. But having been here a few times, i have to say that this place is great!!! The flavors you can have with crab is just mouth watering. Of course my folks get the garlic flavor crab. When I order, though, I get just the steamed crab, because the flavor in the crab is already there, sweet. Yummmy, This is a lil better than being at fisherman's wharf trying to find a place to eat while buying your steamed crab from a vendor. The fries, the soup is just yummy, i recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting s.f. !!!  Great, awesome food. great, chill staff!!!
author: Arthur W.

description:
Okay - so I went back for a second time and I brought out of town guests...I was raving about how much I loved this place...and then we ordered. 

The trio - mussels, shrimp, crab legs that my husband and I ordered  did NOT taste anything like the first time we were there.  Did we do something wrong?  Did we order wrong?  But nay.  They were inconsistent and that's just no bueno.

Service was still great, and the garlic fries delicious as ever...just our entree not as flavorful.  I am not a happy camper, and now I'm not sure if I want to come back...(insert sad face here).  I say that now, but I'll probably be back to eat the garlic fries and try the trio one last time...
author: Chari A.

description:
I would walk to Pier 39 just to eat their clam linguine ($18.99 I believe)... white wine reduction in light garlic broth... heartiest portion of clams with tasty pasta... friggin AWESOME.

I order clam linguine whenever it is available (which means I've eaten a LOT of clam linguine in my life), and this place is hands-down the best there is. Not too creamy and so flavorful!(#*$&# GAH. I need to calm down. Almost spelled that clam down ok I'm out. Just order it and you'll see what I mean.
author: Angela H.

description: The place is not good please go and try another spot and I am speaking of the food. Service was pretty good but as far as food it was disappointing.
author: Cecil D.

description: The food was good, view was great and the waiter was just right.  Lewis, our waiter, was attentive, knowledgable and not to pushy or all over us.  Just right.
author: Bret H.

description: Great place. I highly recommend the cioppino, super good! The place tends to get very busy so I highly suggest putting in a reservation. My only complaint is that the ventilation isn't that great and thus the place tends to get a bit smokey from all the skillets.
author: Danny C.

description:
I remembered the beautiful view when i ate here.  When me and my friends were on the pier and wanted some place to eat; we finally decided to dine here.  On a Saturday night and for a big party they were able to set a table for our group of about 10+.  And we didn't have reservations. 

I thought the painted crabs were cute.  Since this is in a tourist area, the prices are a bit expensive.   Most likely I ordered the pasta but now looking at the online menu I wished i ordered the fish and chips; oh well there's always next time. :)
author: Evelyn K.

description:
4 stars for the garlic fries alone -- they are delicious!

Crab was pretty good too but nothing special I think. 

Service was quick and ambiance was very nice.
author: song c.

description:
Stopped by this tourist trap after a day on Angel island. 
I had a Tureen, a seafood stew; which would taste better if it was less salty. However I would go back and try their crab chowder.
Overall good service and ambiance.
author: vinh t.

description: Go here at least once each time the husband and I go on vacation.  I get the whole crab, it was delicious.  Husband had chippino, and it was quite tasty.  A bit on the spicy side but he'd eat it again.  Warning:  The crab comes inside the soup so it's super hot, and if you take it out and wait til the end of the meal, it'll be cold.
author: Dani T.

description:
