I reluctantly came here after my girlfriend basically nagged me into going to this restaurant. When I was a kid, I remember that I had an allergic reaction to lobster before and was really hesitant to even think about trying crab.

The service is definitely really nice here and we ordered an entire crab to share with a side of alfredo noodles with crab. I did not expect these two items to be filling AND I didn't have an allergic reaction to the crab. I definitely recommend this place, but be prepared to spend a nice chunk of money for a crab-y time. :D
author: Charles L.

description: Terrific crabs cooked in garlic and butter. We ordered 2 crabs for the two of us and it was a lot.   Garlic fries were good.  So was the shrimp Louie salad.   Service left a lot to be desired.
author: Vicky K.

description: This is one of my favorite places to eat crab.  It's right along the pier, so any seat you have will be a good one.  The food is spectacular.  I always get at least a half crab and some garlic fries.  The sauce used to cook the crab is buttery, garlicky and absolutely delicious.  The garlic fries are to die for as well.  It can run a little on the expensive side, but you should be expecting that anytime you're eating crab.
author: King T.

description: I like this place! I recommend the clams and the whole crab. The garlic butter sauce for the clams is amazing! Make sure you keep some for you to dip the crab in. The mojito was ok. I wish they had Captain Morgan as a selection. It would have made a great mojito. Everything else was great. Recommend parking in the parking structure near the pier since they validate the parking
author: Steve W.

description: The food was prepared just about perfectly and they have an awesome and efficient staff. They were very attentive and eager to help.
author: Joey L.

description: Thought it might be a tourist trap given location but...crab was amazingly good and the Caesar salad was excellent!  Everything I saw on a plate looked exceptional.  We had a great view and was a wonderful end to our vacation on the west coast.
author: Dawn P.

description: A little pricy for what you get and not the best tasting seafood. But it was nice and would recommend. The fish and chips was the best, the crab cakes were tasty but overpriced. The crab itself was well done but didn't had that much taste, needed a little more flavor. The waitress was really nice and friendly.
author: Maria C.

description:
We thought it was a bit touristy, and I think some of the traits of a tourist trap were there.  Sun-burnt folks in air-Jesus sandals and Giants t-shirts, high(er) prices and lines at the restroom.  That said, it was a good place to eat and look out over the pier.

Let's start with the good, though.  The mussels were great, and maybe the freshest ones I have ever had.  There weren't any gritty, dirt-like chews in any of them.  The crab legs were also very moist, and not over-cooked at all.  The service was excellent, too.

Things I would suggest if you go; ask for them NOT to salt the mussels or crabs at all.  You might save money on getting a bottle of wine instead of drinking by the glass.  Also, be aware there is no Miller Light (a local favorite with Maryland Blue crabs---and yes, we brought our own Old Bay).  Be prepared to drop about 1hundy if you're hungry and thirsty.
author: Andrew A.

description: it is kind of expensive, i order  WHOLE CRAB AND LOBSTER THERMIDOR ..  looks very beautiful and delicious...
author: Tianzi Y.

description:
to be honest, their calamari and garlic fries alone deserve all three stars i give it.  they were magnificent!  

the crab was delicious too but it was almost forgettable because i was so underwhelmed by its size.  all two pounds of the crab legs was...minuscule.  the garlicy buttery taste was extremely rich and heavy, i was loving it but it made me feel guilty with every lick.  my stomach really wasn't happy with me.  it's not everyone that can stand that much butter in one sitting- my body sure wasn't used to it.  

but for the atmosphere, the quality appetizers, and incredible flavor (crab house is anything BUT lacking in flavor) it's a place i will be returning to when i want a treat at the warf :)
author: Irene W.

description: Was not pleased with this place at all.  Very crowded inside and the crab didn't taste fresh.   I've had better crab in the valley. Very disappointing because this was our big night out. Also the garlic fries that came with the meal were over the top with garlic and I am a garlic lover.  Would not recommend this place.  Beautiful view though. If that's all you care about it would be just fine.
author: Cheri B.

description:
This place is awesome! A group of us went here about a year ago and to this day we can not stop thinking about how great the crab tasted!  

Hands down, one of the best Crab places i've ever been to.  We had the crab feast which was a huge skillet of crab in this amazing butter sauce....
author: Farooq A.

description:
This was a great place to have dinner with friends and family.  I was there for my birthday and we had "crab for four", a pitcher of beer, small garlic fries and two orders of the garlic noodles.  The food wasn't too greasy like Crustacean and the food was hot.

Definitely recommend calling ahead for reservations.  I called in, got my time and we waited less than 10 minutes before we were seated.  Our food came out almost instantly which was awesome.... and hot!

The waiter was extremely nice and helpful.  It was a Saturday so it was kind of crowded and noise levels were pretty loud but we could still talk amongst ourselves without raising our voices.  We had a great seat by the window and I'm pretty sure everything was great.

The only difficult part was parking but we got validated and it was free.  Great for groups!  Planning on going back soon.
author: David C.

description: Fresh meaty crabs! Wonderful weather! A bit pricey but then again it's Pier 39 ;) Can't wait to come back
author: Kristine P.

description:
I'm a vegetarian, so I am basing the rating off my partner.

The restaurant was always packed when we walked by throughout the weekend - whether it was 4pm or 9pm.
Is a casual restaurant, with a huge menu and huge portions. If you like seafood then you need to check out this place. My partner got the mussels, shrimp, and crab and said it was unbelievable. 
Definitely check this place out!
author: Mary T.

description: I thoroughly enjoyed the 1/2 killer crab dinner. The prix fixe menu option was great and the Tiramisu was fantastic. The only small minus was the waiter took a little while to get to us.  It was Saturday night and the place was packed, however so that was not a huge problem. The garlic fries were an awesome appetizer, and a medium order fed four of us quite well. All in all a great meal and experience.
author: Reuben P.

description: Try the crab melt sandwich. It's no wonder the crab house is rated number 1 in San Fran
author: Lee B.

description:
Went here yesterday because we were craving crab and the season is officially open. Having a place like the Crab House available for reservations was exciting. I admit though, my craving is still not satisfied.

Pros:
Had the best server ever. I should have asked his name so that I could give him a shout out. He was attentive, quick, efficient, and professional. Before my husband could finish the last sip of his soda, they had delivered him another. Our drinks and salads came out right away. All of our questions were answered patiently and knowledgeably. We were also advised well when we'd ordered enough food.

Iron skilled roasted shrimp were good. Pretty flavorful. The clams were okay. One was served closed which is a no-no.

Where they fell down just a bit:
The salads are huge! The caesar salad was good but definitely too much for one person. My husband enjoyed his garden salad but it was too garlicky for my tastes to the point where the tomatoes tasted like garlic.

The bread got hard really quickly. The garlic bread was good but they didn't advertise that there was fresh Parmesan and my husband doesn't eat cheese. So I had to eat all of the bread :).

I had a 1/2 roasted garlic crab. It was a little less than 1/2 and was served on a sizzling skillet which I think overcooked the crab legs a bit. Also,I didn't taste the garlic (maybe they'd put it all in the tomatoes), I mostly tasted oil/butter. They could cut that down a bit.

They are also pretty pricey. 

Recommendations from my husband/dinner companion: Modernize it a bit, make portions smaller and then maybe they can lower the prices.

All in all, it was good, not great. I've had better crab at Absinthe and Crustaceans.
author: s n.

description:
I was with a friend wandering around Fisherman's Wharf with a friend and we were hungry for seafood. We saw Crab House and thought it was some sort of tourist trap but we went in anyway. Then how surprised we were when we found out it was super delicious! It's a bit pricey, but worth it for the best crab on the pier.

Our seat had a great view and we ordered a large portion of dungeness crab and the crab chowder (so awesome!!) for an appetizer. It was so delicious, eating the crab in our fancy Crab House bibs! The people next to us ordered the mussels which were sizzling as it passed us. If I ever get a chance to come here again I am definitely ordering that. Highly recommended if you love crab and are in the area!
author: Christine C.

description:
Overrated and overpriced.

I came here because my friend from Denver RAVED about how she craved the killer crab from this restaurant. Being a native nocal person I don't visit many of the restaurants at the pier39 tourist trap, since most of the restaurants are SO expensive. We had 5 adults and 2 kids, so we ordered 3 killer crabs, mussels, crab chowder, crab cakes, garlic fries and some drinks. The crab was just ok. But for the price, I'd rather go to costco and buy 10 lbs of alaskan king crab legs and grill them up myself. At least I'd be stuffed. the crabs aren't that filling so if you plan on coming here, stop by mcd's or something because you won't leave here full unless you drop some serious cash.  The mussels were ok. The crab chowder was mediocre. The crab cakes weren't anything to write home about and the garlic fries were just the run of the mill. Just a very disappointing meal. Go over to fisherman's wharf instead and just get a crab fresh from Alioto's.  Too bad that guy who cracks open the crabs for you doesn't work there anymore.
author: Michael W.

description:
Actually, it's more like 3.5 stars but because their food is better than most other places at the Pier, I rounded up.

Anyway, the boyfriend and I ordered:
~ crab chowder - really great with lots of crab meat, yum!
~ crab cakes - they were pretty good with lots of crab meat inside but it was missing something acidic to tie everything together
~ garlic fries - perfectly crisp with garlic and Parmesan cheese...wish they used more cheese though
~ the prix fixe menu that comes with a salad (it was ok...nothing special), entree of choice (we got the 1/2 order of killer crab...it was not as killer as I had expected.  The garlic butter sauce it came in was a little bit too salty and there wasn't really enough sauce to dip it in since everything dried on the grill it came in) and tiramisu (one of the best tiramisu I've had...super moist and light).

Bill came to $74 including tip.  Not a place I'd be going to unless I was at the Pier already but I'm glad I tried it.  You can definitely get your crab fix here.
author: Katelynn L.

description:
This place is definitely more for seafood than other choices. First, book on opentable, otherwise it can be a hour or more wait. I already hate going down to Fisherman's  Wharf, but the visiting friends and relatives can't help themselves- so cutting down wait time is always good. 

I got the chicken sandwich (I'm not a seafood lover), which was huge and super greasy. I think I ate a 1/4th of it and was full and grossed out- I filled up mostly on my french fries and calamari. The people I was with seemed to thoroughly enjoy their seafood and the view of the marina was cool, so for that- I give it 3 stars.
author: Maggie J.

description:
To be honest if I could give this restaurant 0 stars I would. My husband and I had 9 pm reservations on a Friday night thinking that the place would be packed. We got there and found that there were only 4 other groups and automatically we thought, "Score! We'd get awesome service" since the wait-staff only had 5 parties they should be able to focus on each customer. 

Boy were we wrong! Our waiter's name was Burak and normally I wouldn't put someone on blast but this guy was ridiculous! He had us and 2 other parties. We waited for 20 mins. before he came to take our drink orders and then another 20 mins to take our food orders AFTER we told him that we were ready to order with our drinks! He said he'd be right back but he took his sweet time flirting with the table of women. He actually sat with them and had a major chat fest including his lack of sleep due to non-stop partying. Meanwhile my husband and I are getting impatient and ask for another waiter, apparently they only had one at the time. So our food FINALLY came out and it was brought out by a busboy who barely spoke English...lucky for us I speak Spanish and was able to communicate our needs. 

The food is ok...the mussels were awesome but the "Killer Crab" is completely over-rated. It's not that great. I've had better at Joe's Crab Shack or some hole in the wall Chinese restaurant! Seriously for really good crab you need to go to Redondo Beach and check out Captain Kidd's! The crab chowder isn't all that it's made out to be. I've honestly had better. 

Ultimately I was so upset that I didn't even want to pay the tab for the medium mussels, 3 lbs of crab, crab chowder, and drinks but in the end I did and left a crappy tip. As a former waitress I know how important it is to tip so I did it but I made sure to write on the receipt that the BUSBOY was awesome.

I thought maybe I'd give it another chance someday until I called back the next day to complain to the General Manager. That was the straw that broke the camel's back. I called prepared with my transaction number and receipt. I told the GM calmly and rationally that I wasn't looking for reimbursement I simply wanted him to know about his crappy service and the GM Joseph cut me off and said," I'm sorry, next time ask for me directly and I'll take care of you" Click! Didn't get my name or number just CLICK! So quite frankly in my opinion this place can pick a cheek and kiss my ass.
author: Angela S.

description:
Everytime I travel to the bay area, I make it a point to visit the Crab House.  
Talk about finger-licking good crab ...
The Dungeness Killer Crab is extraordinary. I agree with Jonathan K. - $100 of crab legs never tasted so good. We went with 4 other family members, we devoured two orders of the Crab Feast!
author: Leila S.

description: Service was good and super fast once you are seated. Ordered the crabs to share, chicken pasta with tomatoes, and the garlic bread. The pasta was pretty good! However, the crabs are not as good as expected and the place is way too cramped to have a comfortable crab dinner!
author: Clare H.

description:
I LOVE this place... If i could eat here once a week i totally would ! We always order the crab for 2 people, medium mussels, and large garlic fries.  Plus a bottle of their Italian white wine-so smooth and goes very well with the seafood.  Its pricey but i would pay anything for this crab!  It is really good if you love seafood.  I think this place uses less butter than Thang Long.  Thang Long's crabs are yummy too but may sometimes come a little drenched with oil on your plate.  These two places are equally good for me.

Next time, I have decided to up my order.  I will order crab for 4, medium mussels, and medium garlic fries.  I can't wait...  

Park across the street in the garage and they will validate your ticket at the restaurant.  All you need to pay is $50 for the crab for 2 (or $100 for 4), medium mussels around $25, and $15 for the fries.
author: abbey e.

description: A Raider Must.....Favorite place to go and  eat Dungeness Crab ...you must order the whole crab with a side of alfredo fettuccine.  Love this place
author: SunKiss C.

description:
we ordered the whole crab,filet mignon & pasta w/marinara sauce
incredible. the chef takes your order. we had window seats with a view of the bay & golden gate bridge. very nautically themed
5 star-you want for nothing!! they were super attentive!!
the crab was soooooo good & big!! the filet was cooked perfectly, the veggies were so very fresh & miles couldn't get enough of the bread with his spaghetti. limited menu
classy,delicious,they made you feel as if you owned the place. food was best
author: Scott D.

description: I loved the garlic crab at this place. The service was great and we went on a Sunday but there weren't a lot of tourists. I love crabs so much and I'll probably come back.
author: Manny C.

description: Food was OK, but a little bit overpriced. The waiting time was a little bit too much, so I decided to sit at the bar. The Bartender was great, and service overall was pretty good. I was going to give them three stars, but the parking validation was pretty good. Saved me 14 dollars.
author: Virgilio A.

description: Great food and service.  Was seated quickly at a great table where we were able to open the window.  It was perfect!  The crab was tender and yummy...it just fell out of the shell perfectly!  The filet mignon was cooked a great medium rare.  Will need to return and try other dishes!
author: Ramon T.

description: Came here over the weekend.  The wait wasn't very long, about 10 minutes.  Overall, the price is a bit high, but comparing to other seafood restaurant in Fisherman Wharf, it's about normal.  The crabs are decent.  The meats falls off by itself and it has butter all over them.  I also tried the garlic noodle and the lobster pasta.  I like the taste of the lobster pasta, but kind of oily too.  Overall, the food is good.  The service is horrible though.  Our waiter takes forever to get us our check and never really attended us after taking our order.  I guess that evens up to the 3 stars.
author: Calvin T.

description:
So my Husband and I came here because he really wanted Cajun Crab that we saw on tv but there was none around San Francisco, so we decided to eat at the Crab House. 
I'm not a seafood person, but there Secret Garlic Crabs were delicious. and we also ordered the Lasagna Angel hair Crab Alfredo, that was also delicious but a little too rich. We also tried there tiramisu that was amazing. 
Everything seemed to be delicious, esp. the Garlic fries, but we didn't try it because I knew what we ordered was gonna be too much.
Over all I'd come back here when I visit San Francisco again.
author: June P.

description: We had a small party of 3 with one toddler and they accommodated us very well.The crab alfredo that I ordered was very good, reminiscent of the fettucini alfredo I had in Italy. The service was very good and friendly My husband ordered from the prix fixe menu and got the crab angela hair lasagna (very delicious) and our friend got the killer crab (also very good). Everyone had a great time.
author: Irene S.

description: Well I have to say I was a bit disappointed.   I had really expected great crab.  It was simply OK.  I had the whole crab.  It didn't have much garlic flavor, mostly just lots of  butter (or olive oil) coating.  The crab was cooked fine, it's just there wasn't any explosion of flavor ($37 crab I expected more).  Boiling Crab in SJ is SO much better.  Kids all had the fish&chips.  That was very tasty and good sized filet of fish.  My wife had the Crab Louie salad.  Very little crab meat in it and it was just OK.  The appetizer (fried calamari) was tasty but the sauce given wasn't a  traditional cocktail sauce or aioli, it was some kind of sweet bell pepper sauce.  Not tasty with calamari at all, in my opinion.  This is SF, so why were we served cold soft/chewy sourdough rolls?  They should be hot with a good crunchy crust.  On the plus side, service is prompt and courteous.  Bar service is very quick.  The decor is very cool (colorful decorated crabs all over the place.  My son laughed at this French crab with a beret and a goatee).  I'd say I'd recommend Crab House for taking an out of town guest to, if you we're already at Pier 39, but as a deliberate dining destination, probably not for us again.  Glad I got to go though.  The view is great and it was overall enjoyable, from a touristy stand point.
author: H T.

description:
After a long day in Alcatraz, we decided to have dinner here.

Awesome service: one of the waiters, or maybe busser (I was too busy stuffing my face with crab to notice) came over and helped us tie both our bibs back on after they fell off.  He did the same thing for the table next to us.  He even refilled our pelligrino after our cups were low because our hands were covered in crab and garlic/butter sauce.

Five stars for service, but not in the case for the food.

Although the garlic crab was superb, the rest of our food was forgetful.  The crab chowder was kinda sweet and bland.  I wished the garlic fries were cut thick, not thin.  We ordered the 3 lb. crab (good for two) and it was a little more than enough.  Pair it with the medium garlic fries (you get a lot!  should've gotten the small order instead) and bowl of crab chowder and we were stuffed!

Definitely recommend trying their specialty garlic crab.  Something I wouldn't come back for, just because I'd rather eat my seafood raw... at a sushi bar. (Not that you can eat crab raw, anyways.)
author: Bruce M.

description:
Me:  Hi, we have a party of 12.
Hostess: Okay, no problem.  It will be about 10-15 minutes.

4 minutes later....

Hostess: Your table is ready.  Please follow me.

This place is amazing.  For a place that is a small as my garage, the people that work here hustle and bustle in such a tight area with ease.  

My favorite has to be the crab chowder.  Not clam chowder but crab chowder.  And I must say.... there is a lot of crab in a cup of chowder.   My main course was a muscle, crab and shrimp combo that was shared by 3 people.  The food comes out on a huge sizzling flat skillet.  When the waiter sets down the skillet he drenches the food with butter.  Or should I say butta?  Lots of it.  Before consumption the waiter helps you put on a plastic bib which is a very good idea bc everyone knows I ALWAYS leave a restaurant with some sort of stain on my shirt.  Its hard when you have been blessed. ;-)

4 stars for the wonderful food and service.  Minus 1 star for the 1 stall woman's bathroom.
author: Mechado D.

description: I'm all about finding good Dungeness crab in San Francisco and gave this place a try after a disappointing experience in Nob Hill. This crab was even worse - overcooked, dry, tasteless crab meat, served with their "secret sauce" that tasted like old fish. This seems to be another tourist trap that cuts costs by serving old or previously frozen crab to unsuspecting customers.
author: M R.

description: This place is insanely touristy but absolutely has the best crab in SF. It has wonderful views, good drinks, and I would eat here once a week if I could afford it!
author: Pam S.

description: Excellent.  Had the crab feast for 4 - bunch of crab legs deep fried.  Very yummy but you know how it feels after eating so much deep fried stuff.  This is a place I would go once in a while to have the deep fried crab but would still recommend PPQ as the best place for crabs.
author: Alex W.

description: been here a few times now...we always order the same thing and it has always done the trick...crab caeser, crab chowder and roasted crab!  A little pricey due to location and the tourist money they are after but still good!
author: Forrest Y.

description: Excellent fresh seafood!  The views are spectacular!  When we went on a Saturday night, the wait was almost 90 minutes, but it was well worth it. Plus, we had plenty of time to explore the shops at Pier 39 boardwalk, which are very diversified and interesting. The restaurant was uniquely decorated with different kinds of crabs, my favorite was the zebra crab!  Check it out, you'll be happy you did!
author: Jeffrey D.

description: Hands down, best crab in San Francisco.  Had the garlic cheese bread, crab cakes & the crab melt sandwich.  Our server Rafael, was so helpful & so nice.  For the quality of food and service, I'd say the prices are fair.  We will definitely come back the next time we are in town.
author: Elicia L.

description: The food was SOOOOOO good.  The view over the water was nice too, depending on where you got a seat.  I agree with some of the others about the service being slow, but it was busy and the slow service wasn't too bad.  You have to have crab when you come to the Crab House - but just be aware that the crab comes with JUST crab (and some hard bread).  It's a little pricey but my husband & I took our moms there for Mother's Day and we all got the prefix menu.  The 1/2 order killer crab came with 5 crab legs, a salad, and a dessert.  It was good but we were hungry again in a few hours.  I would suggest getting one of the pasta with crab options so that you get filled up and you still get the crab taste - that's what I will definitely do next time!!
author: Candy R.

description:
Definitely serves tourists because it A: is in pier 39 location, B: had foreign people in the restaurant speaking not English, C: even the waitress was foreign.

Ok other than the fact that it is in a touristy area, the food was alright but the fact that garlic fries was one of their house specialties? really?  The crab chowder was alright, definitely had a lot of crab so they don't rip you off.  The bread they give is hard to break off, and the butter had like a weird texture thing going on.  The bread with garlic and melted mozzarella was good but a bit cheesy (really).  Crab alfredo also not bad with tons of crab.  

You might get sick of crab after eating here.  Not a place I'd check out normally but 3.5 stars from me.
author: Yosie G.

description:
5 stars for the view
4 stars for the service
3 stars for the bar
2 stars for the garlic bread
1 star for the crab LOOKING good
NO STARS for:
 -waiting an hour with reservations
 -over salted been dead, not fresh crab
 -over priced (i'm not cheap either)

I'm a crab eater and I know when a crab is not fresh!  

Buy a live crab no more than $15 from an asian market.  Go home and throw it in a pot with a shit load of garlic, seasonings and 1 cup of water.  Let it boil for 5 minutes n eat!.  It doesn't matter what the seasoning is cuz that shit doesn't marinate through the shell anyways. So crack that sucker open first!!!
author: GaLei J.

description:
My crab chowder was seriously good, loaded with a ton of crab meat and really creamy! We also had the seared scallop alfredo, calamari, and acme mozzarella garlic break. ALL fantastic.

The alcohol, however, was overpriced and WEAK. =(

But, combined with our amazing view of the north beach and the golden gate bridge, I'd say it was all worth it.

Everything people ordered around us, smelled delicious too.  We'll be back for the sizzling crab bucket for sure!

They lose one-star for their service...a bit over-attentive, and our server got confused and thought the $30 in cash was his tip and didn't apply it to the overall bill.

Um...no, honey.

You were good, but not $30 good for a $70 bill.


You know you love me. ;-P
author: Vince S.

description:
Well we made reservations for my mothers birthday and when we got there they seated our party of 6 and one toddler in a table that is supposed to seat 4.  My girlfriend complained and we moved to a booth but it was still too small.  They told us we would have to wait (we made reservations...) because they couldn't put together 2 tables.  My girlfriend turns over and says "They have a big party and they have two tables..." By this time 4 of us were sitting in the booth and 2 on another table.  The waitress finally decides to join another small table.  We fit but we were REALLY close to the customers next to us.  The middle aged woman next to us rolled her eyes in disgust to our close proximity.  Anyways the waitress was really accommodating and didn't throw an attitude they were just a bit disorganized considering we had made reservations.

We ordered crab, calamari( the popcorn calamari was really good), mussels and shrimp.  The food was good however I don't like the fact that you don't get any sort of side with your dish.  You get crab... or shrimp or shrimp and mussels wtf? No veggies no mashed taters... They only offer it if you want to pay more on top of their steep prices.  

Another bad thing.  I was planning on tipping the waitress between 20-25% but I noticed they had already helped themselves to a 18% tip... I figured the 18% mandatory tip is to protect the waitresses from tourists who come from places where tipping isn't too customary.   It discouraged me from tipping more.  Overall an alright experience but I hate the pier 39  area so my expectations weren't too high.
author: Omar V.

description:
I would've considered giving this place 5 stars, but I'll refrain (explanation forthcoming).

For the good:  The crab was amazing.  In our group of 5, one went with a pasta dish and the rest of us went with the giant crab dinner for 4.  I don't know what they did to that crab, but the combination of butter, garlic, and whatever else, baked to perfection, was amazing.  Honestly some of the best crab I've ever had.  The mojito was pretty good too.

Now, the reason I only gave 4 stars: the service was lackluster at best.  Don't get me wrong, the hostess and our waitress were both very friendly, they just weren't very helpful and never around when you needed them.  For one thing, we had to ask for more bread (most places offer) but that wasn't a huge deal.  What was a problem was that once our food came, we didn't have our crab-eating utensils.  The waitress was nowhere to be found, so we ended up having to grab them from another table.  Then, after finishing our mojitos, we were ready for another, but again, nowhere to be found...we never got that second drink.

I've probably just made it seem worse than it is, or maybe it was partly due to the fact that we were there later in the evening, but still, it was slow so I'd expect attentive service.

Problems aside though, this was some amazing crab.  It will definitely set you back a bit, but I'd say it was worth the price.  Delicious crab, a good view off of Pier 39, and in my case someone else paid.

I should also note that after leaving feedback at OpenTable, we received a very apologetic response from the manager, so they get a little props for that as well.

All in all, a pretty solid 4 stars.
author: Matt N.

description: Our party of three ordered the fried calamari, garlic fries, garlic bread, whole killer crab and the 3lbs for two.  We left fully stuffed and satisfied.  It was all very good.  The crab was amazing and I intend to come back for more.  Our waitress was very nice and not overly-attentive, but there when we needed her.  We went on a Wednesday night after 9pm, so we got to avoid the crowds making it a very pleasant trip to the usually annoyingly crowded Pier 39.  Three days later and I'm still thinking of that crab.  It's so filling, you don't need the bread that comes with it, and I would suggest plopping down the cash for the whole crab.  I think it's worth every penny and the body of the crab is very meaty as well as the fat juicy legs. SOOOOO good!!!
author: N. L.

description:
Made reservations here for a Friday night and we were seated right away...no problem. Their wine list totally sucks which was a disappointment.  Also, our server had 7 other tables besides us (the whole room) so we were a little neglected, which is why I am taking away a star.  Had some fried artichokes as an app; they were pretty good but what fried anything is really bad?!  My crab was delicious. I am a transplant from Maryland so it's great to be able to have some good dungeness crab here for some juxtaposition against my previous crab experiences.  :) The garlic butter sauce is really great.  My aunt was with me and had scallops which she really enjoyed.

Yes, this place is touristy but I think that is to be expected.  All in all, a good experience.
author: Jamie G.

description: All I can say us WOW!  And not in a good way.  Food was terrible with prices to match.
author: Curtis C.

description:
Must haves:
Large order of mussels
Bowl of Crab chowder
Crab platter for four

Order this list of food and you won't be disappointed. It's a bit pricey, but well worth it. After being in SF a couple times and visiting the Crab House, we have always been completely satisfied by their service and food; we will most definitely be back.
author: Gene L.

description: We were looking for an easy seafood choice after doing the Alcatraz tour. I saw this on yelp and the other yelpers could not have been more right!  We were sat right against the window looking out into the bay as the sun was slowly setting.  The service was good and attentive. The crab was some of the best crab we have had.  The garlic sauce is awesome!  The only mistake i made was ordering the Caesar salad. It was huge! Definitely not for just 1 person. Over all we were very happy with our choice and will be back when we are in sf again.
author: Brad R.

description:
Tourist trap or not, I haven't had a bad experience here so far and yesterday was our second visit.

The ambiance is... cute.  Lots of cute decorated crabs to look at while waiting for your food.  It's definitely nice and cozy when the weather outside is cold and rainy.  Unfortunately, their seating is cramped.  I mean cramped like made for skinny people who don't have winter coats on.  Service isn't stellar, but not bad considering the location.  It's a little pricy, but what can you expect in tourist central?

On to the food.  We ordered a side salad (not drenched in dressing - good job) and the crab chowder, which was surprisingly good.  It was stuffed full of veggies and crab, so tasted more like a stew. Also shared the crab feast for 4, and ended up feeding 5 of us.  There was plenty of claws, and big meaty chunks to share.  The crab was really tasty, and some meaty parts were crispy... which was good and bad at the same time since everything was drenched in butter.  Our hands were all glistening from all the oil and butter - I'll admit, I was pretty turned off by that and started back on the bread and chowder.  Not sure if that's why I coudn't tell if the crab was fresh or not, but at least it was tasty.  Just don't lick your shiny fingers after each bite.

As long as you ignore the fact that you're consuming clogged arteries, enjoy the food. I think it's one of the better spots to eat at Pier 39.
author: Paulette L.

description:
After reading the reviews on Yelp, I figured this place was a safe bet for a party of 7, and I was not disappointed. I would not have ordered the garlic fries if I hadn't read so much praise, and I would have truly missed out because they were, indeed, fabulous. My husband and I split the 3lbs of crab, which was delicious and rich, and our three boys helped us finish the plate. We did not leave hungry.

The kids' macaroni was also something worth mentioning. It may have been a little sophisticated for the younger boys' pallets, but we thought it was great. The oldest one (who's 6) finished it within minutes.

Our waiter was extremely attentive and accommodating and made the experience very special.
author: Tracy B.

description:
I was very excited to try this place after reading the many good reviews about it.  To me, it was just A-ok.  The best thing we ordered was the crab chowder.  It was very creamy and had many chunky vegetables in it.   Also, it had a little bite to it.. just a small dash of spiciness.   Could have used a little more crab meat.

We ordered the Killer garlic crab.  The crab meat seemed shriveled.. don't know if it was from cooking the crab too long, if the crab was not live or what.  The crab was just ok.  Garlic flavor was not really strong and it wasn't super buttery.  

We also ordered the garlic noodles.  It had a very strong herbal taste to it.  Almost as though it had some Indian spices in it.  Husband said it just tasted like garlic.
author: Somala A.

description: The BEST garlic and buttered crab I have ever tasted. My wife and I always use the sour dough bread to swipe up the sauce after the crab is gone. Ohhh!!!! I love this place. The service is very responsive and fast and it's positioned on the water so I would recommend a seat next to the window if you can get it.
author: Mister M.

description: The serving sizes are huge! The crab was good and the fries were good too, not life changing, but still good. I did not like that it was in the touristy Fisherman's wharf area, so I will try to find a less touristy place next time.
author: Lindsay P.

description: There are a lot of crab restaurant options at Pier 39. This one ranks at the top of the list! You do not visit here for the great décor - you come here for the amazing crab! If you're a seafood fan then this is a must try.
author: Ava G.

description: Good view, service was a little icky.. The Killer crabs are nice, don't ever get the pasta though. the fixed menus are worth the money!
author: Brian M.

description:
Great restaurant for the tourist effect.
Brought my friend from out of town here for a late dinner.
This place is open until 11pm on weekends.
The whole crab was humongoid!
I absolutely do not know how to crack crab so it was fun attempting to crack shells. Bits and pieces were flying all over the place. Thank God no one was sitting around us, since it was so late.
I finished half and only finished half of the garlic fries... which is hella yummie. I think they are the best garlic fries I've had, crispy and not too overwhelming on the garlic but just enough for garlic lovers.
I'd go here again and sample other types of seafood next time.
author: Grace P.

description: Excellent. Nevermind the fact that it's in tourist central. Go there. The whole crab is fantastic. Also, the crab chowder is jam packed win crab and flavor.  You can't beat San Francisco for dungeonous.
author: Jeff P.

description: The Crab house is A-OK. The service is excellent and the views are great looking over the water in the Pier 39 area. Quality of food is fine the Garlic Dungeness Crab for two is a nice way to go. The decor is a bit over the top tourist for me with hand painted plastic crabs on the walls, anchors etc. If your in the area and looking for a family oriented place for crab this is a good bet.
author: Shawn R.

description: Crab was dry and chewy. Too much garlic and they're really messy.
author: Nancy V.

description:
So yesterday my husband and i came to eat here for lunch and when we walked in, we were seated by the hostess right away =) BTW shes really sweet! I dont know if it was because we had reservations through opentable.com or they just have fast service like that, but we expected to wait since it was lunch time and there were hella folks at the pier.

We were seated by the water which was a perfect view !The hostess gave my daughter some crayons and an activity sheet! Our waiter was kind of sorry i dont remember his name , but the husby didnt tip him much, since he didnt provide superb service as we expected , nor was he kid friendly!

We ordered the 3Ib dungeness garlic crab legs the menu states it's enough for 2 people, but I think it's enough for 4 at least! My daughter , myself and my husband shared and we still had some left to take home! I totally recommend this Dish!

Garlic fries -3 stars! again perfect portion!
A cup of crab chowder - 5 STARS!  which i recommend , it's as good as Lobster Bisque from SUNDANCE! mmMmm
and my husband ordered the crab alfredo.. I thought it was okay! I wouuldnt mind eating it again, but not to stoked about it! i think it's something I can cook myself!

With all that we ordered our bill came out to $103.92  I  guess my husband thought it was reasonable, because he had plenty of left overs to take home, since I wasnt going to cook dinner that night! =)

Anyway a nice place to go with the family or friends!
author: April m.

description:
Sure they take advantage of tourists.  However, though I was a bit skeptical, the crab is indeed very good.  Kinda pricey, but most seafood restaurants are.  

Ambience- Overloaded with tourists and crammed.  

Food- You get what you pay for.  Good, delicious crab.  We tried the garlic noodles because it supposedly was a must, but I would pass next time.  

Service- Friendly and professional.  They were busy but still attentive without being overbearing.
author: J H.

description:
I read all the review before coming here and I believe this place is overrated. Sizzling platters are a good show, but not that impressive for the price. 

If you want better seafood, just go to the outside stands at fishermans wharf. Although a bit touristy, it gets the job done
author: B H.

description:
With tourist season kicking in high gear, I was a little dubious about going to pier 39 for a birthday dinner, but because the organizer and birthday person are both food aficionados I knoew I shouldn't question anything.  

Well - they were right!  It was a little rough on the wait staff because people showed up late, but despite this setback they were still efficient and tried to be as helpful as possible (though the host DID scold us a bit before seating us - oh well).  

We got the Dungeness killer crab drenched in a buttery sauce to share among five people, plus a platter of mussels and shrimp.  The pineapple mojito was fabulous but DEFINITELY get the red herring if you are a girl and like fruity drinks.  

It was entertaining cracking open the crabs, and it was very tasty.  If you're really looking to indulge in some greasy goodness, get the garlic fries as well.

I have to say, it was a good meal.  Just be prepared, as other yelpers have attested, it can be slightly pricey.
author: Shay F.

description: I love going to this place everytime im at the wharf. The environment is very relaxing and with a combination of great seafood. The garlic butter flavor they use on the crab is awesome and just cant get enough of it. Perfect place to bring a person who is a seafood lover. The service is great and the price is reasonable. Highly recomendable.
author: Mac D.

description:
This is the best crabhouse I have ever tried in my life!    I also recommended my sister and boyfriend try it while they were visiting in San Fran and they agreed.

Here is the menu http://www.crabhouse39.com/pdf/crabmenu.pdf

You must order the Dungeness Killer Crab, it will feed 2 people.  THe flavor is derived from their roasting technique over butter and garlic.  I can taste it now.   My profile pic is the actual Killer Crab if that tells how much I liked this place. 

My wife and I also split the Zuppa di Pesce (mixed seafood stew).  It is a bit pricey at $19.95 but we were not dissapointed.  It was loaed with all types of seafood.  Fish, clams, shrimp etc.. It had sorta of a spicy, cajun flavor which I loved since I'm from South Louisiana originally.
author: Donald J.

description:
The ambiance of this restaurant was nice - basically your average overdone place aimed at the tourists traveling to Pier 39.  In fact, that's why I was there - for a business meeting with some people who'd never been to San Francisco before.

As a quick aside - I don't recommend this place for business dinners.  The tables are too close together and it got loud.  It was hard to hear each other, especially since we're trying to discuss sensitive business things and not shout at each other.  Maybe that also means that this isn't the best place for an intimate dinner either - decide for yourself.

The food was good - I had some basic fish & chips, which was nice, and one companion was very satisfied with her lobster.  However, another companion had a crab sandwich and disgustingly found a hair inside that was most definitely not hers.  Gross!  

The staff was nice enough, but a bit slow.  The prices are a bit high, but the quality of the food (once she got a new sandwich, sans hair) was good.  It was OK, but I'd rather stay away from the tourist traps like this place.
author: Trisha F.

description: Had a very good dinner, good service, nice table with a water view, great crab.
author: John C.

description: "Lotsa Crab" (3lbs) is sooo good tasting and a good amount for two adults who like crab ($50). It comes out super fast after you order it so if you want some time to enjoy your drinks...then be sure and wait to order. Reservations through Open Table make it so easy to plan your visit.
author: Dawn E.

description:
Came here for dinner last Saturday.  It was really busy!  Our party of 10 had to wait an hour and a half to get seated, and that's when the place started to empty out.  

We ordered the "killer crab- Crab Feast (for four people) and Too Twos (for two-three people)"  I think that's what they're called.  We also ordered two bowls of crab showder.  We all shared this among 8 people and it was perfect.  I'm not a fan of "working for my food", cleaning the crab legs, but the crab was good!  The kids in our group ordered shrimp and chips and they said their food was good too!

Just be warned, when you leave the restaurant, your clothes and hair will smell like garlic crab for awhile!  Overall, the restaurant is small but service was great!  I forgot our server's name but he was very accomodating!
author: tif f.

description:
Not entirely my kind of thing, it was very tourist-like, a bit on the expensive end.  Good view though and atmosphere.  Server was nice but the food was so-so.  Sanitation of the utensils... not too good.

We arrived a little before 8pm sat down and took a long look at our menus. The service was good, very receptive.  Atmosphere was cozy especially since it was raining outside and we were near the big fireplace.  I

We ordered garlic fries and soup for appetizers. I think I got full with both before my main course.  (I was also very hungry seeing that I had class from 930am to 7pm).  I ordered the Salmon, since I'm a Salmon freak but I didn't really like it. The Salmon was too dry and the pasta that came with it had no flavor.  My friends ordered the Crab Alfredo - very creamy and the Crab Angelhair Lasagna (probably the best out of all of ours), and the birthday girl ordered some kind of crab leg tomato soup.  Overall the Crab Angelhair was the best in comparison to the other things we ate.

We finished off with a Tarimisu with a birthday candle for the bday girl. That was ok, but I think my boyfriend had an allergic reaction afterwards... (crab + milk/cream does not mix).  One of the spoons that came with the dessert was unwashed.. or wasn't washed cleanly...

Overall:
$160 for five people for my friend's birthday dinner. Pricey indeed.

Food: 3/5
Service: 4/5
Sanitation of utensils: 2/5
Decorations & Environment: 4/5
author: Natalie G.

description:
DELICIOUS Crab! 

My classmate booked the Crab House to celebrate our graduation from school. We had a party of 40, divided into 4 groups. The service was fast and the food was incredible. EVERYONE was impressed. Even some snooty foodies that were expecting the worst.

A consultant recently came into town and asked where he can take me to dinner. This was the first place that came in to mind. A++ service. However, it is expensive as hell. People don't seem to mind paying, though. It's that good.
author: Chrissy Q.

description:
The best fish and chips I have ever had! It came with garlic fries which was delicious as well. The Fish was seasoned to perfection and juicy. It wasn't greasy or oily. We also tried the Calamari. It was pretty good. Not the best but pretty tasty. My bf got the Crab Alfredo pasta which was amazing as well. 

I think the bill came out to less than 50 but I could be wrong. The food here is amazing though. The service was good. Definitely will be back!
author: Patricia B.

description: My hubby and I are here about a year ago during a long weekend visit to SF.  We shared an order of the Dungeness Crab... holy amazing!!  We also shared a few bottles of wine.  Service was great, food was awesome, Atmosphere was great too.  This was one of our favorite memories of one of our many trips to the bay area.
author: Kelly F.

description: the crab and garlic fries are awesome!  their garlic butter sauce is delish!  one weird thing...they had flies flying around in the middle of the room.  literally in only one area.  kinda weird but the food was still awesome!  i'd go back!
author: Jillian O.

description: Crab enchiladas. Do I need to say more? A little pricey but worth it!
author: Alexa L.

description:
The  boyfriend & I love crab. It's our 'meat' of choice. We ate
here for the first time on xmas. We made reservations just
in case, but when we got there, we were one of the first to
be seated since they had barely opened. We came here
based on yelp reviews, yelp pictures, & my boyfriend always
noticing it when we walk to see the sealions. The place is
medium in size & cutely decorated with painted crabs &
other cute things. Rafael was our waiter & was very attentitive.
We ordered a small grilled shrimp plate. & it was alot for
being a 'small'. & the drawn butter it came with was good.
We ordered small garlic fries which also was alot. & they
were seriously the best garlic fries evarrr. They're seasoned
fries cooked with garlic & sprinkled with Parmesan cheese.
Mmmm. We also order the 3 lbs killer crab. It was hella bomb!
It ties for first place with thanh long/crustacean's in my book.
They're cooked differently but I can't decide which takes first.
But anyway, the bf & I thought 3 lbs was going to be alot but
while we ate it, the table next to us order the 6lb. feast. I think
the bf & I will order that next time cause I think we can finish
it alone. & we also ordered the lobster thermidor. I have never
seen that in my life besides on my cooking mama game but
it was hella good! I thought it was a little cheesy but man I still
ate it. Haha. Everything we ordered was really good & we're
already planning to come back next week for new years. Yay!
author: A A.

description:
Crab House is a little bit hidden away at Pier 39.  Near the "entrance" of the pier, there's a small sign to the left that directs you up some stairs to the second level on the left side (when facing the water).  Walk up and continue past three other restaurants, I think, until you see the restaurant painted on the side of the building.

Everyone raves about the seafood in SF and from the yelp reviews, this seemed like a good place to start especially for crab.  Opentable did not have any reservations for the time we planned on eating, but we walked in (party of 2) and were seated immediately around 1:00pm on a sunny Sunday afternoon.  So if you don't see any open times in Opentable, just give them a call for an estimate on time.  When we left, there were more people waiting, but I overheard white times were only 15-20 minutes.

Now, for the food critique.  My wife and I shared a whole dungeness crab (which is what they claim to be famous) in a buttery, garlic sauce.  Also, we ordered a bowl of the crab chowder and garlic french fries.  I don't have as much experience with dungeness crab as I do with snow, king, and stone crabs but I must say that was very good.  I had to dip each piece of meat in the delicious sauce.  As for the crab chowder, I was hoping for something a bit creamier, but it was decent enough although I probably would not order it again next time.  My wife loved the garlic fries and scarfed most of the small portion which was sufficient for sharing.  I can't say that this was as good as some of the top seafood places I've dined at in Chicago and Seattle.  But, I was very happy at the end meal and will go back.  To top it off, the service was very attentive and friendly and the view next to the water was pleasant and bright.  

Prices were not unreasonable for SF, but I will say that I'm NOT a fan of the 4% mandatory health care waiter tax that they add on top of the sales tax which you have to check for when you dine anywhere in the bay area (and maybe rest of Cali?).  Because of the great service, I didn't "adjust" my tip as much as I normally would when this tax is added.   

Lastly, the bathrooms were very clean.
author: June P.

description: This Crab was so delicious it was soaked in sizzling plate of garlic and butter and it was very sweet tasting, fried shrimp was very good also, our waiter was very attentive also. over all great experience. Highly recommended,very hot food. Ann
author: Ann R.

description:
came here for thanksgiving lunch, and thought the food was delicious! three of us shared the garlic fries. these were some of the best garlic fries i've ever had. they were crisp to perfection and the parmesean cheese was a great touch. the complimentary bread was from acme and came in it's own individual wrapper. so fancy! my chicken pasta was absolutely awesome. it was creamy and filled me up big-time. 

the service was also amazing. our server was a sweetheart as she checked up on us numerous times. the food came in record time. the wait for the fries was, maybe, 5 minutes. then our entrees came 5 minutes later. and everything was still fresh! our table had a great view of the pier from 2 stories up.

the only reason this doesn't get 5 stars from me is because the menu is a bit pricey, though some items much more expensive than others. also, my mom didn't like her crab alfredo too much, claiming it was too oily. other than that, this place is nearly flawless.
author: Andrew T.

description: very garlic. they don't offer a non garlic option. so if you are more of a lemon on your crab person this is not the spot. nice location.
author: Deirdre P.

description: Amazing seafood at the fishermans wharf! Had the combo plate with mussels shrimp and crab, perfectly arranged dipping sauces complement the seafood, the crab chowder is a tasty dish as well. Ask to sit by a window, worth the extra 5 minute wait for the great view. Definitely recommend.
author: Nick B.

description: Came here during the bf's bday trip to sf with a friend for his bday dinner. Made reservations on open table and mentioned it was a birthday. Arrived at the restaurant and there was a huge line. Checked in and were seated right away. Ordered the mussels + shrimp, crab and garlic fries. Two guys and a small girl were super full and couldn't even finish all the food. Maybe it was the pitcher of fast tire too. All of the food was wonderful, nothing was dry or tasteless. The staff was super nice, from the host to the kitchen staff I almost tripped on my way to the bathroom. The bf was very happy with the night. The nice booth by the window was great. P.s. get the tiramisu. Yum!
author: J H.

description:
4.5 stars

I love their crab, among the best in the city. The service is usually pretty good. 
I took my family there when they visited during fleet week and they almost screwed up our reservations. I had to tell the person over the phone twice the day and time I wanted and we still weren't on the list when we got to the restaurant. Luckily the manager came over and after explaining things to her, she had us seated within 10 minutes.

The crab was cooked perfectly and served with just the right amount of butter and garlic. Ask for extra napkins though, it does get messy. Order the whole crab and share it with someone you care for...
author: Russ C.

description:
All I gotta say is wow - the Dungeness Killer Crab roasted in a special garlic sauce was exactly how I imagined.  By the end of the meal I had all kinds of juices dripping down my arms.  

Although, as I was eating my 3 lbs of crab legs (sharing with the bf of course), I could not stop staring at what everyone else was ordering.  There were these huge iron-skillets filled with sizzling steamed mussels, clam, and crab.  Apparently you have several options of assortment and different sizes to chose from.  Amazing - I am definitely going back to try the variety large skillet with all of the above!

Kinda pricey but what else do you expect at Pier 39 with a view of the Golden Gate bridge from your table?
author: Cindy H.

description: First time have Crab Chowder and it was amazing.  Also had the Crab Alfredo which was ok and nothing to write home about.  Service was good and spot on.
author: Aaron B.

description: Great tasty garlic crab!  The price is a little high so this place is saved for special occasion or when I am in the city.  Wait staff is a hit or miss.  The wait can be incredibly long so don't come here famished.
author: Savage ..

description:
Have enjoyed a few lunches here.  The crab is always incredibly fresh and cooked to perfection.  The mussels and prawns are also amazing.  The garlic fries are to die for. The complimentary bread rolls are a nice touch but nothing special.

Despite it's location, I wouldnt call it a tourist trap and I wopuld recommend it.

The only downside would be the ladies bathroom which comprises of one dingy toilet which could use a good scrub.

Also, I suggest you make a reservation esp. on weekends :)
author: J M.

description: Great view, excellent crab chowder and delicious food. I would definitely come here again.
author: Marco S.

description: It's all about the CRAB CHOWDER! I'd pay twice what they charge for the chowder but only half what they charge for everything else. Then again, I tasted some crab lasagna that was yummy, but overall I have to keep it at 3 stars. Stick to the chowder!!
author: Buster C.

description: Went to the Crab house with nephew & twin sons 10 years old here from Phoenix. They were going to take the Rocket Boat (also a 5 star rating...they loved it!).  Wasn't expecting much because it is a tourist spot at Pier 39. But...the food was great and server was a beautiful Russian young woman and she made us feel special.  We ordered the whole crab & mussels brought on a sizzling tray. Server poured hot white wine, garlic butter sauce over it and we ate and dunked our garlic and French bread in the sauce. Yum, yum.  More than enough food and delicious!  Even with a beer and a glass of wine the bill was under $65. I will go back! Go with crab lovers & order the feast of 4 whole crabs served the same way for $100.00.  It is a deal!  Sharon K. Castro Valley
author: Sharon K.

description: Great place for crab.  Good service...not the best since one waiter was overworked in our room full of customers.  The favorite seemed to be seafood roasted on an iron skillet.  I had the seafood stew full of crab, calamari, shrimp, and salmon...very good.  The bread could have been warm and the water boy could have been busier refilling drinks.
author: Doug A.

description: After taking the tourist bay cruise, we found the Crab House among the all the souvenir shops at Pier 39.  We were not expecting quality food in such a tourist area, but were pleasantly surprised.  The crab and garlic sauce was delcious as were the sourdough bread and french fries.  Crab chowder and iceberg salad were also good.  There was plenty of crab meat in the enchilada, but its taste seemed lost in the other ingredients.  Service was good and we did enjoy the meal.
author: V W.

description: Our family of 11 had lunch on Saturday 12/22/12 with reservations for 11:30 am. They open at 11:30 so if you do the same don't plan on getting in until right at 11:30. They tried to cram us in on a few tables put together but no one had any elbow room so we asked to be put at a couple of booths and they did this with no problems. So party's over 6 are hard to place together.  This is a crab house so the best item on the menu should be crab, and it is very very good. My wife and I got the small shrimp appetizer and the crab for two and a small side of garlic fries. It was plenty of food for us. We take our crab eating very seriously and we probably looked like crazy people eating the stuff but who cares when it is this good. its also a good thing the put bibs on us or we would have been a mess. If you love crab the crab house is a good choice. As far as the decor its a little too much of the white tile (floors and walls) for me. Would be much nicer with a little more warmth.
author: Sean H.

description: Amazing fresh crab.  been twice and always got the "killer crab" baked in so much garlic butter! it's definitely worth the work of picking it yourself.  fried appetizers also good but unnecessary. just go for the crab!
author: edith g.

description: Great view (yes you are paying for the view).  Pricey, but you are at fisherman's wharf and the view is great!  Split the crab plenty for two.
author: Mark W.

description:
5 stars for a tourist trap?

Yeah, it's cause I'm a tourist.

We came here almost immediately after checking in at our nearby hotel, super hungry. The staff is extremely polite and we were seated right away. Everyone was very accommodating of my young niece and nephew and tried their best to keep them entertained. The crab feast, fries and macaroni for the kids was excellent!
author: Mike O.

description:
I remember coming here many times on trips to fishermans warf with my family growing up.

Service is good and food tastes very fresh.  Im not much of a seafood person but I love the food here.
author: H.F. B.

description:
Been to this place twice. Seafood was great. Tried a little bit of the pasta, but didn't like it too much--with the exception of the garlic noodle and lasagna. Garlic fries is a must because it's yummy!  Portion sizes are huge. Food is expensive, but well worth it. If you get to sit by the window, you can see a part of the ocean and it's very beautiful at night. Romantic!

I would recommend this place to family and friends.
author: Chunky P.

description:
The crab was great! I shared 3 lbs of crab my coworker which was more than enough to satisfy us. But of course we ordered too much...

The pasta was undercooked with low quality oil, the CRAB fondue was just creamed spinach with a few small chunks of crab, and the CRAB chowder did not have discernable pieces of crab. 

My advice, just get the 3 lb crab for 2 and you will definitely be stuffed. Then go to North Beach for some gelato.
author: Mike S.

description: 4 star for service the waitress she was nice . I remove 2 star because the crab was s little over cooked and the fries was very dry other than that not bad but I liked crustacean better the crab had mor meat
author: Micky B.

description:
As a SF local, I was so surprised to have a beyond exceptional dinner at Crab House.  I basically avoid SF tourist trap areas but I had to do some shopping at Dept 56.  I used my mobile Yelp application on my iPhone to search for a good dinner place at my current location.  Crab House was at the top of the Yelp list.  Friendly staff, beautiful sunset views, but most importantly the FOOD was delicious.  I mean SF high standard delicious.  We ordered the 3 lb crab for 2 special (best crab I've had in the city and I've been to quite a few places), fish and chips (crunchiest fish fillets that I couldn't stop shoving down with fresh out of the fryer fries!). Oh wait, the garlic noodles were better than any Asian inspired garlic noodles AND I am Asian.

I went on a Monday evening and there was no tourist crowd.  Best bet, dine here on the off nights.  I truly was surprised and the food quality is well simply worth the trip to Pier 39.
author: Craig S.

description:
A MUST!! 

I was visiting SF and wanted 2 things....to see Alcatraz and eat some crab and my friend wanted 1....to see Beach Blanket Babylon.

We did all 3 and all 3 were wonderfully pleasing! 

We checked out a few restaurants along the pier after our Alcatraz tour..and we decided on The Crab House...it just looked cool. The Bloody Marys were the bomb!! and my friend had the Mojitos which she said was probably the best she has had. She ordered some soup....I think it was a crab chowder which she really enjoyed...I ordered a Caesar salad...which could have been shared with 4 people. Then the crab came....tossed in some butter and garlic...bibs on and ready to make a mess of some crab we dug in....bits of crab or juice or butter ..not really sure ...would make its way through the air on occasion as we would crack a shell. This is a hands on kind of meal...so there is no room to be shy. It was a blast...they only thing I kind of had a problem with was....the crab is tossed in butter and garlic.....and its still in a shell...so not sure how much flavor actually makes it to the meat...since its still in it shell....AND...have you ever tried cracking open a crab that has been tossed in slippery butter?? Not to easy my friend...but the Bloody Marys and Mojito's made it fun. We did have to ask for more wet wipes tho.. our server was very pleasant...I think she may have been from Russia..very sweet and friendly gal. 

The whole experience was unforgettable with a killer view....I highly recommend!!!
author: Kristi L.

description: Food was awesome, service was horrible!!  Took a good while to get someone to our table and then when order was taken we weren't asked if we wanted drinks, had to make a point to ask for them. Bartender brought us drinks and server brought food....never saw waitress again until we wanted check. Would recommend the food but would warn that the experience could be ruined by wait staff.
author: heather s.

description: Horrible. Skip it. This is a tourist trap. We had horrible service. They don't have normal things like sides with most of their meals. It rook 10 mins just to get our order taken. Then forever to get our dessert. Which was on the prix fix menu. We were then told the dessert was frozen and no good so my boyfriend had to choose another dish which the waitress explained to ME not him. ???? Not worth the price in taste or service in any way!!!
author: L. ..

description:
A little pricey, but what a great meal. 
If you don't thoroughly enjoy yourself here, you weren't trying.
author: E.Mo. ..

description:
Freakin' awesome!

Mind you I didn't pay, so I wouldn't be able to tell you about prices... but the crab was delicious, the salad/cheese bread was great, and the staff were very attentive. Disclaimer: it was a company outing, there were 14 of us, and it was a Tuesday night.

Be prepared to sit for awhile, though... this buttery goodness isn't "lite" cooking, and I had to loosen the belt before I asked for my parking validation/check.
author: Andy A.

description:
Ok, so I didn't have crab at the Crab House. To be more specific, I didn't have the freshly caught boiled/roasted crab thats the house special. Instead we had the crab cakes, crab pasta, and lobster pasta. Let me say, they can't do pasta. They can't do sauce. The plates look pretty, but the taste was so bleh, was hardly able to taste any seasoning. 

So while their crab may be wonderful (but seriously, if the crabs are fresh, you can't really go wrong anyway) and pricey ($100 for 4-person's worth? go to any cantonese seafood restaurant and you can get a lot more for that same price!!), they can't do a basic pasta. And don't get me started on the bread-in-a-wrapper that they throw at you at the beginning of the meal. It's not warm or anything...might as well go to boudin for some fresh bread.
author: Lisa Z.

description:
I really want to hate this place. 

I really want to find the best crab in SF at some secret hideaway where the mom and pop owners serve you crab that their son caught out of their apartment's kitchen. Or some shit like that.

But, unfortunately, when I want the most delicious dungenous crab I've ever had (and yes, I've been to PPQ and Tanh whatever), I brave the tourist hell that is Pier 39 and go to the crab house.

Minus one star because I hate the surroundings, but everything else is on point: good beer on tap, friendly service, and awesome crab.
author: J B.

description:
Ok, about a week after my review about the reservation situation, the restaurant manager gave me a call back. He apologized about the last call and say there is a mis-understanding. We would still have priority over other walk-ins and is still expecting us to dine with them on 7/4. I call a day later and ask if they can accommodate 9-10 ppl (original reservation was 4). I invited more friends to just hang out on 7/4 after he told me i have lost my reservation a week prior. He said he could so we went. 

We had fun. The staff were very accommodating and I was really glad we didn't have to wait out in the cold for the fireworks which turn out to be to foggy to see.  

3 star for the food. The bruchetta and the shrimp appetizer were very good. We also had the crab fest and garlic noodles. The crab was season w/ garlic and some other spices. Some of my friends prefer it just boiled. I think it would be nice if they have the special seasoned and the plain versions to choose from. The garlic noodles were not bad.

5 stars for the service, for trying to make it up to me by making sure my friends and i have a good time :)
author: Virginia y.

description:
For the main tourist destination in the city you really have to expect the worst regardless of what city you are in. This place stands out on the pier. I grew up on Cape Cod Ma so I know a bit about sea food and this place not only cooks a mean crab but the price is not too bad as well!

I have had the steamed clam app and it is darn good, 3 pounds of crab for 2 is a great choice.  highly recommend..  PS eating crab is a bit messy, don't wear your Sunday best.
author: Brian K.

description:
So my wife, her best friend, and I decided to make it a threesome on Valentines day. We roamed around the city, hit up Cobbs Comedy Club and made our way to Crab House... Luckily someone had cancelled their reservations a couple of days before. 

The restarurant is nicely seated at the end of Pier 39, so there are great views of the bay. The evening views are spectacular.

We were all so happy with each of their dishes that we were eating off of eachothers plates!! I would definitely reccommend their Dungeness Killer Crab. (Whole roasted crab in garlic sauce.) DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!!!!

Place is very cozy... Great place to bring a date.

Check them out 
http://www.crabhouse39.com/
author: Jay P.

description: Enjoying a massive whole garlic broiled dungenous crab with my new bride while watching the sun set over the golden gate was awesome. Then watching the fog roll in under the gate was very nice. The service is impeccable, they do not pester you, but are experts at predicting your needs. You are as well treated here as any fine dining establishment in the country. The tables are a little crowded, but it is cozy and there are no large restaurants on the pier. Their beer selection is limited but they are fine beers. I would like to see them add Leinenkugel's sunset wheat, especially since I intend to dine here again next time I visit SFO.
author: Tom G.

description: This place is okay if you like having dinner where there are tourists everywhere. Stupid me, I thought a would "try" something new and NOT go to Crusteans. What a mistake.  The garlic fries were good but how many restauarants can mess up putting some fries, parsley and chopped up garlic together.  The crab I ordered came dry because it was already chopped up and it was laying in a layer of butter. I hate when restaurants think a ton of butter will mask their poor quality of food. Maybe it's an asian thing but I also like to have my crab served whole so I know i'm not missing any extremities.  Anyways, i'm still kicking myself for giving up Crusteans and going here.  Check this place out if you like hanging out with tourists, fight for parking and smelling stinky sea lions.
author: Michelle A.

description:
Apparently, this place is pretty famous for it's seafood, although I didn't know that when my family and I stopped by a couple weeks ago. 

The first thing that I have to say about the crab shack is that it is incredibly cramped inside! The interior looked cool, at least: the walls, ceiling, and floor were all tile, and there were weird things hanging above our heads, and we had quite a nice view of the sea and the wharf. But the place was just too crowded and hot to feel very comfortable =/ Also, the tables were too small for the plates they brought, but oh well.

The first thing I got was the bruschetta. It was very, very tasty...maybe the best I've had, which is strange considering it's not an Italian restaurant. I made the mistake of getting the Caesar salad though, and it was only okay...but I had to cut up the croutons and the romaine leaves myself, which I don't care to do (esp. in the cramped conditions). 

I had a lobster, even though I am not crazy about their consistency, for the main course. It was scrumptious =3 but they really made me work for it...I spent a good bit of time cracking up the spiny shell of the beast (this thing was HUGE) before I got to the meat but hey, it tasted hella good. 

All in all, the food was great, the interior, not so much. I'd say it's a bit overrated judging from the other reviews, but it's worth going stopping by for sure.

***Disclaimer: I am not a seafood guy, so me rating the "Crab House" may be a wee bit unfair =]
author: Aaron D.

description: Service is ok, price is ok, decor is a 2 stars, but I LOVE the $50 Crab Leg dish and I love the view.   The view and the food is why this is recieving 4 stars.
author: Rose R.

description: We were sat in a beautiful room next to a window so excited for dinner when a very large and obnoxious group was sat behind us.  At first we tried to ignore them, but their swearing kept getting louder and louder and then they started talking about disgusting things that were so unappetizing I had to request to be moved.  The staff was so gracious and moved us right away.  We must have been apologized to at least 5 times and they ever gave us free dessert because they felt so bad.  The food was great and the servers certainly try to make everything as comfortable for you as possible :)
author: Michelle G.

description: I took my German friends and customers to this restaurant for a crab feast and it was outstanding.   Great service, fresh crab and extensive wine list to choose from.  A wonderful way to spend an exciting evening out for dinner.
author: Carl P.

description: Great view but very small spaces and I felt claustrophobic in the restaurant. No one came to give us water for 15 minutes. I had to ask to be served once seated. It was wall to wall people. There was only one bathroom. The calamari was good.
author: Laura K.

description: We have been here twice now. Both times had great service and delicious food. The plates are abundant with fresh, local crab and such. Yum!
author: J C.

description:
Food: 5
Variety:4
Service:4
Drinks:4
Atmoshphere:4

No words. Just go there and eat!
I had a sizzling combo, and for that price, I think I had a pretty good deal. Not 5 stars because I am not sure if this is the best place for a date in SF. It is great, but I am sure there are more other options. (Read my reviews!)
author: Ray L.

description: Nice to find really good food in the middle of the overpriced Pier 39 tourist trap.  Picturesque top floor venue and lively crowded atmosphere for  weekend dinner.  Get anything crab, but especially their hot roasted crab.  Messy and awesome.
author: D. M.

description:
i came here for a yearly anniversary with me and my lady.
people hyped me up for this so called amazing crab chowder.

i ordered a crab chowder, 2lb crab, garlic noodles, and garlic bread.

since it was anniversary, i delivered flowers to the restaurant and was told it will be on the table before i get seated.

flowers were not there before seated, portions of food is minimal, and the crab chowder was just ok.

not worth the price you pay in my opinion.

if crab is what you wanna eat, i suggest elsewhere
author: Wilson H.

description:
Crab crab crab crab, crab crab? Crab crab crab. Crab crab, crab crab - crab crab!

Seriously, crab is about all this place serves (though I guess that's to be expected from the name of the restaurant.) The crab is yummy, but  somewhat pricey, and the restaurant tends to nickel-and-dime you for sides, salads, etc. and there isn't a large selection of those to choose from. If you happen to be in Pier 39 and really craving crab and nothing but crab, this might be a reasonable choice, but if you're looking for a general seafood menu, seek elsewhere.

One other note: the restaurant feels somewhat cramped and the decor leaves much to be desired (it tries to look like a retro diner, but lacks all the charm of one.) Lower prices and a more interesting menu would make us consider a return visit.
author: Evan and Christine J.

description: OMG!! Can't wait to go back..... Love love loved this place! Service was good.. Food was delish, free parking with validation was accommodating, price a little expensive.  The crab feast wasn't as big as the pictures look (recession cut backs, I guess) but I liked it overall. Shrimp was a little dry... Good thing there was butter. Will definitely go back.
author: Felicia L.

description: Went here with the wife and kids. Great atmosphere, kid friendly, and great crab. The sauce the crab is cooked in is really garlicky, which is how i like it. The service was the best that I have had in a long time for casual dining. It's in a tourist area but that makes for good people watching. Take the family to see the seals after since they are right downstairs. I will come here again.
author: Jesse O.

description: I have been here with my fiance 2 times already once on our 9 year anniversary and the second was about 2 months ago. Reservations are recommended as this place get busy. The view is pretty good and the restaurant settings are relaxing. We always get the roasted garlic crab,garlic fries, the crab chowder and the iron skillet-roasted mussels and shrimp. This last visit I also decided to try the foggy wharf salad with dugeoness crab and grilled shrimp, with pricing aside this has got to be the best salad I have ever had!  The mussels and shrimp skillet is always good especially with the wine sauce they put on it as the lay it on your table. And the crab chowder is winner in my book! And as everyone else as mentioned the garlic fries are some of the best i have tried!  Pricing is what you would expect from a restaurant like this I mean it is on the waterfront and in San Francisco. But like the saying goes you get what you pay for! And this place is worth it!
author: Karl B.

description: DON'T ORDER THE STEAK! I'm not the biggest fan of seafood, but my girlfriend loves it.  I took her here and she shared  the "lotsa crab" and I shared my filet mignon.  The crab was decent, but the steak was horrid.  I'm not convinced that it was even filet mignon, and if it was... that was the toughest cut i've ever had.
author: Nate B.

description:
This is a lovely place to have lunch, our food was very nice, i had the crab cakes, yummy delicious well cooked.
the staff was very nice, good food portions.
Will be back again.
author: Nina V.

description:
