We had a great lunch yesterday including caesar salad,crab chowder, and 3 pounds of crab. They have good wine by the glass options and gave one of the largest pours I have ever seen on a glass of wine. The garlic infused grab preparation is tasty. I recommend sopping it up with the French bread they provide.

The ambiance is nice for a crab house with a view of the pier 39 harbor. It is also set back from the main part of pier 39. So, you don't get a negative tourist vibe. 

I will be craving this crab fortnightly.
author: Seth K.

description:
I give 4 stars for the food. We ordered garlic butter dungeoness crab and it's pretty good. However it a little on the dry side. Eventually I have to ask for melted butter to dip the crab in, 

We also tried the crab cake and crab cocktail and they were both very good. However I don't like the crab chowder very much, too watery for me. My wife like it very much though.

Overall it's a fun experience eating crab from the big skillet. We have a party of 4 and a kid. Initially we thought we didn't want to spend too much so didn't go with the Feast. However after ordering the $49 3lb portion, we knew it's too little and regretted not ordering the full skillet. We ended up ordering another full crab, and they still look much less than what other tables got for the $100 portion.

I have to take one star away because this place is way too expensive. This is suppose to be the crab season, and why do they charge the same whole year round? $80 for 2 1/2 crabs is way way too much. We sat by the window and there was not much to see either.
author: Ling H.

description:
"We recently visited SF for 2011 Spring Break. We we're really looking forward to eating here. Let me just say. THE FOOD IS GREAT.... the service SUCKS!!!!

I would definitely go back, but this time with really low expectations. 
We got sat, 10 minutes went by and we had not been greeted by "our server." At this point we were looking at each other, looking around considering to leave. The manager saw us, and did not even acknowledge us, he headed to kitchen and got a server really quickly!! The server comes to our table and says, "Are you ready to order?" Those were his first words. Anyways, at this point we just wanted to eat. We ordered. We ate. The busser came by a few times more than the server and asked if we needed anything. So we decided to tip the bus boy instead of "our server." 

We ordered the filet mignon with crab and the combo mussels, shrimp & crab skillet. Both dishes were really good!! We also liked the fact that they offer a pitcher of their house beer for $19. Good amount of beer for 2 ppl.
author: Juan H.

description:
Absolutely terrible. Took my mother in law and wife her at the start of December. I ordered the halibut and pasta which had clearly been microwaved. Toughest driest halibut I have ever had, I couldn't even finish it. The pasta was destroyed by the microwave and was hard in parts and falling apart in others.
My wife and her mother shared a large crab, mussel shrimp combo. The crab was ok but sparse but the mussels and shrimp were in-edible. Terrible service as well, I can't understand how this place is still in business as it is at least 30% more expensive than much better places on the wharf.  Avoid, avoid avoid.
author: Brian M.

description: My only reason for giving them 3 stars and not 4 is the additional $30.00 in taxes added to our bill (something about insurance for employees).  Aside from that the food was good the service was really good.  If you like crab, mussels or shrimp this is the place for you!  Didn't like the people staring at me as they walk by... felt like a animal at the zoo or maybe like those sea lions behind the restaurant.   Probably should have picked another place for our seafood dinner but we spent the whole day at Alcatraz and didn't feel like driving anywhere.  You get what you get and you don't throw a fit!
author: Halley S.

description: Overall, I wasn't impressed. Based on the reviews, I expected better. I guess my expectations were too high. I live in Orange County, CA and we are used to go to Boiling Crab and we were expecting The Crab House to be better. Much to our surprised, we were dissappointed. The portions were small, the food was pricey. We ordered 2 full crabs of which had very little meat in them. The view is nice, the service was okay, nothing spectacular. I'm sure there are a lot of good crab spots in San Francisco, but this isn't one of them.
author: Christina R.

description: My boyfriend & I got the whole crab...the presentation of the crab was the best part.  They literally bring the whole thing out (head & everything).  It had great flavor lots or crab & it was easy to get it out of the shell.  Service was great, they have nice views.  The waitress even puts bibs on you.  Garlic fries are amazing here!
author: Reanna R.

description: This place is great! The crab chowder is a 10! The crab cakes are a 10! The tiramisu was a 10! The cast iron skillet was a 7. The mussels and shrimp were great, the only problem is intense heat dries out the crab a bit. But the garlic dipping butter was to die for. All and all this was a great dinning experience! The drinks were great! The staff was friendly and great! The decor was fun. Go you wont be disappointed!
author: Daniel J.

description: Some friends from NY were out visiting and they had to have seafood (or so they demanded). It's an interesting place, the atmosphere is okay but the food and service was fantastic. Overall it gave my friends a good idea of the type of seafood the Bay had to offer which is always a plus. It's a place to return to? Not so much; the choices were somewhat meager and the pricing... seemed off. Definitely a great spot as a tourist though.
author: Shauna S.

description:
the crab is a lie.  

i realize i am an idiot for expecting anything more as this place is located on pier effing' 39, but four stars!??!  REALLY??  

3lbs of "whole crab" crab for two is total B.S.!  just look at the photos!  it's a pile of legs and claws with a tiny, tiny amount of body meat attached!  you aren't actually served what you are paying for, which is the entirety of the body cavity which any crab lover worth their salt knows is the most delicate and delicious part!  they are using that body meat elsewhere in other dishes and you are paying for it!  give me the entire crab "crab house" watch as i pull it limb from limb and rip it's guts and leave them on your effing' floor and eat the body cavity for FIFTY freaking dollars.  if i had wanted a pile of previously cooked and reheated in butter to the point they were overcooked crab legs i would have gone to "crazy buffet" or some shit and followed those up with some buffalo wings, pizza and a vanilla soft-serve for half the price.

also that "killer" crab sauce is WHACK and way too overpowering for the delicate crab meat.

i should have just waddled my pregnant butt down to ghiradelli square for a sundae for lunch like i wanted and suggested all along.
author: Jessie J.

description: Great food, but the experience was compromised by the tight seating arrangement, and servers who need to work on their communication skills and serving technique.  The atmosphere is fun and the views of the Bay are fabulous.
author: Marq T.

description: Enjoyed the crab chowder and crab louie, friends enjoyed the garlic roasted crab. Yes, I would return.
author: Catherine D.

description: What a great place to eat and I don't care for seafood but my husband loves seafood and he really enjoyed the crab he had and the presentation was great. I had the filet mignon and garlic fries. Oh my goodness - the steak and fries were awesome. I like my steaks well and it could have been cut with a butter knife it was so tender.  There some kind if sauce with it that was so good too. They brought ketchup for the fries but the fries were yummy they didn't need anything. They were awesome. The service was the best. They really take care of their customers. The atmosphere is fun - crabs decorating. The walls painted and or decorated all kinds of ways. Very good place to eat.
author: Phyllis C.

description:
We took some out of town family here for dinner and the food was absolutely delicious! One of the things that stood out the most, were the garlic fries. They are to die for! Even better than the ballpark! 
Crab enchiladas, m-m-m! The service was also very attentive.
author: Marilynn L.

description: After the Fort Mason Ceremonies on Saturday, we headed to Pier 39's Crab House. The food was spectacular! The prices are expensive but so worth it and It's a great restaurant to celebrate special occasions. Attire can be casual but we were dressed  more Formal/Dressy.  I love this place, great food, very friendly staff. I look forward to dinning there again :)
author: Gina F.

description:
killer crab was good
but the waiter did not pay us nearly as much attention as to the other tables (double standards because we did not order as much as the others?); he did not serve bread until we asked; ignored our request twice for hot tea, skipped an order and did not cut our crab or serve us nutcrackers like for other tables

we came in for a fun dining experience but left disappointed and angry on a New Year eve
author: Diane W.

description: Honestly, I can't say enough about the crab here.  It's the best I've ever had.....ever.  It's a tad on the pricey side (for us anyway) but worth it.  You get nothing with your crab except bread.  Everything is ala carte.  We ordered crab cakes (you get two), garlic bread, tea, and shared a tiramisu with a tab of $83.00.  But it was amazingly good.  The server was super attentive and friendly.  We had a window seat which was nice.  The restaurant is nice and clean but not fancy.   We probably won't go on a regular basis because it's kind of expensive but we will definately be back and we wouldn't hesitate to recomment it.
author: liz s.

description: Crispy garlic fries - very light, very crisp-great garlic flavor - raw but not too much or overpowering. Did the 1/2 crab with salad deal. Just legs when u order it this way. Loved the garlic butter sauce it was drenched in. Crab was good. Chewy in the smaller legs but well cooked in the larger pieces. Fresh.
author: PJ C.

description:
Our family of 5 (2 adults and 3 kids) ate here over the weekend.  We're "locals" from San Jose, but we decided to try this place out after reading other Yelp reviews, and we were not disappointed!

Service - 5 stars - fast, friendly, and efficient (servers use wireless devices); servers and bus people were so well coordinated; we always had everything we needed;  our kids made a mess and they did a great job cleaning up after us throughout the meal

Calamari - 4 stars - really light batter; lots of tenacles (our favorite pieces); but a tad on the oily side; dipping sauce was good

Crab Chowder - 3 stars - we were really looking forward to this, but it wasn't what we really expected; lots of crab and vegetables, but we prefer chowders to be more creamy; also the soup came out lukewarm

Roasted Crab - 5 stars!! - we had 2 whole roasted crabs and they were sooooo finger-licking good with all that garlicky, buttery goodness on the iron skillet!

Garlic Fries - 5 stars - wow, I never thought I would give garlic fries 5 stars, but like others have said, these were awesome

Overall - 4+ stars - We will definitely be back when visiting Pier 39 area.
author: Hai C.

description: Not a seafood person, but my sister devoured the crab and says it was delicious. I had the shrimp pasta and it was good. Touristy place, and had to wait an hour because the place was packed.
author: Aclaire H.

description: This had been my 3rd dining experience here, and was very disappointed. Stopped here for lunch with my best friend for lunch on a wednesday. Was greeted by very informal staff, who were too busy socializing with one another. The crab, was great, but I am all about service, I know that this is not the only crab restaurant in the city, and will not be stopping here any longer. The restrooms were just as horrible, and dirty.
author: Gracie S.

description: Best crab ever! I highly recommend going in a group of four to five people and order the Crab Feast, which is Dungenss crab roasted in a secret garlic sauce that tastes so good you want to eat the shell.  Compliment the meal with garlic fries and you are good to go. The service is great and if you sit at a window you will be able to watch the sea lions circling the pier.
author: Alicia O.

description: The crab our table ordered was very good, but that was the only highlight of the evening. Cramped table, cold, hard bread, and pricey considering the quality and atmosphere of the restaurant.
author: Caitlin S.

description: Extremely touristy but we really enjoyed our dungeon crab! LOL. I'll definitely go there again if we get to visit SF.
author: lena k.

description: Whenever we're near the Piers of SF, I get a sudden craving for the Crab House on Pier 39.  I've enjoyed a few meals here in the past years and am never disappointed.  But the one thing that always brings me back is the Crab Chowder!  Delicious!!!
author: Rae L.

description: OMG crab lovers, you're in for a treat.  The mussels are fresh.  The crab chowder tasty (a bit too much corn though).  Last but not least, the Dungeness Crab... incredible.  I think we're going to be monthly regulars.
author: Amelia C.

description:
We were a bit concerned about the waiting when we read the reviews before we went. So I made a reservation in advanced through Open Table. It appears that you can only make reservation for time slot prior to 6 pm or after 9 pm. So we decided to have 5:30 pm early dinner.

I think we made the right decision as not only we beat the crowd, we also get a nice window table with 4 chairs next to bay for a 2-perons party. The view is great and a lot of spaces as there is extra space next to the window where you can put all the condiments, and water pitcher there instead of occupying your table.

The food is nice. We ordered the double shrimp and crab skillet. Also have a bowl of crab chowder. The bowl is large. So the $9.99 is really worth it. It is tasteful with a lot of crab meats. Also the crab in the skillet is well cooked with just right seasoning. 

For the service, the waitress is not very polite in the beginning. Originally we misread the menu and thought we can order mussel, shrimp and crab in the same skillet. The menu said "Double mussel or shrimp & double crab". So we miss the 'or' word. So  we initially ordered "double mussel AND shrimp and double crab". Instead of explaining our misunderstanding to us, the waitress simply said " we don't have that". and just stand there looking at us. So we were a bit confused. Then suddenly my wife get it. She said, "oh, OK, then just "Shrimp & double crab". The waitress still said "no, we don't have that". So we ask what she meant. She eventually said "you can either have "Double mussel and double crab" or "DOUBLE shrimp and double crab". We were like "duh!". What happens to customer is always right?? You can explain to us. But no need to behave like we are stupid or do not understand English. It really spoil our happy mood for the day so far.

We were a bit annoyed. But later on the waitress seems to make a full turn and become very nice. She even helped us to cut the crab in half when it came. So we kind of just let go those bad feeling as we were on holiday mood.

Anyway, the food is 5 star. The 1 star off is really because of the not so professional service.
author: Chun L.

description:
Nice friendly restaurant with a wide choice.  Obviously there's a lot of crab on the menu but they also have some chicken, beef and vegetarian options.  The prices are a little on the high side, but it is in the tourist area so that's sort of to be expected.  
On this visit I had the crab cakes to start, followed by the fish and chips (what a Brit I am).  I have to say though that this was all put to shame by the huge crab salad that my girlfriend ordered.  Next time I'll be ordering just the crab salad.
author: Jon A.

description:
we were being tourist and decided to eat at pier 39.  try out a restaurant we havent been to. a mistake??....hmmmm?

i didnt have their famous killer crab. instead i opted for their crab cioppino. prob a big mistake on my part. there was hardly any crab.  it did taste good, but totally not worth $20.  my wife had the fish and chips (garlic fries) and the fish was huge! that actually was pretty good. 

the services was good and the view was great.  not the best place for kids. their kids menu has 3 items...really not a great selection.

i prob wouldnt go back. 2.5 stars
author: Craig I.

description: Love the food, had a blast with the crabs there.  I thought that crab cakes was average, and garlic noodles was a hit with my husband but I prefer another place's.  Garlic fries was good.  Service was good overall, although our server gave us a little attitude when my husband was trying to ask what brand of root beer they serve (he asked what kind of root beer instead of what brand).  It was also hard to find the server when we needed something.  Wished we had a different server because all other people who helped us were super nice.  Other than that, I'd go back for the crab.
author: YJ L.

description: This review is easy. Never again, never again, never again. If you like being in a place with ghetto adults who have no manners who bring their shrieking one your old kids, service with attitude, and mediocre food, this is your place. But if you want quality service in a pleasent atmosphere worthy of your $200.00 bill for three adults, don't even think about it. By the way the asshole servers name was Vinny. I only know that because for some reason he came and asked me my name for some unknown reason at the end of my meal.
author: Mike M.

description: The view from this restaurant is simply stunning. The crabs were so good. The side of steamed vegetables was on the small side.
author: Annie L.

description:
YUM Freaking YUM!

Craving crab? This is the spot to go, I'm a HUGE fan of crab, the service was great and quick.
author: S A.

description: Would've rated them higher except for the service. We were asked to wait a few minutes while they prepared to open a new section. We were the second party of two to be seated. About 45 minutes later, we still did not have our entrees although every table in the section was full and they all had their food. Our server said the kitchen was "slammed" and we'd get our food soon. Hmmm...wasn't "slammed" when we got there. That said, the food was pretty good although way over priced due I'm sure to the touristy location. I would recommend the crab chowder, which we had with garlic cheese bread. The chowder was super yummy. We also had fish and chips and a crab melt. We also had a couple of over-priced drinks from the bar. All in all, it was tasty, but not worth the price. Our lunch was over $80 not including tip. Probably would not come back.
author: Karen D.

description: Stay away! I would give this restaurant 0 stars if I could. Both the boyfriend and I ended up with an upset stomach after eating dinner here. We think it was the lukewarm crab chowder we were served, but we also had their famous crab. That alone would warrant a bad review, but the service was also hectic and disorganized. We were waiting for a table and heard several parties complain to the host that they never heard their names called from the wait list and then squeezed in--actually our first table was given away to one of these groups. During dinner service, our server was very busy and seemed unavailable to refill our waters, except for one occasion...so I held up my hand to hail another server/bus boy. THREE different times, I made eye contact, the server/bus boy smiled, and totally walked away. I understand walking away to finish up a task but to not even come back after to see what we needed? Definitely cannot un-recommend this restaurant enough.
author: Lisa W.

description: Excellent crab and what appears to be a reasonable (or standard) price for Fisherman's Wharf.  We had a party of 2 and shared the Lotsa-Crab for Two (3 pounds of crab legs). The crab was fresh and delicious.   Service was very fast - maybe a tad too fast.  Being a Wharf restaurant they have a high client turnover.  Drinks were surprisingly inexpensive. The crab ran about $16 a pound (the next day we saw fresh off the boat whole crabs in Bodaga Bay for $3.99/lbs, so you get some idea of the mark-up) but that appeared to be the going rate in most of the Wharf area restaurants.
author: Tom K.

description:
Glad we had reservations! Very busy due to it being 4th of July. Crab Cioppino broth was very good with a little kick, but I didn't like that they just threw crab legs in the soup. Hard to crack crab legs when they are simmering in a hot broth. Next time, I will ask then to put lump crab meat in there. Let's just say it wasn't very "mom" friendly dish to order when you have a toddler to feed. House salad had interesting & yummy dressing.
View was very nice. This place did not knock my socks off, but I would go back here again. Service for that night was GREAT! Giving it 4 stars since service was so good & it was so busy.
author: Peedee M.

description:
I had the best crab in my life at this "Crab house"! 

I went there Sunday night and sat at the bar because the restaurant was full. It was actually fun sitting at the bar and watching the bartender making all these cool drinks:) He is very nice and knows the menu really well. I asked him a bunch of questions before I decided what to get. There was a big choice of mojitos and I couldn't decide which one I want but he recommended to get the regular one and then maybe try a flavored one for the second round. 
I haven't had a crab for a long time and didn't have any clue how to eat that huge killer crab but the bartender and other customers at the bar showed me how to deal with it. The best part was that secret garlic sauce....mmmm....delicious. Now I know why is it "secret"! It's just amazing! 
It took me an hour to finish the killer crab and then I also asked for some bread to dip it into that sauce.
I had a great time there talking to the fun bartender who is Turkish and speaks many languages so it was really nice to talk about Europe and traveling.
Thank you "Crab House" for making my day!
author: Victoria S.

description: This place is AMAZING!!! My mom, cousin, and sister came here for New Year's Eve to have the crab... Not just any crab this I do believe is "MAGIC" crab. I think it's the closest thing to doing ilicit drugs without doing them. Why you ask it's in the GARLIC SAUCE I swear maybe it was just me I thought but then Leena was laughing a lot too then my cousin Ohhh no it wasn't me. Then it hit me like a ton of bricks BAM!!! It's the sauce... The appetizer's didn't effect me the clam chowder didn't effect me then came that sweet succulent crab with that GARLIC SAUCE!!! I feel bad that some of the reviews at this place are not that great my experience was All that and then some... Can't wait to go to pier 39 and suck that garlic juice out of that crustacean...
author: Pooja B.

description: Made reservations via Opentable for 4th of July early dinner. We were not disappointed. Food and service was perfect. Crab and mojitos were the best part of the menu. A little pricey but worth the experience.
author: Laura L.

description: What a pleasant surprise! We happened upon this restaurant by accident and found great food and fantastic service by our waiter, Louis. We had shrimp, crabs and we made up a dish of garlic French fries with crab. Everything was fabulous and the service was exceptional!
author: Nina L.

description: Not bad for a place in a very touristy area. Great views, good food and service. And yes the fries are a MUST.
author: Lisa C.

description: Garlic crab, fries, n noodles is really good but Wharf salad w crab n shrimp ain't that great.  Expensive.  I couldn't say I would go back.
author: ReviewNu T.

description:
The food is OK, it's nothing spectacular.  Some dishes lack seasoning.
The service is excellent.  

I would go back again.
author: Mike C.

description: I ate here with a group of friends after doing a little wandering around the Wharf a couple weeks back and my experience was just average. It wasn't that it was bad, I just expected a little more I guess since being right on the bay. What was really good though was the seasoning they used and the way they prepared the shrimp and crab legs.
author: Ron S.

description: We searched yelp and as usualy yelp didnt let us down. I ordered the haddock and my wife ordered the angel hair crab lasagna and both where very good, my wifes dish was crazy good. It was one of the best dishes ever. Man i wish this place was closer to home. my haddock with seaweed sauce was very good. when it showed up on the table my first thought was shit what did i order because of the seeweed but i ate it all.
author: Mike L.

description:
Like most I was concerned that any place on Pier 39 would be  a tourist trap, over priced and poor quality. This is not so black and white for Pier 39. I went there with friends , some from outta town who insisted on the place. The reviews seems pretty good overall so I thought I would dive in. I got Cioppino (mixed seafood). It was $25 , no salad or others extras. The quality of the seafood and freshness was very good. Given the location, the quantities were generous. The sauce was a little bland and there was no crusty bread served, which SF sourdough fresh form the oven would have been perfect. The served bread what a white roll soft and not overly flavorful. One of the BEST aspects of the restaurant was the $4.95 corkage which is the lowest I can remember seeing in decades. This cuts $10-15 per person off the costs of the meal if you like good wine.
Fora  touristy place this place is well above average. I gave it 3 stars because 4 is a place I really love and 5 is for those few near perfect experiences.
author: Barry F.

description: All the items on the menu are very tempted. A little bit pricey but consider at a tourist spot, I guess it's reasonably. Ordered the set dinner with a very fresh salad(souce is very light) and 1/2 killer crab and tiramisu cake. The killer crab is so yummy. Only had 6 pieces but is filled. Tiramisu is better than the local italian restaurant's. Love it. Will try the crab on a skillet plate next time. The combo dinner is the best price, 29.99 for the while thing. Not to forget the view too! Where else can u eat by the ocean under 30 dollar?
author: Minami A.

description:
Wow was I disappointed in this place.  I had been wanting to go for a long time.  So I finally went with a couple of friends.  One is a conciege at  local hotel and has often sent people there, but had not tried it.  
The restaurant is really narrow and crowded.  The views are not great, not terrible, but there are better at Pier 39.  The place just looks a little tired.

I have eaten at the other restaurants owned by this group and have always really loved them.  This is nothing like Bobos or Franciscan.  The quality of the food is totally different.  Definately geared to a tourist, who will only be eating there once.  Like the tourists I will only be eating there once.

We had mussles and shrimp on the skillet.  The muscles were pretty dry and the shrimp were very small,  I think they were frozen, not fresh.  One of my friends had the crab for a main course, that looked pretty good.  Two of us had the sand dabs,  they were ok, sort of over sauteed in butter, but tasty.  The presentation was also bad,  The bread was not even good.  How can you be at Fishermans Wharf and not have good french bread.
My friend asked which manager was on duty because since he sends lots of business to them, or has until now, wanted to meet a manager.  our waiter said all 4 managers were on duty tonight.  Well no manager ever came over.  As we were leaving we mentioned it to the host, that he was disappointed that he was not able to meet a manager, and the host said yeah it was too bad but they were just too busy to meet customers,  The whole thing was strange.
Anyway, if you are visiting SF and want dinner on the water you can do so much better.
author: Trevor S.

description: It's a touristy place but that whole crab is lucious..you will reek of garlic for 3 days..
author: Bleep S.

description: Crab House is awesome!! First it is a smaller, touristy restaurant because it is at Pier 39. However, the views are awesome and definitely worth the extra price. It is not a local spot just one that you would come to for a special occasion. Situated on the Sea Lion side of the Pier.  Their use of garlic here is evident. Garlic Fries are awesome but you must have the 3lb of crab in the special garlic sauce(meant for 2 to share)!! My wife and I love crab so this will rival many good seafood restaurants. The crab chowder, steamed clam appetizer, and also the cioppino are excellent. I would recommend this to any crab lover and I will definitely go back.
author: Jonathan Q.

description: Crab melt was a little heavy on the garlic... Okay a lot heavy on the garlic.... Service was okay.  So if you like garlic, their garlic fries and crab melt are a must... If you are allergic to garlic, steer clear
author: Angela A.

description: Wasn't expecting this good a meal in thus tourist area, but the Crab and garlic fries were fantastic!  Service was good too, not bad wait time especially with a party of 8.
author: Rob S.

description: I expected much more from the restaurant based on the reviews that I read from Yelp.  We ordered the Crab Feast for $110.  I've had better crab legs from other seafood restaurants.  If they did not fried their crab legs, it would have been much better. I'm used to eating steamed or boiled crabs.  The portion size was adequate for 5 or 6 adults. Service is just okay.  Would probably try another seafood restaurant when I am at Pier 39/Fisherman's Wharf area!
author: Michael T.

description: All in all the food was really really good. The place is cozy (tight quarters) but nice. If you like seafood - crab in particular then here's a place to try. My concern to those would be price for amount you get. There was a total of 3 in my party the night we dined there and ordered the crab feast for 4 ... at the end it seems we still were hungry. Don't get me wrong - I eat but normally there is left over and 1 person in the party doesn't enjoy crab as much so I think we didn't get the amount that comes with what we ordered. Good food but for that price don't think I'll be going back.
author: rube s.

description: I went to the Crab House for a friend's birthday dinner and while we ordered a variety of differnt dishes the one thing that was the best hands down was the killer crab. The crab by itself had so much more flavor than I anticipated. The other tasty item I'd recommend is the garlic fries.
author: Brenda K.

description: This place has the best crab I have ever had in my life.  Born and raised on the California coast, I've tried crab in both the northern and southern state regions, and this has to be the best.  Whenever I go, I order the crab feast, which is $100.  Enough to feed four people I think its a decent price for the quality.  The mountain of crab that comes out an a hot skillet, is immediately attacked by all of the out of town guests I have taken there.  The most recent visit (March 2008), my guests enjoyed it so much, we went there the next day too!
author: Jaweed B.

description: Seated on time, but a bit cramped. Service OK, not very attentive. Noisy .Decent food. Touristy prices, as expected on Pier 39.
author: Jed F.

description: Friends and I decided to spend our last night in SF with something with some of their highly embraced Dungeness Crabs.  All of the other restaurants were pretty vacant for a Saturday night but this place was PACKED!! We waited for, maybe, 15 mins?  The service was very prompt.  Overall, it was a great time!
author: Anmry N.

description: It was okay, service was good but nothing I would rave for.  the place was hot and stuffy.
author: I P.

description: It seemed more like a tourist trap since it's located at Pier 39, but the food was definitely better than I expected (we had a whole crab and lobster pasta) ...Only thing is that it is a bit pricey (but it is seafood, after all), so if you really like crab, the best bet for the money in my opinion is PPQ Dungeness Crab in the Richmond Dist. Having said that, though, I did like the the cozy ambiance of the restaurant with the woodend interior and fireplace.  I'm sure the views of the Bay and the Pier are nice too, but it was already dark outside when we got there.
author: Yinnie L.

description: We stopped here for an early lunch on a busy Saturday before our Alcatraz tour. Awesome efficient service and the food was wonderful. We all got the fish and chips. The fish was a big tasty fillet and it came fresh from the frier. The garlic fries that came with it were also crunchy and tasty.  They have pitchers of waters on the table so if you drain your water quickly there is a way to refill  without waiting for wait staff to do it for you ... Great idea for a busy restaurant in a busy place. Yes it was pricey but even a hot dog at a cart will cost you at Pier 39. I would definitely recommend this place and the other patrons who were eating crab looked very satisfied too.
author: Joyce A.

description: I love this place. We go there for the Crabs & sea food. We take a couple of  big Crabs & a loaf of sour dough bread back to our hotel room. Break out the news papers. A nice cold bottle of lemonade. & Enjoy the crabs, & of course San Fancisco!!!!
author: Brenda H.

description: I always bring all my friends to visit here first since it's at Pier 39 (tourist attraction!). Great food and environment. Wait is not too long and the food and service is great. Never had a problem. They'll always serve a little more food than on the menu (ie. give you a little over a pound of something if it says a pound) so that's cool. More to eat! Their crab and scallop is delicious and their garlic fries is addicting! I think they fry it in the same oil as the crab of something because it taste really good! Anyways, definitely worth the price!
author: Jubei J.

description:
I'm sorry, but whoever thinks the crab served at this place is the best in the city has 1) never had crab before; 2) never had fresh crab before or 3) got paid by the crab house to do a review.

When crab is fresh, it's juicy. Not so here as the meat was dry and hence, receded from the shell. The garlic and seasoning were too strong in the parts of meat exposed and almost nonexistent in those parts covered by shell...

I've had imitation crab meat at cheap Japanese restaurants better than Crab House crab.
author: Ken L.

description: This place brings me back to the Peppermill. Love the bonfire in the middle. We sat at the bonfire, looking out at the view, had a couple anchor steam pints and shared a half crab. Just enough to determine that yes...you can find delicious food in a touristy spot such as Pier 39. The service was authentic, warm, and the bar atmosphere very old school SF. We were on a crab feed, stopping at about 5 or 6 spots for crab tastings and this spot hits the (near) top of the list. It is fun, too, to stop by the open market crab spots next door and do the walk up crab thing and take it out to a bench on a pier. Be a tourist in your own city, come on you can do it!
author: Amy E.

description: I've been going to the Crab House for about 4 years now and it was always very yummy. However, this time we went, the service was OK, the glasses were dirty, the silverware was also dirty and the crab was warm when it came out, not hot as it used to be. The crab used to be very buttery and piping hot and crispy. Now, it's just OK. So I am disappointed and I'm not sure I'll be back again. At least not until their service and food improve.
author: silvia h.

description: I love this place, it is a crab lovers dream. The crabs here are amazing, but that is the only good food there. Everything else is very simple, like burgers and fries. The crabs though are amazing.
author: Nikita K.

description: OK, I'll be the first to say that Fisherman's Wharf isn't a place I would think of for dinner, but a recent craving for Dungeness Crab brought me here.  After hearing about the Roasted garlic crab, I wanted to see what it was about.  First of all, it is MESSY.  The garlic and oil make for a very messy experience.  But is is also  some of the tastiest crab I have had.  Perfectly done and even better when washed down with some local brews, as the wine list isn't that extensive and beer would be easier to drink with the dish.  We also noticed that everyone was eating the garlic fries, so I thought what the hell.  After the first bite, I thought that these were the best garlic fries around!  Seems simple enough to have crisp fries with garlic that ain't raw.  But very few places seem to get it right.  Finally, they also have an excellenet salad with grilled shrimp. So it isn't fusion or noveau or trendy, but it does some basic dishes extremely well.
author: Peter L.

description: You gotta try everything on the menu!!! Eat here like twice a day, everyday, for months, till you have tried all of their treats. Seriously, why not, if money is no object, you should go for it. After you've tried all of their menu items, inquire about their secret menu, members only entrees & starters. Ask for water, no ice, than tell your mommy that your time has not yet come woman
author: John B.

description: Again, I love the food but not the prices!  $20 for a half crab is just not right! Not right at all!  But I just really want to love this place...
author: D J.

description: This place is pricey and touristy but I found it to be delicious. I ordered the crab legs and a bowl of crab chowder. The crab meat was definately fresh but the sauce they coat the legs in is what makes it money.
author: Roland O.

description: This place is great!  Make a quick reservation so you don't have to wait in line.  We had the crab chowder to start, very good.  Then we had the crab for two, in a wonderful sauce.  The legs were fresh and flavorful.  We each had a drink as well.  Sure, this is an expensive lunch-- but that's why you're here, isn't it?  Yes, it's in a tourist trap area, but the views are lovely (I had both Alcatraz and the Golden Gate!) and the food is delicious.  Go!
author: Lauren B.

description: $100 of crab legs never tasted so good.  This place was absolutely great for crab (as it damn well should be), and without doubt my favorite place on the pier.
author: Jonathan K.

description: Hubby and I were in San Fran for vacation and we both are crab lovers, after reading the reviews we decided to try it out. Started off with the Crab chowder and it was good, less creamy and had more vegies compared to New England style. Then for main dish we ordered the killer crab, the crab was fresh and meaty, the garlic sauce was tasty and salted just enough for our taste, it was still enough on the skillet for us to dip the meat in. Overall not bad for a tourist-y area
author: jing c.

description: it's not worth the price and time eating crab here.  you're better off steaming your own and enjoying from home!
author: Kae B.

description: Killer's crab is a highlighter! Service is good, I am over joyed that they booked me a large round table with bat view :)
author: Karen Z.

description: This place didn't change my life, knock me out of my seat or really leave me very excited about crab or anything I'd had while there. It's very touristy, pretty expensive and not very justified. The garlic fries are not the greatest either - don't expect some crazy new invention... all it is is fries + chopped up sauteed garlic... meh. My friend and I ended up sharing the half order of crab - another meh moment ($20 for half a crab - hot damn!). The crab cakes were what really saved this place for me - deeeeelish. The place is pretty rustic looking with kooky crabs on the walls painted in different colors and styles... Think crab-obsessed Outback Steakhouse.
author: evelyn c.

description: I took my girl here for her birthday since she likes crab. We both ordered the dungeness crab. It was mindblowing good. The crab here unlike other restaurants I have been to comes to you seasoned so you don't really need to dip it anything else for it to taste good. The price was a little costly though. Our dinner with everything included was about $140, but it was worth it. They have anchor steam on tap and the service in general was good. Our waitress took forever though to come check up on us and bring refills. If it weren't for the slow service, I would have given it a 5/5.
author: Kevin W.

description: I was craving crab and I wanted a new scenery - so I decided to take the family to Pier 39.  The Crab House was crowded and it smelled so good from the outside we had to try it.  We ordered the Ultimate Feast - Garlic Crab for 4.  It was delicious - very garlicky and yummy.  I wasn't that impress with the garlic noddles though -  I think I expected to be like another restaurant.  The service was great and the food came fast - even the wait didn't take as long as they stated.  Over all excellent!  The minus is for the different garlic noddles good but not that impressive!
author: May A.

description: This used to be my favorite place to have crab, until I discovered Crustacean.  Now it's my second favorite.  They also make a great crab bisque/chowder.  The owner of the Stinking Rose also owns the Crab House, so you'll get the same crab at both places, though parking in North Beach is tough!
author: Kristen K.

description: My bf and I cannot get enough of Crab House. Everything on the menu is good BUT the bestest :) is the Double Shrimp Double Crab...yummy!!! It is served quite fast for being fresh...super steamy and smells amazing. The garlic butter combination they use cannot be beat...the shrimp is grilled perfectly and the dipping sauces given aren't even necessary, but still so yummy. And the crab...cannot forget the crab...melts in the mouth like butter. OMG! This is the ONLY place I finish all my food and my bf gets none of my leftovers. I have a tendency to take friends here or even my sibs when they come to visit...needless to say, they are begging me to return. They're addicted now too :) Definitely recommend Crab House.
author: Angela M.

description:
I remembered reading some better reviews for this place, but I can't really justify anything more than 3 stars. I even threw an extra star in there for the great view of the sea lions from the bar where we ate. Those suckers are NOISY, so it was nice to observe them from indoors.

The service was just OK. Waiter/bartender was underwhelming. The hostess seemed like she had been dealing with tourists one day too many. 

The food was also just alright. Hubby had the crab chowder and I had the crab cakes - both of these items were very good. In fact, the crab chowder was better than any of the clam chowders we had during our visit. Sweet, creamy, chunky with a mild heat at the finish. Delish!

The overall impression of our meal was weighed down, however, by the salad with crab which ended up being soggy with some flimsy wonton noodles. Ick.
author: Nicole W.

description: It was wonderful.. I love crab and it was good.  the salad was good, the artichokes wonderful.. the drinks great  the service outstanding from all.
author: april b.

description: Nice old fashioned seafood restaurant vibe. Good service. Really good crab and garlic fries. A little too touristy for my taste, and I left smelling like I had been soaked in butter and garlic.  If you are okay with that, then this can be a great place to get some fresh seafood.
author: John P.

description:
their killer crab was very good!
it didn't seem like much
for the price we paid tho...
author: Dana L.

description: Be ready to get your diggs dirtied up - even with the protective plastic bib around that neck. If you are willing to face the challenge of cracking that exterior to get to the hearty meat of those succulent dungeness crabs - go to the Crab House. The crab was so good that I don't even recall the appetizers or the tourists. Wow.
author: Judy L.

description: Although I'm not a big fan of Fisherman's Wharf, every time I'm in San Francisco I make myself come here.  The dungeness crabs are the best I've ever had.  The ciappino soup dish is also the best I've ever had.  It can get a little stuffy and loud in there and the crabs get very messy but it is well worth it!  Also, beware of tourists!
author: Marina T.

description: Went here in March and loved it! We order the Crab Feast, Garlic fries, and garlic bread.  Price is reasonable and the food is tasty. There's a lot of garlic in most of their dishes so make sure you bring breath mints!
author: Miki M.

description: If you must go to fisherman's wharf and you must eat somewhere other than In and Out, try this place with the folks. its nice at night with the reflections on the water. if someone else is paying even better!
author: Jenna E.

description: Unlike the other restaurants at Pier 39, the Crab House is actually worth the price you pay and worth returning to. They have a very good Cioppino absolutely brimming with seafood. Their Crab and Muscle Tureens are also good, well seasoned and flavorful. Very generous portions of Calamari and good choice of breads.
author: Irene D.

description:
It's more like the Crap house then Crab House. as we come in we waited forever for the hostess, I been to enough restuarant to know that hostess are suppose to stand in the front lobby and greet customer. We would told that it would be 15minutes before our table is ready, we end up waited for over 30minutes.

now to the food and service.... if you like semi-warm and i mean semi-warm food this is the placed for you. we order our crab cake and 2 minutes later it come out. I always have a bad feeling when food come out fast, cuz two things will happen. (1) it's gonna be suck or/ (2) you gonna get food poison. I didn't get food poison, but my gf did, i just feel ycuky after we left this place. Hot tea's will help!!!  the food was awful. It's seem like they prepare all the dishs in advance and microwave them. And now the services, man... that waitress is such a B%@^&#.  She is not friendly at all, we waited and waited, so i finally call her over to have her take our order. She did not give us our bread, we have to ask. all the thing that she was suppose to do she let order all the bust-boy to do it for her. meanwhile, the waitress in the next section is so nice and friendly to her partron. we wish we were at her section, but we have to stick it out with this B*&@^. 

IF YOU GONNA ORDER ANYTHING FROM THE MENU.... JUST ORDER ANYTHING THAT HAVE "SIZZLING" ON IT. THAT WAY AT LEAST YOUR FOOD WOULD BE HOT (NOT WARM). THE CRAB IS GOOD, BUT ITS NOT SOMETHING THAT YOU CAN COOK AT HOME. JUST A LITTLE SCALLION, GINGER, BASIL, SALT AND PEPPER YOUr DATE, GF OR WIFE WILL BE impress AND MAYBE YOU GET SOMETHING, SOMETHING AFTER DINNER.... ^_^

GO TO NEPTUNE PALACE... THAT'S PLACE IS A LOT BETTER AND THE VIEW IS AMAZING TOO. OH!, AND THEIRS VALIDATION MACHINE WORKS. CRAP HOUSE VALIDATION MACHINE DID NOT WORK. YOU HAVE TO PAY AND THEN GO TO THE CASHIER AND GET A REFUND.
author: Kevin N.

description: the crab feast is the bombdotcom! flavorful and succulent!  oh and garlic fries, crispy with the right amount of garlic. service was awesome, too. the place was super crowded, i recommend making reservations. some may deem it as being a "tourist trap" but when they serve crab like that, who wouldn't wanna be caught?
author: Aileen S.

description:
Overall food experience -- underwhelming.

The Dungeness Crab was FRIED and served drowning in a heavy GARLIC butter sauce (unless you ask to have the sauce on the side, which some of us were glad we did). Such heavy-handed preparation regrettably destroys the delicate taste of the crab. 

The mussels and shrimp appetizer -- small but flavorful mussels, and small and dry shrimp.

The caesar salad -- cool, crispy, fresh, which makes it up to par and by far the best of part of the meal. 

Service -- very inattentive; we have had to wave each time we needed to order more wine, food, etc. in order to get someone's attention.
author: J C.

description: I am surprised to see this place has four stars considering how mediocre their food is. The location is great and decor is crab-themed which is kind of cute, but food was below par. We ordered the crab chowder - too creamy and they skimp on the crab, the crab lasagna - I could tell this was pre-made and they just heat it up cuz the temperature wasn't even. And this was overly creamy and greasy, and they skimp on the crab. This dish was actually pretty gross. And also ordered crab alfredo pasta - this was alright, but really really heavy and creamy. After this meal, my throat felt like it was coated in a thick layer of fat. Eeew. The best thing we had was the bread. I was kinda pissed after lunch since I was really looking forward to a good meal and got a yucky greasy one instead.
author: Josephine V.

description: We had a great experience.  The staff were super nice.  The decor is cute/funny.  And you can sit at a window looking into the water.  The crab was okay but a little buttery for my taste.  The clams were pretty gross, but the shrimp and garlic fries were very good.
author: Campbell B.

description: We settled on this place because we were hanging out by the pier, and I looove seafood. The garlic fries were really awesome, but if you're in it for the dipping sauces, they don't have any- it's ketchup or tarter sauce- no ranch, honey mustard, etc. I was a little disappointed that their menus are all meaty- no real choices of side dishes besides fries or mixed veggies. I did enjoy the crab- it is served in a garlicky marinade of some sort, and did taste awesome. It was my first experience with the cracking and the digging, and the flinging of crab all over the place. The taste was definitely worth it! The crab house draft beer was tasty too.
author: S S.

description: Your family comes in from out of town.  They want to do the tourist things, so you're showing them the sites--Fisherman's Wharf, the sea lions, Ghiradelli--and they want "San Francisco" seafood.  Where to go?  The Crab House fits the bill.  You get kitsch, plastic bibs, and giant sizzling platters of crab.  Definitely get the sizzling platters (big enough for 2-3 people), and the crab chowder is pretty good too.  Avoid the crab angel hair lasagna and crab enchilada.  For the non-seafood eater, there's a decent chicken sandwich.  Be prepared to leave the restaurant smelling like crab--definitely not the most romantic smell.  But, its great for giving the out of towners the crab experience without having to eat on the street.
author: melissa g.

description:
Reserved a table for Saturday night for 12 people for a friends birthday but when we got there they had lost the reservation and we had to wait about 30 minutes for a new table. I expected a manager to apologize but that didn't happen.

Andrew our server was great. We brought our own wine and paid the corkage fee to keep the price of the meal down. Food was very good and everyone enjoyed the crab.

I don't usually go to Fisherman's Wharf  but I was pleasantly surprised by this place. Taking away a star because they lost our reservation and never addressed their mistake.
author: Dana L.

description: Great place for crabs, this is the best tasting crabs I had ever!  I have been coming here for years, not only is the food excellent the service and decor is great too.  It can get a little messy with crab shells all over the place, but hey its part of the fun.  They give you these bibs to protect yourself if you are worried about getting dirty.  You must try the shrimp on the skillet and also the crab chowder all excellent.  Even though its on Pier 39, parking can be a hassle, but its well worth it.
author: Frank N.

description: Maybe it was that it was a Sunday night or that it was colder than usual, but the food was just abysmal. I had been here in the past and I thought that the food was great, so I decided to revisit this spot and left extremely dissatisfied. Granted the views are great since it overlooks the bay, but that was hardly enough to compensate for the poor food. We ordered the crab bisque, crab sandwich, and crab pasta; all three were superbly bland. Even the house ale was not enough to warm my heart towards the food. Could this poor food have been because we did not order the crab, but rather derivatives thereof ? That is and shall continue to remain a mystery since I will not be back here any time soon. Sadly enough, this is one part of San Francisco I do not want to leave heart in.
author: Friedrich H.

description: If you can maneuver your way through the throngs of tourists and brave the unbelievable cold, the Crab House is a good place to feast on crab after a day of sightseeing. The crab chowder is great - unbelievably thick with loads of vegetables and lump crab meat. The veggies still maintain some nice bite, so you're still able to identify what each veggie is. There is a nice hint of spice - not too much to overpower the delicate crab, but enough to feel a kick. The killer crab is juicy, piping hot, and easy to eat. I did find that it was a bit salty for my taste and I'm not really a butter lover. All in all, the Crab House is a good place to go (if you're in the area) but for real crab lovers, I would hit up PPQ Dungeness Crab instead.
author: Joanne T.

description: the food here is okay. we made reservations for a party of 15 and the seating was really awkward, I dont think they prepared and just stuck some tables together next to a tiny booth. the clam chowder wasnt that great, I would have had better luck just walking downstaires and down the block for some clam chower off the street vendors. we ordered the crab feast for 4 and the crab smelled better than it tasted. it seemed as though the crab was boiled and drenched in butter, didnt  taste like much to me. the service was good though, our waiter was nice and keep the drinks coming.
author: Serena L.

description: best dungeon crabs and best garlic fries ever!
author: Zubair K.

description: We were here 2 years ago with my family and I was impressed by their crab enchilada and the place is nice the view of golden gate bridge.  We went there recently  and the mussels and shrim were still good but not the crab enchilada...it was not as tasty as I remembered it before.  Still a nice place to visit and try other food.
author: cecille p.

description: Awesome food and pineapple mojitos. The environment is very lively and the host Issac was very friendly. I do recommend you make reservations though otherwise plan to have a hour wait for a table for two. Can't wait to return.
author: Adriana M.

description: The mussels, clams and the crab are very good and we had fun eating them at this place. We all had lots of fun eating the crab including our mother and the view of the bay and Golden Gate Bridge was also nice.  Also their  bar tender is also very good too mixing drinks.
author: E G.

description: Food wasnt bad but not great.  Restaurant was hot and noisy.   Had the cioppino and crab enchilada, both were good but not great.   Garlic toast was not edible.  Service was adequate.  Price was ok given their location.
author: RIchard R.

description:
I give them a 5 stars for their garlic fries but we ordered their whole garlic crab and it was alright.. We also ordered the mussells and shrimp and that was alright too.. 
I was really expecting to say wow since the reviews were pretty darn good.. 
overall 3 stars for someone who loves seafood...
author: N V.

description:
I'm going to stop going out on Thanksgiving. The place was maybe 1/3 full later in the afternoon and they still tried taking our plates before we were done eating. 
A shake of the finger and a stern, "No, No, No" , and oh yeah, grabbing my unfinished dish of mussels back was finally what it took for them to leave us alone. The manager was very apologetic.
The 1/2 crab was a  bit on the salty side, (well it did come from the ocean)  but the salmon was really tasty. Besides the overzealous bussboy, the most entertaining part of the meal was the "blond" server that we gave our drink order to twice, and then a third time and then still we got the wrong drinks. I suppose it was a rough day for everyone. And oh yes, The Crab Chowder was really, really great....
There was a rather nice restaurant we went to for drinks and oyster shooters a few years back down the embarkadero and I really wish I could find it again.
author: Kevin Q.

description: So I never knew this place existed as Pier 39 has constantly morphed in the years I've lived in SF. Anyway, met a friend yesterday at the crab house, but I have to say my review is solely on the garlic fries. They were crunch but chewy and coated with garlic, but were not completely overpowered with garlic. I saw other tables get this sizzling mussel plate which looked really good except that some of the butter spewed and splashed out. That seemed like a really popular dish. I liked how the restaurant was located on the second floor and had a nice view of the golden gate bridge and had windows that opened up to the walkway. Good on nice days, I'm sure freezing cold when it's foggy.
author: Natalie S.

description:
Okay. So I did my complete research before I booked a dinner here. I had a reservation for 7 (requesting a window seat), but we went in a bit after 6:30 and we were given a table (not window, but understandable) because we were early.
Our server was nice, although he didn't pay as much attention to us as he did the other tables (maybe because we're younger?). The bus boys there were really nice too. 
We ordered 2 sodas, half order dungeness crab, seared scallops, lobster thermidor and a cup of crab chowder. I thought that for 2 people, that going to be too much food, but it wasn't! We finished it, just right about satisfied, but not stuffed. The bill came out to be about $101 before tips. 
Heres a shocker: our first 2 entrees came out 5-10 minutes after we ordered it (LITEREALLY). WOW! I mean.. I guess that's good since we were hungry. But if I was truly trying to "feel the mood", probably not. But yes, super speedy!

Now to review the food:

-The seared scallops was alright. It was good, but not great.
-The crab was good. But I would have to agree with the others who didn't understand what all this rave is about on Yelp. Because it just tasted like regular crab. Yes, there was some special garlic sauce to it, but the crab is cooked in the shell, so...... it wasn't anything special. Order the 3 lbs. for a better value (50$) because theres a lot more to eat. The half order only consists of a few crab legs and a claw or two.
-The lobster thermidor was pretty darn good! I especially like the middle part where the cheese is all melted in. 
-The crab chowder was also delicious.

Would I go back again? Yes, but because I still want to try the crab cakes. Would I order the crab entree again? Probably not.
author: Elaine H.

description: the garlic fries were pretty good. the crabs were pretty good, although i've tried alaskan king crabs much bigger. i'd recommend this place for good food with a group of 5 or more people, because it does have great ambiance and things to do after on the pier.
author: Jason L.

description: This weekend we decided to be SF tourists and stay at the wharf and enjoy some seafood.  We decided to try this place even though I too don't usually go to the tourist trap of Pier 39.  The whole roasted crab did not disappoint garlicky sauce was to die for.  A yummy Caesar salad also was a hit.  The only lacking dish was the clam pasta in a white sauce.  The clams were fresh but the white sauce was nothing to write home about.  If you come here and you want to have some delicious seafood stick with the roasted crab.  Next time we will stay focused and avoid the pasta dishes.  Overall a great meal with good service!
author: Vicky G.

description:
I reviewed just about every restaurant on Pier 39 on Yelp. When we got to the pier, I left my reviews in the car and was subject to my memory (not good after partying all night before), but remembered the Crab House and the good reviews.  I'm usually leery of tourist trap areas and food, but we were thoroughly impressed with this restaurant.  We arrived around 3pm, and though crowded, they still managed to squeeze us in and get a high chair for the little guy.  My granddaughter loved the crab art all over the restaurant, that is, colored, artistic crabs of all sorts and designs kept her really busy.  Server gave her crayons and coloring paper to occupy as well.  Server was really nice and attentive.  We had nice seating next to window with a nice view of the pier and water.
This is the place for crab dishes and crab! I ordered the crab cioppino, without the shell, (could order it either way), though not a huge serving, it hit the spot and could have used a bit more crab, but was okay as we ordered the famous "killer crab" roasted in garlic and butter.  It was a nice size crab, hot and the sauce permeated the meat.  My granddaughter even enjoyed it with her mac n cheese and she never ate crab before.  The fish and chips was ginormous! One huge piece of white fish with a light batter, not the kind that you find elsewhere with super thick batter and thin fish.  The crab enchilada dish was huge in my opinion, 2 enchiladas filled with crab using flour tortillas.  Refills on the drinks, complimentary mini french bread with oil and balsamic.  All kinds of hot sauce available.  Prices are what you'd expect in SF and being a crab house in a tourist spot, I was okay with it.  I was very satisified and the rest of my party was super pleased and full!  I would return and recommend to others!
author: C I.

description: This place is worth going to the Pier for..it is a bit expensive especially for the actual amount of meat you end up getting..but man they do some magic with garlic...they also have a pretty good crab enchilada from what I remember. If you wanna throw down some cash at the pier like a true tourist  I would do it here..plus - you get a bib....COME ON!
author: Natalie G.

description: Hey - we got in and out - food was really - really - really fast and tasted pretty good, was impressed with the service and nice atmosphere - bar looked tempting - just not enough time - enjoy!!!
author: scott P.

description: My friend and I wanted to go to another crab house in San Francisco, but we end up not going there because the place had gotten bad reviews so we decided to go to this place instead. I thought the food was good and the service was great, but the place was too small. We had six people at one table and I did not have elbow space. The food was quite expensive, but then again, we did order the most expensive plate there. My friends and I are going to visit this place again and try something new even though the place is crowded.
author: Nha H.

description: This was our favorite pick of places while in SF. Spent three nights there and ate here the first two. You have to serve pretty good food to get me to eat at the same place two nights in a row. You have to serve pretty good seafood to get me excited about seafood. I will say, without hesitation, if you do not like this place, you just don't like seafood. Despite the fact that this is in a tourist area, they serve damn good crab. Both nights we got the 2 person crab pile. It was more than enough for two people. It came out on a HOT skillet with buttery garlic, salt and pepper sauce. I did not, find the sauce overwhelming. Garlic fries, as many have said, are amazing. Tons of garlic and a little parmesan cheese. A 'small' order was way too large for two people. It compliments the crab very well, by the way. Also good was the crab chowder, big pieces of crab in a good rich sauce. I can also comment that the beer is 'great.' They serve pitchers of beer that are significantly larger than the standard pitcher. They are the large stainless steel 'bell' shaped pitchers. At least 6 full pints in that thing. A true bargain at $20. Service was great. They seemed very good about getting us the food, then leaving us alone. Most waiters, at other places, stop by when you've got crab up to your elbows and a mouthful. They seemed very adept at keeping an eye on their customers. The decor isn't great in here. But we found it to be a reasonably decent atmosphere. I don't like all the red and red lighting. It made me feel like I was the crab being roasted. The prices are 'high' but you totally get what you pay for. So it's a great bargain. One night, there was a table near us with a few ladies, one of them had a shellfish allergy. The staff went absolutely out of their way to make sure she didn't get anything that a shellfish touched. (I wonder why they went in the first place... but anyway.) Says a lot about the staff. That's quite a request to make in a CRAB HOUSE afterall. They were more than willing to comply. So, to sum up, if you like crab (and I know you do, since you're reading this) eat here. This could quite possibly be one of my new, all time favorite places. Absolutely insanely good crab and large portions. 5 HUGE stars for this place, folks.
author: Matt R.

description: This place is the BEAST PLACE IN THE WORLD for dungeness crab. I have been there every time I get to San Fran! The Crab is good and so is everything else. They also were very careful about preparing my friends food since she has shellfish allergies. Great staff and great food!
author: Sinjun1717 M.

description: I'm not a big seafood person but my out-of-town friends are...and because one of them loves crab, we decided to brave the crowd at Fisherman's Wharf and try the Crab House. Overall, it was a good experience. The garlic fries are really tasty, and there were a few decent options for non-seafood-eaters such as myself. (For the record, though, the other people in my group DID love the crab.) Try for a table by the window and you'll have a great view of the water, as well as a nice breeze.
author: Beth T.

description:
HUGE disappointment. I felt so stupid going there and spent this much money for this food. Except the crab chowder, NOTHING worth the money. I'm wondering if they have their REAL chefs and waiters on vacation for July 4 ( I was there for lunch on July 4). I never believe in the restaurant in the hot spot of tourist area. The only reason I went there is because of the review of Yelp. THINK TWICE before you go there folks. You can do better with your 80 bucks. 

1. sizzling shrimp and mussel - SALTY SALTY SALTY, they want to kill people? Both shrimp and mussel are overcooked. I can't taste anything with this much salt. 

2. killer drab - Again, they killed us with SALT. The crab is fresh but not impressive because of the poor seasoning.

3.  crab chowder - It's the only dish we think it's OK.

4. crab cake - There are only 2 small crab cake in a big plate. Each one is only slightly bigger than a chicken nugget and it costs 14.99? We were shocked when we see the dish. 

4. bread - it's cold and hard. However, it's one of the better taste dish since there is not much salt with it. 

5. Service - The waitress never said "hi", "bye" or "is there everything OK?", "how's the dish?" to us. I had very hard time to catch her for some extra napkins. Overall, the service is as bad as the food. 

We left with the empty stomach and wallet (yes, all servings are small but the bean size of crab cake is the highlight. ).  Damn, I should believer in my old belief - NEVER GO TO THE RESTAURANT IN THE TOURIST AREA WITH OCEAN VIEW.  I never got anything good out of this kind of restaurants.

I'm a big fan of crabs. Here is my advice if you really want to get a tasty crab but  don't want to cook yourself. Go to any big Chinese restaurant that there are the big glass tanks with live seafood. They will pick a live one out of the tank and cook whatever way you like for about 25 bucks.
author: Hk K.

description:
At least one of these stars is for the view alone.  We got the famous "Killer Crab" and it was pretty good.  That garlic sauce is delicious, I even soped up the leftover sauce with the crusty bread.  Also got the Crab Fondue, ok but not incorporated enough (oil and cheese separated quickly, was left with a gob of cheese in grease).  Waitress was very attentive and nice.  I made lunch reservations the night before and requested a window seat, we watched the sea lions on the pier while we ate.  Anywho for how expensive it is I could've used a few more dungness crabs, but that view.  Definetely a great place to take people on there first trip to SF. 

 If you just want lots of fresh crab walk down the Wharf and get it from the Asian lady before Boudins on the side of the street ($10 lb.)
author: Matt C.

description: i try to stay away from most of the restaurants by fisherman's wharf but came here with a friend when we were craving crab and were nearby.  to my surprise, the meal we had was pretty tasty. i really enjoyed the crab chowder.  we also had the cioppino and half crab to share which were pretty good.  the cioppino broth was a bit too salty for my taste.  overall, i wouldn't  run to come here again but if i were in the area and needed to pick among all the restaurants, i'd go back here.
author: Helen T.

description: it was O-kay....Theres plenty of better places for the same price. The crab was kind of dry and not too flavorful, but the service was fast. They did forget to bring the noodles but as soon as i reminded them, the noodles were brought in minutes. the wait staff was pretty busy so the not so great hospitality service wasnt a big deal to me.
author: Jessica M.

description: this place is awsome. i went here to have some crab and have never had such tastey crab. i don't think anyone has crab his tastey. will make this the new crab spot
author: christine l.

description: Say what you want about the Crab House's location in the heart of Touristville, but the seafood is damn good. I went there with friends on a rainy day, and this place hit the spot. We shared a large bowl of crab chowder. It filled the belly, but was heavy on cream and butter. The fried artichokes were better than expected. They were a treat, and not too greasy. The Double Shrimp Double Crab was delicious -- 30 well-seasoned shrimp and a crab that we split among the three of us. We ordered a bottle of Kenwood sauvignon blanc with our meal, and its clean, fruity style accompanied the food well. The views overlooking the bay and the city offered a beautiful backdrop and a nice break from the holiday rush. Including tip, the bill came to $35 for each of us -- pretty reasonable for a relaxing lunch.
author: Jason B.

description: Food is served in little proportions. When you come here, expect tourist prices--prices that are more than double what you will normally pay for a crab soup. The crab's huge, but too little meat on it. Service is good, very good. I saw the waiter teaching one lady how to eat the crab with the thingy you use to break it. I'd say that waiter earned this resto 3 stars.
author: Michael Angelo R.

description: I love this place... my mother in law hates it. So it must be good right? To frame her opinion - She thinks all REAL clam chowder should taste like the can it came out of & be served in a sourdough bread bowl ala Boudin.  She thinks that makes it 'authentic.'  Ok... wow. Anyway - back to the Crab House: As a place that sits in touristy Fisherman's Wharf its pretty much one of the better places to eat.  The food is good and messy. I like the spicy seafood soup. Its messy - wear the nerdy bib. I also recommend the Oyster shooter with Vodka. Guaranteed to keep a smile on your face  while dealing with the tourists... And then go look at the seals sunning themselves. They are awesome too.
author: Sandra P.

description: The waiter - terse, condescending, unhelpful.   He rarely showed up so when we needed something, we had to ask a busboy who apparently then told the waiter who then came over.  Uncomfortable.  Unapologetic.  Food  was good, but the veggie on mine was something I thoroughly dislike - it wasn't listed on the menu, if it was I wouldn't have ordered that.  I told the waiter my issue and he said there were no options.  Visit #1 to the manager, a slim, dark-haired man in his 30's (you'll understand why the description later).  Explained situation with veggie and asked if there was an alternative and he said yes and had it delivered.  But not by the waiter - who never said anything about it on a rare visit later.   Had to ask the waiter for check.   Left a very minimal tip, asked at the front desk to see the manager (Visit #2) who now is a young woman in her mid-20's dressed in a wait-staff uniform.  I mentioned (twice) that she was not the same manager I spoke to a few minutes ago, but there was no explanation.  I explained to the manager why there was a minimal tip, who expressed superficial regret and offered a desert. Said if I hadn't already paid, some of the check could have been written off.   If she really was the manager, she'd know how to deal with this.  Going  back? Not so much.
author: Greg A.

description: You must try this place if you like crab and you are in San Francisco but I could only eat here once in a while given the amount of butter involved. The fries are yummy too.
author: A X.

description:
Went there on New Year's Eve 2011 and loved it.  

Cons: The only thing pseudo-negative I can say is I had better Hong Kong Style crab, and the size of the 1/2 killer crab serving is a bit small, the price was definitely tourist-esqe.

Pros:
1.  Service: 4 stars
We arrived 1.5 hour before our RSVP time.  No problem, within 2 minutes we were lead to a table by the window with a view of the pier where the sea lions reside.  The waiter and busboys very very attentive, food and drinks were served promptly and with a smile.  The receptionists and managers were fairy cordial from the beginning to the end.  
2.  Food: 4 stars
As advertised their Garlic Fries was excellent, 1 "median" size fries was equivalent to 3 orders of that from Mcdonald's!!!  The mussel and shrimp pasta was good.  The Killer crab was excellent, the garlic butter source was savory, you could literally dip anything in it and it would have tasted heavenly.  Tiramisu was good but a bit small in portion.
3. Ambience: 4 stars
Near the entrance there's a unique island like brick table with a fire burning in the center, it radiates warm and comfort in a cold night.  The tables were of Marble top, clean and modern, sitting is a little tight and you might bump shoulders with your neighbor.  My date and I loved the different styles and colors of replica crabs hanging on the wall.
4. Restrooms: 4.5 stars
Modern, clean and well kept.
5. Parking: as recommended we parked at the pier 39 parking across the street.  There's a walk way on the 2nd floor which enables you to bypass the streets below and lead directly to Pier 39.  It also has a pretty good view.  Our dinner entitled us to 2 hours of free parking via validation.

Conclusion: definitely return!!
author: Dreadnaught D.

description: If you don't like crabs dont go here. The food is okay! Everything has crabs in it. Ironically nothing really appealed to be so I ended up ordering pasta which was bland. With all the great places in SF, just get yourself some clam chowder from Pier 39.
author: Heather K.

description: Without a doubt my favorite place to go and pig out whenever I'm in the Embarcadero area.  This restaurant was featured on the Food Network, and for good reason.  Any die-hard crab lover will die and go to crab heaven in this restaurant.  I always have my own crab, and while it seems like a lot, it is never enough!  The special garlic butter rub and sauce they use to cook these crabs is the BEST thing I've ever tasted.  I highly recommend ordering a personal crab as well as an appetizer like the calamari or for a winter day, a great cup of crab chowder.  Without a doubt, this place has been the host of a good majority of my family dinners and I will continue to come to this great find!
author: Melissa N.

description: I came here with family and had a great time.  A little wait for the table and food. The service a bit slow, but the food was not disappointing. I enjoy the crab with butter. The crab was nicely done. The portions were good size and I was satisfied after the meal. The price is on the pricey side, but well worth it.
author: Leon C.

description: i had found this restaurant on Yelp and I have to say I was very impressed. My girlfriend and I ordered the 3 lbs. of their crab and the iron plate of mussels. The crab was amazing giving you only the legs and claws. The sauce was perfect for the crab and also came on the iron plate to keep it warm. The mussels were just about the best mussels I have ever had. Only came with 2 unopened mussels, and considering the amount of people in the restaurant that's really good. All and all it was a great experience and I am looking forward to going back again.
author: Jason V.

description: One of my favorite places to eat seafood. The killer dungeness crab and bruschetta are my favorite. The garlic fries are also really good as well. Make sure you reserve a spot early inside this restaurant otherwise you will find yourself waiting and pining for your time to get food. I highly recommend this restaurant!
author: Dave Y.

description:
If we are taking vistors to the Pier, this is the place we go to have Cippino (sic). It is so filling and good. The bread is non-sourdough, as we are fans of sweet bread, so that is a plus. 

Take that chunk of bread and dip it in the pipping, steaming hot, stew-soup. Yum!
author: elizabeth d.

description: Average food, excellent service.
author: Miki N.

description: although a long wait (well maybe long wkends) but it was kindda worth the wait - i got the combo salad/ seafood mix stew/ tiramisu (dessert) all for 24.99 & the dungeoness crab is good too bread w/ balsmic/ evoo =P
author: Kevin L.

description: I think I've had my best Crab in this restaurant, I really can't wait to go back again, The Garlic Fries and Crab Cakes was very enjoyable, and for the entree I Ordered the Garlic Buttered Dungeness Crab was one of the Best Decision I've made in my life!
author: Jon J.

description: I was there on June 2 in the evening and had a great time. I had not eaten crab in years, and was excited to give it a shot. I sat at the bar, and the bartender Chanel (or something similar... I can't quite remember!) was so sweet and helpful. The crab was good, but she made the meal great!
author: Melissa H.

description: I loved it. The mussels and dungeness crab were exceptional. The wait staff was just as great. And, I couldn't have asked for a better view of the bay.
author: Brett B.

description: Good but you have to go when crab is in season. Typical tourist spot but nice views.
author: JA R.

description: Me and my girlfriend stopped in for lunch here because we wanted Crab while visiting San Francisco!
