We were immediatley seated and our waitress came over within minutes to take out order, and the place was a little busy! The atmosphere and restaurant itself was gorgeous! We both ordered the 1/2 LB dungees crab legs and bread. I ordered a draft beer and she ordered a Cosmpopolitan! Our food came out pretty fast as did our drinks. The crab was GREAT!!!!!  And my friend said her Cosmo was pretty strong for an afternoon drink =) My only complaint was that once our food was served and the waitress checked on us once more she didnt really come back that much more and I actually had to ASK her to get me another drink. But all in all I defintely would go back to this restaurant again when visiting the BAY it was delicious!
author: Michele B.

description:
I went there with my bf this past weekend because it was rated well, and he thought Scoma (which was rated higher) was a tourist-trap.  The nice thing about TCH was it was upstairs, away from the craziness of Pier 39 and sitting by the window, you can almost forget that you're at Pier 39.  The other nice thing about it was the waitstaff was discreet--they periodically came by but left us alone.

Food was good but pricey.  We ordered the crab cakes (2 for $14.95!!!), Caesar salad with crab (~$18), and the seafood stew (forgot what it was called on the menu) which went for $19.95 for a small tureen.  The crab cakes were good--full of crab and crispy (I thought they were a bit greasy) served with a light white sauce on top and some pickled zucchini on the side.  My bf liked his Caesar salad--lots of big chunks of crab.  My seafood stew was good, and if I hadn't had the same thing at The Dead Fish in Crockett, I would have loved this--one of the reasons why I gave TCH 3 stars rather than 4.  The seafood stew had calimari, salmon chunks, and mussels served in an extremely hot tomato-y stock.  The stew was so piping hot that it took me about 1.5 hrs. to eat most of it.

Other reasons why I gave it 3 stars rather than 4: the menu was limited--it was more extensive at The Dead Fish; the view as more spectuacular at The Dead Fish, and I liked the seafood stew much better at The Dead Fish--there was more seafood variety in the stew--there were other fish, clams, and even a crab claw there.

To sum it up, if I were in the area, I would probably go there again if I wanted seafood, but I wouldn't necessary go out of my way to go there.
author: Aggie A.

description: Came here this weekend for my mom's birthday. Everyone except me ordered the crab chowder and apparently I missed out. That was everyone's favorite. The bread came out small cold and hard. Everyone had their meals served and I was still waiting for mine 10 minutes later. I ordered the sizzling shrimp and crab combo but since it was never brought out to me on time, it was brought out NOT sizzling and some parts were cold. I wasn't expecting to have to clean my own shrimp so I didn't much care for that part. The crab was good though so that made up some. I still think there are much better places you can go to for crab though and for less money. Oh yea, the waitress never brought us any soda refills and I think she forgot us for awhile too. Another thing is its VERY cramped in this place. Your neighbor is practically sitting on your lap.
author: Miss V.

description: I came here on my anniversary Jan 1st. My boyfriend made reservations for us at 8pm. We got there at 7:45ish & it was busy. They told us about 10 minutes. People who just walked in were getting seated before us & we didn't get seated til almost 8:30pm.  I was pretty annoyed it seemed like making a reservation was pointless & that's why I'm only giving 4 stars. Once we sat down we looked through the menu & a few things caught our eyes. We got the half crab & shrimp skillet, crab chowder, the salmon plate & of course their garlic fries. Everything was really good & came fast. I would come back!
author: Jenelle M.

description: Great food!  You'll not find a better dungeoness crab!  We were in SF for just 3 days and had to go back for a second trip, it was so good.
author: Jeff A.

description: Words cannot describe my fiance's love  for crab.  So I knew we needed to stop at a crab house during our vacation.  I chose Pier 39 not only for the crab but also because of their mojitos.  We arrived and immediately ordered a couple of the mint libations.  Joe of course had his eyes on the dungeness crab that feeds two.  Once we placed our order, the waiter tied a bib around my neck.  I am not ashamed to be a grown woman who wears bibs.  The occasion called for it.  The crab came out snap crackle and pop hot on a hot plate.  And instead of doing the melted butter dip, Crab House likes to smother the crab in garlic.  Once the hot plate hit the table, we started cracking the shell open to get to the meat.  The crab meat and garlic was unbelievably good.  Garlic with crab is way better than butter.  Not sure if it's healthier but who cares.  In the end, I would like to thank Crab House for the wonderful mojitos and crab feast.
author: Myra R.

description: I'm not a huge crab fan, but having the Dungeness Killer Crab here is a must whenever I visit SF.  The garlicky sweetness of the crab meat is heaven.  Tiramisu is pretty good too.  Although I did not order it, I have heard the baked  mussels are worth the trip to SF.
author: Jim A.

description:
The Crab House looks elegant out the outside but once you get inside it screams tourist trap. There are painted crabs all over the place, old sailing "things" all over the walls, etc.

The food was good. Ordered the 1/2 lb crab, crab chowder, crab alfredo and the skillet with mussels and shirmp. The only drawback on the food was that for the price that you pay you do not get much. We originally only ordered two items but were so hungry we kept on ordering more. 

Drinks were pretty good but it took forever for them to get them to us. I recommend that you eat somewhere cheap when your in the pier 39 area, because you basically dont get what you pay for, so go cheap on the food to get filled up.
author: mark h.

description: I am an SF Native and had never heard of the Crab House and I was hesitant because it looked a little empty. I ordered the Chicken Alfredo and it was delicious! Their garlic fries were really good. The service was excellent and our waiter was so nice and funny. And they take your order with a PDA looking device. It was a great experience and would go again.
author: Anacristina S.

description:
It was alright. For something name "Crab House" the crab was not great. Being right by the ocean you figure they would have better crab. It was plain and buttery to me; very little flavor.
From what I remember the fettuccine wasn't cooked right. It was cold and hard still; wasn't fresh at all.
The chowder was watery. 

Unfortunately I haven't tried the fish and steak here, that may prove to be a better experience. 

Don't go here if you're looking for a sure good meal.
author: M N.

description: Garlic crab for two was awesome.  House white wine washed it all down which made the ramble back to the hotel memorable.  Bibs are definitely necessary.
author: nate w.

description: went here with family and we were very satisfied with the food. the crab is excellent you got to have killer crab in secret garlic sauce when you come here.
author: Adrian L.

description: WOW! Did I say WOW?!?  Great display of crab.  And the envy on the faces walking by is confirmation! We ordered the large order of crab. I guess they give you about 2.5 crabs.  And the garlic fries!! This place is outstanding.  Why not 5 stars. Probably because of the very reason why it made me say WOW! The food is so good, the crowds can sometimes have  you saying, well there are other great restaurants around here.  But we waited 40 minutes anyway.
author: Michael J.

description:
The yummiest and freshiest crabs ever, and great view!

I've gone to this place with Bay Area visitors at least ten times.  Unfailingly we get very fresh crabs (I have a sharp nose), excellent service, and the atmosphere is great for the money.
author: Q L.

description:
Food: I had the crab and the garlic noodle. Everything taste just okay, not perfect, but the price is not justified for the portion we got. A little bit pricey and the crab is so damn tiny and malnutritioned. I wasn't even full after that.
Service: It was hard to get our waiter's attention when we asked for water because she was busy catering to those guys and ladies in the suits.
Ambiance: Very very squeezy. Luckily, we got the window seat although it was too sunny to open the blind. hmm.
author: Jessica W.

description: I came here for a birthday celebration with my two friends.   We made reservations because the place is pretty small.  We sat in the booth and had a great view out the window.  We ordered the 3lbs crab, garlic noodles, chicken pasta and seafood chowder.  The crab and seafood chowder was gooooooooooooooood!  The pasta was not too great.  The portion was small and there wasn't a lot of flavors.  My friends told them it was my birthday when I was in the bathroom and at the end of our meal, the waitress brought out a tiramisu saying happy birthday around the plate.  Unlike most restaurants, this birthday dessert was not on the house...we had to pay for it.  Our bill for 3 people came out to be $150+.
author: Linda H.

description: Yay I love this place! In all my years going to Pier 39 I've never once stepped into this restaurant until now! And I'm glad I did, thanks to yelp. :) Today my boyfriend and I decided to come here for dinner. We wanted a light dinner for the two of us since we weren't that hungry, and so we decided on Garlic Noodles and a cup of Crab Chowder to share. We were given two small cute loaves of french bread a few minutes after we sat down, and the bread was made with organic unbleached flour! I was really happy about that. The food was AMAAZZZINGGG! The BEST pasta and chowder I've ever had. The Garlic Noodles were to die for, tons of fresh garlic (but not overpowering), and parmesan cheese. The chicken was also encrusted with garlic, and cooked perfectly! The noodles seemed like they were made fresh. I recommend soaking everything up from your bowl after eating the pasta with the french bread, OMG! Don't leave that amazing garlic sauce to waste. Everything was so light, fresh, but so flavorful as well! Yumyumyum, it was excellent. And the Crab Chowder was great too. I was expecting a heavy chowder like many chowders served in Pier 39, but no! This chowder was light, full of vegetables and chunks of crab, and it too was amazing! The only downside is that they don't serve it in a bread bowl, which would've been more amazing! But I guess the little loaves of french bread make up for it. We were full, but not too full, and completely satisfied with our meal by the end of it. There was nothing left in our bowls! I'm definitely coming back when we stop by the city again.
author: The T.

description:
DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE -- it's a tourist trap!  
We're from the bay area and should have known better.  Even though my SF friends warned me not to eat around Pier 39 as most are over-priced and average food, we took a chance because it seems highly recommended.  You Yelpers let me down on this one.  Why?!!  My family (3 adults, 1 child, 1baby) was hungry for some crabs so Crab House was chosen over the Neptune place.  here's what we ordered:

Crab cakes (two tiny DRY crab cakes ), 1 star
Limp & over-dressed salad, 1 1/2 stars because the portion was slightly better)
Shrimp linguini (I swear, the sauce came right out of a can), 1/2 star
Macaroni & cheese (macaroni being same pasta as our shrimp linguini), 1/2 star -- underflavored & low-quality cheese even my hungry 7-year-old with low expectations took only a few bites
Crab, ahh the crab that we were there for, 1 1/2 stars -- dry, over-cooked.  The meat should've come right off if it had been juicy, but kept breaking off.  The galic sauce was soooo salty, we couldn't get past the other flavors
Side note:  We noticed that other tables got bread where we did not.  It took us 20 minutes to get our bill.  And they charged us automatically for tips.  This is why they don't care about their crappy service because they feel that the tourist would only visit them once.   If I could give zero rating, I would.  I don't know why some people are recommeding this place.   Are you invested in this place or have family members working at Crab House?   This place sucks!    But maybe compared to other tourist traps, this is acceptable by very low standards.  I will definitely pass the word to my friends never to frequent this trap.
author: Ms K.

description: My family's first time at pier 39, we were thinking crab for dinner, so we found  this nice little restaurant. Everything was going great and the food is extremely good, except for the small mussels. We were having a wonderful time and at the end of our dinner, we waited awhile for our server to notice us and give us our bill .... so we decided to pay up front. When we got to the cashier, our server "Hannah" told us to go back to our table, take a seat and there she will present us our bill. She kept repeating that we just had to wait for our bill at the table, she didn't say it with kindness, it was more like she had to dumb it down for us with the accurate finger pointing. STUPID waitress, we know we're we sat, there's no need to point. We understood immediately that this place has horrible customer service! People were looking as if we tried to leave without paying because we notice them all looking at the only Asians in that restaurant. Worse restaurant I've been in San Francisco!!
author: Leli A.

description: The food was okay.  Ordered the whole crab, but the meat was a bit dry.  Made reservations, but ended up waiting 40 minutes for our table.  I ordered a bloody mary while I waited and that was very good, but I couldn't tell if it was actually that good since I was very hungry at that point.  Each person gets a bread roll in a paper "Crab House" bag, which was dry and cold.  The caesar salad was decent and the garlic fries were mediocre.
author: Kate S.

description: Skip it. The food was terrible and overpriced. Don't even think about it if you have a soy allergy. The dungeness crab was greasy and disgusting (maybe I'm spoiled from living in Seattle). My girlfriend ordered lemon butter salmon. She's allergic to soy. No where did it mention the vegetables it came with were soaked in soy sauce (soy sauce and lemon butter, are you serious?). When we asked the waiter about it, he confirmed it had soy sauce in it took it back and brought the same piece of fish (that had been sitting on top of the veggies and in the soy sauce) back out to us on dry noodles. It was inedible.
author: John M.

description: ahh!! i love it here!! I would have uploaded the pictures of the yummy food i ate here but it wouldve just been a repeat photo. I came here on July 4 which happens to be my anniversary and ofcourse it was PACKED!! When I walked in the whole front was crowded with people so I made my way through to the hostess(which is actually pretty unpleasant, shes pretty rude and i never saw her smile once) but luckily since i called 2 weeks in advance they had a window table open for me. We ordered the Crab Feast (omg which is sooo yummy!! i love dungeness crab legs and often have crab like this, but this one was really fresh) We also ordered the garlic fries which were probably the best i ever had and crab cakes, which were yummy, esp the sauce on top, but a little small. The service (besides the hostess) was great, the wait for ppl who didnt reserve was about 2 hours so i def recommend getting reservations and i recommend asking for a window seat in advance, which is alot more pleasant than some of the other smaller crowded area tables. Any way, spend about 160 on dinner that nyte so its definitely a special occasion type of place, but i will be coming back!!!
author: Ashley G.

description:
had the crab chowder.......eh.


i wouldnt go back for it though.
author: Anna U.

description: I always wanted to go to this place and finally was able to go last night. We ordered the Crab specialty - Lotsa (for 2). Thank goodness we did not order anything else since the potion was overwhelming. it is served in a garlic butter and herbs over it on a roasted grill pan. I loved it. Each person gets their own little loaf of french bread and they have oil for the bread for dipping. We had a very romantic view of the bay, docks and buildings of San Francisco. Service was a little lacking, we had to go to lengths to get someone to help. Nice touch, a big metal picture of water with ice at the table. We had a split of champagne to go with it and it was absolutely yummy!
author: Kiri S.

description: best freaking house for crabs ive seen!! on my first day to SF i walked from geary, along market and up Embarcadero all the way to pier 39 where i was met by those gorgeous crabs... tasted devine especaily as i was bloody starving after my walk! oh and the complementary ice water jug just looked delicious on that hot may day. the garlic fires went down a treat too! check it out!!!
author: Fazan K.

description: Our family was on vacation and decided to try this place out because of all the great reviews. The food had good flavor. This is really not a good restaurant for kids. Great for adult date night, but for a family with 5 children ranging in ages from 2-11 not a good place. No kids cups, food was a little to fancy for kids. Crab also did not blow me away. I've had better, and on top of it was a bit pricey.
author: Emily M.

description: i'll get to it at a later date.. just mentioning it makes me so...................................... ugh!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: foodi e.

description: the king dungeness crabs on a hot sizzling platter was sooo good here! the location is great too right on the pier w/ a view of the bay! the crab is super good w/special garlic sauce on it~ wayy better than gettin the crabs at the crab stands which we used to do until we saw a big rat by those street stands~ so please! its wayy worth it eating at a cleaner restaurant style w/a bib, crab tools etc. we also go the garlic fries & garlic noodle sides which were pretty good but it was wayyy too much food due to their pretty large portions. they also give each person a bread of their own & the olive oil/balsamic sauce is set on the table as well as a pitcher of water. overall, probably the BEST place to eat crabs in the bay! i loved it & would go back soon!!!
author: Pudgee W.

description: YUMO!  Server was friendly, attentative and kept the icetea flowing.  Killer Crab was delicious and well worth it the money.  The crab sandwich (open face) was very good and the crab enchilada was tasty too!  Views are spectacular and so happy we found a few favorite place to eat on Pier 39!
author: Barbara L.

description: came here during new years and of course it was crowded,so it was a good thing we had reservations, even though we still had to wait a while than the time we reserved. this place is really small like the table seats are close together, which i wish they fixed since you are dealing with crab and you do need some arm room, and also more table room since there small also. ordered the crab and garlic noodles, calamari, garlic fries, and shrimp alfredo. they were all good but i still like thanh long for the crab and garlic noodles over this place. the bathroom line is always long since its only one stall, so you are better off walking all the way down the pier to the public restroom. i also had there pineapple mojito which was also good. all in all good place to eat but the space is a littel cramped!
author: Francis J.

description: I just came back from the bay area last week so i decided to review some of the places that I have been to.......this is my second time here at the Crab House , I have been craving for the killer crab for so long, this time i went on a weekday so it was not as crowded as the first time ....of course i ordered my favorite ...the Killer Crab.....so yummmzzzzz...I love ....love their garlic sauce..sometimes when you use too much garlic it kills... but this sauce.. i would say ..almost perfect for me... but i can handle a little more garlic...still...so yummmzzz and looking forward for my next trip already :)
author: sareena M.

description: Crab is good but man will kick your arteries after a while.  Pretty cool cause of the sizzling plate.  but dood - butter ramma.  kinda like your insides swimming in butter.
author: Joey N.

description:
best seafood in san francisco. many locals don't know about this place, or if they do, consider themselves too hip to be seen here because the location is very touristy. don't let that hold you back! also, don't let the silly decor throw you -- that's part of what makes this restaurant so special, combined with the million dollar views from the many windows. 

an overall fantastic experience!

bonus: after finishing dinner, head downstairs to the mini donut shop and buy a bag. they are fresh and the perfect after dinner treat!
author: cassandra v.

description: they've got great crabs and i'm not talking about the ones that make your nether regions itch.  no sir or miss, i'm talking about the dungeness kind that goes great with butter and a bib.  what's interesting about this joint as that they go about a different way of cooking their seafood.  they don't steam em' but like cook em' on a hot spit which gives it a different texture.  it's good but i think i prefer steamed.  nonetheless, the food is still damn tasty.
author: dae m.

description: the crab is so buttery and delicious.  the pitchers of beer are huge.  what more do you need?!
author: jessie h.

description: The food here is simply fantastic and the wait staff is very nice. However, the female reservations person (who would not provide her name or refer me to the manager) should be fired. She told me they don't take reservations, then told me she didn't want to take any more reservations because it was a holiday weekend. When I asked for clarification, she got angry and unprofessional and refused to refer me to the manager of identify herself, then hung up on me. I called back two times and she refused to pick up the phone. I called the manager four hours later and he was not much more helpful either. So just go and take your chances with getting a table. Good luck!
author: Tim H.

description: Went here for a special lunch for my daughter's birthday based on all the good yelp reviews. She is a crab fanatic. I don't know what all the fuss is about. I've had dungeness crab, fresh caught in the morning, then steamed and served with a little pot of melted butter on the side for dipping. Absolute heaven. But this? Not even close. The crab itself was an oily, drippy mess and the meatiest part of the leg had been exposed to high heat and was quite crispy instead of tender. Garlic? Really? Didn't taste that at all. My husband and brother-in-law  both had the Zuppa di Pesce and although they said it tasted fine, the aroma coming from the bowl smelled distinctly of past it's prime seafood. The bread was cold and hard, the butter that came with it just as cold, quite solid and unspreadable. It was very cramped for 5 (2 were kids) at our small table and there was still a seat for a 6th person. There's no way we could have fit 3 adults across one side. The ambiance was most definitely touristy. On the other hand, the service was good and our waitress very attentive.
author: L H.

description: Came here with a few girlfriends for our monthly dinner. Decor was very nice and comfy...we were seated at a window table which had a great view of the bay! Had their cioppino here...it was good, but not great. Overall, very nice atmosphere....
author: Sharon H.

description: The Crab house is A-OK. The service is excellent and the views are great looking over the water in the Pier 39 area. Quality of food is fine the Garlic Dungeness Crab for two is a nice way to go. The decor is a bit over the top tourist for me with hand painted plastic crabs on the walls, anchors etc. If your in the area and looking for a family oriented place for crab this is a good bet.
author: lilalaune12

description: real good food crab to die for, a lil expensive, but worth the taste.if ur in mood for seafood.
author: Maria M.

description: we went here the other day and the food was amazing. it was the first time we have ever ate crab in the shell and the server was very helpful on showing us the proper way to crack the crab and get all of the meat out.
author: Rahul S.

description:
The Crab House is in a geat location with its great views of the pier and the bustle of all he tourists.  However, its food is just okay.  The bread was served as cute little baguettes packaged in its own bag.  I expeced them to be really tasty as we were in SF and all, but they were not.  The bread was cold and kinda stale.  Took and bite and I was not enticed to finish it.   We had the calamari, which was very decent, but nothing special.  
My husband ordered the lobster pasta, which was really rather bland and the egg noodles they used did not seem to match the type of suace.  I had the crab enchilada, which was once again jsut okay.  I was starving but did not find that I wanted to lick my plate clean.  My sisters had the house special crab and some garlic noodles. The noodles were disappointing as the sauce was kind of bland and once again the egg noodles were not appealing.  The crab was delicious and tasty, but the portions were small and pricey.
Service was decent, bu is was hard to really gauge because were a party of 6 and tip was included so were sometimes just left to our devices once the food was served.
author: dee t.

description: This weekend my girlfriend and I had a wonderful weekend in San Fransisco, not the least if which was a great afternoon on pier 39 (being tourists). We debated what to eat, and decided to eat at the crab house. We started with calamari, which was very tender, the batter was light and crisp, the sauce was rich, and plenty of lemons were provided. After that we moved onto the 3 pound killer crab for two. This was simply awesome. Really. It contained two dungeness crabs, easily portioned and ready to consume. The butter sauce was flavorful, unlike many plain butter dipping sauces found at other crab places. Service was prompt and courteous. The beer menu was decent, although I wad confused by one selection name, "recer 5." Is this to be a clone of Bear Republic's racer 5, or did they just mispell it? Regardless, I plan to go back and enjoy many crabs at this excellent establishment in the future.
author: Ryan G.

description: When the crab is cooked in the skillet, then of course the meat is not going to be juicy like some of these reviews offer.  The garlic and other spices are there for your tasting and actually make it through the shell.  Some other places, you just taste the spices from the outside and it never  makes it inside to the meat.  Of there are mostly tourists but hey they need to eat and they bring in lots of money into our city.  Plus we all are tourist at one point or another.  We went on a week night and it was raining so business was slow so we got in no problem. We had the lobster salad was a little heavy on sesame dressing.  Overall, not bad and the mussels were delicious.
author: Eric c.

description: If you are looking for some delicious lick your fingers and then soak up the sauce with Acme bread crab then this is the place for you! The crab here is cooked perfectly and served in a buttery garlic sauce which is delicious. Anytime I need a crab fix, this is where I end up. We generally order a caesar salad to split (it is WAY too big for one person). I think this salad is great since they send it out in full crisp romaine leaves lightly tossed in the dressing with nice pieces of parmesan shavings. The Crab House also serves these little sourdough loaves of Acme bread which are perfect to soak up the garlic butter sauce that the crab comes in. It is in a touristy location, but do not let that keep you away. It is actually kind of nice to eat some delicious crab and also see all the different people who come to enjoy our great City! Another cool thing is that since it is at Pier 39 they have their menu printed in many languages.
author: M S.
